Welcome home.\r","Behold, these are the tribunes of the people,\r","The tongues o' the common mouth: I do despise them;\r","For they do prank them in authority,\r","Against all noble sufferance.\r","\r","SICINIUS:\r","Pass no further.\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","Ha! what is that?\r","\r","BRUTUS:\r","It will be dangerous to go on: no further.\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","What makes this change?\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","The matter?\r","\r","COMINIUS:\r","Hath he not pass'd the noble and the common?\r","\r","BRUTUS:\r","Cominius, no.\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","Have I had children's voices?\r","\r","First Senator:\r","Tribunes, give way; he shall to the market-place.\r","\r","BRUTUS:\r","The people are incensed against him.\r","\r","SICINIUS:\r","Stop,\r","Or all will fall in broil.\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","Are these your herd?\r","Must these have voices, that can yield them now\r","And straight disclaim their tongues? What are\r","your offices?\r","You being their mouths, why rule you not their teeth?\r","Have you not set them on?\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","Be calm, be calm.\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","It is a purposed thing, and grows by plot,\r","To curb the will of the nobility:\r","Suffer't, and live with such as cannot rule\r","Nor ever will be ruled.\r","\r","BRUTUS:\r","Call't not a plot:\r","The people cry you mock'd them, and of late,\r","When corn was given them gratis, you repined;\r","Scandal'd the suppliants for the people, call'd them\r","Time-pleasers, flatterers, foes to nobleness.\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","Why, this was known before.\r","\r","BRUTUS:\r","Not to them all.\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","Have you inform'd them sithence?\r","\r","BRUTUS:\r","How! I inform them!\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","You are like to do such business.\r","\r","BRUTUS:\r","Not unlike,\r","Each way, to better yours.\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","Why then should I be consul? By yond clouds,\r","Let me deserve so ill as you, and make me\r","Your fellow tribune.\r","\r","SICINIUS:\r","You show too much of that\r","For which the people stir: if you will pass\r","To where you are bound, you must inquire your way,\r","Which you are out of, with a gentler spirit,\r","Or never be so noble as a consul,\r","Nor yoke with him for tribune.\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","Let's be calm.\r","\r","COMINIUS:\r","The people are abused; set on. This paltering\r","Becomes not Rome, nor has Coriolanus\r","Deserved this so dishonour'd rub, laid falsely\r","I' the plain way of his merit.\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","Tell me of corn!\r","This was my speech, and I will speak't again--\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","Not now, not now.\r","\r","First Senator:\r","Not in this heat, sir, now.\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","Now, as I live, I will. My nobler friends,\r","I crave their pardons:\r","For the mutable, rank-scented many, let them\r","Regard me as I do not flatter, and\r","Therein behold themselves: I say again,\r","In soothing them, we nourish 'gainst our senate\r","The cockle of rebellion, insolence, sedition,\r","Which we ourselves have plough'd for, sow'd,\r","and scatter'd,\r","By mingling them with us, the honour'd number,\r","Who lack not virtue, no, nor power, but that\r","Which they have given to beggars.\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","Well, no more.\r","\r","First Senator:\r","No more words, we beseech you.\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","How! no more!\r","As for my country I have shed my blood,\r","Not fearing outward force, so shall my lungs\r","Coin words till their decay against those measles,\r","Which we disdain should tatter us, yet sought\r","The very way to catch them.\r","\r","BRUTUS:\r","You speak o' the people,\r","As if you were a god to punish, not\r","A man of their infirmity.\r","\r","SICINIUS:\r","'Twere well\r","We let the people know't.\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","What, what? his choler?\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","Choler!\r","Were I as patient as the midnight sleep,\r","By Jove, 'twould be my mind!\r","\r","SICINIUS:\r","It is a mind\r","That shall remain a poison where it is,\r","Not poison any further.\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","Shall remain!\r","Hear you this Triton of the minnows? mark you\r","His absolute 'shall'?\r","\r","COMINIUS:\r","'Twas from the canon.\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","'Shall'!\r","O good but most unwise patricians! why,\r","You grave but reckless senators, have you thus\r","Given Hydra here to choose an officer,\r","That with his peremptory 'shall,' being but\r","The horn and noise o' the monster's, wants not spirit\r","To say he'll turn your current in a ditch,\r","And make your channel his? If he have power\r","Then vail your ignorance; if none, awake\r","Your dangerous lenity. If you are learn'd,\r","Be not as common fools; if you are not,\r","Let them have cushions by you. You are plebeians,\r","If they be senators: and they are no less,\r","When, both your voices blended, the great'st taste\r","Most palates theirs. They choose their magistrate,\r","And such a one as he, who puts his 'shall,'\r","His popular 'shall' against a graver bench\r","Than ever frown in Greece. By Jove himself!\r","It makes the consuls base: and my soul aches\r","To know, when two authorities are up,\r","Neither supreme, how soon confusion\r","May enter 'twixt the gap of both and take\r","The one by the other.\r","\r","COMINIUS:\r","Well, on to the market-place.\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","Whoever gave that counsel, to give forth\r","The corn o' the storehouse gratis, as 'twas used\r","Sometime in Greece,--\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","Well, well, no more of that.\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","Though there the people had more absolute power,\r","I say, they nourish'd disobedience, fed\r","The ruin of the state.\r","\r","BRUTUS:\r","Why, shall the people give\r","One that speaks thus their voice?\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","I'll give my reasons,\r","More worthier than their voices. They know the corn\r","Was not our recompense, resting well assured\r","That ne'er did service for't: being press'd to the war,\r","Even when the navel of the state was touch'd,\r","They would not thread the gates. This kind of service\r","Did not deserve corn gratis. Being i' the war\r","Their mutinies and revolts, wherein they show'd\r","Most valour, spoke not for them: the accusation\r","Which they have often made against the senate,\r","All cause unborn, could never be the motive\r","Of our so frank donation. Well, what then?\r","How shall this bisson multitude digest\r","The senate's courtesy? Let deeds express\r","What's like to be their words: 'we did request it;\r","We are the greater poll, and in true fear\r","They gave us our demands.' Thus we debase\r","The nature of our seats and make the rabble\r","Call our cares fears; which will in time\r","Break ope the locks o' the senate and bring in\r","The crows to peck the eagles.\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","Come, enough.\r","\r","BRUTUS:\r","Enough, with over-measure.\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","No, take more:\r","What may be sworn by, both divine and human,\r","Seal what I end withal! This double worship,\r","Where one part does disdain with cause, the other\r","Insult without all reason, where gentry, title, wisdom,\r","Cannot conclude but by the yea and no\r","Of general ignorance,--it must omit\r","Real necessities, and give way the while\r","To unstable slightness: purpose so barr'd,\r","it follows,\r","Nothing is done to purpose. Therefore, beseech you,--\r","You that will be less fearful than discreet,\r","That love the fundamental part of state\r","More than you doubt the change on't, that prefer\r","A noble life before a long, and wish\r","To jump a body with a dangerous physic\r","That's sure of death without it, at once pluck out\r","The multitudinous tongue; let them not lick\r","The sweet which is their poison: your dishonour\r","Mangles true judgment and bereaves the state\r","Of that integrity which should become't,\r","Not having the power to do the good it would,\r","For the in which doth control't.\r","\r","BRUTUS:\r","Has said enough.\r","\r","SICINIUS:\r","Has spoken like a traitor, and shall answer\r","As traitors do.\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","Thou wretch, despite o'erwhelm thee!\r","What should the people do with these bald tribunes?\r","On whom depending, their obedience fails\r","To the greater bench: in a rebellion,\r","When what's not meet, but what must be, was law,\r","Then were they chosen: in a better hour,\r","Let what is meet be said it must be meet,\r","And throw their power i' the dust.\r","\r","BRUTUS:\r","Manifest treason!\r","\r","SICINIUS:\r","This a consul? no.\r","\r","BRUTUS:\r","The aediles, ho!\r","Let him be apprehended.\r","\r","SICINIUS:\r","Go, call the people:\r","in whose name myself\r","Attach thee as a traitorous innovator,\r","A foe to the public weal: obey, I charge thee,\r","And follow to thine answer.\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","Hence, old goat!\r","\r","Senators, \u0026C:\r","We'll surety him.\r","\r","COMINIUS:\r","Aged sir, hands off.\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","Hence, rotten thing! or I shall shake thy bones\r","Out of thy garments.\r","\r","SICINIUS:\r","Help, ye citizens!\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","On both sides more respect.\r","\r","SICINIUS:\r","Here's he that would take from you all your power.\r","\r","BRUTUS:\r","Seize him, AEdiles!\r","\r","Citizens:\r","Down with him! down with him!\r","\r","Senators, \u0026C:\r","Weapons, weapons, weapons!\r","'Tribunes!' 'Patricians!' 'Citizens!' 'What, ho!'\r","'Sicinius!' 'Brutus!' 'Coriolanus!' 'Citizens!'\r","'Peace, peace, peace!' 'Stay, hold, peace!'\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","What is about to be? I am out of breath;\r","Confusion's near; I cannot speak. You, tribunes\r","To the people! Coriolanus, patience!\r","Speak, good Sicinius.\r","\r","SICINIUS:\r","Hear me, people; peace!\r","\r","Citizens:\r","Let's hear our tribune: peace Speak, speak, speak.\r","\r","SICINIUS:\r","You are at point to lose your liberties:\r","Marcius would have all from you; Marcius,\r","Whom late you have named for consul.\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","Fie, fie, fie!\r","This is the way to kindle, not to quench.\r","\r","First Senator:\r","To unbuild the city and to lay all flat.\r","\r","SICINIUS:\r","What is the city but the people?\r","\r","Citizens:\r","True,\r","The people are the city.\r","\r","BRUTUS:\r","By the consent of all, we were establish'd\r","The people's magistrates.\r","\r","Citizens:\r","You so remain.\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","And so are like to do.\r","\r","COMINIUS:\r","That is the way to lay the city flat;\r","To bring the roof to the foundation,\r","And bury all, which yet distinctly ranges,\r","In heaps and piles of ruin.\r","\r","SICINIUS:\r","This deserves death.\r","\r","BRUTUS:\r","Or let us stand to our authority,\r","Or let us lose it. We do here pronounce,\r","Upon the part o' the people, in whose power\r","We were elected theirs, Marcius is worthy\r","Of present death.\r","\r","SICINIUS:\r","Therefore lay hold of him;\r","Bear him to the rock Tarpeian, and from thence\r","Into destruction cast him.\r","\r","BRUTUS:\r","AEdiles, seize him!\r","\r","Citizens:\r","Yield, Marcius, yield!\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","Hear me one word;\r","Beseech you, tribunes, hear me but a word.\r","\r","AEdile:\r","Peace, peace!\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","\r","BRUTUS:\r","Sir, those cold ways,\r","That seem like prudent helps, are very poisonous\r","Where the disease is violent. Lay hands upon him,\r","And bear him to the rock.\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","No, I'll die here.\r","There's some among you have beheld me fighting:\r","Come, try upon yourselves what you have seen me.\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","Down with that sword! Tribunes, withdraw awhile.\r","\r","BRUTUS:\r","Lay hands upon him.\r","\r","COMINIUS:\r","Help Marcius, help,\r","You that be noble; help him, young and old!\r","\r","Citizens:\r","Down with him, down with him!\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","Go, get you to your house; be gone, away!\r","All will be naught else.\r","\r","Second Senator:\r","Get you gone.\r","\r","COMINIUS:\r","Stand fast;\r","We have as many friends as enemies.\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","Sham it be put to that?\r","\r","First Senator:\r","The gods forbid!\r","I prithee, noble friend, home to thy house;\r","Leave us to cure this cause.\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","For 'tis a sore upon us,\r","You cannot tent yourself: be gone, beseech you.\r","\r","COMINIUS:\r","Come, sir, along with us.\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","I would they were barbarians--as they are,\r","Though in Rome litter'd--not Romans--as they are not,\r","Though calved i' the porch o' the Capitol--\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","Be gone;\r","Put not your worthy rage into your tongue;\r","One time will owe another.\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","On fair ground\r","I could beat forty of them.\r","\r","COMINIUS:\r","I could myself\r","Take up a brace o' the best of them; yea, the\r","two tribunes:\r","But now 'tis odds beyond arithmetic;\r","And manhood is call'd foolery, when it stands\r","Against a falling fabric. Will you hence,\r","Before the tag return? whose rage doth rend\r","Like interrupted waters and o'erbear\r","What they are used to bear.\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","Pray you, be gone:\r","I'll try whether my old wit be in request\r","With those that have but little: this must be patch'd\r","With cloth of any colour.\r","\r","COMINIUS:\r","Nay, come away.\r","\r","A Patrician:\r","This man has marr'd his fortune.\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","His nature is too noble for the world:\r","He would not flatter Neptune for his trident,\r","Or Jove for's power to thunder. His heart's his mouth:\r","What his breast forges, that his tongue must vent;\r","And, being angry, does forget that ever\r","He heard the name of death.\r","Here's goodly work!\r","\r","Second Patrician:\r","I would they were abed!\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","I would they were in Tiber! What the vengeance!\r","Could he not speak 'em fair?\r","\r","SICINIUS:\r","Where is this viper\r","That would depopulate the city and\r","Be every man himself?\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","You worthy tribunes,--\r","\r","SICINIUS:\r","He shall be thrown down the Tarpeian rock\r","With rigorous hands: he hath resisted law,\r","And therefore law shall scorn him further trial\r","Than the severity of the public power\r","Which he so sets at nought.\r","\r","First Citizen:\r","He shall well know\r","The noble tribunes are the people's mouths,\r","And we their hands.\r","\r","Citizens:\r","He shall, sure on't.\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","Sir, sir,--\r","\r","SICINIUS:\r","Peace!\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","Do not cry havoc, where you should but hunt\r","With modest warrant.\r","\r","SICINIUS:\r","Sir, how comes't that you\r","Have holp to make this rescue?\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","Hear me speak:\r","As I do know the consul's worthiness,\r","So can I name his faults,--\r","\r","SICINIUS:\r","Consul! what consul?\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","The consul Coriolanus.\r","\r","BRUTUS:\r","He consul!\r","\r","Citizens:\r","No, no, no, no, no.\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","If, by the tribunes' leave, and yours, good people,\r","I may be heard, I would crave a word or two;\r","The which shall turn you to no further harm\r","Than so much loss of time.\r","\r","SICINIUS:\r","Speak briefly then;\r","For we are peremptory to dispatch\r","This viperous traitor: to eject him hence\r","Were but one danger, and to keep him here\r","Our certain death: therefore it is decreed\r","He dies to-night.\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","Now the good gods forbid\r","That our renowned Rome, whose gratitude\r","Towards her deserved children is enroll'd\r","In Jove's own book, like an unnatural dam\r","Should now eat up her own!\r","\r","SICINIUS:\r","He's a disease that must be cut away.\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","O, he's a limb that has but a disease;\r","Mortal, to cut it off; to cure it, easy.\r","What has he done to Rome that's worthy death?\r","Killing our enemies, the blood he hath lost--\r","Which, I dare vouch, is more than that he hath,\r","By many an ounce--he dropp'd it for his country;\r","And what is left, to lose it by his country,\r","Were to us all, that do't and suffer it,\r","A brand to the end o' the world.\r","\r","SICINIUS:\r","This is clean kam.\r","\r","BRUTUS:\r","Merely awry: when he did love his country,\r","It honour'd him.\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","The service of the foot\r","Being once gangrened, is not then respected\r","For what before it was.\r","\r","BRUTUS:\r","We'll hear no more.\r","Pursue him to his house, and pluck him thence:\r","Lest his infection, being of catching nature,\r","Spread further.\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","One word more, one word.\r","This tiger-footed rage, when it shall find\r","The harm of unscann'd swiftness, will too late\r","Tie leaden pounds to's heels. Proceed by process;\r","Lest parties, as he is beloved, break out,\r","And sack great Rome with Romans.\r","\r","BRUTUS:\r","If it were so,--\r","\r","SICINIUS:\r","What do ye talk?\r","Have we not had a taste of his obedience?\r","Our aediles smote? ourselves resisted? Come.\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","Consider this: he has been bred i' the wars\r","Since he could draw a sword, and is ill school'd\r","In bolted language; meal and bran together\r","He throws without distinction. Give me leave,\r","I'll go to him, and undertake to bring him\r","Where he shall answer, by a lawful form,\r","In peace, to his utmost peril.\r","\r","First Senator:\r","Noble tribunes,\r","It is the humane way: the other course\r","Will prove too bloody, and the end of it\r","Unknown to the beginning.\r","\r","SICINIUS:\r","Noble Menenius,\r","Be you then as the people's officer.\r","Masters, lay down your weapons.\r","\r","BRUTUS:\r","Go not home.\r","\r","SICINIUS:\r","Meet on the market-place. We'll attend you there:\r","Where, if you bring not Marcius, we'll proceed\r","In our first way.\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","I'll bring him to you.\r","Let me desire your company: he must come,\r","Or what is worst will follow.\r","\r","First Senator:\r","Pray you, let's to him.\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","Let them puff all about mine ears, present me\r","Death on the wheel or at wild horses' heels,\r","Or pile ten hills on the Tarpeian rock,\r","That the precipitation might down stretch\r","Below the beam of sight, yet will I still\r","Be thus to them.\r","\r","A Patrician:\r","You do the nobler.\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","I muse my mother\r","Does not approve me further, who was wont\r","To call them woollen vassals, things created\r","To buy and sell with groats, to show bare heads\r","In congregations, to yawn, be still and wonder,\r","When one but of my ordinance stood up\r","To speak of peace or war.\r","I talk of you:\r","Why did you wish me milder? would you have me\r","False to my nature? Rather say I play\r","The man I am.\r","\r","VOLUMNIA:\r","O, sir, sir, sir,\r","I would have had you put your power well on,\r","Before you had worn it out.\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","Let go.\r","\r","VOLUMNIA:\r","You might have been enough the man you are,\r","With striving less to be so; lesser had been\r","The thwartings of your dispositions, if\r","You had not show'd them how ye were disposed\r","Ere they lack'd power to cross you.\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","Let them hang.\r","\r","A Patrician:\r","Ay, and burn too.\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","Come, come, you have been too rough, something\r","too rough;\r","You must return and mend it.\r","\r","First Senator:\r","There's no remedy;\r","Unless, by not so doing, our good city\r","Cleave in the midst, and perish.\r","\r","VOLUMNIA:\r","Pray, be counsell'd:\r","I have a heart as little apt as yours,\r","But yet a brain that leads my use of anger\r","To better vantage.\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","Well said, noble woman?\r","Before he should thus stoop to the herd, but that\r","The violent fit o' the time craves it as physic\r","For the whole state, I would put mine armour on,\r","Which I can scarcely bear.\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","What must I do?\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","Return to the tribunes.\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","Well, what then? what then?\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","Repent what you have spoke.\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","For them! I cannot do it to the gods;\r","Must I then do't to them?\r","\r","VOLUMNIA:\r","You are too absolute;\r","Though therein you can never be too noble,\r","But when extremities speak. I have heard you say,\r","Honour and policy, like unsever'd friends,\r","I' the war do grow together: grant that, and tell me,\r","In peace what each of them by the other lose,\r","That they combine not there.\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","Tush, tush!\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","A good demand.\r","\r","VOLUMNIA:\r","If it be honour in your wars to seem\r","The same you are not, which, for your best ends,\r","You adopt your policy, how is it less or worse,\r","That it shall hold companionship in peace\r","With honour, as in war, since that to both\r","It stands in like request?\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","Why force you this?\r","\r","VOLUMNIA:\r","Because that now it lies you on to speak\r","To the people; not by your own instruction,\r","Nor by the matter which your heart prompts you,\r","But with such words that are but rooted in\r","Your tongue, though but bastards and syllables\r","Of no allowance to your bosom's truth.\r","Now, this no more dishonours you at all\r","Than to take in a town with gentle words,\r","Which else would put you to your fortune and\r","The hazard of much blood.\r","I would dissemble with my nature where\r","My fortunes and my friends at stake required\r","I should do so in honour: I am in this,\r","Your wife, your son, these senators, the nobles;\r","And you will rather show our general louts\r","How you can frown than spend a fawn upon 'em,\r","For the inheritance of their loves and safeguard\r","Of what that want might ruin.\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","Noble lady!\r","Come, go with us; speak fair: you may salve so,\r","Not what is dangerous present, but the loss\r","Of what is past.\r","\r","VOLUMNIA:\r","I prithee now, my son,\r","Go to them, with this bonnet in thy hand;\r","And thus far having stretch'd it--here be with them--\r","Thy knee bussing the stones--for in such business\r","Action is eloquence, and the eyes of the ignorant\r","More learned than the ears--waving thy head,\r","Which often, thus, correcting thy stout heart,\r","Now humble as the ripest mulberry\r","That will not hold the handling: or say to them,\r","Thou art their soldier, and being bred in broils\r","Hast not the soft way which, thou dost confess,\r","Were fit for thee to use as they to claim,\r","In asking their good loves, but thou wilt frame\r","Thyself, forsooth, hereafter theirs, so far\r","As thou hast power and person.\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","This but done,\r","Even as she speaks, why, their hearts were yours;\r","For they have pardons, being ask'd, as free\r","As words to little purpose.\r","\r","VOLUMNIA:\r","Prithee now,\r","Go, and be ruled: although I know thou hadst rather\r","Follow thine enemy in a fiery gulf\r","Than flatter him in a bower. Here is Cominius.\r","\r","COMINIUS:\r","I have been i' the market-place; and, sir,'tis fit\r","You make strong party, or defend yourself\r","By calmness or by absence: all's in anger.\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","Only fair speech.\r","\r","COMINIUS:\r","I think 'twill serve, if he\r","Can thereto frame his spirit.\r","\r","VOLUMNIA:\r","He must, and will\r","Prithee now, say you will, and go about it.\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","Must I go show them my unbarbed sconce?\r","Must I with base tongue give my noble heart\r","A lie that it must bear? Well, I will do't:\r","Yet, were there but this single plot to lose,\r","This mould of Marcius, they to dust should grind it\r","And throw't against the wind. To the market-place!\r","You have put me now to such a part which never\r","I shall discharge to the life.\r","\r","COMINIUS:\r","Come, come, we'll prompt you.\r","\r","VOLUMNIA:\r","I prithee now, sweet son, as thou hast said\r","My praises made thee first a soldier, so,\r","To have my praise for this, perform a part\r","Thou hast not done before.\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","Well, I must do't:\r","Away, my disposition, and possess me\r","Some harlot's spirit! my throat of war be turn'd,\r","Which quired with my drum, into a pipe\r","Small as an eunuch, or the virgin voice\r","That babies lulls asleep! the smiles of knaves\r","Tent in my cheeks, and schoolboys' tears take up\r","The glasses of my sight! a beggar's tongue\r","Make motion through my lips, and my arm'd knees,\r","Who bow'd but in my stirrup, bend like his\r","That hath received an alms! I will not do't,\r","Lest I surcease to honour mine own truth\r","And by my body's action teach my mind\r","A most inherent baseness.\r","\r","VOLUMNIA:\r","At thy choice, then:\r","To beg of thee, it is my more dishonour\r","Than thou of them. Come all to ruin; let\r","Thy mother rather feel thy pride than fear\r","Thy dangerous stoutness, for I mock at death\r","With as big heart as thou. Do as thou list\r","Thy valiantness was mine, thou suck'dst it from me,\r","But owe thy pride thyself.\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","Pray, be content:\r","Mother, I am going to the market-place;\r","Chide me no more. I'll mountebank their loves,\r","Cog their hearts from them, and come home beloved\r","Of all the trades in Rome. Look, I am going:\r","Commend me to my wife. I'll return consul;\r","Or never trust to what my tongue can do\r","I' the way of flattery further.\r","\r","VOLUMNIA:\r","Do your will.\r","\r","COMINIUS:\r","Away! the tribunes do attend you: arm yourself\r","To answer mildly; for they are prepared\r","With accusations, as I hear, more strong\r","Than are upon you yet.\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","The word is 'mildly.' Pray you, let us go:\r","Let them accuse me by invention, I\r","Will answer in mine honour.\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","Ay, but mildly.\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","Well, mildly be it then. Mildly!\r","\r","BRUTUS:\r","In this point charge him home, that he affects\r","Tyrannical power: if he evade us there,\r","Enforce him with his envy to the people,\r","And that the spoil got on the Antiates\r","Was ne'er distributed.\r","What, will he come?\r","\r","AEdile:\r","He's coming.\r","\r","BRUTUS:\r","How accompanied?\r","\r","AEdile:\r","With old Menenius, and those senators\r","That always favour'd him.\r","\r","SICINIUS:\r","Have you a catalogue\r","Of all the voices that we have procured\r","Set down by the poll?\r","\r","AEdile:\r","I have; 'tis ready.\r","\r","SICINIUS:\r","Have you collected them by tribes?\r","\r","AEdile:\r","I have.\r","\r","SICINIUS:\r","Assemble presently the people hither;\r","And when they bear me say 'It shall be so\r","I' the right and strength o' the commons,' be it either\r","For death, for fine, or banishment, then let them\r","If I say fine, cry 'Fine;' if death, cry 'Death.'\r","Insisting on the old prerogative\r","And power i' the truth o' the cause.\r","\r","AEdile:\r","I shall inform them.\r","\r","BRUTUS:\r","And when such time they have begun to cry,\r","Let them not cease, but with a din confused\r","Enforce the present execution\r","Of what we chance to sentence.\r","\r","AEdile:\r","Very well.\r","\r","SICINIUS:\r","Make them be strong and ready for this hint,\r","When we shall hap to give 't them.\r","\r","BRUTUS:\r","Go about it.\r","Put him to choler straight: he hath been used\r","Ever to conquer, and to have his worth\r","Of contradiction: being once chafed, he cannot\r","Be rein'd again to temperance; then he speaks\r","What's in his heart; and that is there which looks\r","With us to break his neck.\r","\r","SICINIUS:\r","Well, here he comes.\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","Calmly, I do beseech you.\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","Ay, as an ostler, that for the poorest piece\r","Will bear the knave by the volume. The honour'd gods\r","Keep Rome in safety, and the chairs of justice\r","Supplied with worthy men! plant love among 's!\r","Throng our large temples with the shows of peace,\r","And not our streets with war!\r","\r","First Senator:\r","Amen, amen.\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","A noble wish.\r","\r","SICINIUS:\r","Draw near, ye people.\r","\r","AEdile:\r","List to your tribunes. Audience: peace, I say!\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","First, hear me speak.\r","\r","Both Tribunes:\r","Well, say. Peace, ho!\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","Shall I be charged no further than this present?\r","Must all determine here?\r","\r","SICINIUS:\r","I do demand,\r","If you submit you to the people's voices,\r","Allow their officers and are content\r","To suffer lawful censure for such faults\r","As shall be proved upon you?\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","I am content.\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","Lo, citizens, he says he is content:\r","The warlike service he has done, consider; think\r","Upon the wounds his body bears, which show\r","Like graves i' the holy churchyard.\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","Scratches with briers,\r","Scars to move laughter only.\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","Consider further,\r","That when he speaks not like a citizen,\r","You find him like a soldier: do not take\r","His rougher accents for malicious sounds,\r","But, as I say, such as become a soldier,\r","Rather than envy you.\r","\r","COMINIUS:\r","Well, well, no more.\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","What is the matter\r","That being pass'd for consul with full voice,\r","I am so dishonour'd that the very hour\r","You take it off again?\r","\r","SICINIUS:\r","Answer to us.\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","Say, then: 'tis true, I ought so.\r","\r","SICINIUS:\r","We charge you, that you have contrived to take\r","From Rome all season'd office and to wind\r","Yourself into a power tyrannical;\r","For which you are a traitor to the people.\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","How! traitor!\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","Nay, temperately; your promise.\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","The fires i' the lowest hell fold-in the people!\r","Call me their traitor! Thou injurious tribune!\r","Within thine eyes sat twenty thousand deaths,\r","In thy hand clutch'd as many millions, in\r","Thy lying tongue both numbers, I would say\r","'Thou liest' unto thee with a voice as free\r","As I do pray the gods.\r","\r","SICINIUS:\r","Mark you this, people?\r","\r","Citizens:\r","To the rock, to the rock with him!\r","\r","SICINIUS:\r","Peace!\r","We need not put new matter to his charge:\r","What you have seen him do and heard him speak,\r","Beating your officers, cursing yourselves,\r","Opposing laws with strokes and here defying\r","Those whose great power must try him; even this,\r","So criminal and in such capital kind,\r","Deserves the extremest death.\r","\r","BRUTUS:\r","But since he hath\r","Served well for Rome,--\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","What do you prate of service?\r","\r","BRUTUS:\r","I talk of that, that know it.\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","You?\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","Is this the promise that you made your mother?\r","\r","COMINIUS:\r","Know, I pray you,--\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","I know no further:\r","Let them pronounce the steep Tarpeian death,\r","Vagabond exile, raying, pent to linger\r","But with a grain a day, I would not buy\r","Their mercy at the price of one fair word;\r","Nor cheque my courage for what they can give,\r","To have't with saying 'Good morrow.'\r","\r","SICINIUS:\r","For that he has,\r","As much as in him lies, from time to time\r","Envied against the people, seeking means\r","To pluck away their power, as now at last\r","Given hostile strokes, and that not in the presence\r","Of dreaded justice, but on the ministers\r","That do distribute it; in the name o' the people\r","And in the power of us the tribunes, we,\r","Even from this instant, banish him our city,\r","In peril of precipitation\r","From off the rock Tarpeian never more\r","To enter our Rome gates: i' the people's name,\r","I say it shall be so.\r","\r","Citizens:\r","It shall be so, it shall be so; let him away:\r","He's banish'd, and it shall be so.\r","\r","COMINIUS:\r","Hear me, my masters, and my common friends,--\r","\r","SICINIUS:\r","He's sentenced; no more hearing.\r","\r","COMINIUS:\r","Let me speak:\r","I have been consul, and can show for Rome\r","Her enemies' marks upon me. I do love\r","My country's good with a respect more tender,\r","More holy and profound, than mine own life,\r","My dear wife's estimate, her womb's increase,\r","And treasure of my loins; then if I would\r","Speak that,--\r","\r","SICINIUS:\r","We know your drift: speak what?\r","\r","BRUTUS:\r","There's no more to be said, but he is banish'd,\r","As enemy to the people and his country:\r","It shall be so.\r","\r","Citizens:\r","It shall be so, it shall be so.\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","You common cry of curs! whose breath I hate\r","As reek o' the rotten fens, whose loves I prize\r","As the dead carcasses of unburied men\r","That do corrupt my air, I banish you;\r","And here remain with your uncertainty!\r","Let every feeble rumour shake your hearts!\r","Your enemies, with nodding of their plumes,\r","Fan you into despair! Have the power still\r","To banish your defenders; till at length\r","Your ignorance, which finds not till it feels,\r","Making not reservation of yourselves,\r","Still your own foes, deliver you as most\r","Abated captives to some nation\r","That won you without blows! Despising,\r","For you, the city, thus I turn my back:\r","There is a world elsewhere.\r","\r","AEdile:\r","The people's enemy is gone, is gone!\r","\r","Citizens:\r","Our enemy is banish'd! he is gone! Hoo! hoo!\r","\r","SICINIUS:\r","Go, see him out at gates, and follow him,\r","As he hath followed you, with all despite;\r","Give him deserved vexation. Let a guard\r","Attend us through the city.\r","\r","Citizens:\r","Come, come; let's see him out at gates; come.\r","The gods preserve our noble tribunes! Come.\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","Come, leave your tears: a brief farewell: the beast\r","With many heads butts me away. Nay, mother,\r","Where is your ancient courage? you were used\r","To say extremity was the trier of spirits;\r","That common chances common men could bear;\r","That when the sea was calm all boats alike\r","Show'd mastership in floating; fortune's blows,\r","When most struck home, being gentle wounded, craves\r","A noble cunning: you were used to load me\r","With precepts that would make invincible\r","The heart that conn'd them.\r","\r","VIRGILIA:\r","O heavens! O heavens!\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","Nay! prithee, woman,--\r","\r","VOLUMNIA:\r","Now the red pestilence strike all trades in Rome,\r","And occupations perish!\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","What, what, what!\r","I shall be loved when I am lack'd. Nay, mother.\r","Resume that spirit, when you were wont to say,\r","If you had been the wife of Hercules,\r","Six of his labours you'ld have done, and saved\r","Your husband so much sweat. Cominius,\r","Droop not; adieu. Farewell, my wife, my mother:\r","I'll do well yet. Thou old and true Menenius,\r","Thy tears are salter than a younger man's,\r","And venomous to thine eyes. My sometime general,\r","I have seen thee stem, and thou hast oft beheld\r","Heart-hardening spectacles; tell these sad women\r","'Tis fond to wail inevitable strokes,\r","As 'tis to laugh at 'em. My mother, you wot well\r","My hazards still have been your solace: and\r","Believe't not lightly--though I go alone,\r","Like to a lonely dragon, that his fen\r","Makes fear'd and talk'd of more than seen--your son\r","Will or exceed the common or be caught\r","With cautelous baits and practise.\r","\r","VOLUMNIA:\r","My first son.\r","Whither wilt thou go? Take good Cominius\r","With thee awhile: determine on some course,\r","More than a wild exposture to each chance\r","That starts i' the way before thee.\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","O the gods!\r","\r","COMINIUS:\r","I'll follow thee a month, devise with thee\r","Where thou shalt rest, that thou mayst hear of us\r","And we of thee: so if the time thrust forth\r","A cause for thy repeal, we shall not send\r","O'er the vast world to seek a single man,\r","And lose advantage, which doth ever cool\r","I' the absence of the needer.\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","Fare ye well:\r","Thou hast years upon thee; and thou art too full\r","Of the wars' surfeits, to go rove with one\r","That's yet unbruised: bring me but out at gate.\r","Come, my sweet wife, my dearest mother, and\r","My friends of noble touch, when I am forth,\r","Bid me farewell, and smile. I pray you, come.\r","While I remain above the ground, you shall\r","Hear from me still, and never of me aught\r","But what is like me formerly.\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","That's worthily\r","As any ear can hear. Come, let's not weep.\r","If I could shake off but one seven years\r","From these old arms and legs, by the good gods,\r","I'ld with thee every foot.\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","Give me thy hand: Come.\r","\r","SICINIUS:\r","Bid them all home; he's gone, and we'll no further.\r","The nobility are vex'd, whom we see have sided\r","In his behalf.\r","\r","BRUTUS:\r","Now we have shown our power,\r","Let us seem humbler after it is done\r","Than when it was a-doing.\r","\r","SICINIUS:\r","Bid them home:\r","Say their great enemy is gone, and they\r","Stand in their ancient strength.\r","\r","BRUTUS:\r","Dismiss them home.\r","Here comes his mother.\r","\r","SICINIUS:\r","Let's not meet her.\r","\r","BRUTUS:\r","Why?\r","\r","SICINIUS:\r","They say she's mad.\r","\r","BRUTUS:\r","They have ta'en note of us: keep on your way.\r","\r","VOLUMNIA:\r","O, ye're well met: the hoarded plague o' the gods\r","Requite your love!\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","Peace, peace; be not so loud.\r","\r","VOLUMNIA:\r","If that I could for weeping, you should hear,--\r","Nay, and you shall hear some.\r","Will you be gone?\r","\r","VIRGILIA:\r","\r","SICINIUS:\r","Are you mankind?\r","\r","VOLUMNIA:\r","Ay, fool; is that a shame? Note but this fool.\r","Was not a man my father? Hadst thou foxship\r","To banish him that struck more blows for Rome\r","Than thou hast spoken words?\r","\r","SICINIUS:\r","O blessed heavens!\r","\r","VOLUMNIA:\r","More noble blows than ever thou wise words;\r","And for Rome's good. I'll tell thee what; yet go:\r","Nay, but thou shalt stay too: I would my son\r","Were in Arabia, and thy tribe before him,\r","His good sword in his hand.\r","\r","SICINIUS:\r","What then?\r","\r","VIRGILIA:\r","What then!\r","He'ld make an end of thy posterity.\r","\r","VOLUMNIA:\r","Bastards and all.\r","Good man, the wounds that he does bear for Rome!\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","Come, come, peace.\r","\r","SICINIUS:\r","I would he had continued to his country\r","As he began, and not unknit himself\r","The noble knot he made.\r","\r","BRUTUS:\r","I would he had.\r","\r","VOLUMNIA:\r","'I would he had'! 'Twas you incensed the rabble:\r","Cats, that can judge as fitly of his worth\r","As I can of those mysteries which heaven\r","Will not have earth to know.\r","\r","BRUTUS:\r","Pray, let us go.\r","\r","VOLUMNIA:\r","Now, pray, sir, get you gone:\r","You have done a brave deed. Ere you go, hear this:--\r","As far as doth the Capitol exceed\r","The meanest house in Rome, so far my son--\r","This lady's husband here, this, do you see--\r","Whom you have banish'd, does exceed you all.\r","\r","BRUTUS:\r","Well, well, we'll leave you.\r","\r","SICINIUS:\r","Why stay we to be baited\r","With one that wants her wits?\r","\r","VOLUMNIA:\r","Take my prayers with you.\r","I would the gods had nothing else to do\r","But to confirm my curses! Could I meet 'em\r","But once a-day, it would unclog my heart\r","Of what lies heavy to't.\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","You have told them home;\r","And, by my troth, you have cause. You'll sup with me?\r","\r","VOLUMNIA:\r","Anger's my meat; I sup upon myself,\r","And so shall starve with feeding. Come, let's go:\r","Leave this faint puling and lament as I do,\r","In anger, Juno-like. Come, come, come.\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","Fie, fie, fie!\r","\r","Roman:\r","I know you well, sir, and you know\r","me: your name, I think, is Adrian.\r","\r","Volsce:\r","It is so, sir: truly, I have forgot you.\r","\r","Roman:\r","I am a Roman; and my services are,\r","as you are, against 'em: know you me yet?\r","\r","Volsce:\r","Nicanor? no.\r","\r","Roman:\r","The same, sir.\r","\r","Volsce:\r","You had more beard when I last saw you; but your\r","favour is well approved by your tongue. What's the\r","news in Rome? I have a note from the Volscian state,\r","to find you out there: you have well saved me a\r","day's journey.\r","\r","Roman:\r","There hath been in Rome strange insurrections; the\r","people against the senators, patricians, and nobles.\r","\r","Volsce:\r","Hath been! is it ended, then? Our state thinks not\r","so: they are in a most warlike preparation, and\r","hope to come upon them in the heat of their division.\r","\r","Roman:\r","The main blaze of it is past, but a small thing\r","would make it flame again: for the nobles receive\r","so to heart the banishment of that worthy\r","Coriolanus, that they are in a ripe aptness to take\r","all power from the people and to pluck from them\r","their tribunes for ever. This lies glowing, I can\r","tell you, and is almost mature for the violent\r","breaking out.\r","\r","Volsce:\r","Coriolanus banished!\r","\r","Roman:\r","Banished, sir.\r","\r","Volsce:\r","You will be welcome with this intelligence, Nicanor.\r","\r","Roman:\r","The day serves well for them now. I have heard it\r","said, the fittest time to corrupt a man's wife is\r","when she's fallen out with her husband. Your noble\r","Tullus Aufidius will appear well in these wars, his\r","great opposer, Coriolanus, being now in no request\r","of his country.\r","\r","Volsce:\r","He cannot choose. I am most fortunate, thus\r","accidentally to encounter you: you have ended my\r","business, and I will merrily accompany you home.\r","\r","Roman:\r","I shall, between this and supper, tell you most\r","strange things from Rome; all tending to the good of\r","their adversaries. Have you an army ready, say you?\r","\r","Volsce:\r","A most royal one; the centurions and their charges,\r","distinctly billeted, already in the entertainment,\r","and to be on foot at an hour's warning.\r","\r","Roman:\r","I am joyful to hear of their readiness, and am the\r","man, I think, that shall set them in present action.\r","So, sir, heartily well met, and most glad of your company.\r","\r","Volsce:\r","You take my part from me, sir; I have the most cause\r","to be glad of yours.\r","\r","Roman:\r","Well, let us go together.\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","A goodly city is this Antium. City,\r","'Tis I that made thy widows: many an heir\r","Of these fair edifices 'fore my wars\r","Have I heard groan and drop: then know me not,\r","Lest that thy wives with spits and boys with stones\r","In puny battle slay me.\r","Save you, sir.\r","\r","Citizen:\r","And you.\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","Direct me, if it be your will,\r","Where great Aufidius lies: is he in Antium?\r","\r","Citizen:\r","He is, and feasts the nobles of the state\r","At his house this night.\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","Which is his house, beseech you?\r","\r","Citizen:\r","This, here before you.\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","Thank you, sir: farewell.\r","O world, thy slippery turns! Friends now fast sworn,\r","Whose double bosoms seem to wear one heart,\r","Whose house, whose bed, whose meal, and exercise,\r","Are still together, who twin, as 'twere, in love\r","Unseparable, shall within this hour,\r","On a dissension of a doit, break out\r","To bitterest enmity: so, fellest foes,\r","Whose passions and whose plots have broke their sleep,\r","To take the one the other, by some chance,\r","Some trick not worth an egg, shall grow dear friends\r","And interjoin their issues. So with me:\r","My birth-place hate I, and my love's upon\r","This enemy town. I'll enter: if he slay me,\r","He does fair justice; if he give me way,\r","I'll do his country service.\r","\r","First Servingman:\r","Wine, wine, wine! What service\r","is here! I think our fellows are asleep.\r","\r","Second Servingman:\r","Where's Cotus? my master calls\r","for him. Cotus!\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","A goodly house: the feast smells well; but I\r","Appear not like a guest.\r","\r","First Servingman:\r","What would you have, friend? whence are you?\r","Here's no place for you: pray, go to the door.\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","I have deserved no better entertainment,\r","In being Coriolanus.\r","\r","Second Servingman:\r","Whence are you, sir? Has the porter his eyes in his\r","head; that he gives entrance to such companions?\r","Pray, get you out.\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","Away!\r","\r","Second Servingman:\r","Away! get you away.\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","Now thou'rt troublesome.\r","\r","Second Servingman:\r","Are you so brave? I'll have you talked with anon.\r","\r","Third Servingman:\r","What fellow's this?\r","\r","First Servingman:\r","A strange one as ever I looked on: I cannot get him\r","out of the house: prithee, call my master to him.\r","\r","Third Servingman:\r","What have you to do here, fellow? Pray you, avoid\r","the house.\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","Let me but stand; I will not hurt your hearth.\r","\r","Third Servingman:\r","What are you?\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","A gentleman.\r","\r","Third Servingman:\r","A marvellous poor one.\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","True, so I am.\r","\r","Third Servingman:\r","Pray you, poor gentleman, take up some other\r","station; here's no place for you; pray you, avoid: come.\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","Follow your function, go, and batten on cold bits.\r","\r","Third Servingman:\r","What, you will not? Prithee, tell my master what a\r","strange guest he has here.\r","\r","Second Servingman:\r","And I shall.\r","\r","Third Servingman:\r","Where dwellest thou?\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","Under the canopy.\r","\r","Third Servingman:\r","Under the canopy!\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","Ay.\r","\r","Third Servingman:\r","Where's that?\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","I' the city of kites and crows.\r","\r","Third Servingman:\r","I' the city of kites and crows! What an ass it is!\r","Then thou dwellest with daws too?\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","No, I serve not thy master.\r","\r","Third Servingman:\r","How, sir! do you meddle with my master?\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","Ay; 'tis an honester service than to meddle with thy\r","mistress. Thou pratest, and pratest; serve with thy\r","trencher, hence!\r","\r","AUFIDIUS:\r","Where is this fellow?\r","\r","Second Servingman:\r","Here, sir: I'ld have beaten him like a dog, but for\r","disturbing the lords within.\r","\r","AUFIDIUS:\r","Whence comest thou? what wouldst thou? thy name?\r","Why speak'st not? speak, man: what's thy name?\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","If, Tullus,\r","Not yet thou knowest me, and, seeing me, dost not\r","Think me for the man I am, necessity\r","Commands me name myself.\r","\r","AUFIDIUS:\r","What is thy name?\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","A name unmusical to the Volscians' ears,\r","And harsh in sound to thine.\r","\r","AUFIDIUS:\r","Say, what's thy name?\r","Thou hast a grim appearance, and thy face\r","Bears a command in't; though thy tackle's torn.\r","Thou show'st a noble vessel: what's thy name?\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","Prepare thy brow to frown: know'st\r","thou me yet?\r","\r","AUFIDIUS:\r","I know thee not: thy name?\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","My name is Caius Marcius, who hath done\r","To thee particularly and to all the Volsces\r","Great hurt and mischief; thereto witness may\r","My surname, Coriolanus: the painful service,\r","The extreme dangers and the drops of blood\r","Shed for my thankless country are requited\r","But with that surname; a good memory,\r","And witness of the malice and displeasure\r","Which thou shouldst bear me: only that name remains;\r","The cruelty and envy of the people,\r","Permitted by our dastard nobles, who\r","Have all forsook me, hath devour'd the rest;\r","And suffer'd me by the voice of slaves to be\r","Whoop'd out of Rome. Now this extremity\r","Hath brought me to thy hearth; not out of hope--\r","Mistake me not--to save my life, for if\r","I had fear'd death, of all the men i' the world\r","I would have 'voided thee, but in mere spite,\r","To be full quit of those my banishers,\r","Stand I before thee here. Then if thou hast\r","A heart of wreak in thee, that wilt revenge\r","Thine own particular wrongs and stop those maims\r","Of shame seen through thy country, speed\r","thee straight,\r","And make my misery serve thy turn: so use it\r","That my revengeful services may prove\r","As benefits to thee, for I will fight\r","Against my canker'd country with the spleen\r","Of all the under fiends. But if so be\r","Thou darest not this and that to prove more fortunes\r","Thou'rt tired, then, in a word, I also am\r","Longer to live most weary, and present\r","My throat to thee and to thy ancient malice;\r","Which not to cut would show thee but a fool,\r","Since I have ever follow'd thee with hate,\r","Drawn tuns of blood out of thy country's breast,\r","And cannot live but to thy shame, unless\r","It be to do thee service.\r","\r","AUFIDIUS:\r","O Marcius, Marcius!\r","Each word thou hast spoke hath weeded from my heart\r","A root of ancient envy. If Jupiter\r","Should from yond cloud speak divine things,\r","And say 'Tis true,' I'ld not believe them more\r","Than thee, all noble Marcius. Let me twine\r","Mine arms about that body, where against\r","My grained ash an hundred times hath broke\r","And scarr'd the moon with splinters: here I clip\r","The anvil of my sword, and do contest\r","As hotly and as nobly with thy love\r","As ever in ambitious strength I did\r","Contend against thy valour. Know thou first,\r","I loved the maid I married; never man\r","Sigh'd truer breath; but that I see thee here,\r","Thou noble thing! more dances my rapt heart\r","Than when I first my wedded mistress saw\r","Bestride my threshold. Why, thou Mars! I tell thee,\r","We have a power on foot; and I had purpose\r","Once more to hew thy target from thy brawn,\r","Or lose mine arm fort: thou hast beat me out\r","Twelve several times, and I have nightly since\r","Dreamt of encounters 'twixt thyself and me;\r","We have been down together in my sleep,\r","Unbuckling helms, fisting each other's throat,\r","And waked half dead with nothing. Worthy Marcius,\r","Had we no quarrel else to Rome, but that\r","Thou art thence banish'd, we would muster all\r","From twelve to seventy, and pouring war\r","Into the bowels of ungrateful Rome,\r","Like a bold flood o'er-bear. O, come, go in,\r","And take our friendly senators by the hands;\r","Who now are here, taking their leaves of me,\r","Who am prepared against your territories,\r","Though not for Rome itself.\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","You bless me, gods!\r","\r","AUFIDIUS:\r","Therefore, most absolute sir, if thou wilt have\r","The leading of thine own revenges, take\r","The one half of my commission; and set down--\r","As best thou art experienced, since thou know'st\r","Thy country's strength and weakness,--thine own ways;\r","Whether to knock against the gates of Rome,\r","Or rudely visit them in parts remote,\r","To fright them, ere destroy. But come in:\r","Let me commend thee first to those that shall\r","Say yea to thy desires. A thousand welcomes!\r","And more a friend than e'er an enemy;\r","Yet, Marcius, that was much. Your hand: most welcome!\r","\r","First Servingman:\r","Here's a strange alteration!\r","\r","Second Servingman:\r","By my hand, I had thought to have strucken him with\r","a cudgel; and yet my mind gave me his clothes made a\r","false report of him.\r","\r","First Servingman:\r","What an arm he has! he turned me about with his\r","finger and his thumb, as one would set up a top.\r","\r","Second Servingman:\r","Nay, I knew by his face that there was something in\r","him: he had, sir, a kind of face, methought,--I\r","cannot tell how to term it.\r","\r","First Servingman:\r","He had so; looking as it were--would I were hanged,\r","but I thought there was more in him than I could think.\r","\r","Second Servingman:\r","So did I, I'll be sworn: he is simply the rarest\r","man i' the world.\r","\r","First Servingman:\r","I think he is: but a greater soldier than he you wot on.\r","\r","Second Servingman:\r","Who, my master?\r","\r","First Servingman:\r","Nay, it's no matter for that.\r","\r","Second Servingman:\r","Worth six on him.\r","\r","First Servingman:\r","Nay, not so neither: but I take him to be the\r","greater soldier.\r","\r","Second Servingman:\r","Faith, look you, one cannot tell how to say that:\r","for the defence of a town, our general is excellent.\r","\r","First Servingman:\r","Ay, and for an assault too.\r","\r","Third Servingman:\r","O slaves, I can tell you news,-- news, you rascals!\r","\r","First Servingman:\r","What, what, what? let's partake.\r","\r","Third Servingman:\r","I would not be a Roman, of all nations; I had as\r","lieve be a condemned man.\r","\r","First Servingman:\r","Wherefore? wherefore?\r","\r","Third Servingman:\r","Why, here's he that was wont to thwack our general,\r","Caius Marcius.\r","\r","First Servingman:\r","Why do you say 'thwack our general '?\r","\r","Third Servingman:\r","I do not say 'thwack our general;' but he was always\r","good enough for him.\r","\r","Second Servingman:\r","Come, we are fellows and friends: he was ever too\r","hard for him; I have heard him say so himself.\r","\r","First Servingman:\r","He was too hard for him directly, to say the troth\r","on't: before Corioli he scotched him and notched\r","him like a carbon ado.\r","\r","Second Servingman:\r","An he had been cannibally given, he might have\r","broiled and eaten him too.\r","\r","First Servingman:\r","But, more of thy news?\r","\r","Third Servingman:\r","Why, he is so made on here within, as if he were son\r","and heir to Mars; set at upper end o' the table; no\r","question asked him by any of the senators, but they\r","stand bald before him: our general himself makes a\r","mistress of him: sanctifies himself with's hand and\r","turns up the white o' the eye to his discourse. But\r","the bottom of the news is that our general is cut i'\r","the middle and but one half of what he was\r","yesterday; for the other has half, by the entreaty\r","and grant of the whole table. He'll go, he says,\r","and sowl the porter of Rome gates by the ears: he\r","will mow all down before him, and leave his passage polled.\r","\r","Second Servingman:\r","And he's as like to do't as any man I can imagine.\r","\r","Third Servingman:\r","Do't! he will do't; for, look you, sir, he has as\r","many friends as enemies; which friends, sir, as it\r","were, durst not, look you, sir, show themselves, as\r","we term it, his friends whilst he's in directitude.\r","\r","First Servingman:\r","Directitude! what's that?\r","\r","Third Servingman:\r","But when they shall see, sir, his crest up again,\r","and the man in blood, they will out of their\r","burrows, like conies after rain, and revel all with\r","him.\r","\r","First Servingman:\r","But when goes this forward?\r","\r","Third Servingman:\r","To-morrow; to-day; presently; you shall have the\r","drum struck up this afternoon: 'tis, as it were, a\r","parcel of their feast, and to be executed ere they\r","wipe their lips.\r","\r","Second Servingman:\r","Why, then we shall have a stirring world again.\r","This peace is nothing, but to rust iron, increase\r","tailors, and breed ballad-makers.\r","\r","First Servingman:\r","Let me have war, say I; it exceeds peace as far as\r","day does night; it's spritely, waking, audible, and\r","full of vent. Peace is a very apoplexy, lethargy;\r","mulled, deaf, sleepy, insensible; a getter of more\r","bastard children than war's a destroyer of men.\r","\r","Second Servingman:\r","'Tis so: and as war, in some sort, may be said to\r","be a ravisher, so it cannot be denied but peace is a\r","great maker of cuckolds.\r","\r","First Servingman:\r","Ay, and it makes men hate one another.\r","\r","Third Servingman:\r","Reason; because they then less need one another.\r","The wars for my money. I hope to see Romans as cheap\r","as Volscians. They are rising, they are rising.\r","\r","All:\r","In, in, in, in!\r","\r","SICINIUS:\r","We hear not of him, neither need we fear him;\r","His remedies are tame i' the present peace\r","And quietness of the people, which before\r","Were in wild hurry. Here do we make his friends\r","Blush that the world goes well, who rather had,\r","Though they themselves did suffer by't, behold\r","Dissentious numbers pestering streets than see\r","Our tradesmen with in their shops and going\r","About their functions friendly.\r","\r","BRUTUS:\r","We stood to't in good time.\r","Is this Menenius?\r","\r","SICINIUS:\r","'Tis he,'tis he: O, he is grown most kind of late.\r","\r","Both Tribunes:\r","Hail sir!\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","Hail to you both!\r","\r","SICINIUS:\r","Your Coriolanus\r","Is not much miss'd, but with his friends:\r","The commonwealth doth stand, and so would do,\r","Were he more angry at it.\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","All's well; and might have been much better, if\r","He could have temporized.\r","\r","SICINIUS:\r","Where is he, hear you?\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","Nay, I hear nothing: his mother and his wife\r","Hear nothing from him.\r","\r","Citizens:\r","The gods preserve you both!\r","\r","SICINIUS:\r","God-den, our neighbours.\r","\r","BRUTUS:\r","God-den to you all, god-den to you all.\r","\r","First Citizen:\r","Ourselves, our wives, and children, on our knees,\r","Are bound to pray for you both.\r","\r","SICINIUS:\r","Live, and thrive!\r","\r","BRUTUS:\r","Farewell, kind neighbours: we wish'd Coriolanus\r","Had loved you as we did.\r","\r","Citizens:\r","Now the gods keep you!\r","\r","Both Tribunes:\r","Farewell, farewell.\r","\r","SICINIUS:\r","This is a happier and more comely time\r","Than when these fellows ran about the streets,\r","Crying confusion.\r","\r","BRUTUS:\r","Caius Marcius was\r","A worthy officer i' the war; but insolent,\r","O'ercome with pride, ambitious past all thinking,\r","Self-loving,--\r","\r","SICINIUS:\r","And affecting one sole throne,\r","Without assistance.\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","I think not so.\r","\r","SICINIUS:\r","We should by this, to all our lamentation,\r","If he had gone forth consul, found it so.\r","\r","BRUTUS:\r","The gods have well prevented it, and Rome\r","Sits safe and still without him.\r","\r","AEdile:\r","Worthy tribunes,\r","There is a slave, whom we have put in prison,\r","Reports, the Volsces with two several powers\r","Are enter'd in the Roman territories,\r","And with the deepest malice of the war\r","Destroy what lies before 'em.\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","'Tis Aufidius,\r","Who, hearing of our Marcius' banishment,\r","Thrusts forth his horns again into the world;\r","Which were inshell'd when Marcius stood for Rome,\r","And durst not once peep out.\r","\r","SICINIUS:\r","Come, what talk you\r","Of Marcius?\r","\r","BRUTUS:\r","Go see this rumourer whipp'd. It cannot be\r","The Volsces dare break with us.\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","Cannot be!\r","We have record that very well it can,\r","And three examples of the like have been\r","Within my age. But reason with the fellow,\r","Before you punish him, where he heard this,\r","Lest you shall chance to whip your information\r","And beat the messenger who bids beware\r","Of what is to be dreaded.\r","\r","SICINIUS:\r","Tell not me:\r","I know this cannot be.\r","\r","BRUTUS:\r","Not possible.\r","\r","Messenger:\r","The nobles in great earnestness are going\r","All to the senate-house: some news is come\r","That turns their countenances.\r","\r","SICINIUS:\r","'Tis this slave;--\r","Go whip him, 'fore the people's eyes:--his raising;\r","Nothing but his report.\r","\r","Messenger:\r","Yes, worthy sir,\r","The slave's report is seconded; and more,\r","More fearful, is deliver'd.\r","\r","SICINIUS:\r","What more fearful?\r","\r","Messenger:\r","It is spoke freely out of many mouths--\r","How probable I do not know--that Marcius,\r","Join'd with Aufidius, leads a power 'gainst Rome,\r","And vows revenge as spacious as between\r","The young'st and oldest thing.\r","\r","SICINIUS:\r","This is most likely!\r","\r","BRUTUS:\r","Raised only, that the weaker sort may wish\r","Good Marcius home again.\r","\r","SICINIUS:\r","The very trick on't.\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","This is unlikely:\r","He and Aufidius can no more atone\r","Than violentest contrariety.\r","\r","Second Messenger:\r","You are sent for to the senate:\r","A fearful army, led by Caius Marcius\r","Associated with Aufidius, rages\r","Upon our territories; and have already\r","O'erborne their way, consumed with fire, and took\r","What lay before them.\r","\r","COMINIUS:\r","O, you have made good work!\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","What news? what news?\r","\r","COMINIUS:\r","You have holp to ravish your own daughters and\r","To melt the city leads upon your pates,\r","To see your wives dishonour'd to your noses,--\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","What's the news? what's the news?\r","\r","COMINIUS:\r","Your temples burned in their cement, and\r","Your franchises, whereon you stood, confined\r","Into an auger's bore.\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","Pray now, your news?\r","You have made fair work, I fear me.--Pray, your news?--\r","If Marcius should be join'd with Volscians,--\r","\r","COMINIUS:\r","If!\r","He is their god: he leads them like a thing\r","Made by some other deity than nature,\r","That shapes man better; and they follow him,\r","Against us brats, with no less confidence\r","Than boys pursuing summer butterflies,\r","Or butchers killing flies.\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","You have made good work,\r","You and your apron-men; you that stood so up much\r","on the voice of occupation and\r","The breath of garlic-eaters!\r","\r","COMINIUS:\r","He will shake\r","Your Rome about your ears.\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","As Hercules\r","Did shake down mellow fruit.\r","You have made fair work!\r","\r","BRUTUS:\r","But is this true, sir?\r","\r","COMINIUS:\r","Ay; and you'll look pale\r","Before you find it other. All the regions\r","Do smilingly revolt; and who resist\r","Are mock'd for valiant ignorance,\r","And perish constant fools. Who is't can blame him?\r","Your enemies and his find something in him.\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","We are all undone, unless\r","The noble man have mercy.\r","\r","COMINIUS:\r","Who shall ask it?\r","The tribunes cannot do't for shame; the people\r","Deserve such pity of him as the wolf\r","Does of the shepherds: for his best friends, if they\r","Should say 'Be good to Rome,' they charged him even\r","As those should do that had deserved his hate,\r","And therein show'd like enemies.\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","'Tis true:\r","If he were putting to my house the brand\r","That should consume it, I have not the face\r","To say 'Beseech you, cease.' You have made fair hands,\r","You and your crafts! you have crafted fair!\r","\r","COMINIUS:\r","You have brought\r","A trembling upon Rome, such as was never\r","So incapable of help.\r","\r","Both Tribunes:\r","Say not we brought it.\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","How! Was it we? we loved him but, like beasts\r","And cowardly nobles, gave way unto your clusters,\r","Who did hoot him out o' the city.\r","\r","COMINIUS:\r","But I fear\r","They'll roar him in again. Tullus Aufidius,\r","The second name of men, obeys his points\r","As if he were his officer: desperation\r","Is all the policy, strength and defence,\r","That Rome can make against them.\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","Here come the clusters.\r","And is Aufidius with him? You are they\r","That made the air unwholesome, when you cast\r","Your stinking greasy caps in hooting at\r","Coriolanus' exile. Now he's coming;\r","And not a hair upon a soldier's head\r","Which will not prove a whip: as many coxcombs\r","As you threw caps up will he tumble down,\r","And pay you for your voices. 'Tis no matter;\r","if he could burn us all into one coal,\r","We have deserved it.\r","\r","Citizens:\r","Faith, we hear fearful news.\r","\r","First Citizen:\r","For mine own part,\r","When I said, banish him, I said 'twas pity.\r","\r","Second Citizen:\r","And so did I.\r","\r","Third Citizen:\r","And so did I; and, to say the truth, so did very\r","many of us: that we did, we did for the best; and\r","though we willingly consented to his banishment, yet\r","it was against our will.\r","\r","COMINIUS:\r","Ye re goodly things, you voices!\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","You have made\r","Good work, you and your cry! Shall's to the Capitol?\r","\r","COMINIUS:\r","O, ay, what else?\r","\r","SICINIUS:\r","Go, masters, get you home; be not dismay'd:\r","These are a side that would be glad to have\r","This true which they so seem to fear. Go home,\r","And show no sign of fear.\r","\r","First Citizen:\r","The gods be good to us! Come, masters, let's home.\r","I ever said we were i' the wrong when we banished\r","him.\r","\r","Second Citizen:\r","So did we all. But, come, let's home.\r","\r","BRUTUS:\r","I do not like this news.\r","\r","SICINIUS:\r","Nor I.\r","\r","BRUTUS:\r","Let's to the Capitol. Would half my wealth\r","Would buy this for a lie!\r","\r","SICINIUS:\r","Pray, let us go.\r","\r","AUFIDIUS:\r","Do they still fly to the Roman?\r","\r","Lieutenant:\r","I do not know what witchcraft's in him, but\r","Your soldiers use him as the grace 'fore meat,\r","Their talk at table, and their thanks at end;\r","And you are darken'd in this action, sir,\r","Even by your own.\r","\r","AUFIDIUS:\r","I cannot help it now,\r","Unless, by using means, I lame the foot\r","Of our design. He bears himself more proudlier,\r","Even to my person, than I thought he would\r","When first I did embrace him: yet his nature\r","In that's no changeling; and I must excuse\r","What cannot be amended.\r","\r","Lieutenant:\r","Yet I wish, sir,--\r","I mean for your particular,--you had not\r","Join'd in commission with him; but either\r","Had borne the action of yourself, or else\r","To him had left it solely.\r","\r","AUFIDIUS:\r","I understand thee well; and be thou sure,\r","when he shall come to his account, he knows not\r","What I can urge against him. Although it seems,\r","And so he thinks, and is no less apparent\r","To the vulgar eye, that he bears all things fairly.\r","And shows good husbandry for the Volscian state,\r","Fights dragon-like, and does achieve as soon\r","As draw his sword; yet he hath left undone\r","That which shall break his neck or hazard mine,\r","Whene'er we come to our account.\r","\r","Lieutenant:\r","Sir, I beseech you, think you he'll carry Rome?\r","\r","AUFIDIUS:\r","All places yield to him ere he sits down;\r","And the nobility of Rome are his:\r","The senators and patricians love him too:\r","The tribunes are no soldiers; and their people\r","Will be as rash in the repeal, as hasty\r","To expel him thence. I think he'll be to Rome\r","As is the osprey to the fish, who takes it\r","By sovereignty of nature. First he was\r","A noble servant to them; but he could not\r","Carry his honours even: whether 'twas pride,\r","Which out of daily fortune ever taints\r","The happy man; whether defect of judgment,\r","To fail in the disposing of those chances\r","Which he was lord of; or whether nature,\r","Not to be other than one thing, not moving\r","From the casque to the cushion, but commanding peace\r","Even with the same austerity and garb\r","As he controll'd the war; but one of these--\r","As he hath spices of them all, not all,\r","For I dare so far free him--made him fear'd,\r","So hated, and so banish'd: but he has a merit,\r","To choke it in the utterance. So our virtues\r","Lie in the interpretation of the time:\r","And power, unto itself most commendable,\r","Hath not a tomb so evident as a chair\r","To extol what it hath done.\r","One fire drives out one fire; one nail, one nail;\r","Rights by rights falter, strengths by strengths do fail.\r","Come, let's away. When, Caius, Rome is thine,\r","Thou art poor'st of all; then shortly art thou mine.\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","No, I'll not go: you hear what he hath said\r","Which was sometime his general; who loved him\r","In a most dear particular. He call'd me father:\r","But what o' that? Go, you that banish'd him;\r","A mile before his tent fall down, and knee\r","The way into his mercy: nay, if he coy'd\r","To hear Cominius speak, I'll keep at home.\r","\r","COMINIUS:\r","He would not seem to know me.\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","Do you hear?\r","\r","COMINIUS:\r","Yet one time he did call me by my name:\r","I urged our old acquaintance, and the drops\r","That we have bled together. Coriolanus\r","He would not answer to: forbad all names;\r","He was a kind of nothing, titleless,\r","Till he had forged himself a name o' the fire\r","Of burning Rome.\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","Why, so: you have made good work!\r","A pair of tribunes that have rack'd for Rome,\r","To make coals cheap,--a noble memory!\r","\r","COMINIUS:\r","I minded him how royal 'twas to pardon\r","When it was less expected: he replied,\r","It was a bare petition of a state\r","To one whom they had punish'd.\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","Very well:\r","Could he say less?\r","\r","COMINIUS:\r","I offer'd to awaken his regard\r","For's private friends: his answer to me was,\r","He could not stay to pick them in a pile\r","Of noisome musty chaff: he said 'twas folly,\r","For one poor grain or two, to leave unburnt,\r","And still to nose the offence.\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","For one poor grain or two!\r","I am one of those; his mother, wife, his child,\r","And this brave fellow too, we are the grains:\r","You are the musty chaff; and you are smelt\r","Above the moon: we must be burnt for you.\r","\r","SICINIUS:\r","Nay, pray, be patient: if you refuse your aid\r","In this so never-needed help, yet do not\r","Upbraid's with our distress. But, sure, if you\r","Would be your country's pleader, your good tongue,\r","More than the instant army we can make,\r","Might stop our countryman.\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","No, I'll not meddle.\r","\r","SICINIUS:\r","Pray you, go to him.\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","What should I do?\r","\r","BRUTUS:\r","Only make trial what your love can do\r","For Rome, towards Marcius.\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","Well, and say that Marcius\r","Return me, as Cominius is return'd,\r","Unheard; what then?\r","But as a discontented friend, grief-shot\r","With his unkindness? say't be so?\r","\r","SICINIUS:\r","Yet your good will\r","must have that thanks from Rome, after the measure\r","As you intended well.\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","I'll undertake 't:\r","I think he'll hear me. Yet, to bite his lip\r","And hum at good Cominius, much unhearts me.\r","He was not taken well; he had not dined:\r","The veins unfill'd, our blood is cold, and then\r","We pout upon the morning, are unapt\r","To give or to forgive; but when we have stuff'd\r","These and these conveyances of our blood\r","With wine and feeding, we have suppler souls\r","Than in our priest-like fasts: therefore I'll watch him\r","Till he be dieted to my request,\r","And then I'll set upon him.\r","\r","BRUTUS:\r","You know the very road into his kindness,\r","And cannot lose your way.\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","Good faith, I'll prove him,\r","Speed how it will. I shall ere long have knowledge\r","Of my success.\r","\r","COMINIUS:\r","He'll never hear him.\r","\r","SICINIUS:\r","Not?\r","\r","COMINIUS:\r","I tell you, he does sit in gold, his eye\r","Red as 'twould burn Rome; and his injury\r","The gaoler to his pity. I kneel'd before him;\r","'Twas very faintly he said 'Rise;' dismiss'd me\r","Thus, with his speechless hand: what he would do,\r","He sent in writing after me; what he would not,\r","Bound with an oath to yield to his conditions:\r","So that all hope is vain.\r","Unless his noble mother, and his wife;\r","Who, as I hear, mean to solicit him\r","For mercy to his country. Therefore, let's hence,\r","And with our fair entreaties haste them on.\r","\r","First Senator:\r","Stay: whence are you?\r","\r","Second Senator:\r","Stand, and go back.\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","You guard like men; 'tis well: but, by your leave,\r","I am an officer of state, and come\r","To speak with Coriolanus.\r","\r","First Senator:\r","From whence?\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","From Rome.\r","\r","First Senator:\r","You may not pass, you must return: our general\r","Will no more hear from thence.\r","\r","Second Senator:\r","You'll see your Rome embraced with fire before\r","You'll speak with Coriolanus.\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","Good my friends,\r","If you have heard your general talk of Rome,\r","And of his friends there, it is lots to blanks,\r","My name hath touch'd your ears it is Menenius.\r","\r","First Senator:\r","Be it so; go back: the virtue of your name\r","Is not here passable.\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","I tell thee, fellow,\r","The general is my lover: I have been\r","The book of his good acts, whence men have read\r","His name unparallel'd, haply amplified;\r","For I have ever verified my friends,\r","Of whom he's chief, with all the size that verity\r","Would without lapsing suffer: nay, sometimes,\r","Like to a bowl upon a subtle ground,\r","I have tumbled past the throw; and in his praise\r","Have almost stamp'd the leasing: therefore, fellow,\r","I must have leave to pass.\r","\r","First Senator:\r","Faith, sir, if you had told as many lies in his\r","behalf as you have uttered words in your own, you\r","should not pass here; no, though it were as virtuous\r","to lie as to live chastely. Therefore, go back.\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","Prithee, fellow, remember my name is Menenius,\r","always factionary on the party of your general.\r","\r","Second Senator:\r","Howsoever you have been his liar, as you say you\r","have, I am one that, telling true under him, must\r","say, you cannot pass. Therefore, go back.\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","Has he dined, canst thou tell? for I would not\r","speak with him till after dinner.\r","\r","First Senator:\r","You are a Roman, are you?\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","I am, as thy general is.\r","\r","First Senator:\r","Then you should hate Rome, as he does. Can you,\r","when you have pushed out your gates the very\r","defender of them, and, in a violent popular\r","ignorance, given your enemy your shield, think to\r","front his revenges with the easy groans of old\r","women, the virginal palms of your daughters, or with\r","the palsied intercession of such a decayed dotant as\r","you seem to be? Can you think to blow out the\r","intended fire your city is ready to flame in, with\r","such weak breath as this? No, you are deceived;\r","therefore, back to Rome, and prepare for your\r","execution: you are condemned, our general has sworn\r","you out of reprieve and pardon.\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","Sirrah, if thy captain knew I were here, he would\r","use me with estimation.\r","\r","Second Senator:\r","Come, my captain knows you not.\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","I mean, thy general.\r","\r","First Senator:\r","My general cares not for you. Back, I say, go; lest\r","I let forth your half-pint of blood; back,--that's\r","the utmost of your having: back.\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","Nay, but, fellow, fellow,--\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","What's the matter?\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","Now, you companion, I'll say an errand for you:\r","You shall know now that I am in estimation; you shall\r","perceive that a Jack guardant cannot office me from\r","my son Coriolanus: guess, but by my entertainment\r","with him, if thou standest not i' the state of\r","hanging, or of some death more long in\r","spectatorship, and crueller in suffering; behold now\r","presently, and swoon for what's to come upon thee.\r","The glorious gods sit in hourly synod about thy\r","particular prosperity, and love thee no worse than\r","thy old father Menenius does! O my son, my son!\r","thou art preparing fire for us; look thee, here's\r","water to quench it. I was hardly moved to come to\r","thee; but being assured none but myself could move\r","thee, I have been blown out of your gates with\r","sighs; and conjure thee to pardon Rome, and thy\r","petitionary countrymen. The good gods assuage thy\r","wrath, and turn the dregs of it upon this varlet\r","here,--this, who, like a block, hath denied my\r","access to thee.\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","Away!\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","How! away!\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","Wife, mother, child, I know not. My affairs\r","Are servanted to others: though I owe\r","My revenge properly, my remission lies\r","In Volscian breasts. That we have been familiar,\r","Ingrate forgetfulness shall poison, rather\r","Than pity note how much. Therefore, be gone.\r","Mine ears against your suits are stronger than\r","Your gates against my force. Yet, for I loved thee,\r","Take this along; I writ it for thy sake\r","And would have rent it. Another word, Menenius,\r","I will not hear thee speak. This man, Aufidius,\r","Was my beloved in Rome: yet thou behold'st!\r","\r","AUFIDIUS:\r","You keep a constant temper.\r","\r","First Senator:\r","Now, sir, is your name Menenius?\r","\r","Second Senator:\r","'Tis a spell, you see, of much power: you know the\r","way home again.\r","\r","First Senator:\r","Do you hear how we are shent for keeping your\r","greatness back?\r","\r","Second Senator:\r","What cause, do you think, I have to swoon?\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","I neither care for the world nor your general: for\r","such things as you, I can scarce think there's any,\r","ye're so slight. He that hath a will to die by\r","himself fears it not from another: let your general\r","do his worst. For you, be that you are, long; and\r","your misery increase with your age! I say to you,\r","as I was said to, Away!\r","\r","First Senator:\r","A noble fellow, I warrant him.\r","\r","Second Senator:\r","The worthy fellow is our general: he's the rock, the\r","oak not to be wind-shaken.\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","We will before the walls of Rome tomorrow\r","Set down our host. My partner in this action,\r","You must report to the Volscian lords, how plainly\r","I have borne this business.\r","\r","AUFIDIUS:\r","Only their ends\r","You have respected; stopp'd your ears against\r","The general suit of Rome; never admitted\r","A private whisper, no, not with such friends\r","That thought them sure of you.\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","This last old man,\r","Whom with a crack'd heart I have sent to Rome,\r","Loved me above the measure of a father;\r","Nay, godded me, indeed. Their latest refuge\r","Was to send him; for whose old love I have,\r","Though I show'd sourly to him, once more offer'd\r","The first conditions, which they did refuse\r","And cannot now accept; to grace him only\r","That thought he could do more, a very little\r","I have yielded to: fresh embassies and suits,\r","Nor from the state nor private friends, hereafter\r","Will I lend ear to. Ha! what shout is this?\r","Shall I be tempted to infringe my vow\r","In the same time 'tis made? I will not.\r","My wife comes foremost; then the honour'd mould\r","Wherein this trunk was framed, and in her hand\r","The grandchild to her blood. But, out, affection!\r","All bond and privilege of nature, break!\r","Let it be virtuous to be obstinate.\r","What is that curt'sy worth? or those doves' eyes,\r","Which can make gods forsworn? I melt, and am not\r","Of stronger earth than others. My mother bows;\r","As if Olympus to a molehill should\r","In supplication nod: and my young boy\r","Hath an aspect of intercession, which\r","Great nature cries 'Deny not.' let the Volsces\r","Plough Rome and harrow Italy: I'll never\r","Be such a gosling to obey instinct, but stand,\r","As if a man were author of himself\r","And knew no other kin.\r","\r","VIRGILIA:\r","My lord and husband!\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","These eyes are not the same I wore in Rome.\r","\r","VIRGILIA:\r","The sorrow that delivers us thus changed\r","Makes you think so.\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","Like a dull actor now,\r","I have forgot my part, and I am out,\r","Even to a full disgrace. Best of my flesh,\r","Forgive my tyranny; but do not say\r","For that 'Forgive our Romans.' O, a kiss\r","Long as my exile, sweet as my revenge!\r","Now, by the jealous queen of heaven, that kiss\r","I carried from thee, dear; and my true lip\r","Hath virgin'd it e'er since. You gods!
