I prate,\r","And the most noble mother of the world\r","Leave unsaluted: sink, my knee, i' the earth;\r","Of thy deep duty more impression show\r","Than that of common sons.\r","\r","VOLUMNIA:\r","O, stand up blest!\r","Whilst, with no softer cushion than the flint,\r","I kneel before thee; and unproperly\r","Show duty, as mistaken all this while\r","Between the child and parent.\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","What is this?\r","Your knees to me? to your corrected son?\r","Then let the pebbles on the hungry beach\r","Fillip the stars; then let the mutinous winds\r","Strike the proud cedars 'gainst the fiery sun;\r","Murdering impossibility, to make\r","What cannot be, slight work.\r","\r","VOLUMNIA:\r","Thou art my warrior;\r","I holp to frame thee. Do you know this lady?\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","The noble sister of Publicola,\r","The moon of Rome, chaste as the icicle\r","That's curdied by the frost from purest snow\r","And hangs on Dian's temple: dear Valeria!\r","\r","VOLUMNIA:\r","This is a poor epitome of yours,\r","Which by the interpretation of full time\r","May show like all yourself.\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","The god of soldiers,\r","With the consent of supreme Jove, inform\r","Thy thoughts with nobleness; that thou mayst prove\r","To shame unvulnerable, and stick i' the wars\r","Like a great sea-mark, standing every flaw,\r","And saving those that eye thee!\r","\r","VOLUMNIA:\r","Your knee, sirrah.\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","That's my brave boy!\r","\r","VOLUMNIA:\r","Even he, your wife, this lady, and myself,\r","Are suitors to you.\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","I beseech you, peace:\r","Or, if you'ld ask, remember this before:\r","The thing I have forsworn to grant may never\r","Be held by you denials. Do not bid me\r","Dismiss my soldiers, or capitulate\r","Again with Rome's mechanics: tell me not\r","Wherein I seem unnatural: desire not\r","To ally my rages and revenges with\r","Your colder reasons.\r","\r","VOLUMNIA:\r","O, no more, no more!\r","You have said you will not grant us any thing;\r","For we have nothing else to ask, but that\r","Which you deny already: yet we will ask;\r","That, if you fail in our request, the blame\r","May hang upon your hardness: therefore hear us.\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","Aufidius, and you Volsces, mark; for we'll\r","Hear nought from Rome in private. Your request?\r","\r","VOLUMNIA:\r","Should we be silent and not speak, our raiment\r","And state of bodies would bewray what life\r","We have led since thy exile. Think with thyself\r","How more unfortunate than all living women\r","Are we come hither: since that thy sight,\r","which should\r","Make our eyes flow with joy, hearts dance\r","with comforts,\r","Constrains them weep and shake with fear and sorrow;\r","Making the mother, wife and child to see\r","The son, the husband and the father tearing\r","His country's bowels out. And to poor we\r","Thine enmity's most capital: thou barr'st us\r","Our prayers to the gods, which is a comfort\r","That all but we enjoy; for how can we,\r","Alas, how can we for our country pray.\r","Whereto we are bound, together with thy victory,\r","Whereto we are bound? alack, or we must lose\r","The country, our dear nurse, or else thy person,\r","Our comfort in the country. We must find\r","An evident calamity, though we had\r","Our wish, which side should win: for either thou\r","Must, as a foreign recreant, be led\r","With manacles thorough our streets, or else\r","triumphantly tread on thy country's ruin,\r","And bear the palm for having bravely shed\r","Thy wife and children's blood. For myself, son,\r","I purpose not to wait on fortune till\r","These wars determine: if I cannot persuade thee\r","Rather to show a noble grace to both parts\r","Than seek the end of one, thou shalt no sooner\r","March to assault thy country than to tread--\r","Trust to't, thou shalt not--on thy mother's womb,\r","That brought thee to this world.\r","\r","VIRGILIA:\r","Ay, and mine,\r","That brought you forth this boy, to keep your name\r","Living to time.\r","\r","Young MARCIUS:\r","A' shall not tread on me;\r","I'll run away till I am bigger, but then I'll fight.\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","Not of a woman's tenderness to be,\r","Requires nor child nor woman's face to see.\r","I have sat too long.\r","\r","VOLUMNIA:\r","Nay, go not from us thus.\r","If it were so that our request did tend\r","To save the Romans, thereby to destroy\r","The Volsces whom you serve, you might condemn us,\r","As poisonous of your honour: no; our suit\r","Is that you reconcile them: while the Volsces\r","May say 'This mercy we have show'd;' the Romans,\r","'This we received;' and each in either side\r","Give the all-hail to thee and cry 'Be blest\r","For making up this peace!' Thou know'st, great son,\r","The end of war's uncertain, but this certain,\r","That, if thou conquer Rome, the benefit\r","Which thou shalt thereby reap is such a name,\r","Whose repetition will be dogg'd with curses;\r","Whose chronicle thus writ: 'The man was noble,\r","But with his last attempt he wiped it out;\r","Destroy'd his country, and his name remains\r","To the ensuing age abhorr'd.' Speak to me, son:\r","Thou hast affected the fine strains of honour,\r","To imitate the graces of the gods;\r","To tear with thunder the wide cheeks o' the air,\r","And yet to charge thy sulphur with a bolt\r","That should but rive an oak. Why dost not speak?\r","Think'st thou it honourable for a noble man\r","Still to remember wrongs? Daughter, speak you:\r","He cares not for your weeping. Speak thou, boy:\r","Perhaps thy childishness will move him more\r","Than can our reasons. There's no man in the world\r","More bound to 's mother; yet here he lets me prate\r","Like one i' the stocks. Thou hast never in thy life\r","Show'd thy dear mother any courtesy,\r","When she, poor hen, fond of no second brood,\r","Has cluck'd thee to the wars and safely home,\r","Loaden with honour. Say my request's unjust,\r","And spurn me back: but if it be not so,\r","Thou art not honest; and the gods will plague thee,\r","That thou restrain'st from me the duty which\r","To a mother's part belongs. He turns away:\r","Down, ladies; let us shame him with our knees.\r","To his surname Coriolanus 'longs more pride\r","Than pity to our prayers. Down: an end;\r","This is the last: so we will home to Rome,\r","And die among our neighbours. Nay, behold 's:\r","This boy, that cannot tell what he would have\r","But kneels and holds up bands for fellowship,\r","Does reason our petition with more strength\r","Than thou hast to deny 't. Come, let us go:\r","This fellow had a Volscian to his mother;\r","His wife is in Corioli and his child\r","Like him by chance. Yet give us our dispatch:\r","I am hush'd until our city be a-fire,\r","And then I'll speak a little.\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","O mother, mother!\r","What have you done? Behold, the heavens do ope,\r","The gods look down, and this unnatural scene\r","They laugh at. O my mother, mother! O!\r","You have won a happy victory to Rome;\r","But, for your son,--believe it, O, believe it,\r","Most dangerously you have with him prevail'd,\r","If not most mortal to him. But, let it come.\r","Aufidius, though I cannot make true wars,\r","I'll frame convenient peace. Now, good Aufidius,\r","Were you in my stead, would you have heard\r","A mother less? or granted less, Aufidius?\r","\r","AUFIDIUS:\r","I was moved withal.\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","I dare be sworn you were:\r","And, sir, it is no little thing to make\r","Mine eyes to sweat compassion. But, good sir,\r","What peace you'll make, advise me: for my part,\r","I'll not to Rome, I'll back with you; and pray you,\r","Stand to me in this cause. O mother! wife!\r","\r","AUFIDIUS:\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","Ay, by and by;\r","But we will drink together; and you shall bear\r","A better witness back than words, which we,\r","On like conditions, will have counter-seal'd.\r","Come, enter with us. Ladies, you deserve\r","To have a temple built you: all the swords\r","In Italy, and her confederate arms,\r","Could not have made this peace.\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","See you yond coign o' the Capitol, yond\r","corner-stone?\r","\r","SICINIUS:\r","Why, what of that?\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","If it be possible for you to displace it with your\r","little finger, there is some hope the ladies of\r","Rome, especially his mother, may prevail with him.\r","But I say there is no hope in't: our throats are\r","sentenced and stay upon execution.\r","\r","SICINIUS:\r","Is't possible that so short a time can alter the\r","condition of a man!\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","There is differency between a grub and a butterfly;\r","yet your butterfly was a grub. This Marcius is grown\r","from man to dragon: he has wings; he's more than a\r","creeping thing.\r","\r","SICINIUS:\r","He loved his mother dearly.\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","So did he me: and he no more remembers his mother\r","now than an eight-year-old horse. The tartness\r","of his face sours ripe grapes: when he walks, he\r","moves like an engine, and the ground shrinks before\r","his treading: he is able to pierce a corslet with\r","his eye; talks like a knell, and his hum is a\r","battery. He sits in his state, as a thing made for\r","Alexander. What he bids be done is finished with\r","his bidding. He wants nothing of a god but eternity\r","and a heaven to throne in.\r","\r","SICINIUS:\r","Yes, mercy, if you report him truly.\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","I paint him in the character. Mark what mercy his\r","mother shall bring from him: there is no more mercy\r","in him than there is milk in a male tiger; that\r","shall our poor city find: and all this is long of\r","you.\r","\r","SICINIUS:\r","The gods be good unto us!\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","No, in such a case the gods will not be good unto\r","us. When we banished him, we respected not them;\r","and, he returning to break our necks, they respect not us.\r","\r","Messenger:\r","Sir, if you'ld save your life, fly to your house:\r","The plebeians have got your fellow-tribune\r","And hale him up and down, all swearing, if\r","The Roman ladies bring not comfort home,\r","They'll give him death by inches.\r","\r","SICINIUS:\r","What's the news?\r","\r","Second Messenger:\r","Good news, good news; the ladies have prevail'd,\r","The Volscians are dislodged, and Marcius gone:\r","A merrier day did never yet greet Rome,\r","No, not the expulsion of the Tarquins.\r","\r","SICINIUS:\r","Friend,\r","Art thou certain this is true? is it most certain?\r","\r","Second Messenger:\r","As certain as I know the sun is fire:\r","Where have you lurk'd, that you make doubt of it?\r","Ne'er through an arch so hurried the blown tide,\r","As the recomforted through the gates. Why, hark you!\r","The trumpets, sackbuts, psalteries and fifes,\r","Tabours and cymbals and the shouting Romans,\r","Make the sun dance. Hark you!\r","\r","MENENIUS:\r","This is good news:\r","I will go meet the ladies. This Volumnia\r","Is worth of consuls, senators, patricians,\r","A city full; of tribunes, such as you,\r","A sea and land full. You have pray'd well to-day:\r","This morning for ten thousand of your throats\r","I'd not have given a doit. Hark, how they joy!\r","\r","SICINIUS:\r","First, the gods bless you for your tidings; next,\r","Accept my thankfulness.\r","\r","Second Messenger:\r","Sir, we have all\r","Great cause to give great thanks.\r","\r","SICINIUS:\r","They are near the city?\r","\r","Second Messenger:\r","Almost at point to enter.\r","\r","SICINIUS:\r","We will meet them,\r","And help the joy.\r","\r","First Senator:\r","Behold our patroness, the life of Rome!\r","Call all your tribes together, praise the gods,\r","And make triumphant fires; strew flowers before them:\r","Unshout the noise that banish'd Marcius,\r","Repeal him with the welcome of his mother;\r","Cry 'Welcome, ladies, welcome!'\r","\r","All:\r","Welcome, ladies, Welcome!\r","\r","AUFIDIUS:\r","Go tell the lords o' the city I am here:\r","Deliver them this paper: having read it,\r","Bid them repair to the market place; where I,\r","Even in theirs and in the commons' ears,\r","Will vouch the truth of it. Him I accuse\r","The city ports by this hath enter'd and\r","Intends to appear before the people, hoping\r","To purge herself with words: dispatch.\r","Most welcome!\r","\r","First Conspirator:\r","How is it with our general?\r","\r","AUFIDIUS:\r","Even so\r","As with a man by his own alms empoison'd,\r","And with his charity slain.\r","\r","Second Conspirator:\r","Most noble sir,\r","If you do hold the same intent wherein\r","You wish'd us parties, we'll deliver you\r","Of your great danger.\r","\r","AUFIDIUS:\r","Sir, I cannot tell:\r","We must proceed as we do find the people.\r","\r","Third Conspirator:\r","The people will remain uncertain whilst\r","'Twixt you there's difference; but the fall of either\r","Makes the survivor heir of all.\r","\r","AUFIDIUS:\r","I know it;\r","And my pretext to strike at him admits\r","A good construction. I raised him, and I pawn'd\r","Mine honour for his truth: who being so heighten'd,\r","He water'd his new plants with dews of flattery,\r","Seducing so my friends; and, to this end,\r","He bow'd his nature, never known before\r","But to be rough, unswayable and free.\r","\r","Third Conspirator:\r","Sir, his stoutness\r","When he did stand for consul, which he lost\r","By lack of stooping,--\r","\r","AUFIDIUS:\r","That I would have spoke of:\r","Being banish'd for't, he came unto my hearth;\r","Presented to my knife his throat: I took him;\r","Made him joint-servant with me; gave him way\r","In all his own desires; nay, let him choose\r","Out of my files, his projects to accomplish,\r","My best and freshest men; served his designments\r","In mine own person; holp to reap the fame\r","Which he did end all his; and took some pride\r","To do myself this wrong: till, at the last,\r","I seem'd his follower, not partner, and\r","He waged me with his countenance, as if\r","I had been mercenary.\r","\r","First Conspirator:\r","So he did, my lord:\r","The army marvell'd at it, and, in the last,\r","When he had carried Rome and that we look'd\r","For no less spoil than glory,--\r","\r","AUFIDIUS:\r","There was it:\r","For which my sinews shall be stretch'd upon him.\r","At a few drops of women's rheum, which are\r","As cheap as lies, he sold the blood and labour\r","Of our great action: therefore shall he die,\r","And I'll renew me in his fall. But, hark!\r","\r","First Conspirator:\r","Your native town you enter'd like a post,\r","And had no welcomes home: but he returns,\r","Splitting the air with noise.\r","\r","Second Conspirator:\r","And patient fools,\r","Whose children he hath slain, their base throats tear\r","With giving him glory.\r","\r","Third Conspirator:\r","Therefore, at your vantage,\r","Ere he express himself, or move the people\r","With what he would say, let him feel your sword,\r","Which we will second. When he lies along,\r","After your way his tale pronounced shall bury\r","His reasons with his body.\r","\r","AUFIDIUS:\r","Say no more:\r","Here come the lords.\r","\r","All The Lords:\r","You are most welcome home.\r","\r","AUFIDIUS:\r","I have not deserved it.\r","But, worthy lords, have you with heed perused\r","What I have written to you?\r","\r","Lords:\r","We have.\r","\r","First Lord:\r","And grieve to hear't.\r","What faults he made before the last, I think\r","Might have found easy fines: but there to end\r","Where he was to begin and give away\r","The benefit of our levies, answering us\r","With our own charge, making a treaty where\r","There was a yielding,--this admits no excuse.\r","\r","AUFIDIUS:\r","He approaches: you shall hear him.\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","Hail, lords! I am return'd your soldier,\r","No more infected with my country's love\r","Than when I parted hence, but still subsisting\r","Under your great command. You are to know\r","That prosperously I have attempted and\r","With bloody passage led your wars even to\r","The gates of Rome. Our spoils we have brought home\r","Do more than counterpoise a full third part\r","The charges of the action. We have made peace\r","With no less honour to the Antiates\r","Than shame to the Romans: and we here deliver,\r","Subscribed by the consuls and patricians,\r","Together with the seal o' the senate, what\r","We have compounded on.\r","\r","AUFIDIUS:\r","Read it not, noble lords;\r","But tell the traitor, in the high'st degree\r","He hath abused your powers.\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","Traitor! how now!\r","\r","AUFIDIUS:\r","Ay, traitor, Marcius!\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","Marcius!\r","\r","AUFIDIUS:\r","Ay, Marcius, Caius Marcius: dost thou think\r","I'll grace thee with that robbery, thy stol'n name\r","Coriolanus in Corioli?\r","You lords and heads o' the state, perfidiously\r","He has betray'd your business, and given up,\r","For certain drops of salt, your city Rome,\r","I say 'your city,' to his wife and mother;\r","Breaking his oath and resolution like\r","A twist of rotten silk, never admitting\r","Counsel o' the war, but at his nurse's tears\r","He whined and roar'd away your victory,\r","That pages blush'd at him and men of heart\r","Look'd wondering each at other.\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","Hear'st thou, Mars?\r","\r","AUFIDIUS:\r","Name not the god, thou boy of tears!\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","Ha!\r","\r","AUFIDIUS:\r","No more.\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","Measureless liar, thou hast made my heart\r","Too great for what contains it. Boy! O slave!\r","Pardon me, lords, 'tis the first time that ever\r","I was forced to scold. Your judgments, my grave lords,\r","Must give this cur the lie: and his own notion--\r","Who wears my stripes impress'd upon him; that\r","Must bear my beating to his grave--shall join\r","To thrust the lie unto him.\r","\r","First Lord:\r","Peace, both, and hear me speak.\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","Cut me to pieces, Volsces; men and lads,\r","Stain all your edges on me. Boy! false hound!\r","If you have writ your annals true, 'tis there,\r","That, like an eagle in a dove-cote, I\r","Flutter'd your Volscians in Corioli:\r","Alone I did it. Boy!\r","\r","AUFIDIUS:\r","Why, noble lords,\r","Will you be put in mind of his blind fortune,\r","Which was your shame, by this unholy braggart,\r","'Fore your own eyes and ears?\r","\r","All Conspirators:\r","Let him die for't.\r","\r","All The People:\r","'Tear him to pieces.' 'Do it presently.' 'He kill'd\r","my son.' 'My daughter.' 'He killed my cousin\r","Marcus.' 'He killed my father.'\r","\r","Second Lord:\r","Peace, ho! no outrage: peace!\r","The man is noble and his fame folds-in\r","This orb o' the earth. His last offences to us\r","Shall have judicious hearing. Stand, Aufidius,\r","And trouble not the peace.\r","\r","CORIOLANUS:\r","O that I had him,\r","With six Aufidiuses, or more, his tribe,\r","To use my lawful sword!\r","\r","AUFIDIUS:\r","Insolent villain!\r","\r","All Conspirators:\r","Kill, kill, kill, kill, kill him!\r","\r","Lords:\r","Hold, hold, hold, hold!\r","\r","AUFIDIUS:\r","My noble masters, hear me speak.\r","\r","First Lord:\r","O Tullus,--\r","\r","Second Lord:\r","Thou hast done a deed whereat valour will weep.\r","\r","Third Lord:\r","Tread not upon him. Masters all, be quiet;\r","Put up your swords.\r","\r","AUFIDIUS:\r","My lords, when you shall know--as in this rage,\r","Provoked by him, you cannot--the great danger\r","Which this man's life did owe you, you'll rejoice\r","That he is thus cut off. Please it your honours\r","To call me to your senate, I'll deliver\r","Myself your loyal servant, or endure\r","Your heaviest censure.\r","\r","First Lord:\r","Bear from hence his body;\r","And mourn you for him: let him be regarded\r","As the most noble corse that ever herald\r","Did follow to his urn.\r","\r","Second Lord:\r","His own impatience\r","Takes from Aufidius a great part of blame.\r","Let's make the best of it.\r","\r","AUFIDIUS:\r","My rage is gone;\r","And I am struck with sorrow. Take him up.\r","Help, three o' the chiefest soldiers; I'll be one.\r","Beat thou the drum, that it speak mournfully:\r","Trail your steel pikes. Though in this city he\r","Hath widow'd and unchilded many a one,\r","Which to this hour bewail the injury,\r","Yet he shall have a noble memory. Assist.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Now is the winter of our discontent\r","Made glorious summer by this sun of York;\r","And all the clouds that lour'd upon our house\r","In the deep bosom of the ocean buried.\r","Now are our brows bound with victorious wreaths;\r","Our bruised arms hung up for monuments;\r","Our stern alarums changed to merry meetings,\r","Our dreadful marches to delightful measures.\r","Grim-visaged war hath smooth'd his wrinkled front;\r","And now, instead of mounting barded steeds\r","To fright the souls of fearful adversaries,\r","He capers nimbly in a lady's chamber\r","To the lascivious pleasing of a lute.\r","But I, that am not shaped for sportive tricks,\r","Nor made to court an amorous looking-glass;\r","I, that am rudely stamp'd, and want love's majesty\r","To strut before a wanton ambling nymph;\r","I, that am curtail'd of this fair proportion,\r","Cheated of feature by dissembling nature,\r","Deformed, unfinish'd, sent before my time\r","Into this breathing world, scarce half made up,\r","And that so lamely and unfashionable\r","That dogs bark at me as I halt by them;\r","Why, I, in this weak piping time of peace,\r","Have no delight to pass away the time,\r","Unless to spy my shadow in the sun\r","And descant on mine own deformity:\r","And therefore, since I cannot prove a lover,\r","To entertain these fair well-spoken days,\r","I am determined to prove a villain\r","And hate the idle pleasures of these days.\r","Plots have I laid, inductions dangerous,\r","By drunken prophecies, libels and dreams,\r","To set my brother Clarence and the king\r","In deadly hate the one against the other:\r","And if King Edward be as true and just\r","As I am subtle, false and treacherous,\r","This day should Clarence closely be mew'd up,\r","About a prophecy, which says that 'G'\r","Of Edward's heirs the murderer shall be.\r","Dive, thoughts, down to my soul: here\r","Clarence comes.\r","Brother, good day; what means this armed guard\r","That waits upon your grace?\r","\r","CLARENCE:\r","His majesty\r","Tendering my person's safety, hath appointed\r","This conduct to convey me to the Tower.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Upon what cause?\r","\r","CLARENCE:\r","Because my name is George.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Alack, my lord, that fault is none of yours;\r","He should, for that, commit your godfathers:\r","O, belike his majesty hath some intent\r","That you shall be new-christen'd in the Tower.\r","But what's the matter, Clarence?  may I know?\r","\r","CLARENCE:\r","Yea, Richard, when I know; for I protest\r","As yet I do not: but, as I can learn,\r","He hearkens after prophecies and dreams;\r","And from the cross-row plucks the letter G.\r","And says a wizard told him that by G\r","His issue disinherited should be;\r","And, for my name of George begins with G,\r","It follows in his thought that I am he.\r","These, as I learn, and such like toys as these\r","Have moved his highness to commit me now.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Why, this it is, when men are ruled by women:\r","'Tis not the king that sends you to the Tower:\r","My Lady Grey his wife, Clarence, 'tis she\r","That tempers him to this extremity.\r","Was it not she and that good man of worship,\r","Anthony Woodville, her brother there,\r","That made him send Lord Hastings to the Tower,\r","From whence this present day he is deliver'd?\r","We are not safe, Clarence; we are not safe.\r","\r","CLARENCE:\r","By heaven, I think there's no man is secure\r","But the queen's kindred and night-walking heralds\r","That trudge betwixt the king and Mistress Shore.\r","Heard ye not what an humble suppliant\r","Lord hastings was to her for his delivery?\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Humbly complaining to her deity\r","Got my lord chamberlain his liberty.\r","I'll tell you what; I think it is our way,\r","If we will keep in favour with the king,\r","To be her men and wear her livery:\r","The jealous o'erworn widow and herself,\r","Since that our brother dubb'd them gentlewomen.\r","Are mighty gossips in this monarchy.\r","\r","BRAKENBURY:\r","I beseech your graces both to pardon me;\r","His majesty hath straitly given in charge\r","That no man shall have private conference,\r","Of what degree soever, with his brother.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Even so; an't please your worship, Brakenbury,\r","You may partake of any thing we say:\r","We speak no treason, man: we say the king\r","Is wise and virtuous, and his noble queen\r","Well struck in years, fair, and not jealous;\r","We say that Shore's wife hath a pretty foot,\r","A cherry lip, a bonny eye, a passing pleasing tongue;\r","And that the queen's kindred are made gentle-folks:\r","How say you sir? Can you deny all this?\r","\r","BRAKENBURY:\r","With this, my lord, myself have nought to do.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Naught to do with mistress Shore! I tell thee, fellow,\r","He that doth naught with her, excepting one,\r","Were best he do it secretly, alone.\r","\r","BRAKENBURY:\r","What one, my lord?\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Her husband, knave: wouldst thou betray me?\r","\r","BRAKENBURY:\r","I beseech your grace to pardon me, and withal\r","Forbear your conference with the noble duke.\r","\r","CLARENCE:\r","We know thy charge, Brakenbury, and will obey.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","We are the queen's abjects, and must obey.\r","Brother, farewell: I will unto the king;\r","And whatsoever you will employ me in,\r","Were it to call King Edward's widow sister,\r","I will perform it to enfranchise you.\r","Meantime, this deep disgrace in brotherhood\r","Touches me deeper than you can imagine.\r","\r","CLARENCE:\r","I know it pleaseth neither of us well.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Well, your imprisonment shall not be long;\r","Meantime, have patience.\r","\r","CLARENCE:\r","I must perforce. Farewell.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Go, tread the path that thou shalt ne'er return.\r","Simple, plain Clarence! I do love thee so,\r","That I will shortly send thy soul to heaven,\r","If heaven will take the present at our hands.\r","But who comes here? the new-deliver'd Hastings?\r","\r","HASTINGS:\r","Good time of day unto my gracious lord!\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","As much unto my good lord chamberlain!\r","Well are you welcome to the open air.\r","How hath your lordship brook'd imprisonment?\r","\r","HASTINGS:\r","With patience, noble lord, as prisoners must:\r","But I shall live, my lord, to give them thanks\r","That were the cause of my imprisonment.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","No doubt, no doubt; and so shall Clarence too;\r","For they that were your enemies are his,\r","And have prevail'd as much on him as you.\r","\r","HASTINGS:\r","More pity that the eagle should be mew'd,\r","While kites and buzzards prey at liberty.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","What news abroad?\r","\r","HASTINGS:\r","No news so bad abroad as this at home;\r","The King is sickly, weak and melancholy,\r","And his physicians fear him mightily.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Now, by Saint Paul, this news is bad indeed.\r","O, he hath kept an evil diet long,\r","And overmuch consumed his royal person:\r","'Tis very grievous to be thought upon.\r","What, is he in his bed?\r","\r","HASTINGS:\r","He is.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Go you before, and I will follow you.\r","He cannot live, I hope; and must not die\r","Till George be pack'd with post-horse up to heaven.\r","I'll in, to urge his hatred more to Clarence,\r","With lies well steel'd with weighty arguments;\r","And, if I fall not in my deep intent,\r","Clarence hath not another day to live:\r","Which done, God take King Edward to his mercy,\r","And leave the world for me to bustle in!\r","For then I'll marry Warwick's youngest daughter.\r","What though I kill'd her husband and her father?\r","The readiest way to make the wench amends\r","Is to become her husband and her father:\r","The which will I; not all so much for love\r","As for another secret close intent,\r","By marrying her which I must reach unto.\r","But yet I run before my horse to market:\r","Clarence still breathes; Edward still lives and reigns:\r","When they are gone, then must I count my gains.\r","\r","LADY ANNE:\r","Set down, set down your honourable load,\r","If honour may be shrouded in a hearse,\r","Whilst I awhile obsequiously lament\r","The untimely fall of virtuous Lancaster.\r","Poor key-cold figure of a holy king!\r","Pale ashes of the house of Lancaster!\r","Thou bloodless remnant of that royal blood!\r","Be it lawful that I invocate thy ghost,\r","To hear the lamentations of Poor Anne,\r","Wife to thy Edward, to thy slaughter'd son,\r","Stabb'd by the selfsame hand that made these wounds!\r","Lo, in these windows that let forth thy life,\r","I pour the helpless balm of my poor eyes.\r","Cursed be the hand that made these fatal holes!\r","Cursed be the heart that had the heart to do it!\r","Cursed the blood that let this blood from hence!\r","More direful hap betide that hated wretch,\r","That makes us wretched by the death of thee,\r","Than I can wish to adders, spiders, toads,\r","Or any creeping venom'd thing that lives!\r","If ever he have child, abortive be it,\r","Prodigious, and untimely brought to light,\r","Whose ugly and unnatural aspect\r","May fright the hopeful mother at the view;\r","And that be heir to his unhappiness!\r","If ever he have wife, let her he made\r","A miserable by the death of him\r","As I am made by my poor lord and thee!\r","Come, now towards Chertsey with your holy load,\r","Taken from Paul's to be interred there;\r","And still, as you are weary of the weight,\r","Rest you, whiles I lament King Henry's corse.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Stay, you that bear the corse, and set it down.\r","\r","LADY ANNE:\r","What black magician conjures up this fiend,\r","To stop devoted charitable deeds?\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Villains, set down the corse; or, by Saint Paul,\r","I'll make a corse of him that disobeys.\r","\r","Gentleman:\r","My lord, stand back, and let the coffin pass.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Unmanner'd dog! stand thou, when I command:\r","Advance thy halbert higher than my breast,\r","Or, by Saint Paul, I'll strike thee to my foot,\r","And spurn upon thee, beggar, for thy boldness.\r","\r","LADY ANNE:\r","What, do you tremble? are you all afraid?\r","Alas, I blame you not; for you are mortal,\r","And mortal eyes cannot endure the devil.\r","Avaunt, thou dreadful minister of hell!\r","Thou hadst but power over his mortal body,\r","His soul thou canst not have; therefore be gone.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Sweet saint, for charity, be not so curst.\r","\r","LADY ANNE:\r","Foul devil, for God's sake, hence, and trouble us not;\r","For thou hast made the happy earth thy hell,\r","Fill'd it with cursing cries and deep exclaims.\r","If thou delight to view thy heinous deeds,\r","Behold this pattern of thy butcheries.\r","O, gentlemen, see, see! dead Henry's wounds\r","Open their congeal'd mouths and bleed afresh!\r","Blush, Blush, thou lump of foul deformity;\r","For 'tis thy presence that exhales this blood\r","From cold and empty veins, where no blood dwells;\r","Thy deed, inhuman and unnatural,\r","Provokes this deluge most unnatural.\r","O God, which this blood madest, revenge his death!\r","O earth, which this blood drink'st revenge his death!\r","Either heaven with lightning strike the\r","murderer dead,\r","Or earth, gape open wide and eat him quick,\r","As thou dost swallow up this good king's blood\r","Which his hell-govern'd arm hath butchered!\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Lady, you know no rules of charity,\r","Which renders good for bad, blessings for curses.\r","\r","LADY ANNE:\r","Villain, thou know'st no law of God nor man:\r","No beast so fierce but knows some touch of pity.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","But I know none, and therefore am no beast.\r","\r","LADY ANNE:\r","O wonderful, when devils tell the truth!\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","More wonderful, when angels are so angry.\r","Vouchsafe, divine perfection of a woman,\r","Of these supposed-evils, to give me leave,\r","By circumstance, but to acquit myself.\r","\r","LADY ANNE:\r","Vouchsafe, defused infection of a man,\r","For these known evils, but to give me leave,\r","By circumstance, to curse thy cursed self.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Fairer than tongue can name thee, let me have\r","Some patient leisure to excuse myself.\r","\r","LADY ANNE:\r","Fouler than heart can think thee, thou canst make\r","No excuse current, but to hang thyself.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","By such despair, I should accuse myself.\r","\r","LADY ANNE:\r","And, by despairing, shouldst thou stand excused;\r","For doing worthy vengeance on thyself,\r","Which didst unworthy slaughter upon others.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Say that I slew them not?\r","\r","LADY ANNE:\r","Why, then they are not dead:\r","But dead they are, and devilish slave, by thee.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","I did not kill your husband.\r","\r","LADY ANNE:\r","Why, then he is alive.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Nay, he is dead; and slain by Edward's hand.\r","\r","LADY ANNE:\r","In thy foul throat thou liest: Queen Margaret saw\r","Thy murderous falchion smoking in his blood;\r","The which thou once didst bend against her breast,\r","But that thy brothers beat aside the point.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","I was provoked by her slanderous tongue,\r","which laid their guilt upon my guiltless shoulders.\r","\r","LADY ANNE:\r","Thou wast provoked by thy bloody mind.\r","Which never dreamt on aught but butcheries:\r","Didst thou not kill this king?\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","I grant ye.\r","\r","LADY ANNE:\r","Dost grant me, hedgehog? then, God grant me too\r","Thou mayst be damned for that wicked deed!\r","O, he was gentle, mild, and virtuous!\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","The fitter for the King of heaven, that hath him.\r","\r","LADY ANNE:\r","He is in heaven, where thou shalt never come.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Let him thank me, that holp to send him thither;\r","For he was fitter for that place than earth.\r","\r","LADY ANNE:\r","And thou unfit for any place but hell.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Yes, one place else, if you will hear me name it.\r","\r","LADY ANNE:\r","Some dungeon.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Your bed-chamber.\r","\r","LADY ANNE:\r","I'll rest betide the chamber where thou liest!\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","So will it, madam till I lie with you.\r","\r","LADY ANNE:\r","I hope so.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","I know so. But, gentle Lady Anne,\r","To leave this keen encounter of our wits,\r","And fall somewhat into a slower method,\r","Is not the causer of the timeless deaths\r","Of these Plantagenets, Henry and Edward,\r","As blameful as the executioner?\r","\r","LADY ANNE:\r","Thou art the cause, and most accursed effect.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Your beauty was the cause of that effect;\r","Your beauty: which did haunt me in my sleep\r","To undertake the death of all the world,\r","So I might live one hour in your sweet bosom.\r","\r","LADY ANNE:\r","If I thought that, I tell thee, homicide,\r","These nails should rend that beauty from my cheeks.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","These eyes could never endure sweet beauty's wreck;\r","You should not blemish it, if I stood by:\r","As all the world is cheered by the sun,\r","So I by that; it is my day, my life.\r","\r","LADY ANNE:\r","Black night o'ershade thy day, and death thy life!\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Curse not thyself, fair creature thou art both.\r","\r","LADY ANNE:\r","I would I were, to be revenged on thee.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","It is a quarrel most unnatural,\r","To be revenged on him that loveth you.\r","\r","LADY ANNE:\r","It is a quarrel just and reasonable,\r","To be revenged on him that slew my husband.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","He that bereft thee, lady, of thy husband,\r","Did it to help thee to a better husband.\r","\r","LADY ANNE:\r","His better doth not breathe upon the earth.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","He lives that loves thee better than he could.\r","\r","LADY ANNE:\r","Name him.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Plantagenet.\r","\r","LADY ANNE:\r","Why, that was he.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","The selfsame name, but one of better nature.\r","\r","LADY ANNE:\r","Where is he?\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Here.\r","Why dost thou spit at me?\r","\r","LADY ANNE:\r","Would it were mortal poison, for thy sake!\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Never came poison from so sweet a place.\r","\r","LADY ANNE:\r","Never hung poison on a fouler toad.\r","Out of my sight! thou dost infect my eyes.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Thine eyes, sweet lady, have infected mine.\r","\r","LADY ANNE:\r","Would they were basilisks, to strike thee dead!\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","I would they were, that I might die at once;\r","For now they kill me with a living death.\r","Those eyes of thine from mine have drawn salt tears,\r","Shamed their aspect with store of childish drops:\r","These eyes that never shed remorseful tear,\r","No, when my father York and Edward wept,\r","To hear the piteous moan that Rutland made\r","When black-faced Clifford shook his sword at him;\r","Nor when thy warlike father, like a child,\r","Told the sad story of my father's death,\r","And twenty times made pause to sob and weep,\r","That all the standers-by had wet their cheeks\r","Like trees bedash'd with rain: in that sad time\r","My manly eyes did scorn an humble tear;\r","And what these sorrows could not thence exhale,\r","Thy beauty hath, and made them blind with weeping.\r","I never sued to friend nor enemy;\r","My tongue could never learn sweet smoothing word;\r","But now thy beauty is proposed my fee,\r","My proud heart sues, and prompts my tongue to speak.\r","Teach not thy lips such scorn, for they were made\r","For kissing, lady, not for such contempt.\r","If thy revengeful heart cannot forgive,\r","Lo, here I lend thee this sharp-pointed sword;\r","Which if thou please to hide in this true bosom.\r","And let the soul forth that adoreth thee,\r","I lay it naked to the deadly stroke,\r","And humbly beg the death upon my knee.\r","Nay, do not pause; for I did kill King Henry,\r","But 'twas thy beauty that provoked me.\r","Nay, now dispatch; 'twas I that stabb'd young Edward,\r","But 'twas thy heavenly face that set me on.\r","Take up the sword again, or take up me.\r","\r","LADY ANNE:\r","Arise, dissembler: though I wish thy death,\r","I will not be the executioner.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Then bid me kill myself, and I will do it.\r","\r","LADY ANNE:\r","I have already.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Tush, that was in thy rage:\r","Speak it again, and, even with the word,\r","That hand, which, for thy love, did kill thy love,\r","Shall, for thy love, kill a far truer love;\r","To both their deaths thou shalt be accessary.\r","\r","LADY ANNE:\r","I would I knew thy heart.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","'Tis figured in my tongue.\r","\r","LADY ANNE:\r","I fear me both are false.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Then never man was true.\r","\r","LADY ANNE:\r","Well, well, put up your sword.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Say, then, my peace is made.\r","\r","LADY ANNE:\r","That shall you know hereafter.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","But shall I live in hope?\r","\r","LADY ANNE:\r","All men, I hope, live so.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Vouchsafe to wear this ring.\r","\r","LADY ANNE:\r","To take is not to give.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Look, how this ring encompasseth finger.\r","Even so thy breast encloseth my poor heart;\r","Wear both of them, for both of them are thine.\r","And if thy poor devoted suppliant may\r","But beg one favour at thy gracious hand,\r","Thou dost confirm his happiness for ever.\r","\r","LADY ANNE:\r","What is it?\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","That it would please thee leave these sad designs\r","To him that hath more cause to be a mourner,\r","And presently repair to Crosby Place;\r","Where, after I have solemnly interr'd\r","At Chertsey monastery this noble king,\r","And wet his grave with my repentant tears,\r","I will with all expedient duty see you:\r","For divers unknown reasons. I beseech you,\r","Grant me this boon.\r","\r","LADY ANNE:\r","With all my heart; and much it joys me too,\r","To see you are become so penitent.\r","Tressel and Berkeley, go along with me.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Bid me farewell.\r","\r","LADY ANNE:\r","'Tis more than you deserve;\r","But since you teach me how to flatter you,\r","Imagine I have said farewell already.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Sirs, take up the corse.\r","\r","GENTLEMEN:\r","Towards Chertsey, noble lord?\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","No, to White-Friars; there attend my coining.\r","Was ever woman in this humour woo'd?\r","Was ever woman in this humour won?\r","I'll have her; but I will not keep her long.\r","What! I, that kill'd her husband and his father,\r","To take her in her heart's extremest hate,\r","With curses in her mouth, tears in her eyes,\r","The bleeding witness of her hatred by;\r","Having God, her conscience, and these bars\r","against me,\r","And I nothing to back my suit at all,\r","But the plain devil and dissembling looks,\r","And yet to win her, all the world to nothing!\r","Ha!\r","Hath she forgot already that brave prince,\r","Edward, her lord, whom I, some three months since,\r","Stabb'd in my angry mood at Tewksbury?\r","A sweeter and a lovelier gentleman,\r","Framed in the prodigality of nature,\r","Young, valiant, wise, and, no doubt, right royal,\r","The spacious world cannot again afford\r","And will she yet debase her eyes on me,\r","That cropp'd the golden prime of this sweet prince,\r","And made her widow to a woful bed?\r","On me, whose all not equals Edward's moiety?\r","On me, that halt and am unshapen thus?\r","My dukedom to a beggarly denier,\r","I do mistake my person all this while:\r","Upon my life, she finds, although I cannot,\r","Myself to be a marvellous proper man.\r","I'll be at charges for a looking-glass,\r","And entertain some score or two of tailors,\r","To study fashions to adorn my body:\r","Since I am crept in favour with myself,\r","Will maintain it with some little cost.\r","But first I'll turn yon fellow in his grave;\r","And then return lamenting to my love.\r","Shine out, fair sun, till I have bought a glass,\r","That I may see my shadow as I pass.\r","\r","RIVERS:\r","Have patience, madam: there's no doubt his majesty\r","Will soon recover his accustom'd health.\r","\r","GREY:\r","In that you brook it in, it makes him worse:\r","Therefore, for God's sake, entertain good comfort,\r","And cheer his grace with quick and merry words.\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","If he were dead, what would betide of me?\r","\r","RIVERS:\r","No other harm but loss of such a lord.\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","The loss of such a lord includes all harm.\r","\r","GREY:\r","The heavens have bless'd you with a goodly son,\r","To be your comforter when he is gone.\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","Oh, he is young and his minority\r","Is put unto the trust of Richard Gloucester,\r","A man that loves not me, nor none of you.\r","\r","RIVERS:\r","Is it concluded that he shall be protector?\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","It is determined, not concluded yet:\r","But so it must be, if the king miscarry.\r","\r","GREY:\r","Here come the lords of Buckingham and Derby.\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","Good time of day unto your royal grace!\r","\r","DERBY:\r","God make your majesty joyful as you have been!\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","The Countess Richmond, good my Lord of Derby.\r","To your good prayers will scarcely say amen.\r","Yet, Derby, notwithstanding she's your wife,\r","And loves not me, be you, good lord, assured\r","I hate not you for her proud arrogance.\r","\r","DERBY:\r","I do beseech you, either not believe\r","The envious slanders of her false accusers;\r","Or, if she be accused in true report,\r","Bear with her weakness, which, I think proceeds\r","From wayward sickness, and no grounded malice.\r","\r","RIVERS:\r","Saw you the king to-day, my Lord of Derby?\r","\r","DERBY:\r","But now the Duke of Buckingham and I\r","Are come from visiting his majesty.\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","What likelihood of his amendment, lords?\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","Madam, good hope; his grace speaks cheerfully.\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","God grant him health! Did you confer with him?\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","Madam, we did: he desires to make atonement\r","Betwixt the Duke of Gloucester and your brothers,\r","And betwixt them and my lord chamberlain;\r","And sent to warn them to his royal presence.\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","Would all were well! but that will never be\r","I fear our happiness is at the highest.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","They do me wrong, and I will not endure it:\r","Who are they that complain unto the king,\r","That I, forsooth, am stern, and love them not?\r","By holy Paul, they love his grace but lightly\r","That fill his ears with such dissentious rumours.\r","Because I cannot flatter and speak fair,\r","Smile in men's faces, smooth, deceive and cog,\r","Duck with French nods and apish courtesy,\r","I must be held a rancorous enemy.\r","Cannot a plain man live and think no harm,\r","But thus his simple truth must be abused\r","By silken, sly, insinuating Jacks?\r","\r","RIVERS:\r","To whom in all this presence speaks your grace?\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","To thee, that hast nor honesty nor grace.\r","When have I injured thee? when done thee wrong?\r","Or thee? or thee? or any of your faction?\r","A plague upon you all! His royal person,--\r","Whom God preserve better than you would wish!--\r","Cannot be quiet scarce a breathing-while,\r","But you must trouble him with lewd complaints.\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","Brother of Gloucester, you mistake the matter.\r","The king, of his own royal disposition,\r","And not provoked by any suitor else;\r","Aiming, belike, at your interior hatred,\r","Which in your outward actions shows itself\r","Against my kindred, brothers, and myself,\r","Makes him to send; that thereby he may gather\r","The ground of your ill-will, and so remove it.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","I cannot tell: the world is grown so bad,\r","That wrens make prey where eagles dare not perch:\r","Since every Jack became a gentleman\r","There's many a gentle person made a Jack.\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","Come, come, we know your meaning, brother\r","Gloucester;\r","You envy my advancement and my friends':\r","God grant we never may have need of you!\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Meantime, God grants that we have need of you:\r","Your brother is imprison'd by your means,\r","Myself disgraced, and the nobility\r","Held in contempt; whilst many fair promotions\r","Are daily given to ennoble those\r","That scarce, some two days since, were worth a noble.\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","By Him that raised me to this careful height\r","From that contented hap which I enjoy'd,\r","I never did incense his majesty\r","Against the Duke of Clarence, but have been\r","An earnest advocate to plead for him.\r","My lord, you do me shameful injury,\r","Falsely to draw me in these vile suspects.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","You may deny that you were not the cause\r","Of my Lord Hastings' late imprisonment.\r","\r","RIVERS:\r","She may, my lord, for--\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","She may, Lord Rivers! why, who knows not so?\r","She may do more, sir, than denying that:\r","She may help you to many fair preferments,\r","And then deny her aiding hand therein,\r","And lay those honours on your high deserts.\r","What may she not? She may, yea, marry, may she--\r","\r","RIVERS:\r","What, marry, may she?\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","What, marry, may she! marry with a king,\r","A bachelor, a handsome stripling too:\r","I wis your grandam had a worser match.\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","My Lord of Gloucester, I have too long borne\r","Your blunt upbraidings and your bitter scoffs:\r","By heaven, I will acquaint his majesty\r","With those gross taunts I often have endured.\r","I had rather be a country servant-maid\r","Than a great queen, with this condition,\r","To be thus taunted, scorn'd, and baited at:\r","Small joy have I in being England's queen.\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","And lessen'd be that small, God, I beseech thee!\r","Thy honour, state and seat is due to me.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","What! threat you me with telling of the king?\r","Tell him, and spare not: look, what I have said\r","I will avouch in presence of the king:\r","I dare adventure to be sent to the Tower.\r","'Tis time to speak; my pains are quite forgot.\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","Out, devil! I remember them too well:\r","Thou slewest my husband Henry in the Tower,\r","And Edward, my poor son, at Tewksbury.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Ere you were queen, yea, or your husband king,\r","I was a pack-horse in his great affairs;\r","A weeder-out of his proud adversaries,\r","A liberal rewarder of his friends:\r","To royalize his blood I spilt mine own.\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","Yea, and much better blood than his or thine.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","In all which time you and your husband Grey\r","Were factious for the house of Lancaster;\r","And, Rivers, so were you. Was not your husband\r","In Margaret's battle at Saint Alban's slain?\r","Let me put in your minds, if you forget,\r","What you have been ere now, and what you are;\r","Withal, what I have been, and what I am.\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","A murderous villain, and so still thou art.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Poor Clarence did forsake his father, Warwick;\r","Yea, and forswore himself,--which Jesu pardon!--\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","Which God revenge!\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","To fight on Edward's party for the crown;\r","And for his meed, poor lord, he is mew'd up.\r","I would to God my heart were flint, like Edward's;\r","Or Edward's soft and pitiful, like mine\r","I am too childish-foolish for this world.\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","Hie thee to hell for shame, and leave the world,\r","Thou cacodemon! there thy kingdom is.\r","\r","RIVERS:\r","My Lord of Gloucester, in those busy days\r","Which here you urge to prove us enemies,\r","We follow'd then our lord, our lawful king:\r","So should we you, if you should be our king.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","If I should be! I had rather be a pedlar:\r","Far be it from my heart, the thought of it!\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","As little joy, my lord, as you suppose\r","You should enjoy, were you this country's king,\r","As little joy may you suppose in me.\r","That I enjoy, being the queen thereof.\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","A little joy enjoys the queen thereof;\r","For I am she, and altogether joyless.\r","I can no longer hold me patient.\r","Hear me, you wrangling pirates, that fall out\r","In sharing that which you have pill'd from me!\r","Which of you trembles not that looks on me?\r","If not, that, I being queen, you bow like subjects,\r","Yet that, by you deposed, you quake like rebels?\r","O gentle villain, do not turn away!\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Foul wrinkled witch, what makest thou in my sight?\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","But repetition of what thou hast marr'd;\r","That will I make before I let thee go.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Wert thou not banished on pain of death?\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","I was; but I do find more pain in banishment\r","Than death can yield me here by my abode.\r","A husband and a son thou owest to me;\r","And thou a kingdom; all of you allegiance:\r","The sorrow that I have, by right is yours,\r","And all the pleasures you usurp are mine.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","The curse my noble father laid on thee,\r","When thou didst crown his warlike brows with paper\r","And with thy scorns drew'st rivers from his eyes,\r","And then, to dry them, gavest the duke a clout\r","Steep'd in the faultless blood of pretty Rutland--\r","His curses, then from bitterness of soul\r","Denounced against thee, are all fall'n upon thee;\r","And God, not we, hath plagued thy bloody deed.\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","So just is God, to right the innocent.\r","\r","HASTINGS:\r","O, 'twas the foulest deed to slay that babe,\r","And the most merciless that e'er was heard of!\r","\r","RIVERS:\r","Tyrants themselves wept when it was reported.\r","\r","DORSET:\r","No man but prophesied revenge for it.\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","Northumberland, then present, wept to see it.\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","What were you snarling all before I came,\r","Ready to catch each other by the throat,\r","And turn you all your hatred now on me?\r","Did York's dread curse prevail so much with heaven?\r","That Henry's death, my lovely Edward's death,\r","Their kingdom's loss, my woful banishment,\r","Could all but answer for that peevish brat?\r","Can curses pierce the clouds and enter heaven?\r","Why, then, give way, dull clouds, to my quick curses!\r","If not by war, by surfeit die your king,\r","As ours by murder, to make him a king!\r","Edward thy son, which now is Prince of Wales,\r","For Edward my son, which was Prince of Wales,\r","Die in his youth by like untimely violence!\r","Thyself a queen, for me that was a queen,\r","Outlive thy glory, like my wretched self!\r","Long mayst thou live to wail thy children's loss;\r","And see another, as I see thee now,\r","Deck'd in thy rights, as thou art stall'd in mine!\r","Long die thy happy days before thy death;\r","And, after many lengthen'd hours of grief,\r","Die neither mother, wife, nor England's queen!\r","Rivers and Dorset, you were standers by,\r","And so wast thou, Lord Hastings, when my son\r","Was stabb'd with bloody daggers: God, I pray him,\r","That none of you may live your natural age,\r","But by some unlook'd accident cut off!\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Have done thy charm, thou hateful wither'd hag!\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","And leave out thee? stay, dog, for thou shalt hear me.\r","If heaven have any grievous plague in store\r","Exceeding those that I can wish upon thee,\r","O, let them keep it till thy sins be ripe,\r","And then hurl down their indignation\r","On thee, the troubler of the poor world's peace!\r","The worm of conscience still begnaw thy soul!\r","Thy friends suspect for traitors while thou livest,\r","And take deep traitors for thy dearest friends!\r","No sleep close up that deadly eye of thine,\r","Unless it be whilst some tormenting dream\r","Affrights thee with a hell of ugly devils!\r","Thou elvish-mark'd, abortive, rooting hog!\r","Thou that wast seal'd in thy nativity\r","The slave of nature and the son of hell!\r","Thou slander of thy mother's heavy womb!\r","Thou loathed issue of thy father's loins!\r","Thou rag of honour! thou detested--\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Margaret.\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","Richard!\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Ha!\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","I call thee not.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","I cry thee mercy then, for I had thought\r","That thou hadst call'd me all these bitter names.\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","Why, so I did; but look'd for no reply.\r","O, let me make the period to my curse!\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","'Tis done by me, and ends in 'Margaret.'\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","Thus have you breathed your curse against yourself.\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","Poor painted queen, vain flourish of my fortune!\r","Why strew'st thou sugar on that bottled spider,\r","Whose deadly web ensnareth thee about?\r","Fool, fool! thou whet'st a knife to kill thyself.\r","The time will come when thou shalt wish for me\r","To help thee curse that poisonous bunchback'd toad.\r","\r","HASTINGS:\r","False-boding woman, end thy frantic curse,\r","Lest to thy harm thou move our patience.\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","Foul shame upon you! you have all moved mine.\r","\r","RIVERS:\r","Were you well served, you would be taught your duty.\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","To serve me well, you all should do me duty,\r","Teach me to be your queen, and you my subjects:\r","O, serve me well, and teach yourselves that duty!\r","\r","DORSET:\r","Dispute not with her; she is lunatic.\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","Peace, master marquess, you are malapert:\r","Your fire-new stamp of honour is scarce current.\r","O, that your young nobility could judge\r","What 'twere to lose it, and be miserable!\r","They that stand high have many blasts to shake them;\r","And if they fall, they dash themselves to pieces.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Good counsel, marry: learn it, learn it, marquess.\r","\r","DORSET:\r","It toucheth you, my lord, as much as me.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Yea, and much more: but I was born so high,\r","Our aery buildeth in the cedar's top,\r","And dallies with the wind and scorns the sun.\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","And turns the sun to shade; alas! alas!\r","Witness my son, now in the shade of death;\r","Whose bright out-shining beams thy cloudy wrath\r","Hath in eternal darkness folded up.\r","Your aery buildeth in our aery's nest.\r","O God, that seest it, do not suffer it!\r","As it was won with blood, lost be it so!\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","Have done! for shame, if not for charity.\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","Urge neither charity nor shame to me:\r","Uncharitably with me have you dealt,\r","And shamefully by you my hopes are butcher'd.\r","My charity is outrage, life my shame\r","And in that shame still live my sorrow's rage.\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","Have done, have done.\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","O princely Buckingham I'll kiss thy hand,\r","In sign of league and amity with thee:\r","Now fair befal thee and thy noble house!\r","Thy garments are not spotted with our blood,\r","Nor thou within the compass of my curse.\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","Nor no one here; for curses never pass\r","The lips of those that breathe them in the air.\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","I'll not believe but they ascend the sky,\r","And there awake God's gentle-sleeping peace.\r","O Buckingham, take heed of yonder dog!\r","Look, when he fawns, he bites; and when he bites,\r","His venom tooth will rankle to the death:\r","Have not to do with him, beware of him;\r","Sin, death, and hell have set their marks on him,\r","And all their ministers attend on him.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","What doth she say, my Lord of Buckingham?\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","Nothing that I respect, my gracious lord.\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","What, dost thou scorn me for my gentle counsel?\r","And soothe the devil that I warn thee from?\r","O, but remember this another day,\r","When he shall split thy very heart with sorrow,\r","And say poor Margaret was a prophetess!\r","Live each of you the subjects to his hate,\r","And he to yours, and all of you to God's!\r","\r","HASTINGS:\r","My hair doth stand on end to hear her curses.\r","\r","RIVERS:\r","And so doth mine: I muse why she's at liberty.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","I cannot blame her: by God's holy mother,\r","She hath had too much wrong; and I repent\r","My part thereof that I have done to her.\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","I never did her any, to my knowledge.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","But you have all the vantage of her wrong.\r","I was too hot to do somebody good,\r","That is too cold in thinking of it now.\r","Marry, as for Clarence, he is well repaid,\r","He is frank'd up to fatting for his pains\r","God pardon them that are the cause of it!\r","\r","RIVERS:\r","A virtuous and a Christian-like conclusion,\r","To pray for them that have done scathe to us.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","So do I ever:\r","being well-advised.\r","For had I cursed now, I had cursed myself.\r","\r","CATESBY:\r","Madam, his majesty doth call for you,\r","And for your grace; and you, my noble lords.\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","Catesby, we come. Lords, will you go with us?\r","\r","RIVERS:\r","Madam, we will attend your grace.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","I do the wrong, and first begin to brawl.\r","The secret mischiefs that I set abroach\r","I lay unto the grievous charge of others.\r","Clarence, whom I, indeed, have laid in darkness,\r","I do beweep to many simple gulls\r","Namely, to Hastings, Derby, Buckingham;\r","And say it is the queen and her allies\r","That stir the king against the duke my brother.\r","Now, they believe it; and withal whet me\r","To be revenged on Rivers, Vaughan, Grey:\r","But then I sigh; and, with a piece of scripture,\r","Tell them that God bids us do good for evil:\r","And thus I clothe my naked villany\r","With old odd ends stolen out of holy writ;\r","And seem a saint, when most I play the devil.\r","But, soft! here come my executioners.\r","How now, my hardy, stout resolved mates!\r","Are you now going to dispatch this deed?\r","\r","First Murderer:\r","We are, my lord; and come to have the warrant\r","That we may be admitted where he is.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Well thought upon; I have it here about me.\r","When you have done, repair to Crosby Place.\r","But, sirs, be sudden in the execution,\r","Withal obdurate, do not hear him plead;\r","For Clarence is well-spoken, and perhaps\r","May move your hearts to pity if you mark him.\r","\r","First Murderer:\r","Tush!\r","Fear not, my lord, we will not stand to prate;\r","Talkers are no good doers: be assured\r","We come to use our hands and not our tongues.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Your eyes drop millstones, when fools' eyes drop tears:\r","I like you, lads; about your business straight;\r","Go, go, dispatch.\r","\r","First Murderer:\r","We will, my noble lord.\r","\r","BRAKENBURY:\r","Why looks your grace so heavily today?\r","\r","CLARENCE:\r","O, I have pass'd a miserable night,\r","So full of ugly sights, of ghastly dreams,\r","That, as I am a Christian faithful man,\r","I would not spend another such a night,\r","Though 'twere to buy a world of happy days,\r","So full of dismal terror was the time!\r","\r","BRAKENBURY:\r","What was your dream? I long to hear you tell it.\r","\r","CLARENCE:\r","Methoughts that I had broken from the Tower,\r","And was embark'd to cross to Burgundy;\r","And, in my company, my brother Gloucester;\r","Who from my cabin tempted me to walk\r","Upon the hatches: thence we looked toward England,\r","And cited up a thousand fearful times,\r","During the wars of York and Lancaster\r","That had befall'n us. As we paced along\r","Upon the giddy footing of the hatches,\r","Methought that Gloucester stumbled; and, in falling,\r","Struck me, that thought to stay him, overboard,\r","Into the tumbling billows of the main.\r","Lord, Lord! methought, what pain it was to drown!\r","What dreadful noise of waters in mine ears!\r","What ugly sights of death within mine eyes!\r","Methought I saw a thousand fearful wrecks;\r","Ten thousand men that fishes gnaw'd upon;\r","Wedges of gold, great anchors, heaps of pearl,\r","Inestimable stones, unvalued jewels,\r","All scatter'd in the bottom of the sea:\r","Some lay in dead men's skulls; and, in those holes\r","Where eyes did once inhabit, there were crept,\r","As 'twere in scorn of eyes, reflecting gems,\r","Which woo'd the slimy bottom of the deep,\r","And mock'd the dead bones that lay scatter'd by.\r","\r","BRAKENBURY:\r","Had you such leisure in the time of death\r","To gaze upon the secrets of the deep?\r","\r","CLARENCE:\r","Methought I had; and often did I strive\r","To yield the ghost: but still the envious flood\r","Kept in my soul, and would not let it forth\r","To seek the empty, vast and wandering air;\r","But smother'd it within my panting bulk,\r","Which almost burst to belch it in the sea.\r","\r","BRAKENBURY:\r","Awaked you not with this sore agony?\r","\r","CLARENCE:\r","O, no, my dream was lengthen'd after life;\r","O, then began the tempest to my soul,\r","Who pass'd, methought, the melancholy flood,\r","With that grim ferryman which poets write of,\r","Unto the kingdom of perpetual night.\r","The first that there did greet my stranger soul,\r","Was my great father-in-law, renowned Warwick;\r","Who cried aloud, 'What scourge for perjury\r","Can this dark monarchy afford false Clarence?'\r","And so he vanish'd: then came wandering by\r","A shadow like an angel, with bright hair\r","Dabbled in blood; and he squeak'd out aloud,\r","'Clarence is come; false, fleeting, perjured Clarence,\r","That stabb'd me in the field by Tewksbury;\r","Seize on him, Furies, take him to your torments!'\r","With that, methoughts, a legion of foul fiends\r","Environ'd me about, and howled in mine ears\r","Such hideous cries, that with the very noise\r","I trembling waked, and for a season after\r","Could not believe but that I was in hell,\r","Such terrible impression made the dream.\r","\r","BRAKENBURY:\r","No marvel, my lord, though it affrighted you;\r","I promise, I am afraid to hear you tell it.\r","\r","CLARENCE:\r","O Brakenbury, I have done those things,\r","Which now bear evidence against my soul,\r","For Edward's sake; and see how he requites me!\r","O God! if my deep prayers cannot appease thee,\r","But thou wilt be avenged on my misdeeds,\r","Yet execute thy wrath in me alone,\r","O, spare my guiltless wife and my poor children!\r","I pray thee, gentle keeper, stay by me;\r","My soul is heavy, and I fain would sleep.\r","\r","BRAKENBURY:\r","I will, my lord: God give your grace good rest!\r","Sorrow breaks seasons and reposing hours,\r","Makes the night morning, and the noon-tide night.\r","Princes have but their tides for their glories,\r","An outward honour for an inward toil;\r","And, for unfelt imagination,\r","They often feel a world of restless cares:\r","So that, betwixt their tides and low names,\r","There's nothing differs but the outward fame.\r","\r","First Murderer:\r","Ho! who's here?\r","\r","BRAKENBURY:\r","In God's name what are you, and how came you hither?\r","\r","First Murderer:\r","I would speak with Clarence, and I came hither on my legs.\r","\r","BRAKENBURY:\r","Yea, are you so brief?\r","\r","Second Murderer:\r","O sir, it is better to be brief than tedious. Show\r","him our commission; talk no more.\r","\r","BRAKENBURY:\r","I am, in this, commanded to deliver\r","The noble Duke of Clarence to your hands:\r","I will not reason what is meant hereby,\r","Because I will be guiltless of the meaning.\r","Here are the keys, there sits the duke asleep:\r","I'll to the king; and signify to him\r","That thus I have resign'd my charge to you.\r","\r","First Murderer:\r","Do so, it is a point of wisdom: fare you well.\r","\r","Second Murderer:\r","What, shall we stab him as he sleeps?\r","\r","First Murderer:\r","No; then he will say 'twas done cowardly, when he wakes.\r","\r","Second Murderer:\r","When he wakes! why, fool, he shall never wake till\r","the judgment-day.\r","\r","First Murderer:\r","Why, then he will say we stabbed him sleeping.\r","\r","Second Murderer:\r","The urging of that word 'judgment' hath bred a kind\r","of remorse in me.\r","\r","First Murderer:\r","What, art thou afraid?\r","\r","Second Murderer:\r","Not to kill him, having a warrant for it; but to be\r","damned for killing him, from which no warrant can defend us.\r","\r","First Murderer:\r","I thought thou hadst been resolute.\r","\r","Second Murderer:\r","So I am, to let him live.\r","\r","First Murderer:\r","Back to the Duke of Gloucester, tell him so.\r","\r","Second Murderer:\r","I pray thee, stay a while: I hope my holy humour\r","will change; 'twas wont to hold me but while one\r","would tell twenty.\r","\r","First Murderer:\r","How dost thou feel thyself now?\r","\r","Second Murderer:\r","'Faith, some certain dregs of conscience are yet\r","within me.\r","\r","First Murderer:\r","Remember our reward, when the deed is done.\r","\r","Second Murderer:\r","'Zounds, he dies: I had forgot the reward.\r","\r","First Murderer:\r","Where is thy conscience now?\r","\r","Second Murderer:\r","In the Duke of Gloucester's purse.\r","\r","First Murderer:\r","So when he opens his purse to give us our reward,\r","thy conscience flies out.\r","\r","Second Murderer:\r","Let it go; there's few or none will entertain it.\r","\r","First Murderer:\r","How if it come to thee again?\r","\r","Second Murderer:\r","I'll not meddle with it: it is a dangerous thing: it\r","makes a man a coward: a man cannot steal, but it\r","accuseth him; he cannot swear, but it cheques him;\r","he cannot lie with his neighbour's wife, but it\r","detects him: 'tis a blushing shamefast spirit that\r","mutinies in a man's bosom; it fills one full of\r","obstacles: it made me once restore a purse of gold\r","that I found; it beggars any man that keeps it: it\r","is turned out of all towns and cities for a\r","dangerous thing; and every man that means to live\r","well endeavours to trust to himself and to live\r","without it.\r","\r","First Murderer:\r","'Zounds, it is even now at my elbow, persuading me\r","not to kill the duke.\r","\r","Second Murderer:\r","Take the devil in thy mind, and relieve him not: he\r","would insinuate with thee but to make thee sigh.\r","\r","First Murderer:\r","Tut, I am strong-framed, he cannot prevail with me,\r","I warrant thee.\r","\r","Second Murderer:\r","Spoke like a tail fellow that respects his\r","reputation. Come, shall we to this gear?\r","\r","First Murderer:\r","Take him over the costard with the hilts of thy\r","sword, and then we will chop him in the malmsey-butt\r","in the next room.\r","\r","Second Murderer:\r","O excellent devise! make a sop of him.\r","\r","First Murderer:\r","Hark! he stirs: shall I strike?\r","\r","Second Murderer:\r","No, first let's reason with him.\r","\r","CLARENCE:\r","Where art thou, keeper? give me a cup of wine.\r","\r","Second murderer:\r","You shall have wine enough, my lord, anon.\r","\r","CLARENCE:\r","In God's name, what art thou?\r","\r","Second Murderer:\r","A man, as you are.\r","\r","CLARENCE:\r","But not, as I am, royal.\r","\r","Second Murderer:\r","Nor you, as we are, loyal.\r","\r","CLARENCE:\r","Thy voice is thunder, but thy looks are humble.\r","\r","Second Murderer:\r","My voice is now the king's, my looks mine own.\r","\r","CLARENCE:\r","How darkly and how deadly dost thou speak!\r","Your eyes do menace me: why look you pale?\r","Who sent you hither? Wherefore do you come?\r","\r","Both:\r","To, to, to--\r","\r","CLARENCE:\r","To murder me?\r","\r","Both:\r","Ay, ay.\r","\r","CLARENCE:\r","You scarcely have the hearts to tell me so,\r","And therefore cannot have the hearts to do it.\r","Wherein, my friends, have I offended you?\r","\r","First Murderer:\r","Offended us you have not, but the king.\r","\r","CLARENCE:\r","I shall be reconciled to him again.\r","\r","Second Murderer:\r","Never, my lord; therefore prepare to die.\r","\r","CLARENCE:\r","Are you call'd forth from out a world of men\r","To slay the innocent? What is my offence?\r","Where are the evidence that do accuse me?\r","What lawful quest have given their verdict up\r","Unto the frowning judge? or who pronounced\r","The bitter sentence of poor Clarence' death?\r","Before I be convict by course of law,\r","To threaten me with death is most unlawful.\r","I charge you, as you hope to have redemption\r","By Christ's dear blood shed for our grievous sins,\r","That you depart and lay no hands on me\r","The deed you undertake is damnable.\r","\r","First Murderer:\r","What we will do, we do upon command.\r","\r","Second Murderer:\r","And he that hath commanded is the king.\r","\r","CLARENCE:\r","Erroneous vassal! the great King of kings\r","Hath in the tables of his law commanded\r","That thou shalt do no murder: and wilt thou, then,\r","Spurn at his edict and fulfil a man's?\r","Take heed; for he holds vengeance in his hands,\r","To hurl upon their heads that break his law.\r","\r","Second Murderer:\r","And that same vengeance doth he hurl on thee,\r","For false forswearing and for murder too:\r","Thou didst receive the holy sacrament,\r","To fight in quarrel of the house of Lancaster.\r","\r","First Murderer:\r","And, like a traitor to the name of God,\r","Didst break that vow; and with thy treacherous blade\r","Unrip'dst the bowels of thy sovereign's son.\r","\r","Second Murderer:\r","Whom thou wert sworn to cherish and defend.\r","\r","First Murderer:\r","How canst thou urge God's dreadful law to us,\r","When thou hast broke it in so dear degree?\r","\r","CLARENCE:\r","Alas! for whose sake did I that ill deed?\r","For Edward, for my brother, for his sake: Why, sirs,\r","He sends ye not to murder me for this\r","For in this sin he is as deep as I.\r","If God will be revenged for this deed.\r","O, know you yet, he doth it publicly,\r","Take not the quarrel from his powerful arm;\r","He needs no indirect nor lawless course\r","To cut off those that have offended him.\r","\r","First Murderer:\r","Who made thee, then, a bloody minister,\r","When gallant-springing brave Plantagenet,\r","That princely novice, was struck dead by thee?\r","\r","CLARENCE:\r","My brother's love, the devil, and my rage.\r","\r","First Murderer:\r","Thy brother's love, our duty, and thy fault,\r","Provoke us hither now to slaughter thee.\r","\r","CLARENCE:\r","Oh, if you love my brother, hate not me;\r","I am his brother, and I love him well.\r","If you be hired for meed, go back again,\r","And I will send you to my brother Gloucester,\r","Who shall reward you better for my life\r","Than Edward will for tidings of my death.\r","\r","Second Murderer:\r","You are deceived, your brother Gloucester hates you.\r","\r","CLARENCE:\r","O, no, he loves me, and he holds me dear:\r","Go you to him from me.\r","\r","Both:\r","Ay, so we will.\r","\r","CLARENCE:\r","Tell him, when that our princely father York\r","Bless'd his three sons with his victorious arm,\r","And charged us from his soul to love each other,\r","He little thought of this divided friendship:\r","Bid Gloucester think of this, and he will weep.\r","\r","First Murderer:\r","Ay, millstones; as be lesson'd us to weep.\r","\r","CLARENCE:\r","O, do not slander him, for he is kind.\r","\r","First Murderer:\r","Right,\r","As snow in harvest. Thou deceivest thyself:\r","'Tis he that sent us hither now to slaughter thee.\r","\r","CLARENCE:\r","It cannot be; for when I parted with him,\r","He hugg'd me in his arms, and swore, with sobs,\r","That he would labour my delivery.\r","\r","Second Murderer:\r","Why, so he doth, now he delivers thee\r","From this world's thraldom to the joys of heaven.\r","\r","First Murderer:\r","Make peace with God, for you must die, my lord.\r","\r","CLARENCE:\r","Hast thou that holy feeling in thy soul,\r","To counsel me to make my peace with God,\r","And art thou yet to thy own soul so blind,\r","That thou wilt war with God by murdering me?\r","Ah, sirs, consider, he that set you on\r","To do this deed will hate you for the deed.\r","\r","Second Murderer:\r","What shall we do?\r","\r","CLARENCE:\r","Relent, and save your souls.\r","\r","First Murderer:\r","Relent! 'tis cowardly and womanish.\r","\r","CLARENCE:\r","Not to relent is beastly, savage, devilish.\r","Which of you, if you were a prince's son,\r","Being pent from liberty, as I am now,\r","if two such murderers as yourselves came to you,\r","Would not entreat for life?\r","My friend, I spy some pity in thy looks:\r","O, if thine eye be not a flatterer,\r","Come thou on my side, and entreat for me,\r","As you would beg, were you in my distress\r","A begging prince what beggar pities not?\r","\r","Second Murderer:\r","Look behind you, my lord.\r","\r","First Murderer:\r","Take that, and that: if all this will not do,\r","I'll drown you in the malmsey-butt within.\r","\r","Second Murderer:\r","A bloody deed, and desperately dispatch'd!\r","How fain, like Pilate, would I wash my hands\r","Of this most grievous guilty murder done!\r","\r","First Murderer:\r","How now! what mean'st thou, that thou help'st me not?\r","By heavens, the duke shall know how slack thou art!\r","\r","Second Murderer:\r","I would he knew that I had saved his brother!\r","Take thou the fee, and tell him what I say;\r","For I repent me that the duke is slain.\r","\r","First Murderer:\r","So do not I: go, coward as thou art.\r","Now must I hide his body in some hole,\r","Until the duke take order for his burial:\r","And when I have my meed, I must away;\r","For this will out, and here I must not stay.\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","Why, so: now have I done a good day's work:\r","You peers, continue this united league:\r","I every day expect an embassage\r","From my Redeemer to redeem me hence;\r","And now in peace my soul shall part to heaven,\r","Since I have set my friends at peace on earth.\r","Rivers and Hastings, take each other's hand;\r","Dissemble not your hatred, swear your love.\r","\r","RIVERS:\r","By heaven, my heart is purged from grudging hate:\r","And with my hand I seal my true heart's love.\r","\r","HASTINGS:\r","So thrive I, as I truly swear the like!\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","Take heed you dally not before your king;\r","Lest he that is the supreme King of kings\r","Confound your hidden falsehood, and award\r","Either of you to be the other's end.\r","\r","HASTINGS:\r","So prosper I, as I swear perfect love!\r","\r","RIVERS:\r","And I, as I love Hastings with my heart!\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","Madam, yourself are not exempt in this,\r","Nor your son Dorset, Buckingham, nor you;\r","You have been factious one against the other,\r","Wife, love Lord Hastings, let him kiss your hand;\r","And what you do, do it unfeignedly.\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","Here, Hastings; I will never more remember\r","Our former hatred, so thrive I and mine!\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","Dorset, embrace him; Hastings, love lord marquess.\r","\r","DORSET:\r","This interchange of love, I here protest,\r","Upon my part shall be unviolable.\r","\r","HASTINGS:\r","And so swear I, my lord\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","Now, princely Buckingham, seal thou this league\r","With thy embracements to my wife's allies,\r","And make me happy in your unity.\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","Whenever Buckingham doth turn his hate\r","On you or yours,\r","but with all duteous love\r","Doth cherish you and yours, God punish me\r","With hate in those where I expect most love!\r","When I have most need to employ a friend,\r","And most assured that he is a friend\r","Deep, hollow, treacherous, and full of guile,\r","Be he unto me! this do I beg of God,\r","When I am cold in zeal to yours.\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","A pleasing cordial, princely Buckingham,\r","is this thy vow unto my sickly heart.\r","There wanteth now our brother Gloucester here,\r","To make the perfect period of this peace.\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","And, in good time, here comes the noble duke.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Good morrow to my sovereign king and queen:\r","And, princely peers, a happy time of day!\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","Happy, indeed, as we have spent the day.\r","Brother, we done deeds of charity;\r","Made peace enmity, fair love of hate,\r","Between these swelling wrong-incensed peers.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","A blessed labour, my most sovereign liege:\r","Amongst this princely heap, if any here,\r","By false intelligence, or wrong surmise,\r","Hold me a foe;\r","If I unwittingly, or in my rage,\r","Have aught committed that is hardly borne\r","By any in this presence, I desire\r","To reconcile me to his friendly peace:\r","'Tis death to me to be at enmity;\r","I hate it, and desire all good men's love.\r","First, madam, I entreat true peace of you,\r","Which I will purchase with my duteous service;\r","Of you, my noble cousin Buckingham,\r","If ever any grudge were lodged between us;\r","Of you, Lord Rivers, and, Lord Grey, of you;\r","That without desert have frown'd on me;\r","Dukes, earls, lords, gentlemen; indeed, of all.\r","I do not know that Englishman alive\r","With whom my soul is any jot at odds\r","More than the infant that is born to-night\r","I thank my God for my humility.\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","A holy day shall this be kept hereafter:\r","I would to God all strifes were well
