compounded.\r","My sovereign liege, I do beseech your majesty\r","To take our brother Clarence to your grace.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Why, madam, have I offer'd love for this\r","To be so bouted in this royal presence?\r","Who knows not that the noble duke is dead?\r","You do him injury to scorn his corse.\r","\r","RIVERS:\r","Who knows not he is dead! who knows he is?\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","All seeing heaven, what a world is this!\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","Look I so pale, Lord Dorset, as the rest?\r","\r","DORSET:\r","Ay, my good lord; and no one in this presence\r","But his red colour hath forsook his cheeks.\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","Is Clarence dead? the order was reversed.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","But he, poor soul, by your first order died,\r","And that a winged Mercury did bear:\r","Some tardy cripple bore the countermand,\r","That came too lag to see him buried.\r","God grant that some, less noble and less loyal,\r","Nearer in bloody thoughts, but not in blood,\r","Deserve not worse than wretched Clarence did,\r","And yet go current from suspicion!\r","\r","DORSET:\r","A boon, my sovereign, for my service done!\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","I pray thee, peace: my soul is full of sorrow.\r","\r","DORSET:\r","I will not rise, unless your highness grant.\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","Then speak at once what is it thou demand'st.\r","\r","DORSET:\r","The forfeit, sovereign, of my servant's life;\r","Who slew to-day a righteous gentleman\r","Lately attendant on the Duke of Norfolk.\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","Have a tongue to doom my brother's death,\r","And shall the same give pardon to a slave?\r","My brother slew no man; his fault was thought,\r","And yet his punishment was cruel death.\r","Who sued to me for him? who, in my rage,\r","Kneel'd at my feet, and bade me be advised\r","Who spake of brotherhood? who spake of love?\r","Who told me how the poor soul did forsake\r","The mighty Warwick, and did fight for me?\r","Who told me, in the field by Tewksbury\r","When Oxford had me down, he rescued me,\r","And said, 'Dear brother, live, and be a king'?\r","Who told me, when we both lay in the field\r","Frozen almost to death, how he did lap me\r","Even in his own garments, and gave himself,\r","All thin and naked, to the numb cold night?\r","All this from my remembrance brutish wrath\r","Sinfully pluck'd, and not a man of you\r","Had so much grace to put it in my mind.\r","But when your carters or your waiting-vassals\r","Have done a drunken slaughter, and defaced\r","The precious image of our dear Redeemer,\r","You straight are on your knees for pardon, pardon;\r","And I unjustly too, must grant it you\r","But for my brother not a man would speak,\r","Nor I, ungracious, speak unto myself\r","For him, poor soul. The proudest of you all\r","Have been beholding to him in his life;\r","Yet none of you would once plead for his life.\r","O God, I fear thy justice will take hold\r","On me, and you, and mine, and yours for this!\r","Come, Hastings, help me to my closet.\r","Oh, poor Clarence!\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","This is the fruit of rashness! Mark'd you not\r","How that the guilty kindred of the queen\r","Look'd pale when they did hear of Clarence' death?\r","O, they did urge it still unto the king!\r","God will revenge it. But come, let us in,\r","To comfort Edward with our company.\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","We wait upon your grace.\r","\r","Boy:\r","Tell me, good grandam, is our father dead?\r","\r","DUCHESS OF YORK:\r","No, boy.\r","\r","Boy:\r","Why do you wring your hands, and beat your breast,\r","And cry 'O Clarence, my unhappy son!'\r","\r","Girl:\r","Why do you look on us, and shake your head,\r","And call us wretches, orphans, castaways\r","If that our noble father be alive?\r","\r","DUCHESS OF YORK:\r","My pretty cousins, you mistake me much;\r","I do lament the sickness of the king.\r","As loath to lose him, not your father's death;\r","It were lost sorrow to wail one that's lost.\r","\r","Boy:\r","Then, grandam, you conclude that he is dead.\r","The king my uncle is to blame for this:\r","God will revenge it; whom I will importune\r","With daily prayers all to that effect.\r","\r","Girl:\r","And so will I.\r","\r","DUCHESS OF YORK:\r","Peace, children, peace! the king doth love you well:\r","Incapable and shallow innocents,\r","You cannot guess who caused your father's death.\r","\r","Boy:\r","Grandam, we can; for my good uncle Gloucester\r","Told me, the king, provoked by the queen,\r","Devised impeachments to imprison him :\r","And when my uncle told me so, he wept,\r","And hugg'd me in his arm, and kindly kiss'd my cheek;\r","Bade me rely on him as on my father,\r","And he would love me dearly as his child.\r","\r","DUCHESS OF YORK:\r","Oh, that deceit should steal such gentle shapes,\r","And with a virtuous vizard hide foul guile!\r","He is my son; yea, and therein my shame;\r","Yet from my dugs he drew not this deceit.\r","\r","Boy:\r","Think you my uncle did dissemble, grandam?\r","\r","DUCHESS OF YORK:\r","Ay, boy.\r","\r","Boy:\r","I cannot think it. Hark! what noise is this?\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","Oh, who shall hinder me to wail and weep,\r","To chide my fortune, and torment myself?\r","I'll join with black despair against my soul,\r","And to myself become an enemy.\r","\r","DUCHESS OF YORK:\r","What means this scene of rude impatience?\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","To make an act of tragic violence:\r","Edward, my lord, your son, our king, is dead.\r","Why grow the branches now the root is wither'd?\r","Why wither not the leaves the sap being gone?\r","If you will live, lament; if die, be brief,\r","That our swift-winged souls may catch the king's;\r","Or, like obedient subjects, follow him\r","To his new kingdom of perpetual rest.\r","\r","DUCHESS OF YORK:\r","Ah, so much interest have I in thy sorrow\r","As I had title in thy noble husband!\r","I have bewept a worthy husband's death,\r","And lived by looking on his images:\r","But now two mirrors of his princely semblance\r","Are crack'd in pieces by malignant death,\r","And I for comfort have but one false glass,\r","Which grieves me when I see my shame in him.\r","Thou art a widow; yet thou art a mother,\r","And hast the comfort of thy children left thee:\r","But death hath snatch'd my husband from mine arms,\r","And pluck'd two crutches from my feeble limbs,\r","Edward and Clarence. O, what cause have I,\r","Thine being but a moiety of my grief,\r","To overgo thy plaints and drown thy cries!\r","\r","Boy:\r","Good aunt, you wept not for our father's death;\r","How can we aid you with our kindred tears?\r","\r","Girl:\r","Our fatherless distress was left unmoan'd;\r","Your widow-dolour likewise be unwept!\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","Give me no help in lamentation;\r","I am not barren to bring forth complaints\r","All springs reduce their currents to mine eyes,\r","That I, being govern'd by the watery moon,\r","May send forth plenteous tears to drown the world!\r","Oh for my husband, for my dear lord Edward!\r","\r","Children:\r","Oh for our father, for our dear lord Clarence!\r","\r","DUCHESS OF YORK:\r","Alas for both, both mine, Edward and Clarence!\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","What stay had I but Edward? and he's gone.\r","\r","Children:\r","What stay had we but Clarence? and he's gone.\r","\r","DUCHESS OF YORK:\r","What stays had I but they? and they are gone.\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","Was never widow had so dear a loss!\r","\r","Children:\r","Were never orphans had so dear a loss!\r","\r","DUCHESS OF YORK:\r","Was never mother had so dear a loss!\r","Alas, I am the mother of these moans!\r","Their woes are parcell'd, mine are general.\r","She for an Edward weeps, and so do I;\r","I for a Clarence weep, so doth not she:\r","These babes for Clarence weep and so do I;\r","I for an Edward weep, so do not they:\r","Alas, you three, on me, threefold distress'd,\r","Pour all your tears! I am your sorrow's nurse,\r","And I will pamper it with lamentations.\r","\r","DORSET:\r","Comfort, dear mother: God is much displeased\r","That you take with unthankfulness, his doing:\r","In common worldly things, 'tis call'd ungrateful,\r","With dull unwilligness to repay a debt\r","Which with a bounteous hand was kindly lent;\r","Much more to be thus opposite with heaven,\r","For it requires the royal debt it lent you.\r","\r","RIVERS:\r","Madam, bethink you, like a careful mother,\r","Of the young prince your son: send straight for him\r","Let him be crown'd; in him your comfort lives:\r","Drown desperate sorrow in dead Edward's grave,\r","And plant your joys in living Edward's throne.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Madam, have comfort: all of us have cause\r","To wail the dimming of our shining star;\r","But none can cure their harms by wailing them.\r","Madam, my mother, I do cry you mercy;\r","I did not see your grace: humbly on my knee\r","I crave your blessing.\r","\r","DUCHESS OF YORK:\r","God bless thee; and put meekness in thy mind,\r","Love, charity, obedience, and true duty!\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","You cloudy princes and heart-sorrowing peers,\r","That bear this mutual heavy load of moan,\r","Now cheer each other in each other's love\r","Though we have spent our harvest of this king,\r","We are to reap the harvest of his son.\r","The broken rancour of your high-swoln hearts,\r","But lately splinter'd, knit, and join'd together,\r","Must gently be preserved, cherish'd, and kept:\r","Me seemeth good, that, with some little train,\r","Forthwith from Ludlow the young prince be fetch'd\r","Hither to London, to be crown'd our king.\r","\r","RIVERS:\r","Why with some little train, my Lord of Buckingham?\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","Marry, my lord, lest, by a multitude,\r","The new-heal'd wound of malice should break out,\r","Which would be so much the more dangerous\r","By how much the estate is green and yet ungovern'd:\r","Where every horse bears his commanding rein,\r","And may direct his course as please himself,\r","As well the fear of harm, as harm apparent,\r","In my opinion, ought to be prevented.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","I hope the king made peace with all of us\r","And the compact is firm and true in me.\r","\r","RIVERS:\r","And so in me; and so, I think, in all:\r","Yet, since it is but green, it should be put\r","To no apparent likelihood of breach,\r","Which haply by much company might be urged:\r","Therefore I say with noble Buckingham,\r","That it is meet so few should fetch the prince.\r","\r","HASTINGS:\r","And so say I.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Then be it so; and go we to determine\r","Who they shall be that straight shall post to Ludlow.\r","Madam, and you, my mother, will you go\r","To give your censures in this weighty business?\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","With all our harts.\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","My lord, whoever journeys to the Prince,\r","For God's sake, let not us two be behind;\r","For, by the way, I'll sort occasion,\r","As index to the story we late talk'd of,\r","To part the queen's proud kindred from the king.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","My other self, my counsel's consistory,\r","My oracle, my prophet! My dear cousin,\r","I, like a child, will go by thy direction.\r","Towards Ludlow then, for we'll not stay behind.\r","\r","First Citizen:\r","Neighbour, well met: whither away so fast?\r","\r","Second Citizen:\r","I promise you, I scarcely know myself:\r","Hear you the news abroad?\r","\r","First Citizen:\r","Ay, that the king is dead.\r","\r","Second Citizen:\r","Bad news, by'r lady; seldom comes the better:\r","I fear, I fear 'twill prove a troublous world.\r","\r","Third Citizen:\r","Neighbours, God speed!\r","\r","First Citizen:\r","Give you good morrow, sir.\r","\r","Third Citizen:\r","Doth this news hold of good King Edward's death?\r","\r","Second Citizen:\r","Ay, sir, it is too true; God help the while!\r","\r","Third Citizen:\r","Then, masters, look to see a troublous world.\r","\r","First Citizen:\r","No, no; by God's good grace his son shall reign.\r","\r","Third Citizen:\r","Woe to the land that's govern'd by a child!\r","\r","Second Citizen:\r","In him there is a hope of government,\r","That in his nonage council under him,\r","And in his full and ripen'd years himself,\r","No doubt, shall then and till then govern well.\r","\r","First Citizen:\r","So stood the state when Henry the Sixth\r","Was crown'd in Paris but at nine months old.\r","\r","Third Citizen:\r","Stood the state so? No, no, good friends, God wot;\r","For then this land was famously enrich'd\r","With politic grave counsel; then the king\r","Had virtuous uncles to protect his grace.\r","\r","First Citizen:\r","Why, so hath this, both by the father and mother.\r","\r","Third Citizen:\r","Better it were they all came by the father,\r","Or by the father there were none at all;\r","For emulation now, who shall be nearest,\r","Will touch us all too near, if God prevent not.\r","O, full of danger is the Duke of Gloucester!\r","And the queen's sons and brothers haught and proud:\r","And were they to be ruled, and not to rule,\r","This sickly land might solace as before.\r","\r","First Citizen:\r","Come, come, we fear the worst; all shall be well.\r","\r","Third Citizen:\r","When clouds appear, wise men put on their cloaks;\r","When great leaves fall, the winter is at hand;\r","When the sun sets, who doth not look for night?\r","Untimely storms make men expect a dearth.\r","All may be well; but, if God sort it so,\r","'Tis more than we deserve, or I expect.\r","\r","Second Citizen:\r","Truly, the souls of men are full of dread:\r","Ye cannot reason almost with a man\r","That looks not heavily and full of fear.\r","\r","Third Citizen:\r","Before the times of change, still is it so:\r","By a divine instinct men's minds mistrust\r","Ensuing dangers; as by proof, we see\r","The waters swell before a boisterous storm.\r","But leave it all to God. whither away?\r","\r","Second Citizen:\r","Marry, we were sent for to the justices.\r","\r","Third Citizen:\r","And so was I: I'll bear you company.\r","\r","ARCHBISHOP OF YORK:\r","Last night, I hear, they lay at Northampton;\r","At Stony-Stratford will they be to-night:\r","To-morrow, or next day, they will be here.\r","\r","DUCHESS OF YORK:\r","I long with all my heart to see the prince:\r","I hope he is much grown since last I saw him.\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","But I hear, no; they say my son of York\r","Hath almost overta'en him in his growth.\r","\r","YORK:\r","Ay, mother; but I would not have it so.\r","\r","DUCHESS OF YORK:\r","Why, my young cousin, it is good to grow.\r","\r","YORK:\r","Grandam, one night, as we did sit at supper,\r","My uncle Rivers talk'd how I did grow\r","More than my brother: 'Ay,' quoth my uncle\r","Gloucester,\r","'Small herbs have grace, great weeds do grow apace:'\r","And since, methinks, I would not grow so fast,\r","Because sweet flowers are slow and weeds make haste.\r","\r","DUCHESS OF YORK:\r","Good faith, good faith, the saying did not hold\r","In him that did object the same to thee;\r","He was the wretched'st thing when he was young,\r","So long a-growing and so leisurely,\r","That, if this rule were true, he should be gracious.\r","\r","ARCHBISHOP OF YORK:\r","Why, madam, so, no doubt, he is.\r","\r","DUCHESS OF YORK:\r","I hope he is; but yet let mothers doubt.\r","\r","YORK:\r","Now, by my troth, if I had been remember'd,\r","I could have given my uncle's grace a flout,\r","To touch his growth nearer than he touch'd mine.\r","\r","DUCHESS OF YORK:\r","How, my pretty York? I pray thee, let me hear it.\r","\r","YORK:\r","Marry, they say my uncle grew so fast\r","That he could gnaw a crust at two hours old\r","'Twas full two years ere I could get a tooth.\r","Grandam, this would have been a biting jest.\r","\r","DUCHESS OF YORK:\r","I pray thee, pretty York, who told thee this?\r","\r","YORK:\r","Grandam, his nurse.\r","\r","DUCHESS OF YORK:\r","His nurse! why, she was dead ere thou wert born.\r","\r","YORK:\r","If 'twere not she, I cannot tell who told me.\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","A parlous boy: go to, you are too shrewd.\r","\r","ARCHBISHOP OF YORK:\r","Good madam, be not angry with the child.\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","Pitchers have ears.\r","\r","ARCHBISHOP OF YORK:\r","Here comes a messenger. What news?\r","\r","Messenger:\r","Such news, my lord, as grieves me to unfold.\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","How fares the prince?\r","\r","Messenger:\r","Well, madam, and in health.\r","\r","DUCHESS OF YORK:\r","What is thy news then?\r","\r","Messenger:\r","Lord Rivers and Lord Grey are sent to Pomfret,\r","With them Sir Thomas Vaughan, prisoners.\r","\r","DUCHESS OF YORK:\r","Who hath committed them?\r","\r","Messenger:\r","The mighty dukes\r","Gloucester and Buckingham.\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","For what offence?\r","\r","Messenger:\r","The sum of all I can, I have disclosed;\r","Why or for what these nobles were committed\r","Is all unknown to me, my gracious lady.\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","Ay me, I see the downfall of our house!\r","The tiger now hath seized the gentle hind;\r","Insulting tyranny begins to jet\r","Upon the innocent and aweless throne:\r","Welcome, destruction, death, and massacre!\r","I see, as in a map, the end of all.\r","\r","DUCHESS OF YORK:\r","Accursed and unquiet wrangling days,\r","How many of you have mine eyes beheld!\r","My husband lost his life to get the crown;\r","And often up and down my sons were toss'd,\r","For me to joy and weep their gain and loss:\r","And being seated, and domestic broils\r","Clean over-blown, themselves, the conquerors.\r","Make war upon themselves; blood against blood,\r","Self against self: O, preposterous\r","And frantic outrage, end thy damned spleen;\r","Or let me die, to look on death no more!\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","Come, come, my boy; we will to sanctuary.\r","Madam, farewell.\r","\r","DUCHESS OF YORK:\r","I'll go along with you.\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","You have no cause.\r","\r","ARCHBISHOP OF YORK:\r","My gracious lady, go;\r","And thither bear your treasure and your goods.\r","For my part, I'll resign unto your grace\r","The seal I keep: and so betide to me\r","As well I tender you and all of yours!\r","Come, I'll conduct you to the sanctuary.\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","Welcome, sweet prince, to London, to your chamber.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Welcome, dear cousin, my thoughts' sovereign\r","The weary way hath made you melancholy.\r","\r","PRINCE EDWARD:\r","No, uncle; but our crosses on the way\r","Have made it tedious, wearisome, and heavy\r","I want more uncles here to welcome me.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Sweet prince, the untainted virtue of your years\r","Hath not yet dived into the world's deceit\r","Nor more can you distinguish of a man\r","Than of his outward show; which, God he knows,\r","Seldom or never jumpeth with the heart.\r","Those uncles which you want were dangerous;\r","Your grace attended to their sugar'd words,\r","But look'd not on the poison of their hearts :\r","God keep you from them, and from such false friends!\r","\r","PRINCE EDWARD:\r","God keep me from false friends! but they were none.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","My lord, the mayor of London comes to greet you.\r","\r","Lord Mayor:\r","God bless your grace with health and happy days!\r","\r","PRINCE EDWARD:\r","I thank you, good my lord; and thank you all.\r","I thought my mother, and my brother York,\r","Would long ere this have met us on the way\r","Fie, what a slug is Hastings, that he comes not\r","To tell us whether they will come or no!\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","And, in good time, here comes the sweating lord.\r","\r","PRINCE EDWARD:\r","Welcome, my lord: what, will our mother come?\r","\r","HASTINGS:\r","On what occasion, God he knows, not I,\r","The queen your mother, and your brother York,\r","Have taken sanctuary: the tender prince\r","Would fain have come with me to meet your grace,\r","But by his mother was perforce withheld.\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","Fie, what an indirect and peevish course\r","Is this of hers! Lord cardinal, will your grace\r","Persuade the queen to send the Duke of York\r","Unto his princely brother presently?\r","If she deny, Lord Hastings, go with him,\r","And from her jealous arms pluck him perforce.\r","\r","CARDINAL:\r","My Lord of Buckingham, if my weak oratory\r","Can from his mother win the Duke of York,\r","Anon expect him here; but if she be obdurate\r","To mild entreaties, God in heaven forbid\r","We should infringe the holy privilege\r","Of blessed sanctuary! not for all this land\r","Would I be guilty of so deep a sin.\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","You are too senseless--obstinate, my lord,\r","Too ceremonious and traditional\r","Weigh it but with the grossness of this age,\r","You break not sanctuary in seizing him.\r","The benefit thereof is always granted\r","To those whose dealings have deserved the place,\r","And those who have the wit to claim the place:\r","This prince hath neither claim'd it nor deserved it;\r","And therefore, in mine opinion, cannot have it:\r","Then, taking him from thence that is not there,\r","You break no privilege nor charter there.\r","Oft have I heard of sanctuary men;\r","But sanctuary children ne'er till now.\r","\r","CARDINAL:\r","My lord, you shall o'er-rule my mind for once.\r","Come on, Lord Hastings, will you go with me?\r","\r","HASTINGS:\r","I go, my lord.\r","\r","PRINCE EDWARD:\r","Good lords, make all the speedy haste you may.\r","Say, uncle Gloucester, if our brother come,\r","Where shall we sojourn till our coronation?\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Where it seems best unto your royal self.\r","If I may counsel you, some day or two\r","Your highness shall repose you at the Tower:\r","Then where you please, and shall be thought most fit\r","For your best health and recreation.\r","\r","PRINCE EDWARD:\r","I do not like the Tower, of any place.\r","Did Julius Caesar build that place, my lord?\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","He did, my gracious lord, begin that place;\r","Which, since, succeeding ages have re-edified.\r","\r","PRINCE EDWARD:\r","Is it upon record, or else reported\r","Successively from age to age, he built it?\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","Upon record, my gracious lord.\r","\r","PRINCE EDWARD:\r","But say, my lord, it were not register'd,\r","Methinks the truth should live from age to age,\r","As 'twere retail'd to all posterity,\r","Even to the general all-ending day.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","\r","PRINCE EDWARD:\r","What say you, uncle?\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","I say, without characters, fame lives long.\r","Thus, like the formal vice, Iniquity,\r","I moralize two meanings in one word.\r","\r","PRINCE EDWARD:\r","That Julius Caesar was a famous man;\r","With what his valour did enrich his wit,\r","His wit set down to make his valour live\r","Death makes no conquest of this conqueror;\r","For now he lives in fame, though not in life.\r","I'll tell you what, my cousin Buckingham,--\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","What, my gracious lord?\r","\r","PRINCE EDWARD:\r","An if I live until I be a man,\r","I'll win our ancient right in France again,\r","Or die a soldier, as I lived a king.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","Now, in good time, here comes the Duke of York.\r","\r","PRINCE EDWARD:\r","Richard of York! how fares our loving brother?\r","\r","YORK:\r","Well, my dread lord; so must I call you now.\r","\r","PRINCE EDWARD:\r","Ay, brother, to our grief, as it is yours:\r","Too late he died that might have kept that title,\r","Which by his death hath lost much majesty.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","How fares our cousin, noble Lord of York?\r","\r","YORK:\r","I thank you, gentle uncle. O, my lord,\r","You said that idle weeds are fast in growth\r","The prince my brother hath outgrown me far.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","He hath, my lord.\r","\r","YORK:\r","And therefore is he idle?\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","O, my fair cousin, I must not say so.\r","\r","YORK:\r","Then is he more beholding to you than I.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","He may command me as my sovereign;\r","But you have power in me as in a kinsman.\r","\r","YORK:\r","I pray you, uncle, give me this dagger.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","My dagger, little cousin? with all my heart.\r","\r","PRINCE EDWARD:\r","A beggar, brother?\r","\r","YORK:\r","Of my kind uncle, that I know will give;\r","And being but a toy, which is no grief to give.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","A greater gift than that I'll give my cousin.\r","\r","YORK:\r","A greater gift! O, that's the sword to it.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","A gentle cousin, were it light enough.\r","\r","YORK:\r","O, then, I see, you will part but with light gifts;\r","In weightier things you'll say a beggar nay.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","It is too heavy for your grace to wear.\r","\r","YORK:\r","I weigh it lightly, were it heavier.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","What, would you have my weapon, little lord?\r","\r","YORK:\r","I would, that I might thank you as you call me.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","How?\r","\r","YORK:\r","Little.\r","\r","PRINCE EDWARD:\r","My Lord of York will still be cross in talk:\r","Uncle, your grace knows how to bear with him.\r","\r","YORK:\r","You mean, to bear me, not to bear with me:\r","Uncle, my brother mocks both you and me;\r","Because that I am little, like an ape,\r","He thinks that you should bear me on your shoulders.\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","With what a sharp-provided wit he reasons!\r","To mitigate the scorn he gives his uncle,\r","He prettily and aptly taunts himself:\r","So cunning and so young is wonderful.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","My lord, will't please you pass along?\r","Myself and my good cousin Buckingham\r","Will to your mother, to entreat of her\r","To meet you at the Tower and welcome you.\r","\r","YORK:\r","What, will you go unto the Tower, my lord?\r","\r","PRINCE EDWARD:\r","My lord protector needs will have it so.\r","\r","YORK:\r","I shall not sleep in quiet at the Tower.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Why, what should you fear?\r","\r","YORK:\r","Marry, my uncle Clarence' angry ghost:\r","My grandam told me he was murdered there.\r","\r","PRINCE EDWARD:\r","I fear no uncles dead.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Nor none that live, I hope.\r","\r","PRINCE EDWARD:\r","An if they live, I hope I need not fear.\r","But come, my lord; and with a heavy heart,\r","Thinking on them, go I unto the Tower.\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","Think you, my lord, this little prating York\r","Was not incensed by his subtle mother\r","To taunt and scorn you thus opprobriously?\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","No doubt, no doubt; O, 'tis a parlous boy;\r","Bold, quick, ingenious, forward, capable\r","He is all the mother's, from the top to toe.\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","Well, let them rest. Come hither, Catesby.\r","Thou art sworn as deeply to effect what we intend\r","As closely to conceal what we impart:\r","Thou know'st our reasons urged upon the way;\r","What think'st thou? is it not an easy matter\r","To make William Lord Hastings of our mind,\r","For the instalment of this noble duke\r","In the seat royal of this famous isle?\r","\r","CATESBY:\r","He for his father's sake so loves the prince,\r","That he will not be won to aught against him.\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","What think'st thou, then, of Stanley? what will he?\r","\r","CATESBY:\r","He will do all in all as Hastings doth.\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","Well, then, no more but this: go, gentle Catesby,\r","And, as it were far off sound thou Lord Hastings,\r","How doth he stand affected to our purpose;\r","And summon him to-morrow to the Tower,\r","To sit about the coronation.\r","If thou dost find him tractable to us,\r","Encourage him, and show him all our reasons:\r","If he be leaden, icy-cold, unwilling,\r","Be thou so too; and so break off your talk,\r","And give us notice of his inclination:\r","For we to-morrow hold divided councils,\r","Wherein thyself shalt highly be employ'd.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Commend me to Lord William: tell him, Catesby,\r","His ancient knot of dangerous adversaries\r","To-morrow are let blood at Pomfret-castle;\r","And bid my friend, for joy of this good news,\r","Give mistress Shore one gentle kiss the more.\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","Good Catesby, go, effect this business soundly.\r","\r","CATESBY:\r","My good lords both, with all the heed I may.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Shall we hear from you, Catesby, ere we sleep?\r","\r","CATESBY:\r","You shall, my lord.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","At Crosby Place, there shall you find us both.\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","Now, my lord, what shall we do, if we perceive\r","Lord Hastings will not yield to our complots?\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Chop off his head, man; somewhat we will do:\r","And, look, when I am king, claim thou of me\r","The earldom of Hereford, and the moveables\r","Whereof the king my brother stood possess'd.\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","I'll claim that promise at your grace's hands.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","And look to have it yielded with all willingness.\r","Come, let us sup betimes, that afterwards\r","We may digest our complots in some form.\r","\r","Messenger:\r","What, ho! my lord!\r","\r","HASTINGS:\r","\r","Messenger:\r","A messenger from the Lord Stanley.\r","\r","HASTINGS:\r","What is't o'clock?\r","\r","Messenger:\r","Upon the stroke of four.\r","\r","HASTINGS:\r","Cannot thy master sleep these tedious nights?\r","\r","Messenger:\r","So it should seem by that I have to say.\r","First, he commends him to your noble lordship.\r","\r","HASTINGS:\r","And then?\r","\r","Messenger:\r","And then he sends you word\r","He dreamt to-night the boar had razed his helm:\r","Besides, he says there are two councils held;\r","And that may be determined at the one\r","which may make you and him to rue at the other.\r","Therefore he sends to know your lordship's pleasure,\r","If presently you will take horse with him,\r","And with all speed post with him toward the north,\r","To shun the danger that his soul divines.\r","\r","HASTINGS:\r","Go, fellow, go, return unto thy lord;\r","Bid him not fear the separated councils\r","His honour and myself are at the one,\r","And at the other is my servant Catesby\r","Where nothing can proceed that toucheth us\r","Whereof I shall not have intelligence.\r","Tell him his fears are shallow, wanting instance:\r","And for his dreams, I wonder he is so fond\r","To trust the mockery of unquiet slumbers\r","To fly the boar before the boar pursues,\r","Were to incense the boar to follow us\r","And make pursuit where he did mean no chase.\r","Go, bid thy master rise and come to me\r","And we will both together to the Tower,\r","Where, he shall see, the boar will use us kindly.\r","\r","Messenger:\r","My gracious lord, I'll tell him what you say.\r","\r","CATESBY:\r","Many good morrows to my noble lord!\r","\r","HASTINGS:\r","Good morrow, Catesby; you are early stirring\r","What news, what news, in this our tottering state?\r","\r","CATESBY:\r","It is a reeling world, indeed, my lord;\r","And I believe twill never stand upright\r","Tim Richard wear the garland of the realm.\r","\r","HASTINGS:\r","How! wear the garland! dost thou mean the crown?\r","\r","CATESBY:\r","Ay, my good lord.\r","\r","HASTINGS:\r","I'll have this crown of mine cut from my shoulders\r","Ere I will see the crown so foul misplaced.\r","But canst thou guess that he doth aim at it?\r","\r","CATESBY:\r","Ay, on my life; and hopes to find forward\r","Upon his party for the gain thereof:\r","And thereupon he sends you this good news,\r","That this same very day your enemies,\r","The kindred of the queen, must die at Pomfret.\r","\r","HASTINGS:\r","Indeed, I am no mourner for that news,\r","Because they have been still mine enemies:\r","But, that I'll give my voice on Richard's side,\r","To bar my master's heirs in true descent,\r","God knows I will not do it, to the death.\r","\r","CATESBY:\r","God keep your lordship in that gracious mind!\r","\r","HASTINGS:\r","But I shall laugh at this a twelve-month hence,\r","That they who brought me in my master's hate\r","I live to look upon their tragedy.\r","I tell thee, Catesby--\r","\r","CATESBY:\r","What, my lord?\r","\r","HASTINGS:\r","Ere a fortnight make me elder,\r","I'll send some packing that yet think not on it.\r","\r","CATESBY:\r","'Tis a vile thing to die, my gracious lord,\r","When men are unprepared and look not for it.\r","\r","HASTINGS:\r","O monstrous, monstrous! and so falls it out\r","With Rivers, Vaughan, Grey: and so 'twill do\r","With some men else, who think themselves as safe\r","As thou and I; who, as thou know'st, are dear\r","To princely Richard and to Buckingham.\r","\r","CATESBY:\r","The princes both make high account of you;\r","For they account his head upon the bridge.\r","\r","HASTINGS:\r","I know they do; and I have well deserved it.\r","Come on, come on; where is your boar-spear, man?\r","Fear you the boar, and go so unprovided?\r","\r","STANLEY:\r","My lord, good morrow; good morrow, Catesby:\r","You may jest on, but, by the holy rood,\r","I do not like these several councils, I.\r","\r","HASTINGS:\r","My lord,\r","I hold my life as dear as you do yours;\r","And never in my life, I do protest,\r","Was it more precious to me than 'tis now:\r","Think you, but that I know our state secure,\r","I would be so triumphant as I am?\r","\r","STANLEY:\r","The lords at Pomfret, when they rode from London,\r","Were jocund, and supposed their state was sure,\r","And they indeed had no cause to mistrust;\r","But yet, you see how soon the day o'ercast.\r","This sudden stag of rancour I misdoubt:\r","Pray God, I say, I prove a needless coward!\r","What, shall we toward the Tower? the day is spent.\r","\r","HASTINGS:\r","Come, come, have with you. Wot you what, my lord?\r","To-day the lords you talk of are beheaded.\r","\r","LORD STANLEY:\r","They, for their truth, might better wear their heads\r","Than some that have accused them wear their hats.\r","But come, my lord, let us away.\r","\r","HASTINGS:\r","Go on before; I'll talk with this good fellow.\r","How now, sirrah! how goes the world with thee?\r","\r","Pursuivant:\r","The better that your lordship please to ask.\r","\r","HASTINGS:\r","I tell thee, man, 'tis better with me now\r","Than when I met thee last where now we meet:\r","Then was I going prisoner to the Tower,\r","By the suggestion of the queen's allies;\r","But now, I tell thee--keep it to thyself--\r","This day those enemies are put to death,\r","And I in better state than e'er I was.\r","\r","Pursuivant:\r","God hold it, to your honour's good content!\r","\r","HASTINGS:\r","Gramercy, fellow: there, drink that for me.\r","\r","Pursuivant:\r","God save your lordship!\r","\r","Priest:\r","Well met, my lord; I am glad to see your honour.\r","\r","HASTINGS:\r","I thank thee, good Sir John, with all my heart.\r","I am in your debt for your last exercise;\r","Come the next Sabbath, and I will content you.\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","What, talking with a priest, lord chamberlain?\r","Your friends at Pomfret, they do need the priest;\r","Your honour hath no shriving work in hand.\r","\r","HASTINGS:\r","Good faith, and when I met this holy man,\r","Those men you talk of came into my mind.\r","What, go you toward the Tower?\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","I do, my lord; but long I shall not stay\r","I shall return before your lordship thence.\r","\r","HASTINGS:\r","'Tis like enough, for I stay dinner there.\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","\r","HASTINGS:\r","I'll wait upon your lordship.\r","\r","RATCLIFF:\r","Come, bring forth the prisoners.\r","\r","RIVERS:\r","Sir Richard Ratcliff, let me tell thee this:\r","To-day shalt thou behold a subject die\r","For truth, for duty, and for loyalty.\r","\r","GREY:\r","God keep the prince from all the pack of you!\r","A knot you are of damned blood-suckers!\r","\r","VAUGHAN:\r","You live that shall cry woe for this after.\r","\r","RATCLIFF:\r","Dispatch; the limit of your lives is out.\r","\r","RIVERS:\r","O Pomfret, Pomfret! O thou bloody prison,\r","Fatal and ominous to noble peers!\r","Within the guilty closure of thy walls\r","Richard the second here was hack'd to death;\r","And, for more slander to thy dismal seat,\r","We give thee up our guiltless blood to drink.\r","\r","GREY:\r","Now Margaret's curse is fall'n upon our heads,\r","For standing by when Richard stabb'd her son.\r","\r","RIVERS:\r","Then cursed she Hastings, then cursed she Buckingham,\r","Then cursed she Richard. O, remember, God\r","To hear her prayers for them, as now for us\r","And for my sister and her princely sons,\r","Be satisfied, dear God, with our true blood,\r","Which, as thou know'st, unjustly must be spilt.\r","\r","RATCLIFF:\r","Make haste; the hour of death is expiate.\r","\r","RIVERS:\r","Come, Grey, come, Vaughan, let us all embrace:\r","And take our leave, until we meet in heaven.\r","\r","HASTINGS:\r","My lords, at once: the cause why we are met\r","Is, to determine of the coronation.\r","In God's name, speak: when is the royal day?\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","Are all things fitting for that royal time?\r","\r","DERBY:\r","It is, and wants but nomination.\r","\r","BISHOP OF ELY:\r","To-morrow, then, I judge a happy day.\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","Who knows the lord protector's mind herein?\r","Who is most inward with the royal duke?\r","\r","BISHOP OF ELY:\r","Your grace, we think, should soonest know his mind.\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","Who, I, my lord I we know each other's faces,\r","But for our hearts, he knows no more of mine,\r","Than I of yours;\r","Nor I no more of his, than you of mine.\r","Lord Hastings, you and he are near in love.\r","\r","HASTINGS:\r","I thank his grace, I know he loves me well;\r","But, for his purpose in the coronation.\r","I have not sounded him, nor he deliver'd\r","His gracious pleasure any way therein:\r","But you, my noble lords, may name the time;\r","And in the duke's behalf I'll give my voice,\r","Which, I presume, he'll take in gentle part.\r","\r","BISHOP OF ELY:\r","Now in good time, here comes the duke himself.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","My noble lords and cousins all, good morrow.\r","I have been long a sleeper; but, I hope,\r","My absence doth neglect no great designs,\r","Which by my presence might have been concluded.\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","Had not you come upon your cue, my lord\r","William Lord Hastings had pronounced your part,--\r","I mean, your voice,--for crowning of the king.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Than my Lord Hastings no man might be bolder;\r","His lordship knows me well, and loves me well.\r","\r","HASTINGS:\r","I thank your grace.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","My lord of Ely!\r","\r","BISHOP OF ELY:\r","My lord?\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","When I was last in Holborn,\r","I saw good strawberries in your garden there\r","I do beseech you send for some of them.\r","\r","BISHOP OF ELY:\r","Marry, and will, my lord, with all my heart.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Cousin of Buckingham, a word with you.\r","Catesby hath sounded Hastings in our business,\r","And finds the testy gentleman so hot,\r","As he will lose his head ere give consent\r","His master's son, as worshipful as he terms it,\r","Shall lose the royalty of England's throne.\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","Withdraw you hence, my lord, I'll follow you.\r","\r","DERBY:\r","We have not yet set down this day of triumph.\r","To-morrow, in mine opinion, is too sudden;\r","For I myself am not so well provided\r","As else I would be, were the day prolong'd.\r","\r","BISHOP OF ELY:\r","Where is my lord protector? I have sent for these\r","strawberries.\r","\r","HASTINGS:\r","His grace looks cheerfully and smooth to-day;\r","There's some conceit or other likes him well,\r","When he doth bid good morrow with such a spirit.\r","I think there's never a man in Christendom\r","That can less hide his love or hate than he;\r","For by his face straight shall you know his heart.\r","\r","DERBY:\r","What of his heart perceive you in his face\r","By any likelihood he show'd to-day?\r","\r","HASTINGS:\r","Marry, that with no man here he is offended;\r","For, were he, he had shown it in his looks.\r","\r","DERBY:\r","I pray God he be not, I say.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","I pray you all, tell me what they deserve\r","That do conspire my death with devilish plots\r","Of damned witchcraft, and that have prevail'd\r","Upon my body with their hellish charms?\r","\r","HASTINGS:\r","The tender love I bear your grace, my lord,\r","Makes me most forward in this noble presence\r","To doom the offenders, whatsoever they be\r","I say, my lord, they have deserved death.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Then be your eyes the witness of this ill:\r","See how I am bewitch'd; behold mine arm\r","Is, like a blasted sapling, wither'd up:\r","And this is Edward's wife, that monstrous witch,\r","Consorted with that harlot strumpet Shore,\r","That by their witchcraft thus have marked me.\r","\r","HASTINGS:\r","If they have done this thing, my gracious lord--\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","If I thou protector of this damned strumpet--\r","Tellest thou me of 'ifs'?  Thou art a traitor:\r","Off with his head! Now, by Saint Paul I swear,\r","I will not dine until I see the same.\r","Lovel and Ratcliff, look that it be done:\r","The rest, that love me, rise and follow me.\r","\r","HASTINGS:\r","Woe, woe for England! not a whit for me;\r","For I, too fond, might have prevented this.\r","Stanley did dream the boar did raze his helm;\r","But I disdain'd it, and did scorn to fly:\r","Three times to-day my foot-cloth horse did stumble,\r","And startled, when he look'd upon the Tower,\r","As loath to bear me to the slaughter-house.\r","O, now I want the priest that spake to me:\r","I now repent I told the pursuivant\r","As 'twere triumphing at mine enemies,\r","How they at Pomfret bloodily were butcher'd,\r","And I myself secure in grace and favour.\r","O Margaret, Margaret, now thy heavy curse\r","Is lighted on poor Hastings' wretched head!\r","\r","RATCLIFF:\r","Dispatch, my lord; the duke would be at dinner:\r","Make a short shrift; he longs to see your head.\r","\r","HASTINGS:\r","O momentary grace of mortal men,\r","Which we more hunt for than the grace of God!\r","Who builds his hopes in air of your good looks,\r","Lives like a drunken sailor on a mast,\r","Ready, with every nod, to tumble down\r","Into the fatal bowels of the deep.\r","\r","LOVEL:\r","Come, come, dispatch; 'tis bootless to exclaim.\r","\r","HASTINGS:\r","O bloody Richard! miserable England!\r","I prophesy the fearful'st time to thee\r","That ever wretched age hath look'd upon.\r","Come, lead me to the block; bear him my head.\r","They smile at me that shortly shall be dead.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Come, cousin, canst thou quake, and change thy colour,\r","Murder thy breath in the middle of a word,\r","And then begin again, and stop again,\r","As if thou wert distraught and mad with terror?\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","Tut, I can counterfeit the deep tragedian;\r","Speak and look back, and pry on every side,\r","Tremble and start at wagging of a straw,\r","Intending deep suspicion: ghastly looks\r","Are at my service, like enforced smiles;\r","And both are ready in their offices,\r","At any time, to grace my stratagems.\r","But what, is Catesby gone?\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","He is; and, see, he brings the mayor along.\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","Lord mayor,--\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Look to the drawbridge there!\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","Hark! a drum.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Catesby, o'erlook the walls.\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","Lord mayor, the reason we have sent--\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Look back, defend thee, here are enemies.\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","God and our innocency defend and guard us!\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Be patient, they are friends, Ratcliff and Lovel.\r","\r","LOVEL:\r","Here is the head of that ignoble traitor,\r","The dangerous and unsuspected Hastings.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","So dear I loved the man, that I must weep.\r","I took him for the plainest harmless creature\r","That breathed upon this earth a Christian;\r","Made him my book wherein my soul recorded\r","The history of all her secret thoughts:\r","So smooth he daub'd his vice with show of virtue,\r","That, his apparent open guilt omitted,\r","I mean, his conversation with Shore's wife,\r","He lived from all attainder of suspect.\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","Well, well, he was the covert'st shelter'd traitor\r","That ever lived.\r","Would you imagine, or almost believe,\r","Were't not that, by great preservation,\r","We live to tell it you, the subtle traitor\r","This day had plotted, in the council-house\r","To murder me and my good Lord of Gloucester?\r","\r","Lord Mayor:\r","What, had he so?\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","What, think You we are Turks or infidels?\r","Or that we would, against the form of law,\r","Proceed thus rashly to the villain's death,\r","But that the extreme peril of the case,\r","The peace of England and our persons' safety,\r","Enforced us to this execution?\r","\r","Lord Mayor:\r","Now, fair befall you! he deserved his death;\r","And you my good lords, both have well proceeded,\r","To warn false traitors from the like attempts.\r","I never look'd for better at his hands,\r","After he once fell in with Mistress Shore.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Yet had not we determined he should die,\r","Until your lordship came to see his death;\r","Which now the loving haste of these our friends,\r","Somewhat against our meaning, have prevented:\r","Because, my lord, we would have had you heard\r","The traitor speak, and timorously confess\r","The manner and the purpose of his treason;\r","That you might well have signified the same\r","Unto the citizens, who haply may\r","Misconstrue us in him and wail his death.\r","\r","Lord Mayor:\r","But, my good lord, your grace's word shall serve,\r","As well as I had seen and heard him speak\r","And doubt you not, right noble princes both,\r","But I'll acquaint our duteous citizens\r","With all your just proceedings in this cause.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","And to that end we wish'd your lord-ship here,\r","To avoid the carping censures of the world.\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","But since you come too late of our intents,\r","Yet witness what you hear we did intend:\r","And so, my good lord mayor, we bid farewell.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Go, after, after, cousin Buckingham.\r","The mayor towards Guildhall hies him in all post:\r","There, at your meet'st advantage of the time,\r","Infer the bastardy of Edward's children:\r","Tell them how Edward put to death a citizen,\r","Only for saying he would make his son\r","Heir to the crown; meaning indeed his house,\r","Which, by the sign thereof was termed so.\r","Moreover, urge his hateful luxury\r","And bestial appetite in change of lust;\r","Which stretched to their servants, daughters, wives,\r","Even where his lustful eye or savage heart,\r","Without control, listed to make his prey.\r","Nay, for a need, thus far come near my person:\r","Tell them, when that my mother went with child\r","Of that unsatiate Edward, noble York\r","My princely father then had wars in France\r","And, by just computation of the time,\r","Found that the issue was not his begot;\r","Which well appeared in his lineaments,\r","Being nothing like the noble duke my father:\r","But touch this sparingly, as 'twere far off,\r","Because you know, my lord, my mother lives.\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","Fear not, my lord, I'll play the orator\r","As if the golden fee for which I plead\r","Were for myself: and so, my lord, adieu.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","If you thrive well, bring them to Baynard's Castle;\r","Where you shall find me well accompanied\r","With reverend fathers and well-learned bishops.\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","I go: and towards three or four o'clock\r","Look for the news that the Guildhall affords.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Go, Lovel, with all speed to Doctor Shaw;\r","Go thou to Friar Penker; bid them both\r","Meet me within this hour at Baynard's Castle.\r","Now will I in, to take some privy order,\r","To draw the brats of Clarence out of sight;\r","And to give notice, that no manner of person\r","At any time have recourse unto the princes.\r","\r","Scrivener:\r","This is the indictment of the good Lord Hastings;\r","Which in a set hand fairly is engross'd,\r","That it may be this day read over in Paul's.\r","And mark how well the sequel hangs together:\r","Eleven hours I spent to write it over,\r","For yesternight by Catesby was it brought me;\r","The precedent was full as long a-doing:\r","And yet within these five hours lived Lord Hastings,\r","Untainted, unexamined, free, at liberty\r","Here's a good world the while! Why who's so gross,\r","That seeth not this palpable device?\r","Yet who's so blind, but says he sees it not?\r","Bad is the world; and all will come to nought,\r","When such bad dealings must be seen in thought.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","How now, my lord, what say the citizens?\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","Now, by the holy mother of our Lord,\r","The citizens are mum and speak not a word.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Touch'd you the bastardy of Edward's children?\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","I did; with his contract with Lady Lucy,\r","And his contract by deputy in France;\r","The insatiate greediness of his desires,\r","And his enforcement of the city wives;\r","His tyranny for trifles; his own bastardy,\r","As being got, your father then in France,\r","His resemblance, being not like the duke;\r","Withal I did infer your lineaments,\r","Being the right idea of your father,\r","Both in your form and nobleness of mind;\r","Laid open all your victories in Scotland,\r","Your dicipline in war, wisdom in peace,\r","Your bounty, virtue, fair humility:\r","Indeed, left nothing fitting for the purpose\r","Untouch'd, or slightly handled, in discourse\r","And when mine oratory grew to an end\r","I bid them that did love their country's good\r","Cry 'God save Richard, England's royal king!'\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Ah! and did they so?\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","No, so God help me, they spake not a word;\r","But, like dumb statues or breathing stones,\r","Gazed each on other, and look'd deadly pale.\r","Which when I saw, I reprehended them;\r","And ask'd the mayor what meant this wilful silence:\r","His answer was, the people were not wont\r","To be spoke to but by the recorder.\r","Then he was urged to tell my tale again,\r","'Thus saith the duke, thus hath the duke inferr'd;'\r","But nothing spake in warrant from himself.\r","When he had done, some followers of mine own,\r","At the lower end of the hall, hurl'd up their caps,\r","And some ten voices cried 'God save King Richard!'\r","And thus I took the vantage of those few,\r","'Thanks, gentle citizens and friends,' quoth I;\r","'This general applause and loving shout\r","Argues your wisdoms and your love to Richard:'\r","And even here brake off, and came away.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","What tongueless blocks were they! would not they speak?\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","No, by my troth, my lord.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Will not the mayor then and his brethren come?\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","The mayor is here at hand: intend some fear;\r","Be not you spoke with, but by mighty suit:\r","And look you get a prayer-book in your hand,\r","And stand betwixt two churchmen, good my lord;\r","For on that ground I'll build a holy descant:\r","And be not easily won to our request:\r","Play the maid's part, still answer nay, and take it.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","I go; and if you plead as well for them\r","As I can say nay to thee for myself,\r","No doubt well bring it to a happy issue.\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","Go, go, up to the leads; the lord mayor knocks.\r","Welcome my lord; I dance attendance here;\r","I think the duke will not be spoke withal.\r","Here comes his servant: how now, Catesby,\r","What says he?\r","\r","CATESBY:\r","My lord: he doth entreat your grace;\r","To visit him to-morrow or next day:\r","He is within, with two right reverend fathers,\r","Divinely bent to meditation;\r","And no worldly suit would he be moved,\r","To draw him from his holy exercise.\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","Return, good Catesby, to thy lord again;\r","Tell him, myself, the mayor and citizens,\r","In deep designs and matters of great moment,\r","No less importing than our general good,\r","Are come to have some conference with his grace.\r","\r","CATESBY:\r","I'll tell him what you say, my lord.\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","Ah, ha, my lord, this prince is not an Edward!\r","He is not lolling on a lewd day-bed,\r","But on his knees at meditation;\r","Not dallying with a brace of courtezans,\r","But meditating with two deep divines;\r","Not sleeping, to engross his idle body,\r","But praying, to enrich his watchful soul:\r","Happy were England, would this gracious prince\r","Take on himself the sovereignty thereof:\r","But, sure, I fear, we shall ne'er win him to it.\r","\r","Lord Mayor:\r","Marry, God forbid his grace should say us nay!\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","I fear he will.\r","How now, Catesby, what says your lord?\r","\r","CATESBY:\r","My lord,\r","He wonders to what end you have assembled\r","Such troops of citizens to speak with him,\r","His grace not being warn'd thereof before:\r","My lord, he fears you mean no good to him.\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","Sorry I am my noble cousin should\r","Suspect me, that I mean no good to him:\r","By heaven, I come in perfect love to him;\r","And so once more return and tell his grace.\r","When holy and devout religious men\r","Are at their beads, 'tis hard to draw them thence,\r","So sweet is zealous contemplation.\r","\r","Lord Mayor:\r","See, where he stands between two clergymen!\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","Two props of virtue for a Christian prince,\r","To stay him from the fall of vanity:\r","And, see, a book of prayer in his hand,\r","True ornaments to know a holy man.\r","Famous Plantagenet, most gracious prince,\r","Lend favourable ears to our request;\r","And pardon us the interruption\r","Of thy devotion and right Christian zeal.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","My lord, there needs no such apology:\r","I rather do beseech you pardon me,\r","Who, earnest in the service of my God,\r","Neglect the visitation of my friends.\r","But, leaving this, what is your grace's pleasure?\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","Even that, I hope, which pleaseth God above,\r","And all good men of this ungovern'd isle.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","I do suspect I have done some offence\r","That seems disgracious in the city's eyes,\r","And that you come to reprehend my ignorance.\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","You have, my lord: would it might please your grace,\r","At our entreaties, to amend that fault!\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Else wherefore breathe I in a Christian land?\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","Then know, it is your fault that you resign\r","The supreme seat, the throne majestical,\r","The scepter'd office of your ancestors,\r","Your state of fortune and your due of birth,\r","The lineal glory of your royal house,\r","To the corruption of a blemished stock:\r","Whilst, in the mildness of your sleepy thoughts,\r","Which here we waken to our country's good,\r","This noble isle doth want her proper limbs;\r","Her face defaced with scars of infamy,\r","Her royal stock graft with ignoble plants,\r","And almost shoulder'd in the swallowing gulf\r","Of blind forgetfulness and dark oblivion.\r","Which to recure, we heartily solicit\r","Your gracious self to take on you the charge\r","And kingly government of this your land,\r","Not as protector, steward, substitute,\r","Or lowly factor for another's gain;\r","But as successively from blood to blood,\r","Your right of birth, your empery, your own.\r","For this, consorted with the citizens,\r","Your very worshipful and loving friends,\r","And by their vehement instigation,\r","In this just suit come I to move your grace.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","I know not whether to depart in silence,\r","Or bitterly to speak in your reproof.\r","Best fitteth my degree or your condition\r","If not to answer, you might haply think\r","Tongue-tied ambition, not replying, yielded\r","To bear the golden yoke of sovereignty,\r","Which fondly you would here impose on me;\r","If to reprove you for this suit of yours,\r","So season'd with your faithful love to me.\r","Then, on the other side, I cheque'd my friends.\r","Therefore, to speak, and to avoid the first,\r","And then, in speaking, not to incur the last,\r","Definitively thus I answer you.\r","Your love deserves my thanks; but my desert\r","Unmeritable shuns your high request.\r","First if all obstacles were cut away,\r","And that my path were even to the crown,\r","As my ripe revenue and due by birth\r","Yet so much is my poverty of spirit,\r","So mighty and so many my defects,\r","As I had rather hide me from my greatness,\r","Being a bark to brook no mighty sea,\r","Than in my greatness covet to be hid,\r","And in the vapour of my glory smother'd.\r","But, God be thank'd, there's no need of me,\r","And much I need to help you, if need were;\r","The royal tree hath left us royal fruit,\r","Which, mellow'd by the stealing hours of time,\r","Will well become the seat of majesty,\r","And make, no doubt, us happy by his reign.\r","On him I lay what you would lay on me,\r","The right and fortune of his happy stars;\r","Which God defend that I should wring from him!\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","My lord, this argues conscience in your grace;\r","But the respects thereof are nice and trivial,\r","All circumstances well considered.\r","You say that Edward is your brother's son:\r","So say we too, but not by Edward's wife;\r","For first he was contract to Lady Lucy--\r","Your mother lives a witness to that vow--\r","And afterward by substitute betroth'd\r","To Bona, sister to the King of France.\r","These both put by a poor petitioner,\r","A care-crazed mother of a many children,\r","A beauty-waning and distressed widow,\r","Even in the afternoon of her best days,\r","Made prize and purchase of his lustful eye,\r","Seduced the pitch and height of all his thoughts\r","To base declension and loathed bigamy\r","By her, in his unlawful bed, he got\r","This Edward, whom our manners term the prince.\r","More bitterly could I expostulate,\r","Save that, for reverence to some alive,\r","I give a sparing limit to my tongue.\r","Then, good my lord, take to your royal self\r","This proffer'd benefit of dignity;\r","If non to bless us and the land withal,\r","Yet to draw forth your noble ancestry\r","From the corruption of abusing times,\r","Unto a lineal true-derived course.\r","\r","Lord Mayor:\r","Do, good my lord, your citizens entreat you.\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","Refuse not, mighty lord, this proffer'd love.\r","\r","CATESBY:\r","O, make them joyful, grant their lawful suit!\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Alas, why would you heap these cares on me?\r","I am unfit for state and majesty;\r","I do beseech you, take it not amiss;\r","I cannot nor I will not yield to you.\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","If you refuse it,--as, in love and zeal,\r","Loath to depose the child, Your brother's son;\r","As well we know your tenderness of heart\r","And gentle, kind, effeminate remorse,\r","Which we have noted in you to your kin,\r","And egally indeed to all estates,--\r","Yet whether you accept our suit or no,\r","Your brother's son shall never reign our king;\r","But we will plant some other in the throne,\r","To the disgrace and downfall of your house:\r","And in this resolution here we leave you.--\r","Come, citizens: 'zounds! I'll entreat no more.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","O, do not swear, my lord of Buckingham.\r","\r","CATESBY:\r","Call them again, my lord, and accept their suit.\r","\r","ANOTHER:\r","Do, good my lord, lest all the land do rue it.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Would you enforce me to a world of care?\r","Well, call them again. I am not made of stone,\r","But penetrable to your. kind entreats,\r","Albeit against my conscience and my soul.\r","Cousin of Buckingham, and you sage, grave men,\r","Since you will buckle fortune on my back,\r","To bear her burthen, whether I will or no,\r","I must have patience to endure the load:\r","But if black scandal or foul-faced reproach\r","Attend the sequel of your imposition,\r","Your mere enforcement shall acquittance me\r","From all the impure blots and stains thereof;\r","For God he knows, and you may partly see,\r","How far I am from the desire thereof.\r","\r","Lord Mayor:\r","God bless your grace! we see it, and will say it.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","In saying so, you shall but say the truth.\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","Then I salute you with this kingly title:\r","Long live Richard, England's royal king!\r","\r","Lord Mayor:\r","Amen.\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","To-morrow will it please you to be crown'd?\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Even when you please, since you will have it so.\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","To-morrow, then, we will attend your grace:\r","And so most joyfully we take our leave.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Come, let us to our holy task again.\r","Farewell, good cousin; farewell, gentle friends.\r","\r","DUCHESS OF YORK:\r","Who meets us here?  my niece Plantagenet\r","Led in the hand of her kind aunt of Gloucester?\r","Now, for my life, she's wandering to the Tower,\r","On pure heart's love to greet the tender princes.\r","Daughter, well met.\r","\r","LADY ANNE:\r","God give your graces both\r","A happy and a joyful time of day!\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","As much to you, good sister! Whither away?\r","\r","LADY ANNE:\r","No farther than the Tower; and, as I guess,\r","Upon the like devotion as yourselves,\r","To gratulate the gentle princes there.\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","Kind sister, thanks: we'll enter all together.\r","And, in good time, here the lieutenant comes.\r","Master lieutenant, pray you, by your leave,\r","How doth the prince, and my young son of York?\r","\r","BRAKENBURY:\r","Right well, dear madam. By your patience,\r","I may not suffer you to visit them;\r","The king hath straitly charged the contrary.\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","The king! why, who's that?\r","\r","BRAKENBURY:\r","I cry you mercy: I mean the lord protector.\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","The Lord protect him from that kingly title!\r","Hath he set bounds betwixt their love and me?\r","I am their mother; who should keep me from them?\r","\r","DUCHESS OF YORK:\r","I am their fathers mother; I will see them.\r","\r","LADY ANNE:\r","Their aunt I am in law, in love their mother:\r","Then bring me to their sights; I'll bear thy blame\r","And take thy office from thee, on my peril.\r","\r","BRAKENBURY:\r","No, madam, no; I may not leave it so:\r","I am bound by oath, and therefore pardon me.\r","\r","LORD STANLEY:\r","Let me but meet you, ladies, one hour hence,\r","And I'll salute your grace of York as mother,\r","And reverend looker on, of two fair queens.\r","Come, madam, you must straight to Westminster,\r","There to be crowned Richard's royal queen.\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","O, cut my lace in sunder, that my pent heart\r","May have some scope to beat, or else I swoon\r","With this dead-killing news!\r","\r","LADY ANNE:\r","Despiteful tidings! O unpleasing news!\r","\r","DORSET:\r","Be of good cheer: mother, how fares your grace?\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","O Dorset, speak not to me, get thee hence!\r","Death and destruction dog thee at the heels;\r","Thy mother's name is ominous to children.\r","If thou wilt outstrip death, go cross the seas,\r","And live with Richmond, from the reach of hell\r","Go, hie thee, hie thee from this slaughter-house,\r","Lest thou increase the number of the dead;\r","And make me die the thrall of Margaret's curse,\r","Nor mother, wife, nor England's counted queen.\r","\r","LORD STANLEY:\r","Full of wise care is this your counsel, madam.\r","Take all the swift advantage of the hours;\r","You shall have letters from me to my son\r","To meet you on the way, and welcome you.\r","Be not ta'en tardy by unwise delay.\r","\r","DUCHESS OF YORK:\r","O ill-dispersing wind of misery!\r","O my accursed womb, the bed of death!\r","A cockatrice hast thou hatch'd to the world,\r","Whose unavoided eye is murderous.\r","\r","LORD STANLEY:\r","Come, madam, come; I in all haste was sent.\r","\r","LADY ANNE:\r","And I in all unwillingness will go.\r","I would to God that the inclusive verge\r","Of golden metal that must round my brow\r","Were red-hot steel, to sear me to the brain!\r","Anointed let me be with deadly venom,\r","And die, ere men can say, God save the queen!\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","Go, go, poor soul, I envy not thy glory\r","To feed my humour, wish thyself no harm.\r","\r","LADY ANNE:\r","No! why?  When he that is my husband now\r","Came to me, as I follow'd Henry's corse,\r","When scarce the blood was well wash'd from his hands\r","Which issued from my other angel husband\r","And that dead saint which then I weeping follow'd;\r","O, when, I say, I look'd on Richard's face,\r","This was my wish: 'Be thou,' quoth I, ' accursed,\r","For making me, so young, so old a widow!\r","And, when thou wed'st, let sorrow haunt thy bed;\r","And be thy wife--if any be so mad--\r","As miserable by the life of thee\r","As thou hast made me by my dear lord's death!\r","Lo, ere I can repeat this curse again,\r","Even in so short a space, my woman's heart\r","Grossly grew captive to his honey words\r","And proved the subject of my own soul's curse,\r","Which ever since hath kept my eyes from rest;\r","For never yet one hour in his bed\r","Have I enjoy'd the golden dew of sleep,\r","But have been waked by his timorous dreams.\r","Besides, he hates me for my father Warwick;\r","And will, no doubt, shortly be rid of me.\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","Poor heart, adieu! I pity thy complaining.\r","\r","LADY ANNE:\r","No more than from my soul I mourn for yours.\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","Farewell, thou woful welcomer of glory!\r","\r","LADY ANNE:\r","Adieu, poor soul, that takest thy leave of it!\r","\r","DUCHESS OF YORK:\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","Stay, yet look back with me unto the Tower.\r","Pity, you ancient stones, those tender babes\r","Whom envy hath immured within your walls!\r","Rough cradle for such little pretty ones!\r","Rude ragged nurse, old sullen playfellow\r","For tender princes, use my babies well!\r","So foolish sorrow bids your stones farewell.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Stand all apart Cousin of Buckingham!\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","My gracious sovereign?\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Give me thy hand.\r","Thus high, by thy advice\r","And thy assistance, is King Richard seated;\r","But shall we wear these honours for a day?\r","Or shall they last, and we rejoice in them?\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","Still live they and for ever may they last!\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","O Buckingham, now do I play the touch,\r","To try if thou be current gold indeed\r","Young Edward lives: think now what I would say.\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","Say on, my loving lord.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Why, Buckingham, I say, I would be king,\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","Why, so you are, my thrice renowned liege.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Ha! am I king? 'tis so: but Edward lives.\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","True, noble prince.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","O bitter consequence,\r","That Edward still should live! 'True, noble prince!'\r","Cousin, thou wert not wont to be so dull:\r","Shall I be plain? I wish the bastards dead;\r","And I would have it suddenly perform'd.\r","What sayest thou? speak suddenly; be brief.\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","Your grace may do your pleasure.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Tut, tut, thou art all ice, thy kindness freezeth:\r","Say, have I thy consent that they shall die?\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","Give me some breath, some little pause, my lord\r","Before I positively herein:\r","I will resolve your grace immediately.\r","\r","CATESBY:\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","I will converse with iron-witted fools\r","And unrespective boys: none are for me\r","That look into me with considerate eyes:\r","High-reaching Buckingham grows circumspect.\r","Boy!\r","\r","Page:\r","My lord?\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Know'st thou not any whom corrupting gold\r","Would tempt unto a close exploit of death?\r","\r","Page:\r","My lord, I know a discontented gentleman,\r","Whose humble means match not his haughty mind:\r","Gold were as good as twenty orators,\r","And will, no doubt, tempt him to any thing.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","What is his name?\r","\r","Page:\r","His name, my lord, is Tyrrel.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","I partly know the man: go, call him hither.\r","The deep-revolving witty Buckingham\r","No more shall be the neighbour to my counsel:\r","Hath he so long held out with me untired,\r","And stops he now for breath?\r","How now! what news with you?\r","\r","STANLEY:\r","My lord, I hear the Marquis Dorset's fled\r","To Richmond, in those parts beyond the sea\r","Where he abides.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Catesby!\r","\r","CATESBY:\r","My lord?\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Rumour it abroad\r","That Anne, my wife, is sick and like to die:\r","I will take order for her keeping close.\r","Inquire me out some mean-born gentleman,\r","Whom I will marry straight to Clarence' daughter:\r","The boy is foolish, and I fear not him.\r","Look, how thou dream'st! I say again, give out\r","That Anne my wife is sick and like to die:\r","About it; for it stands me much upon,\r","To stop all hopes whose growth may damage me.\r","I must be married to my brother's daughter,\r","Or else my kingdom stands on brittle glass.\r","Murder her brothers, and then marry her!\r","Uncertain way of gain! But I am in\r","So far in blood that sin will pluck on sin:\r","Tear-falling pity dwells not in this eye.\r","Is thy name Tyrrel?\r","\r","TYRREL:\r","James Tyrrel, and your most obedient subject.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Art thou, indeed?\r","\r","TYRREL:\r","Prove me, my gracious sovereign.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Darest thou resolve to kill a friend of mine?\r","\r","TYRREL:\r","Ay, my lord;\r","But I had rather kill two enemies.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Why, there thou hast it: two deep enemies,\r","Foes to my rest and my sweet sleep's disturbers\r","Are they that I would have thee deal upon:\r","Tyrrel, I mean those bastards in the Tower.\r","\r","TYRREL:\r","Let me have open means to come to them,\r","And soon I'll rid you from the fear of them.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Thou sing'st sweet music. Hark, come hither, Tyrrel\r","Go, by this token: rise, and lend thine ear:\r","There is no more but so: say it is done,\r","And I will love thee, and prefer thee too.\r","\r","TYRREL:\r","'Tis done, my gracious lord.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Shall we hear from thee, Tyrrel, ere we sleep?\r","\r","TYRREL:\r","Ye shall, my Lord.\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","My Lord, I have consider'd in my mind\r","The late demand that you did sound me in.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Well, let that pass. Dorset is fled to Richmond.\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","I hear that news, my lord.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Stanley, he is your wife's son well, look to it.\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","My lord, I claim your gift, my due by promise,\r","For which your honour and your faith is pawn'd;\r","The earldom of Hereford and the moveables\r","The which you promised I should possess.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Stanley, look to your wife; if she convey\r","Letters to Richmond, you shall answer it.\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","What says your highness to my just demand?\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","As I remember, Henry the Sixth\r","Did prophesy that Richmond should be king,\r","When Richmond was a little peevish boy.\r","A king, perhaps, perhaps,--\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","My lord!\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","How chance the prophet could not at that time\r","Have told me, I being by, that I should kill him?\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","My lord, your promise for the earldom,--\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Richmond! When last I was at Exeter,\r","The mayor in courtesy show'd me the castle,\r","And call'd it Rougemont: at which name I started,\r","Because a bard of Ireland told me once\r","I should not live long after I saw Richmond.\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","My Lord!\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Ay, what's o'clock?\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","I am thus bold to put your grace in mind\r","Of what you promised me.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Well, but what's o'clock?\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","Upon the stroke of ten.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Well, let it strike.\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","Why let it strike?\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Because that, like a Jack, thou keep'st the stroke\r","Betwixt thy begging and my meditation.\r","I am not in the giving vein to-day.\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","Why, then resolve me whether you will or no.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Tut, tut,\r","Thou troublest me; am not in the vein.\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","Is it even so? rewards he my true service\r","With such deep contempt made I him king for this?\r","O, let me think on Hastings, and be gone\r","To Brecknock, while my fearful head is on!\r","\r","TYRREL:\r","The tyrannous and bloody deed is done.\r","The most arch of piteous massacre\r","That ever yet this land was guilty of.\r","Dighton and Forrest, whom I did suborn\r","To do this ruthless piece of butchery,\r","Although they were flesh'd villains, bloody dogs,\r","Melting with tenderness and kind compassion\r","Wept like two children in their deaths' sad stories.\r","'Lo, thus' quoth Dighton, 'lay those tender babes:'\r","'Thus, thus,' quoth Forrest, 'girdling one another\r","Within their innocent alabaster arms:\r","Their lips were four red roses on a stalk,\r","Which in their summer beauty kiss'd each other.\r","A book of prayers on their pillow lay;\r","Which once,' quoth Forrest, 'almost changed my mind;\r","But O! the devil'--there the villain stopp'd\r","Whilst Dighton thus told on: 'We smothered\r","The most replenished sweet work of nature,\r","That from the prime creation e'er she framed.'\r","Thus both are gone with conscience and remorse;\r","They could not speak; and so I left them both,\r","To bring this tidings to the bloody king.\r","And here he comes.\r","All hail, my sovereign liege!\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Kind Tyrrel, am I happy in thy news?\r","\r","TYRREL:\r","If to have done the thing you gave in charge\r","Beget your happiness, be happy then,\r","For it is done, my lord.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","But didst thou see them dead?\r","\r","TYRREL:\r","I did, my lord.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","And buried, gentle Tyrrel?\r","\r","TYRREL:\r","The chaplain of the Tower hath buried them;\r","But how or in what place I do not know.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Come to me, Tyrrel, soon at after supper,\r","And thou shalt tell the process of their death.\r","Meantime, but think how I may do thee good,\r","And be inheritor of thy desire.\r","Farewell till soon.\r","The son of Clarence have I pent up close;\r","His daughter meanly have I match'd in marriage;\r","The sons of Edward sleep in Abraham's bosom,\r","And Anne my wife hath bid the world good night.\r","Now, for I know the Breton Richmond aims\r","At young Elizabeth, my brother's daughter,\r","And, by that knot, looks proudly o'er the crown,\r","To her I go, a jolly thriving wooer.\r","\r","CATESBY:\r","My lord!\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Good news or bad, that thou comest in so bluntly?\r","\r","CATESBY:\r","Bad news, my lord: Ely is fled to Richmond;\r","And Buckingham, back'd with the hardy Welshmen,\r","Is in the field, and still his power increaseth.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Ely with Richmond troubles me more near\r","Than Buckingham and his rash-levied army.\r","Come, I have heard that fearful commenting\r","Is leaden servitor to dull delay;\r","Delay leads impotent and snail-paced beggary\r","Then fiery expedition be my wing,\r","Jove's Mercury, and herald for a king!\r","Come, muster men: my counsel is my shield;\r","We must be brief when traitors brave the field.\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","So, now prosperity begins to mellow\r","And drop into the rotten mouth of death.\r","Here in these confines slily have I lurk'd,\r","To watch the waning of mine adversaries.\r","A dire induction am I witness to,\r","And will to France, hoping the consequence\r","Will prove as bitter, black, and tragical.\r","Withdraw thee, wretched Margaret: who comes here?\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","Ah, my young princes! ah, my tender babes!\r","My unblown flowers, new-appearing sweets!\r","If yet your gentle souls fly in the air\r","And be not fix'd in doom perpetual,\r","Hover about me with your airy wings\r","And hear your mother's lamentation!\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","Hover about her; say, that right for right\r","Hath dimm'd your infant morn to aged night.\r","\r","DUCHESS OF YORK:\r","So many miseries have crazed my voice,\r","That my woe-wearied tongue is mute and dumb,\r","Edward Plantagenet, why art thou dead?\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","Plantagenet doth quit Plantagenet.\r","Edward for Edward pays a dying debt.\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","Wilt thou, O God, fly from such gentle lambs,\r","And throw them in the entrails of the wolf?\r","When didst thou sleep when such a deed was done?\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","When holy Harry died, and my sweet son.\r","\r","DUCHESS OF YORK:\r","Blind sight, dead life, poor mortal living ghost,\r","Woe's scene, world's shame, grave's due by life usurp'd,\r","Brief abstract and record of tedious days,\r","Rest thy unrest on England's lawful earth,\r","Unlawfully made drunk with innocents' blood!\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","O, that thou wouldst as well afford a grave\r","As thou canst yield a melancholy seat!\r","Then would I hide my bones, not rest them here.\r","O, who hath any cause to mourn but I?\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","If ancient sorrow be most reverend,\r","Give mine the benefit of seniory,\r","And let my woes frown on the upper hand.\r","If sorrow can admit society,\r","Tell o'er your woes again by viewing mine:\r","I had an Edward, till a Richard kill'd him;\r","I had a Harry, till a Richard kill'd him:\r","Thou hadst an Edward, till a Richard kill'd him;\r","Thou hadst a Richard, till a Richard killed him;\r","\r","DUCHESS OF YORK:\r","I had a Richard too, and thou didst kill him;\r","I had a Rutland too, thou holp'st to kill him.\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","Thou hadst a Clarence too, and Richard kill'd him.\r","From forth the kennel of thy womb hath crept\r","A hell-hound that doth hunt us all to death:\r","That dog, that had his teeth before his eyes,\r","To worry lambs and lap their gentle blood,\r","That foul defacer of God's handiwork,\r","That excellent grand tyrant of the earth,\r","That reigns in galled eyes of weeping souls,\r","Thy womb let loose, to chase us to our graves.\r","O upright, just, and true-disposing God,\r","How do I thank thee, that this carnal cur\r","Preys on the issue of his mother's body,\r","And makes her pew-fellow with others' moan!\r","\r","DUCHESS OF YORK:\r","O Harry's wife, triumph not in my woes!\r","God witness with me, I have wept for thine.\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","Bear with me; I am hungry for revenge,\r","And now I cloy me with beholding it.\r","Thy Edward he is dead, that stabb'd my Edward:\r","Thy other Edward dead, to quit my Edward;\r","Young York he is but boot, because both they\r","Match not the high perfection of my loss:\r","Thy Clarence he is dead that kill'd my Edward;\r","And the beholders of this tragic play,\r","The adulterate Hastings, Rivers, Vaughan, Grey,\r","Untimely smother'd in their dusky graves.\r","Richard yet lives, hell's black intelligencer,\r","Only reserved their factor, to buy souls\r","And send them thither: but at hand, at hand,\r","Ensues his piteous and unpitied end:\r","Earth gapes, hell burns, fiends roar, saints pray.\r","To have him suddenly convey'd away.\r","Cancel his bond of life, dear
