God, I prey,\r","That I may live to say, The dog is dead!\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","O, thou didst prophesy the time would come\r","That I should wish for thee to help me curse\r","That bottled spider, that foul bunch-back'd toad!\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","I call'd thee then vain flourish of my fortune;\r","I call'd thee then poor shadow, painted queen;\r","The presentation of but what I was;\r","The flattering index of a direful pageant;\r","One heaved a-high, to be hurl'd down below;\r","A mother only mock'd with two sweet babes;\r","A dream of what thou wert, a breath, a bubble,\r","A sign of dignity, a garish flag,\r","To be the aim of every dangerous shot,\r","A queen in jest, only to fill the scene.\r","Where is thy husband now? where be thy brothers?\r","Where are thy children? wherein dost thou, joy?\r","Who sues to thee and cries 'God save the queen'?\r","Where be the bending peers that flatter'd thee?\r","Where be the thronging troops that follow'd thee?\r","Decline all this, and see what now thou art:\r","For happy wife, a most distressed widow;\r","For joyful mother, one that wails the name;\r","For queen, a very caitiff crown'd with care;\r","For one being sued to, one that humbly sues;\r","For one that scorn'd at me, now scorn'd of me;\r","For one being fear'd of all, now fearing one;\r","For one commanding all, obey'd of none.\r","Thus hath the course of justice wheel'd about,\r","And left thee but a very prey to time;\r","Having no more but thought of what thou wert,\r","To torture thee the more, being what thou art.\r","Thou didst usurp my place, and dost thou not\r","Usurp the just proportion of my sorrow?\r","Now thy proud neck bears half my burthen'd yoke;\r","From which even here I slip my weary neck,\r","And leave the burthen of it all on thee.\r","Farewell, York's wife, and queen of sad mischance:\r","These English woes will make me smile in France.\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","O thou well skill'd in curses, stay awhile,\r","And teach me how to curse mine enemies!\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","Forbear to sleep the nights, and fast the days;\r","Compare dead happiness with living woe;\r","Think that thy babes were fairer than they were,\r","And he that slew them fouler than he is:\r","Bettering thy loss makes the bad causer worse:\r","Revolving this will teach thee how to curse.\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","My words are dull; O, quicken them with thine!\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","Thy woes will make them sharp, and pierce like mine.\r","\r","DUCHESS OF YORK:\r","Why should calamity be full of words?\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","Windy attorneys to their client woes,\r","Airy succeeders of intestate joys,\r","Poor breathing orators of miseries!\r","Let them have scope: though what they do impart\r","Help not all, yet do they ease the heart.\r","\r","DUCHESS OF YORK:\r","If so, then be not tongue-tied: go with me.\r","And in the breath of bitter words let's smother\r","My damned son, which thy two sweet sons smother'd.\r","I hear his drum: be copious in exclaims.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Who intercepts my expedition?\r","\r","DUCHESS OF YORK:\r","O, she that might have intercepted thee,\r","By strangling thee in her accursed womb\r","From all the slaughters, wretch, that thou hast done!\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","Hidest thou that forehead with a golden crown,\r","Where should be graven, if that right were right,\r","The slaughter of the prince that owed that crown,\r","And the dire death of my two sons and brothers?\r","Tell me, thou villain slave, where are my children?\r","\r","DUCHESS OF YORK:\r","Thou toad, thou toad, where is thy brother Clarence?\r","And little Ned Plantagenet, his son?\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","Where is kind Hastings, Rivers, Vaughan, Grey?\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","A flourish, trumpets! strike alarum, drums!\r","Let not the heavens hear these tell-tale women\r","Rail on the Lord's enointed: strike, I say!\r","Either be patient, and entreat me fair,\r","Or with the clamorous report of war\r","Thus will I drown your exclamations.\r","\r","DUCHESS OF YORK:\r","Art thou my son?\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Ay, I thank God, my father, and yourself.\r","\r","DUCHESS OF YORK:\r","Then patiently hear my impatience.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Madam, I have a touch of your condition,\r","Which cannot brook the accent of reproof.\r","\r","DUCHESS OF YORK:\r","O, let me speak!\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Do then: but I'll not hear.\r","\r","DUCHESS OF YORK:\r","I will be mild and gentle in my speech.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","And brief, good mother; for I am in haste.\r","\r","DUCHESS OF YORK:\r","Art thou so hasty? I have stay'd for thee,\r","God knows, in anguish, pain and agony.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","And came I not at last to comfort you?\r","\r","DUCHESS OF YORK:\r","No, by the holy rood, thou know'st it well,\r","Thou camest on earth to make the earth my hell.\r","A grievous burthen was thy birth to me;\r","Tetchy and wayward was thy infancy;\r","Thy school-days frightful, desperate, wild, and furious,\r","Thy prime of manhood daring, bold, and venturous,\r","Thy age confirm'd, proud, subdued, bloody,\r","treacherous,\r","More mild, but yet more harmful, kind in hatred:\r","What comfortable hour canst thou name,\r","That ever graced me in thy company?\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Faith, none, but Humphrey Hour, that call'd\r","your grace\r","To breakfast once forth of my company.\r","If I be so disgracious in your sight,\r","Let me march on, and not offend your grace.\r","Strike the drum.\r","\r","DUCHESS OF YORK:\r","I prithee, hear me speak.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","You speak too bitterly.\r","\r","DUCHESS OF YORK:\r","Hear me a word;\r","For I shall never speak to thee again.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","So.\r","\r","DUCHESS OF YORK:\r","Either thou wilt die, by God's just ordinance,\r","Ere from this war thou turn a conqueror,\r","Or I with grief and extreme age shall perish\r","And never look upon thy face again.\r","Therefore take with thee my most heavy curse;\r","Which, in the day of battle, tire thee more\r","Than all the complete armour that thou wear'st!\r","My prayers on the adverse party fight;\r","And there the little souls of Edward's children\r","Whisper the spirits of thine enemies\r","And promise them success and victory.\r","Bloody thou art, bloody will be thy end;\r","Shame serves thy life and doth thy death attend.\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","Though far more cause, yet much less spirit to curse\r","Abides in me; I say amen to all.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Stay, madam; I must speak a word with you.\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","I have no more sons of the royal blood\r","For thee to murder: for my daughters, Richard,\r","They shall be praying nuns, not weeping queens;\r","And therefore level not to hit their lives.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","You have a daughter call'd Elizabeth,\r","Virtuous and fair, royal and gracious.\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","And must she die for this? O, let her live,\r","And I'll corrupt her manners, stain her beauty;\r","Slander myself as false to Edward's bed;\r","Throw over her the veil of infamy:\r","So she may live unscarr'd of bleeding slaughter,\r","I will confess she was not Edward's daughter.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Wrong not her birth, she is of royal blood.\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","To save her life, I'll say she is not so.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Her life is only safest in her birth.\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","And only in that safety died her brothers.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Lo, at their births good stars were opposite.\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","No, to their lives bad friends were contrary.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","All unavoided is the doom of destiny.\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","True, when avoided grace makes destiny:\r","My babes were destined to a fairer death,\r","If grace had bless'd thee with a fairer life.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","You speak as if that I had slain my cousins.\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","Cousins, indeed; and by their uncle cozen'd\r","Of comfort, kingdom, kindred, freedom, life.\r","Whose hand soever lanced their tender hearts,\r","Thy head, all indirectly, gave direction:\r","No doubt the murderous knife was dull and blunt\r","Till it was whetted on thy stone-hard heart,\r","To revel in the entrails of my lambs.\r","But that still use of grief makes wild grief tame,\r","My tongue should to thy ears not name my boys\r","Till that my nails were anchor'd in thine eyes;\r","And I, in such a desperate bay of death,\r","Like a poor bark, of sails and tackling reft,\r","Rush all to pieces on thy rocky bosom.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Madam, so thrive I in my enterprise\r","And dangerous success of bloody wars,\r","As I intend more good to you and yours,\r","Than ever you or yours were by me wrong'd!\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","What good is cover'd with the face of heaven,\r","To be discover'd, that can do me good?\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","The advancement of your children, gentle lady.\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","Up to some scaffold, there to lose their heads?\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","No, to the dignity and height of honour\r","The high imperial type of this earth's glory.\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","Flatter my sorrows with report of it;\r","Tell me what state, what dignity, what honour,\r","Canst thou demise to any child of mine?\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Even all I have; yea, and myself and all,\r","Will I withal endow a child of thine;\r","So in the Lethe of thy angry soul\r","Thou drown the sad remembrance of those wrongs\r","Which thou supposest I have done to thee.\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","Be brief, lest that be process of thy kindness\r","Last longer telling than thy kindness' date.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Then know, that from my soul I love thy daughter.\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","My daughter's mother thinks it with her soul.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","What do you think?\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","That thou dost love my daughter from thy soul:\r","So from thy soul's love didst thou love her brothers;\r","And from my heart's love I do thank thee for it.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Be not so hasty to confound my meaning:\r","I mean, that with my soul I love thy daughter,\r","And mean to make her queen of England.\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","Say then, who dost thou mean shall be her king?\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Even he that makes her queen who should be else?\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","What, thou?\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","I, even I: what think you of it, madam?\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","How canst thou woo her?\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","That would I learn of you,\r","As one that are best acquainted with her humour.\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","And wilt thou learn of me?\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Madam, with all my heart.\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","Send to her, by the man that slew her brothers,\r","A pair of bleeding-hearts; thereon engrave\r","Edward and York; then haply she will weep:\r","Therefore present to her--as sometime Margaret\r","Did to thy father, steep'd in Rutland's blood,--\r","A handkerchief; which, say to her, did drain\r","The purple sap from her sweet brother's body\r","And bid her dry her weeping eyes therewith.\r","If this inducement force her not to love,\r","Send her a story of thy noble acts;\r","Tell her thou madest away her uncle Clarence,\r","Her uncle Rivers; yea, and, for her sake,\r","Madest quick conveyance with her good aunt Anne.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Come, come, you mock me; this is not the way\r","To win our daughter.\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","There is no other way\r","Unless thou couldst put on some other shape,\r","And not be Richard that hath done all this.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Say that I did all this for love of her.\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","Nay, then indeed she cannot choose but hate thee,\r","Having bought love with such a bloody spoil.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Look, what is done cannot be now amended:\r","Men shall deal unadvisedly sometimes,\r","Which after hours give leisure to repent.\r","If I did take the kingdom from your sons,\r","To make amends, Ill give it to your daughter.\r","If I have kill'd the issue of your womb,\r","To quicken your increase, I will beget\r","Mine issue of your blood upon your daughter\r","A grandam's name is little less in love\r","Than is the doting title of a mother;\r","They are as children but one step below,\r","Even of your mettle, of your very blood;\r","Of an one pain, save for a night of groans\r","Endured of her, for whom you bid like sorrow.\r","Your children were vexation to your youth,\r","But mine shall be a comfort to your age.\r","The loss you have is but a son being king,\r","And by that loss your daughter is made queen.\r","I cannot make you what amends I would,\r","Therefore accept such kindness as I can.\r","Dorset your son, that with a fearful soul\r","Leads discontented steps in foreign soil,\r","This fair alliance quickly shall call home\r","To high promotions and great dignity:\r","The king, that calls your beauteous daughter wife.\r","Familiarly shall call thy Dorset brother;\r","Again shall you be mother to a king,\r","And all the ruins of distressful times\r","Repair'd with double riches of content.\r","What! we have many goodly days to see:\r","The liquid drops of tears that you have shed\r","Shall come again, transform'd to orient pearl,\r","Advantaging their loan with interest\r","Of ten times double gain of happiness.\r","Go, then my mother, to thy daughter go\r","Make bold her bashful years with your experience;\r","Prepare her ears to hear a wooer's tale\r","Put in her tender heart the aspiring flame\r","Of golden sovereignty; acquaint the princess\r","With the sweet silent hours of marriage joys\r","And when this arm of mine hath chastised\r","The petty rebel, dull-brain'd Buckingham,\r","Bound with triumphant garlands will I come\r","And lead thy daughter to a conqueror's bed;\r","To whom I will retail my conquest won,\r","And she shall be sole victress, Caesar's Caesar.\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","What were I best to say? her father's brother\r","Would be her lord? or shall I say, her uncle?\r","Or, he that slew her brothers and her uncles?\r","Under what title shall I woo for thee,\r","That God, the law, my honour and her love,\r","Can make seem pleasing to her tender years?\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Infer fair England's peace by this alliance.\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","Which she shall purchase with still lasting war.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Say that the king, which may command, entreats.\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","That at her hands which the king's King forbids.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Say, she shall be a high and mighty queen.\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","To wail the tide, as her mother doth.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Say, I will love her everlastingly.\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","But how long shall that title 'ever' last?\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Sweetly in force unto her fair life's end.\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","But how long fairly shall her sweet lie last?\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","So long as heaven and nature lengthens it.\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","So long as hell and Richard likes of it.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Say, I, her sovereign, am her subject love.\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","But she, your subject, loathes such sovereignty.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Be eloquent in my behalf to her.\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","An honest tale speeds best being plainly told.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Then in plain terms tell her my loving tale.\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","Plain and not honest is too harsh a style.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Your reasons are too shallow and too quick.\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","O no, my reasons are too deep and dead;\r","Too deep and dead, poor infants, in their grave.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Harp not on that string, madam; that is past.\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","Harp on it still shall I till heart-strings break.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Now, by my George, my garter, and my crown,--\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","Profaned, dishonour'd, and the third usurp'd.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","I swear--\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","By nothing; for this is no oath:\r","The George, profaned, hath lost his holy honour;\r","The garter, blemish'd, pawn'd his knightly virtue;\r","The crown, usurp'd, disgraced his kingly glory.\r","if something thou wilt swear to be believed,\r","Swear then by something that thou hast not wrong'd.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Now, by the world--\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","'Tis full of thy foul wrongs.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","My father's death--\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","Thy life hath that dishonour'd.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Then, by myself--\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","Thyself thyself misusest.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Why then, by God--\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","God's wrong is most of all.\r","If thou hadst fear'd to break an oath by Him,\r","The unity the king thy brother made\r","Had not been broken, nor my brother slain:\r","If thou hadst fear'd to break an oath by Him,\r","The imperial metal, circling now thy brow,\r","Had graced the tender temples of my child,\r","And both the princes had been breathing here,\r","Which now, two tender playfellows to dust,\r","Thy broken faith hath made a prey for worms.\r","What canst thou swear by now?\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","The time to come.\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","That thou hast wronged in the time o'erpast;\r","For I myself have many tears to wash\r","Hereafter time, for time past wrong'd by thee.\r","The children live, whose parents thou hast\r","slaughter'd,\r","Ungovern'd youth, to wail it in their age;\r","The parents live, whose children thou hast butcher'd,\r","Old wither'd plants, to wail it with their age.\r","Swear not by time to come; for that thou hast\r","Misused ere used, by time misused o'erpast.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","As I intend to prosper and repent,\r","So thrive I in my dangerous attempt\r","Of hostile arms! myself myself confound!\r","Heaven and fortune bar me happy hours!\r","Day, yield me not thy light; nor, night, thy rest!\r","Be opposite all planets of good luck\r","To my proceedings, if, with pure heart's love,\r","Immaculate devotion, holy thoughts,\r","I tender not thy beauteous princely daughter!\r","In her consists my happiness and thine;\r","Without her, follows to this land and me,\r","To thee, herself, and many a Christian soul,\r","Death, desolation, ruin and decay:\r","It cannot be avoided but by this;\r","It will not be avoided but by this.\r","Therefore, good mother,--I must can you so--\r","Be the attorney of my love to her:\r","Plead what I will be, not what I have been;\r","Not my deserts, but what I will deserve:\r","Urge the necessity and state of times,\r","And be not peevish-fond in great designs.\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","Shall I be tempted of the devil thus?\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Ay, if the devil tempt thee to do good.\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","Shall I forget myself to be myself?\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Ay, if yourself's remembrance wrong yourself.\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","But thou didst kill my children.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","But in your daughter's womb I bury them:\r","Where in that nest of spicery they shall breed\r","Selves of themselves, to your recomforture.\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","Shall I go win my daughter to thy will?\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","And be a happy mother by the deed.\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","I go. Write to me very shortly.\r","And you shall understand from me her mind.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Bear her my true love's kiss; and so, farewell.\r","Relenting fool, and shallow, changing woman!\r","How now! what news?\r","\r","RATCLIFF:\r","My gracious sovereign, on the western coast\r","Rideth a puissant navy; to the shore\r","Throng many doubtful hollow-hearted friends,\r","Unarm'd, and unresolved to beat them back:\r","'Tis thought that Richmond is their admiral;\r","And there they hull, expecting but the aid\r","Of Buckingham to welcome them ashore.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Some light-foot friend post to the Duke of Norfolk:\r","Ratcliff, thyself, or Catesby; where is he?\r","\r","CATESBY:\r","Here, my lord.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Fly to the duke:\r","Post thou to Salisbury\r","When thou comest thither--\r","Dull, unmindful villain,\r","Why stand'st thou still, and go'st not to the duke?\r","\r","CATESBY:\r","First, mighty sovereign, let me know your mind,\r","What from your grace I shall deliver to him.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","O, true, good Catesby: bid him levy straight\r","The greatest strength and power he can make,\r","And meet me presently at Salisbury.\r","\r","CATESBY:\r","I go.\r","\r","RATCLIFF:\r","What is't your highness' pleasure I shall do at\r","Salisbury?\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Why, what wouldst thou do there before I go?\r","\r","RATCLIFF:\r","Your highness told me I should post before.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","My mind is changed, sir, my mind is changed.\r","How now, what news with you?\r","\r","STANLEY:\r","None good, my lord, to please you with the hearing;\r","Nor none so bad, but it may well be told.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Hoyday, a riddle! neither good nor bad!\r","Why dost thou run so many mile about,\r","When thou mayst tell thy tale a nearer way?\r","Once more, what news?\r","\r","STANLEY:\r","Richmond is on the seas.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","There let him sink, and be the seas on him!\r","White-liver'd runagate, what doth he there?\r","\r","STANLEY:\r","I know not, mighty sovereign, but by guess.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Well, sir, as you guess, as you guess?\r","\r","STANLEY:\r","Stirr'd up by Dorset, Buckingham, and Ely,\r","He makes for England, there to claim the crown.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Is the chair empty? is the sword unsway'd?\r","Is the king dead? the empire unpossess'd?\r","What heir of York is there alive but we?\r","And who is England's king but great York's heir?\r","Then, tell me, what doth he upon the sea?\r","\r","STANLEY:\r","Unless for that, my liege, I cannot guess.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Unless for that he comes to be your liege,\r","You cannot guess wherefore the Welshman comes.\r","Thou wilt revolt, and fly to him, I fear.\r","\r","STANLEY:\r","No, mighty liege; therefore mistrust me not.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Where is thy power, then, to beat him back?\r","Where are thy tenants and thy followers?\r","Are they not now upon the western shore.\r","Safe-conducting the rebels from their ships!\r","\r","STANLEY:\r","No, my good lord, my friends are in the north.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Cold friends to Richard: what do they in the north,\r","When they should serve their sovereign in the west?\r","\r","STANLEY:\r","They have not been commanded, mighty sovereign:\r","Please it your majesty to give me leave,\r","I'll muster up my friends, and meet your grace\r","Where and what time your majesty shall please.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Ay, ay. thou wouldst be gone to join with Richmond:\r","I will not trust you, sir.\r","\r","STANLEY:\r","Most mighty sovereign,\r","You have no cause to hold my friendship doubtful:\r","I never was nor never will be false.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Well,\r","Go muster men; but, hear you, leave behind\r","Your son, George Stanley: look your faith be firm.\r","Or else his head's assurance is but frail.\r","\r","STANLEY:\r","So deal with him as I prove true to you.\r","\r","Messenger:\r","My gracious sovereign, now in Devonshire,\r","As I by friends am well advertised,\r","Sir Edward Courtney, and the haughty prelate\r","Bishop of Exeter, his brother there,\r","With many more confederates, are in arms.\r","\r","Second Messenger:\r","My liege, in Kent the Guildfords are in arms;\r","And every hour more competitors\r","Flock to their aid, and still their power increaseth.\r","\r","Third Messenger:\r","My lord, the army of the Duke of Buckingham--\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Out on you, owls! nothing but songs of death?\r","Take that, until thou bring me better news.\r","\r","Third Messenger:\r","The news I have to tell your majesty\r","Is, that by sudden floods and fall of waters,\r","Buckingham's army is dispersed and scatter'd;\r","And he himself wander'd away alone,\r","No man knows whither.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","I cry thee mercy:\r","There is my purse to cure that blow of thine.\r","Hath any well-advised friend proclaim'd\r","Reward to him that brings the traitor in?\r","\r","Third Messenger:\r","Such proclamation hath been made, my liege.\r","\r","Fourth Messenger:\r","Sir Thomas Lovel and Lord Marquis Dorset,\r","'Tis said, my liege, in Yorkshire are in arms.\r","Yet this good comfort bring I to your grace,\r","The Breton navy is dispersed by tempest:\r","Richmond, in Yorkshire, sent out a boat\r","Unto the shore, to ask those on the banks\r","If they were his assistants, yea or no;\r","Who answer'd him, they came from Buckingham.\r","Upon his party: he, mistrusting them,\r","Hoisted sail and made away for Brittany.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","March on, march on, since we are up in arms;\r","If not to fight with foreign enemies,\r","Yet to beat down these rebels here at home.\r","\r","CATESBY:\r","My liege, the Duke of Buckingham is taken;\r","That is the best news: that the Earl of Richmond\r","Is with a mighty power landed at Milford,\r","Is colder tidings, yet they must be told.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Away towards Salisbury! while we reason here,\r","A royal battle might be won and lost\r","Some one take order Buckingham be brought\r","To Salisbury; the rest march on with me.\r","\r","DERBY:\r","Sir Christopher, tell Richmond this from me:\r","That in the sty of this most bloody boar\r","My son George Stanley is frank'd up in hold:\r","If I revolt, off goes young George's head;\r","The fear of that withholds my present aid.\r","But, tell me, where is princely Richmond now?\r","\r","CHRISTOPHER:\r","At Pembroke, or at Harford-west, in Wales.\r","\r","DERBY:\r","What men of name resort to him?\r","\r","CHRISTOPHER:\r","Sir Walter Herbert, a renowned soldier;\r","Sir Gilbert Talbot, Sir William Stanley;\r","Oxford, redoubted Pembroke, Sir James Blunt,\r","And Rice ap Thomas with a valiant crew;\r","And many more of noble fame and worth:\r","And towards London they do bend their course,\r","If by the way they be not fought withal.\r","\r","DERBY:\r","Return unto thy lord; commend me to him:\r","Tell him the queen hath heartily consented\r","He shall espouse Elizabeth her daughter.\r","These letters will resolve him of my mind. Farewell.\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","Will not King Richard let me speak with him?\r","\r","Sheriff:\r","No, my good lord; therefore be patient.\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","Hastings, and Edward's children, Rivers, Grey,\r","Holy King Henry, and thy fair son Edward,\r","Vaughan, and all that have miscarried\r","By underhand corrupted foul injustice,\r","If that your moody discontented souls\r","Do through the clouds behold this present hour,\r","Even for revenge mock my destruction!\r","This is All-Souls' day, fellows, is it not?\r","\r","Sheriff:\r","It is, my lord.\r","\r","BUCKINGHAM:\r","Why, then All-Souls' day is my body's doomsday.\r","This is the day that, in King Edward's time,\r","I wish't might fall on me, when I was found\r","False to his children or his wife's allies\r","This is the day wherein I wish'd to fall\r","By the false faith of him I trusted most;\r","This, this All-Souls' day to my fearful soul\r","Is the determined respite of my wrongs:\r","That high All-Seer that I dallied with\r","Hath turn'd my feigned prayer on my head\r","And given in earnest what I begg'd in jest.\r","Thus doth he force the swords of wicked men\r","To turn their own points on their masters' bosoms:\r","Now Margaret's curse is fallen upon my head;\r","'When he,' quoth she, 'shall split thy heart with sorrow,\r","Remember Margaret was a prophetess.'\r","Come, sirs, convey me to the block of shame;\r","Wrong hath but wrong, and blame the due of blame.\r","\r","RICHMOND:\r","Fellows in arms, and my most loving friends,\r","Bruised underneath the yoke of tyranny,\r","Thus far into the bowels of the land\r","Have we march'd on without impediment;\r","And here receive we from our father Stanley\r","Lines of fair comfort and encouragement.\r","The wretched, bloody, and usurping boar,\r","That spoil'd your summer fields and fruitful vines,\r","Swills your warm blood like wash, and makes his trough\r","In your embowell'd bosoms, this foul swine\r","Lies now even in the centre of this isle,\r","Near to the town of Leicester, as we learn\r","From Tamworth thither is but one day's march.\r","In God's name, cheerly on, courageous friends,\r","To reap the harvest of perpetual peace\r","By this one bloody trial of sharp war.\r","\r","OXFORD:\r","Every man's conscience is a thousand swords,\r","To fight against that bloody homicide.\r","\r","HERBERT:\r","I doubt not but his friends will fly to us.\r","\r","BLUNT:\r","He hath no friends but who are friends for fear.\r","Which in his greatest need will shrink from him.\r","\r","RICHMOND:\r","All for our vantage. Then, in God's name, march:\r","True hope is swift, and flies with swallow's wings:\r","Kings it makes gods, and meaner creatures kings.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Here pitch our tents, even here in Bosworth field.\r","My Lord of Surrey, why look you so sad?\r","\r","SURREY:\r","My heart is ten times lighter than my looks.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","My Lord of Norfolk,--\r","\r","NORFOLK:\r","Here, most gracious liege.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Norfolk, we must have knocks; ha! must we not?\r","\r","NORFOLK:\r","We must both give and take, my gracious lord.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Up with my tent there! here will I lie tonight;\r","But where to-morrow?  Well, all's one for that.\r","Who hath descried the number of the foe?\r","\r","NORFOLK:\r","Six or seven thousand is their utmost power.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Why, our battalion trebles that account:\r","Besides, the king's name is a tower of strength,\r","Which they upon the adverse party want.\r","Up with my tent there! Valiant gentlemen,\r","Let us survey the vantage of the field\r","Call for some men of sound direction\r","Let's want no discipline, make no delay,\r","For, lords, to-morrow is a busy day.\r","\r","RICHMOND:\r","The weary sun hath made a golden set,\r","And by the bright track of his fiery car,\r","Gives signal, of a goodly day to-morrow.\r","Sir William Brandon, you shall bear my standard.\r","Give me some ink and paper in my tent\r","I'll draw the form and model of our battle,\r","Limit each leader to his several charge,\r","And part in just proportion our small strength.\r","My Lord of Oxford, you, Sir William Brandon,\r","And you, Sir Walter Herbert, stay with me.\r","The Earl of Pembroke keeps his regiment:\r","Good Captain Blunt, bear my good night to him\r","And by the second hour in the morning\r","Desire the earl to see me in my tent:\r","Yet one thing more, good Blunt, before thou go'st,\r","Where is Lord Stanley quarter'd, dost thou know?\r","\r","BLUNT:\r","Unless I have mista'en his colours much,\r","Which well I am assured I have not done,\r","His regiment lies half a mile at least\r","South from the mighty power of the king.\r","\r","RICHMOND:\r","If without peril it be possible,\r","Good Captain Blunt, bear my good-night to him,\r","And give him from me this most needful scroll.\r","\r","BLUNT:\r","Upon my life, my lord, I'll under-take it;\r","And so, God give you quiet rest to-night!\r","\r","RICHMOND:\r","Good night, good Captain Blunt. Come gentlemen,\r","Let us consult upon to-morrow's business\r","In to our tent; the air is raw and cold.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","What is't o'clock?\r","\r","CATESBY:\r","It's supper-time, my lord;\r","It's nine o'clock.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","I will not sup to-night.\r","Give me some ink and paper.\r","What, is my beaver easier than it was?\r","And all my armour laid into my tent?\r","\r","CATESBY:\r","If is, my liege; and all things are in readiness.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Good Norfolk, hie thee to thy charge;\r","Use careful watch, choose trusty sentinels.\r","\r","NORFOLK:\r","I go, my lord.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Stir with the lark to-morrow, gentle Norfolk.\r","\r","NORFOLK:\r","I warrant you, my lord.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Catesby!\r","\r","CATESBY:\r","My lord?\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Send out a pursuivant at arms\r","To Stanley's regiment; bid him bring his power\r","Before sunrising, lest his son George fall\r","Into the blind cave of eternal night.\r","Fill me a bowl of wine. Give me a watch.\r","Saddle white Surrey for the field to-morrow.\r","Look that my staves be sound, and not too heavy.\r","Ratcliff!\r","\r","RATCLIFF:\r","My lord?\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Saw'st thou the melancholy Lord Northumberland?\r","\r","RATCLIFF:\r","Thomas the Earl of Surrey, and himself,\r","Much about cock-shut time, from troop to troop\r","Went through the army, cheering up the soldiers.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","So, I am satisfied. Give me a bowl of wine:\r","I have not that alacrity of spirit,\r","Nor cheer of mind, that I was wont to have.\r","Set it down. Is ink and paper ready?\r","\r","RATCLIFF:\r","It is, my lord.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Bid my guard watch; leave me.\r","Ratcliff, about the mid of night come to my tent\r","And help to arm me. Leave me, I say.\r","\r","DERBY:\r","Fortune and victory sit on thy helm!\r","\r","RICHMOND:\r","All comfort that the dark night can afford\r","Be to thy person, noble father-in-law!\r","Tell me, how fares our loving mother?\r","\r","DERBY:\r","I, by attorney, bless thee from thy mother\r","Who prays continually for Richmond's good:\r","So much for that. The silent hours steal on,\r","And flaky darkness breaks within the east.\r","In brief,--for so the season bids us be,--\r","Prepare thy battle early in the morning,\r","And put thy fortune to the arbitrement\r","Of bloody strokes and mortal-staring war.\r","I, as I may--that which I would I cannot,--\r","With best advantage will deceive the time,\r","And aid thee in this doubtful shock of arms:\r","But on thy side I may not be too forward\r","Lest, being seen, thy brother, tender George,\r","Be executed in his father's sight.\r","Farewell: the leisure and the fearful time\r","Cuts off the ceremonious vows of love\r","And ample interchange of sweet discourse,\r","Which so long sunder'd friends should dwell upon:\r","God give us leisure for these rites of love!\r","Once more, adieu: be valiant, and speed well!\r","\r","RICHMOND:\r","Good lords, conduct him to his regiment:\r","I'll strive, with troubled thoughts, to take a nap,\r","Lest leaden slumber peise me down to-morrow,\r","When I should mount with wings of victory:\r","Once more, good night, kind lords and gentlemen.\r","O Thou, whose captain I account myself,\r","Look on my forces with a gracious eye;\r","Put in their hands thy bruising irons of wrath,\r","That they may crush down with a heavy fall\r","The usurping helmets of our adversaries!\r","Make us thy ministers of chastisement,\r","That we may praise thee in the victory!\r","To thee I do commend my watchful soul,\r","Ere I let fall the windows of mine eyes:\r","Sleeping and waking, O, defend me still!\r","\r","Ghost of Prince Edward:\r","\r","Ghost of King Henry VI:\r","\r","Ghost of CLARENCE:\r","\r","Ghost of RIVERS:\r","\r","Ghost of GREY:\r","\r","Ghost of VAUGHAN:\r","\r","All:\r","\r","Ghost of HASTINGS:\r","\r","Ghosts of young Princes:\r","\r","Ghost of LADY ANNE:\r","\r","Ghost of BUCKINGHAM:\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Give me another horse: bind up my wounds.\r","Have mercy, Jesu!--Soft! I did but dream.\r","O coward conscience, how dost thou afflict me!\r","The lights burn blue. It is now dead midnight.\r","Cold fearful drops stand on my trembling flesh.\r","What do I fear?  myself?  there's none else by:\r","Richard loves Richard; that is, I am I.\r","Is there a murderer here?  No. Yes, I am:\r","Then fly. What, from myself?   Great reason why:\r","Lest I revenge. What, myself upon myself?\r","Alack. I love myself. Wherefore?  for any good\r","That I myself have done unto myself?\r","O, no! alas, I rather hate myself\r","For hateful deeds committed by myself!\r","I am a villain: yet I lie. I am not.\r","Fool, of thyself speak well: fool, do not flatter.\r","My conscience hath a thousand several tongues,\r","And every tongue brings in a several tale,\r","And every tale condemns me for a villain.\r","Perjury, perjury, in the high'st degree\r","Murder, stem murder, in the direst degree;\r","All several sins, all used in each degree,\r","Throng to the bar, crying all, Guilty! guilty!\r","I shall despair. There is no creature loves me;\r","And if I die, no soul shall pity me:\r","Nay, wherefore should they, since that I myself\r","Find in myself no pity to myself?\r","Methought the souls of all that I had murder'd\r","Came to my tent; and every one did threat\r","To-morrow's vengeance on the head of Richard.\r","\r","RATCLIFF:\r","My lord!\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","'Zounds! who is there?\r","\r","RATCLIFF:\r","Ratcliff, my lord; 'tis I. The early village-cock\r","Hath twice done salutation to the morn;\r","Your friends are up, and buckle on their armour.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","O Ratcliff, I have dream'd a fearful dream!\r","What thinkest thou, will our friends prove all true?\r","\r","RATCLIFF:\r","No doubt, my lord.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","O Ratcliff, I fear, I fear,--\r","\r","RATCLIFF:\r","Nay, good my lord, be not afraid of shadows.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","By the apostle Paul, shadows to-night\r","Have struck more terror to the soul of Richard\r","Than can the substance of ten thousand soldiers\r","Armed in proof, and led by shallow Richmond.\r","It is not yet near day. Come, go with me;\r","Under our tents I'll play the eaves-dropper,\r","To see if any mean to shrink from me.\r","\r","LORDS:\r","Good morrow, Richmond!\r","\r","RICHMOND:\r","Cry mercy, lords and watchful gentlemen,\r","That you have ta'en a tardy sluggard here.\r","\r","LORDS:\r","How have you slept, my lord?\r","\r","RICHMOND:\r","The sweetest sleep, and fairest-boding dreams\r","That ever enter'd in a drowsy head,\r","Have I since your departure had, my lords.\r","Methought their souls, whose bodies Richard murder'd,\r","Came to my tent, and cried on victory:\r","I promise you, my soul is very jocund\r","In the remembrance of so fair a dream.\r","How far into the morning is it, lords?\r","\r","LORDS:\r","Upon the stroke of four.\r","\r","RICHMOND:\r","Why, then 'tis time to arm and give direction.\r","More than I have said, loving countrymen,\r","The leisure and enforcement of the time\r","Forbids to dwell upon: yet remember this,\r","God and our good cause fight upon our side;\r","The prayers of holy saints and wronged souls,\r","Like high-rear'd bulwarks, stand before our faces;\r","Richard except, those whom we fight against\r","Had rather have us win than him they follow:\r","For what is he they follow?  truly, gentlemen,\r","A bloody tyrant and a homicide;\r","One raised in blood, and one in blood establish'd;\r","One that made means to come by what he hath,\r","And slaughter'd those that were the means to help him;\r","Abase foul stone, made precious by the foil\r","Of England's chair, where he is falsely set;\r","One that hath ever been God's enemy:\r","Then, if you fight against God's enemy,\r","God will in justice ward you as his soldiers;\r","If you do sweat to put a tyrant down,\r","You sleep in peace, the tyrant being slain;\r","If you do fight against your country's foes,\r","Your country's fat shall pay your pains the hire;\r","If you do fight in safeguard of your wives,\r","Your wives shall welcome home the conquerors;\r","If you do free your children from the sword,\r","Your children's children quit it in your age.\r","Then, in the name of God and all these rights,\r","Advance your standards, draw your willing swords.\r","For me, the ransom of my bold attempt\r","Shall be this cold corpse on the earth's cold face;\r","But if I thrive, the gain of my attempt\r","The least of you shall share his part thereof.\r","Sound drums and trumpets boldly and cheerfully;\r","God and Saint George! Richmond and victory!\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","What said Northumberland as touching Richmond?\r","\r","RATCLIFF:\r","That he was never trained up in arms.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","He said the truth: and what said Surrey then?\r","\r","RATCLIFF:\r","He smiled and said 'The better for our purpose.'\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","He was in the right; and so indeed it is.\r","Ten the clock there. Give me a calendar.\r","Who saw the sun to-day?\r","\r","RATCLIFF:\r","Not I, my lord.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Then he disdains to shine; for by the book\r","He should have braved the east an hour ago\r","A black day will it be to somebody. Ratcliff!\r","\r","RATCLIFF:\r","My lord?\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","The sun will not be seen to-day;\r","The sky doth frown and lour upon our army.\r","I would these dewy tears were from the ground.\r","Not shine to-day! Why, what is that to me\r","More than to Richmond?  for the selfsame heaven\r","That frowns on me looks sadly upon him.\r","\r","NORFOLK:\r","Arm, arm, my lord; the foe vaunts in the field.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Come, bustle, bustle; caparison my horse.\r","Call up Lord Stanley, bid him bring his power:\r","I will lead forth my soldiers to the plain,\r","And thus my battle shall be ordered:\r","My foreward shall be drawn out all in length,\r","Consisting equally of horse and foot;\r","Our archers shall be placed in the midst\r","John Duke of Norfolk, Thomas Earl of Surrey,\r","Shall have the leading of this foot and horse.\r","They thus directed, we will follow\r","In the main battle, whose puissance on either side\r","Shall be well winged with our chiefest horse.\r","This, and Saint George to boot! What think'st thou, Norfolk?\r","\r","NORFOLK:\r","A good direction, warlike sovereign.\r","This found I on my tent this morning.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","\r","Messenger:\r","My lord, he doth deny to come.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Off with his son George's head!\r","\r","NORFOLK:\r","My lord, the enemy is past the marsh\r","After the battle let George Stanley die.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","A thousand hearts are great within my bosom:\r","Advance our standards, set upon our foes\r","Our ancient word of courage, fair Saint George,\r","Inspire us with the spleen of fiery dragons!\r","Upon them! victory sits on our helms.\r","\r","CATESBY:\r","Rescue, my Lord of Norfolk, rescue, rescue!\r","The king enacts more wonders than a man,\r","Daring an opposite to every danger:\r","His horse is slain, and all on foot he fights,\r","Seeking for Richmond in the throat of death.\r","Rescue, fair lord, or else the day is lost!\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","A horse! a horse! my kingdom for a horse!\r","\r","CATESBY:\r","Withdraw, my lord; I'll help you to a horse.\r","\r","KING RICHARD III:\r","Slave, I have set my life upon a cast,\r","And I will stand the hazard of the die:\r","I think there be six Richmonds in the field;\r","Five have I slain to-day instead of him.\r","A horse! a horse! my kingdom for a horse!\r","\r","RICHMOND:\r","God and your arms be praised, victorious friends,\r","The day is ours, the bloody dog is dead.\r","\r","DERBY:\r","Courageous Richmond, well hast thou acquit thee.\r","Lo, here, this long-usurped royalty\r","From the dead temples of this bloody wretch\r","Have I pluck'd off, to grace thy brows withal:\r","Wear it, enjoy it, and make much of it.\r","\r","RICHMOND:\r","Great God of heaven, say Amen to all!\r","But, tell me, is young George Stanley living?\r","\r","DERBY:\r","He is, my lord, and safe in Leicester town;\r","Whither, if it please you, we may now withdraw us.\r","\r","RICHMOND:\r","What men of name are slain on either side?\r","\r","DERBY:\r","John Duke of Norfolk, Walter Lord Ferrers,\r","Sir Robert Brakenbury, and Sir William Brandon.\r","\r","RICHMOND:\r","Inter their bodies as becomes their births:\r","Proclaim a pardon to the soldiers fled\r","That in submission will return to us:\r","And then, as we have ta'en the sacrament,\r","We will unite the white rose and the red:\r","Smile heaven upon this fair conjunction,\r","That long have frown'd upon their enmity!\r","What traitor hears me, and says not amen?\r","England hath long been mad, and scarr'd herself;\r","The brother blindly shed the brother's blood,\r","The father rashly slaughter'd his own son,\r","The son, compell'd, been butcher to the sire:\r","All this divided York and Lancaster,\r","Divided in their dire division,\r","O, now, let Richmond and Elizabeth,\r","The true succeeders of each royal house,\r","By God's fair ordinance conjoin together!\r","And let their heirs, God, if thy will be so.\r","Enrich the time to come with smooth-faced peace,\r","With smiling plenty and fair prosperous days!\r","Abate the edge of traitors, gracious Lord,\r","That would reduce these bloody days again,\r","And make poor England weep in streams of blood!\r","Let them not live to taste this land's increase\r","That would with treason wound this fair land's peace!\r","Now civil wounds are stopp'd, peace lives again:\r","That she may long live here, God say amen!\r","\r","KING RICHARD II:\r","Old John of Gaunt, time-honour'd Lancaster,\r","Hast thou, according to thy oath and band,\r","Brought hither Henry Hereford thy bold son,\r","Here to make good the boisterous late appeal,\r","Which then our leisure would not let us hear,\r","Against the Duke of Norfolk, Thomas Mowbray?\r","\r","JOHN OF GAUNT:\r","I have, my liege.\r","\r","KING RICHARD II:\r","Tell me, moreover, hast thou sounded him,\r","If he appeal the duke on ancient malice;\r","Or worthily, as a good subject should,\r","On some known ground of treachery in him?\r","\r","JOHN OF GAUNT:\r","As near as I could sift him on that argument,\r","On some apparent danger seen in him\r","Aim'd at your highness, no inveterate malice.\r","\r","KING RICHARD II:\r","Then call them to our presence; face to face,\r","And frowning brow to brow, ourselves will hear\r","The accuser and the accused freely speak:\r","High-stomach'd are they both, and full of ire,\r","In rage deaf as the sea, hasty as fire.\r","\r","HENRY BOLINGBROKE:\r","Many years of happy days befal\r","My gracious sovereign, my most loving liege!\r","\r","THOMAS MOWBRAY:\r","Each day still better other's happiness;\r","Until the heavens, envying earth's good hap,\r","Add an immortal title to your crown!\r","\r","KING RICHARD II:\r","We thank you both: yet one but flatters us,\r","As well appeareth by the cause you come;\r","Namely to appeal each other of high treason.\r","Cousin of Hereford, what dost thou object\r","Against the Duke of Norfolk, Thomas Mowbray?\r","\r","HENRY BOLINGBROKE:\r","First, heaven be the record to my speech!\r","In the devotion of a subject's love,\r","Tendering the precious safety of my prince,\r","And free from other misbegotten hate,\r","Come I appellant to this princely presence.\r","Now, Thomas Mowbray, do I turn to thee,\r","And mark my greeting well; for what I speak\r","My body shall make good upon this earth,\r","Or my divine soul answer it in heaven.\r","Thou art a traitor and a miscreant,\r","Too good to be so and too bad to live,\r","Since the more fair and crystal is the sky,\r","The uglier seem the clouds that in it fly.\r","Once more, the more to aggravate the note,\r","With a foul traitor's name stuff I thy throat;\r","And wish, so please my sovereign, ere I move,\r","What my tongue speaks my right drawn sword may prove.\r","\r","THOMAS MOWBRAY:\r","Let not my cold words here accuse my zeal:\r","'Tis not the trial of a woman's war,\r","The bitter clamour of two eager tongues,\r","Can arbitrate this cause betwixt us twain;\r","The blood is hot that must be cool'd for this:\r","Yet can I not of such tame patience boast\r","As to be hush'd and nought at all to say:\r","First, the fair reverence of your highness curbs me\r","From giving reins and spurs to my free speech;\r","Which else would post until it had return'd\r","These terms of treason doubled down his throat.\r","Setting aside his high blood's royalty,\r","And let him be no kinsman to my liege,\r","I do defy him, and I spit at him;\r","Call him a slanderous coward and a villain:\r","Which to maintain I would allow him odds,\r","And meet him, were I tied to run afoot\r","Even to the frozen ridges of the Alps,\r","Or any other ground inhabitable,\r","Where ever Englishman durst set his foot.\r","Mean time let this defend my loyalty,\r","By all my hopes, most falsely doth he lie.\r","\r","HENRY BOLINGBROKE:\r","Pale trembling coward, there I throw my gage,\r","Disclaiming here the kindred of the king,\r","And lay aside my high blood's royalty,\r","Which fear, not reverence, makes thee to except.\r","If guilty dread have left thee so much strength\r","As to take up mine honour's pawn, then stoop:\r","By that and all the rites of knighthood else,\r","Will I make good against thee, arm to arm,\r","What I have spoke, or thou canst worse devise.\r","\r","THOMAS MOWBRAY:\r","I take it up; and by that sword I swear\r","Which gently laid my knighthood on my shoulder,\r","I'll answer thee in any fair degree,\r","Or chivalrous design of knightly trial:\r","And when I mount, alive may I not light,\r","If I be traitor or unjustly fight!\r","\r","KING RICHARD II:\r","What doth our cousin lay to Mowbray's charge?\r","It must be great that can inherit us\r","So much as of a thought of ill in him.\r","\r","HENRY BOLINGBROKE:\r","Look, what I speak, my life shall prove it true;\r","That Mowbray hath received eight thousand nobles\r","In name of lendings for your highness' soldiers,\r","The which he hath detain'd for lewd employments,\r","Like a false traitor and injurious villain.\r","Besides I say and will in battle prove,\r","Or here or elsewhere to the furthest verge\r","That ever was survey'd by English eye,\r","That all the treasons for these eighteen years\r","Complotted and contrived in this land\r","Fetch from false Mowbray their first head and spring.\r","Further I say and further will maintain\r","Upon his bad life to make all this good,\r","That he did plot the Duke of Gloucester's death,\r","Suggest his soon-believing adversaries,\r","And consequently, like a traitor coward,\r","Sluiced out his innocent soul through streams of blood:\r","Which blood, like sacrificing Abel's, cries,\r","Even from the tongueless caverns of the earth,\r","To me for justice and rough chastisement;\r","And, by the glorious worth of my descent,\r","This arm shall do it, or this life be spent.\r","\r","KING RICHARD II:\r","How high a pitch his resolution soars!\r","Thomas of Norfolk, what say'st thou to this?\r","\r","THOMAS MOWBRAY:\r","O, let my sovereign turn away his face\r","And bid his ears a little while be deaf,\r","Till I have told this slander of his blood,\r","How God and good men hate so foul a liar.\r","\r","KING RICHARD II:\r","Mowbray, impartial are our eyes and ears:\r","Were he my brother, nay, my kingdom's heir,\r","As he is but my father's brother's son,\r","Now, by my sceptre's awe, I make a vow,\r","Such neighbour nearness to our sacred blood\r","Should nothing privilege him, nor partialize\r","The unstooping firmness of my upright soul:\r","He is our subject, Mowbray; so art thou:\r","Free speech and fearless I to thee allow.\r","\r","THOMAS MOWBRAY:\r","Then, Bolingbroke, as low as to thy heart,\r","Through the false passage of thy throat, thou liest.\r","Three parts of that receipt I had for Calais\r","Disbursed I duly to his highness' soldiers;\r","The other part reserved I by consent,\r","For that my sovereign liege was in my debt\r","Upon remainder of a dear account,\r","Since last I went to France to fetch his queen:\r","Now swallow down that lie. For Gloucester's death,\r","I slew him not; but to my own disgrace\r","Neglected my sworn duty in that case.\r","For you, my noble Lord of Lancaster,\r","The honourable father to my foe\r","Once did I lay an ambush for your life,\r","A trespass that doth vex my grieved soul\r","But ere I last received the sacrament\r","I did confess it, and exactly begg'd\r","Your grace's pardon, and I hope I had it.\r","This is my fault: as for the rest appeall'd,\r","It issues from the rancour of a villain,\r","A recreant and most degenerate traitor\r","Which in myself I boldly will defend;\r","And interchangeably hurl down my gage\r","Upon this overweening traitor's foot,\r","To prove myself a loyal gentleman\r","Even in the best blood chamber'd in his bosom.\r","In haste whereof, most heartily I pray\r","Your highness to assign our trial day.\r","\r","KING RICHARD II:\r","Wrath-kindled gentlemen, be ruled by me;\r","Let's purge this choler without letting blood:\r","This we prescribe, though no physician;\r","Deep malice makes too deep incision;\r","Forget, forgive; conclude and be agreed;\r","Our doctors say this is no month to bleed.\r","Good uncle, let this end where it begun;\r","We'll calm the Duke of Norfolk, you your son.\r","\r","JOHN OF GAUNT:\r","To be a make-peace shall become my age:\r","Throw down, my son, the Duke of Norfolk's gage.\r","\r","KING RICHARD II:\r","And, Norfolk, throw down his.\r","\r","JOHN OF GAUNT:\r","When, Harry, when?\r","Obedience bids I should not bid again.\r","\r","KING RICHARD II:\r","Norfolk, throw down, we bid; there is no boot.\r","\r","THOMAS MOWBRAY:\r","Myself I throw, dread sovereign, at thy foot.\r","My life thou shalt command, but not my shame:\r","The one my duty owes; but my fair name,\r","Despite of death that lives upon my grave,\r","To dark dishonour's use thou shalt not have.\r","I am disgraced, impeach'd and baffled here,\r","Pierced to the soul with slander's venom'd spear,\r","The which no balm can cure but his heart-blood\r","Which breathed this poison.\r","\r","KING RICHARD II:\r","Rage must be withstood:\r","Give me his gage: lions make leopards tame.\r","\r","THOMAS MOWBRAY:\r","Yea, but not change his spots: take but my shame.\r","And I resign my gage. My dear dear lord,\r","The purest treasure mortal times afford\r","Is spotless reputation: that away,\r","Men are but gilded loam or painted clay.\r","A jewel in a ten-times-barr'd-up chest\r","Is a bold spirit in a loyal breast.\r","Mine honour is my life; both grow in one:\r","Take honour from me, and my life is done:\r","Then, dear my liege, mine honour let me try;\r","In that I live and for that will I die.\r","\r","KING RICHARD II:\r","Cousin, throw up your gage; do you begin.\r","\r","HENRY BOLINGBROKE:\r","O, God defend my soul from such deep sin!\r","Shall I seem crest-fall'n in my father's sight?\r","Or with pale beggar-fear impeach my height\r","Before this out-dared dastard? Ere my tongue\r","Shall wound my honour with such feeble wrong,\r","Or sound so base a parle, my teeth shall tear\r","The slavish motive of recanting fear,\r","And spit it bleeding in his high disgrace,\r","Where shame doth harbour, even in Mowbray's face.\r","\r","KING RICHARD II:\r","We were not born to sue, but to command;\r","Which since we cannot do to make you friends,\r","Be ready, as your lives shall answer it,\r","At Coventry, upon Saint Lambert's day:\r","There shall your swords and lances arbitrate\r","The swelling difference of your settled hate:\r","Since we can not atone you, we shall see\r","Justice design the victor's chivalry.\r","Lord marshal, command our officers at arms\r","Be ready to direct these home alarms.\r","\r","JOHN OF GAUNT:\r","Alas, the part I had in Woodstock's blood\r","Doth more solicit me than your exclaims,\r","To stir against the butchers of his life!\r","But since correction lieth in those hands\r","Which made the fault that we cannot correct,\r","Put we our quarrel to the will of heaven;\r","Who, when they see the hours ripe on earth,\r","Will rain hot vengeance on offenders' heads.\r","\r","DUCHESS:\r","Finds brotherhood in thee no sharper spur?\r","Hath love in thy old blood no living fire?\r","Edward's seven sons, whereof thyself art one,\r","Were as seven vials of his sacred blood,\r","Or seven fair branches springing from one root:\r","Some of those seven are dried by nature's course,\r","Some of those branches by the Destinies cut;\r","But Thomas, my dear lord, my life, my Gloucester,\r","One vial full of Edward's sacred blood,\r","One flourishing branch of his most royal root,\r","Is crack'd, and all the precious liquor spilt,\r","Is hack'd down, and his summer leaves all faded,\r","By envy's hand and murder's bloody axe.\r","Ah, Gaunt, his blood was thine! that bed, that womb,\r","That metal, that self-mould, that fashion'd thee\r","Made him a man; and though thou livest and breathest,\r","Yet art thou slain in him: thou dost consent\r","In some large measure to thy father's death,\r","In that thou seest thy wretched brother die,\r","Who was the model of thy father's life.\r","Call it not patience, Gaunt; it is despair:\r","In suffering thus thy brother to be slaughter'd,\r","Thou showest the naked pathway to thy life,\r","Teaching stern murder how to butcher thee:\r","That which in mean men we intitle patience\r","Is pale cold cowardice in noble breasts.\r","What shall I say? to safeguard thine own life,\r","The best way is to venge my Gloucester's death.\r","\r","JOHN OF GAUNT:\r","God's is the quarrel; for God's substitute,\r","His deputy anointed in His sight,\r","Hath caused his death: the which if wrongfully,\r","Let heaven revenge; for I may never lift\r","An angry arm against His minister.\r","\r","DUCHESS:\r","Where then, alas, may I complain myself?\r","\r","JOHN OF GAUNT:\r","To God, the widow's champion and defence.\r","\r","DUCHESS:\r","Why, then, I will. Farewell, old Gaunt.\r","Thou goest to Coventry, there to behold\r","Our cousin Hereford and fell Mowbray fight:\r","O, sit my husband's wrongs on Hereford's spear,\r","That it may enter butcher Mowbray's breast!\r","Or, if misfortune miss the first career,\r","Be Mowbray's sins so heavy in his bosom,\r","They may break his foaming courser's back,\r","And throw the rider headlong in the lists,\r","A caitiff recreant to my cousin Hereford!\r","Farewell, old Gaunt: thy sometimes brother's wife\r","With her companion grief must end her life.\r","\r","JOHN OF GAUNT:\r","Sister, farewell; I must to Coventry:\r","As much good stay with thee as go with me!\r","\r","DUCHESS:\r","Yet one word more: grief boundeth where it falls,\r","Not with the empty hollowness, but weight:\r","I take my leave before I have begun,\r","For sorrow ends not when it seemeth done.\r","Commend me to thy brother, Edmund York.\r","Lo, this is all:--nay, yet depart not so;\r","Though this be all, do not so quickly go;\r","I shall remember more. Bid him--ah, what?--\r","With all good speed at Plashy visit me.\r","Alack, and what shall good old York there see\r","But empty lodgings and unfurnish'd walls,\r","Unpeopled offices, untrodden stones?\r","And what hear there for welcome but my groans?\r","Therefore commend me; let him not come there,\r","To seek out sorrow that dwells every where.\r","Desolate, desolate, will I hence and die:\r","The last leave of thee takes my weeping eye.\r","\r","Lord Marshal:\r","My Lord Aumerle, is Harry Hereford arm'd?\r","\r","DUKE OF AUMERLE:\r","Yea, at all points; and longs to enter in.\r","\r","Lord Marshal:\r","The Duke of Norfolk, sprightfully and bold,\r","Stays but the summons of the appellant's trumpet.\r","\r","DUKE OF AUMERLE:\r","Why, then, the champions are prepared, and stay\r","For nothing but his majesty's approach.\r","\r","KING RICHARD II:\r","Marshal, demand of yonder champion\r","The cause of his arrival here in arms:\r","Ask him his name and orderly proceed\r","To swear him in the justice of his cause.\r","\r","Lord Marshal:\r","In God's name and the king's, say who thou art\r","And why thou comest thus knightly clad in arms,\r","Against what man thou comest, and what thy quarrel:\r","Speak truly, on thy knighthood and thy oath;\r","As so defend thee heaven and thy valour!\r","\r","THOMAS MOWBRAY:\r","My name is Thomas Mowbray, Duke of Norfolk;\r","Who hither come engaged by my oath--\r","Which God defend a knight should violate!--\r","Both to defend my loyalty and truth\r","To God, my king and my succeeding issue,\r","Against the Duke of Hereford that appeals me\r","And, by the grace of God and this mine arm,\r","To prove him, in defending of myself,\r","A traitor to my God, my king, and me:\r","And as I truly fight, defend me heaven!\r","\r","KING RICHARD II:\r","Marshal, ask yonder knight in arms,\r","Both who he is and why he cometh hither\r","Thus plated in habiliments of war,\r","And formally, according to our law,\r","Depose him in the justice of his cause.\r","\r","Lord Marshal:\r","What is thy name? and wherefore comest thou hither,\r","Before King Richard in his royal lists?\r","Against whom comest thou? and what's thy quarrel?\r","Speak like a true knight, so defend thee heaven!\r","\r","HENRY BOLINGBROKE:\r","Harry of Hereford, Lancaster and Derby\r","Am I; who ready here do stand in arms,\r","To prove, by God's grace and my body's valour,\r","In lists, on Thomas Mowbray, Duke of Norfolk,\r","That he is a traitor, foul and dangerous,\r","To God of heaven, King Richard and to me;\r","And as I truly fight, defend me heaven!\r","\r","Lord Marshal:\r","On pain of death, no person be so bold\r","Or daring-hardy as to touch the lists,\r","Except the marshal and such officers\r","Appointed to direct these fair designs.\r","\r","HENRY BOLINGBROKE:\r","Lord marshal, let me kiss my sovereign's hand,\r","And bow my knee before his majesty:\r","For Mowbray and myself are like two men\r","That vow a long and weary pilgrimage;\r","Then let us take a ceremonious leave\r","And loving farewell of our several friends.\r","\r","Lord Marshal:\r","The appellant in all duty greets your highness,\r","And craves to kiss your hand and take his leave.\r","\r","KING RICHARD II:\r","We will descend and fold him in our arms.\r","Cousin of Hereford, as thy cause is right,\r","So be thy fortune in this royal fight!\r","Farewell, my blood; which if to-day thou shed,\r","Lament we may, but not revenge thee dead.\r","\r","HENRY BOLINGBROKE:\r","O let no noble eye profane a tear\r","For me, if I be gored with Mowbray's spear:\r","As confident as is the falcon's flight\r","Against a bird, do I with Mowbray fight.\r","My loving lord, I take my leave of you;\r","Of you, my noble cousin, Lord Aumerle;\r","Not sick, although I have to do with death,\r","But lusty, young, and cheerly drawing breath.\r","Lo, as at English feasts, so I regreet\r","The daintiest last, to make the end most sweet:\r","O thou, the earthly author of my blood,\r","Whose youthful spirit, in me regenerate,\r","Doth with a twofold vigour lift me up\r","To reach at victory above my head,\r","Add proof unto mine armour with thy prayers;\r","And with thy blessings steel my lance's point,\r","That it may enter Mowbray's waxen coat,\r","And furbish new the name of John a Gaunt,\r","Even in the lusty havior of his son.\r","\r","JOHN OF GAUNT:\r","God in thy good cause make thee prosperous!\r","Be swift like lightning in the execution;\r","And let thy blows, doubly redoubled,\r","Fall like amazing thunder on the casque\r","Of thy adverse pernicious enemy:\r","Rouse up thy youthful blood, be valiant and live.\r","\r","HENRY BOLINGBROKE:\r","Mine innocency and Saint George to thrive!\r","\r","THOMAS MOWBRAY:\r","However God or fortune cast my lot,\r","There lives or dies, true to King Richard's throne,\r","A loyal, just and upright gentleman:\r","Never did captive with a freer heart\r","Cast off his chains of bondage and embrace\r","His golden uncontroll'd enfranchisement,\r","More than my dancing soul doth celebrate\r","This feast of battle with mine adversary.\r","Most mighty liege, and my companion peers,\r","Take from my mouth the wish of happy years:\r","As gentle and as jocund as to jest\r","Go I to fight: truth hath a quiet breast.\r","\r","KING RICHARD II:\r","Farewell, my lord: securely I espy\r","Virtue with valour couched in thine eye.\r","Order the trial, marshal, and begin.\r","\r","Lord Marshal:\r","Harry of Hereford, Lancaster and Derby,\r","Receive thy lance; and God defend the right!\r","\r","HENRY BOLINGBROKE:\r","Strong as a tower in hope, I cry amen.\r","\r","Lord Marshal:\r","Go bear this lance to Thomas, Duke of Norfolk.\r","\r","First Herald:\r","Harry of Hereford, Lancaster and Derby,\r","Stands here for God, his sovereign and himself,\r","On pain to be found false and recreant,\r","To prove the Duke of Norfolk, Thomas Mowbray,\r","A traitor to his God, his king and him;\r","And dares him to set forward to the fight.\r","\r","Second Herald:\r","Here standeth Thomas Mowbray, Duke of Norfolk,\r","On pain to be found false and recreant,\r","Both to defend himself and to approve\r","Henry of Hereford, Lancaster, and Derby,\r","To God, his sovereign and to him disloyal;\r","Courageously and with a free desire\r","Attending but the signal to begin.\r","\r","Lord Marshal:\r","Sound, trumpets; and set forward, combatants.\r","Stay, the king hath thrown his warder down.\r","\r","KING RICHARD II:\r","Let them lay by their helmets and their spears,\r","And both return back to their chairs again:\r","Withdraw with us: and let the trumpets sound\r","While we return these dukes what we decree.\r","Draw near,\r","And list what with our council we have done.\r","For that our kingdom's earth should not be soil'd\r","With that dear blood which it hath fostered;\r","And for our eyes do hate the dire aspect\r","Of civil wounds plough'd up with neighbours' sword;\r","And for we think the eagle-winged pride\r","Of sky-aspiring and ambitious thoughts,\r","With rival-hating envy, set on you\r","To wake our peace, which in our country's cradle\r","Draws the sweet infant breath of gentle sleep;\r","Which so roused up with boisterous untuned drums,\r","With harsh resounding trumpets' dreadful bray,\r","And grating shock of wrathful iron arms,\r","Might from our quiet confines fright fair peace\r","And make us wade even in our kindred's blood,\r","Therefore, we banish you our territories:\r","You, cousin Hereford, upon pain of life,\r","Till twice five summers have enrich'd our fields\r","Shall not regreet our fair dominions,\r","But tread the stranger paths of banishment.\r","\r","HENRY BOLINGBROKE:\r","Your will be done: this must my comfort be,\r","Sun that warms you here shall shine on me;\r","And those his golden beams to you here lent\r","Shall point on me and gild my banishment.\r","\r","KING RICHARD II:\r","Norfolk, for thee remains a heavier doom,\r","Which I with some unwillingness pronounce:\r","The sly slow hours shall not determinate\r","The dateless limit of thy dear exile;\r","The hopeless word of 'never to return'\r","Breathe I against thee, upon pain of life.\r","\r","THOMAS MOWBRAY:\r","A heavy sentence, my most sovereign liege,\r","And all unlook'd for from your highness' mouth:\r","A dearer merit, not so deep a maim\r","As to be cast forth in the common air,\r","Have I deserved at your highness' hands.\r","The language I have learn'd these forty years,\r","My native English, now I must forego:\r","And now my tongue's use is to me no more\r","Than an unstringed viol or a harp,\r","Or like a cunning instrument cased up,\r","Or, being open, put into his hands\r","That knows no touch to tune the harmony:\r","Within my mouth you have engaol'd my tongue,\r","Doubly portcullis'd with my teeth and lips;\r","And dull unfeeling barren ignorance\r","Is made my gaoler to attend on me.\r","I am too old to fawn upon a nurse,\r","Too far in years to be a pupil now:\r","What is thy sentence then but speechless death,\r","Which robs my tongue from breathing native breath?\r","\r","KING RICHARD II:\r","It boots thee not to be compassionate:\r","After our sentence plaining comes too late.\r","\r","THOMAS MOWBRAY:\r","Then thus I turn me from my country's light,\r","To dwell in solemn shades of endless night.\r","\r","KING RICHARD II:\r","Return again, and take an oath with thee.\r","Lay on our royal sword your banish'd hands;\r","Swear by the duty that you owe to God--\r","Our part therein we banish with yourselves--\r","To keep the oath that we administer:\r","You never shall, so help you truth and God!\r","Embrace each other's love in banishment;\r","Nor never look upon each other's face;\r","Nor never write, regreet, nor reconcile\r","This louring tempest of your home-bred hate;\r","Nor never by advised purpose meet\r","To plot, contrive, or complot any ill\r","'Gainst us, our state, our subjects, or our land.\r","\r","HENRY BOLINGBROKE:\r","I swear.\r","\r","THOMAS MOWBRAY:\r","And I, to keep all this.\r","\r","HENRY BOLINGBROKE:\r","Norfolk, so far as to mine enemy:--\r","By this time, had the king permitted us,\r","One of our souls had wander'd in the air.\r","Banish'd this frail sepulchre of our flesh,\r","As now our flesh is banish'd from this land:\r","Confess thy treasons ere thou fly the realm;\r","Since thou hast far to go, bear not along\r","The clogging burthen of a guilty soul.\r","\r","THOMAS MOWBRAY:\r","No, Bolingbroke: if ever I were traitor,\r","My name be blotted from the book of life,\r","And I from heaven banish'd as from hence!\r","But what thou art, God, thou, and I do know;\r","And all too soon, I fear, the king shall rue.\r","Farewell, my liege. Now no way can I stray;\r","Save back to England, all the world's my way.\r","\r","KING RICHARD II:\r","Uncle, even in the glasses of thine eyes\r","I see thy grieved heart: thy sad aspect\r","Hath from the number of his banish'd years\r","Pluck'd four away.\r","Six frozen winter spent,\r","Return with welcome home from banishment.\r","\r","HENRY BOLINGBROKE:\r","How long a time lies in one little word!\r","Four lagging winters and four wanton springs\r","End in a word: such is the breath of kings.\r","\r","JOHN OF GAUNT:\r","I thank my liege, that in regard of me\r","He shortens four years of my son's exile:\r","But little vantage shall I reap thereby;\r","For, ere the six years that he hath to spend\r","Can change their moons and bring their times about\r","My oil-dried lamp and time-bewasted light\r","Shall be extinct with age and endless night;\r","My inch of taper will be burnt and done,\r","And blindfold death not let me see my son.\r","\r","KING RICHARD II:\r","Why uncle, thou hast many years to live.\r","\r","JOHN OF GAUNT:\r","But not a minute, king, that thou canst give:\r","Shorten my days thou canst with sullen sorrow,\r","And pluck nights from me, but not lend a morrow;\r","Thou canst help time to furrow me with age,\r","But stop no wrinkle in his pilgrimage;\r","Thy word is current with him for my death,\r","But dead, thy kingdom cannot buy my breath.\r","\r","KING RICHARD II:\r","Thy son is banish'd upon good advice,\r","Whereto thy tongue a party-verdict gave:\r","Why at our justice seem'st thou then to lour?\r","\r","JOHN OF GAUNT:\r","Things sweet to taste prove in digestion sour.\r","You urged me as a judge; but I had rather\r","You would have bid me argue like a father.\r","O, had it been a stranger, not my child,\r","To smooth his fault I should have been more mild:\r","A partial slander sought I to avoid,\r","And in the sentence my own life destroy'd.\r","Alas, I look'd when some of you should say,\r","I was too strict to make mine own away;\r","But you gave leave to my unwilling tongue\r","Against my will to do myself this wrong.\r","\r","KING RICHARD II:\r","Cousin, farewell; and, uncle, bid him so:\r","Six years we banish him, and he shall go.\r","\r","DUKE OF AUMERLE:\r","Cousin, farewell: what presence must not know,\r","From where you do remain let paper show.\r","\r","Lord Marshal:\r","My lord, no leave take I; for I will ride,\r","As far as land will let me, by your side.\r","\r","JOHN OF GAUNT:\r","O, to what purpose dost thou hoard thy words,\r","That thou return'st no greeting to thy friends?\r","\r","HENRY BOLINGBROKE:\r","I have too few to take my leave of you,\r","When the tongue's office should be prodigal\r","To breathe the abundant dolour of the heart.\r","\r","JOHN OF GAUNT:\r","Thy grief is but thy absence for a time.\r","\r","HENRY BOLINGBROKE:\r","Joy absent, grief is present for that time.\r","\r","JOHN OF GAUNT:\r","What is six winters? they are quickly gone.\r","\r","HENRY BOLINGBROKE:\r","To men in joy; but grief makes one hour ten.\r","\r","JOHN OF GAUNT:\r","Call it a travel that thou takest for pleasure.\r","\r","HENRY BOLINGBROKE:\r","My heart will sigh when I miscall it so,\r","Which finds it an inforced pilgrimage.\r","\r","JOHN OF GAUNT:\r","The sullen passage of thy weary steps\r","Esteem as foil wherein thou art to set\r","The precious jewel of thy home return.\r","\r","HENRY BOLINGBROKE:\r","Nay, rather, every tedious stride I make\r","Will but remember me what a deal of world\r","I wander from the jewels that I love.\r","Must I not serve a long apprenticehood\r","To foreign passages, and in the end,\r","Having my freedom, boast of nothing else\r","But that I was a journeyman to grief?\r","\r","JOHN OF GAUNT:\r","All places that the eye of heaven visits\r","Are to a wise man ports and happy havens.\r","Teach thy necessity to reason thus;\r","There is no virtue like necessity.\r","Think not the king did banish thee,\r","But thou the king. Woe doth the heavier sit,\r","Where it perceives it is but faintly borne.\r","Go, say I sent thee forth to purchase honour\r","And not the king exiled thee; or suppose\r","Devouring pestilence hangs in our air\r","And thou art flying to a fresher clime:\r","Look, what thy soul holds dear, imagine it\r","To lie that way thou go'st, not whence thou comest:\r","Suppose the singing birds musicians,\r","The grass whereon thou tread'st the presence strew'd,\r","The flowers fair ladies, and thy steps no more\r","Than a delightful measure or a dance;\r","For gnarling sorrow hath less power to bite\r","The man that mocks at it and sets it light.\r","\r","HENRY BOLINGBROKE:\r","O, who can hold a fire in his hand\r","By thinking on the frosty Caucasus?\r","Or cloy the hungry edge of appetite\r","By bare imagination of a feast?\r","Or wallow naked in December snow\r","By thinking on fantastic summer's heat?\r","O, no! the apprehension of the good\r","Gives but the greater feeling to the worse:\r","Fell sorrow's tooth doth never rankle more\r","Than when he bites, but lanceth not the sore.\r","\r","JOHN OF GAUNT:\r","Come, come, my son, I'll bring thee on thy way:\r","Had I thy youth and cause, I would not stay.\r","\r","HENRY BOLINGBROKE:\r","Then, England's ground, farewell; sweet soil, adieu;\r","My mother, and my nurse, that bears me yet!\r","Where'er I wander, boast of this I can,\r","Though banish'd, yet a trueborn Englishman.\r","\r","KING RICHARD II:\r","We did observe. Cousin Aumerle,\r","How far brought you high Hereford on his way?\r","\r","DUKE OF AUMERLE:\r","I brought high Hereford, if you call him so,\r","But to the next highway, and there I left him.\r","\r","KING RICHARD II:\r","And say, what store of parting tears were shed?\r","\r","DUKE OF AUMERLE:\r","Faith, none for me; except the north-east wind,\r","Which then blew bitterly against our faces,\r","Awaked the sleeping rheum, and so by chance\r","Did grace our hollow parting with a tear.\r","\r","KING RICHARD II:\r","What said our cousin when you parted with him?\r","\r","DUKE OF AUMERLE:\r","'Farewell:'\r","And, for my heart disdained that my tongue\r","Should so profane the word, that taught me craft\r","To counterfeit oppression of such grief\r","That words seem'd buried in my sorrow's grave.\r","Marry, would the word 'farewell' have lengthen'd hours\r","And added years to his short banishment,\r","He should have had a volume of farewells;\r","But since it would not, he had none of me.\r","\r","KING RICHARD II:\r","He is our cousin, cousin; but 'tis doubt,\r","When time shall call him home from banishment,\r","Whether our kinsman come to see his friends.\r","Ourself and Bushy, Bagot here and Green\r","Observed his courtship to the common people;\r","How he did seem to dive into their hearts\r","With humble and familiar courtesy,\r","What reverence he did throw away on slaves,\r","Wooing poor craftsmen with the craft of smiles\r","And patient underbearing of his fortune,\r","As 'twere to banish their affects with him.\r","Off goes his bonnet to an oyster-wench;\r","A brace of draymen bid God speed him well\r","And had the tribute of his supple knee,\r","With 'Thanks, my countrymen, my loving friends;'\r","As were our England in reversion his,\r","And he our subjects' next degree in hope.\r","\r","GREEN:\r","Well, he is gone; and with him go these thoughts.\r","Now for the rebels which stand out in Ireland,\r","Expedient manage must be made, my liege,\r","Ere further leisure yield them further means\r","For their advantage and your highness' loss.\r","\r","KING RICHARD II:\r","We will ourself in person to this war:\r","And, for our coffers, with too great a court\r","And liberal largess, are grown somewhat light,\r","We are inforced to farm our royal realm;\r","The revenue whereof shall furnish us\r","For our affairs in hand: if that come short,\r","Our substitutes at home shall have blank charters;\r","Whereto, when they shall know what men are rich,\r","They shall subscribe them for large sums of gold\r","And send them after to supply our wants;\r","For we will make for Ireland presently.\r","Bushy, what news?\r","\r","BUSHY:\r","Old John of Gaunt is grievous sick, my lord,\r","Suddenly taken; and hath sent post haste\r","To entreat your majesty to visit him.\r","\r","KING RICHARD II:\r","Where lies he?\r","\r","BUSHY:\r","At Ely House.\r","\r","KING RICHARD II:\r","Now put it, God, in the physician's mind\r","To help him to his grave immediately!\r","The lining of his coffers shall make coats\r","To deck our soldiers for these Irish wars.\r","Come, gentlemen, let's all go visit him:\r","Pray God we may make haste, and come too late!\r","\r","All:\r","Amen.\r","\r","JOHN OF GAUNT:\r","Will the king come, that I may breathe my last\r","In wholesome counsel to his unstaid youth?\r","\r","DUKE OF YORK:\r","Vex not yourself, nor strive not with your breath;\r","For all in vain comes counsel to his ear.\r","\r","JOHN OF GAUNT:\r","O, but they say the tongues of dying men\r","Enforce attention like deep harmony:\r","Where words are scarce, they are seldom spent in vain,\r","For they breathe truth that breathe their words in pain.\r","He that no more must say is listen'd more\r","Than they whom youth and ease have taught to glose;\r","More are men's ends mark'd than their lives before:\r","The setting sun, and music at the close,\r","As the last taste of sweets, is sweetest last,\r","Writ in remembrance more than things long past:\r","Though Richard my life's counsel would not hear,\r","My death's sad tale may yet undeaf his ear.\r","\r","DUKE OF YORK:\r","No; it is stopp'd with other flattering sounds,\r","As praises, of whose taste the wise are fond,\r","Lascivious metres, to whose venom sound\r","The open ear of youth doth always listen;\r","Report of fashions
