waste,\r","To season love, that of it doth not taste!\r","The sun not yet thy sighs from heaven clears,\r","Thy old groans ring yet in my ancient ears;\r","Lo, here upon thy cheek the stain doth sit\r","Of an old tear that is not wash'd off yet:\r","If e'er thou wast thyself and these woes thine,\r","Thou and these woes were all for Rosaline:\r","And art thou changed? pronounce this sentence then,\r","Women may fall, when there's no strength in men.\r","\r","ROMEO:\r","Thou chid'st me oft for loving Rosaline.\r","\r","FRIAR LAURENCE:\r","For doting, not for loving, pupil mine.\r","\r","ROMEO:\r","And bad'st me bury love.\r","\r","FRIAR LAURENCE:\r","Not in a grave,\r","To lay one in, another out to have.\r","\r","ROMEO:\r","I pray thee, chide not; she whom I love now\r","Doth grace for grace and love for love allow;\r","The other did not so.\r","\r","FRIAR LAURENCE:\r","O, she knew well\r","Thy love did read by rote and could not spell.\r","But come, young waverer, come, go with me,\r","In one respect I'll thy assistant be;\r","For this alliance may so happy prove,\r","To turn your households' rancour to pure love.\r","\r","ROMEO:\r","O, let us hence; I stand on sudden haste.\r","\r","FRIAR LAURENCE:\r","Wisely and slow; they stumble that run fast.\r","\r","MERCUTIO:\r","Where the devil should this Romeo be?\r","Came he not home to-night?\r","\r","BENVOLIO:\r","Not to his father's; I spoke with his man.\r","\r","MERCUTIO:\r","Ah, that same pale hard-hearted wench, that Rosaline.\r","Torments him so, that he will sure run mad.\r","\r","BENVOLIO:\r","Tybalt, the kinsman of old Capulet,\r","Hath sent a letter to his father's house.\r","\r","MERCUTIO:\r","A challenge, on my life.\r","\r","BENVOLIO:\r","Romeo will answer it.\r","\r","MERCUTIO:\r","Any man that can write may answer a letter.\r","\r","BENVOLIO:\r","Nay, he will answer the letter's master, how he\r","dares, being dared.\r","\r","MERCUTIO:\r","Alas poor Romeo! he is already dead; stabbed with a\r","white wench's black eye; shot through the ear with a\r","love-song; the very pin of his heart cleft with the\r","blind bow-boy's butt-shaft: and is he a man to\r","encounter Tybalt?\r","\r","BENVOLIO:\r","Why, what is Tybalt?\r","\r","MERCUTIO:\r","More than prince of cats, I can tell you. O, he is\r","the courageous captain of compliments. He fights as\r","you sing prick-song, keeps time, distance, and\r","proportion; rests me his minim rest, one, two, and\r","the third in your bosom: the very butcher of a silk\r","button, a duellist, a duellist; a gentleman of the\r","very first house, of the first and second cause:\r","ah, the immortal passado! the punto reverso! the\r","hai!\r","\r","BENVOLIO:\r","The what?\r","\r","MERCUTIO:\r","The pox of such antic, lisping, affecting\r","fantasticoes; these new tuners of accents! 'By Jesu,\r","a very good blade! a very tall man! a very good\r","whore!' Why, is not this a lamentable thing,\r","grandsire, that we should be thus afflicted with\r","these strange flies, these fashion-mongers, these\r","perdona-mi's, who stand so much on the new form,\r","that they cannot at ease on the old bench? O, their\r","bones, their bones!\r","\r","BENVOLIO:\r","Here comes Romeo, here comes Romeo.\r","\r","MERCUTIO:\r","Without his roe, like a dried herring: flesh, flesh,\r","how art thou fishified! Now is he for the numbers\r","that Petrarch flowed in: Laura to his lady was but a\r","kitchen-wench; marry, she had a better love to\r","be-rhyme her; Dido a dowdy; Cleopatra a gipsy;\r","Helen and Hero hildings and harlots; Thisbe a grey\r","eye or so, but not to the purpose. Signior\r","Romeo, bon jour! there's a French salutation\r","to your French slop. You gave us the counterfeit\r","fairly last night.\r","\r","ROMEO:\r","Good morrow to you both. What counterfeit did I give you?\r","\r","MERCUTIO:\r","The ship, sir, the slip; can you not conceive?\r","\r","ROMEO:\r","Pardon, good Mercutio, my business was great; and in\r","such a case as mine a man may strain courtesy.\r","\r","MERCUTIO:\r","That's as much as to say, such a case as yours\r","constrains a man to bow in the hams.\r","\r","ROMEO:\r","Meaning, to court'sy.\r","\r","MERCUTIO:\r","Thou hast most kindly hit it.\r","\r","ROMEO:\r","A most courteous exposition.\r","\r","MERCUTIO:\r","Nay, I am the very pink of courtesy.\r","\r","ROMEO:\r","Pink for flower.\r","\r","MERCUTIO:\r","Right.\r","\r","ROMEO:\r","Why, then is my pump well flowered.\r","\r","MERCUTIO:\r","Well said: follow me this jest now till thou hast\r","worn out thy pump, that when the single sole of it\r","is worn, the jest may remain after the wearing sole singular.\r","\r","ROMEO:\r","O single-soled jest, solely singular for the\r","singleness.\r","\r","MERCUTIO:\r","Come between us, good Benvolio; my wits faint.\r","\r","ROMEO:\r","Switch and spurs, switch and spurs; or I'll cry a match.\r","\r","MERCUTIO:\r","Nay, if thy wits run the wild-goose chase, I have\r","done, for thou hast more of the wild-goose in one of\r","thy wits than, I am sure, I have in my whole five:\r","was I with you there for the goose?\r","\r","ROMEO:\r","Thou wast never with me for any thing when thou wast\r","not there for the goose.\r","\r","MERCUTIO:\r","I will bite thee by the ear for that jest.\r","\r","ROMEO:\r","Nay, good goose, bite not.\r","\r","MERCUTIO:\r","Thy wit is a very bitter sweeting; it is a most\r","sharp sauce.\r","\r","ROMEO:\r","And is it not well served in to a sweet goose?\r","\r","MERCUTIO:\r","O here's a wit of cheveril, that stretches from an\r","inch narrow to an ell broad!\r","\r","ROMEO:\r","I stretch it out for that word 'broad;' which added\r","to the goose, proves thee far and wide a broad goose.\r","\r","MERCUTIO:\r","Why, is not this better now than groaning for love?\r","now art thou sociable, now art thou Romeo; now art\r","thou what thou art, by art as well as by nature:\r","for this drivelling love is like a great natural,\r","that runs lolling up and down to hide his bauble in a hole.\r","\r","BENVOLIO:\r","Stop there, stop there.\r","\r","MERCUTIO:\r","Thou desirest me to stop in my tale against the hair.\r","\r","BENVOLIO:\r","Thou wouldst else have made thy tale large.\r","\r","MERCUTIO:\r","O, thou art deceived; I would have made it short:\r","for I was come to the whole depth of my tale; and\r","meant, indeed, to occupy the argument no longer.\r","\r","ROMEO:\r","Here's goodly gear!\r","\r","MERCUTIO:\r","A sail, a sail!\r","\r","BENVOLIO:\r","Two, two; a shirt and a smock.\r","\r","Nurse:\r","Peter!\r","\r","PETER:\r","Anon!\r","\r","Nurse:\r","My fan, Peter.\r","\r","MERCUTIO:\r","Good Peter, to hide her face; for her fan's the\r","fairer face.\r","\r","Nurse:\r","God ye good morrow, gentlemen.\r","\r","MERCUTIO:\r","God ye good den, fair gentlewoman.\r","\r","Nurse:\r","Is it good den?\r","\r","MERCUTIO:\r","'Tis no less, I tell you, for the bawdy hand of the\r","dial is now upon the prick of noon.\r","\r","Nurse:\r","Out upon you! what a man are you!\r","\r","ROMEO:\r","One, gentlewoman, that God hath made for himself to\r","mar.\r","\r","Nurse:\r","By my troth, it is well said; 'for himself to mar,'\r","quoth a'? Gentlemen, can any of you tell me where I\r","may find the young Romeo?\r","\r","ROMEO:\r","I can tell you; but young Romeo will be older when\r","you have found him than he was when you sought him:\r","I am the youngest of that name, for fault of a worse.\r","\r","Nurse:\r","You say well.\r","\r","MERCUTIO:\r","Yea, is the worst well? very well took, i' faith;\r","wisely, wisely.\r","\r","Nurse:\r","if you be he, sir, I desire some confidence with\r","you.\r","\r","BENVOLIO:\r","She will indite him to some supper.\r","\r","MERCUTIO:\r","A bawd, a bawd, a bawd! so ho!\r","\r","ROMEO:\r","What hast thou found?\r","\r","MERCUTIO:\r","No hare, sir; unless a hare, sir, in a lenten pie,\r","that is something stale and hoar ere it be spent.\r","An old hare hoar,\r","And an old hare hoar,\r","Is very good meat in lent\r","But a hare that is hoar\r","Is too much for a score,\r","When it hoars ere it be spent.\r","Romeo, will you come to your father's? we'll\r","to dinner, thither.\r","\r","ROMEO:\r","I will follow you.\r","\r","MERCUTIO:\r","Farewell, ancient lady; farewell,\r","'lady, lady, lady.'\r","\r","Nurse:\r","Marry, farewell! I pray you, sir, what saucy\r","merchant was this, that was so full of his ropery?\r","\r","ROMEO:\r","A gentleman, nurse, that loves to hear himself talk,\r","and will speak more in a minute than he will stand\r","to in a month.\r","\r","Nurse:\r","An a' speak any thing against me, I'll take him\r","down, an a' were lustier than he is, and twenty such\r","Jacks; and if I cannot, I'll find those that shall.\r","Scurvy knave! I am none of his flirt-gills; I am\r","none of his skains-mates. And thou must stand by\r","too, and suffer every knave to use me at his pleasure?\r","\r","PETER:\r","I saw no man use you a pleasure; if I had, my weapon\r","should quickly have been out, I warrant you: I dare\r","draw as soon as another man, if I see occasion in a\r","good quarrel, and the law on my side.\r","\r","Nurse:\r","Now, afore God, I am so vexed, that every part about\r","me quivers. Scurvy knave! Pray you, sir, a word:\r","and as I told you, my young lady bade me inquire you\r","out; what she bade me say, I will keep to myself:\r","but first let me tell ye, if ye should lead her into\r","a fool's paradise, as they say, it were a very gross\r","kind of behavior, as they say: for the gentlewoman\r","is young; and, therefore, if you should deal double\r","with her, truly it were an ill thing to be offered\r","to any gentlewoman, and very weak dealing.\r","\r","ROMEO:\r","Nurse, commend me to thy lady and mistress. I\r","protest unto thee--\r","\r","Nurse:\r","Good heart, and, i' faith, I will tell her as much:\r","Lord, Lord, she will be a joyful woman.\r","\r","ROMEO:\r","What wilt thou tell her, nurse? thou dost not mark me.\r","\r","Nurse:\r","I will tell her, sir, that you do protest; which, as\r","I take it, is a gentlemanlike offer.\r","\r","ROMEO:\r","Bid her devise\r","Some means to come to shrift this afternoon;\r","And there she shall at Friar Laurence' cell\r","Be shrived and married. Here is for thy pains.\r","\r","Nurse:\r","No truly sir; not a penny.\r","\r","ROMEO:\r","Go to; I say you shall.\r","\r","Nurse:\r","This afternoon, sir? well, she shall be there.\r","\r","ROMEO:\r","And stay, good nurse, behind the abbey wall:\r","Within this hour my man shall be with thee\r","And bring thee cords made like a tackled stair;\r","Which to the high top-gallant of my joy\r","Must be my convoy in the secret night.\r","Farewell; be trusty, and I'll quit thy pains:\r","Farewell; commend me to thy mistress.\r","\r","Nurse:\r","Now God in heaven bless thee! Hark you, sir.\r","\r","ROMEO:\r","What say'st thou, my dear nurse?\r","\r","Nurse:\r","Is your man secret? Did you ne'er hear say,\r","Two may keep counsel, putting one away?\r","\r","ROMEO:\r","I warrant thee, my man's as true as steel.\r","\r","NURSE:\r","Well, sir; my mistress is the sweetest lady--Lord,\r","Lord! when 'twas a little prating thing:--O, there\r","is a nobleman in town, one Paris, that would fain\r","lay knife aboard; but she, good soul, had as lief\r","see a toad, a very toad, as see him. I anger her\r","sometimes and tell her that Paris is the properer\r","man; but, I'll warrant you, when I say so, she looks\r","as pale as any clout in the versal world. Doth not\r","rosemary and Romeo begin both with a letter?\r","\r","ROMEO:\r","Ay, nurse; what of that? both with an R.\r","\r","Nurse:\r","Ah. mocker! that's the dog's name; R is for\r","the--No; I know it begins with some other\r","letter:--and she hath the prettiest sententious of\r","it, of you and rosemary, that it would do you good\r","to hear it.\r","\r","ROMEO:\r","Commend me to thy lady.\r","\r","Nurse:\r","Ay, a thousand times.\r","Peter!\r","\r","PETER:\r","Anon!\r","\r","Nurse:\r","Peter, take my fan, and go before and apace.\r","\r","JULIET:\r","The clock struck nine when I did send the nurse;\r","In half an hour she promised to return.\r","Perchance she cannot meet him: that's not so.\r","O, she is lame! love's heralds should be thoughts,\r","Which ten times faster glide than the sun's beams,\r","Driving back shadows over louring hills:\r","Therefore do nimble-pinion'd doves draw love,\r","And therefore hath the wind-swift Cupid wings.\r","Now is the sun upon the highmost hill\r","Of this day's journey, and from nine till twelve\r","Is three long hours, yet she is not come.\r","Had she affections and warm youthful blood,\r","She would be as swift in motion as a ball;\r","My words would bandy her to my sweet love,\r","And his to me:\r","But old folks, many feign as they were dead;\r","Unwieldy, slow, heavy and pale as lead.\r","O God, she comes!\r","O honey nurse, what news?\r","Hast thou met with him? Send thy man away.\r","\r","Nurse:\r","Peter, stay at the gate.\r","\r","JULIET:\r","Now, good sweet nurse,--O Lord, why look'st thou sad?\r","Though news be sad, yet tell them merrily;\r","If good, thou shamest the music of sweet news\r","By playing it to me with so sour a face.\r","\r","Nurse:\r","I am a-weary, give me leave awhile:\r","Fie, how my bones ache! what a jaunt have I had!\r","\r","JULIET:\r","I would thou hadst my bones, and I thy news:\r","Nay, come, I pray thee, speak; good, good nurse, speak.\r","\r","Nurse:\r","Jesu, what haste? can you not stay awhile?\r","Do you not see that I am out of breath?\r","\r","JULIET:\r","How art thou out of breath, when thou hast breath\r","To say to me that thou art out of breath?\r","The excuse that thou dost make in this delay\r","Is longer than the tale thou dost excuse.\r","Is thy news good, or bad? answer to that;\r","Say either, and I'll stay the circumstance:\r","Let me be satisfied, is't good or bad?\r","\r","Nurse:\r","Well, you have made a simple choice; you know not\r","how to choose a man: Romeo! no, not he; though his\r","face be better than any man's, yet his leg excels\r","all men's; and for a hand, and a foot, and a body,\r","though they be not to be talked on, yet they are\r","past compare: he is not the flower of courtesy,\r","but, I'll warrant him, as gentle as a lamb. Go thy\r","ways, wench; serve God. What, have you dined at home?\r","\r","JULIET:\r","No, no: but all this did I know before.\r","What says he of our marriage? what of that?\r","\r","Nurse:\r","Lord, how my head aches! what a head have I!\r","It beats as it would fall in twenty pieces.\r","My back o' t' other side,--O, my back, my back!\r","Beshrew your heart for sending me about,\r","To catch my death with jaunting up and down!\r","\r","JULIET:\r","I' faith, I am sorry that thou art not well.\r","Sweet, sweet, sweet nurse, tell me, what says my love?\r","\r","Nurse:\r","Your love says, like an honest gentleman, and a\r","courteous, and a kind, and a handsome, and, I\r","warrant, a virtuous,--Where is your mother?\r","\r","JULIET:\r","Where is my mother! why, she is within;\r","Where should she be? How oddly thou repliest!\r","'Your love says, like an honest gentleman,\r","Where is your mother?'\r","\r","Nurse:\r","O God's lady dear!\r","Are you so hot? marry, come up, I trow;\r","Is this the poultice for my aching bones?\r","Henceforward do your messages yourself.\r","\r","JULIET:\r","Here's such a coil! come, what says Romeo?\r","\r","Nurse:\r","Have you got leave to go to shrift to-day?\r","\r","JULIET:\r","I have.\r","\r","Nurse:\r","Then hie you hence to Friar Laurence' cell;\r","There stays a husband to make you a wife:\r","Now comes the wanton blood up in your cheeks,\r","They'll be in scarlet straight at any news.\r","Hie you to church; I must another way,\r","To fetch a ladder, by the which your love\r","Must climb a bird's nest soon when it is dark:\r","I am the drudge and toil in your delight,\r","But you shall bear the burden soon at night.\r","Go; I'll to dinner: hie you to the cell.\r","\r","JULIET:\r","Hie to high fortune! Honest nurse, farewell.\r","\r","FRIAR LAURENCE:\r","So smile the heavens upon this holy act,\r","That after hours with sorrow chide us not!\r","\r","ROMEO:\r","Amen, amen! but come what sorrow can,\r","It cannot countervail the exchange of joy\r","That one short minute gives me in her sight:\r","Do thou but close our hands with holy words,\r","Then love-devouring death do what he dare;\r","It is enough I may but call her mine.\r","\r","FRIAR LAURENCE:\r","These violent delights have violent ends\r","And in their triumph die, like fire and powder,\r","Which as they kiss consume: the sweetest honey\r","Is loathsome in his own deliciousness\r","And in the taste confounds the appetite:\r","Therefore love moderately; long love doth so;\r","Too swift arrives as tardy as too slow.\r","Here comes the lady: O, so light a foot\r","Will ne'er wear out the everlasting flint:\r","A lover may bestride the gossamer\r","That idles in the wanton summer air,\r","And yet not fall; so light is vanity.\r","\r","JULIET:\r","Good even to my ghostly confessor.\r","\r","FRIAR LAURENCE:\r","Romeo shall thank thee, daughter, for us both.\r","\r","JULIET:\r","As much to him, else is his thanks too much.\r","\r","ROMEO:\r","Ah, Juliet, if the measure of thy joy\r","Be heap'd like mine and that thy skill be more\r","To blazon it, then sweeten with thy breath\r","This neighbour air, and let rich music's tongue\r","Unfold the imagined happiness that both\r","Receive in either by this dear encounter.\r","\r","JULIET:\r","Conceit, more rich in matter than in words,\r","Brags of his substance, not of ornament:\r","They are but beggars that can count their worth;\r","But my true love is grown to such excess\r","I cannot sum up sum of half my wealth.\r","\r","FRIAR LAURENCE:\r","Come, come with me, and we will make short work;\r","For, by your leaves, you shall not stay alone\r","Till holy church incorporate two in one.\r","\r","BENVOLIO:\r","I pray thee, good Mercutio, let's retire:\r","The day is hot, the Capulets abroad,\r","And, if we meet, we shall not scape a brawl;\r","For now, these hot days, is the mad blood stirring.\r","\r","MERCUTIO:\r","Thou art like one of those fellows that when he\r","enters the confines of a tavern claps me his sword\r","upon the table and says 'God send me no need of\r","thee!' and by the operation of the second cup draws\r","it on the drawer, when indeed there is no need.\r","\r","BENVOLIO:\r","Am I like such a fellow?\r","\r","MERCUTIO:\r","Come, come, thou art as hot a Jack in thy mood as\r","any in Italy, and as soon moved to be moody, and as\r","soon moody to be moved.\r","\r","BENVOLIO:\r","And what to?\r","\r","MERCUTIO:\r","Nay, an there were two such, we should have none\r","shortly, for one would kill the other. Thou! why,\r","thou wilt quarrel with a man that hath a hair more,\r","or a hair less, in his beard, than thou hast: thou\r","wilt quarrel with a man for cracking nuts, having no\r","other reason but because thou hast hazel eyes: what\r","eye but such an eye would spy out such a quarrel?\r","Thy head is as fun of quarrels as an egg is full of\r","meat, and yet thy head hath been beaten as addle as\r","an egg for quarrelling: thou hast quarrelled with a\r","man for coughing in the street, because he hath\r","wakened thy dog that hath lain asleep in the sun:\r","didst thou not fall out with a tailor for wearing\r","his new doublet before Easter? with another, for\r","tying his new shoes with old riband? and yet thou\r","wilt tutor me from quarrelling!\r","\r","BENVOLIO:\r","An I were so apt to quarrel as thou art, any man\r","should buy the fee-simple of my life for an hour and a quarter.\r","\r","MERCUTIO:\r","The fee-simple! O simple!\r","\r","BENVOLIO:\r","By my head, here come the Capulets.\r","\r","MERCUTIO:\r","By my heel, I care not.\r","\r","TYBALT:\r","Follow me close, for I will speak to them.\r","Gentlemen, good den: a word with one of you.\r","\r","MERCUTIO:\r","And but one word with one of us? couple it with\r","something; make it a word and a blow.\r","\r","TYBALT:\r","You shall find me apt enough to that, sir, an you\r","will give me occasion.\r","\r","MERCUTIO:\r","Could you not take some occasion without giving?\r","\r","TYBALT:\r","Mercutio, thou consort'st with Romeo,--\r","\r","MERCUTIO:\r","Consort! what, dost thou make us minstrels? an\r","thou make minstrels of us, look to hear nothing but\r","discords: here's my fiddlestick; here's that shall\r","make you dance. 'Zounds, consort!\r","\r","BENVOLIO:\r","We talk here in the public haunt of men:\r","Either withdraw unto some private place,\r","And reason coldly of your grievances,\r","Or else depart; here all eyes gaze on us.\r","\r","MERCUTIO:\r","Men's eyes were made to look, and let them gaze;\r","I will not budge for no man's pleasure, I.\r","\r","TYBALT:\r","Well, peace be with you, sir: here comes my man.\r","\r","MERCUTIO:\r","But I'll be hanged, sir, if he wear your livery:\r","Marry, go before to field, he'll be your follower;\r","Your worship in that sense may call him 'man.'\r","\r","TYBALT:\r","Romeo, the hate I bear thee can afford\r","No better term than this,--thou art a villain.\r","\r","ROMEO:\r","Tybalt, the reason that I have to love thee\r","Doth much excuse the appertaining rage\r","To such a greeting: villain am I none;\r","Therefore farewell; I see thou know'st me not.\r","\r","TYBALT:\r","Boy, this shall not excuse the injuries\r","That thou hast done me; therefore turn and draw.\r","\r","ROMEO:\r","I do protest, I never injured thee,\r","But love thee better than thou canst devise,\r","Till thou shalt know the reason of my love:\r","And so, good Capulet,--which name I tender\r","As dearly as my own,--be satisfied.\r","\r","MERCUTIO:\r","O calm, dishonourable, vile submission!\r","Alla stoccata carries it away.\r","Tybalt, you rat-catcher, will you walk?\r","\r","TYBALT:\r","What wouldst thou have with me?\r","\r","MERCUTIO:\r","Good king of cats, nothing but one of your nine\r","lives; that I mean to make bold withal, and as you\r","shall use me hereafter, drybeat the rest of the\r","eight. Will you pluck your sword out of his pitcher\r","by the ears? make haste, lest mine be about your\r","ears ere it be out.\r","\r","TYBALT:\r","I am for you.\r","\r","ROMEO:\r","Gentle Mercutio, put thy rapier up.\r","\r","MERCUTIO:\r","Come, sir, your passado.\r","\r","ROMEO:\r","Draw, Benvolio; beat down their weapons.\r","Gentlemen, for shame, forbear this outrage!\r","Tybalt, Mercutio, the prince expressly hath\r","Forbidden bandying in Verona streets:\r","Hold, Tybalt! good Mercutio!\r","\r","MERCUTIO:\r","I am hurt.\r","A plague o' both your houses! I am sped.\r","Is he gone, and hath nothing?\r","\r","BENVOLIO:\r","What, art thou hurt?\r","\r","MERCUTIO:\r","Ay, ay, a scratch, a scratch; marry, 'tis enough.\r","Where is my page? Go, villain, fetch a surgeon.\r","\r","ROMEO:\r","Courage, man; the hurt cannot be much.\r","\r","MERCUTIO:\r","No, 'tis not so deep as a well, nor so wide as a\r","church-door; but 'tis enough,'twill serve: ask for\r","me to-morrow, and you shall find me a grave man. I\r","am peppered, I warrant, for this world. A plague o'\r","both your houses! 'Zounds, a dog, a rat, a mouse, a\r","cat, to scratch a man to death! a braggart, a\r","rogue, a villain, that fights by the book of\r","arithmetic! Why the devil came you between us? I\r","was hurt under your arm.\r","\r","ROMEO:\r","I thought all for the best.\r","\r","MERCUTIO:\r","Help me into some house, Benvolio,\r","Or I shall faint. A plague o' both your houses!\r","They have made worms' meat of me: I have it,\r","And soundly too: your houses!\r","\r","ROMEO:\r","This gentleman, the prince's near ally,\r","My very friend, hath got his mortal hurt\r","In my behalf; my reputation stain'd\r","With Tybalt's slander,--Tybalt, that an hour\r","Hath been my kinsman! O sweet Juliet,\r","Thy beauty hath made me effeminate\r","And in my temper soften'd valour's steel!\r","\r","BENVOLIO:\r","O Romeo, Romeo, brave Mercutio's dead!\r","That gallant spirit hath aspired the clouds,\r","Which too untimely here did scorn the earth.\r","\r","ROMEO:\r","This day's black fate on more days doth depend;\r","This but begins the woe, others must end.\r","\r","BENVOLIO:\r","Here comes the furious Tybalt back again.\r","\r","ROMEO:\r","Alive, in triumph! and Mercutio slain!\r","Away to heaven, respective lenity,\r","And fire-eyed fury be my conduct now!\r","Now, Tybalt, take the villain back again,\r","That late thou gavest me; for Mercutio's soul\r","Is but a little way above our heads,\r","Staying for thine to keep him company:\r","Either thou, or I, or both, must go with him.\r","\r","TYBALT:\r","Thou, wretched boy, that didst consort him here,\r","Shalt with him hence.\r","\r","ROMEO:\r","This shall determine that.\r","\r","BENVOLIO:\r","Romeo, away, be gone!\r","The citizens are up, and Tybalt slain.\r","Stand not amazed: the prince will doom thee death,\r","If thou art taken: hence, be gone, away!\r","\r","ROMEO:\r","O, I am fortune's fool!\r","\r","BENVOLIO:\r","Why dost thou stay?\r","\r","First Citizen:\r","Which way ran he that kill'd Mercutio?\r","Tybalt, that murderer, which way ran he?\r","\r","BENVOLIO:\r","There lies that Tybalt.\r","\r","First Citizen:\r","Up, sir, go with me;\r","I charge thee in the princes name, obey.\r","\r","PRINCE:\r","Where are the vile beginners of this fray?\r","\r","BENVOLIO:\r","O noble prince, I can discover all\r","The unlucky manage of this fatal brawl:\r","There lies the man, slain by young Romeo,\r","That slew thy kinsman, brave Mercutio.\r","\r","LADY CAPULET:\r","Tybalt, my cousin! O my brother's child!\r","O prince! O cousin! husband! O, the blood is spilt\r","O my dear kinsman! Prince, as thou art true,\r","For blood of ours, shed blood of Montague.\r","O cousin, cousin!\r","\r","PRINCE:\r","Benvolio, who began this bloody fray?\r","\r","BENVOLIO:\r","Tybalt, here slain, whom Romeo's hand did slay;\r","Romeo that spoke him fair, bade him bethink\r","How nice the quarrel was, and urged withal\r","Your high displeasure: all this uttered\r","With gentle breath, calm look, knees humbly bow'd,\r","Could not take truce with the unruly spleen\r","Of Tybalt deaf to peace, but that he tilts\r","With piercing steel at bold Mercutio's breast,\r","Who all as hot, turns deadly point to point,\r","And, with a martial scorn, with one hand beats\r","Cold death aside, and with the other sends\r","It back to Tybalt, whose dexterity,\r","Retorts it: Romeo he cries aloud,\r","'Hold, friends! friends, part!' and, swifter than\r","his tongue,\r","His agile arm beats down their fatal points,\r","And 'twixt them rushes; underneath whose arm\r","An envious thrust from Tybalt hit the life\r","Of stout Mercutio, and then Tybalt fled;\r","But by and by comes back to Romeo,\r","Who had but newly entertain'd revenge,\r","And to 't they go like lightning, for, ere I\r","Could draw to part them, was stout Tybalt slain.\r","And, as he fell, did Romeo turn and fly.\r","This is the truth, or let Benvolio die.\r","\r","LADY CAPULET:\r","He is a kinsman to the Montague;\r","Affection makes him false; he speaks not true:\r","Some twenty of them fought in this black strife,\r","And all those twenty could but kill one life.\r","I beg for justice, which thou, prince, must give;\r","Romeo slew Tybalt, Romeo must not live.\r","\r","PRINCE:\r","Romeo slew him, he slew Mercutio;\r","Who now the price of his dear blood doth owe?\r","\r","MONTAGUE:\r","Not Romeo, prince, he was Mercutio's friend;\r","His fault concludes but what the law should end,\r","The life of Tybalt.\r","\r","PRINCE:\r","And for that offence\r","Immediately we do exile him hence:\r","I have an interest in your hate's proceeding,\r","My blood for your rude brawls doth lie a-bleeding;\r","But I'll amerce you with so strong a fine\r","That you shall all repent the loss of mine:\r","I will be deaf to pleading and excuses;\r","Nor tears nor prayers shall purchase out abuses:\r","Therefore use none: let Romeo hence in haste,\r","Else, when he's found, that hour is his last.\r","Bear hence this body and attend our will:\r","Mercy but murders, pardoning those that kill.\r","\r","JULIET:\r","Gallop apace, you fiery-footed steeds,\r","Towards Phoebus' lodging: such a wagoner\r","As Phaethon would whip you to the west,\r","And bring in cloudy night immediately.\r","Spread thy close curtain, love-performing night,\r","That runaway's eyes may wink and Romeo\r","Leap to these arms, untalk'd of and unseen.\r","Lovers can see to do their amorous rites\r","By their own beauties; or, if love be blind,\r","It best agrees with night. Come, civil night,\r","Thou sober-suited matron, all in black,\r","And learn me how to lose a winning match,\r","Play'd for a pair of stainless maidenhoods:\r","Hood my unmann'd blood, bating in my cheeks,\r","With thy black mantle; till strange love, grown bold,\r","Think true love acted simple modesty.\r","Come, night; come, Romeo; come, thou day in night;\r","For thou wilt lie upon the wings of night\r","Whiter than new snow on a raven's back.\r","Come, gentle night, come, loving, black-brow'd night,\r","Give me my Romeo; and, when he shall die,\r","Take him and cut him out in little stars,\r","And he will make the face of heaven so fine\r","That all the world will be in love with night\r","And pay no worship to the garish sun.\r","O, I have bought the mansion of a love,\r","But not possess'd it, and, though I am sold,\r","Not yet enjoy'd: so tedious is this day\r","As is the night before some festival\r","To an impatient child that hath new robes\r","And may not wear them. O, here comes my nurse,\r","And she brings news; and every tongue that speaks\r","But Romeo's name speaks heavenly eloquence.\r","Now, nurse, what news? What hast thou there? the cords\r","That Romeo bid thee fetch?\r","\r","Nurse:\r","Ay, ay, the cords.\r","\r","JULIET:\r","Ay me! what news? why dost thou wring thy hands?\r","\r","Nurse:\r","Ah, well-a-day! he's dead, he's dead, he's dead!\r","We are undone, lady, we are undone!\r","Alack the day! he's gone, he's kill'd, he's dead!\r","\r","JULIET:\r","Can heaven be so envious?\r","\r","Nurse:\r","Romeo can,\r","Though heaven cannot: O Romeo, Romeo!\r","Who ever would have thought it? Romeo!\r","\r","JULIET:\r","What devil art thou, that dost torment me thus?\r","This torture should be roar'd in dismal hell.\r","Hath Romeo slain himself? say thou but 'I,'\r","And that bare vowel 'I' shall poison more\r","Than the death-darting eye of cockatrice:\r","I am not I, if there be such an I;\r","Or those eyes shut, that make thee answer 'I.'\r","If he be slain, say 'I'; or if not, no:\r","Brief sounds determine of my weal or woe.\r","\r","Nurse:\r","I saw the wound, I saw it with mine eyes,--\r","God save the mark!--here on his manly breast:\r","A piteous corse, a bloody piteous corse;\r","Pale, pale as ashes, all bedaub'd in blood,\r","All in gore-blood; I swounded at the sight.\r","\r","JULIET:\r","O, break, my heart! poor bankrupt, break at once!\r","To prison, eyes, ne'er look on liberty!\r","Vile earth, to earth resign; end motion here;\r","And thou and Romeo press one heavy bier!\r","\r","Nurse:\r","O Tybalt, Tybalt, the best friend I had!\r","O courteous Tybalt! honest gentleman!\r","That ever I should live to see thee dead!\r","\r","JULIET:\r","What storm is this that blows so contrary?\r","Is Romeo slaughter'd, and is Tybalt dead?\r","My dear-loved cousin, and my dearer lord?\r","Then, dreadful trumpet, sound the general doom!\r","For who is living, if those two are gone?\r","\r","Nurse:\r","Tybalt is gone, and Romeo banished;\r","Romeo that kill'd him, he is banished.\r","\r","JULIET:\r","O God! did Romeo's hand shed Tybalt's blood?\r","\r","Nurse:\r","It did, it did; alas the day, it did!\r","\r","JULIET:\r","O serpent heart, hid with a flowering face!\r","Did ever dragon keep so fair a cave?\r","Beautiful tyrant! fiend angelical!\r","Dove-feather'd raven! wolvish-ravening lamb!\r","Despised substance of divinest show!\r","Just opposite to what thou justly seem'st,\r","A damned saint, an honourable villain!\r","O nature, what hadst thou to do in hell,\r","When thou didst bower the spirit of a fiend\r","In moral paradise of such sweet flesh?\r","Was ever book containing such vile matter\r","So fairly bound? O that deceit should dwell\r","In such a gorgeous palace!\r","\r","Nurse:\r","There's no trust,\r","No faith, no honesty in men; all perjured,\r","All forsworn, all naught, all dissemblers.\r","Ah, where's my man? give me some aqua vitae:\r","These griefs, these woes, these sorrows make me old.\r","Shame come to Romeo!\r","\r","JULIET:\r","Blister'd be thy tongue\r","For such a wish! he was not born to shame:\r","Upon his brow shame is ashamed to sit;\r","For 'tis a throne where honour may be crown'd\r","Sole monarch of the universal earth.\r","O, what a beast was I to chide at him!\r","\r","Nurse:\r","Will you speak well of him that kill'd your cousin?\r","\r","JULIET:\r","Shall I speak ill of him that is my husband?\r","Ah, poor my lord, what tongue shall smooth thy name,\r","When I, thy three-hours wife, have mangled it?\r","But, wherefore, villain, didst thou kill my cousin?\r","That villain cousin would have kill'd my husband:\r","Back, foolish tears, back to your native spring;\r","Your tributary drops belong to woe,\r","Which you, mistaking, offer up to joy.\r","My husband lives, that Tybalt would have slain;\r","And Tybalt's dead, that would have slain my husband:\r","All this is comfort; wherefore weep I then?\r","Some word there was, worser than Tybalt's death,\r","That murder'd me: I would forget it fain;\r","But, O, it presses to my memory,\r","Like damned guilty deeds to sinners' minds:\r","'Tybalt is dead, and Romeo--banished;'\r","That 'banished,' that one word 'banished,'\r","Hath slain ten thousand Tybalts. Tybalt's death\r","Was woe enough, if it had ended there:\r","Or, if sour woe delights in fellowship\r","And needly will be rank'd with other griefs,\r","Why follow'd not, when she said 'Tybalt's dead,'\r","Thy father, or thy mother, nay, or both,\r","Which modern lamentations might have moved?\r","But with a rear-ward following Tybalt's death,\r","'Romeo is banished,' to speak that word,\r","Is father, mother, Tybalt, Romeo, Juliet,\r","All slain, all dead. 'Romeo is banished!'\r","There is no end, no limit, measure, bound,\r","In that word's death; no words can that woe sound.\r","Where is my father, and my mother, nurse?\r","\r","Nurse:\r","Weeping and wailing over Tybalt's corse:\r","Will you go to them? I will bring you thither.\r","\r","JULIET:\r","Wash they his wounds with tears: mine shall be spent,\r","When theirs are dry, for Romeo's banishment.\r","Take up those cords: poor ropes, you are beguiled,\r","Both you and I; for Romeo is exiled:\r","He made you for a highway to my bed;\r","But I, a maid, die maiden-widowed.\r","Come, cords, come, nurse; I'll to my wedding-bed;\r","And death, not Romeo, take my maidenhead!\r","\r","Nurse:\r","Hie to your chamber: I'll find Romeo\r","To comfort you: I wot well where he is.\r","Hark ye, your Romeo will be here at night:\r","I'll to him; he is hid at Laurence' cell.\r","\r","JULIET:\r","O, find him! give this ring to my true knight,\r","And bid him come to take his last farewell.\r","\r","FRIAR LAURENCE:\r","Romeo, come forth; come forth, thou fearful man:\r","Affliction is enamour'd of thy parts,\r","And thou art wedded to calamity.\r","\r","ROMEO:\r","Father, what news? what is the prince's doom?\r","What sorrow craves acquaintance at my hand,\r","That I yet know not?\r","\r","FRIAR LAURENCE:\r","Too familiar\r","Is my dear son with such sour company:\r","I bring thee tidings of the prince's doom.\r","\r","ROMEO:\r","What less than dooms-day is the prince's doom?\r","\r","FRIAR LAURENCE:\r","A gentler judgment vanish'd from his lips,\r","Not body's death, but body's banishment.\r","\r","ROMEO:\r","Ha, banishment! be merciful, say 'death;'\r","For exile hath more terror in his look,\r","Much more than death: do not say 'banishment.'\r","\r","FRIAR LAURENCE:\r","Hence from Verona art thou banished:\r","Be patient, for the world is broad and wide.\r","\r","ROMEO:\r","There is no world without Verona walls,\r","But purgatory, torture, hell itself.\r","Hence-banished is banish'd from the world,\r","And world's exile is death: then banished,\r","Is death mis-term'd: calling death banishment,\r","Thou cutt'st my head off with a golden axe,\r","And smilest upon the stroke that murders me.\r","\r","FRIAR LAURENCE:\r","O deadly sin! O rude unthankfulness!\r","Thy fault our law calls death; but the kind prince,\r","Taking thy part, hath rush'd aside the law,\r","And turn'd that black word death to banishment:\r","This is dear mercy, and thou seest it not.\r","\r","ROMEO:\r","'Tis torture, and not mercy: heaven is here,\r","Where Juliet lives; and every cat and dog\r","And little mouse, every unworthy thing,\r","Live here in heaven and may look on her;\r","But Romeo may not: more validity,\r","More honourable state, more courtship lives\r","In carrion-flies than Romeo: they my seize\r","On the white wonder of dear Juliet's hand\r","And steal immortal blessing from her lips,\r","Who even in pure and vestal modesty,\r","Still blush, as thinking their own kisses sin;\r","But Romeo may not; he is banished:\r","Flies may do this, but I from this must fly:\r","They are free men, but I am banished.\r","And say'st thou yet that exile is not death?\r","Hadst thou no poison mix'd, no sharp-ground knife,\r","No sudden mean of death, though ne'er so mean,\r","But 'banished' to kill me?--'banished'?\r","O friar, the damned use that word in hell;\r","Howlings attend it: how hast thou the heart,\r","Being a divine, a ghostly confessor,\r","A sin-absolver, and my friend profess'd,\r","To mangle me with that word 'banished'?\r","\r","FRIAR LAURENCE:\r","Thou fond mad man, hear me but speak a word.\r","\r","ROMEO:\r","O, thou wilt speak again of banishment.\r","\r","FRIAR LAURENCE:\r","I'll give thee armour to keep off that word:\r","Adversity's sweet milk, philosophy,\r","To comfort thee, though thou art banished.\r","\r","ROMEO:\r","Yet 'banished'? Hang up philosophy!\r","Unless philosophy can make a Juliet,\r","Displant a town, reverse a prince's doom,\r","It helps not, it prevails not: talk no more.\r","\r","FRIAR LAURENCE:\r","O, then I see that madmen have no ears.\r","\r","ROMEO:\r","How should they, when that wise men have no eyes?\r","\r","FRIAR LAURENCE:\r","Let me dispute with thee of thy estate.\r","\r","ROMEO:\r","Thou canst not speak of that thou dost not feel:\r","Wert thou as young as I, Juliet thy love,\r","An hour but married, Tybalt murdered,\r","Doting like me and like me banished,\r","Then mightst thou speak, then mightst thou tear thy hair,\r","And fall upon the ground, as I do now,\r","Taking the measure of an unmade grave.\r","\r","FRIAR LAURENCE:\r","Arise; one knocks; good Romeo, hide thyself.\r","\r","ROMEO:\r","Not I; unless the breath of heartsick groans,\r","Mist-like, infold me from the search of eyes.\r","\r","FRIAR LAURENCE:\r","Hark, how they knock! Who's there? Romeo, arise;\r","Thou wilt be taken. Stay awhile! Stand up;\r","Run to my study. By and by! God's will,\r","What simpleness is this! I come, I come!\r","Who knocks so hard? whence come you? what's your will?\r","\r","Nurse:\r","\r","FRIAR LAURENCE:\r","Welcome, then.\r","\r","Nurse:\r","O holy friar, O, tell me, holy friar,\r","Where is my lady's lord, where's Romeo?\r","\r","FRIAR LAURENCE:\r","There on the ground, with his own tears made drunk.\r","\r","Nurse:\r","O, he is even in my mistress' case,\r","Just in her case! O woful sympathy!\r","Piteous predicament! Even so lies she,\r","Blubbering and weeping, weeping and blubbering.\r","Stand up, stand up; stand, and you be a man:\r","For Juliet's sake, for her sake, rise and stand;\r","Why should you fall into so deep an O?\r","\r","ROMEO:\r","Nurse!\r","\r","Nurse:\r","Ah sir! ah sir! Well, death's the end of all.\r","\r","ROMEO:\r","Spakest thou of Juliet? how is it with her?\r","Doth she not think me an old murderer,\r","Now I have stain'd the childhood of our joy\r","With blood removed but little from her own?\r","Where is she? and how doth she? and what says\r","My conceal'd lady to our cancell'd love?\r","\r","Nurse:\r","O, she says nothing, sir, but weeps and weeps;\r","And now falls on her bed; and then starts up,\r","And Tybalt calls; and then on Romeo cries,\r","And then down falls again.\r","\r","ROMEO:\r","As if that name,\r","Shot from the deadly level of a gun,\r","Did murder her; as that name's cursed hand\r","Murder'd her kinsman. O, tell me, friar, tell me,\r","In what vile part of this anatomy\r","Doth my name lodge? tell me, that I may sack\r","The hateful mansion.\r","\r","FRIAR LAURENCE:\r","Hold thy desperate hand:\r","Art thou a man? thy form cries out thou art:\r","Thy tears are womanish; thy wild acts denote\r","The unreasonable fury of a beast:\r","Unseemly woman in a seeming man!\r","Or ill-beseeming beast in seeming both!\r","Thou hast amazed me: by my holy order,\r","I thought thy disposition better temper'd.\r","Hast thou slain Tybalt? wilt thou slay thyself?\r","And stay thy lady too that lives in thee,\r","By doing damned hate upon thyself?\r","Why rail'st thou on thy birth, the heaven, and earth?\r","Since birth, and heaven, and earth, all three do meet\r","In thee at once; which thou at once wouldst lose.\r","Fie, fie, thou shamest thy shape, thy love, thy wit;\r","Which, like a usurer, abound'st in all,\r","And usest none in that true use indeed\r","Which should bedeck thy shape, thy love, thy wit:\r","Thy noble shape is but a form of wax,\r","Digressing from the valour of a man;\r","Thy dear love sworn but hollow perjury,\r","Killing that love which thou hast vow'd to cherish;\r","Thy wit, that ornament to shape and love,\r","Misshapen in the conduct of them both,\r","Like powder in a skitless soldier's flask,\r","Is set afire by thine own ignorance,\r","And thou dismember'd with thine own defence.\r","What, rouse thee, man! thy Juliet is alive,\r","For whose dear sake thou wast but lately dead;\r","There art thou happy: Tybalt would kill thee,\r","But thou slew'st Tybalt; there are thou happy too:\r","The law that threaten'd death becomes thy friend\r","And turns it to exile; there art thou happy:\r","A pack of blessings lights up upon thy back;\r","Happiness courts thee in her best array;\r","But, like a misbehaved and sullen wench,\r","Thou pout'st upon thy fortune and thy love:\r","Take heed, take heed, for such die miserable.\r","Go, get thee to thy love, as was decreed,\r","Ascend her chamber, hence and comfort her:\r","But look thou stay not till the watch be set,\r","For then thou canst not pass to Mantua;\r","Where thou shalt live, till we can find a time\r","To blaze your marriage, reconcile your friends,\r","Beg pardon of the prince, and call thee back\r","With twenty hundred thousand times more joy\r","Than thou went'st forth in lamentation.\r","Go before, nurse: commend me to thy lady;\r","And bid her hasten all the house to bed,\r","Which heavy sorrow makes them apt unto:\r","Romeo is coming.\r","\r","Nurse:\r","O Lord, I could have stay'd here all the night\r","To hear good counsel: O, what learning is!\r","My lord, I'll tell my lady you will come.\r","\r","ROMEO:\r","Do so, and bid my sweet prepare to chide.\r","\r","Nurse:\r","Here, sir, a ring she bid me give you, sir:\r","Hie you, make haste, for it grows very late.\r","\r","ROMEO:\r","How well my comfort is revived by this!\r","\r","FRIAR LAURENCE:\r","Go hence; good night; and here stands all your state:\r","Either be gone before the watch be set,\r","Or by the break of day disguised from hence:\r","Sojourn in Mantua; I'll find out your man,\r","And he shall signify from time to time\r","Every good hap to you that chances here:\r","Give me thy hand; 'tis late: farewell; good night.\r","\r","ROMEO:\r","But that a joy past joy calls out on me,\r","It were a grief, so brief to part with thee: Farewell.\r","\r","CAPULET:\r","Things have fall'n out, sir, so unluckily,\r","That we have had no time to move our daughter:\r","Look you, she loved her kinsman Tybalt dearly,\r","And so did I:--Well, we were born to die.\r","'Tis very late, she'll not come down to-night:\r","I promise you, but for your company,\r","I would have been a-bed an hour ago.\r","\r","PARIS:\r","These times of woe afford no time to woo.\r","Madam, good night: commend me to your daughter.\r","\r","LADY CAPULET:\r","I will, and know her mind early to-morrow;\r","To-night she is mew'd up to her heaviness.\r","\r","CAPULET:\r","Sir Paris, I will make a desperate tender\r","Of my child's love: I think she will be ruled\r","In all respects by me; nay, more, I doubt it not.\r","Wife, go you to her ere you go to bed;\r","Acquaint her here of my son Paris' love;\r","And bid her, mark you me, on Wednesday next--\r","But, soft! what day is this?\r","\r","PARIS:\r","Monday, my lord,\r","\r","CAPULET:\r","Monday! ha, ha! Well, Wednesday is too soon,\r","O' Thursday let it be: o' Thursday, tell her,\r","She shall be married to this noble earl.\r","Will you be ready? do you like this haste?\r","We'll keep no great ado,--a friend or two;\r","For, hark you, Tybalt being slain so late,\r","It may be thought we held him carelessly,\r","Being our kinsman, if we revel much:\r","Therefore we'll have some half a dozen friends,\r","And there an end. But what say you to Thursday?\r","\r","PARIS:\r","My lord, I would that Thursday were to-morrow.\r","\r","CAPULET:\r","Well get you gone: o' Thursday be it, then.\r","Go you to Juliet ere you go to bed,\r","Prepare her, wife, against this wedding-day.\r","Farewell, my lord. Light to my chamber, ho!\r","Afore me! it is so very very late,\r","That we may call it early by and by.\r","Good night.\r","\r","JULIET:\r","Wilt thou be gone? it is not yet near day:\r","It was the nightingale, and not the lark,\r","That pierced the fearful hollow of thine ear;\r","Nightly she sings on yon pomegranate-tree:\r","Believe me, love, it was the nightingale.\r","\r","ROMEO:\r","It was the lark, the herald of the morn,\r","No nightingale: look, love, what envious streaks\r","Do lace the severing clouds in yonder east:\r","Night's candles are burnt out, and jocund day\r","Stands tiptoe on the misty mountain tops.\r","I must be gone and live, or stay and die.\r","\r","JULIET:\r","Yon light is not day-light, I know it, I:\r","It is some meteor that the sun exhales,\r","To be to thee this night a torch-bearer,\r","And light thee on thy way to Mantua:\r","Therefore stay yet; thou need'st not to be gone.\r","\r","ROMEO:\r","Let me be ta'en, let me be put to death;\r","I am content, so thou wilt have it so.\r","I'll say yon grey is not the morning's eye,\r","'Tis but the pale reflex of Cynthia's brow;\r","Nor that is not the lark, whose notes do beat\r","The vaulty heaven so high above our heads:\r","I have more care to stay than will to go:\r","Come, death, and welcome! Juliet wills it so.\r","How is't, my soul? let's talk; it is not day.\r","\r","JULIET:\r","It is, it is: hie hence, be gone, away!\r","It is the lark that sings so out of tune,\r","Straining harsh discords and unpleasing sharps.\r","Some say the lark makes sweet division;\r","This doth not so, for she divideth us:\r","Some say the lark and loathed toad change eyes,\r","O, now I would they had changed voices too!\r","Since arm from arm that voice doth us affray,\r","Hunting thee hence with hunt's-up to the day,\r","O, now be gone; more light and light it grows.\r","\r","ROMEO:\r","More light and light; more dark and dark our woes!\r","\r","Nurse:\r","Madam!\r","\r","JULIET:\r","Nurse?\r","\r","Nurse:\r","Your lady mother is coming to your chamber:\r","The day is broke; be wary, look about.\r","\r","JULIET:\r","Then, window, let day in, and let life out.\r","\r","ROMEO:\r","Farewell, farewell! one kiss, and I'll descend.\r","\r","JULIET:\r","Art thou gone so? love, lord, ay, husband, friend!\r","I must hear from thee every day in the hour,\r","For in a minute there are many days:\r","O, by this count I shall be much in years\r","Ere I again behold my Romeo!\r","\r","ROMEO:\r","Farewell!\r","I will omit no opportunity\r","That may convey my greetings, love, to thee.\r","\r","JULIET:\r","O think'st thou we shall ever meet again?\r","\r","ROMEO:\r","I doubt it not; and all these woes shall serve\r","For sweet discourses in our time to come.\r","\r","JULIET:\r","O God, I have an ill-divining soul!\r","Methinks I see thee, now thou art below,\r","As one dead in the bottom of a tomb:\r","Either my eyesight fails, or thou look'st pale.\r","\r","ROMEO:\r","And trust me, love, in my eye so do you:\r","Dry sorrow drinks our blood. Adieu, adieu!\r","\r","JULIET:\r","O fortune, fortune! all men call thee fickle:\r","If thou art fickle, what dost thou with him.\r","That is renown'd for faith? Be fickle, fortune;\r","For then, I hope, thou wilt not keep him long,\r","But send him back.\r","\r","LADY CAPULET:\r","\r","JULIET:\r","Who is't that calls? is it my lady mother?\r","Is she not down so late, or up so early?\r","What unaccustom'd cause procures her hither?\r","\r","LADY CAPULET:\r","Why, how now, Juliet!\r","\r","JULIET:\r","Madam, I am not well.\r","\r","LADY CAPULET:\r","Evermore weeping for your cousin's death?\r","What, wilt thou wash him from his grave with tears?\r","An if thou couldst, thou couldst not make him live;\r","Therefore, have done: some grief shows much of love;\r","But much of grief shows still some want of wit.\r","\r","JULIET:\r","Yet let me weep for such a feeling loss.\r","\r","LADY CAPULET:\r","So shall you feel the loss, but not the friend\r","Which you weep for.\r","\r","JULIET:\r","Feeling so the loss,\r","Cannot choose but ever weep the friend.\r","\r","LADY CAPULET:\r","Well, girl, thou weep'st not so much for his death,\r","As that the villain lives which slaughter'd him.\r","\r","JULIET:\r","What villain madam?\r","\r","LADY CAPULET:\r","That same villain, Romeo.\r","\r","JULIET:\r","\r","LADY CAPULET:\r","That is, because the traitor murderer lives.\r","\r","JULIET:\r","Ay, madam, from the reach of these my hands:\r","Would none but I might venge my cousin's death!\r","\r","LADY CAPULET:\r","We will have vengeance for it, fear thou not:\r","Then weep no more. I'll send to one in Mantua,\r","Where that same banish'd runagate doth live,\r","Shall give him such an unaccustom'd dram,\r","That he shall soon keep Tybalt company:\r","And then, I hope, thou wilt be satisfied.\r","\r","JULIET:\r","Indeed, I never shall be satisfied\r","With Romeo, till I behold him--dead--\r","Is my poor heart for a kinsman vex'd.\r","Madam, if you could find out but a man\r","To bear a poison, I would temper it;\r","That Romeo should, upon receipt thereof,\r","Soon sleep in quiet. O, how my heart abhors\r","To hear him named, and cannot come to him.\r","To wreak the love I bore my cousin\r","Upon his body that slaughter'd him!\r","\r","LADY CAPULET:\r","Find thou the means, and I'll find such a man.\r","But now I'll tell thee joyful tidings, girl.\r","\r","JULIET:\r","And joy comes well in such a needy time:\r","What are they, I beseech your ladyship?\r","\r","LADY CAPULET:\r","Well, well, thou hast a careful father, child;\r","One who, to put thee from thy heaviness,\r","Hath sorted out a sudden day of joy,\r","That thou expect'st not nor I look'd not for.\r","\r","JULIET:\r","Madam, in happy time, what day is that?\r","\r","LADY CAPULET:\r","Marry, my child, early next Thursday morn,\r","The gallant, young and noble gentleman,\r","The County Paris, at Saint Peter's Church,\r","Shall happily make thee there a joyful bride.\r","\r","JULIET:\r","Now, by Saint Peter's Church and Peter too,\r","He shall not make me there a joyful bride.\r","I wonder at this haste; that I must wed\r","Ere he, that should be husband, comes to woo.\r","I pray you, tell my lord and father, madam,\r","I will not marry yet; and, when I do, I swear,\r","It shall be Romeo, whom you know I hate,\r","Rather than Paris. These are news indeed!\r","\r","LADY CAPULET:\r","Here comes your father; tell him so yourself,\r","And see how he will take it at your hands.\r","\r","CAPULET:\r","When the sun sets, the air doth drizzle dew;\r","But for the sunset of my brother's son\r","It rains downright.\r","How now! a conduit, girl? what, still in tears?\r","Evermore showering? In one little body\r","Thou counterfeit'st a bark, a sea, a wind;\r","For still thy eyes, which I may call the sea,\r","Do ebb and flow with tears; the bark thy body is,\r","Sailing in this salt flood; the winds, thy sighs;\r","Who, raging with thy tears, and they with them,\r","Without a sudden calm, will overset\r","Thy tempest-tossed body. How now, wife!\r","Have you deliver'd to her our decree?\r","\r","LADY CAPULET:\r","Ay, sir; but she will none, she gives you thanks.\r","I would the fool were married to her grave!\r","\r","CAPULET:\r","Soft! take me with you, take me with you, wife.\r","How! will she none? doth she not give us thanks?\r","Is she not proud? doth she not count her blest,\r","Unworthy as she is, that we have wrought\r","So worthy a gentleman to be her bridegroom?\r","\r","JULIET:\r","Not proud, you have; but thankful, that you have:\r","Proud can I never be of what I hate;\r","But thankful even for hate, that is meant love.\r","\r","CAPULET:\r","How now, how now, chop-logic! What is this?\r","'Proud,' and 'I thank you,' and 'I thank you not;'\r","And yet 'not proud,' mistress minion, you,\r","Thank me no thankings, nor, proud me no prouds,\r","But fettle your fine joints 'gainst Thursday next,\r","To go with Paris to Saint Peter's Church,\r","Or I will drag thee on a hurdle thither.\r","Out, you green-sickness carrion! out, you baggage!\r","You tallow-face!\r","\r","LADY CAPULET:\r","Fie, fie! what, are you mad?\r","\r","JULIET:\r","Good father, I beseech you on my knees,\r","Hear me with patience but to speak a word.\r","\r","CAPULET:\r","Hang thee, young baggage! disobedient wretch!\r","I tell thee what: get thee to church o' Thursday,\r","Or never after look me in the face:\r","Speak not, reply not, do not answer me;\r","My fingers itch. Wife, we scarce thought us blest\r","That God had lent us but this only child;\r","But now I see this one is one too much,\r","And that we have a curse in having her:\r","Out on her, hilding!\r","\r","Nurse:\r","God in heaven bless her!\r","You are to blame, my lord, to rate her so.\r","\r","CAPULET:\r","And why, my lady wisdom? hold your tongue,\r","Good prudence; smatter with your gossips, go.\r","\r","Nurse:\r","I speak no treason.\r","\r","CAPULET:\r","O, God ye god-den.\r","\r","Nurse:\r","May not one speak?\r","\r","CAPULET:\r","Peace, you mumbling fool!\r","Utter your gravity o'er a gossip's bowl;\r","For here we need it not.\r","\r","LADY CAPULET:\r","You are too hot.\r","\r","CAPULET:\r","God's bread! it makes me mad:\r","Day, night, hour, tide, time, work, play,\r","Alone, in company, still my care hath been\r","To have her match'd: and having now provided\r","A gentleman of noble parentage,\r","Of fair demesnes, youthful, and nobly train'd,\r","Stuff'd, as they say, with honourable parts,\r","Proportion'd as one's thought would wish a man;\r","And then to have a wretched puling fool,\r","A whining mammet, in her fortune's tender,\r","To answer 'I'll not wed; I cannot love,\r","I am too young; I pray you, pardon me.'\r","But, as you will not wed, I'll pardon you:\r","Graze where you will you shall not house with me:\r","Look to't, think on't, I do not use to jest.\r","Thursday is near; lay hand on heart, advise:\r","An you be mine, I'll give you to my friend;\r","And you be not, hang, beg, starve, die in\r","the streets,\r","For, by my soul, I'll ne'er acknowledge thee,\r","Nor what is mine shall never do thee good:\r","Trust to't, bethink you; I'll not be forsworn.\r","\r","JULIET:\r","Is there no pity sitting in the clouds,\r","That sees into the bottom of my grief?\r","O, sweet my mother, cast me not away!\r","Delay this marriage for a month, a week;\r","Or, if you do not, make the bridal bed\r","In that dim monument where Tybalt lies.\r","\r","LADY CAPULET:\r","Talk not to me, for I'll not speak a word:\r","Do as thou wilt, for I have done with thee.\r","\r","JULIET:\r","O God!--O nurse, how shall this be prevented?\r","My husband is on earth, my faith in heaven;\r","How shall that faith return again to earth,\r","Unless that husband send it me from heaven\r","By leaving earth? comfort me, counsel me.\r","Alack, alack, that heaven should practise stratagems\r","Upon so soft a subject as myself!\r","What say'st thou? hast thou not a word of joy?\r","Some comfort, nurse.\r","\r","Nurse:\r","Faith, here it is.\r","Romeo is banish'd; and all the world to nothing,\r","That he dares ne'er come back to challenge you;\r","Or, if he do, it needs must be by stealth.\r","Then, since the case so stands as now it doth,\r","I think it best you married with the county.\r","O, he's a lovely gentleman!\r","Romeo's a dishclout to him: an eagle, madam,\r","Hath not so green, so quick, so fair an eye\r","As Paris hath. Beshrew my very heart,\r","I think you are happy in this second match,\r","For it excels your first: or if it did not,\r","Your first is dead; or 'twere as good he were,\r","As living here and you no use of him.\r","\r","JULIET:\r","Speakest thou from thy heart?\r","\r","Nurse:\r","And from my soul too;\r","Or else beshrew them both.\r","\r","JULIET:\r","Amen!\r","\r","Nurse:\r","What?\r","\r","JULIET:\r","Well, thou hast comforted me marvellous much.\r","Go in: and tell my lady I am gone,\r","Having displeased my father, to Laurence' cell,\r","To make confession and to be absolved.\r","\r","Nurse:\r","Marry, I will; and this is wisely done.\r","\r","JULIET:\r","Ancient damnation! O most wicked fiend!\r","Is it more sin to wish me thus forsworn,\r","Or to dispraise my lord with that same tongue\r","Which she hath praised him with above compare\r","So many thousand times? Go, counsellor;\r","Thou and my bosom henceforth shall be twain.\r","I'll to the friar, to know his remedy:\r","If all else fail, myself have power to die.\r","\r","FRIAR LAURENCE:\r","On Thursday, sir? the time is very short.\r","\r","PARIS:\r","My father Capulet will have it so;\r","And I am nothing slow to slack his haste.\r","\r","FRIAR LAURENCE:\r","You say you do not know the lady's mind:\r","Uneven is the course, I like it not.\r","\r","PARIS:\r","Immoderately she weeps for Tybalt's death,\r","And therefore have I little talk'd of love;\r","For Venus smiles not in a house of tears.\r","Now, sir, her father counts it dangerous\r","That she doth give her sorrow so much sway,\r","And in his wisdom hastes our marriage,\r","To stop the inundation of her tears;\r","Which, too much minded by herself alone,\r","May be put from her by society:\r","Now do you know the reason of this haste.\r","\r","FRIAR LAURENCE:\r","\r","PARIS:\r","Happily met, my lady and my wife!\r","\r","JULIET:\r","That may be, sir, when I may be a wife.\r","\r","PARIS:\r","That may be must be, love, on Thursday next.\r","\r","JULIET:\r","What must be shall be.\r","\r","FRIAR LAURENCE:\r","That's a certain text.\r","\r","PARIS:\r","Come you to make confession to this father?\r","\r","JULIET:\r","To answer that, I should confess to you.\r","\r","PARIS:\r","Do not deny to him that you love me.\r","\r","JULIET:\r","I will confess to you that I love him.\r","\r","PARIS:\r","So will ye, I am sure, that you love me.\r","\r","JULIET:\r","If I do so, it will be of more price,\r","Being spoke behind your back, than to your face.\r","\r","PARIS:\r","Poor soul, thy face is much abused with tears.\r","\r","JULIET:\r","The tears have got small victory by that;\r","For it was bad enough before their spite.\r","\r","PARIS:\r","Thou wrong'st it, more than tears, with that report.\r","\r","JULIET:\r","That is no slander, sir, which is a truth;\r","And what I spake, I spake it to my face.\r","\r","PARIS:\r","Thy face is mine, and thou hast slander'd it.\r","\r","JULIET:\r","It may be so, for it is not mine own.\r","Are you at leisure, holy father, now;\r","Or shall I come to you at evening mass?\r","\r","FRIAR LAURENCE:\r","My leisure serves me, pensive daughter, now.\r","My lord, we must entreat the time alone.\r","\r","PARIS:\r","God shield I should disturb devotion!\r","Juliet, on Thursday early will I rouse ye:\r","Till then, adieu; and keep this holy kiss.\r","\r","JULIET:\r","O shut the door! and when thou hast done so,\r","Come weep with me; past hope, past cure, past help!\r","\r","FRIAR LAURENCE:\r","Ah, Juliet, I already know thy grief;\r","It strains me past the compass of my wits:\r","I hear thou must, and nothing may prorogue it,\r","On Thursday next be married to this county.\r","\r","JULIET:\r","Tell me not, friar, that thou hear'st of this,\r","Unless thou tell me how I may prevent it:\r","If, in thy wisdom, thou canst give no help,\r","Do thou but call my resolution wise,\r","And with this knife I'll help it presently.\r","God join'd my heart and Romeo's, thou our hands;\r","And ere this hand, by thee to Romeo seal'd,\r","Shall be the label to another deed,\r","Or my true heart with treacherous revolt\r","Turn to another, this shall slay them both:\r","Therefore, out of thy long-experienced time,\r","Give me some present counsel, or, behold,\r","'Twixt my extremes and me this bloody knife\r","Shall play the umpire, arbitrating that\r","Which the commission of thy years and art\r","Could to no issue of true honour bring.\r","Be not so long to speak; I long to die,\r","If what thou speak'st speak not of remedy.\r","\r","FRIAR LAURENCE:\r","Hold, daughter: I do spy a kind of hope,\r","Which craves as desperate an execution.\r","As that is desperate which we would prevent.\r","If, rather than to marry County Paris,\r","Thou hast the strength of will to slay thyself,\r","Then is it likely thou wilt undertake\r","A thing like death to chide away this shame,\r","That copest with death himself to scape from it:\r","And, if thou darest, I'll give thee remedy.\r","\r","JULIET:\r","O, bid me leap, rather than marry Paris,\r","From off the battlements of yonder tower;\r","Or walk in thievish ways; or bid me lurk\r","Where serpents are; chain me with roaring bears;\r","Or shut me nightly in a charnel-house,\r","O'er-cover'd quite with dead men's rattling bones,\r","With reeky shanks and yellow chapless skulls;\r","Or bid me go into a new-made grave\r","And hide me with a dead man in his shroud;\r","Things that, to hear them told, have made me tremble;\r","And I will do it without fear or doubt,\r","To live an unstain'd wife to my sweet love.\r","\r","FRIAR LAURENCE:\r","Hold, then; go home, be merry, give consent\r","To marry Paris: Wednesday is to-morrow:\r","To-morrow night look that thou lie alone;\r","Let not thy nurse lie with thee in thy chamber:\r","Take thou this vial, being then in bed,\r","And this distilled liquor drink thou off;\r","When presently through all thy veins shall run\r","A cold and drowsy humour, for no pulse\r","Shall keep his native progress, but surcease:\r","No warmth, no breath, shall testify thou livest;\r","The roses in thy lips and cheeks shall fade\r","To paly ashes, thy eyes' windows fall,\r","Like death, when he shuts up the day of life;\r","Each part, deprived of supple government,\r","Shall, stiff and stark and cold, appear like death:\r","And in this borrow'd likeness of shrunk death\r","Thou shalt continue two and forty hours,\r","And then awake as from a pleasant sleep.\r","Now, when the bridegroom in the morning comes\r","To rouse thee from thy bed, there art thou dead:\r","Then, as the manner of our country is,\r","In thy best robes uncover'd on the bier\r","Thou shalt be borne to that same ancient vault\r","Where all the kindred of the Capulets lie.\r","In the mean time, against thou shalt awake,\r","Shall Romeo by my letters know our drift,\r","And hither shall he come: and he and I\r","Will watch thy waking, and that very night\r","Shall Romeo bear thee hence to Mantua.\r","And this shall free thee from this present shame;\r","If no inconstant toy, nor womanish fear,\r","Abate thy valour in the acting it.\r","\r","JULIET:\r","Give me, give me! O, tell not me of fear!\r","\r","FRIAR LAURENCE:\r","Hold; get you gone, be strong and prosperous\r","In this resolve: I'll send a friar with speed\r","To Mantua, with my letters to thy lord.\r","\r","JULIET:\r","Love give me strength! and strength shall help afford.\r","Farewell, dear father!\r","\r","CAPULET:\r","So many guests invite as here are writ.\r","Sirrah, go hire me twenty cunning cooks.\r","\r","Second Servant:\r","You shall have none ill, sir; for I'll try if they\r","can lick their fingers.\r","\r","CAPULET:\r","How canst thou try them so?\r","\r","Second Servant:\r","Marry, sir, 'tis an ill cook that cannot lick his\r","own fingers: therefore he that cannot lick his\r","fingers goes not with me.\r","\r","CAPULET:\r","Go, be gone.\r","We shall be much unfurnished for this time.\r","What, is my daughter gone to Friar Laurence?\r","\r","Nurse:\r","Ay, forsooth.\r","\r","CAPULET:\r","Well, he may chance to do some good on her:\r","A peevish self-will'd harlotry it is.\r","\r","Nurse:\r","See where she comes from shrift with merry look.\r","\r","CAPULET:\r","How now, my headstrong! where have you been gadding?\r","\r","JULIET:\r","Where I have learn'd me to repent the sin\r","Of disobedient opposition\r","To you and your behests, and am enjoin'd\r","By holy Laurence to fall prostrate here,\r","And beg your pardon: pardon, I beseech you!\r","Henceforward I am ever ruled by you.\r","\r","CAPULET:\r","Send for the county; go tell him of this:\r","I'll have this knot knit up to-morrow morning.\r","\r","JULIET:\r","I met the youthful lord at Laurence' cell;\r","And gave him what becomed love I might,\r","Not step o'er the bounds of modesty.\r","\r","CAPULET:\r","Why, I am glad on't; this is well: stand up:\r","This is as't should be. Let me see the county;\r","Ay, marry, go, I say, and fetch him hither.\r","Now, afore God! this reverend holy friar,\r","Our whole city is much bound to him.\r","\r","JULIET:\r","Nurse, will you go with me into my closet,\r","To help me sort such needful ornaments\r","As you think fit to furnish me to-morrow?\r","\r","LADY CAPULET:\r","No, not till Thursday; there is time enough.\r","\r","CAPULET:\r","Go, nurse, go with her: we'll to church to-morrow.\r","\r","LADY  CAPULET:\r","We shall be short in our provision:\r","'Tis now near night.\r","\r","CAPULET:\r","Tush, I will stir about,\r","And all things shall be well, I warrant thee, wife:\r","Go thou to Juliet, help to deck up her;\r","I'll not to bed to-night; let me alone;\r","I'll play the housewife for this once. What, ho!\r","They are all forth. Well, I will walk myself\r","To County Paris, to prepare him up\r","Against to-morrow: my heart is wondrous light,\r","Since this same wayward girl is so reclaim'd.\r","\r","JULIET:\r","Ay, those attires are best: but, gentle nurse,\r","I pray thee, leave me to myself to-night,\r","For I have need of many orisons\r","To move the heavens to smile upon my state,\r","Which, well thou know'st, is cross, and full of sin.\r","\r","LADY CAPULET:\r","What, are you busy, ho? need you my help?\r","\r","JULIET:\r","No, madam; we have cull'd such necessaries\r","As are behoveful for our state to-morrow:\r","So please you, let me now be left alone,\r","And let the nurse this night sit up with you;\r","For, I am sure, you have your hands full all,\r","In this so sudden business.\r","\r","LADY CAPULET:\r","Good night:\r","Get thee to bed, and rest; for thou hast need.\r","\r","JULIET:\r","Farewell! God knows when we shall meet again.\r","I have a faint cold fear thrills through my veins,\r","That almost freezes up the heat of life:\r","I'll call them back again to comfort me:\r","Nurse! What should she do here?\r","My dismal scene I needs must act alone.\r","Come, vial.\r","What if this mixture do not work at all?\r","Shall I be married then to-morrow morning?\r","No, no: this shall forbid it: lie thou there.\r","What if it be a poison, which the friar\r","Subtly hath minister'd to have me dead,\r","Lest in this marriage he should be dishonour'd,\r","Because he married me before to Romeo?\r","I fear it is: and yet, methinks, it should not,\r","For he hath still been tried a holy man.\r","How if, when I am laid into the tomb,\r","I wake before the time that Romeo\r","Come to redeem me? there's a fearful point!\r","Shall I not, then, be stifled in the vault,\r","To whose foul mouth no healthsome air breathes in,\r","And there die strangled ere my Romeo comes?\r","Or, if I live, is it not very like,\r","The horrible conceit of death and night,\r","Together with the terror of the place,--\r","As in a vault, an ancient receptacle,\r","Where, for these many hundred years, the bones\r","Of all my buried ancestors are packed:\r","Where bloody Tybalt, yet but green in earth,\r","Lies festering in his shroud; where, as they say,\r","At some hours in the night spirits resort;--\r","Alack, alack, is it not like that I,\r","So early waking, what with loathsome smells,\r","And shrieks like mandrakes' torn out of the earth,\r","That living mortals, hearing them, run mad:--\r","O, if I wake, shall I not be distraught,\r","Environed with all these hideous fears?\r","And madly play with my forefather's joints?\r","And pluck the mangled Tybalt from his shroud?\r","And, in this rage, with some great kinsman's bone,\r","As with a club, dash out my desperate brains?\r","O, look! methinks I see my cousin's ghost\r","Seeking out Romeo, that did spit his body\r","Upon a rapier's point: stay, Tybalt, stay!\r","Romeo, I come! this do I drink to thee.\r","\r","LADY CAPULET:\r","Hold, take these keys, and fetch more spices, nurse.\r","\r","Nurse:\r","They call for dates and quinces in the pastry.\r","\r","CAPULET:\r","Come, stir, stir, stir! the second cock hath crow'd,\r","The curfew-bell hath rung, 'tis three o'clock:\r","Look to the baked meats, good Angelica:\r","Spare not for the cost.\r","\r","Nurse:\r","Go, you cot-quean, go,\r","Get you to bed; faith, You'll be sick to-morrow\r","For this night's watching.\r","\r","CAPULET:\r","No, not a whit: what! I have watch'd ere now\r","All night for lesser cause, and ne'er been sick.\r","\r","LADY CAPULET:\r","Ay, you have been a mouse-hunt in your time;\r","But I will watch you from such watching now.\r","\r","CAPULET:\r","A jealous hood, a jealous hood!\r","Now, fellow,\r","What's there?\r","\r","First Servant:\r","Things for the cook, sir; but I know not what.\r","\r","CAPULET:\r","Make haste, make haste.\r","Sirrah, fetch drier logs:\r","Call Peter, he will show thee where they are.\r","\r","Second Servant:\r","I have a head, sir, that will find out logs,\r","And never trouble Peter for the matter.\r","\r","CAPULET:\r","Mass, and well said; a merry whoreson, ha!\r","Thou shalt be logger-head. Good faith, 'tis day:\r","The county will be here with music straight,\r","For so he said he would: I hear him near.\r","Nurse! Wife! What, ho! What, nurse, I say!\r","Go waken Juliet, go and trim her up;\r","I'll go and chat with Paris: hie, make haste,\r","Make haste; the bridegroom he is come already:\r","Make haste, I say.\r","\r","Nurse:\r","Mistress! what, mistress! Juliet! fast, I warrant her, she:\r","Why, lamb! why, lady! fie, you slug-a-bed!\r","Why, love, I say! madam! sweet-heart! why, bride!\r","What, not a word? you take your pennyworths now;\r","Sleep for a week; for the next night, I warrant,\r","The County Paris hath set up his rest,\r","That you shall rest but little. God forgive me,\r","Marry, and amen, how sound is she asleep!\r","I must needs wake her. Madam, madam, madam!\r","Ay, let the county take you in your bed;\r","He'll fright you up, i' faith. Will it not be?\r","What, dress'd! and in your clothes! and down again!\r","I must needs wake you; Lady! lady! lady!\r","Alas, alas! Help, help! my lady's dead!\r","O, well-a-day, that ever I was born!\r","Some aqua vitae, ho! My lord! my lady!\r","\r","LADY CAPULET:\r","What noise is here?\r","\r","Nurse:\r","O lamentable day!\r","\r","LADY CAPULET:\r","What is the matter?\r","\r","Nurse:\r","Look, look! O heavy day!\r","\r","LADY CAPULET:\r","O me, O me! My child, my only life,\r","Revive, look up, or I will die with thee!\r","Help, help! Call help.\r","\r","CAPULET:\r","For shame, bring Juliet forth; her lord is come.\r","\r","Nurse:\r","She's dead, deceased, she's dead; alack the day!\r","\r","LADY CAPULET:\r","Alack the day, she's dead, she's dead, she's dead!\r","\r","CAPULET:\r","Ha! let me see her: out, alas! she's cold:\r","Her blood is settled, and her joints are stiff;\r","Life and these lips have long been separated:\r","Death lies on her like an untimely frost\r","Upon the sweetest flower of all the field.\r","\r","Nurse:\r","O lamentable day!\r","\r","LADY CAPULET:\r","O woful time!\r","\r","CAPULET:\r","Death, that hath ta'en her hence to make me wail,\r","Ties up my tongue, and will not let me speak.\r","\r","FRIAR LAURENCE:\r","Come, is the bride ready to go to church?\r","\r","CAPULET:\r","Ready to go, but never to return.\r","O son! the night before thy wedding-day\r","Hath Death lain with thy wife. There she lies,\r","Flower as she was, deflowered by him.\r","Death is my son-in-law, Death is my heir;\r","My daughter he hath wedded: I will die,\r","And leave him all; life, living, all is Death's.\r","\r","PARIS:\r","Have I thought long to see this morning's face,\r","And doth it give me such a sight as this?\r","\r","LADY CAPULET:\r","Accursed, unhappy, wretched, hateful day!\r","Most miserable hour that e'er time saw\r","In lasting labour of his pilgrimage!\r","But one, poor one, one poor and loving child,\r","But one thing to rejoice and solace in,\r","And cruel death hath catch'd it from my sight!\r","\r","Nurse:\r","O woe! O woful, woful, woful day!\r","Most lamentable day, most woful day,\r","That ever, ever, I did yet behold!\r","O day! O day! O day! O hateful day!\r","Never was seen so black a day as this:\r","O woful day, O woful day!\r","\r","PARIS:\r","Beguiled, divorced, wronged, spited, slain!\r","Most detestable death, by thee beguil'd,\r","By cruel cruel thee quite overthrown!\r","O love! O life! not life, but love in death!\r","\r","CAPULET:\r","Despised, distressed, hated, martyr'd, kill'd!\r","Uncomfortable time, why camest thou now\r","To murder, murder our solemnity?\r","O child! O child! my soul, and not my child!\r","Dead art thou! Alack! my child is dead;\r","And with my child my joys are buried.\r","\r","FRIAR LAURENCE:\r","Peace, ho, for shame! confusion's cure lives not\r","In these confusions. Heaven and yourself\r","Had part in this fair maid; now heaven hath all,\r","And all the better is it for the maid:\r","Your part in her you could not keep from death,\r","But heaven keeps his part in eternal life.\r","The most you sought was her promotion;\r","For 'twas your heaven she should be advanced:\r","And weep ye now, seeing she is advanced\r","Above the clouds, as high as heaven itself?\r","O, in this love, you love your child so ill,\r","That you run mad, seeing that she is well:\r","She's not well married that lives married long;\r","But she's best married that dies married young.\r","Dry up your tears, and stick your rosemary\r","On this fair corse; and, as the custom is,\r","In all her best array bear her to church:\r","For though fond nature bids us an lament,\r","Yet nature's tears are reason's merriment.\r","\r","CAPULET:\r","All things that we ordained festival,\r","Turn from their office to black funeral;\r","Our instruments to melancholy bells,\r","Our wedding cheer to a sad burial feast,\r","Our solemn hymns to sullen dirges change,\r","Our bridal flowers serve for a buried corse,\r","And all things change them to the contrary.\r","\r","FRIAR LAURENCE:\r","Sir, go you in; and, madam, go with him;\r","And go, Sir Paris; every one prepare\r","To follow this fair corse unto her grave:\r","The heavens do lour upon you for some ill;\r","Move them no more by crossing their high will.\r","\r","First Musician:\r","Faith, we may put up our pipes, and be gone.\r","\r","Nurse:\r","Honest goodfellows, ah, put up, put up;\r","For, well you know, this is a pitiful case.\r","\r","First Musician:\r","Ay, by my troth, the case may be amended.\r","\r","PETER:\r","Musicians, O, musicians, 'Heart's ease, Heart's\r","ease:' O, an you will have me live, play 'Heart's ease.'\r","\r","First Musician:\r","Why 'Heart's ease?'\r","\r","PETER:\r","O, musicians, because my heart itself plays 'My\r","heart is full of woe:' O, play me some merry dump,\r","to comfort me.\r","\r","First Musician:\r","Not a dump we; 'tis no time to play now.\r","\r","PETER:\r","You will not, then?\r","\r","First Musician:\r","No.\r","\r","PETER:\r","I will then give it you soundly.\r","\r","First Musician:\r","What will you give us?\r","\r","PETER:\r","No money, on my faith, but the gleek;\r","I will give you the minstrel.\r","\r","First Musician:\r","Then I will give you the serving-creature.\r","\r","PETER:\r","Then will I lay the serving-creature's dagger on\r","your pate. I will carry no crotchets: I'll re you,\r","I'll fa you; do you note me?\r","\r","First Musician:\r","An you re us and fa us, you note us.\r","\r","Second Musician:\r","Pray you, put up your dagger, and put out your wit.\r","\r","PETER:\r","Then have at you with my wit! I will dry-beat you\r","with an iron wit, and put up my iron dagger. Answer\r","me like men:\r","'When griping grief the heart doth wound,\r","And doleful dumps the mind oppress,\r","Then music with her silver sound'--\r","why 'silver sound'? why 'music with her silver\r","sound'? What say you, Simon Catling?\r","\r","Musician:\r","Marry, sir, because silver hath a sweet sound.\r","\r","PETER:\r","Pretty! What say you, Hugh Rebeck?\r","\r","Second Musician:\r","I say 'silver sound,' because musicians sound for silver.\r","\r","PETER:\r","Pretty too! What say you, James Soundpost?\r","\r","Third Musician:\r","Faith, I know not what to say.\r","\r","PETER:\r","O, I cry you mercy; you are the singer: I will say\r","for you. It is 'music with her silver sound,'\r","because musicians have no gold for sounding:\r","'Then music with her silver sound\r","With speedy help doth lend redress.'\r","\r","First Musician:\r","What a pestilent knave is this same!\r","\r","Second Musician:\r","Hang him, Jack! Come, we'll in here; tarry for the\r","mourners, and stay dinner.\r","\r","ROMEO:\r","If I may trust the flattering truth of sleep,\r","My dreams presage some joyful news at hand:\r","My bosom's lord sits lightly in his throne;\r","And all this day an unaccustom'd spirit\r","Lifts me above the ground with cheerful thoughts.\r","I dreamt my lady came and found me dead--\r","Strange dream, that gives a dead man leave\r","to think!--\r","And breathed such life with kisses in my lips,\r","That I revived, and was an emperor.\r","Ah me! how sweet is love itself possess'd,\r","When but love's shadows are so rich in joy!\r","News from Verona!--How now, Balthasar!\r","Dost thou not bring me letters from the friar?\r","How doth my lady?
