Is my father well?\r","How fares my Juliet? that I ask again;\r","For nothing can be ill, if she be well.\r","\r","BALTHASAR:\r","Then she is well, and nothing can be ill:\r","Her body sleeps in Capel's monument,\r","And her immortal part with angels lives.\r","I saw her laid low in her kindred's vault,\r","And presently took post to tell it you:\r","O, pardon me for bringing these ill news,\r","Since you did leave it for my office, sir.\r","\r","ROMEO:\r","Is it even so? then I defy you, stars!\r","Thou know'st my lodging: get me ink and paper,\r","And hire post-horses; I will hence to-night.\r","\r","BALTHASAR:\r","I do beseech you, sir, have patience:\r","Your looks are pale and wild, and do import\r","Some misadventure.\r","\r","ROMEO:\r","Tush, thou art deceived:\r","Leave me, and do the thing I bid thee do.\r","Hast thou no letters to me from the friar?\r","\r","BALTHASAR:\r","No, my good lord.\r","\r","ROMEO:\r","No matter: get thee gone,\r","And hire those horses; I'll be with thee straight.\r","Well, Juliet, I will lie with thee to-night.\r","Let's see for means: O mischief, thou art swift\r","To enter in the thoughts of desperate men!\r","I do remember an apothecary,--\r","And hereabouts he dwells,--which late I noted\r","In tatter'd weeds, with overwhelming brows,\r","Culling of simples; meagre were his looks,\r","Sharp misery had worn him to the bones:\r","And in his needy shop a tortoise hung,\r","An alligator stuff'd, and other skins\r","Of ill-shaped fishes; and about his shelves\r","A beggarly account of empty boxes,\r","Green earthen pots, bladders and musty seeds,\r","Remnants of packthread and old cakes of roses,\r","Were thinly scatter'd, to make up a show.\r","Noting this penury, to myself I said\r","'An if a man did need a poison now,\r","Whose sale is present death in Mantua,\r","Here lives a caitiff wretch would sell it him.'\r","O, this same thought did but forerun my need;\r","And this same needy man must sell it me.\r","As I remember, this should be the house.\r","Being holiday, the beggar's shop is shut.\r","What, ho! apothecary!\r","\r","Apothecary:\r","Who calls so loud?\r","\r","ROMEO:\r","Come hither, man. I see that thou art poor:\r","Hold, there is forty ducats: let me have\r","A dram of poison, such soon-speeding gear\r","As will disperse itself through all the veins\r","That the life-weary taker may fall dead\r","And that the trunk may be discharged of breath\r","As violently as hasty powder fired\r","Doth hurry from the fatal cannon's womb.\r","\r","Apothecary:\r","Such mortal drugs I have; but Mantua's law\r","Is death to any he that utters them.\r","\r","ROMEO:\r","Art thou so bare and full of wretchedness,\r","And fear'st to die? famine is in thy cheeks,\r","Need and oppression starveth in thine eyes,\r","Contempt and beggary hangs upon thy back;\r","The world is not thy friend nor the world's law;\r","The world affords no law to make thee rich;\r","Then be not poor, but break it, and take this.\r","\r","Apothecary:\r","My poverty, but not my will, consents.\r","\r","ROMEO:\r","I pay thy poverty, and not thy will.\r","\r","Apothecary:\r","Put this in any liquid thing you will,\r","And drink it off; and, if you had the strength\r","Of twenty men, it would dispatch you straight.\r","\r","ROMEO:\r","There is thy gold, worse poison to men's souls,\r","Doing more murders in this loathsome world,\r","Than these poor compounds that thou mayst not sell.\r","I sell thee poison; thou hast sold me none.\r","Farewell: buy food, and get thyself in flesh.\r","Come, cordial and not poison, go with me\r","To Juliet's grave; for there must I use thee.\r","\r","FRIAR JOHN:\r","Holy Franciscan friar! brother, ho!\r","\r","FRIAR LAURENCE:\r","This same should be the voice of Friar John.\r","Welcome from Mantua: what says Romeo?\r","Or, if his mind be writ, give me his letter.\r","\r","FRIAR JOHN:\r","Going to find a bare-foot brother out\r","One of our order, to associate me,\r","Here in this city visiting the sick,\r","And finding him, the searchers of the town,\r","Suspecting that we both were in a house\r","Where the infectious pestilence did reign,\r","Seal'd up the doors, and would not let us forth;\r","So that my speed to Mantua there was stay'd.\r","\r","FRIAR LAURENCE:\r","Who bare my letter, then, to Romeo?\r","\r","FRIAR JOHN:\r","I could not send it,--here it is again,--\r","Nor get a messenger to bring it thee,\r","So fearful were they of infection.\r","\r","FRIAR LAURENCE:\r","Unhappy fortune! by my brotherhood,\r","The letter was not nice but full of charge\r","Of dear import, and the neglecting it\r","May do much danger. Friar John, go hence;\r","Get me an iron crow, and bring it straight\r","Unto my cell.\r","\r","FRIAR JOHN:\r","Brother, I'll go and bring it thee.\r","\r","FRIAR LAURENCE:\r","Now must I to the monument alone;\r","Within three hours will fair Juliet wake:\r","She will beshrew me much that Romeo\r","Hath had no notice of these accidents;\r","But I will write again to Mantua,\r","And keep her at my cell till Romeo come;\r","Poor living corse, closed in a dead man's tomb!\r","\r","PARIS:\r","Give me thy torch, boy: hence, and stand aloof:\r","Yet put it out, for I would not be seen.\r","Under yond yew-trees lay thee all along,\r","Holding thine ear close to the hollow ground;\r","So shall no foot upon the churchyard tread,\r","Being loose, unfirm, with digging up of graves,\r","But thou shalt hear it: whistle then to me,\r","As signal that thou hear'st something approach.\r","Give me those flowers. Do as I bid thee, go.\r","\r","PAGE:\r","\r","PARIS:\r","Sweet flower, with flowers thy bridal bed I strew,--\r","O woe! thy canopy is dust and stones;--\r","Which with sweet water nightly I will dew,\r","Or, wanting that, with tears distill'd by moans:\r","The obsequies that I for thee will keep\r","Nightly shall be to strew thy grave and weep.\r","The boy gives warning something doth approach.\r","What cursed foot wanders this way to-night,\r","To cross my obsequies and true love's rite?\r","What with a torch! muffle me, night, awhile.\r","\r","ROMEO:\r","Give me that mattock and the wrenching iron.\r","Hold, take this letter; early in the morning\r","See thou deliver it to my lord and father.\r","Give me the light: upon thy life, I charge thee,\r","Whate'er thou hear'st or seest, stand all aloof,\r","And do not interrupt me in my course.\r","Why I descend into this bed of death,\r","Is partly to behold my lady's face;\r","But chiefly to take thence from her dead finger\r","A precious ring, a ring that I must use\r","In dear employment: therefore hence, be gone:\r","But if thou, jealous, dost return to pry\r","In what I further shall intend to do,\r","By heaven, I will tear thee joint by joint\r","And strew this hungry churchyard with thy limbs:\r","The time and my intents are savage-wild,\r","More fierce and more inexorable far\r","Than empty tigers or the roaring sea.\r","\r","BALTHASAR:\r","I will be gone, sir, and not trouble you.\r","\r","ROMEO:\r","So shalt thou show me friendship. Take thou that:\r","Live, and be prosperous: and farewell, good fellow.\r","\r","BALTHASAR:\r","\r","ROMEO:\r","Thou detestable maw, thou womb of death,\r","Gorged with the dearest morsel of the earth,\r","Thus I enforce thy rotten jaws to open,\r","And, in despite, I'll cram thee with more food!\r","\r","PARIS:\r","This is that banish'd haughty Montague,\r","That murder'd my love's cousin, with which grief,\r","It is supposed, the fair creature died;\r","And here is come to do some villanous shame\r","To the dead bodies: I will apprehend him.\r","Stop thy unhallow'd toil, vile Montague!\r","Can vengeance be pursued further than death?\r","Condemned villain, I do apprehend thee:\r","Obey, and go with me; for thou must die.\r","\r","ROMEO:\r","I must indeed; and therefore came I hither.\r","Good gentle youth, tempt not a desperate man;\r","Fly hence, and leave me: think upon these gone;\r","Let them affright thee. I beseech thee, youth,\r","Put not another sin upon my head,\r","By urging me to fury: O, be gone!\r","By heaven, I love thee better than myself;\r","For I come hither arm'd against myself:\r","Stay not, be gone; live, and hereafter say,\r","A madman's mercy bade thee run away.\r","\r","PARIS:\r","I do defy thy conjurations,\r","And apprehend thee for a felon here.\r","\r","ROMEO:\r","Wilt thou provoke me? then have at thee, boy!\r","\r","PAGE:\r","O Lord, they fight! I will go call the watch.\r","\r","PARIS:\r","O, I am slain!\r","If thou be merciful,\r","Open the tomb, lay me with Juliet.\r","\r","ROMEO:\r","In faith, I will. Let me peruse this face.\r","Mercutio's kinsman, noble County Paris!\r","What said my man, when my betossed soul\r","Did not attend him as we rode? I think\r","He told me Paris should have married Juliet:\r","Said he not so? or did I dream it so?\r","Or am I mad, hearing him talk of Juliet,\r","To think it was so? O, give me thy hand,\r","One writ with me in sour misfortune's book!\r","I'll bury thee in a triumphant grave;\r","A grave? O no! a lantern, slaughter'd youth,\r","For here lies Juliet, and her beauty makes\r","This vault a feasting presence full of light.\r","Death, lie thou there, by a dead man interr'd.\r","How oft when men are at the point of death\r","Have they been merry! which their keepers call\r","A lightning before death: O, how may I\r","Call this a lightning? O my love! my wife!\r","Death, that hath suck'd the honey of thy breath,\r","Hath had no power yet upon thy beauty:\r","Thou art not conquer'd; beauty's ensign yet\r","Is crimson in thy lips and in thy cheeks,\r","And death's pale flag is not advanced there.\r","Tybalt, liest thou there in thy bloody sheet?\r","O, what more favour can I do to thee,\r","Than with that hand that cut thy youth in twain\r","To sunder his that was thine enemy?\r","Forgive me, cousin! Ah, dear Juliet,\r","Why art thou yet so fair? shall I believe\r","That unsubstantial death is amorous,\r","And that the lean abhorred monster keeps\r","Thee here in dark to be his paramour?\r","For fear of that, I still will stay with thee;\r","And never from this palace of dim night\r","Depart again: here, here will I remain\r","With worms that are thy chamber-maids; O, here\r","Will I set up my everlasting rest,\r","And shake the yoke of inauspicious stars\r","From this world-wearied flesh. Eyes, look your last!\r","Arms, take your last embrace! and, lips, O you\r","The doors of breath, seal with a righteous kiss\r","A dateless bargain to engrossing death!\r","Come, bitter conduct, come, unsavoury guide!\r","Thou desperate pilot, now at once run on\r","The dashing rocks thy sea-sick weary bark!\r","Here's to my love!\r","O true apothecary!\r","Thy drugs are quick. Thus with a kiss I die.\r","\r","FRIAR LAURENCE:\r","Saint Francis be my speed! how oft to-night\r","Have my old feet stumbled at graves! Who's there?\r","\r","BALTHASAR:\r","Here's one, a friend, and one that knows you well.\r","\r","FRIAR LAURENCE:\r","Bliss be upon you! Tell me, good my friend,\r","What torch is yond, that vainly lends his light\r","To grubs and eyeless skulls? as I discern,\r","It burneth in the Capel's monument.\r","\r","BALTHASAR:\r","It doth so, holy sir; and there's my master,\r","One that you love.\r","\r","FRIAR LAURENCE:\r","Who is it?\r","\r","BALTHASAR:\r","Romeo.\r","\r","FRIAR LAURENCE:\r","How long hath he been there?\r","\r","BALTHASAR:\r","Full half an hour.\r","\r","FRIAR LAURENCE:\r","Go with me to the vault.\r","\r","BALTHASAR:\r","I dare not, sir\r","My master knows not but I am gone hence;\r","And fearfully did menace me with death,\r","If I did stay to look on his intents.\r","\r","FRIAR LAURENCE:\r","Stay, then; I'll go alone. Fear comes upon me:\r","O, much I fear some ill unlucky thing.\r","\r","BALTHASAR:\r","As I did sleep under this yew-tree here,\r","I dreamt my master and another fought,\r","And that my master slew him.\r","\r","FRIAR LAURENCE:\r","Romeo!\r","Alack, alack, what blood is this, which stains\r","The stony entrance of this sepulchre?\r","What mean these masterless and gory swords\r","To lie discolour'd by this place of peace?\r","Romeo! O, pale! Who else? what, Paris too?\r","And steep'd in blood? Ah, what an unkind hour\r","Is guilty of this lamentable chance!\r","The lady stirs.\r","\r","JULIET:\r","O comfortable friar! where is my lord?\r","I do remember well where I should be,\r","And there I am. Where is my Romeo?\r","\r","FRIAR LAURENCE:\r","I hear some noise. Lady, come from that nest\r","Of death, contagion, and unnatural sleep:\r","A greater power than we can contradict\r","Hath thwarted our intents. Come, come away.\r","Thy husband in thy bosom there lies dead;\r","And Paris too. Come, I'll dispose of thee\r","Among a sisterhood of holy nuns:\r","Stay not to question, for the watch is coming;\r","Come, go, good Juliet,\r","I dare no longer stay.\r","\r","JULIET:\r","Go, get thee hence, for I will not away.\r","What's here? a cup, closed in my true love's hand?\r","Poison, I see, hath been his timeless end:\r","O churl! drunk all, and left no friendly drop\r","To help me after? I will kiss thy lips;\r","Haply some poison yet doth hang on them,\r","To make die with a restorative.\r","Thy lips are warm.\r","\r","First Watchman:\r","\r","JULIET:\r","Yea, noise? then I'll be brief. O happy dagger!\r","This is thy sheath;\r","there rust, and let me die.\r","\r","PAGE:\r","This is the place; there, where the torch doth burn.\r","\r","First Watchman:\r","The ground is bloody; search about the churchyard:\r","Go, some of you, whoe'er you find attach.\r","Pitiful sight! here lies the county slain,\r","And Juliet bleeding, warm, and newly dead,\r","Who here hath lain these two days buried.\r","Go, tell the prince: run to the Capulets:\r","Raise up the Montagues: some others search:\r","We see the ground whereon these woes do lie;\r","But the true ground of all these piteous woes\r","We cannot without circumstance descry.\r","\r","Second Watchman:\r","Here's Romeo's man; we found him in the churchyard.\r","\r","First Watchman:\r","Hold him in safety, till the prince come hither.\r","\r","Third Watchman:\r","Here is a friar, that trembles, sighs and weeps:\r","We took this mattock and this spade from him,\r","As he was coming from this churchyard side.\r","\r","First Watchman:\r","A great suspicion: stay the friar too.\r","\r","PRINCE:\r","What misadventure is so early up,\r","That calls our person from our morning's rest?\r","\r","CAPULET:\r","What should it be, that they so shriek abroad?\r","\r","LADY CAPULET:\r","The people in the street cry Romeo,\r","Some Juliet, and some Paris; and all run,\r","With open outcry toward our monument.\r","\r","PRINCE:\r","What fear is this which startles in our ears?\r","\r","First Watchman:\r","Sovereign, here lies the County Paris slain;\r","And Romeo dead; and Juliet, dead before,\r","Warm and new kill'd.\r","\r","PRINCE:\r","Search, seek, and know how this foul murder comes.\r","\r","First Watchman:\r","Here is a friar, and slaughter'd Romeo's man;\r","With instruments upon them, fit to open\r","These dead men's tombs.\r","\r","CAPULET:\r","O heavens! O wife, look how our daughter bleeds!\r","This dagger hath mista'en--for, lo, his house\r","Is empty on the back of Montague,--\r","And it mis-sheathed in my daughter's bosom!\r","\r","LADY CAPULET:\r","O me! this sight of death is as a bell,\r","That warns my old age to a sepulchre.\r","\r","PRINCE:\r","Come, Montague; for thou art early up,\r","To see thy son and heir more early down.\r","\r","MONTAGUE:\r","Alas, my liege, my wife is dead to-night;\r","Grief of my son's exile hath stopp'd her breath:\r","What further woe conspires against mine age?\r","\r","PRINCE:\r","Look, and thou shalt see.\r","\r","MONTAGUE:\r","O thou untaught! what manners is in this?\r","To press before thy father to a grave?\r","\r","PRINCE:\r","Seal up the mouth of outrage for a while,\r","Till we can clear these ambiguities,\r","And know their spring, their head, their\r","true descent;\r","And then will I be general of your woes,\r","And lead you even to death: meantime forbear,\r","And let mischance be slave to patience.\r","Bring forth the parties of suspicion.\r","\r","FRIAR LAURENCE:\r","I am the greatest, able to do least,\r","Yet most suspected, as the time and place\r","Doth make against me of this direful murder;\r","And here I stand, both to impeach and purge\r","Myself condemned and myself excused.\r","\r","PRINCE:\r","Then say at once what thou dost know in this.\r","\r","FRIAR LAURENCE:\r","I will be brief, for my short date of breath\r","Is not so long as is a tedious tale.\r","Romeo, there dead, was husband to that Juliet;\r","And she, there dead, that Romeo's faithful wife:\r","I married them; and their stol'n marriage-day\r","Was Tybalt's dooms-day, whose untimely death\r","Banish'd the new-made bridegroom from the city,\r","For whom, and not for Tybalt, Juliet pined.\r","You, to remove that siege of grief from her,\r","Betroth'd and would have married her perforce\r","To County Paris: then comes she to me,\r","And, with wild looks, bid me devise some mean\r","To rid her from this second marriage,\r","Or in my cell there would she kill herself.\r","Then gave I her, so tutor'd by my art,\r","A sleeping potion; which so took effect\r","As I intended, for it wrought on her\r","The form of death: meantime I writ to Romeo,\r","That he should hither come as this dire night,\r","To help to take her from her borrow'd grave,\r","Being the time the potion's force should cease.\r","But he which bore my letter, Friar John,\r","Was stay'd by accident, and yesternight\r","Return'd my letter back. Then all alone\r","At the prefixed hour of her waking,\r","Came I to take her from her kindred's vault;\r","Meaning to keep her closely at my cell,\r","Till I conveniently could send to Romeo:\r","But when I came, some minute ere the time\r","Of her awaking, here untimely lay\r","The noble Paris and true Romeo dead.\r","She wakes; and I entreated her come forth,\r","And bear this work of heaven with patience:\r","But then a noise did scare me from the tomb;\r","And she, too desperate, would not go with me,\r","But, as it seems, did violence on herself.\r","All this I know; and to the marriage\r","Her nurse is privy: and, if aught in this\r","Miscarried by my fault, let my old life\r","Be sacrificed, some hour before his time,\r","Unto the rigour of severest law.\r","\r","PRINCE:\r","We still have known thee for a holy man.\r","Where's Romeo's man? what can he say in this?\r","\r","BALTHASAR:\r","I brought my master news of Juliet's death;\r","And then in post he came from Mantua\r","To this same place, to this same monument.\r","This letter he early bid me give his father,\r","And threatened me with death, going in the vault,\r","I departed not and left him there.\r","\r","PRINCE:\r","Give me the letter; I will look on it.\r","Where is the county's page, that raised the watch?\r","Sirrah, what made your master in this place?\r","\r","PAGE:\r","He came with flowers to strew his lady's grave;\r","And bid me stand aloof, and so I did:\r","Anon comes one with light to ope the tomb;\r","And by and by my master drew on him;\r","And then I ran away to call the watch.\r","\r","PRINCE:\r","This letter doth make good the friar's words,\r","Their course of love, the tidings of her death:\r","And here he writes that he did buy a poison\r","Of a poor 'pothecary, and therewithal\r","Came to this vault to die, and lie with Juliet.\r","Where be these enemies? Capulet! Montague!\r","See, what a scourge is laid upon your hate,\r","That heaven finds means to kill your joys with love.\r","And I for winking at your discords too\r","Have lost a brace of kinsmen: all are punish'd.\r","\r","CAPULET:\r","O brother Montague, give me thy hand:\r","This is my daughter's jointure, for no more\r","Can I demand.\r","\r","MONTAGUE:\r","But I can give thee more:\r","For I will raise her statue in pure gold;\r","That while Verona by that name is known,\r","There shall no figure at such rate be set\r","As that of true and faithful Juliet.\r","\r","CAPULET:\r","As rich shall Romeo's by his lady's lie;\r","Poor sacrifices of our enmity!\r","\r","PRINCE:\r","A glooming peace this morning with it brings;\r","The sun, for sorrow, will not show his head:\r","Go hence, to have more talk of these sad things;\r","Some shall be pardon'd, and some punished:\r","For never was a story of more woe\r","Than this of Juliet and her Romeo.\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","I wonder how the king escaped our hands.\r","\r","YORK:\r","While we pursued the horsemen of the north,\r","He slily stole away and left his men:\r","Whereat the great Lord of Northumberland,\r","Whose warlike ears could never brook retreat,\r","Cheer'd up the drooping army; and himself,\r","Lord Clifford and Lord Stafford, all abreast,\r","Charged our main battle's front, and breaking in\r","Were by the swords of common soldiers slain.\r","\r","EDWARD:\r","Lord Stafford's father, Duke of Buckingham,\r","Is either slain or wounded dangerously;\r","I cleft his beaver with a downright blow:\r","That this is true, father, behold his blood.\r","\r","MONTAGUE:\r","And, brother, here's the Earl of Wiltshire's blood,\r","Whom I encounter'd as the battles join'd.\r","\r","RICHARD:\r","Speak thou for me and tell them what I did.\r","\r","YORK:\r","Richard hath best deserved of all my sons.\r","But is your grace dead, my Lord of Somerset?\r","\r","NORFOLK:\r","Such hope have all the line of John of Gaunt!\r","\r","RICHARD:\r","Thus do I hope to shake King Henry's head.\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","And so do I. Victorious Prince of York,\r","Before I see thee seated in that throne\r","Which now the house of Lancaster usurps,\r","I vow by heaven these eyes shall never close.\r","This is the palace of the fearful king,\r","And this the regal seat: possess it, York;\r","For this is thine and not King Henry's heirs'\r","\r","YORK:\r","Assist me, then, sweet Warwick, and I will;\r","For hither we have broken in by force.\r","\r","NORFOLK:\r","We'll all assist you; he that flies shall die.\r","\r","YORK:\r","Thanks, gentle Norfolk: stay by me, my lords;\r","And, soldiers, stay and lodge by me this night.\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","And when the king comes, offer no violence,\r","Unless he seek to thrust you out perforce.\r","\r","YORK:\r","The queen this day here holds her parliament,\r","But little thinks we shall be of her council:\r","By words or blows here let us win our right.\r","\r","RICHARD:\r","Arm'd as we are, let's stay within this house.\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","The bloody parliament shall this be call'd,\r","Unless Plantagenet, Duke of York, be king,\r","And bashful Henry deposed, whose cowardice\r","Hath made us by-words to our enemies.\r","\r","YORK:\r","Then leave me not, my lords; be resolute;\r","I mean to take possession of my right.\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","Neither the king, nor he that loves him best,\r","The proudest he that holds up Lancaster,\r","Dares stir a wing, if Warwick shake his bells.\r","I'll plant Plantagenet, root him up who dares:\r","Resolve thee, Richard; claim the English crown.\r","\r","KING HENRY VI:\r","My lords, look where the sturdy rebel sits,\r","Even in the chair of state: belike he means,\r","Back'd by the power of Warwick, that false peer,\r","To aspire unto the crown and reign as king.\r","Earl of Northumberland, he slew thy father.\r","And thine, Lord Clifford; and you both have vow'd revenge\r","On him, his sons, his favourites and his friends.\r","\r","NORTHUMBERLAND:\r","If I be not, heavens be revenged on me!\r","\r","CLIFFORD:\r","The hope thereof makes Clifford mourn in steel.\r","\r","WESTMORELAND:\r","What, shall we suffer this? let's pluck him down:\r","My heart for anger burns; I cannot brook it.\r","\r","KING HENRY VI:\r","Be patient, gentle Earl of Westmoreland.\r","\r","CLIFFORD:\r","Patience is for poltroons, such as he:\r","He durst not sit there, had your father lived.\r","My gracious lord, here in the parliament\r","Let us assail the family of York.\r","\r","NORTHUMBERLAND:\r","Well hast thou spoken, cousin: be it so.\r","\r","KING HENRY VI:\r","Ah, know you not the city favours them,\r","And they have troops of soldiers at their beck?\r","\r","EXETER:\r","But when the duke is slain, they'll quickly fly.\r","\r","KING HENRY VI:\r","Far be the thought of this from Henry's heart,\r","To make a shambles of the parliament-house!\r","Cousin of Exeter, frowns, words and threats\r","Shall be the war that Henry means to use.\r","Thou factious Duke of York, descend my throne,\r","and kneel for grace and mercy at my feet;\r","I am thy sovereign.\r","\r","YORK:\r","I am thine.\r","\r","EXETER:\r","For shame, come down: he made thee Duke of York.\r","\r","YORK:\r","'Twas my inheritance, as the earldom was.\r","\r","EXETER:\r","Thy father was a traitor to the crown.\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","Exeter, thou art a traitor to the crown\r","In following this usurping Henry.\r","\r","CLIFFORD:\r","Whom should he follow but his natural king?\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","True, Clifford; and that's Richard Duke of York.\r","\r","KING HENRY VI:\r","And shall I stand, and thou sit in my throne?\r","\r","YORK:\r","It must and shall be so: content thyself.\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","Be Duke of Lancaster; let him be king.\r","\r","WESTMORELAND:\r","He is both king and Duke of Lancaster;\r","And that the Lord of Westmoreland shall maintain.\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","And Warwick shall disprove it. You forget\r","That we are those which chased you from the field\r","And slew your fathers, and with colours spread\r","March'd through the city to the palace gates.\r","\r","NORTHUMBERLAND:\r","Yes, Warwick, I remember it to my grief;\r","And, by his soul, thou and thy house shall rue it.\r","\r","WESTMORELAND:\r","Plantagenet, of thee and these thy sons,\r","Thy kinsman and thy friends, I'll have more lives\r","Than drops of blood were in my father's veins.\r","\r","CLIFFORD:\r","Urge it no more; lest that, instead of words,\r","I send thee, Warwick, such a messenger\r","As shall revenge his death before I stir.\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","Poor Clifford! how I scorn his worthless threats!\r","\r","YORK:\r","Will you we show our title to the crown?\r","If not, our swords shall plead it in the field.\r","\r","KING HENRY VI:\r","What title hast thou, traitor, to the crown?\r","Thy father was, as thou art, Duke of York;\r","Thy grandfather, Roger Mortimer, Earl of March:\r","I am the son of Henry the Fifth,\r","Who made the Dauphin and the French to stoop\r","And seized upon their towns and provinces.\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","Talk not of France, sith thou hast lost it all.\r","\r","KING HENRY VI:\r","The lord protector lost it, and not I:\r","When I was crown'd I was but nine months old.\r","\r","RICHARD:\r","You are old enough now, and yet, methinks, you lose.\r","Father, tear the crown from the usurper's head.\r","\r","EDWARD:\r","Sweet father, do so; set it on your head.\r","\r","MONTAGUE:\r","Good brother, as thou lovest and honourest arms,\r","Let's fight it out and not stand cavilling thus.\r","\r","RICHARD:\r","Sound drums and trumpets, and the king will fly.\r","\r","YORK:\r","Sons, peace!\r","\r","KING HENRY VI:\r","Peace, thou! and give King Henry leave to speak.\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","Plantagenet shall speak first: hear him, lords;\r","And be you silent and attentive too,\r","For he that interrupts him shall not live.\r","\r","KING HENRY VI:\r","Think'st thou that I will leave my kingly throne,\r","Wherein my grandsire and my father sat?\r","No: first shall war unpeople this my realm;\r","Ay, and their colours, often borne in France,\r","And now in England to our heart's great sorrow,\r","Shall be my winding-sheet. Why faint you, lords?\r","My title's good, and better far than his.\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","Prove it, Henry, and thou shalt be king.\r","\r","KING HENRY VI:\r","Henry the Fourth by conquest got the crown.\r","\r","YORK:\r","'Twas by rebellion against his king.\r","\r","KING HENRY VI:\r","\r","YORK:\r","What then?\r","\r","KING HENRY VI:\r","An if he may, then am I lawful king;\r","For Richard, in the view of many lords,\r","Resign'd the crown to Henry the Fourth,\r","Whose heir my father was, and I am his.\r","\r","YORK:\r","He rose against him, being his sovereign,\r","And made him to resign his crown perforce.\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","Suppose, my lords, he did it unconstrain'd,\r","Think you 'twere prejudicial to his crown?\r","\r","EXETER:\r","No; for he could not so resign his crown\r","But that the next heir should succeed and reign.\r","\r","KING HENRY VI:\r","Art thou against us, Duke of Exeter?\r","\r","EXETER:\r","His is the right, and therefore pardon me.\r","\r","YORK:\r","Why whisper you, my lords, and answer not?\r","\r","EXETER:\r","My conscience tells me he is lawful king.\r","\r","KING HENRY VI:\r","\r","NORTHUMBERLAND:\r","Plantagenet, for all the claim thou lay'st,\r","Think not that Henry shall be so deposed.\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","Deposed he shall be, in despite of all.\r","\r","NORTHUMBERLAND:\r","Thou art deceived: 'tis not thy southern power,\r","Of Essex, Norfolk, Suffolk, nor of Kent,\r","Which makes thee thus presumptuous and proud,\r","Can set the duke up in despite of me.\r","\r","CLIFFORD:\r","King Henry, be thy title right or wrong,\r","Lord Clifford vows to fight in thy defence:\r","May that ground gape and swallow me alive,\r","Where I shall kneel to him that slew my father!\r","\r","KING HENRY VI:\r","O Clifford, how thy words revive my heart!\r","\r","YORK:\r","Henry of Lancaster, resign thy crown.\r","What mutter you, or what conspire you, lords?\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","Do right unto this princely Duke of York,\r","Or I will fill the house with armed men,\r","And over the chair of state, where now he sits,\r","Write up his title with usurping blood.\r","\r","KING HENRY VI:\r","My Lord of Warwick, hear me but one word:\r","Let me for this my life-time reign as king.\r","\r","YORK:\r","Confirm the crown to me and to mine heirs,\r","And thou shalt reign in quiet while thou livest.\r","\r","KING HENRY VI:\r","I am content: Richard Plantagenet,\r","Enjoy the kingdom after my decease.\r","\r","CLIFFORD:\r","What wrong is this unto the prince your son!\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","What good is this to England and himself!\r","\r","WESTMORELAND:\r","Base, fearful and despairing Henry!\r","\r","CLIFFORD:\r","How hast thou injured both thyself and us!\r","\r","WESTMORELAND:\r","I cannot stay to hear these articles.\r","\r","NORTHUMBERLAND:\r","Nor I.\r","\r","CLIFFORD:\r","Come, cousin, let us tell the queen these news.\r","\r","WESTMORELAND:\r","Farewell, faint-hearted and degenerate king,\r","In whose cold blood no spark of honour bides.\r","\r","NORTHUMBERLAND:\r","Be thou a prey unto the house of York,\r","And die in bands for this unmanly deed!\r","\r","CLIFFORD:\r","In dreadful war mayst thou be overcome,\r","Or live in peace abandon'd and despised!\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","Turn this way, Henry, and regard them not.\r","\r","EXETER:\r","They seek revenge and therefore will not yield.\r","\r","KING HENRY VI:\r","Ah, Exeter!\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","Why should you sigh, my lord?\r","\r","KING HENRY VI:\r","Not for myself, Lord Warwick, but my son,\r","Whom I unnaturally shall disinherit.\r","But be it as it may: I here entail\r","The crown to thee and to thine heirs for ever;\r","Conditionally, that here thou take an oath\r","To cease this civil war, and, whilst I live,\r","To honour me as thy king and sovereign,\r","And neither by treason nor hostility\r","To seek to put me down and reign thyself.\r","\r","YORK:\r","This oath I willingly take and will perform.\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","Long live King Henry! Plantagenet embrace him.\r","\r","KING HENRY VI:\r","And long live thou and these thy forward sons!\r","\r","YORK:\r","Now York and Lancaster are reconciled.\r","\r","EXETER:\r","Accursed be he that seeks to make them foes!\r","\r","YORK:\r","Farewell, my gracious lord; I'll to my castle.\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","And I'll keep London with my soldiers.\r","\r","NORFOLK:\r","And I to Norfolk with my followers.\r","\r","MONTAGUE:\r","And I unto the sea from whence I came.\r","\r","KING HENRY VI:\r","And I, with grief and sorrow, to the court.\r","\r","EXETER:\r","Here comes the queen, whose looks bewray her anger:\r","I'll steal away.\r","\r","KING HENRY VI:\r","Exeter, so will I.\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","Nay, go not from me; I will follow thee.\r","\r","KING HENRY VI:\r","Be patient, gentle queen, and I will stay.\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","Who can be patient in such extremes?\r","Ah, wretched man! would I had died a maid\r","And never seen thee, never borne thee son,\r","Seeing thou hast proved so unnatural a father\r","Hath he deserved to lose his birthright thus?\r","Hadst thou but loved him half so well as I,\r","Or felt that pain which I did for him once,\r","Or nourish'd him as I did with my blood,\r","Thou wouldst have left thy dearest heart-blood there,\r","Rather than have that savage duke thine heir\r","And disinherited thine only son.\r","\r","PRINCE EDWARD:\r","Father, you cannot disinherit me:\r","If you be king, why should not I succeed?\r","\r","KING HENRY VI:\r","Pardon me, Margaret; pardon me, sweet son:\r","The Earl of Warwick and the duke enforced me.\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","Enforced thee! art thou king, and wilt be forced?\r","I shame to hear thee speak. Ah, timorous wretch!\r","Thou hast undone thyself, thy son and me;\r","And given unto the house of York such head\r","As thou shalt reign but by their sufferance.\r","To entail him and his heirs unto the crown,\r","What is it, but to make thy sepulchre\r","And creep into it far before thy time?\r","Warwick is chancellor and the lord of Calais;\r","Stern Falconbridge commands the narrow seas;\r","The duke is made protector of the realm;\r","And yet shalt thou be safe? such safety finds\r","The trembling lamb environed with wolves.\r","Had I been there, which am a silly woman,\r","The soldiers should have toss'd me on their pikes\r","Before I would have granted to that act.\r","But thou preferr'st thy life before thine honour:\r","And seeing thou dost, I here divorce myself\r","Both from thy table, Henry, and thy bed,\r","Until that act of parliament be repeal'd\r","Whereby my son is disinherited.\r","The northern lords that have forsworn thy colours\r","Will follow mine, if once they see them spread;\r","And spread they shall be, to thy foul disgrace\r","And utter ruin of the house of York.\r","Thus do I leave thee. Come, son, let's away;\r","Our army is ready; come, we'll after them.\r","\r","KING HENRY VI:\r","Stay, gentle Margaret, and hear me speak.\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","Thou hast spoke too much already: get thee gone.\r","\r","KING HENRY VI:\r","Gentle son Edward, thou wilt stay with me?\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","Ay, to be murder'd by his enemies.\r","\r","PRINCE EDWARD:\r","When I return with victory from the field\r","I'll see your grace: till then I'll follow her.\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","Come, son, away; we may not linger thus.\r","\r","KING HENRY VI:\r","Poor queen! how love to me and to her son\r","Hath made her break out into terms of rage!\r","Revenged may she be on that hateful duke,\r","Whose haughty spirit, winged with desire,\r","Will cost my crown, and like an empty eagle\r","Tire on the flesh of me and of my son!\r","The loss of those three lords torments my heart:\r","I'll write unto them and entreat them fair.\r","Come, cousin you shall be the messenger.\r","\r","EXETER:\r","And I, I hope, shall reconcile them all.\r","3 KING HENRY VI\r","\r","RICHARD:\r","Brother, though I be youngest, give me leave.\r","\r","EDWARD:\r","No, I can better play the orator.\r","\r","MONTAGUE:\r","But I have reasons strong and forcible.\r","\r","YORK:\r","Why, how now, sons and brother! at a strife?\r","What is your quarrel? how began it first?\r","\r","EDWARD:\r","No quarrel, but a slight contention.\r","\r","YORK:\r","About what?\r","\r","RICHARD:\r","About that which concerns your grace and us;\r","The crown of England, father, which is yours.\r","\r","YORK:\r","Mine boy? not till King Henry be dead.\r","\r","RICHARD:\r","Your right depends not on his life or death.\r","\r","EDWARD:\r","Now you are heir, therefore enjoy it now:\r","By giving the house of Lancaster leave to breathe,\r","It will outrun you, father, in the end.\r","\r","YORK:\r","I took an oath that he should quietly reign.\r","\r","EDWARD:\r","But for a kingdom any oath may be broken:\r","I would break a thousand oaths to reign one year.\r","\r","RICHARD:\r","No; God forbid your grace should be forsworn.\r","\r","YORK:\r","I shall be, if I claim by open war.\r","\r","RICHARD:\r","I'll prove the contrary, if you'll hear me speak.\r","\r","YORK:\r","Thou canst not, son; it is impossible.\r","\r","RICHARD:\r","An oath is of no moment, being not took\r","Before a true and lawful magistrate,\r","That hath authority over him that swears:\r","Henry had none, but did usurp the place;\r","Then, seeing 'twas he that made you to depose,\r","Your oath, my lord, is vain and frivolous.\r","Therefore, to arms! And, father, do but think\r","How sweet a thing it is to wear a crown;\r","Within whose circuit is Elysium\r","And all that poets feign of bliss and joy.\r","Why do we finger thus? I cannot rest\r","Until the white rose that I wear be dyed\r","Even in the lukewarm blood of Henry's heart.\r","\r","YORK:\r","Richard, enough; I will be king, or die.\r","Brother, thou shalt to London presently,\r","And whet on Warwick to this enterprise.\r","Thou, Richard, shalt to the Duke of Norfolk,\r","And tell him privily of our intent.\r","You Edward, shall unto my Lord Cobham,\r","With whom the Kentishmen will willingly rise:\r","In them I trust; for they are soldiers,\r","Witty, courteous, liberal, full of spirit.\r","While you are thus employ'd, what resteth more,\r","But that I seek occasion how to rise,\r","And yet the king not privy to my drift,\r","Nor any of the house of Lancaster?\r","But, stay: what news? Why comest thou in such post?\r","\r","Messenger:\r","The queen with all the northern earls and lords\r","Intend here to besiege you in your castle:\r","She is hard by with twenty thousand men;\r","And therefore fortify your hold, my lord.\r","\r","YORK:\r","Ay, with my sword. What! think'st thou that we fear them?\r","Edward and Richard, you shall stay with me;\r","My brother Montague shall post to London:\r","Let noble Warwick, Cobham, and the rest,\r","Whom we have left protectors of the king,\r","With powerful policy strengthen themselves,\r","And trust not simple Henry nor his oaths.\r","\r","MONTAGUE:\r","Brother, I go; I'll win them, fear it not:\r","And thus most humbly I do take my leave.\r","Sir John and Sir Hugh Mortimer, mine uncles,\r","You are come to Sandal in a happy hour;\r","The army of the queen mean to besiege us.\r","\r","JOHN MORTIMER:\r","She shall not need; we'll meet her in the field.\r","\r","YORK:\r","What, with five thousand men?\r","\r","RICHARD:\r","Ay, with five hundred, father, for a need:\r","A woman's general; what should we fear?\r","\r","EDWARD:\r","I hear their drums: let's set our men in order,\r","And issue forth and bid them battle straight.\r","\r","YORK:\r","Five men to twenty! though the odds be great,\r","I doubt not, uncle, of our victory.\r","Many a battle have I won in France,\r","When as the enemy hath been ten to one:\r","Why should I not now have the like success?\r","3 KING HENRY VI\r","\r","RUTLAND:\r","Ah, whither shall I fly to 'scape their hands?\r","Ah, tutor, look where bloody Clifford comes!\r","\r","CLIFFORD:\r","Chaplain, away! thy priesthood saves thy life.\r","As for the brat of this accursed duke,\r","Whose father slew my father, he shall die.\r","\r","Tutor:\r","And I, my lord, will bear him company.\r","\r","CLIFFORD:\r","Soldiers, away with him!\r","\r","Tutor:\r","Ah, Clifford, murder not this innocent child,\r","Lest thou be hated both of God and man!\r","\r","CLIFFORD:\r","How now! is he dead already? or is it fear\r","That makes him close his eyes? I'll open them.\r","\r","RUTLAND:\r","So looks the pent-up lion o'er the wretch\r","That trembles under his devouring paws;\r","And so he walks, insulting o'er his prey,\r","And so he comes, to rend his limbs asunder.\r","Ah, gentle Clifford, kill me with thy sword,\r","And not with such a cruel threatening look.\r","Sweet Clifford, hear me speak before I die.\r","I am too mean a subject for thy wrath:\r","Be thou revenged on men, and let me live.\r","\r","CLIFFORD:\r","In vain thou speak'st, poor boy; my father's blood\r","Hath stopp'd the passage where thy words should enter.\r","\r","RUTLAND:\r","Then let my father's blood open it again:\r","He is a man, and, Clifford, cope with him.\r","\r","CLIFFORD:\r","Had thy brethren here, their lives and thine\r","Were not revenge sufficient for me;\r","No, if I digg'd up thy forefathers' graves\r","And hung their rotten coffins up in chains,\r","It could not slake mine ire, nor ease my heart.\r","The sight of any of the house of York\r","Is as a fury to torment my soul;\r","And till I root out their accursed line\r","And leave not one alive, I live in hell.\r","Therefore--\r","\r","RUTLAND:\r","O, let me pray before I take my death!\r","To thee I pray; sweet Clifford, pity me!\r","\r","CLIFFORD:\r","Such pity as my rapier's point affords.\r","\r","RUTLAND:\r","I never did thee harm: why wilt thou slay me?\r","\r","CLIFFORD:\r","Thy father hath.\r","\r","RUTLAND:\r","But 'twas ere I was born.\r","Thou hast one son; for his sake pity me,\r","Lest in revenge thereof, sith God is just,\r","He be as miserably slain as I.\r","Ah, let me live in prison all my days;\r","And when I give occasion of offence,\r","Then let me die, for now thou hast no cause.\r","\r","CLIFFORD:\r","No cause!\r","Thy father slew my father; therefore, die.\r","\r","RUTLAND:\r","Di faciant laudis summa sit ista tuae!\r","\r","CLIFFORD:\r","Plantagenet! I come, Plantagenet!\r","And this thy son's blood cleaving to my blade\r","Shall rust upon my weapon, till thy blood,\r","Congeal'd with this, do make me wipe off both.\r","3 KING HENRY VI\r","\r","YORK:\r","The army of the queen hath got the field:\r","My uncles both are slain in rescuing me;\r","And all my followers to the eager foe\r","Turn back and fly, like ships before the wind\r","Or lambs pursued by hunger-starved wolves.\r","My sons, God knows what hath bechanced them:\r","But this I know, they have demean'd themselves\r","Like men born to renown by life or death.\r","Three times did Richard make a lane to me.\r","And thrice cried 'Courage, father! fight it out!'\r","And full as oft came Edward to my side,\r","With purple falchion, painted to the hilt\r","In blood of those that had encounter'd him:\r","And when the hardiest warriors did retire,\r","Richard cried 'Charge! and give no foot of ground!'\r","And cried 'A crown, or else a glorious tomb!\r","A sceptre, or an earthly sepulchre!'\r","With this, we charged again: but, out, alas!\r","We bodged again; as I have seen a swan\r","With bootless labour swim against the tide\r","And spend her strength with over-matching waves.\r","Ah, hark! the fatal followers do pursue;\r","And I am faint and cannot fly their fury:\r","And were I strong, I would not shun their fury:\r","The sands are number'd that make up my life;\r","Here must I stay, and here my life must end.\r","Come, bloody Clifford, rough Northumberland,\r","I dare your quenchless fury to more rage:\r","I am your butt, and I abide your shot.\r","\r","NORTHUMBERLAND:\r","Yield to our mercy, proud Plantagenet.\r","\r","CLIFFORD:\r","Ay, to such mercy as his ruthless arm,\r","With downright payment, show'd unto my father.\r","Now Phaethon hath tumbled from his car,\r","And made an evening at the noontide prick.\r","\r","YORK:\r","My ashes, as the phoenix, may bring forth\r","A bird that will revenge upon you all:\r","And in that hope I throw mine eyes to heaven,\r","Scorning whate'er you can afflict me with.\r","Why come you not? what! multitudes, and fear?\r","\r","CLIFFORD:\r","So cowards fight when they can fly no further;\r","So doves do peck the falcon's piercing talons;\r","So desperate thieves, all hopeless of their lives,\r","Breathe out invectives 'gainst the officers.\r","\r","YORK:\r","O Clifford, but bethink thee once again,\r","And in thy thought o'er-run my former time;\r","And, if though canst for blushing, view this face,\r","And bite thy tongue, that slanders him with cowardice\r","Whose frown hath made thee faint and fly ere this!\r","\r","CLIFFORD:\r","I will not bandy with thee word for word,\r","But buckle with thee blows, twice two for one.\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","Hold, valiant Clifford! for a thousand causes\r","I would prolong awhile the traitor's life.\r","Wrath makes him deaf: speak thou, Northumberland.\r","\r","NORTHUMBERLAND:\r","Hold, Clifford! do not honour him so much\r","To prick thy finger, though to wound his heart:\r","What valour were it, when a cur doth grin,\r","For one to thrust his hand between his teeth,\r","When he might spurn him with his foot away?\r","It is war's prize to take all vantages;\r","And ten to one is no impeach of valour.\r","\r","CLIFFORD:\r","Ay, ay, so strives the woodcock with the gin.\r","\r","NORTHUMBERLAND:\r","So doth the cony struggle in the net.\r","\r","YORK:\r","So triumph thieves upon their conquer'd booty;\r","So true men yield, with robbers so o'ermatch'd.\r","\r","NORTHUMBERLAND:\r","What would your grace have done unto him now?\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","Brave warriors, Clifford and Northumberland,\r","Come, make him stand upon this molehill here,\r","That raught at mountains with outstretched arms,\r","Yet parted but the shadow with his hand.\r","What! was it you that would be England's king?\r","Was't you that revell'd in our parliament,\r","And made a preachment of your high descent?\r","Where are your mess of sons to back you now?\r","The wanton Edward, and the lusty George?\r","And where's that valiant crook-back prodigy,\r","Dicky your boy, that with his grumbling voice\r","Was wont to cheer his dad in mutinies?\r","Or, with the rest, where is your darling Rutland?\r","Look, York: I stain'd this napkin with the blood\r","That valiant Clifford, with his rapier's point,\r","Made issue from the bosom of the boy;\r","And if thine eyes can water for his death,\r","I give thee this to dry thy cheeks withal.\r","Alas poor York! but that I hate thee deadly,\r","I should lament thy miserable state.\r","I prithee, grieve, to make me merry, York.\r","What, hath thy fiery heart so parch'd thine entrails\r","That not a tear can fall for Rutland's death?\r","Why art thou patient, man? thou shouldst be mad;\r","And I, to make thee mad, do mock thee thus.\r","Stamp, rave, and fret, that I may sing and dance.\r","Thou wouldst be fee'd, I see, to make me sport:\r","York cannot speak, unless he wear a crown.\r","A crown for York! and, lords, bow low to him:\r","Hold you his hands, whilst I do set it on.\r","Ay, marry, sir, now looks he like a king!\r","Ay, this is he that took King Henry's chair,\r","And this is he was his adopted heir.\r","But how is it that great Plantagenet\r","Is crown'd so soon, and broke his solemn oath?\r","As I bethink me, you should not be king\r","Till our King Henry had shook hands with death.\r","And will you pale your head in Henry's glory,\r","And rob his temples of the diadem,\r","Now in his life, against your holy oath?\r","O, 'tis a fault too too unpardonable!\r","Off with the crown, and with the crown his head;\r","And, whilst we breathe, take time to do him dead.\r","\r","CLIFFORD:\r","That is my office, for my father's sake.\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","Nay, stay; lets hear the orisons he makes.\r","\r","YORK:\r","She-wolf of France, but worse than wolves of France,\r","Whose tongue more poisons than the adder's tooth!\r","How ill-beseeming is it in thy sex\r","To triumph, like an Amazonian trull,\r","Upon their woes whom fortune captivates!\r","But that thy face is, vizard-like, unchanging,\r","Made impudent with use of evil deeds,\r","I would assay, proud queen, to make thee blush.\r","To tell thee whence thou camest, of whom derived,\r","Were shame enough to shame thee, wert thou not shameless.\r","Thy father bears the type of King of Naples,\r","Of both the Sicils and Jerusalem,\r","Yet not so wealthy as an English yeoman.\r","Hath that poor monarch taught thee to insult?\r","It needs not, nor it boots thee not, proud queen,\r","Unless the adage must be verified,\r","That beggars mounted run their horse to death.\r","'Tis beauty that doth oft make women proud;\r","But, God he knows, thy share thereof is small:\r","'Tis virtue that doth make them most admired;\r","The contrary doth make thee wonder'd at:\r","'Tis government that makes them seem divine;\r","The want thereof makes thee abominable:\r","Thou art as opposite to every good\r","As the Antipodes are unto us,\r","Or as the south to the septentrion.\r","O tiger's heart wrapt in a woman's hide!\r","How couldst thou drain the life-blood of the child,\r","To bid the father wipe his eyes withal,\r","And yet be seen to bear a woman's face?\r","Women are soft, mild, pitiful and flexible;\r","Thou stern, obdurate, flinty, rough, remorseless.\r","Bids't thou me rage? why, now thou hast thy wish:\r","Wouldst have me weep? why, now thou hast thy will:\r","For raging wind blows up incessant showers,\r","And when the rage allays, the rain begins.\r","These tears are my sweet Rutland's obsequies:\r","And every drop cries vengeance for his death,\r","'Gainst thee, fell Clifford, and thee, false\r","Frenchwoman.\r","\r","NORTHUMBERLAND:\r","Beshrew me, but his passion moves me so\r","That hardly can I cheque my eyes from tears.\r","\r","YORK:\r","That face of his the hungry cannibals\r","Would not have touch'd, would not have stain'd with blood:\r","But you are more inhuman, more inexorable,\r","O, ten times more, than tigers of Hyrcania.\r","See, ruthless queen, a hapless father's tears:\r","This cloth thou dip'dst in blood of my sweet boy,\r","And I with tears do wash the blood away.\r","Keep thou the napkin, and go boast of this:\r","And if thou tell'st the heavy story right,\r","Upon my soul, the hearers will shed tears;\r","Yea even my foes will shed fast-falling tears,\r","And say 'Alas, it was a piteous deed!'\r","There, take the crown, and, with the crown, my curse;\r","And in thy need such comfort come to thee\r","As now I reap at thy too cruel hand!\r","Hard-hearted Clifford, take me from the world:\r","My soul to heaven, my blood upon your heads!\r","\r","NORTHUMBERLAND:\r","Had he been slaughter-man to all my kin,\r","I should not for my life but weep with him.\r","To see how inly sorrow gripes his soul.\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","What, weeping-ripe, my Lord Northumberland?\r","Think but upon the wrong he did us all,\r","And that will quickly dry thy melting tears.\r","\r","CLIFFORD:\r","Here's for my oath, here's for my father's death.\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","And here's to right our gentle-hearted king.\r","\r","YORK:\r","Open Thy gate of mercy, gracious God!\r","My soul flies through these wounds to seek out Thee.\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","Off with his head, and set it on York gates;\r","So York may overlook the town of York.\r","3 KING HENRY VI\r","\r","EDWARD:\r","I wonder how our princely father 'scaped,\r","Or whether he be 'scaped away or no\r","From Clifford's and Northumberland's pursuit:\r","Had he been ta'en, we should have heard the news;\r","Had he been slain, we should have heard the news;\r","Or had he 'scaped, methinks we should have heard\r","The happy tidings of his good escape.\r","How fares my brother? why is he so sad?\r","\r","RICHARD:\r","I cannot joy, until I be resolved\r","Where our right valiant father is become.\r","I saw him in the battle range about;\r","And watch'd him how he singled Clifford forth.\r","Methought he bore him in the thickest troop\r","As doth a lion in a herd of neat;\r","Or as a bear, encompass'd round with dogs,\r","Who having pinch'd a few and made them cry,\r","The rest stand all aloof, and bark at him.\r","So fared our father with his enemies;\r","So fled his enemies my warlike father:\r","Methinks, 'tis prize enough to be his son.\r","See how the morning opes her golden gates,\r","And takes her farewell of the glorious sun!\r","How well resembles it the prime of youth,\r","Trimm'd like a younker prancing to his love!\r","\r","EDWARD:\r","Dazzle mine eyes, or do I see three suns?\r","\r","RICHARD:\r","Three glorious suns, each one a perfect sun;\r","Not separated with the racking clouds,\r","But sever'd in a pale clear-shining sky.\r","See, see! they join, embrace, and seem to kiss,\r","As if they vow'd some league inviolable:\r","Now are they but one lamp, one light, one sun.\r","In this the heaven figures some event.\r","\r","EDWARD:\r","'Tis wondrous strange, the like yet never heard of.\r","I think it cites us, brother, to the field,\r","That we, the sons of brave Plantagenet,\r","Each one already blazing by our meeds,\r","Should notwithstanding join our lights together\r","And over-shine the earth as this the world.\r","Whate'er it bodes, henceforward will I bear\r","Upon my target three fair-shining suns.\r","\r","RICHARD:\r","Nay, bear three daughters: by your leave I speak it,\r","You love the breeder better than the male.\r","But what art thou, whose heavy looks foretell\r","Some dreadful story hanging on thy tongue?\r","\r","Messenger:\r","Ah, one that was a woful looker-on\r","When as the noble Duke of York was slain,\r","Your princely father and my loving lord!\r","\r","EDWARD:\r","O, speak no more, for I have heard too much.\r","\r","RICHARD:\r","Say how he died, for I will hear it all.\r","\r","Messenger:\r","Environed he was with many foes,\r","And stood against them, as the hope of Troy\r","Against the Greeks that would have enter'd Troy.\r","But Hercules himself must yield to odds;\r","And many strokes, though with a little axe,\r","Hew down and fell the hardest-timber'd oak.\r","By many hands your father was subdued;\r","But only slaughter'd by the ireful arm\r","Of unrelenting Clifford and the queen,\r","Who crown'd the gracious duke in high despite,\r","Laugh'd in his face; and when with grief he wept,\r","The ruthless queen gave him to dry his cheeks\r","A napkin steeped in the harmless blood\r","Of sweet young Rutland, by rough Clifford slain:\r","And after many scorns, many foul taunts,\r","They took his head, and on the gates of York\r","They set the same; and there it doth remain,\r","The saddest spectacle that e'er I view'd.\r","\r","EDWARD:\r","Sweet Duke of York, our prop to lean upon,\r","Now thou art gone, we have no staff, no stay.\r","O Clifford, boisterous Clifford! thou hast slain\r","The flower of Europe for his chivalry;\r","And treacherously hast thou vanquish'd him,\r","For hand to hand he would have vanquish'd thee.\r","Now my soul's palace is become a prison:\r","Ah, would she break from hence, that this my body\r","Might in the ground be closed up in rest!\r","For never henceforth shall I joy again,\r","Never, O never shall I see more joy!\r","\r","RICHARD:\r","I cannot weep; for all my body's moisture\r","Scarce serves to quench my furnace-burning heart:\r","Nor can my tongue unload my heart's great burthen;\r","For selfsame wind that I should speak withal\r","Is kindling coals that fires all my breast,\r","And burns me up with flames that tears would quench.\r","To weep is to make less the depth of grief:\r","Tears then for babes; blows and revenge for me\r","Richard, I bear thy name; I'll venge thy death,\r","Or die renowned by attempting it.\r","\r","EDWARD:\r","His name that valiant duke hath left with thee;\r","His dukedom and his chair with me is left.\r","\r","RICHARD:\r","Nay, if thou be that princely eagle's bird,\r","Show thy descent by gazing 'gainst the sun:\r","For chair and dukedom, throne and kingdom say;\r","Either that is thine, or else thou wert not his.\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","How now, fair lords! What fare? what news abroad?\r","\r","RICHARD:\r","Great Lord of Warwick, if we should recount\r","Our baleful news, and at each word's deliverance\r","Stab poniards in our flesh till all were told,\r","The words would add more anguish than the wounds.\r","O valiant lord, the Duke of York is slain!\r","\r","EDWARD:\r","O Warwick, Warwick! that Plantagenet,\r","Which held three dearly as his soul's redemption,\r","Is by the stern Lord Clifford done to death.\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","Ten days ago I drown'd these news in tears;\r","And now, to add more measure to your woes,\r","I come to tell you things sith then befall'n.\r","After the bloody fray at Wakefield fought,\r","Where your brave father breathed his latest gasp,\r","Tidings, as swiftly as the posts could run,\r","Were brought me of your loss and his depart.\r","I, then in London keeper of the king,\r","Muster'd my soldiers, gather'd flocks of friends,\r","And very well appointed, as I thought,\r","March'd toward Saint Alban's to intercept the queen,\r","Bearing the king in my behalf along;\r","For by my scouts I was advertised\r","That she was coming with a full intent\r","To dash our late decree in parliament\r","Touching King Henry's oath and your succession.\r","Short tale to make, we at Saint Alban's met\r","Our battles join'd, and both sides fiercely fought:\r","But whether 'twas the coldness of the king,\r","Who look'd full gently on his warlike queen,\r","That robb'd my soldiers of their heated spleen;\r","Or whether 'twas report of her success;\r","Or more than common fear of Clifford's rigour,\r","Who thunders to his captives blood and death,\r","I cannot judge: but to conclude with truth,\r","Their weapons like to lightning came and went;\r","Our soldiers', like the night-owl's lazy flight,\r","Or like an idle thresher with a flail,\r","Fell gently down, as if they struck their friends.\r","I cheer'd them up with justice of our cause,\r","With promise of high pay and great rewards:\r","But all in vain; they had no heart to fight,\r","And we in them no hope to win the day;\r","So that we fled; the king unto the queen;\r","Lord George your brother, Norfolk and myself,\r","In haste, post-haste, are come to join with you:\r","For in the marches here we heard you were,\r","Making another head to fight again.\r","\r","EDWARD:\r","Where is the Duke of Norfolk, gentle Warwick?\r","And when came George from Burgundy to England?\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","Some six miles off the duke is with the soldiers;\r","And for your brother, he was lately sent\r","From your kind aunt, Duchess of Burgundy,\r","With aid of soldiers to this needful war.\r","\r","RICHARD:\r","'Twas odds, belike, when valiant Warwick fled:\r","Oft have I heard his praises in pursuit,\r","But ne'er till now his scandal of retire.\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","Nor now my scandal, Richard, dost thou hear;\r","For thou shalt know this strong right hand of mine\r","Can pluck the diadem from faint Henry's head,\r","And wring the awful sceptre from his fist,\r","Were he as famous and as bold in war\r","As he is famed for mildness, peace, and prayer.\r","\r","RICHARD:\r","I know it well, Lord Warwick; blame me not:\r","'Tis love I bear thy glories makes me speak.\r","But in this troublous time what's to be done?\r","Shall we go throw away our coats of steel,\r","And wrap our bodies in black mourning gowns,\r","Numbering our Ave-Maries with our beads?\r","Or shall we on the helmets of our foes\r","Tell our devotion with revengeful arms?\r","If for the last, say ay, and to it, lords.\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","Why, therefore Warwick came to seek you out;\r","And therefore comes my brother Montague.\r","Attend me, lords. The proud insulting queen,\r","With Clifford and the haught Northumberland,\r","And of their feather many more proud birds,\r","Have wrought the easy-melting king like wax.\r","He swore consent to your succession,\r","His oath enrolled in the parliament;\r","And now to London all the crew are gone,\r","To frustrate both his oath and what beside\r","May make against the house of Lancaster.\r","Their power, I think, is thirty thousand strong:\r","Now, if the help of Norfolk and myself,\r","With all the friends that thou, brave Earl of March,\r","Amongst the loving Welshmen canst procure,\r","Will but amount to five and twenty thousand,\r","Why, Via! to London will we march amain,\r","And once again bestride our foaming steeds,\r","And once again cry 'Charge upon our foes!'\r","But never once again turn back and fly.\r","\r","RICHARD:\r","Ay, now methinks I hear great Warwick speak:\r","Ne'er may he live to see a sunshine day,\r","That cries 'Retire,' if Warwick bid him stay.\r","\r","EDWARD:\r","Lord Warwick, on thy shoulder will I lean;\r","And when thou fail'st--as God forbid the hour!--\r","Must Edward fall, which peril heaven forfend!\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","No longer Earl of March, but Duke of York:\r","The next degree is England's royal throne;\r","For King of England shalt thou be proclaim'd\r","In every borough as we pass along;\r","And he that throws not up his cap for joy\r","Shall for the fault make forfeit of his head.\r","King Edward, valiant Richard, Montague,\r","Stay we no longer, dreaming of renown,\r","But sound the trumpets, and about our task.\r","\r","RICHARD:\r","Then, Clifford, were thy heart as hard as steel,\r","As thou hast shown it flinty by thy deeds,\r","I come to pierce it, or to give thee mine.\r","\r","EDWARD:\r","Then strike up drums: God and Saint George for us!\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","How now! what news?\r","\r","Messenger:\r","The Duke of Norfolk sends you word by me,\r","The queen is coming with a puissant host;\r","And craves your company for speedy counsel.\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","Why then it sorts, brave warriors, let's away.\r","3 KING HENRY VI\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","Welcome, my lord, to this brave town of York.\r","Yonder's the head of that arch-enemy\r","That sought to be encompass'd with your crown:\r","Doth not the object cheer your heart, my lord?\r","\r","KING HENRY VI:\r","Ay, as the rocks cheer them that fear their wreck:\r","To see this sight, it irks my very soul.\r","Withhold revenge, dear God! 'tis not my fault,\r","Nor wittingly have I infringed my vow.\r","\r","CLIFFORD:\r","My gracious liege, this too much lenity\r","And harmful pity must be laid aside.\r","To whom do lions cast their gentle looks?\r","Not to the beast that would usurp their den.\r","Whose hand is that the forest bear doth lick?\r","Not his that spoils her young before her face.\r","Who 'scapes the lurking serpent's mortal sting?\r","Not he that sets his foot upon her back.\r","The smallest worm will turn being trodden on,\r","And doves will peck in safeguard of their brood.\r","Ambitious York doth level at thy crown,\r","Thou smiling while he knit his angry brows:\r","He, but a duke, would have his son a king,\r","And raise his issue, like a loving sire;\r","Thou, being a king, blest with a goodly son,\r","Didst yield consent to disinherit him,\r","Which argued thee a most unloving father.\r","Unreasonable creatures feed their young;\r","And though man's face be fearful to their eyes,\r","Yet, in protection of their tender ones,\r","Who hath not seen them, even with those wings\r","Which sometime they have used with fearful flight,\r","Make war with him that climb'd unto their nest,\r","Offer their own lives in their young's defence?\r","For shame, my liege, make them your precedent!\r","Were it not pity that this goodly boy\r","Should lose his birthright by his father's fault,\r","And long hereafter say unto his child,\r","'What my great-grandfather and his grandsire got\r","My careless father fondly gave away'?\r","Ah, what a shame were this! Look on the boy;\r","And let his manly face, which promiseth\r","Successful fortune, steel thy melting heart\r","To hold thine own and leave thine own with him.\r","\r","KING HENRY VI:\r","Full well hath Clifford play'd the orator,\r","Inferring arguments of mighty force.\r","But, Clifford, tell me, didst thou never hear\r","That things ill-got had ever bad success?\r","And happy always was it for that son\r","Whose father for his hoarding went to hell?\r","I'll leave my son my virtuous deeds behind;\r","And would my father had left me no more!\r","For all the rest is held at such a rate\r","As brings a thousand-fold more care to keep\r","Than in possession and jot of pleasure.\r","Ah, cousin York! would thy best friends did know\r","How it doth grieve me that thy head is here!\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","My lord, cheer up your spirits: our foes are nigh,\r","And this soft courage makes your followers faint.\r","You promised knighthood to our forward son:\r","Unsheathe your sword, and dub him presently.\r","Edward, kneel down.\r","\r","KING HENRY VI:\r","Edward Plantagenet, arise a knight;\r","And learn this lesson, draw thy sword in right.\r","\r","PRINCE:\r","My gracious father, by your kingly leave,\r","I'll draw it as apparent to the crown,\r","And in that quarrel use it to the death.\r","\r","CLIFFORD:\r","Why, that is spoken like a toward prince.\r","\r","Messenger:\r","Royal commanders, be in readiness:\r","For with a band of thirty thousand men\r","Comes Warwick, backing of the Duke of York;\r","And in the towns, as they do march along,\r","Proclaims him king, and many fly to him:\r","Darraign your battle, for they are at hand.\r","\r","CLIFFORD:\r","I would your highness would depart the field:\r","The queen hath best success when you are absent.\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","Ay, good my lord, and leave us to our fortune.\r","\r","KING HENRY VI:\r","Why, that's my fortune too; therefore I'll stay.\r","\r","NORTHUMBERLAND:\r","Be it with resolution then to fight.\r","\r","PRINCE EDWARD:\r","My royal father, cheer these noble lords\r","And hearten those that fight in your defence:\r","Unsheathe your sword, good father; cry 'Saint George!'\r","\r","EDWARD:\r","Now, perjured Henry! wilt thou kneel for grace,\r","And set thy diadem upon my head;\r","Or bide the mortal fortune of the field?\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","Go, rate thy minions, proud insulting boy!\r","Becomes it thee to be thus bold in terms\r","Before thy sovereign and thy lawful king?\r","\r","EDWARD:\r","I am his king, and he should bow his knee;\r","I was adopted heir by his consent:\r","Since when, his oath is broke; for, as I hear,\r","You, that are king, though he do wear the crown,\r","Have caused him, by new act of parliament,\r","To blot out me, and put his own son in.\r","\r","CLIFFORD:\r","And reason too:\r","Who should succeed the father but the son?\r","\r","RICHARD:\r","Are you there, butcher? O, I cannot speak!\r","\r","CLIFFORD:\r","Ay, crook-back, here I stand to answer thee,\r","Or any he the proudest of thy sort.\r","\r","RICHARD:\r","'Twas you that kill'd young Rutland, was it not?\r","\r","CLIFFORD:\r","Ay, and old York, and yet not satisfied.\r","\r","RICHARD:\r","For God's sake, lords, give signal to the fight.\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","What say'st thou, Henry, wilt thou yield the crown?\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","Why, how now, long-tongued Warwick! dare you speak?\r","When you and I met at Saint Alban's last,\r","Your legs did better service than your hands.\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","Then 'twas my turn to fly, and now 'tis thine.\r","\r","CLIFFORD:\r","You said so much before, and yet you fled.\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","'Twas not your valour, Clifford, drove me thence.\r","\r","NORTHUMBERLAND:\r","No, nor your manhood that durst make you stay.\r","\r","RICHARD:\r","Northumberland, I hold thee reverently.\r","Break off the parley; for scarce I can refrain\r","The execution of my big-swoln heart\r","Upon that Clifford, that cruel child-killer.\r","\r","CLIFFORD:\r","I slew thy father, call'st thou him a child?\r","\r","RICHARD:\r","Ay, like a dastard and a treacherous coward,\r","As thou didst kill our tender brother Rutland;\r","But ere sunset I'll make thee curse the deed.\r","\r","KING HENRY VI:\r","Have done with words, my lords, and hear me speak.\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","Defy them then, or else hold close thy lips.\r","\r","KING HENRY VI:\r","I prithee, give no limits to my tongue:\r","I am a king, and privileged to speak.\r","\r","CLIFFORD:\r","My liege, the wound that bred this meeting here\r","Cannot be cured by words; therefore be still.\r","\r","RICHARD:\r","Then, executioner, unsheathe thy sword:\r","By him that made us all, I am resolved\r","that Clifford's manhood lies upon his tongue.\r","\r","EDWARD:\r","Say, Henry, shall I have my right, or no?\r","A thousand men have broke their fasts to-day,\r","That ne'er shall dine unless thou yield the crown.\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","If thou deny, their blood upon thy head;\r","For York in justice puts his armour on.\r","\r","PRINCE EDWARD:\r","If that be right which Warwick says is right,\r","There is no wrong, but every thing is right.\r","\r","RICHARD:\r","Whoever got thee, there thy mother stands;\r","For, well I wot, thou hast thy mother's tongue.\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","But thou art neither like thy sire nor dam;\r","But like a foul mis-shapen stigmatic,\r","Mark'd by the destinies to be avoided,\r","As venom toads, or lizards' dreadful stings.\r","\r","RICHARD:\r","Iron of Naples hid with English gilt,\r","Whose father bears the title of a king,--\r","As if a channel should be call'd the sea,--\r","Shamest thou not, knowing whence thou art extraught,\r","To let thy tongue detect thy base-born heart?\r","\r","EDWARD:\r","A wisp of straw were worth a thousand crowns,\r","To make this shameless callet know herself.\r","Helen of Greece was fairer far than thou,\r","Although thy husband may be Menelaus;\r","And ne'er was Agamemnon's brother wrong'd\r","By that false woman, as this king by thee.\r","His father revell'd in the heart of France,\r","And tamed the king, and made the dauphin stoop;\r","And had he match'd according to his state,\r","He might have kept that glory to this day;\r","But when he took a beggar to his bed,\r","And graced thy poor sire with his bridal-day,\r","Even then that sunshine brew'd a shower for him,\r","That wash'd his father's fortunes forth of France,\r","And heap'd sedition on his crown at home.\r","For what hath broach'd this tumult but thy pride?\r","Hadst thou been meek, our title still had slept;\r","And we, in pity of the gentle king,\r","Had slipp'd our claim until another age.\r","\r","GEORGE:\r","But when we saw our sunshine made thy spring,\r","And that thy summer bred us no increase,\r","We set the axe to thy usurping root;\r","And though the edge hath something hit ourselves,\r","Yet, know thou, since we have begun to strike,\r","We'll never leave till we have hewn thee down,\r","Or bathed thy growing with our heated bloods.\r","\r","EDWARD:\r","And, in this resolution, I defy thee;\r","Not willing any longer conference,\r","Since thou deniest the gentle king to speak.\r","Sound trumpets! let our bloody colours wave!\r","And either victory, or else a grave.\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","Stay, Edward.\r","\r","EDWARD:\r","No, wrangling woman, we'll no longer stay:\r","These words will cost ten thousand lives this day.\r","3 KING HENRY VI\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","Forspent with toil, as runners with a race,\r","I lay me down a little while to breathe;\r","For strokes received, and many blows repaid,\r","Have robb'd my strong-knit sinews of their strength,\r","And spite of spite needs must I rest awhile.\r","\r","EDWARD:\r","Smile, gentle heaven! or strike, ungentle death!\r","For this world frowns, and Edward's sun is clouded.\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","How now, my lord! what hap? what hope of good?\r","\r","GEORGE:\r","Our hap is loss, our hope but sad despair;\r","Our ranks are broke, and ruin follows us:\r","What counsel give you? whither shall we fly?\r","\r","EDWARD:\r","Bootless is flight, they follow us with wings;\r","And weak we are and cannot shun pursuit.\r","\r","RICHARD:\r","Ah, Warwick, why hast thou withdrawn thyself?\r","Thy brother's blood the thirsty earth hath drunk,\r","Broach'd with the steely point of Clifford's lance;\r","And in the very pangs of death he cried,\r","Like to a dismal clangour heard from far,\r","'Warwick, revenge! brother, revenge my death!'\r","So, underneath the belly of their steeds,\r","That stain'd their fetlocks in his smoking blood,\r","The noble gentleman gave up the ghost.\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","Then let the earth be drunken with our blood:\r","I'll kill my horse, because I will not fly.\r","Why stand we like soft-hearted women here,\r","Wailing our losses, whiles the foe doth rage;\r","And look upon, as if the tragedy\r","Were play'd in jest by counterfeiting actors?\r","Here on my knee I vow to God above,\r","I'll never pause again, never stand still,\r","Till either death hath closed these eyes of mine\r","Or fortune given me measure of revenge.\r","\r","EDWARD:\r","O Warwick, I do bend my knee with thine;\r","And in this vow do chain my soul to thine!\r","And, ere my knee rise from the earth's cold face,\r","I throw my hands, mine eyes, my heart to thee,\r","Thou setter up and plucker down of kings,\r","Beseeching thee, if with they will it stands\r","That to my foes this body must be prey,\r","Yet that thy brazen gates of heaven may ope,\r","And give sweet passage to my sinful soul!\r","Now, lords, take leave until we meet again,\r","Where'er it be, in heaven or in earth.\r","\r","RICHARD:\r","Brother, give me thy hand; and, gentle Warwick,\r","Let me embrace thee in my weary arms:\r","I, that did never weep, now melt with woe\r","That winter should cut off our spring-time so.\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","Away, away! Once more, sweet lords farewell.\r","\r","GEORGE:\r","Yet let us all together to our troops,\r","And give them leave to fly that will not stay;\r","And call them pillars that will stand to us;\r","And, if we thrive, promise them such rewards\r","As victors wear at the Olympian games:\r","This may plant courage in their quailing breasts;\r","For yet is hope of life and victory.\r","Forslow no longer, make we hence amain.\r","3 KING HENRY VI\r","\r","RICHARD:\r","Now, Clifford, I have singled thee alone:\r","Suppose this arm is for the Duke of York,\r","And this for Rutland; both bound to revenge,\r","Wert thou environ'd with a brazen wall.\r","\r","CLIFFORD:\r","Now, Richard, I am with thee here alone:\r","This is the hand that stabb'd thy father York;\r","And this the hand that slew thy brother Rutland;\r","And here's the heart that triumphs in their death\r","And cheers these hands that slew thy sire and brother\r","To execute the like upon thyself;\r","And so, have at thee!\r","\r","RICHARD:\r","Nay Warwick, single out some other chase;\r","For I myself will hunt this wolf to death.\r","3 KING HENRY VI\r","\r","KING HENRY VI:\r","This battle fares like to the morning's war,\r","When dying clouds contend with growing light,\r","What time the shepherd, blowing of his nails,\r","Can neither call it perfect day nor night.\r","Now sways it this way, like a mighty sea\r","Forced by the tide to combat with the wind;\r","Now sways it that way, like the selfsame sea\r","Forced to retire by fury of the wind:\r","Sometime the flood prevails, and then the wind;\r","Now one the better, then another best;\r","Both tugging to be victors, breast to breast,\r","Yet neither conqueror nor conquered:\r","So is the equal of this fell war.\r","Here on this molehill will I sit me down.\r","To whom God will, there be the victory!\r","For Margaret my queen, and Clifford too,\r","Have chid me from the battle; swearing both\r","They prosper best of all when I am thence.\r","Would I were dead! if God's good will were so;\r","For what is in this world but grief and woe?\r","O God! methinks it were a happy life,\r","To be no better than a homely swain;\r","To sit upon a hill, as I do now,\r","To carve out dials quaintly, point by point,\r","Thereby to see the minutes how they run,\r","How many make the hour full complete;\r","How many hours bring about the day;\r","How many days will finish up the year;\r","How many years a mortal man may live.\r","When this is known, then to divide the times:\r","So many hours must I tend my flock;\r","So many hours must I take my rest;\r","So many hours must I contemplate;\r","So many hours must I sport myself;\r","So many days my ewes have been with young;\r","So many weeks ere the poor fools will ean:\r","So many years ere I shall shear the fleece:\r","So minutes, hours, days, months, and years,\r","Pass'd over to the end they were created,\r","Would bring white hairs unto a quiet grave.\r","Ah, what a life were this! how sweet! how lovely!\r","Gives not the hawthorn-bush a sweeter shade\r","To shepherds looking on their silly sheep,\r","Than doth a rich embroider'd canopy\r","To kings that fear their subjects' treachery?\r","O, yes, it doth; a thousand-fold it doth.\r","And to conclude, the shepherd's homely curds,\r","His cold thin drink out of his leather bottle.\r","His wonted sleep under a fresh tree's shade,\r","All which secure and sweetly he enjoys,\r","Is far beyond a prince's delicates,\r","His viands sparkling in a golden cup,\r","His body couched in a curious bed,\r","When care, mistrust, and treason waits on him.\r","\r","Son:\r","Ill blows the wind that profits nobody.\r","This man, whom hand to hand I slew in fight,\r","May be possessed with some store of crowns;\r","And I, that haply take them from him now,\r","May yet ere night yield both my life and them\r","To some man else, as this dead man doth me.\r","Who's this? O God! it is my father's face,\r","Whom in this conflict I unwares have kill'd.\r","O heavy times, begetting such events!\r","From London by the king was I press'd forth;\r","My father, being the Earl of Warwick's man,\r","Came on the part of York, press'd by his master;\r","And I, who at his hands received my life, him\r","Have by my hands of life bereaved him.\r","Pardon me, God, I knew not what I did!\r","And pardon, father, for I knew not thee!\r","My tears shall wipe away these bloody marks;\r","And no more words till they have flow'd their fill.\r","\r","KING HENRY VI:\r","O piteous spectacle! O bloody times!\r","Whiles lions war and battle for their dens,\r","Poor harmless lambs abide their enmity.\r","Weep, wretched man, I'll aid thee tear for tear;\r","And let our hearts and eyes, like civil war,\r","Be blind with tears, and break o'ercharged with grief.\r","\r","Father:\r","Thou that so stoutly hast resisted me,\r","Give me thy gold, if thou hast any gold:\r","For I have bought it with an hundred blows.\r","But let me see: is this our foeman's face?\r","Ah, no, no, no, it is mine only son!\r","Ah, boy, if any life be left in thee,\r","Throw up thine eye! see, see what showers arise,\r","Blown with the windy tempest of my heart,\r","Upon thy words, that kill mine eye and heart!\r","O, pity, God, this miserable age!\r","What stratagems, how fell, how butcherly,\r","Erroneous, mutinous and unnatural,\r","This deadly quarrel daily doth beget!\r","O boy, thy father gave thee life too soon,\r","And hath bereft thee of thy life too late!\r","\r","KING HENRY VI:\r","Woe above woe!
