grief more than common grief!\r","O that my death would stay these ruthful deeds!\r","O pity, pity, gentle heaven, pity!\r","The red rose and the white are on his face,\r","The fatal colours of our striving houses:\r","The one his purple blood right well resembles;\r","The other his pale cheeks, methinks, presenteth:\r","Wither one rose, and let the other flourish;\r","If you contend, a thousand lives must wither.\r","\r","Son:\r","How will my mother for a father's death\r","Take on with me and ne'er be satisfied!\r","\r","Father:\r","How will my wife for slaughter of my son\r","Shed seas of tears and ne'er be satisfied!\r","\r","KING HENRY VI:\r","How will the country for these woful chances\r","Misthink the king and not be satisfied!\r","\r","Son:\r","Was ever son so rued a father's death?\r","\r","Father:\r","Was ever father so bemoan'd his son?\r","\r","KING HENRY VI:\r","Was ever king so grieved for subjects' woe?\r","Much is your sorrow; mine ten times so much.\r","\r","Son:\r","I'll bear thee hence, where I may weep my fill.\r","\r","Father:\r","These arms of mine shall be thy winding-sheet;\r","My heart, sweet boy, shall be thy sepulchre,\r","For from my heart thine image ne'er shall go;\r","My sighing breast shall be thy funeral bell;\r","And so obsequious will thy father be,\r","Even for the loss of thee, having no more,\r","As Priam was for all his valiant sons.\r","I'll bear thee hence; and let them fight that will,\r","For I have murdered where I should not kill.\r","\r","KING HENRY VI:\r","Sad-hearted men, much overgone with care,\r","Here sits a king more woful than you are.\r","\r","PRINCE EDWARD:\r","Fly, father, fly! for all your friends are fled,\r","And Warwick rages like a chafed bull:\r","Away! for death doth hold us in pursuit.\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","Mount you, my lord; towards Berwick post amain:\r","Edward and Richard, like a brace of greyhounds\r","Having the fearful flying hare in sight,\r","With fiery eyes sparkling for very wrath,\r","And bloody steel grasp'd in their ireful hands,\r","Are at our backs; and therefore hence amain.\r","\r","EXETER:\r","Away! for vengeance comes along with them:\r","Nay, stay not to expostulate, make speed;\r","Or else come after: I'll away before.\r","\r","KING HENRY VI:\r","Nay, take me with thee, good sweet Exeter:\r","Not that I fear to stay, but love to go\r","Whither the queen intends. Forward; away!\r","3 KING HENRY VI\r","\r","CLIFFORD:\r","Here burns my candle out; ay, here it dies,\r","Which, whiles it lasted, gave King Henry light.\r","O Lancaster, I fear thy overthrow\r","More than my body's parting with my soul!\r","My love and fear glued many friends to thee;\r","And, now I fall, thy tough commixture melts.\r","Impairing Henry, strengthening misproud York,\r","The common people swarm like summer flies;\r","And whither fly the gnats but to the sun?\r","And who shines now but Henry's enemies?\r","O Phoebus, hadst thou never given consent\r","That Phaethon should cheque thy fiery steeds,\r","Thy burning car never had scorch'd the earth!\r","And, Henry, hadst thou sway'd as kings should do,\r","Or as thy father and his father did,\r","Giving no ground unto the house of York,\r","They never then had sprung like summer flies;\r","I and ten thousand in this luckless realm\r","Had left no mourning widows for our death;\r","And thou this day hadst kept thy chair in peace.\r","For what doth cherish weeds but gentle air?\r","And what makes robbers bold but too much lenity?\r","Bootless are plaints, and cureless are my wounds;\r","No way to fly, nor strength to hold out flight:\r","The foe is merciless, and will not pity;\r","For at their hands I have deserved no pity.\r","The air hath got into my deadly wounds,\r","And much effuse of blood doth make me faint.\r","Come, York and Richard, Warwick and the rest;\r","I stabb'd your fathers' bosoms, split my breast.\r","\r","EDWARD:\r","Now breathe we, lords: good fortune bids us pause,\r","And smooth the frowns of war with peaceful looks.\r","Some troops pursue the bloody-minded queen,\r","That led calm Henry, though he were a king,\r","As doth a sail, fill'd with a fretting gust,\r","Command an argosy to stem the waves.\r","But think you, lords, that Clifford fled with them?\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","No, 'tis impossible he should escape,\r","For, though before his face I speak the words\r","Your brother Richard mark'd him for the grave:\r","And wheresoe'er he is, he's surely dead.\r","\r","EDWARD:\r","Whose soul is that which takes her heavy leave?\r","\r","RICHARD:\r","A deadly groan, like life and death's departing.\r","\r","EDWARD:\r","See who it is: and, now the battle's ended,\r","If friend or foe, let him be gently used.\r","\r","RICHARD:\r","Revoke that doom of mercy, for 'tis Clifford;\r","Who not contented that he lopp'd the branch\r","In hewing Rutland when his leaves put forth,\r","But set his murdering knife unto the root\r","From whence that tender spray did sweetly spring,\r","I mean our princely father, Duke of York.\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","From off the gates of York fetch down the head,\r","Your father's head, which Clifford placed there;\r","Instead whereof let this supply the room:\r","Measure for measure must be answered.\r","\r","EDWARD:\r","Bring forth that fatal screech-owl to our house,\r","That nothing sung but death to us and ours:\r","Now death shall stop his dismal threatening sound,\r","And his ill-boding tongue no more shall speak.\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","I think his understanding is bereft.\r","Speak, Clifford, dost thou know who speaks to thee?\r","Dark cloudy death o'ershades his beams of life,\r","And he nor sees nor hears us what we say.\r","\r","RICHARD:\r","O, would he did! and so perhaps he doth:\r","'Tis but his policy to counterfeit,\r","Because he would avoid such bitter taunts\r","Which in the time of death he gave our father.\r","\r","GEORGE:\r","If so thou think'st, vex him with eager words.\r","\r","RICHARD:\r","Clifford, ask mercy and obtain no grace.\r","\r","EDWARD:\r","Clifford, repent in bootless penitence.\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","Clifford, devise excuses for thy faults.\r","\r","GEORGE:\r","While we devise fell tortures for thy faults.\r","\r","RICHARD:\r","Thou didst love York, and I am son to York.\r","\r","EDWARD:\r","Thou pitied'st Rutland; I will pity thee.\r","\r","GEORGE:\r","Where's Captain Margaret, to fence you now?\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","They mock thee, Clifford: swear as thou wast wont.\r","\r","RICHARD:\r","What, not an oath? nay, then the world goes hard\r","When Clifford cannot spare his friends an oath.\r","I know by that he's dead; and, by my soul,\r","If this right hand would buy two hour's life,\r","That I in all despite might rail at him,\r","This hand should chop it off, and with the\r","issuing blood\r","Stifle the villain whose unstanched thirst\r","York and young Rutland could not satisfy.\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","Ay, but he's dead: off with the traitor's head,\r","And rear it in the place your father's stands.\r","And now to London with triumphant march,\r","There to be crowned England's royal king:\r","From whence shall Warwick cut the sea to France,\r","And ask the Lady Bona for thy queen:\r","So shalt thou sinew both these lands together;\r","And, having France thy friend, thou shalt not dread\r","The scatter'd foe that hopes to rise again;\r","For though they cannot greatly sting to hurt,\r","Yet look to have them buzz to offend thine ears.\r","First will I see the coronation;\r","And then to Brittany I'll cross the sea,\r","To effect this marriage, so it please my lord.\r","\r","EDWARD:\r","Even as thou wilt, sweet Warwick, let it be;\r","For in thy shoulder do I build my seat,\r","And never will I undertake the thing\r","Wherein thy counsel and consent is wanting.\r","Richard, I will create thee Duke of Gloucester,\r","And George, of Clarence: Warwick, as ourself,\r","Shall do and undo as him pleaseth best.\r","\r","RICHARD:\r","Let me be Duke of Clarence, George of Gloucester;\r","For Gloucester's dukedom is too ominous.\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","Tut, that's a foolish observation:\r","Richard, be Duke of Gloucester. Now to London,\r","To see these honours in possession.\r","3 KING HENRY VI\r","\r","First Keeper:\r","Under this thick-grown brake we'll shroud ourselves;\r","For through this laund anon the deer will come;\r","And in this covert will we make our stand,\r","Culling the principal of all the deer.\r","\r","Second Keeper:\r","I'll stay above the hill, so both may shoot.\r","\r","First Keeper:\r","That cannot be; the noise of thy cross-bow\r","Will scare the herd, and so my shoot is lost.\r","Here stand we both, and aim we at the best:\r","And, for the time shall not seem tedious,\r","I'll tell thee what befell me on a day\r","In this self-place where now we mean to stand.\r","\r","Second Keeper:\r","Here comes a man; let's stay till he be past.\r","\r","KING HENRY VI:\r","From Scotland am I stol'n, even of pure love,\r","To greet mine own land with my wishful sight.\r","No, Harry, Harry, 'tis no land of thine;\r","Thy place is fill'd, thy sceptre wrung from thee,\r","Thy balm wash'd off wherewith thou wast anointed:\r","No bending knee will call thee Caesar now,\r","No humble suitors press to speak for right,\r","No, not a man comes for redress of thee;\r","For how can I help them, and not myself?\r","\r","First Keeper:\r","Ay, here's a deer whose skin's a keeper's fee:\r","This is the quondam king; let's seize upon him.\r","\r","KING HENRY VI:\r","Let me embrace thee, sour adversity,\r","For wise men say it is the wisest course.\r","\r","Second Keeper:\r","Why linger we? let us lay hands upon him.\r","\r","First Keeper:\r","Forbear awhile; we'll hear a little more.\r","\r","KING HENRY VI:\r","My queen and son are gone to France for aid;\r","And, as I hear, the great commanding Warwick\r","Is thither gone, to crave the French king's sister\r","To wife for Edward: if this news be true,\r","Poor queen and son, your labour is but lost;\r","For Warwick is a subtle orator,\r","And Lewis a prince soon won with moving words.\r","By this account then Margaret may win him;\r","For she's a woman to be pitied much:\r","Her sighs will make a battery in his breast;\r","Her tears will pierce into a marble heart;\r","The tiger will be mild whiles she doth mourn;\r","And Nero will be tainted with remorse,\r","To hear and see her plaints, her brinish tears.\r","Ay, but she's come to beg, Warwick to give;\r","She, on his left side, craving aid for Henry,\r","He, on his right, asking a wife for Edward.\r","She weeps, and says her Henry is deposed;\r","He smiles, and says his Edward is install'd;\r","That she, poor wretch, for grief can speak no more;\r","Whiles Warwick tells his title, smooths the wrong,\r","Inferreth arguments of mighty strength,\r","And in conclusion wins the king from her,\r","With promise of his sister, and what else,\r","To strengthen and support King Edward's place.\r","O Margaret, thus 'twill be; and thou, poor soul,\r","Art then forsaken, as thou went'st forlorn!\r","\r","Second Keeper:\r","Say, what art thou that talk'st of kings and queens?\r","\r","KING HENRY VI:\r","More than I seem, and less than I was born to:\r","A man at least, for less I should not be;\r","And men may talk of kings, and why not I?\r","\r","Second Keeper:\r","Ay, but thou talk'st as if thou wert a king.\r","\r","KING HENRY VI:\r","Why, so I am, in mind; and that's enough.\r","\r","Second Keeper:\r","But, if thou be a king, where is thy crown?\r","\r","KING HENRY VI:\r","My crown is in my heart, not on my head;\r","Not decked with diamonds and Indian stones,\r","Nor to be seen: my crown is called content:\r","A crown it is that seldom kings enjoy.\r","\r","Second Keeper:\r","Well, if you be a king crown'd with content,\r","Your crown content and you must be contented\r","To go along with us; for as we think,\r","You are the king King Edward hath deposed;\r","And we his subjects sworn in all allegiance\r","Will apprehend you as his enemy.\r","\r","KING HENRY VI:\r","But did you never swear, and break an oath?\r","\r","Second Keeper:\r","No, never such an oath; nor will not now.\r","\r","KING HENRY VI:\r","Where did you dwell when I was King of England?\r","\r","Second Keeper:\r","Here in this country, where we now remain.\r","\r","KING HENRY VI:\r","I was anointed king at nine months old;\r","My father and my grandfather were kings,\r","And you were sworn true subjects unto me:\r","And tell me, then, have you not broke your oaths?\r","\r","First Keeper:\r","No;\r","For we were subjects but while you were king.\r","\r","KING HENRY VI:\r","Why, am I dead? do I not breathe a man?\r","Ah, simple men, you know not what you swear!\r","Look, as I blow this feather from my face,\r","And as the air blows it to me again,\r","Obeying with my wind when I do blow,\r","And yielding to another when it blows,\r","Commanded always by the greater gust;\r","Such is the lightness of you common men.\r","But do not break your oaths; for of that sin\r","My mild entreaty shall not make you guilty.\r","Go where you will, the king shall be commanded;\r","And be you kings, command, and I'll obey.\r","\r","First Keeper:\r","We are true subjects to the king, King Edward.\r","\r","KING HENRY VI:\r","So would you be again to Henry,\r","If he were seated as King Edward is.\r","\r","First Keeper:\r","We charge you, in God's name, and the king's,\r","To go with us unto the officers.\r","\r","KING HENRY VI:\r","In God's name, lead; your king's name be obey'd:\r","And what God will, that let your king perform;\r","And what he will, I humbly yield unto.\r","3 KING HENRY VI\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","Brother of Gloucester, at Saint Alban's field\r","This lady's husband, Sir Richard Grey, was slain,\r","His lands then seized on by the conqueror:\r","Her suit is now to repossess those lands;\r","Which we in justice cannot well deny,\r","Because in quarrel of the house of York\r","The worthy gentleman did lose his life.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Your highness shall do well to grant her suit;\r","It were dishonour to deny it her.\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","It were no less; but yet I'll make a pause.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","\r","CLARENCE:\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","Widow, we will consider of your suit;\r","And come some other time to know our mind.\r","\r","LADY GREY:\r","Right gracious lord, I cannot brook delay:\r","May it please your highness to resolve me now;\r","And what your pleasure is, shall satisfy me.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","\r","CLARENCE:\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","How many children hast thou, widow? tell me.\r","\r","CLARENCE:\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","\r","LADY GREY:\r","Three, my most gracious lord.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","'Twere pity they should lose their father's lands.\r","\r","LADY GREY:\r","Be pitiful, dread lord, and grant it then.\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","Lords, give us leave: I'll try this widow's wit.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","Now tell me, madam, do you love your children?\r","\r","LADY GREY:\r","Ay, full as dearly as I love myself.\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","And would you not do much to do them good?\r","\r","LADY GREY:\r","To do them good, I would sustain some harm.\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","Then get your husband's lands, to do them good.\r","\r","LADY GREY:\r","Therefore I came unto your majesty.\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","I'll tell you how these lands are to be got.\r","\r","LADY GREY:\r","So shall you bind me to your highness' service.\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","What service wilt thou do me, if I give them?\r","\r","LADY GREY:\r","What you command, that rests in me to do.\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","But you will take exceptions to my boon.\r","\r","LADY GREY:\r","No, gracious lord, except I cannot do it.\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","Ay, but thou canst do what I mean to ask.\r","\r","LADY GREY:\r","Why, then I will do what your grace commands.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","\r","CLARENCE:\r","\r","LADY GREY:\r","Why stops my lord, shall I not hear my task?\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","An easy task; 'tis but to love a king.\r","\r","LADY GREY:\r","That's soon perform'd, because I am a subject.\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","Why, then, thy husband's lands I freely give thee.\r","\r","LADY GREY:\r","I take my leave with many thousand thanks.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","But stay thee, 'tis the fruits of love I mean.\r","\r","LADY GREY:\r","The fruits of love I mean, my loving liege.\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","Ay, but, I fear me, in another sense.\r","What love, think'st thou, I sue so much to get?\r","\r","LADY GREY:\r","My love till death, my humble thanks, my prayers;\r","That love which virtue begs and virtue grants.\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","No, by my troth, I did not mean such love.\r","\r","LADY GREY:\r","Why, then you mean not as I thought you did.\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","But now you partly may perceive my mind.\r","\r","LADY GREY:\r","My mind will never grant what I perceive\r","Your highness aims at, if I aim aright.\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","To tell thee plain, I aim to lie with thee.\r","\r","LADY GREY:\r","To tell you plain, I had rather lie in prison.\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","Why, then thou shalt not have thy husband's lands.\r","\r","LADY GREY:\r","Why, then mine honesty shall be my dower;\r","For by that loss I will not purchase them.\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","Therein thou wrong'st thy children mightily.\r","\r","LADY GREY:\r","Herein your highness wrongs both them and me.\r","But, mighty lord, this merry inclination\r","Accords not with the sadness of my suit:\r","Please you dismiss me either with 'ay' or 'no.'\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","Ay, if thou wilt say 'ay' to my request;\r","No if thou dost say 'no' to my demand.\r","\r","LADY GREY:\r","Then, no, my lord. My suit is at an end.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","\r","CLARENCE:\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","\r","LADY GREY:\r","'Tis better said than done, my gracious lord:\r","I am a subject fit to jest withal,\r","But far unfit to be a sovereign.\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","Sweet widow, by my state I swear to thee\r","I speak no more than what my soul intends;\r","And that is, to enjoy thee for my love.\r","\r","LADY GREY:\r","And that is more than I will yield unto:\r","I know I am too mean to be your queen,\r","And yet too good to be your concubine.\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","You cavil, widow: I did mean, my queen.\r","\r","LADY GREY:\r","'Twill grieve your grace my sons should call you father.\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","No more than when my daughters call thee mother.\r","Thou art a widow, and thou hast some children;\r","And, by God's mother, I, being but a bachelor,\r","Have other some: why, 'tis a happy thing\r","To be the father unto many sons.\r","Answer no more, for thou shalt be my queen.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","\r","CLARENCE:\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","Brothers, you muse what chat we two have had.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","The widow likes it not, for she looks very sad.\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","You'll think it strange if I should marry her.\r","\r","CLARENCE:\r","To whom, my lord?\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","Why, Clarence, to myself.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","That would be ten days' wonder at the least.\r","\r","CLARENCE:\r","That's a day longer than a wonder lasts.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","By so much is the wonder in extremes.\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","Well, jest on, brothers: I can tell you both\r","Her suit is granted for her husband's lands.\r","\r","Nobleman:\r","My gracious lord, Henry your foe is taken,\r","And brought your prisoner to your palace gate.\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","See that he be convey'd unto the Tower:\r","And go we, brothers, to the man that took him,\r","To question of his apprehension.\r","Widow, go you along. Lords, use her honourably.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Ay, Edward will use women honourably.\r","Would he were wasted, marrow, bones and all,\r","That from his loins no hopeful branch may spring,\r","To cross me from the golden time I look for!\r","And yet, between my soul's desire and me--\r","The lustful Edward's title buried--\r","Is Clarence, Henry, and his son young Edward,\r","And all the unlook'd for issue of their bodies,\r","To take their rooms, ere I can place myself:\r","A cold premeditation for my purpose!\r","Why, then, I do but dream on sovereignty;\r","Like one that stands upon a promontory,\r","And spies a far-off shore where he would tread,\r","Wishing his foot were equal with his eye,\r","And chides the sea that sunders him from thence,\r","Saying, he'll lade it dry to have his way:\r","So do I wish the crown, being so far off;\r","And so I chide the means that keeps me from it;\r","And so I say, I'll cut the causes off,\r","Flattering me with impossibilities.\r","My eye's too quick, my heart o'erweens too much,\r","Unless my hand and strength could equal them.\r","Well, say there is no kingdom then for Richard;\r","What other pleasure can the world afford?\r","I'll make my heaven in a lady's lap,\r","And deck my body in gay ornaments,\r","And witch sweet ladies with my words and looks.\r","O miserable thought! and more unlikely\r","Than to accomplish twenty golden crowns!\r","Why, love forswore me in my mother's womb:\r","And, for I should not deal in her soft laws,\r","She did corrupt frail nature with some bribe,\r","To shrink mine arm up like a wither'd shrub;\r","To make an envious mountain on my back,\r","Where sits deformity to mock my body;\r","To shape my legs of an unequal size;\r","To disproportion me in every part,\r","Like to a chaos, or an unlick'd bear-whelp\r","That carries no impression like the dam.\r","And am I then a man to be beloved?\r","O monstrous fault, to harbour such a thought!\r","Then, since this earth affords no joy to me,\r","But to command, to cheque, to o'erbear such\r","As are of better person than myself,\r","I'll make my heaven to dream upon the crown,\r","And, whiles I live, to account this world but hell,\r","Until my mis-shaped trunk that bears this head\r","Be round impaled with a glorious crown.\r","And yet I know not how to get the crown,\r","For many lives stand between me and home:\r","And I,--like one lost in a thorny wood,\r","That rends the thorns and is rent with the thorns,\r","Seeking a way and straying from the way;\r","Not knowing how to find the open air,\r","But toiling desperately to find it out,--\r","Torment myself to catch the English crown:\r","And from that torment I will free myself,\r","Or hew my way out with a bloody axe.\r","Why, I can smile, and murder whiles I smile,\r","And cry 'Content' to that which grieves my heart,\r","And wet my cheeks with artificial tears,\r","And frame my face to all occasions.\r","I'll drown more sailors than the mermaid shall;\r","I'll slay more gazers than the basilisk;\r","I'll play the orator as well as Nestor,\r","Deceive more slily than Ulysses could,\r","And, like a Sinon, take another Troy.\r","I can add colours to the chameleon,\r","Change shapes with Proteus for advantages,\r","And set the murderous Machiavel to school.\r","Can I do this, and cannot get a crown?\r","Tut, were it farther off, I'll pluck it down.\r","3 KING HENRY VI\r","\r","KING LEWIS XI:\r","Fair Queen of England, worthy Margaret,\r","Sit down with us: it ill befits thy state\r","And birth, that thou shouldst stand while Lewis doth sit.\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","No, mighty King of France: now Margaret\r","Must strike her sail and learn awhile to serve\r","Where kings command. I was, I must confess,\r","Great Albion's queen in former golden days:\r","But now mischance hath trod my title down,\r","And with dishonour laid me on the ground;\r","Where I must take like seat unto my fortune,\r","And to my humble seat conform myself.\r","\r","KING LEWIS XI:\r","Why, say, fair queen, whence springs this deep despair?\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","From such a cause as fills mine eyes with tears\r","And stops my tongue, while heart is drown'd in cares.\r","\r","KING LEWIS XI:\r","Whate'er it be, be thou still like thyself,\r","And sit thee by our side:\r","Yield not thy neck\r","To fortune's yoke, but let thy dauntless mind\r","Still ride in triumph over all mischance.\r","Be plain, Queen Margaret, and tell thy grief;\r","It shall be eased, if France can yield relief.\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","Those gracious words revive my drooping thoughts\r","And give my tongue-tied sorrows leave to speak.\r","Now, therefore, be it known to noble Lewis,\r","That Henry, sole possessor of my love,\r","Is of a king become a banish'd man,\r","And forced to live in Scotland a forlorn;\r","While proud ambitious Edward Duke of York\r","Usurps the regal title and the seat\r","Of England's true-anointed lawful king.\r","This is the cause that I, poor Margaret,\r","With this my son, Prince Edward, Henry's heir,\r","Am come to crave thy just and lawful aid;\r","And if thou fail us, all our hope is done:\r","Scotland hath will to help, but cannot help;\r","Our people and our peers are both misled,\r","Our treasures seized, our soldiers put to flight,\r","And, as thou seest, ourselves in heavy plight.\r","\r","KING LEWIS XI:\r","Renowned queen, with patience calm the storm,\r","While we bethink a means to break it off.\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","The more we stay, the stronger grows our foe.\r","\r","KING LEWIS XI:\r","The more I stay, the more I'll succor thee.\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","O, but impatience waiteth on true sorrow.\r","And see where comes the breeder of my sorrow!\r","\r","KING LEWIS XI:\r","What's he approacheth boldly to our presence?\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","Our Earl of Warwick, Edward's greatest friend.\r","\r","KING LEWIS XI:\r","Welcome, brave Warwick! What brings thee to France?\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","Ay, now begins a second storm to rise;\r","For this is he that moves both wind and tide.\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","From worthy Edward, King of Albion,\r","My lord and sovereign, and thy vowed friend,\r","I come, in kindness and unfeigned love,\r","First, to do greetings to thy royal person;\r","And then to crave a league of amity;\r","And lastly, to confirm that amity\r","With a nuptial knot, if thou vouchsafe to grant\r","That virtuous Lady Bona, thy fair sister,\r","To England's king in lawful marriage.\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","King Lewis and Lady Bona, hear me speak,\r","Before you answer Warwick. His demand\r","Springs not from Edward's well-meant honest love,\r","But from deceit bred by necessity;\r","For how can tyrants safely govern home,\r","Unless abroad they purchase great alliance?\r","To prove him tyrant this reason may suffice,\r","That Henry liveth still: but were he dead,\r","Yet here Prince Edward stands, King Henry's son.\r","Look, therefore, Lewis, that by this league and marriage\r","Thou draw not on thy danger and dishonour;\r","For though usurpers sway the rule awhile,\r","Yet heavens are just, and time suppresseth wrongs.\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","Injurious Margaret!\r","\r","PRINCE EDWARD:\r","And why not queen?\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","Because thy father Henry did usurp;\r","And thou no more are prince than she is queen.\r","\r","OXFORD:\r","Then Warwick disannuls great John of Gaunt,\r","Which did subdue the greatest part of Spain;\r","And, after John of Gaunt, Henry the Fourth,\r","Whose wisdom was a mirror to the wisest;\r","And, after that wise prince, Henry the Fifth,\r","Who by his prowess conquered all France:\r","From these our Henry lineally descends.\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","Oxford, how haps it, in this smooth discourse,\r","You told not how Henry the Sixth hath lost\r","All that which Henry Fifth had gotten?\r","Methinks these peers of France should smile at that.\r","But for the rest, you tell a pedigree\r","Of threescore and two years; a silly time\r","To make prescription for a kingdom's worth.\r","\r","OXFORD:\r","Why, Warwick, canst thou speak against thy liege,\r","Whom thou obeyed'st thirty and six years,\r","And not bewray thy treason with a blush?\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","Can Oxford, that did ever fence the right,\r","Now buckler falsehood with a pedigree?\r","For shame! leave Henry, and call Edward king.\r","\r","OXFORD:\r","Call him my king by whose injurious doom\r","My elder brother, the Lord Aubrey Vere,\r","Was done to death? and more than so, my father,\r","Even in the downfall of his mellow'd years,\r","When nature brought him to the door of death?\r","No, Warwick, no; while life upholds this arm,\r","This arm upholds the house of Lancaster.\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","And I the house of York.\r","\r","KING LEWIS XI:\r","Queen Margaret, Prince Edward, and Oxford,\r","Vouchsafe, at our request, to stand aside,\r","While I use further conference with Warwick.\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","Heavens grant that Warwick's words bewitch him not!\r","\r","KING LEWIS XI:\r","Now Warwick, tell me, even upon thy conscience,\r","Is Edward your true king? for I were loath\r","To link with him that were not lawful chosen.\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","Thereon I pawn my credit and mine honour.\r","\r","KING LEWIS XI:\r","But is he gracious in the people's eye?\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","The more that Henry was unfortunate.\r","\r","KING LEWIS XI:\r","Then further, all dissembling set aside,\r","Tell me for truth the measure of his love\r","Unto our sister Bona.\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","Such it seems\r","As may beseem a monarch like himself.\r","Myself have often heard him say and swear\r","That this his love was an eternal plant,\r","Whereof the root was fix'd in virtue's ground,\r","The leaves and fruit maintain'd with beauty's sun,\r","Exempt from envy, but not from disdain,\r","Unless the Lady Bona quit his pain.\r","\r","KING LEWIS XI:\r","Now, sister, let us hear your firm resolve.\r","\r","BONA:\r","Your grant, or your denial, shall be mine:\r","Yet I confess that often ere this day,\r","When I have heard your king's desert recounted,\r","Mine ear hath tempted judgment to desire.\r","\r","KING LEWIS XI:\r","Then, Warwick, thus: our sister shall be Edward's;\r","And now forthwith shall articles be drawn\r","Touching the jointure that your king must make,\r","Which with her dowry shall be counterpoised.\r","Draw near, Queen Margaret, and be a witness\r","That Bona shall be wife to the English king.\r","\r","PRINCE EDWARD:\r","To Edward, but not to the English king.\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","Deceitful Warwick! it was thy device\r","By this alliance to make void my suit:\r","Before thy coming Lewis was Henry's friend.\r","\r","KING LEWIS XI:\r","And still is friend to him and Margaret:\r","But if your title to the crown be weak,\r","As may appear by Edward's good success,\r","Then 'tis but reason that I be released\r","From giving aid which late I promised.\r","Yet shall you have all kindness at my hand\r","That your estate requires and mine can yield.\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","Henry now lives in Scotland at his ease,\r","Where having nothing, nothing can he lose.\r","And as for you yourself, our quondam queen,\r","You have a father able to maintain you;\r","And better 'twere you troubled him than France.\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","Peace, impudent and shameless Warwick, peace,\r","Proud setter up and puller down of kings!\r","I will not hence, till, with my talk and tears,\r","Both full of truth, I make King Lewis behold\r","Thy sly conveyance and thy lord's false love;\r","For both of you are birds of selfsame feather.\r","\r","KING LEWIS XI:\r","Warwick, this is some post to us or thee.\r","\r","Post:\r","\r","OXFORD:\r","I like it well that our fair queen and mistress\r","Smiles at her news, while Warwick frowns at his.\r","\r","PRINCE EDWARD:\r","Nay, mark how Lewis stamps, as he were nettled:\r","I hope all's for the best.\r","\r","KING LEWIS XI:\r","Warwick, what are thy news? and yours, fair queen?\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","Mine, such as fill my heart with unhoped joys.\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","Mine, full of sorrow and heart's discontent.\r","\r","KING LEWIS XI:\r","What! has your king married the Lady Grey!\r","And now, to soothe your forgery and his,\r","Sends me a paper to persuade me patience?\r","Is this the alliance that he seeks with France?\r","Dare he presume to scorn us in this manner?\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","I told your majesty as much before:\r","This proveth Edward's love and Warwick's honesty.\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","King Lewis, I here protest, in sight of heaven,\r","And by the hope I have of heavenly bliss,\r","That I am clear from this misdeed of Edward's,\r","No more my king, for he dishonours me,\r","But most himself, if he could see his shame.\r","Did I forget that by the house of York\r","My father came untimely to his death?\r","Did I let pass the abuse done to my niece?\r","Did I impale him with the regal crown?\r","Did I put Henry from his native right?\r","And am I guerdon'd at the last with shame?\r","Shame on himself! for my desert is honour:\r","And to repair my honour lost for him,\r","I here renounce him and return to Henry.\r","My noble queen, let former grudges pass,\r","And henceforth I am thy true servitor:\r","I will revenge his wrong to Lady Bona,\r","And replant Henry in his former state.\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","Warwick, these words have turn'd my hate to love;\r","And I forgive and quite forget old faults,\r","And joy that thou becomest King Henry's friend.\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","So much his friend, ay, his unfeigned friend,\r","That, if King Lewis vouchsafe to furnish us\r","With some few bands of chosen soldiers,\r","I'll undertake to land them on our coast\r","And force the tyrant from his seat by war.\r","'Tis not his new-made bride shall succor him:\r","And as for Clarence, as my letters tell me,\r","He's very likely now to fall from him,\r","For matching more for wanton lust than honour,\r","Or than for strength and safety of our country.\r","\r","BONA:\r","Dear brother, how shall Bona be revenged\r","But by thy help to this distressed queen?\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","Renowned prince, how shall poor Henry live,\r","Unless thou rescue him from foul despair?\r","\r","BONA:\r","My quarrel and this English queen's are one.\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","And mine, fair lady Bona, joins with yours.\r","\r","KING LEWIS XI:\r","And mine with hers, and thine, and Margaret's.\r","Therefore at last I firmly am resolved\r","You shall have aid.\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","Let me give humble thanks for all at once.\r","\r","KING LEWIS XI:\r","Then, England's messenger, return in post,\r","And tell false Edward, thy supposed king,\r","That Lewis of France is sending over masquers\r","To revel it with him and his new bride:\r","Thou seest what's past, go fear thy king withal.\r","\r","BONA:\r","Tell him, in hope he'll prove a widower shortly,\r","I'll wear the willow garland for his sake.\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","Tell him, my mourning weeds are laid aside,\r","And I am ready to put armour on.\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","Tell him from me that he hath done me wrong,\r","And therefore I'll uncrown him ere't be long.\r","There's thy reward: be gone.\r","\r","KING LEWIS XI:\r","But, Warwick,\r","Thou and Oxford, with five thousand men,\r","Shall cross the seas, and bid false Edward battle;\r","And, as occasion serves, this noble queen\r","And prince shall follow with a fresh supply.\r","Yet, ere thou go, but answer me one doubt,\r","What pledge have we of thy firm loyalty?\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","This shall assure my constant loyalty,\r","That if our queen and this young prince agree,\r","I'll join mine eldest daughter and my joy\r","To him forthwith in holy wedlock bands.\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","Yes, I agree, and thank you for your motion.\r","Son Edward, she is fair and virtuous,\r","Therefore delay not, give thy hand to Warwick;\r","And, with thy hand, thy faith irrevocable,\r","That only Warwick's daughter shall be thine.\r","\r","PRINCE EDWARD:\r","Yes, I accept her, for she well deserves it;\r","And here, to pledge my vow, I give my hand.\r","\r","KING LEWIS XI:\r","Why stay we now? These soldiers shall be levied,\r","And thou, Lord Bourbon, our high admiral,\r","Shalt waft them over with our royal fleet.\r","I long till Edward fall by war's mischance,\r","For mocking marriage with a dame of France.\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","I came from Edward as ambassador,\r","But I return his sworn and mortal foe:\r","Matter of marriage was the charge he gave me,\r","But dreadful war shall answer his demand.\r","Had he none else to make a stale but me?\r","Then none but I shall turn his jest to sorrow.\r","I was the chief that raised him to the crown,\r","And I'll be chief to bring him down again:\r","Not that I pity Henry's misery,\r","But seek revenge on Edward's mockery.\r","3 KING HENRY VI\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Now tell me, brother Clarence, what think you\r","Of this new marriage with the Lady Grey?\r","Hath not our brother made a worthy choice?\r","\r","CLARENCE:\r","Alas, you know, 'tis far from hence to France;\r","How could he stay till Warwick made return?\r","\r","SOMERSET:\r","My lords, forbear this talk; here comes the king.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","And his well-chosen bride.\r","\r","CLARENCE:\r","I mind to tell him plainly what I think.\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","Now, brother of Clarence, how like you our choice,\r","That you stand pensive, as half malcontent?\r","\r","CLARENCE:\r","As well as Lewis of France, or the Earl of Warwick,\r","Which are so weak of courage and in judgment\r","That they'll take no offence at our abuse.\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","Suppose they take offence without a cause,\r","They are but Lewis and Warwick: I am Edward,\r","Your king and Warwick's, and must have my will.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","And shall have your will, because our king:\r","Yet hasty marriage seldom proveth well.\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","Yea, brother Richard, are you offended too?\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Not I:\r","No, God forbid that I should wish them sever'd\r","Whom God hath join'd together; ay, and 'twere pity\r","To sunder them that yoke so well together.\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","Setting your scorns and your mislike aside,\r","Tell me some reason why the Lady Grey\r","Should not become my wife and England's queen.\r","And you too, Somerset and Montague,\r","Speak freely what you think.\r","\r","CLARENCE:\r","Then this is mine opinion: that King Lewis\r","Becomes your enemy, for mocking him\r","About the marriage of the Lady Bona.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","And Warwick, doing what you gave in charge,\r","Is now dishonoured by this new marriage.\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","What if both Lewis and Warwick be appeased\r","By such invention as I can devise?\r","\r","MONTAGUE:\r","Yet, to have join'd with France in such alliance\r","Would more have strengthen'd this our commonwealth\r","'Gainst foreign storms than any home-bred marriage.\r","\r","HASTINGS:\r","Why, knows not Montague that of itself\r","England is safe, if true within itself?\r","\r","MONTAGUE:\r","But the safer when 'tis back'd with France.\r","\r","HASTINGS:\r","'Tis better using France than trusting France:\r","Let us be back'd with God and with the seas\r","Which He hath given for fence impregnable,\r","And with their helps only defend ourselves;\r","In them and in ourselves our safety lies.\r","\r","CLARENCE:\r","For this one speech Lord Hastings well deserves\r","To have the heir of the Lord Hungerford.\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","Ay, what of that? it was my will and grant;\r","And for this once my will shall stand for law.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","And yet methinks your grace hath not done well,\r","To give the heir and daughter of Lord Scales\r","Unto the brother of your loving bride;\r","She better would have fitted me or Clarence:\r","But in your bride you bury brotherhood.\r","\r","CLARENCE:\r","Or else you would not have bestow'd the heir\r","Of the Lord Bonville on your new wife's son,\r","And leave your brothers to go speed elsewhere.\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","Alas, poor Clarence! is it for a wife\r","That thou art malcontent? I will provide thee.\r","\r","CLARENCE:\r","In choosing for yourself, you show'd your judgment,\r","Which being shallow, you give me leave\r","To play the broker in mine own behalf;\r","And to that end I shortly mind to leave you.\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","Leave me, or tarry, Edward will be king,\r","And not be tied unto his brother's will.\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","My lords, before it pleased his majesty\r","To raise my state to title of a queen,\r","Do me but right, and you must all confess\r","That I was not ignoble of descent;\r","And meaner than myself have had like fortune.\r","But as this title honours me and mine,\r","So your dislike, to whom I would be pleasing,\r","Doth cloud my joys with danger and with sorrow.\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","My love, forbear to fawn upon their frowns:\r","What danger or what sorrow can befall thee,\r","So long as Edward is thy constant friend,\r","And their true sovereign, whom they must obey?\r","Nay, whom they shall obey, and love thee too,\r","Unless they seek for hatred at my hands;\r","Which if they do, yet will I keep thee safe,\r","And they shall feel the vengeance of my wrath.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","Now, messenger, what letters or what news\r","From France?\r","\r","Post:\r","My sovereign liege, no letters; and few words,\r","But such as I, without your special pardon,\r","Dare not relate.\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","Go to, we pardon thee: therefore, in brief,\r","Tell me their words as near as thou canst guess them.\r","What answer makes King Lewis unto our letters?\r","\r","Post:\r","At my depart, these were his very words:\r","'Go tell false Edward, thy supposed king,\r","That Lewis of France is sending over masquers\r","To revel it with him and his new bride.'\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","Is Lewis so brave? belike he thinks me Henry.\r","But what said Lady Bona to my marriage?\r","\r","Post:\r","These were her words, utter'd with mad disdain:\r","'Tell him, in hope he'll prove a widower shortly,\r","I'll wear the willow garland for his sake.'\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","I blame not her, she could say little less;\r","She had the wrong. But what said Henry's queen?\r","For I have heard that she was there in place.\r","\r","Post:\r","'Tell him,' quoth she, 'my mourning weeds are done,\r","And I am ready to put armour on.'\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","Belike she minds to play the Amazon.\r","But what said Warwick to these injuries?\r","\r","Post:\r","He, more incensed against your majesty\r","Than all the rest, discharged me with these words:\r","'Tell him from me that he hath done me wrong,\r","And therefore I'll uncrown him ere't be long.'\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","Ha! durst the traitor breathe out so proud words?\r","Well I will arm me, being thus forewarn'd:\r","They shall have wars and pay for their presumption.\r","But say, is Warwick friends with Margaret?\r","\r","Post:\r","Ay, gracious sovereign; they are so link'd in\r","friendship\r","That young Prince Edward marries Warwick's daughter.\r","\r","CLARENCE:\r","Belike the elder; Clarence will have the younger.\r","Now, brother king, farewell, and sit you fast,\r","For I will hence to Warwick's other daughter;\r","That, though I want a kingdom, yet in marriage\r","I may not prove inferior to yourself.\r","You that love me and Warwick, follow me.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","Clarence and Somerset both gone to Warwick!\r","Yet am I arm'd against the worst can happen;\r","And haste is needful in this desperate case.\r","Pembroke and Stafford, you in our behalf\r","Go levy men, and make prepare for war;\r","They are already, or quickly will be landed:\r","Myself in person will straight follow you.\r","But, ere I go, Hastings and Montague,\r","Resolve my doubt. You twain, of all the rest,\r","Are near to Warwick by blood and by alliance:\r","Tell me if you love Warwick more than me?\r","If it be so, then both depart to him;\r","I rather wish you foes than hollow friends:\r","But if you mind to hold your true obedience,\r","Give me assurance with some friendly vow,\r","That I may never have you in suspect.\r","\r","MONTAGUE:\r","So God help Montague as he proves true!\r","\r","HASTINGS:\r","And Hastings as he favours Edward's cause!\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","Now, brother Richard, will you stand by us?\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Ay, in despite of all that shall withstand you.\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","Why, so! then am I sure of victory.\r","Now therefore let us hence; and lose no hour,\r","Till we meet Warwick with his foreign power.\r","3 KING HENRY VI\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","Trust me, my lord, all hitherto goes well;\r","The common people by numbers swarm to us.\r","But see where Somerset and Clarence come!\r","Speak suddenly, my lords, are we all friends?\r","\r","CLARENCE:\r","Fear not that, my lord.\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","Then, gentle Clarence, welcome unto Warwick;\r","And welcome, Somerset: I hold it cowardice\r","To rest mistrustful where a noble heart\r","Hath pawn'd an open hand in sign of love;\r","Else might I think that Clarence, Edward's brother,\r","Were but a feigned friend to our proceedings:\r","But welcome, sweet Clarence; my daughter shall be thine.\r","And now what rests but, in night's coverture,\r","Thy brother being carelessly encamp'd,\r","His soldiers lurking in the towns about,\r","And but attended by a simple guard,\r","We may surprise and take him at our pleasure?\r","Our scouts have found the adventure very easy:\r","That as Ulysses and stout Diomede\r","With sleight and manhood stole to Rhesus' tents,\r","And brought from thence the Thracian fatal steeds,\r","So we, well cover'd with the night's black mantle,\r","At unawares may beat down Edward's guard\r","And seize himself; I say not, slaughter him,\r","For I intend but only to surprise him.\r","You that will follow me to this attempt,\r","Applaud the name of Henry with your leader.\r","Why, then, let's on our way in silent sort:\r","For Warwick and his friends, God and Saint George!\r","3 KING HENRY VI\r","\r","First Watchman:\r","Come on, my masters, each man take his stand:\r","The king by this is set him down to sleep.\r","\r","Second Watchman:\r","What, will he not to bed?\r","\r","First Watchman:\r","Why, no; for he hath made a solemn vow\r","Never to lie and take his natural rest\r","Till Warwick or himself be quite suppress'd.\r","\r","Second Watchman:\r","To-morrow then belike shall be the day,\r","If Warwick be so near as men report.\r","\r","Third Watchman:\r","But say, I pray, what nobleman is that\r","That with the king here resteth in his tent?\r","\r","First Watchman:\r","'Tis the Lord Hastings, the king's chiefest friend.\r","\r","Third Watchman:\r","O, is it so? But why commands the king\r","That his chief followers lodge in towns about him,\r","While he himself keeps in the cold field?\r","\r","Second Watchman:\r","'Tis the more honour, because more dangerous.\r","\r","Third Watchman:\r","Ay, but give me worship and quietness;\r","I like it better than a dangerous honour.\r","If Warwick knew in what estate he stands,\r","'Tis to be doubted he would waken him.\r","\r","First Watchman:\r","Unless our halberds did shut up his passage.\r","\r","Second Watchman:\r","Ay, wherefore else guard we his royal tent,\r","But to defend his person from night-foes?\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","This is his tent; and see where stand his guard.\r","Courage, my masters! honour now or never!\r","But follow me, and Edward shall be ours.\r","\r","First Watchman:\r","Who goes there?\r","\r","Second Watchman:\r","Stay, or thou diest!\r","\r","SOMERSET:\r","What are they that fly there?\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","Richard and Hastings: let them go; here is The duke.\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","The duke! Why, Warwick, when we parted,\r","Thou call'dst me king.\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","Ay, but the case is alter'd:\r","When you disgraced me in my embassade,\r","Then I degraded you from being king,\r","And come now to create you Duke of York.\r","Alas! how should you govern any kingdom,\r","That know not how to use ambassadors,\r","Nor how to be contented with one wife,\r","Nor how to use your brothers brotherly,\r","Nor how to study for the people's welfare,\r","Nor how to shroud yourself from enemies?\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","Yea, brother of Clarence, are thou here too?\r","Nay, then I see that Edward needs must down.\r","Yet, Warwick, in despite of all mischance,\r","Of thee thyself and all thy complices,\r","Edward will always bear himself as king:\r","Though fortune's malice overthrow my state,\r","My mind exceeds the compass of her wheel.\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","Then, for his mind, be Edward England's king:\r","But Henry now shall wear the English crown,\r","And be true king indeed, thou but the shadow.\r","My Lord of Somerset, at my request,\r","See that forthwith Duke Edward be convey'd\r","Unto my brother, Archbishop of York.\r","When I have fought with Pembroke and his fellows,\r","I'll follow you, and tell what answer\r","Lewis and the Lady Bona send to him.\r","Now, for a while farewell, good Duke of York.\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","What fates impose, that men must needs abide;\r","It boots not to resist both wind and tide.\r","\r","OXFORD:\r","What now remains, my lords, for us to do\r","But march to London with our soldiers?\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","Ay, that's the first thing that we have to do;\r","To free King Henry from imprisonment\r","And see him seated in the regal throne.\r","3 KING HENRY VI\r","\r","RIVERS:\r","Madam, what makes you in this sudden change?\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","Why brother Rivers, are you yet to learn\r","What late misfortune is befall'n King Edward?\r","\r","RIVERS:\r","What! loss of some pitch'd battle against Warwick?\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","No, but the loss of his own royal person.\r","\r","RIVERS:\r","Then is my sovereign slain?\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","Ay, almost slain, for he is taken prisoner,\r","Either betray'd by falsehood of his guard\r","Or by his foe surprised at unawares:\r","And, as I further have to understand,\r","Is new committed to the Bishop of York,\r","Fell Warwick's brother and by that our foe.\r","\r","RIVERS:\r","These news I must confess are full of grief;\r","Yet, gracious madam, bear it as you may:\r","Warwick may lose, that now hath won the day.\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","Till then fair hope must hinder life's decay.\r","And I the rather wean me from despair\r","For love of Edward's offspring in my womb:\r","This is it that makes me bridle passion\r","And bear with mildness my misfortune's cross;\r","Ay, ay, for this I draw in many a tear\r","And stop the rising of blood-sucking sighs,\r","Lest with my sighs or tears I blast or drown\r","King Edward's fruit, true heir to the English crown.\r","\r","RIVERS:\r","But, madam, where is Warwick then become?\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","I am inform'd that he comes towards London,\r","To set the crown once more on Henry's head:\r","Guess thou the rest; King Edward's friends must down,\r","But, to prevent the tyrant's violence,--\r","For trust not him that hath once broken faith,--\r","I'll hence forthwith unto the sanctuary,\r","To save at least the heir of Edward's right:\r","There shall I rest secure from force and fraud.\r","Come, therefore, let us fly while we may fly:\r","If Warwick take us we are sure to die.\r","3 KING HENRY VI\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Now, my Lord Hastings and Sir William Stanley,\r","Leave off to wonder why I drew you hither,\r","Into this chiefest thicket of the park.\r","Thus stands the case: you know our king, my brother,\r","Is prisoner to the bishop here, at whose hands\r","He hath good usage and great liberty,\r","And, often but attended with weak guard,\r","Comes hunting this way to disport himself.\r","I have advertised him by secret means\r","That if about this hour he make his way\r","Under the colour of his usual game,\r","He shall here find his friends with horse and men\r","To set him free from his captivity.\r","\r","Huntsman:\r","This way, my lord; for this way lies the game.\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","Nay, this way, man: see where the huntsmen stand.\r","Now, brother of Gloucester, Lord Hastings, and the rest,\r","Stand you thus close, to steal the bishop's deer?\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Brother, the time and case requireth haste:\r","Your horse stands ready at the park-corner.\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","But whither shall we then?\r","\r","HASTINGS:\r","To Lynn, my lord,\r","And ship from thence to Flanders.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Well guess'd, believe me; for that was my meaning.\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","Stanley, I will requite thy forwardness.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","But wherefore stay we? 'tis no time to talk.\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","Huntsman, what say'st thou? wilt thou go along?\r","\r","Huntsman:\r","Better do so than tarry and be hang'd.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Come then, away; let's ha' no more ado.\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","Bishop, farewell: shield thee from Warwick's frown;\r","And pray that I may repossess the crown.\r","3 KING HENRY VI\r","\r","KING HENRY VI:\r","Master lieutenant, now that God and friends\r","Have shaken Edward from the regal seat,\r","And turn'd my captive state to liberty,\r","My fear to hope, my sorrows unto joys,\r","At our enlargement what are thy due fees?\r","\r","Lieutenant:\r","Subjects may challenge nothing of their sovereigns;\r","But if an humble prayer may prevail,\r","I then crave pardon of your majesty.\r","\r","KING HENRY VI:\r","For what, lieutenant? for well using me?\r","Nay, be thou sure I'll well requite thy kindness,\r","For that it made my imprisonment a pleasure;\r","Ay, such a pleasure as incaged birds\r","Conceive when after many moody thoughts\r","At last by notes of household harmony\r","They quite forget their loss of liberty.\r","But, Warwick, after God, thou set'st me free,\r","And chiefly therefore I thank God and thee;\r","He was the author, thou the instrument.\r","Therefore, that I may conquer fortune's spite\r","By living low, where fortune cannot hurt me,\r","And that the people of this blessed land\r","May not be punish'd with my thwarting stars,\r","Warwick, although my head still wear the crown,\r","I here resign my government to thee,\r","For thou art fortunate in all thy deeds.\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","Your grace hath still been famed for virtuous;\r","And now may seem as wise as virtuous,\r","By spying and avoiding fortune's malice,\r","For few men rightly temper with the stars:\r","Yet in this one thing let me blame your grace,\r","For choosing me when Clarence is in place.\r","\r","CLARENCE:\r","No, Warwick, thou art worthy of the sway,\r","To whom the heavens in thy nativity\r","Adjudged an olive branch and laurel crown,\r","As likely to be blest in peace and war;\r","And therefore I yield thee my free consent.\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","And I choose Clarence only for protector.\r","\r","KING HENRY VI:\r","Warwick and Clarence give me both your hands:\r","Now join your hands, and with your hands your hearts,\r","That no dissension hinder government:\r","I make you both protectors of this land,\r","While I myself will lead a private life\r","And in devotion spend my latter days,\r","To sin's rebuke and my Creator's praise.\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","What answers Clarence to his sovereign's will?\r","\r","CLARENCE:\r","That he consents, if Warwick yield consent;\r","For on thy fortune I repose myself.\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","Why, then, though loath, yet must I be content:\r","We'll yoke together, like a double shadow\r","To Henry's body, and supply his place;\r","I mean, in bearing weight of government,\r","While he enjoys the honour and his ease.\r","And, Clarence, now then it is more than needful\r","Forthwith that Edward be pronounced a traitor,\r","And all his lands and goods be confiscate.\r","\r","CLARENCE:\r","What else? and that succession be determined.\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","Ay, therein Clarence shall not want his part.\r","\r","KING HENRY VI:\r","But, with the first of all your chief affairs,\r","Let me entreat, for I command no more,\r","That Margaret your queen and my son Edward\r","Be sent for, to return from France with speed;\r","For, till I see them here, by doubtful fear\r","My joy of liberty is half eclipsed.\r","\r","CLARENCE:\r","It shall be done, my sovereign, with all speed.\r","\r","KING HENRY VI:\r","My Lord of Somerset, what youth is that,\r","Of whom you seem to have so tender care?\r","\r","SOMERSET:\r","My liege, it is young Henry, earl of Richmond.\r","\r","KING HENRY VI:\r","Come hither, England's hope.\r","If secret powers\r","Suggest but truth to my divining thoughts,\r","This pretty lad will prove our country's bliss.\r","His looks are full of peaceful majesty,\r","His head by nature framed to wear a crown,\r","His hand to wield a sceptre, and himself\r","Likely in time to bless a regal throne.\r","Make much of him, my lords, for this is he\r","Must help you more than you are hurt by me.\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","What news, my friend?\r","\r","Post:\r","That Edward is escaped from your brother,\r","And fled, as he hears since, to Burgundy.\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","Unsavoury news! but how made he escape?\r","\r","Post:\r","He was convey'd by Richard Duke of Gloucester\r","And the Lord Hastings, who attended him\r","In secret ambush on the forest side\r","And from the bishop's huntsmen rescued him;\r","For hunting was his daily exercise.\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","My brother was too careless of his charge.\r","But let us hence, my sovereign, to provide\r","A salve for any sore that may betide.\r","\r","SOMERSET:\r","My lord, I like not of this flight of Edward's;\r","For doubtless Burgundy will yield him help,\r","And we shall have more wars before 't be long.\r","As Henry's late presaging prophecy\r","Did glad my heart with hope of this young Richmond,\r","So doth my heart misgive me, in these conflicts\r","What may befall him, to his harm and ours:\r","Therefore, Lord Oxford, to prevent the worst,\r","Forthwith we'll send him hence to Brittany,\r","Till storms be past of civil enmity.\r","\r","OXFORD:\r","Ay, for if Edward repossess the crown,\r","'Tis like that Richmond with the rest shall down.\r","\r","SOMERSET:\r","It shall be so; he shall to Brittany.\r","Come, therefore, let's about it speedily.\r","3 KING HENRY VI\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","Now, brother Richard, Lord Hastings, and the rest,\r","Yet thus far fortune maketh us amends,\r","And says that once more I shall interchange\r","My waned state for Henry's regal crown.\r","Well have we pass'd and now repass'd the seas\r","And brought desired help from Burgundy:\r","What then remains, we being thus arrived\r","From Ravenspurgh haven before the gates of York,\r","But that we enter, as into our dukedom?\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","The gates made fast! Brother, I like not this;\r","For many men that stumble at the threshold\r","Are well foretold that danger lurks within.\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","Tush, man, abodements must not now affright us:\r","By fair or foul means we must enter in,\r","For hither will our friends repair to us.\r","\r","HASTINGS:\r","My liege, I'll knock once more to summon them.\r","\r","Mayor:\r","My lords, we were forewarned of your coming,\r","And shut the gates for safety of ourselves;\r","For now we owe allegiance unto Henry.\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","But, master mayor, if Henry be your king,\r","Yet Edward at the least is Duke of York.\r","\r","Mayor:\r","True, my good lord; I know you for no less.\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","Why, and I challenge nothing but my dukedom,\r","As being well content with that alone.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","\r","HASTINGS:\r","Why, master mayor, why stand you in a doubt?\r","Open the gates; we are King Henry's friends.\r","\r","Mayor:\r","Ay, say you so? the gates shall then be open'd.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","A wise stout captain, and soon persuaded!\r","\r","HASTINGS:\r","The good old man would fain that all were well,\r","So 'twere not 'long of him; but being enter'd,\r","I doubt not, I, but we shall soon persuade\r","Both him and all his brothers unto reason.\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","So, master mayor: these gates must not be shut\r","But in the night or in the time of war.\r","What! fear not, man, but yield me up the keys;\r","For Edward will defend the town and thee,\r","And all those friends that deign to follow me.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Brother, this is Sir John Montgomery,\r","Our trusty friend, unless I be deceived.\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","Welcome, Sir John! But why come you in arms?\r","\r","MONTAGUE:\r","To help King Edward in his time of storm,\r","As every loyal subject ought to do.\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","Thanks, good Montgomery; but we now forget\r","Our title to the crown and only claim\r","Our dukedom till God please to send the rest.\r","\r","MONTAGUE:\r","Then fare you well, for I will hence again:\r","I came to serve a king and not a duke.\r","Drummer, strike up, and let us march away.\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","Nay, stay, Sir John, awhile, and we'll debate\r","By what safe means the crown may be recover'd.\r","\r","MONTAGUE:\r","What talk you of debating? in few words,\r","If you'll not here proclaim yourself our king,\r","I'll leave you to your fortune and be gone\r","To keep them back that come to succor you:\r","Why shall we fight, if you pretend no title?\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Why, brother, wherefore stand you on nice points?\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","When we grow stronger, then we'll make our claim:\r","Till then, 'tis wisdom to conceal our meaning.\r","\r","HASTINGS:\r","Away with scrupulous wit! now arms must rule.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","And fearless minds climb soonest unto crowns.\r","Brother, we will proclaim you out of hand:\r","The bruit thereof will bring you many friends.\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","Then be it as you will; for 'tis my right,\r","And Henry but usurps the diadem.\r","\r","MONTAGUE:\r","Ay, now my sovereign speaketh like himself;\r","And now will I be Edward's champion.\r","\r","HASTINGS:\r","Sound trumpet; Edward shall be here proclaim'd:\r","Come, fellow-soldier, make thou proclamation.\r","\r","Soldier:\r","Edward the Fourth, by the grace of God, king of\r","England and France, and lord of Ireland, \u0026c.\r","\r","MONTAGUE:\r","And whosoe'er gainsays King Edward's right,\r","By this I challenge him to single fight.\r","\r","All:\r","Long live Edward the Fourth!\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","Thanks, brave Montgomery; and thanks unto you all:\r","If fortune serve me, I'll requite this kindness.\r","Now, for this night, let's harbour here in York;\r","And when the morning sun shall raise his car\r","Above the border of this horizon,\r","We'll forward towards Warwick and his mates;\r","For well I wot that Henry is no soldier.\r","Ah, froward Clarence! how evil it beseems thee\r","To flatter Henry and forsake thy brother!\r","Yet, as we may, we'll meet both thee and Warwick.\r","Come on, brave soldiers: doubt not of the day,\r","And, that once gotten, doubt not of large pay.\r","3 KING HENRY VI\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","What counsel, lords? Edward from Belgia,\r","With hasty Germans and blunt Hollanders,\r","Hath pass'd in safety through the narrow seas,\r","And with his troops doth march amain to London;\r","And many giddy people flock to him.\r","\r","KING HENRY VI:\r","Let's levy men, and beat him back again.\r","\r","CLARENCE:\r","A little fire is quickly trodden out;\r","Which, being suffer'd, rivers cannot quench.\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","In Warwickshire I have true-hearted friends,\r","Not mutinous in peace, yet bold in war;\r","Those will I muster up: and thou, son Clarence,\r","Shalt stir up in Suffolk, Norfolk, and in Kent,\r","The knights and gentlemen to come with thee:\r","Thou, brother Montague, in Buckingham,\r","Northampton and in Leicestershire, shalt find\r","Men well inclined to hear what thou command'st:\r","And thou, brave Oxford, wondrous well beloved,\r","In Oxfordshire shalt muster up thy friends.\r","My sovereign, with the loving citizens,\r","Like to his island girt in with the ocean,\r","Or modest Dian circled with her nymphs,\r","Shall rest in London till we come to him.\r","Fair lords, take leave and stand not to reply.\r","Farewell, my sovereign.\r","\r","KING HENRY VI:\r","Farewell, my Hector, and my Troy's true hope.\r","\r","CLARENCE:\r","In sign of truth, I kiss your highness' hand.\r","\r","KING HENRY VI:\r","Well-minded Clarence, be thou fortunate!\r","\r","MONTAGUE:\r","Comfort, my lord; and so I take my leave.\r","\r","OXFORD:\r","And thus I seal my truth, and bid adieu.\r","\r","KING HENRY VI:\r","Sweet Oxford, and my loving Montague,\r","And all at once, once more a happy farewell.\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","Farewell, sweet lords: let's meet at Coventry.\r","\r","KING HENRY VI:\r","Here at the palace I will rest awhile.\r","Cousin of Exeter, what thinks your lordship?\r","Methinks the power that Edward hath in field\r","Should not be able to encounter mine.\r","\r","EXETER:\r","The doubt is that he will seduce the rest.\r","\r","KING HENRY VI:\r","That's not my fear; my meed hath got me fame:\r","I have not stopp'd mine ears to their demands,\r","Nor posted off their suits with slow delays;\r","My pity hath been balm to heal their wounds,\r","My mildness hath allay'd their swelling griefs,\r","My mercy dried their water-flowing tears;\r","I have not been desirous of their wealth,\r","Nor much oppress'd them with great subsidies.\r","Nor forward of revenge, though they much err'd:\r","Then why should they love Edward more than me?\r","No, Exeter, these graces challenge grace:\r","And when the lion fawns upon the lamb,\r","The lamb will never cease to follow him.\r","\r","EXETER:\r","Hark, hark, my lord! what shouts are these?\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","Seize on the shame-faced Henry, bear him hence;\r","And once again proclaim us King of England.\r","You are the fount that makes small brooks to flow:\r","Now stops thy spring; my sea sha$l suck them dry,\r","And swell so much the higher by their ebb.\r","Hence with him to the Tower; let him not speak.\r","And, lords, towards Coventry bend we our course\r","Where peremptory Warwick now remains:\r","The sun shines hot; and, if we use delay,\r","Cold biting winter mars our hoped-for hay.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Away betimes, before his forces join,\r","And take the great-grown traitor unawares:\r","Brave warriors, march amain towards Coventry.\r","3 KING HENRY VI\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","Where is the post that came from valiant Oxford?\r","How far hence is thy lord, mine honest fellow?\r","\r","First Messenger:\r","By this at Dunsmore, marching hitherward.\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","How far off is our brother Montague?\r","Where is the post that came from Montague?\r","\r","Second Messenger:\r","By this at Daintry, with a puissant troop.\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","Say, Somerville, what says my loving son?\r","And, by thy guess, how nigh is Clarence now?\r","\r","SOMERSET:\r","At Southam I did leave him with his forces,\r","And do expect him here some two hours hence.\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","Then Clarence is at hand, I hear his drum.\r","\r","SOMERSET:\r","It is not his, my lord; here Southam lies:\r","The drum your honour hears marcheth from Warwick.\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","Who should that be? belike, unlook'd-for friends.\r","\r","SOMERSET:\r","They are at hand, and you shall quickly know.\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","Go, trumpet, to the walls, and sound a parle.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","See how the surly Warwick mans the wall!\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","O unbid spite! is sportful Edward come?\r","Where slept our scouts, or how are they seduced,\r","That we could hear no news of his repair?\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","Now, Warwick, wilt thou ope the city gates,\r","Speak gentle words and humbly bend thy knee,\r","Call Edward king and at his hands beg mercy?\r","And he shall pardon thee these outrages.\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","Nay, rather, wilt thou draw thy forces hence,\r","Confess who set thee up and pluck'd thee own,\r","Call Warwick patron and be penitent?\r","And thou shalt still remain the Duke of York.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","I thought, at least, he would have said the king;\r","Or did he make the jest against his will?\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","Is not a dukedom, sir, a goodly gift?\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Ay, by my faith, for a poor earl to give:\r","I'll do thee service for so good a gift.\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","'Twas I that gave the kingdom to thy brother.\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","Why then 'tis mine, if but by Warwick's gift.\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","Thou art no Atlas for so great a weight:\r","And weakling, Warwick takes his gift again;\r","And Henry is my king, Warwick his subject.\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","But Warwick's king is Edward's prisoner:\r","And, gallant Warwick, do but answer this:\r","What is the body when the head is off?\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Alas, that Warwick had no more forecast,\r","But, whiles he thought to steal the single ten,\r","The king was slily finger'd from the deck!\r","You left poor Henry at the Bishop's palace,\r","And, ten to one, you'll meet him in the Tower.\r","\r","EDWARD:\r","'Tis even so; yet you are Warwick still.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Come, Warwick, take the time; kneel down, kneel down:\r","Nay, when? strike now, or else the iron cools.\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","I had rather chop this hand off at a blow,\r","And with the other fling it at thy face,\r","Than bear so low a sail, to strike to thee.\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","Sail how thou canst, have wind and tide thy friend,\r","This hand, fast wound about thy coal-black hair\r","Shall, whiles thy head is warm and new cut off,\r","Write in the dust this sentence with thy blood,\r","'Wind-changing Warwick now can change no more.'\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","O cheerful colours! see where Oxford comes!\r","\r","OXFORD:\r","Oxford, Oxford, for Lancaster!\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","The gates are open, let us enter too.\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","So other foes may set upon our backs.\r","Stand we in good array; for they no doubt\r","Will issue out again and bid us battle:\r","If not, the city being but of small defence,\r","We'll quickly rouse the traitors in the same.\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","O, welcome, Oxford! for we want thy help.\r","\r","MONTAGUE:\r","Montague, Montague, for Lancaster!\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Thou and thy brother both shall buy this treason\r","Even with the dearest blood your bodies bear.\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","The harder match'd, the greater victory:\r","My mind presageth happy gain and conquest.\r","\r","SOMERSET:\r","Somerset, Somerset, for Lancaster!\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Two of thy name, both Dukes of Somerset,\r","Have sold their lives unto the house of York;\r","And thou shalt be the third if this sword hold.\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","And lo, where George of Clarence sweeps along,\r","Of force enough to bid his brother battle;\r","With whom an upright zeal to right prevails\r","More than the nature of a brother's love!\r","Come, Clarence, come; thou wilt, if Warwick call.\r","\r","CLARENCE:\r","Father of Warwick, know you what this means?\r","Look here, I throw my infamy at thee\r","I will not ruinate my father's house,\r","Who gave his blood to lime the stones together,\r","And set up Lancaster. Why, trow'st thou, Warwick,\r","That Clarence is so harsh, so blunt, unnatural,\r","To bend the fatal instruments of war\r","Against his brother and his lawful king?\r","Perhaps thou wilt object my holy oath:\r","To keep that oath were more impiety\r","Than Jephthah's, when he sacrificed his daughter.\r","I am so sorry for my trespass made\r","That, to deserve well at my brother's hands,\r","I here proclaim myself thy mortal foe,\r","With resolution, wheresoe'er I meet thee--\r","As I will meet thee, if thou stir abroad--\r","To plague thee for thy foul misleading me.\r","And so, proud-hearted Warwick, I defy thee,\r","And to my brother turn my blushing cheeks.\r","Pardon me, Edward, I will make amends:\r","And, Richard, do not frown upon my faults,\r","For I will henceforth be no more unconstant.\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","Now welcome more, and ten times more beloved,\r","Than if thou never hadst deserved our hate.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Welcome, good Clarence; this is brotherlike.\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","O passing traitor, perjured and unjust!\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","What, Warwick, wilt thou leave the town and fight?\r","Or shall we beat the stones about thine ears?\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","Alas, I am not coop'd here for defence!\r","I will away towards Barnet presently,\r","And bid thee battle, Edward, if thou darest.\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","Yes, Warwick, Edward dares, and leads the way.\r","Lords, to the field; Saint George and victory!\r","3 KING HENRY VI\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","So, lie thou there: die thou, and die our fear;\r","For Warwick was a bug that fear'd us all.\r","Now, Montague, sit fast; I seek for thee,\r","That Warwick's bones may keep thine company.\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","Ah, who is nigh? come to me, friend or foe,\r","And tell me who is victor, York or Warwick?\r","Why ask I that? my mangled body shows,\r","My blood, my want of strength, my sick heart shows.\r","That I must yield my body to the earth\r","And, by my fall, the conquest to my foe.\r","Thus yields the cedar to the axe's edge,\r","Whose arms gave shelter to the princely eagle,\r","Under whose shade the ramping lion slept,\r","Whose top-branch overpeer'd Jove's spreading tree\r","And kept low shrubs from winter's powerful wind.\r","These eyes, that now are dimm'd with death's black veil,\r","Have been as piercing as the mid-day sun,\r","To search the secret treasons of the world:\r","The wrinkles in my brows, now filled with blood,\r","Were liken'd oft to kingly sepulchres;\r","For who lived king, but I could dig his grave?\r","And who durst mine when Warwick bent his brow?\r","Lo, now my glory smear'd in dust and blood!\r","My parks, my walks, my manors that I had.\r","Even now forsake me, and of all my lands\r","Is nothing left me but my body's length.\r","Why, what is pomp, rule, reign, but earth and dust?\r","And, live we how we can, yet die we must.\r","\r","SOMERSET:\r","Ah, Warwick, Warwick! wert thou as we are.\r","We might recover all our loss again;\r","The queen from France hath brought a puissant power:\r","Even now we heard the news: ah, could'st thou fly!\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","Why, then I would not fly. Ah, Montague,\r","If thou be there, sweet brother, take my hand.\r","And with thy lips keep in my soul awhile!\r","Thou lovest me not; for, brother, if thou didst,\r","Thy tears would wash this cold congealed blood\r","That glues my lips and will not let me speak.\r","Come quickly, Montague, or I am dead.\r","\r","SOMERSET:\r","Ah, Warwick! Montague hath breathed his last;\r","And to the latest gasp cried out for Warwick,\r","And said 'Commend me to my valiant brother.'\r","And more he would have said, and more he spoke,\r","Which sounded like a clamour in a vault,\r","That mought not be distinguished; but at last\r","I well might hear, delivered with a groan,\r","'O, farewell, Warwick!'\r","\r","WARWICK:\r","Sweet rest his soul! Fly, lords, and save yourselves;\r","For Warwick bids you all farewell to meet in heaven.\r","\r","OXFORD:\r","Away, away, to meet the queen's great power!\r","3 KING HENRY VI\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","Thus far our fortune keeps an upward course,\r","And we are graced with wreaths of victory.\r","But, in the midst of this bright-shining day,\r","I spy a black, suspicious, threatening cloud,\r","That will encounter with our glorious sun,\r","Ere he attain his easeful western bed:\r","I mean, my lords, those powers that the queen\r","Hath raised in Gallia have arrived our coast\r","And, as we hear, march on to fight with us.\r","\r","CLARENCE:\r","A little gale will soon disperse that cloud\r","And blow it to the source from whence it came:\r","The very beams will dry those vapours up,\r","For every cloud engenders not a storm.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","The queen is valued thirty thousand strong,\r","And Somerset, with Oxford fled to her:\r","If she have time to breathe be well assured\r","Her faction will be full as strong as ours.\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","We are advertised by our loving friends\r","That they do hold their course toward Tewksbury:\r","We, having now the best at Barnet field,\r","Will thither straight, for willingness rids way;\r","And, as we march, our strength will be augmented\r","In every county as we go along.\r","Strike up the drum; cry 'Courage!' and away.\r","3 KING HENRY VI\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","Great lords, wise men ne'er sit and wail their loss,\r","But cheerly seek how to redress their harms.\r","What though the mast be now blown overboard,\r","The cable broke, the holding-anchor lost,\r","And half our sailors swallow'd in the flood?\r","Yet lives our pilot still. Is't meet that he\r","Should leave the helm and like a fearful lad\r","With tearful eyes add water to the sea\r","And give more strength to that which hath too much,\r","Whiles, in his moan, the ship splits on the rock,\r","Which industry and courage might have saved?\r","Ah, what a shame! ah, what a fault were this!\r","Say Warwick was our anchor; what of that?\r","And Montague our topmost; what of him?\r","Our slaughter'd friends the tackles; what of these?\r","Why, is not Oxford here another anchor?\r","And Somerset another goodly mast?\r","The friends of France our shrouds and tacklings?\r","And, though unskilful, why not Ned and I\r","For once allow'd the skilful pilot's charge?\r","We will not from the helm to sit and weep,\r","But keep our course, though the rough wind say no,\r","From shelves and rocks that threaten us with wreck.\r","As good to chide the waves as speak them fair.\r","And what is Edward but ruthless sea?\r","What Clarence but a quicksand of deceit?\r","And Richard but a ragged fatal rock?\r","All these the enemies to our poor bark.\r","Say you can swim; alas, 'tis but a while!\r","Tread on the sand; why, there you quickly sink:\r","Bestride the rock; the tide will wash you off,\r","Or else you famish; that's a threefold death.\r","This speak I, lords, to let you understand,\r","If case some one of you would fly from us,\r","That there's no hoped-for mercy with the brothers\r","More than with ruthless waves, with sands and rocks.\r","Why, courage then! what cannot be avoided\r","'Twere childish weakness to lament or fear.\r","\r","PRINCE EDWARD:\r","Methinks a woman of this valiant spirit\r","Should, if a coward heard her speak these words,\r","Infuse his breast with magnanimity\r","And make him, naked, foil a man at arms.\r","I speak not this as doubting any here\r","For did I but suspect a fearful man\r","He should have leave to go away betimes,\r","Lest in our need he might infect another\r","And make him of like spirit to himself.\r","If any such be here--as God forbid!--\r","Let him depart before we need his help.\r","\r","OXFORD:\r","Women and children of so high a courage,\r","And warriors faint! why, 'twere perpetual shame.\r","O brave young prince! thy famous grandfather\r","Doth live again in thee: long mayst thou live\r","To bear his image and renew his glories!\r","\r","SOMERSET:\r","And he that will not fight for such a hope.\r","Go home to bed, and like the owl by day,\r","If he arise, be mock'd and wonder'd at.\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","Thanks, gentle Somerset;
