sweet Oxford, thanks.\r","\r","PRINCE EDWARD:\r","And take his thanks that yet hath nothing else.\r","\r","Messenger:\r","Prepare you, lords, for Edward is at hand.\r","Ready to fight; therefore be resolute.\r","\r","OXFORD:\r","I thought no less: it is his policy\r","To haste thus fast, to find us unprovided.\r","\r","SOMERSET:\r","But he's deceived; we are in readiness.\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","This cheers my heart, to see your forwardness.\r","\r","OXFORD:\r","Here pitch our battle; hence we will not budge.\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","Brave followers, yonder stands the thorny wood,\r","Which, by the heavens' assistance and your strength,\r","Must by the roots be hewn up yet ere night.\r","I need not add more fuel to your fire,\r","For well I wot ye blaze to burn them out\r","Give signal to the fight, and to it, lords!\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","Lords, knights, and gentlemen, what I should say\r","My tears gainsay; for every word I speak,\r","Ye see, I drink the water of mine eyes.\r","Therefore, no more but this: Henry, your sovereign,\r","Is prisoner to the foe; his state usurp'd,\r","His realm a slaughter-house, his subjects slain,\r","His statutes cancell'd and his treasure spent;\r","And yonder is the wolf that makes this spoil.\r","You fight in justice: then, in God's name, lords,\r","Be valiant and give signal to the fight.\r","3 KING HENRY VI\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","Now here a period of tumultuous broils.\r","Away with Oxford to Hames Castle straight:\r","For Somerset, off with his guilty head.\r","Go, bear them hence; I will not hear them speak.\r","\r","OXFORD:\r","For my part, I'll not trouble thee with words.\r","\r","SOMERSET:\r","Nor I, but stoop with patience to my fortune.\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","So part we sadly in this troublous world,\r","To meet with joy in sweet Jerusalem.\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","Is proclamation made, that who finds Edward\r","Shall have a high reward, and he his life?\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","It is: and lo, where youthful Edward comes!\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","Bring forth the gallant, let us hear him speak.\r","What! can so young a thorn begin to prick?\r","Edward, what satisfaction canst thou make\r","For bearing arms, for stirring up my subjects,\r","And all the trouble thou hast turn'd me to?\r","\r","PRINCE EDWARD:\r","Speak like a subject, proud ambitious York!\r","Suppose that I am now my father's mouth;\r","Resign thy chair, and where I stand kneel thou,\r","Whilst I propose the selfsame words to thee,\r","Which traitor, thou wouldst have me answer to.\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","Ah, that thy father had been so resolved!\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","That you might still have worn the petticoat,\r","And ne'er have stol'n the breech from Lancaster.\r","\r","PRINCE EDWARD:\r","Let AEsop fable in a winter's night;\r","His currish riddles sort not with this place.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","By heaven, brat, I'll plague ye for that word.\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","Ay, thou wast born to be a plague to men.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","For God's sake, take away this captive scold.\r","\r","PRINCE EDWARD:\r","Nay, take away this scolding crookback rather.\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","Peace, wilful boy, or I will charm your tongue.\r","\r","CLARENCE:\r","Untutor'd lad, thou art too malapert.\r","\r","PRINCE EDWARD:\r","I know my duty; you are all undutiful:\r","Lascivious Edward, and thou perjured George,\r","And thou mis-shapen Dick, I tell ye all\r","I am your better, traitors as ye are:\r","And thou usurp'st my father's right and mine.\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","Take that, thou likeness of this railer here.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Sprawl'st thou? take that, to end thy agony.\r","\r","CLARENCE:\r","And there's for twitting me with perjury.\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","O, kill me too!\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Marry, and shall.\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","Hold, Richard, hold; for we have done too much.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Why should she live, to fill the world with words?\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","What, doth she swoon? use means for her recovery.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Clarence, excuse me to the king my brother;\r","I'll hence to London on a serious matter:\r","Ere ye come there, be sure to hear some news.\r","\r","CLARENCE:\r","What? what?\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","The Tower, the Tower.\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","O Ned, sweet Ned! speak to thy mother, boy!\r","Canst thou not speak? O traitors! murderers!\r","They that stabb'd Caesar shed no blood at all,\r","Did not offend, nor were not worthy blame,\r","If this foul deed were by to equal it:\r","He was a man; this, in respect, a child:\r","And men ne'er spend their fury on a child.\r","What's worse than murderer, that I may name it?\r","No, no, my heart will burst, and if I speak:\r","And I will speak, that so my heart may burst.\r","Butchers and villains! bloody cannibals!\r","How sweet a plant have you untimely cropp'd!\r","You have no children, butchers! if you had,\r","The thought of them would have stirr'd up remorse:\r","But if you ever chance to have a child,\r","Look in his youth to have him so cut off\r","As, deathmen, you have rid this sweet young prince!\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","Away with her; go, bear her hence perforce.\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","Nay, never bear me hence, dispatch me here,\r","Here sheathe thy sword, I'll pardon thee my death:\r","What, wilt thou not? then, Clarence, do it thou.\r","\r","CLARENCE:\r","By heaven, I will not do thee so much ease.\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","Good Clarence, do; sweet Clarence, do thou do it.\r","\r","CLARENCE:\r","Didst thou not hear me swear I would not do it?\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","Ay, but thou usest to forswear thyself:\r","'Twas sin before, but now 'tis charity.\r","What, wilt thou not? Where is that devil's butcher,\r","Hard-favour'd Richard? Richard, where art thou?\r","Thou art not here: murder is thy alms-deed;\r","Petitioners for blood thou ne'er put'st back.\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","Away, I say; I charge ye, bear her hence.\r","\r","QUEEN MARGARET:\r","So come to you and yours, as to this Prince!\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","Where's Richard gone?\r","\r","CLARENCE:\r","To London, all in post; and, as I guess,\r","To make a bloody supper in the Tower.\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","He's sudden, if a thing comes in his head.\r","Now march we hence: discharge the common sort\r","With pay and thanks, and let's away to London\r","And see our gentle queen how well she fares:\r","By this, I hope, she hath a son for me.\r","3 KING HENRY VI\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Good day, my lord. What, at your book so hard?\r","\r","KING HENRY VI:\r","Ay, my good lord:--my lord, I should say rather;\r","'Tis sin to flatter; 'good' was little better:\r","'Good Gloucester' and 'good devil' were alike,\r","And both preposterous; therefore, not 'good lord.'\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Sirrah, leave us to ourselves: we must confer.\r","\r","KING HENRY VI:\r","So flies the reckless shepherd from the wolf;\r","So first the harmless sheep doth yield his fleece\r","And next his throat unto the butcher's knife.\r","What scene of death hath Roscius now to act?\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Suspicion always haunts the guilty mind;\r","The thief doth fear each bush an officer.\r","\r","KING HENRY VI:\r","The bird that hath been limed in a bush,\r","With trembling wings misdoubteth every bush;\r","And I, the hapless male to one sweet bird,\r","Have now the fatal object in my eye\r","Where my poor young was limed, was caught and kill'd.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Why, what a peevish fool was that of Crete,\r","That taught his son the office of a fowl!\r","An yet, for all his wings, the fool was drown'd.\r","\r","KING HENRY VI:\r","I, Daedalus; my poor boy, Icarus;\r","Thy father, Minos, that denied our course;\r","The sun that sear'd the wings of my sweet boy\r","Thy brother Edward, and thyself the sea\r","Whose envious gulf did swallow up his life.\r","Ah, kill me with thy weapon, not with words!\r","My breast can better brook thy dagger's point\r","Than can my ears that tragic history.\r","But wherefore dost thou come? is't for my life?\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Think'st thou I am an executioner?\r","\r","KING HENRY VI:\r","A persecutor, I am sure, thou art:\r","If murdering innocents be executing,\r","Why, then thou art an executioner.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","Thy son I kill'd for his presumption.\r","\r","KING HENRY VI:\r","Hadst thou been kill'd when first thou didst presume,\r","Thou hadst not lived to kill a son of mine.\r","And thus I prophesy, that many a thousand,\r","Which now mistrust no parcel of my fear,\r","And many an old man's sigh and many a widow's,\r","And many an orphan's water-standing eye--\r","Men for their sons, wives for their husbands,\r","And orphans for their parents timeless death--\r","Shall rue the hour that ever thou wast born.\r","The owl shriek'd at thy birth,--an evil sign;\r","The night-crow cried, aboding luckless time;\r","Dogs howl'd, and hideous tempest shook down trees;\r","The raven rook'd her on the chimney's top,\r","And chattering pies in dismal discords sung.\r","Thy mother felt more than a mother's pain,\r","And, yet brought forth less than a mother's hope,\r","To wit, an indigested and deformed lump,\r","Not like the fruit of such a goodly tree.\r","Teeth hadst thou in thy head when thou wast born,\r","To signify thou camest to bite the world:\r","And, if the rest be true which I have heard,\r","Thou camest--\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","I'll hear no more: die, prophet in thy speech:\r","For this amongst the rest, was I ordain'd.\r","\r","KING HENRY VI:\r","Ay, and for much more slaughter after this.\r","God forgive my sins, and pardon thee!\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","What, will the aspiring blood of Lancaster\r","Sink in the ground? I thought it would have mounted.\r","See how my sword weeps for the poor king's death!\r","O, may such purple tears be alway shed\r","From those that wish the downfall of our house!\r","If any spark of life be yet remaining,\r","Down, down to hell; and say I sent thee thither:\r","I, that have neither pity, love, nor fear.\r","Indeed, 'tis true that Henry told me of;\r","For I have often heard my mother say\r","I came into the world with my legs forward:\r","Had I not reason, think ye, to make haste,\r","And seek their ruin that usurp'd our right?\r","The midwife wonder'd and the women cried\r","'O, Jesus bless us, he is born with teeth!'\r","And so I was; which plainly signified\r","That I should snarl and bite and play the dog.\r","Then, since the heavens have shaped my body so,\r","Let hell make crook'd my mind to answer it.\r","I have no brother, I am like no brother;\r","And this word 'love,' which graybeards call divine,\r","Be resident in men like one another\r","And not in me: I am myself alone.\r","Clarence, beware; thou keep'st me from the light:\r","But I will sort a pitchy day for thee;\r","For I will buz abroad such prophecies\r","That Edward shall be fearful of his life,\r","And then, to purge his fear, I'll be thy death.\r","King Henry and the prince his son are gone:\r","Clarence, thy turn is next, and then the rest,\r","Counting myself but bad till I be best.\r","I'll throw thy body in another room\r","And triumph, Henry, in thy day of doom.\r","3 KING HENRY VI\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","Once more we sit in England's royal throne,\r","Re-purchased with the blood of enemies.\r","What valiant foemen, like to autumn's corn,\r","Have we mow'd down, in tops of all their pride!\r","Three Dukes of Somerset, threefold renown'd\r","For hardy and undoubted champions;\r","Two Cliffords, as the father and the son,\r","And two Northumberlands; two braver men\r","Ne'er spurr'd their coursers at the trumpet's sound;\r","With them, the two brave bears, Warwick and Montague,\r","That in their chains fetter'd the kingly lion\r","And made the forest tremble when they roar'd.\r","Thus have we swept suspicion from our seat\r","And made our footstool of security.\r","Come hither, Bess, and let me kiss my boy.\r","Young Ned, for thee, thine uncles and myself\r","Have in our armours watch'd the winter's night,\r","Went all afoot in summer's scalding heat,\r","That thou mightst repossess the crown in peace;\r","And of our labours thou shalt reap the gain.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","Clarence and Gloucester, love my lovely queen;\r","And kiss your princely nephew, brothers both.\r","\r","CLARENCE:\r","The duty that I owe unto your majesty\r","I seal upon the lips of this sweet babe.\r","\r","QUEEN ELIZABETH:\r","Thanks, noble Clarence; worthy brother, thanks.\r","\r","GLOUCESTER:\r","And, that I love the tree from whence thou sprang'st,\r","Witness the loving kiss I give the fruit.\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","Now am I seated as my soul delights,\r","Having my country's peace and brothers' loves.\r","\r","CLARENCE:\r","What will your grace have done with Margaret?\r","Reignier, her father, to the king of France\r","Hath pawn'd the Sicils and Jerusalem,\r","And hither have they sent it for her ransom.\r","\r","KING EDWARD IV:\r","Away with her, and waft her hence to France.\r","And now what rests but that we spend the time\r","With stately triumphs, mirthful comic shows,\r","Such as befits the pleasure of the court?\r","Sound drums and trumpets! farewell sour annoy!\r","For here, I hope, begins our lasting joy.\r","\r","ARCHIDAMUS:\r","If you shall chance, Camillo, to visit Bohemia, on\r","the like occasion whereon my services are now on\r","foot, you shall see, as I have said, great\r","difference betwixt our Bohemia and your Sicilia.\r","\r","CAMILLO:\r","I think, this coming summer, the King of Sicilia\r","means to pay Bohemia the visitation which he justly owes him.\r","\r","ARCHIDAMUS:\r","Wherein our entertainment shall shame us we will be\r","justified in our loves; for indeed--\r","\r","CAMILLO:\r","Beseech you,--\r","\r","ARCHIDAMUS:\r","Verily, I speak it in the freedom of my knowledge:\r","we cannot with such magnificence--in so rare--I know\r","not what to say. We will give you sleepy drinks,\r","that your senses, unintelligent of our insufficience,\r","may, though they cannot praise us, as little accuse\r","us.\r","\r","CAMILLO:\r","You pay a great deal too dear for what's given freely.\r","\r","ARCHIDAMUS:\r","Believe me, I speak as my understanding instructs me\r","and as mine honesty puts it to utterance.\r","\r","CAMILLO:\r","Sicilia cannot show himself over-kind to Bohemia.\r","They were trained together in their childhoods; and\r","there rooted betwixt them then such an affection,\r","which cannot choose but branch now. Since their\r","more mature dignities and royal necessities made\r","separation of their society, their encounters,\r","though not personal, have been royally attorneyed\r","with interchange of gifts, letters, loving\r","embassies; that they have seemed to be together,\r","though absent, shook hands, as over a vast, and\r","embraced, as it were, from the ends of opposed\r","winds. The heavens continue their loves!\r","\r","ARCHIDAMUS:\r","I think there is not in the world either malice or\r","matter to alter it. You have an unspeakable\r","comfort of your young prince Mamillius: it is a\r","gentleman of the greatest promise that ever came\r","into my note.\r","\r","CAMILLO:\r","I very well agree with you in the hopes of him: it\r","is a gallant child; one that indeed physics the\r","subject, makes old hearts fresh: they that went on\r","crutches ere he was born desire yet their life to\r","see him a man.\r","\r","ARCHIDAMUS:\r","Would they else be content to die?\r","\r","CAMILLO:\r","Yes; if there were no other excuse why they should\r","desire to live.\r","\r","ARCHIDAMUS:\r","If the king had no son, they would desire to live\r","on crutches till he had one.\r","\r","POLIXENES:\r","Nine changes of the watery star hath been\r","The shepherd's note since we have left our throne\r","Without a burthen: time as long again\r","Would be find up, my brother, with our thanks;\r","And yet we should, for perpetuity,\r","Go hence in debt: and therefore, like a cipher,\r","Yet standing in rich place, I multiply\r","With one 'We thank you' many thousands moe\r","That go before it.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","Stay your thanks a while;\r","And pay them when you part.\r","\r","POLIXENES:\r","Sir, that's to-morrow.\r","I am question'd by my fears, of what may chance\r","Or breed upon our absence; that may blow\r","No sneaping winds at home, to make us say\r","'This is put forth too truly:' besides, I have stay'd\r","To tire your royalty.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","We are tougher, brother,\r","Than you can put us to't.\r","\r","POLIXENES:\r","No longer stay.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","One seven-night longer.\r","\r","POLIXENES:\r","Very sooth, to-morrow.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","We'll part the time between's then; and in that\r","I'll no gainsaying.\r","\r","POLIXENES:\r","Press me not, beseech you, so.\r","There is no tongue that moves, none, none i' the world,\r","So soon as yours could win me: so it should now,\r","Were there necessity in your request, although\r","'Twere needful I denied it. My affairs\r","Do even drag me homeward: which to hinder\r","Were in your love a whip to me; my stay\r","To you a charge and trouble: to save both,\r","Farewell, our brother.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","Tongue-tied, our queen?\r","speak you.\r","\r","HERMIONE:\r","I had thought, sir, to have held my peace until\r","You have drawn oaths from him not to stay. You, sir,\r","Charge him too coldly. Tell him, you are sure\r","All in Bohemia's well; this satisfaction\r","The by-gone day proclaim'd: say this to him,\r","He's beat from his best ward.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","Well said, Hermione.\r","\r","HERMIONE:\r","To tell, he longs to see his son, were strong:\r","But let him say so then, and let him go;\r","But let him swear so, and he shall not stay,\r","We'll thwack him hence with distaffs.\r","Yet of your royal presence I'll adventure\r","The borrow of a week. When at Bohemia\r","You take my lord, I'll give him my commission\r","To let him there a month behind the gest\r","Prefix'd for's parting: yet, good deed, Leontes,\r","I love thee not a jar o' the clock behind\r","What lady-she her lord. You'll stay?\r","\r","POLIXENES:\r","No, madam.\r","\r","HERMIONE:\r","Nay, but you will?\r","\r","POLIXENES:\r","I may not, verily.\r","\r","HERMIONE:\r","Verily!\r","You put me off with limber vows; but I,\r","Though you would seek to unsphere the\r","stars with oaths,\r","Should yet say 'Sir, no going.' Verily,\r","You shall not go: a lady's 'Verily' 's\r","As potent as a lord's. Will you go yet?\r","Force me to keep you as a prisoner,\r","Not like a guest; so you shall pay your fees\r","When you depart, and save your thanks. How say you?\r","My prisoner? or my guest? by your dread 'Verily,'\r","One of them you shall be.\r","\r","POLIXENES:\r","Your guest, then, madam:\r","To be your prisoner should import offending;\r","Which is for me less easy to commit\r","Than you to punish.\r","\r","HERMIONE:\r","Not your gaoler, then,\r","But your kind hostess. Come, I'll question you\r","Of my lord's tricks and yours when you were boys:\r","You were pretty lordings then?\r","\r","POLIXENES:\r","We were, fair queen,\r","Two lads that thought there was no more behind\r","But such a day to-morrow as to-day,\r","And to be boy eternal.\r","\r","HERMIONE:\r","Was not my lord\r","The verier wag o' the two?\r","\r","POLIXENES:\r","We were as twinn'd lambs that did frisk i' the sun,\r","And bleat the one at the other: what we changed\r","Was innocence for innocence; we knew not\r","The doctrine of ill-doing, nor dream'd\r","That any did. Had we pursued that life,\r","And our weak spirits ne'er been higher rear'd\r","With stronger blood, we should have answer'd heaven\r","Boldly 'not guilty;' the imposition clear'd\r","Hereditary ours.\r","\r","HERMIONE:\r","By this we gather\r","You have tripp'd since.\r","\r","POLIXENES:\r","O my most sacred lady!\r","Temptations have since then been born to's; for\r","In those unfledged days was my wife a girl;\r","Your precious self had then not cross'd the eyes\r","Of my young play-fellow.\r","\r","HERMIONE:\r","Grace to boot!\r","Of this make no conclusion, lest you say\r","Your queen and I are devils: yet go on;\r","The offences we have made you do we'll answer,\r","If you first sinn'd with us and that with us\r","You did continue fault and that you slipp'd not\r","With any but with us.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","Is he won yet?\r","\r","HERMIONE:\r","He'll stay my lord.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","At my request he would not.\r","Hermione, my dearest, thou never spokest\r","To better purpose.\r","\r","HERMIONE:\r","Never?\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","Never, but once.\r","\r","HERMIONE:\r","What! have I twice said well? when was't before?\r","I prithee tell me; cram's with praise, and make's\r","As fat as tame things: one good deed dying tongueless\r","Slaughters a thousand waiting upon that.\r","Our praises are our wages: you may ride's\r","With one soft kiss a thousand furlongs ere\r","With spur we beat an acre. But to the goal:\r","My last good deed was to entreat his stay:\r","What was my first? it has an elder sister,\r","Or I mistake you: O, would her name were Grace!\r","But once before I spoke to the purpose: when?\r","Nay, let me have't; I long.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","Why, that was when\r","Three crabbed months had sour'd themselves to death,\r","Ere I could make thee open thy white hand\r","And clap thyself my love: then didst thou utter\r","'I am yours for ever.'\r","\r","HERMIONE:\r","'Tis grace indeed.\r","Why, lo you now, I have spoke to the purpose twice:\r","The one for ever earn'd a royal husband;\r","The other for some while a friend.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","\r","MAMILLIUS:\r","Ay, my good lord.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","I' fecks!\r","Why, that's my bawcock. What, hast\r","smutch'd thy nose?\r","They say it is a copy out of mine. Come, captain,\r","We must be neat; not neat, but cleanly, captain:\r","And yet the steer, the heifer and the calf\r","Are all call'd neat.--Still virginalling\r","Upon his palm!--How now, you wanton calf!\r","Art thou my calf?\r","\r","MAMILLIUS:\r","Yes, if you will, my lord.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","Thou want'st a rough pash and the shoots that I have,\r","To be full like me: yet they say we are\r","Almost as like as eggs; women say so,\r","That will say anything but were they false\r","As o'er-dyed blacks, as wind, as waters, false\r","As dice are to be wish'd by one that fixes\r","No bourn 'twixt his and mine, yet were it true\r","To say this boy were like me. Come, sir page,\r","Look on me with your welkin eye: sweet villain!\r","Most dear'st! my collop! Can thy dam?--may't be?--\r","Affection! thy intention stabs the centre:\r","Thou dost make possible things not so held,\r","Communicatest with dreams;--how can this be?--\r","With what's unreal thou coactive art,\r","And fellow'st nothing: then 'tis very credent\r","Thou mayst co-join with something; and thou dost,\r","And that beyond commission, and I find it,\r","And that to the infection of my brains\r","And hardening of my brows.\r","\r","POLIXENES:\r","What means Sicilia?\r","\r","HERMIONE:\r","He something seems unsettled.\r","\r","POLIXENES:\r","How, my lord!\r","What cheer? how is't with you, best brother?\r","\r","HERMIONE:\r","You look as if you held a brow of much distraction\r","Are you moved, my lord?\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","No, in good earnest.\r","How sometimes nature will betray its folly,\r","Its tenderness, and make itself a pastime\r","To harder bosoms! Looking on the lines\r","Of my boy's face, methoughts I did recoil\r","Twenty-three years, and saw myself unbreech'd,\r","In my green velvet coat, my dagger muzzled,\r","Lest it should bite its master, and so prove,\r","As ornaments oft do, too dangerous:\r","How like, methought, I then was to this kernel,\r","This squash, this gentleman. Mine honest friend,\r","Will you take eggs for money?\r","\r","MAMILLIUS:\r","No, my lord, I'll fight.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","You will! why, happy man be's dole! My brother,\r","Are you so fond of your young prince as we\r","Do seem to be of ours?\r","\r","POLIXENES:\r","If at home, sir,\r","He's all my exercise, my mirth, my matter,\r","Now my sworn friend and then mine enemy,\r","My parasite, my soldier, statesman, all:\r","He makes a July's day short as December,\r","And with his varying childness cures in me\r","Thoughts that would thick my blood.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","So stands this squire\r","Officed with me: we two will walk, my lord,\r","And leave you to your graver steps. Hermione,\r","How thou lovest us, show in our brother's welcome;\r","Let what is dear in Sicily be cheap:\r","Next to thyself and my young rover, he's\r","Apparent to my heart.\r","\r","HERMIONE:\r","If you would seek us,\r","We are yours i' the garden: shall's attend you there?\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","To your own bents dispose you: you'll be found,\r","Be you beneath the sky.\r","I am angling now,\r","Though you perceive me not how I give line.\r","Go to, go to!\r","How she holds up the neb, the bill to him!\r","And arms her with the boldness of a wife\r","To her allowing husband!\r","Gone already!\r","Inch-thick, knee-deep, o'er head and\r","ears a fork'd one!\r","Go, play, boy, play: thy mother plays, and I\r","Play too, but so disgraced a part, whose issue\r","Will hiss me to my grave: contempt and clamour\r","Will be my knell. Go, play, boy, play.\r","There have been,\r","Or I am much deceived, cuckolds ere now;\r","And many a man there is, even at this present,\r","Now while I speak this, holds his wife by the arm,\r","That little thinks she has been sluiced in's absence\r","And his pond fish'd by his next neighbour, by\r","Sir Smile, his neighbour: nay, there's comfort in't\r","Whiles other men have gates and those gates open'd,\r","As mine, against their will. Should all despair\r","That have revolted wives, the tenth of mankind\r","Would hang themselves. Physic for't there is none;\r","It is a bawdy planet, that will strike\r","Where 'tis predominant; and 'tis powerful, think it,\r","From east, west, north and south: be it concluded,\r","No barricado for a belly; know't;\r","It will let in and out the enemy\r","With bag and baggage: many thousand on's\r","Have the disease, and feel't not. How now, boy!\r","\r","MAMILLIUS:\r","I am like you, they say.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","Why that's some comfort. What, Camillo there?\r","\r","CAMILLO:\r","Ay, my good lord.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","Go play, Mamillius; thou'rt an honest man.\r","Camillo, this great sir will yet stay longer.\r","\r","CAMILLO:\r","You had much ado to make his anchor hold:\r","When you cast out, it still came home.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","Didst note it?\r","\r","CAMILLO:\r","He would not stay at your petitions: made\r","His business more material.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","Didst perceive it?\r","They're here with me already, whispering, rounding\r","'Sicilia is a so-forth:' 'tis far gone,\r","When I shall gust it last. How came't, Camillo,\r","That he did stay?\r","\r","CAMILLO:\r","At the good queen's entreaty.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","At the queen's be't: 'good' should be pertinent\r","But, so it is, it is not. Was this taken\r","By any understanding pate but thine?\r","For thy conceit is soaking, will draw in\r","More than the common blocks: not noted, is't,\r","But of the finer natures? by some severals\r","Of head-piece extraordinary? lower messes\r","Perchance are to this business purblind? say.\r","\r","CAMILLO:\r","Business, my lord! I think most understand\r","Bohemia stays here longer.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","Ha!\r","\r","CAMILLO:\r","Stays here longer.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","Ay, but why?\r","\r","CAMILLO:\r","To satisfy your highness and the entreaties\r","Of our most gracious mistress.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","Satisfy!\r","The entreaties of your mistress! satisfy!\r","Let that suffice. I have trusted thee, Camillo,\r","With all the nearest things to my heart, as well\r","My chamber-councils, wherein, priest-like, thou\r","Hast cleansed my bosom, I from thee departed\r","Thy penitent reform'd: but we have been\r","Deceived in thy integrity, deceived\r","In that which seems so.\r","\r","CAMILLO:\r","Be it forbid, my lord!\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","To bide upon't, thou art not honest, or,\r","If thou inclinest that way, thou art a coward,\r","Which hoxes honesty behind, restraining\r","From course required; or else thou must be counted\r","A servant grafted in my serious trust\r","And therein negligent; or else a fool\r","That seest a game play'd home, the rich stake drawn,\r","And takest it all for jest.\r","\r","CAMILLO:\r","My gracious lord,\r","I may be negligent, foolish and fearful;\r","In every one of these no man is free,\r","But that his negligence, his folly, fear,\r","Among the infinite doings of the world,\r","Sometime puts forth. In your affairs, my lord,\r","If ever I were wilful-negligent,\r","It was my folly; if industriously\r","I play'd the fool, it was my negligence,\r","Not weighing well the end; if ever fearful\r","To do a thing, where I the issue doubted,\r","Where of the execution did cry out\r","Against the non-performance, 'twas a fear\r","Which oft infects the wisest: these, my lord,\r","Are such allow'd infirmities that honesty\r","Is never free of. But, beseech your grace,\r","Be plainer with me; let me know my trespass\r","By its own visage: if I then deny it,\r","'Tis none of mine.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","Ha' not you seen, Camillo,--\r","But that's past doubt, you have, or your eye-glass\r","Is thicker than a cuckold's horn,--or heard,--\r","For to a vision so apparent rumour\r","Cannot be mute,--or thought,--for cogitation\r","Resides not in that man that does not think,--\r","My wife is slippery? If thou wilt confess,\r","Or else be impudently negative,\r","To have nor eyes nor ears nor thought, then say\r","My wife's a hobby-horse, deserves a name\r","As rank as any flax-wench that puts to\r","Before her troth-plight: say't and justify't.\r","\r","CAMILLO:\r","I would not be a stander-by to hear\r","My sovereign mistress clouded so, without\r","My present vengeance taken: 'shrew my heart,\r","You never spoke what did become you less\r","Than this; which to reiterate were sin\r","As deep as that, though true.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","Is whispering nothing?\r","Is leaning cheek to cheek? is meeting noses?\r","Kissing with inside lip? stopping the career\r","Of laughing with a sigh?--a note infallible\r","Of breaking honesty--horsing foot on foot?\r","Skulking in corners? wishing clocks more swift?\r","Hours, minutes? noon, midnight? and all eyes\r","Blind with the pin and web but theirs, theirs only,\r","That would unseen be wicked? is this nothing?\r","Why, then the world and all that's in't is nothing;\r","The covering sky is nothing; Bohemia nothing;\r","My wife is nothing; nor nothing have these nothings,\r","If this be nothing.\r","\r","CAMILLO:\r","Good my lord, be cured\r","Of this diseased opinion, and betimes;\r","For 'tis most dangerous.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","Say it be, 'tis true.\r","\r","CAMILLO:\r","No, no, my lord.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","It is; you lie, you lie:\r","I say thou liest, Camillo, and I hate thee,\r","Pronounce thee a gross lout, a mindless slave,\r","Or else a hovering temporizer, that\r","Canst with thine eyes at once see good and evil,\r","Inclining to them both: were my wife's liver\r","Infected as her life, she would not live\r","The running of one glass.\r","\r","CAMILLO:\r","Who does infect her?\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","Why, he that wears her like a medal, hanging\r","About his neck, Bohemia: who, if I\r","Had servants true about me, that bare eyes\r","To see alike mine honour as their profits,\r","Their own particular thrifts, they would do that\r","Which should undo more doing: ay, and thou,\r","His cupbearer,--whom I from meaner form\r","Have benched and reared to worship, who mayst see\r","Plainly as heaven sees earth and earth sees heaven,\r","How I am galled,--mightst bespice a cup,\r","To give mine enemy a lasting wink;\r","Which draught to me were cordial.\r","\r","CAMILLO:\r","Sir, my lord,\r","I could do this, and that with no rash potion,\r","But with a lingering dram that should not work\r","Maliciously like poison: but I cannot\r","Believe this crack to be in my dread mistress,\r","So sovereignly being honourable.\r","I have loved thee,--\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","Make that thy question, and go rot!\r","Dost think I am so muddy, so unsettled,\r","To appoint myself in this vexation, sully\r","The purity and whiteness of my sheets,\r","Which to preserve is sleep, which being spotted\r","Is goads, thorns, nettles, tails of wasps,\r","Give scandal to the blood o' the prince my son,\r","Who I do think is mine and love as mine,\r","Without ripe moving to't? Would I do this?\r","Could man so blench?\r","\r","CAMILLO:\r","I must believe you, sir:\r","I do; and will fetch off Bohemia for't;\r","Provided that, when he's removed, your highness\r","Will take again your queen as yours at first,\r","Even for your son's sake; and thereby for sealing\r","The injury of tongues in courts and kingdoms\r","Known and allied to yours.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","Thou dost advise me\r","Even so as I mine own course have set down:\r","I'll give no blemish to her honour, none.\r","\r","CAMILLO:\r","My lord,\r","Go then; and with a countenance as clear\r","As friendship wears at feasts, keep with Bohemia\r","And with your queen. I am his cupbearer:\r","If from me he have wholesome beverage,\r","Account me not your servant.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","This is all:\r","Do't and thou hast the one half of my heart;\r","Do't not, thou split'st thine own.\r","\r","CAMILLO:\r","I'll do't, my lord.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","I will seem friendly, as thou hast advised me.\r","\r","CAMILLO:\r","O miserable lady! But, for me,\r","What case stand I in? I must be the poisoner\r","Of good Polixenes; and my ground to do't\r","Is the obedience to a master, one\r","Who in rebellion with himself will have\r","All that are his so too. To do this deed,\r","Promotion follows. If I could find example\r","Of thousands that had struck anointed kings\r","And flourish'd after, I'ld not do't; but since\r","Nor brass nor stone nor parchment bears not one,\r","Let villany itself forswear't. I must\r","Forsake the court: to do't, or no, is certain\r","To me a break-neck. Happy star, reign now!\r","Here comes Bohemia.\r","\r","POLIXENES:\r","This is strange: methinks\r","My favour here begins to warp. Not speak?\r","Good day, Camillo.\r","\r","CAMILLO:\r","Hail, most royal sir!\r","\r","POLIXENES:\r","What is the news i' the court?\r","\r","CAMILLO:\r","None rare, my lord.\r","\r","POLIXENES:\r","The king hath on him such a countenance\r","As he had lost some province and a region\r","Loved as he loves himself: even now I met him\r","With customary compliment; when he,\r","Wafting his eyes to the contrary and falling\r","A lip of much contempt, speeds from me and\r","So leaves me to consider what is breeding\r","That changeth thus his manners.\r","\r","CAMILLO:\r","I dare not know, my lord.\r","\r","POLIXENES:\r","How! dare not! do not. Do you know, and dare not?\r","Be intelligent to me: 'tis thereabouts;\r","For, to yourself, what you do know, you must.\r","And cannot say, you dare not. Good Camillo,\r","Your changed complexions are to me a mirror\r","Which shows me mine changed too; for I must be\r","A party in this alteration, finding\r","Myself thus alter'd with 't.\r","\r","CAMILLO:\r","There is a sickness\r","Which puts some of us in distemper, but\r","I cannot name the disease; and it is caught\r","Of you that yet are well.\r","\r","POLIXENES:\r","How! caught of me!\r","Make me not sighted like the basilisk:\r","I have look'd on thousands, who have sped the better\r","By my regard, but kill'd none so. Camillo,--\r","As you are certainly a gentleman, thereto\r","Clerk-like experienced, which no less adorns\r","Our gentry than our parents' noble names,\r","In whose success we are gentle,--I beseech you,\r","If you know aught which does behove my knowledge\r","Thereof to be inform'd, imprison't not\r","In ignorant concealment.\r","\r","CAMILLO:\r","I may not answer.\r","\r","POLIXENES:\r","A sickness caught of me, and yet I well!\r","I must be answer'd. Dost thou hear, Camillo,\r","I conjure thee, by all the parts of man\r","Which honour does acknowledge, whereof the least\r","Is not this suit of mine, that thou declare\r","What incidency thou dost guess of harm\r","Is creeping toward me; how far off, how near;\r","Which way to be prevented, if to be;\r","If not, how best to bear it.\r","\r","CAMILLO:\r","Sir, I will tell you;\r","Since I am charged in honour and by him\r","That I think honourable: therefore mark my counsel,\r","Which must be even as swiftly follow'd as\r","I mean to utter it, or both yourself and me\r","Cry lost, and so good night!\r","\r","POLIXENES:\r","On, good Camillo.\r","\r","CAMILLO:\r","I am appointed him to murder you.\r","\r","POLIXENES:\r","By whom, Camillo?\r","\r","CAMILLO:\r","By the king.\r","\r","POLIXENES:\r","For what?\r","\r","CAMILLO:\r","He thinks, nay, with all confidence he swears,\r","As he had seen't or been an instrument\r","To vice you to't, that you have touch'd his queen\r","Forbiddenly.\r","\r","POLIXENES:\r","O, then my best blood turn\r","To an infected jelly and my name\r","Be yoked with his that did betray the Best!\r","Turn then my freshest reputation to\r","A savour that may strike the dullest nostril\r","Where I arrive, and my approach be shunn'd,\r","Nay, hated too, worse than the great'st infection\r","That e'er was heard or read!\r","\r","CAMILLO:\r","Swear his thought over\r","By each particular star in heaven and\r","By all their influences, you may as well\r","Forbid the sea for to obey the moon\r","As or by oath remove or counsel shake\r","The fabric of his folly, whose foundation\r","Is piled upon his faith and will continue\r","The standing of his body.\r","\r","POLIXENES:\r","How should this grow?\r","\r","CAMILLO:\r","I know not: but I am sure 'tis safer to\r","Avoid what's grown than question how 'tis born.\r","If therefore you dare trust my honesty,\r","That lies enclosed in this trunk which you\r","Shall bear along impawn'd, away to-night!\r","Your followers I will whisper to the business,\r","And will by twos and threes at several posterns\r","Clear them o' the city. For myself, I'll put\r","My fortunes to your service, which are here\r","By this discovery lost. Be not uncertain;\r","For, by the honour of my parents, I\r","Have utter'd truth: which if you seek to prove,\r","I dare not stand by; nor shall you be safer\r","Than one condemn'd by the king's own mouth, thereon\r","His execution sworn.\r","\r","POLIXENES:\r","I do believe thee:\r","I saw his heart in 's face. Give me thy hand:\r","Be pilot to me and thy places shall\r","Still neighbour mine. My ships are ready and\r","My people did expect my hence departure\r","Two days ago. This jealousy\r","Is for a precious creature: as she's rare,\r","Must it be great, and as his person's mighty,\r","Must it be violent, and as he does conceive\r","He is dishonour'd by a man which ever\r","Profess'd to him, why, his revenges must\r","In that be made more bitter. Fear o'ershades me:\r","Good expedition be my friend, and comfort\r","The gracious queen, part of his theme, but nothing\r","Of his ill-ta'en suspicion! Come, Camillo;\r","I will respect thee as a father if\r","Thou bear'st my life off hence: let us avoid.\r","\r","CAMILLO:\r","It is in mine authority to command\r","The keys of all the posterns: please your highness\r","To take the urgent hour. Come, sir, away.\r","\r","HERMIONE:\r","Take the boy to you: he so troubles me,\r","'Tis past enduring.\r","\r","First Lady:\r","Come, my gracious lord,\r","Shall I be your playfellow?\r","\r","MAMILLIUS:\r","No, I'll none of you.\r","\r","First Lady:\r","Why, my sweet lord?\r","\r","MAMILLIUS:\r","You'll kiss me hard and speak to me as if\r","I were a baby still. I love you better.\r","\r","Second Lady:\r","And why so, my lord?\r","\r","MAMILLIUS:\r","Not for because\r","Your brows are blacker; yet black brows, they say,\r","Become some women best, so that there be not\r","Too much hair there, but in a semicircle\r","Or a half-moon made with a pen.\r","\r","Second Lady:\r","Who taught you this?\r","\r","MAMILLIUS:\r","I learnt it out of women's faces. Pray now\r","What colour are your eyebrows?\r","\r","First Lady:\r","Blue, my lord.\r","\r","MAMILLIUS:\r","Nay, that's a mock: I have seen a lady's nose\r","That has been blue, but not her eyebrows.\r","\r","First Lady:\r","Hark ye;\r","The queen your mother rounds apace: we shall\r","Present our services to a fine new prince\r","One of these days; and then you'ld wanton with us,\r","If we would have you.\r","\r","Second Lady:\r","She is spread of late\r","Into a goodly bulk: good time encounter her!\r","\r","HERMIONE:\r","What wisdom stirs amongst you? Come, sir, now\r","I am for you again: pray you, sit by us,\r","And tell 's a tale.\r","\r","MAMILLIUS:\r","Merry or sad shall't be?\r","\r","HERMIONE:\r","As merry as you will.\r","\r","MAMILLIUS:\r","A sad tale's best for winter: I have one\r","Of sprites and goblins.\r","\r","HERMIONE:\r","Let's have that, good sir.\r","Come on, sit down: come on, and do your best\r","To fright me with your sprites; you're powerful at it.\r","\r","MAMILLIUS:\r","There was a man--\r","\r","HERMIONE:\r","Nay, come, sit down; then on.\r","\r","MAMILLIUS:\r","Dwelt by a churchyard: I will tell it softly;\r","Yond crickets shall not hear it.\r","\r","HERMIONE:\r","Come on, then,\r","And give't me in mine ear.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","Was he met there? his train? Camillo with him?\r","\r","First Lord:\r","Behind the tuft of pines I met them; never\r","Saw I men scour so on their way: I eyed them\r","Even to their ships.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","How blest am I\r","In my just censure, in my true opinion!\r","Alack, for lesser knowledge! how accursed\r","In being so blest! There may be in the cup\r","A spider steep'd, and one may drink, depart,\r","And yet partake no venom, for his knowledge\r","Is not infected: but if one present\r","The abhorr'd ingredient to his eye, make known\r","How he hath drunk, he cracks his gorge, his sides,\r","With violent hefts. I have drunk,\r","and seen the spider.\r","Camillo was his help in this, his pander:\r","There is a plot against my life, my crown;\r","All's true that is mistrusted: that false villain\r","Whom I employ'd was pre-employ'd by him:\r","He has discover'd my design, and I\r","Remain a pinch'd thing; yea, a very trick\r","For them to play at will. How came the posterns\r","So easily open?\r","\r","First Lord:\r","By his great authority;\r","Which often hath no less prevail'd than so\r","On your command.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","I know't too well.\r","Give me the boy: I am glad you did not nurse him:\r","Though he does bear some signs of me, yet you\r","Have too much blood in him.\r","\r","HERMIONE:\r","What is this? sport?\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","Bear the boy hence; he shall not come about her;\r","Away with him! and let her sport herself\r","With that she's big with; for 'tis Polixenes\r","Has made thee swell thus.\r","\r","HERMIONE:\r","But I'ld say he had not,\r","And I'll be sworn you would believe my saying,\r","Howe'er you lean to the nayward.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","You, my lords,\r","Look on her, mark her well; be but about\r","To say 'she is a goodly lady,' and\r","The justice of your bearts will thereto add\r","'Tis pity she's not honest, honourable:'\r","Praise her but for this her without-door form,\r","Which on my faith deserves high speech, and straight\r","The shrug, the hum or ha, these petty brands\r","That calumny doth use--O, I am out--\r","That mercy does, for calumny will sear\r","Virtue itself: these shrugs, these hums and ha's,\r","When you have said 'she's goodly,' come between\r","Ere you can say 'she's honest:' but be 't known,\r","From him that has most cause to grieve it should be,\r","She's an adulteress.\r","\r","HERMIONE:\r","Should a villain say so,\r","The most replenish'd villain in the world,\r","He were as much more villain: you, my lord,\r","Do but mistake.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","You have mistook, my lady,\r","Polixenes for Leontes: O thou thing!\r","Which I'll not call a creature of thy place,\r","Lest barbarism, making me the precedent,\r","Should a like language use to all degrees\r","And mannerly distinguishment leave out\r","Betwixt the prince and beggar: I have said\r","She's an adulteress; I have said with whom:\r","More, she's a traitor and Camillo is\r","A federary with her, and one that knows\r","What she should shame to know herself\r","But with her most vile principal, that she's\r","A bed-swerver, even as bad as those\r","That vulgars give bold'st titles, ay, and privy\r","To this their late escape.\r","\r","HERMIONE:\r","No, by my life.\r","Privy to none of this. How will this grieve you,\r","When you shall come to clearer knowledge, that\r","You thus have publish'd me! Gentle my lord,\r","You scarce can right me throughly then to say\r","You did mistake.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","No; if I mistake\r","In those foundations which I build upon,\r","The centre is not big enough to bear\r","A school-boy's top. Away with her! to prison!\r","He who shall speak for her is afar off guilty\r","But that he speaks.\r","\r","HERMIONE:\r","There's some ill planet reigns:\r","I must be patient till the heavens look\r","With an aspect more favourable. Good my lords,\r","I am not prone to weeping, as our sex\r","Commonly are; the want of which vain dew\r","Perchance shall dry your pities: but I have\r","That honourable grief lodged here which burns\r","Worse than tears drown: beseech you all, my lords,\r","With thoughts so qualified as your charities\r","Shall best instruct you, measure me; and so\r","The king's will be perform'd!\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","Shall I be heard?\r","\r","HERMIONE:\r","Who is't that goes with me? Beseech your highness,\r","My women may be with me; for you see\r","My plight requires it. Do not weep, good fools;\r","There is no cause: when you shall know your mistress\r","Has deserved prison, then abound in tears\r","As I come out: this action I now go on\r","Is for my better grace. Adieu, my lord:\r","I never wish'd to see you sorry; now\r","I trust I shall. My women, come; you have leave.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","Go, do our bidding; hence!\r","\r","First Lord:\r","Beseech your highness, call the queen again.\r","\r","ANTIGONUS:\r","Be certain what you do, sir, lest your justice\r","Prove violence; in the which three great ones suffer,\r","Yourself, your queen, your son.\r","\r","First Lord:\r","For her, my lord,\r","I dare my life lay down and will do't, sir,\r","Please you to accept it, that the queen is spotless\r","I' the eyes of heaven and to you; I mean,\r","In this which you accuse her.\r","\r","ANTIGONUS:\r","If it prove\r","She's otherwise, I'll keep my stables where\r","I lodge my wife; I'll go in couples with her;\r","Than when I feel and see her no farther trust her;\r","For every inch of woman in the world,\r","Ay, every dram of woman's flesh is false, If she be.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","Hold your peaces.\r","\r","First Lord:\r","Good my lord,--\r","\r","ANTIGONUS:\r","It is for you we speak, not for ourselves:\r","You are abused and by some putter-on\r","That will be damn'd for't; would I knew the villain,\r","I would land-damn him. Be she honour-flaw'd,\r","I have three daughters; the eldest is eleven\r","The second and the third, nine, and some five;\r","If this prove true, they'll pay for't:\r","by mine honour,\r","I'll geld 'em all; fourteen they shall not see,\r","To bring false generations: they are co-heirs;\r","And I had rather glib myself than they\r","Should not produce fair issue.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","Cease; no more.\r","You smell this business with a sense as cold\r","As is a dead man's nose: but I do see't and feel't\r","As you feel doing thus; and see withal\r","The instruments that feel.\r","\r","ANTIGONUS:\r","If it be so,\r","We need no grave to bury honesty:\r","There's not a grain of it the face to sweeten\r","Of the whole dungy earth.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","What! lack I credit?\r","\r","First Lord:\r","I had rather you did lack than I, my lord,\r","Upon this ground; and more it would content me\r","To have her honour true than your suspicion,\r","Be blamed for't how you might.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","Why, what need we\r","Commune with you of this, but rather follow\r","Our forceful instigation? Our prerogative\r","Calls not your counsels, but our natural goodness\r","Imparts this; which if you, or stupefied\r","Or seeming so in skill, cannot or will not\r","Relish a truth like us, inform yourselves\r","We need no more of your advice: the matter,\r","The loss, the gain, the ordering on't, is all\r","Properly ours.\r","\r","ANTIGONUS:\r","And I wish, my liege,\r","You had only in your silent judgment tried it,\r","Without more overture.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","How could that be?\r","Either thou art most ignorant by age,\r","Or thou wert born a fool. Camillo's flight,\r","Added to their familiarity,\r","Which was as gross as ever touch'd conjecture,\r","That lack'd sight only, nought for approbation\r","But only seeing, all other circumstances\r","Made up to the deed, doth push on this proceeding:\r","Yet, for a greater confirmation,\r","For in an act of this importance 'twere\r","Most piteous to be wild, I have dispatch'd in post\r","To sacred Delphos, to Apollo's temple,\r","Cleomenes and Dion, whom you know\r","Of stuff'd sufficiency: now from the oracle\r","They will bring all; whose spiritual counsel had,\r","Shall stop or spur me. Have I done well?\r","\r","First Lord:\r","Well done, my lord.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","Though I am satisfied and need no more\r","Than what I know, yet shall the oracle\r","Give rest to the minds of others, such as he\r","Whose ignorant credulity will not\r","Come up to the truth. So have we thought it good\r","From our free person she should be confined,\r","Lest that the treachery of the two fled hence\r","Be left her to perform. Come, follow us;\r","We are to speak in public; for this business\r","Will raise us all.\r","\r","ANTIGONUS:\r","\r","PAULINA:\r","The keeper of the prison, call to him;\r","let him have knowledge who I am.\r","Good lady,\r","No court in Europe is too good for thee;\r","What dost thou then in prison?\r","Now, good sir,\r","You know me, do you not?\r","\r","Gaoler:\r","For a worthy lady\r","And one whom much I honour.\r","\r","PAULINA:\r","Pray you then,\r","Conduct me to the queen.\r","\r","Gaoler:\r","I may not, madam:\r","To the contrary I have express commandment.\r","\r","PAULINA:\r","Here's ado,\r","To lock up honesty and honour from\r","The access of gentle visitors!\r","Is't lawful, pray you,\r","To see her women? any of them? Emilia?\r","\r","Gaoler:\r","So please you, madam,\r","To put apart these your attendants, I\r","Shall bring Emilia forth.\r","\r","PAULINA:\r","I pray now, call her.\r","Withdraw yourselves.\r","\r","Gaoler:\r","And, madam,\r","I must be present at your conference.\r","\r","PAULINA:\r","Well, be't so, prithee.\r","Here's such ado to make no stain a stain\r","As passes colouring.\r","Dear gentlewoman,\r","How fares our gracious lady?\r","\r","EMILIA:\r","As well as one so great and so forlorn\r","May hold together: on her frights and griefs,\r","Which never tender lady hath born greater,\r","She is something before her time deliver'd.\r","\r","PAULINA:\r","A boy?\r","\r","EMILIA:\r","A daughter, and a goodly babe,\r","Lusty and like to live: the queen receives\r","Much comfort in't; says 'My poor prisoner,\r","I am innocent as you.'\r","\r","PAULINA:\r","I dare be sworn\r","These dangerous unsafe lunes i' the king,\r","beshrew them!\r","He must be told on't, and he shall: the office\r","Becomes a woman best; I'll take't upon me:\r","If I prove honey-mouth'd let my tongue blister\r","And never to my red-look'd anger be\r","The trumpet any more. Pray you, Emilia,\r","Commend my best obedience to the queen:\r","If she dares trust me with her little babe,\r","I'll show't the king and undertake to be\r","Her advocate to the loud'st. We do not know\r","How he may soften at the sight o' the child:\r","The silence often of pure innocence\r","Persuades when speaking fails.\r","\r","EMILIA:\r","Most worthy madam,\r","Your honour and your goodness is so evident\r","That your free undertaking cannot miss\r","A thriving issue: there is no lady living\r","So meet for this great errand. Please your ladyship\r","To visit the next room, I'll presently\r","Acquaint the queen of your most noble offer;\r","Who but to-day hammer'd of this design,\r","But durst not tempt a minister of honour,\r","Lest she should be denied.\r","\r","PAULINA:\r","Tell her, Emilia.\r","I'll use that tongue I have: if wit flow from't\r","As boldness from my bosom, let 't not be doubted\r","I shall do good.\r","\r","EMILIA:\r","Now be you blest for it!\r","I'll to the queen: please you,\r","come something nearer.\r","\r","Gaoler:\r","Madam, if't please the queen to send the babe,\r","I know not what I shall incur to pass it,\r","Having no warrant.\r","\r","PAULINA:\r","You need not fear it, sir:\r","This child was prisoner to the womb and is\r","By law and process of great nature thence\r","Freed and enfranchised, not a party to\r","The anger of the king nor guilty of,\r","If any be, the trespass of the queen.\r","\r","Gaoler:\r","I do believe it.\r","\r","PAULINA:\r","Do not you fear: upon mine honour,\r","I will stand betwixt you and danger.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","Nor night nor day no rest: it is but weakness\r","To bear the matter thus; mere weakness. If\r","The cause were not in being,--part o' the cause,\r","She the adulteress; for the harlot king\r","Is quite beyond mine arm, out of the blank\r","And level of my brain, plot-proof; but she\r","I can hook to me: say that she were gone,\r","Given to the fire, a moiety of my rest\r","Might come to me again. Who's there?\r","\r","First Servant:\r","My lord?\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","How does the boy?\r","\r","First Servant:\r","He took good rest to-night;\r","'Tis hoped his sickness is discharged.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","To see his nobleness!\r","Conceiving the dishonour of his mother,\r","He straight declined, droop'd, took it deeply,\r","Fasten'd and fix'd the shame on't in himself,\r","Threw off his spirit, his appetite, his sleep,\r","And downright languish'd. Leave me solely: go,\r","See how he fares.\r","Fie, fie! no thought of him:\r","The thought of my revenges that way\r","Recoil upon me: in himself too mighty,\r","And in his parties, his alliance; let him be\r","Until a time may serve: for present vengeance,\r","Take it on her. Camillo and Polixenes\r","Laugh at me, make their pastime at my sorrow:\r","They should not laugh if I could reach them, nor\r","Shall she within my power.\r","\r","First Lord:\r","You must not enter.\r","\r","PAULINA:\r","Nay, rather, good my lords, be second to me:\r","Fear you his tyrannous passion more, alas,\r","Than the queen's life? a gracious innocent soul,\r","More free than he is jealous.\r","\r","ANTIGONUS:\r","That's enough.\r","\r","Second Servant:\r","Madam, he hath not slept tonight; commanded\r","None should come at him.\r","\r","PAULINA:\r","Not so hot, good sir:\r","I come to bring him sleep. 'Tis such as you,\r","That creep like shadows by him and do sigh\r","At each his needless heavings, such as you\r","Nourish the cause of his awaking: I\r","Do come with words as medicinal as true,\r","Honest as either, to purge him of that humour\r","That presses him from sleep.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","What noise there, ho?\r","\r","PAULINA:\r","No noise, my lord; but needful conference\r","About some gossips for your highness.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","How!\r","Away with that audacious lady! Antigonus,\r","I charged thee that she should not come about me:\r","I knew she would.\r","\r","ANTIGONUS:\r","I told her so, my lord,\r","On your displeasure's peril and on mine,\r","She should not visit you.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","What, canst not rule her?\r","\r","PAULINA:\r","From all dishonesty he can: in this,\r","Unless he take the course that you have done,\r","Commit me for committing honour, trust it,\r","He shall not rule me.\r","\r","ANTIGONUS:\r","La you now, you hear:\r","When she will take the rein I let her run;\r","But she'll not stumble.\r","\r","PAULINA:\r","Good my liege, I come;\r","And, I beseech you, hear me, who profess\r","Myself your loyal servant, your physician,\r","Your most obedient counsellor, yet that dare\r","Less appear so in comforting your evils,\r","Than such as most seem yours: I say, I come\r","From your good queen.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","Good queen!\r","\r","PAULINA:\r","Good queen, my lord,\r","Good queen; I say good queen;\r","And would by combat make her good, so were I\r","A man, the worst about you.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","Force her hence.\r","\r","PAULINA:\r","Let him that makes but trifles of his eyes\r","First hand me: on mine own accord I'll off;\r","But first I'll do my errand. The good queen,\r","For she is good, hath brought you forth a daughter;\r","Here 'tis; commends it to your blessing.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","Out!\r","A mankind witch! Hence with her, out o' door:\r","A most intelligencing bawd!\r","\r","PAULINA:\r","Not so:\r","I am as ignorant in that as you\r","In so entitling me, and no less honest\r","Than you are mad; which is enough, I'll warrant,\r","As this world goes, to pass for honest.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","Traitors!\r","Will you not push her out? Give her the bastard.\r","Thou dotard! thou art woman-tired, unroosted\r","By thy dame Partlet here. Take up the bastard;\r","Take't up, I say; give't to thy crone.\r","\r","PAULINA:\r","For ever\r","Unvenerable be thy hands, if thou\r","Takest up the princess by that forced baseness\r","Which he has put upon't!\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","He dreads his wife.\r","\r","PAULINA:\r","So I would you did; then 'twere past all doubt\r","You'ld call your children yours.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","A nest of traitors!\r","\r","ANTIGONUS:\r","I am none, by this good light.\r","\r","PAULINA:\r","Nor I, nor any\r","But one that's here, and that's himself, for he\r","The sacred honour of himself, his queen's,\r","His hopeful son's, his babe's, betrays to slander,\r","Whose sting is sharper than the sword's;\r","and will not--\r","For, as the case now stands, it is a curse\r","He cannot be compell'd to't--once remove\r","The root of his opinion, which is rotten\r","As ever oak or stone was sound.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","A callat\r","Of boundless tongue, who late hath beat her husband\r","And now baits me! This brat is none of mine;\r","It is the issue of Polixenes:\r","Hence with it, and together with the dam\r","Commit them to the fire!\r","\r","PAULINA:\r","It is yours;\r","And, might we lay the old proverb to your charge,\r","So like you, 'tis the worse. Behold, my lords,\r","Although the print be little, the whole matter\r","And copy of the father, eye, nose, lip,\r","The trick of's frown, his forehead, nay, the valley,\r","The pretty dimples of his chin and cheek,\r","His smiles,\r","The very mould and frame of hand, nail, finger:\r","And thou, good goddess Nature, which hast made it\r","So like to him that got it, if thou hast\r","The ordering of the mind too, 'mongst all colours\r","No yellow in't, lest she suspect, as he does,\r","Her children not her husband's!\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","A gross hag\r","And, lozel, thou art worthy to be hang'd,\r","That wilt not stay her tongue.\r","\r","ANTIGONUS:\r","Hang all the husbands\r","That cannot do that feat, you'll leave yourself\r","Hardly one subject.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","Once more, take her hence.\r","\r","PAULINA:\r","A most unworthy and unnatural lord\r","Can do no more.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","I'll ha' thee burnt.\r","\r","PAULINA:\r","I care not:\r","It is an heretic that makes the fire,\r","Not she which burns in't. I'll not call you tyrant;\r","But this most cruel usage of your queen,\r","Not able to produce more accusation\r","Than your own weak-hinged fancy, something savours\r","Of tyranny and will ignoble make you,\r","Yea, scandalous to the world.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","On your allegiance,\r","Out of the chamber with her! Were I a tyrant,\r","Where were her life? she durst not call me so,\r","If she did know me one. Away with her!\r","\r","PAULINA:\r","I pray you, do not push me; I'll be gone.\r","Look to your babe, my lord; 'tis yours:\r","Jove send her\r","A better guiding spirit! What needs these hands?\r","You, that are thus so tender o'er his follies,\r","Will never do him good, not one of you.\r","So, so: farewell; we are gone.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","Thou, traitor, hast set on thy wife to this.\r","My child? away with't! Even thou, that hast\r","A heart so tender o'er it, take it hence\r","And see it instantly consumed with fire;\r","Even thou and none but thou. Take it up straight:\r","Within this hour bring me word 'tis done,\r","And by good testimony, or I'll seize thy life,\r","With what thou else call'st thine. If thou refuse\r","And wilt encounter with my wrath, say so;\r","The bastard brains with these my proper hands\r","Shall I dash out. Go, take it to the fire;\r","For thou set'st on thy wife.\r","\r","ANTIGONUS:\r","I did not, sir:\r","These lords, my noble fellows, if they please,\r","Can clear me in't.\r","\r","Lords:\r","We can: my royal liege,\r","He is not guilty of her coming hither.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","You're liars all.\r","\r","First Lord:\r","Beseech your highness, give us better credit:\r","We have always truly served you, and beseech you\r","So to esteem of us, and on our knees we beg,\r","As recompense of our dear services\r","Past and to come, that you do change this purpose,\r","Which being so horrible, so bloody, must\r","Lead on to some foul issue: we all kneel.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","I am a feather for each wind that blows:\r","Shall I live on to see this bastard kneel\r","And call me father? better burn it now\r","Than curse it then. But be it; let it live.\r","It shall not neither. You, sir, come you hither;\r","You that have been so tenderly officious\r","With Lady Margery, your midwife there,\r","To save this bastard's life,--for 'tis a bastard,\r","So sure as this beard's grey,\r","--what will you adventure\r","To save this brat's life?\r","\r","ANTIGONUS:\r","Any thing, my lord,\r","That my ability may undergo\r","And nobleness impose: at least thus much:\r","I'll pawn the little blood which I have left\r","To save the innocent: any thing possible.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","It shall be possible. Swear by this sword\r","Thou wilt perform my bidding.\r","\r","ANTIGONUS:\r","I will, my lord.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","Mark and perform it, see'st thou! for the fail\r","Of any point in't shall not only be\r","Death to thyself but to thy lewd-tongued wife,\r","Whom for this time we pardon. We enjoin thee,\r","As thou art liege-man to us, that thou carry\r","This female bastard hence and that thou bear it\r","To some remote and desert place quite out\r","Of our dominions, and that there thou leave it,\r","Without more mercy, to its own protection\r","And favour of the climate. As by strange fortune\r","It came to us, I do in justice charge thee,\r","On thy soul's peril and thy body's torture,\r","That thou commend it strangely to some place\r","Where chance may nurse or end it. Take it up.\r","\r","ANTIGONUS:\r","I swear to do this, though a present death\r","Had been more merciful. Come on, poor babe:\r","Some powerful spirit instruct the kites and ravens\r","To be thy nurses! Wolves and bears, they say\r","Casting their savageness aside have done\r","Like offices of pity. Sir, be prosperous\r","In more than this deed does require! And blessing\r","Against this cruelty fight on thy side,\r","Poor thing, condemn'd to loss!\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","No, I'll not rear\r","Another's issue.\r","\r","Servant:\r","Please your highness, posts\r","From those you sent to the oracle are come\r","An hour since: Cleomenes and Dion,\r","Being well arrived from Delphos, are both landed,\r","Hasting to the court.\r","\r","First Lord:\r","So please you, sir, their speed\r","Hath been beyond account.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","Twenty-three days\r","They have been absent: 'tis good speed; foretells\r","The great Apollo suddenly will have\r","The truth of this appear. Prepare you, lords;\r","Summon a session, that we may arraign\r","Our most disloyal lady, for, as she hath\r","Been publicly accused, so shall she have\r","A just and open trial. While she lives\r","My heart will be a burthen to me. Leave me,\r","And think upon my bidding.\r","\r","CLEOMENES:\r","The climate's delicate, the air most sweet,\r","Fertile the isle, the temple much surpassing\r","The common praise it bears.\r","\r","DION:\r","I shall report,\r","For most it caught me, the celestial habits,\r","Methinks I so should term them, and the reverence\r","Of the grave wearers. O, the sacrifice!\r","How ceremonious, solemn and unearthly\r","It was i' the offering!\r","\r","CLEOMENES:\r","But of all, the burst\r","And the ear-deafening voice o' the oracle,\r","Kin to Jove's thunder, so surprised my sense.\r","That I was nothing.\r","\r","DION:\r","If the event o' the journey\r","Prove as successful to the queen,--O be't so!--\r","As it hath been to us rare, pleasant, speedy,\r","The time is worth the use on't.\r","\r","CLEOMENES:\r","Great Apollo\r","Turn all to the best! These proclamations,\r","So forcing faults upon Hermione,\r","I little like.\r","\r","DION:\r","The violent carriage of it\r","Will clear or end the business: when the oracle,\r","Thus by Apollo's great divine seal'd up,\r","Shall the contents discover, something rare\r","Even then will rush to knowledge. Go: fresh horses!\r","And gracious be the issue!\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","This sessions, to our great grief we pronounce,\r","Even pushes 'gainst our heart: the party tried\r","The daughter of a king, our wife, and one\r","Of us too much beloved. Let us be clear'd\r","Of being tyrannous, since we so openly\r","Proceed in justice, which shall have due course,\r","Even to the guilt or the purgation.\r","Produce the prisoner.\r","\r","Officer:\r","It is his highness' pleasure that the queen\r","Appear in person here in court. Silence!\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","Read the indictment.\r","\r","Officer:\r","\r","HERMIONE:\r","Since what I am to say must be but that\r","Which contradicts my accusation and\r","The testimony on my part no other\r","But what comes from myself, it shall scarce boot me\r","To say 'not guilty:' mine integrity\r","Being counted falsehood, shall, as I express it,\r","Be so received. But thus: if powers divine\r","Behold our human actions, as they do,\r","I doubt not then but innocence shall make\r","False accusation blush and tyranny\r","Tremble at patience. You, my lord, best know,\r","Who least will seem to do so, my past life\r","Hath been as continent, as chaste, as true,\r","As I am now unhappy; which is more\r","Than history can pattern, though devised\r","And play'd to take spectators. For behold me\r","A fellow of the royal bed, which owe\r","A moiety of the throne a great king's daughter,\r","The mother to a hopeful prince, here standing\r","To prate and talk for life and honour 'fore\r","Who please to come and hear. For life, I prize it\r","As I weigh grief, which I would spare: for honour,\r","'Tis a derivative from me to mine,\r","And only that I stand for. I appeal\r","To your own conscience, sir, before Polixenes\r","Came to your court, how I was in your grace,\r","How merited to be so; since he came,\r","With what encounter so uncurrent I\r","Have strain'd to appear thus: if one jot beyond\r","The bound of honour, or in act or will\r","That way inclining, harden'd be the hearts\r","Of all that hear me, and my near'st of kin\r","Cry fie upon my grave!\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","I ne'er heard yet\r","That any of these bolder vices wanted\r","Less impudence to gainsay what they did\r","Than to perform it first.\r","\r","HERMIONE:\r","That's true enough;\r","Through 'tis a saying, sir, not due to me.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","You will not own it.\r","\r","HERMIONE:\r","More than mistress of\r","Which comes to me in name of fault, I must not\r","At all acknowledge. For Polixenes,\r","With whom I am accused, I do confess\r","I loved him as in honour he required,\r","With such a kind of love as might become\r","A lady like me, with a love even such,\r","So and no other, as yourself commanded:\r","Which not to have done I think had been in me\r","Both disobedience and ingratitude\r","To you and toward your friend, whose love had spoke,\r","Even since it could speak, from an infant, freely\r","That it was yours. Now, for conspiracy,\r","I know not how it tastes; though it be dish'd\r","For me to try how: all I know of it\r","Is that Camillo was an honest man;\r","And why he left your court, the gods themselves,\r","Wotting no more than I, are ignorant.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","You knew of his departure, as you know\r","What you have underta'en to do in's absence.\r","\r","HERMIONE:\r","Sir,\r","You speak a language that I understand not:\r","My life stands in the level of your dreams,\r","Which I'll lay down.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","Your actions are my dreams;\r","You had a bastard by Polixenes,\r","And I but dream'd it. As you were past all shame,--\r","Those of your fact are so--so past all truth:\r","Which to deny concerns more than avails; for as\r","Thy brat hath been cast out, like to itself,\r","No father owning it,--which is, indeed,\r","More criminal in thee than it,--so thou\r","Shalt feel our justice, in whose easiest passage\r","Look for no less than death.\r","\r","HERMIONE:\r","Sir, spare your threats:\r","The bug which you would fright me with I seek.\r","To me can life be no commodity:\r","The crown and comfort of my life, your favour,\r","I do give lost; for I do feel it gone,\r","But know not how it went. My second joy\r","And first-fruits of my body, from his presence\r","I am barr'd, like one infectious. My third comfort\r","Starr'd most unluckily, is from my breast,\r","The innocent milk in its most innocent mouth,\r","Haled out to murder: myself on every post\r","Proclaimed a strumpet: with immodest hatred\r","The child-bed privilege denied, which 'longs\r","To women of all fashion; lastly, hurried\r","Here to this place, i' the open air, before\r","I have got strength of limit. Now, my liege,\r","Tell me what blessings I have here alive,\r","That I should fear to die? Therefore proceed.\r","But yet hear this: mistake me not; no life,\r","I prize it not a straw, but for mine honour,\r","Which I would free, if I shall be condemn'd\r","Upon surmises, all proofs sleeping else\r","But what your jealousies awake, I tell you\r","'Tis rigor and not law. Your honours all,\r","I do refer me to the oracle:\r","Apollo be my judge!\r","\r","First Lord:\r","This your request\r","Is altogether just: therefore bring forth,\r","And in Apollos name, his oracle.\r","\r","HERMIONE:\r","The Emperor of Russia was my father:\r","O that he were alive, and here beholding\r","His daughter's trial! that he did but see\r","The flatness of my misery, yet with eyes\r","Of pity, not revenge!\r","\r","Officer:\r","You here shall swear upon this sword of justice,\r","That you, Cleomenes and Dion, have\r","Been both at Delphos, and from thence have brought\r","The seal'd-up oracle, by the hand deliver'd\r","Of great Apollo's priest; and that, since then,\r","You have not dared to break the holy seal\r","Nor read the secrets in't.\r","\r","CLEOMENES:\r","All this we swear.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","Break up the seals and read.\r","\r","Officer:\r","\r","Lords:\r","Now blessed be the great Apollo!\r","\r","HERMIONE:\r","Praised!\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","Hast thou read truth?\r","\r","Officer:\r","Ay, my lord; even so\r","As it is here set down.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","There is no truth at all i' the oracle:\r","The sessions shall proceed: this is mere falsehood.\r","\r","Servant:\r","My lord the king, the king!\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","What is the business?\r","\r","Servant:\r","O sir, I shall be hated to report it!\r","The prince your son, with mere conceit and fear\r","Of the queen's speed, is gone.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","How! gone!\r","\r","Servant:\r","Is dead.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","Apollo's angry; and the heavens themselves\r","Do strike at my injustice.\r","How now there!\r","\r","PAULINA:\r","This news is mortal to the queen: look down\r","And see what death is doing.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","Take her hence:\r","Her heart is but o'ercharged; she will recover:\r","I have too much believed mine own suspicion:\r","Beseech you, tenderly apply to her\r","Some remedies for life.\r","Apollo, pardon\r","My great profaneness 'gainst thine oracle!\r","I'll reconcile me to Polixenes,\r","New woo my queen, recall the good Camillo,\r","Whom I proclaim a man of truth, of mercy;\r","For, being transported by my jealousies\r","To bloody thoughts and to revenge, I chose\r","Camillo for the minister to poison\r","My friend Polixenes: which had been done,\r","But that the good mind of Camillo tardied\r","My swift command, though I with death and with\r","Reward did threaten and encourage him,\r","Not doing 't and being done: he, most humane\r","And fill'd with honour, to my kingly guest\r","Unclasp'd my practise, quit his fortunes here,\r","Which you knew great, and to the hazard\r","Of all encertainties himself commended,\r","No richer than his honour: how he glisters\r","Thorough my rust! and how his pity\r","Does my deeds make the blacker!\r","\r","PAULINA:\r","Woe the while!\r","O, cut my lace, lest my heart, cracking it,\r","Break too.\r","\r","First Lord:\r","What fit is this, good lady?\r","\r","PAULINA:\r","What studied torments, tyrant, hast for me?\r","What wheels? racks? fires? what flaying? boiling?\r","In leads or oils? what old or newer torture\r","Must I receive, whose every word deserves\r","To taste of thy most worst? Thy tyranny\r","Together working with thy jealousies,\r","Fancies too weak for boys, too green and idle\r","For girls of nine, O, think what they have done\r","And then run mad indeed, stark mad! for all\r","Thy by-gone fooleries were but spices of it.\r","That thou betray'dst Polixenes,'twas nothing;\r","That did but show thee, of a fool, inconstant\r","And damnable ingrateful: nor was't much,\r","Thou wouldst have poison'd good Camillo's honour,\r","To have him kill a king: poor trespasses,\r","More monstrous standing by: whereof I reckon\r","The casting forth to crows thy baby-daughter\r","To be or none or little; though a devil\r","Would have shed water out of fire ere done't:\r","Nor is't directly laid to thee, the death\r","Of the young prince, whose honourable thoughts,\r","Thoughts high for one so tender, cleft the heart\r","That could conceive a gross and foolish sire\r","Blemish'd his gracious dam: this is not, no,\r","Laid to thy answer: but the last,--O lords,\r","When I have said, cry 'woe!' the queen, the queen,\r","The sweet'st, dear'st creature's dead,\r","and vengeance for't\r","Not dropp'd down yet.\r","\r","First Lord:\r","The higher powers forbid!\r","\r","PAULINA:\r","I say she's dead; I'll swear't. If word nor oath\r","Prevail not, go and see: if you can bring\r","Tincture or lustre in her lip, her eye,\r","Heat outwardly or breath within, I'll serve you\r","As I would do the gods. But, O thou tyrant!\r","Do not repent these things, for they are heavier\r","Than all thy woes can stir; therefore betake thee\r","To nothing but despair. A thousand knees\r","Ten thousand years together, naked, fasting,\r","Upon a barren mountain and still winter\r","In storm perpetual, could not move the gods\r","To look that way thou wert.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","Go on, go on\r","Thou canst not speak too much; I have deserved\r","All tongues to talk their bitterest.\r","\r","First Lord:\r","Say no more:\r","Howe'er the business goes, you have made fault\r","I' the boldness of your speech.\r","\r","PAULINA:\r","I am sorry for't:\r","All faults I make, when I shall come to know them,\r","I do repent. Alas! I have show'd too much\r","The rashness of a woman: he is touch'd\r","To the noble heart. What's gone and what's past help\r","Should be past grief: do not receive affliction\r","At my petition; I beseech you, rather\r","Let me be punish'd, that have minded you\r","Of what you should forget. Now, good my liege\r","Sir, royal sir, forgive a foolish woman:\r","The love I bore your queen--lo, fool again!--\r","I'll speak of her no more, nor of your children;\r","I'll not remember you of my own lord,\r","Who is lost too: take your patience to you,\r","And I'll say nothing.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","Thou didst speak but well\r","When most the truth; which I receive much better\r","Than to be pitied of thee. Prithee, bring me\r","To the dead bodies of my queen and son:\r","One grave shall be for both: upon them shall\r","The causes of their death appear, unto\r","Our shame perpetual. Once a day I'll visit\r","The chapel where they lie, and tears shed there\r","Shall be my recreation: so long as nature\r","Will bear up with this exercise, so long\r","I daily vow to use it. Come and lead me\r","Unto these sorrows.\r","\r","ANTIGONUS:\r","Thou art perfect then, our ship hath touch'd upon\r","The deserts of Bohemia?\r","\r","Mariner:\r","Ay, my lord: and fear\r","We have landed in ill time: the skies look grimly\r","And threaten present blusters. In my conscience,\r","The heavens with that we have in hand are angry\r","And frown upon 's.\r","\r","ANTIGONUS:\r","Their sacred wills be done! Go, get aboard;\r","Look to thy bark: I'll not be long before\r","I call upon thee.\r","\r","Mariner:\r","Make your best haste, and go not\r","Too far i' the land: 'tis like to be loud weather;\r","Besides, this place is famous for the creatures\r","Of prey that keep upon't.\r","\r","ANTIGONUS:\r","Go thou away:\r","I'll follow instantly.\r","\r","Mariner:\r","I am glad at heart\r","To be so rid o' the business.\r","\r","ANTIGONUS:\r","Come, poor babe:\r","I have heard, but not believed,\r","the spirits o' the dead\r","May walk again: if such thing be, thy mother\r","Appear'd to me last night, for ne'er was dream\r","So like a waking. To me comes a creature,\r","Sometimes her head on one side, some another;\r","I never saw a vessel of like sorrow,\r","So fill'd and so becoming: in pure white robes,\r","Like very sanctity, she did approach\r","My cabin where I lay; thrice bow'd before me,\r","And gasping to begin some speech, her eyes\r","Became two spouts: the fury spent, anon\r","Did this break-from her: 'Good Antigonus,\r","Since fate, against thy better disposition,\r","Hath made thy person for the thrower-out\r","Of my poor babe, according to thine oath,\r","Places remote enough are in Bohemia,\r","There weep and leave it crying; and, for the babe\r","Is counted lost for ever, Perdita,\r","I prithee, call't. For this ungentle business\r","Put on thee by my lord, thou ne'er shalt see\r","Thy wife Paulina more.' And so, with shrieks\r","She melted into air. Affrighted much,\r","I did in time collect myself and thought\r","This was so and no slumber. Dreams are toys:\r","Yet for this once, yea, superstitiously,\r","I will be squared by this. I do believe\r","Hermione hath suffer'd death, and that\r","Apollo would, this being indeed the issue\r","Of King Polixenes, it should here be laid,\r","Either for life or death, upon the earth\r","Of its right father.
