Blossom, speed thee well!\r","There lie, and there thy character: there these;\r","Which may, if fortune please, both breed thee, pretty,\r","And still rest thine. The storm begins; poor wretch,\r","That for thy mother's fault art thus exposed\r","To loss and what may follow! Weep I cannot,\r","But my heart bleeds; and most accursed am I\r","To be by oath enjoin'd to this. Farewell!\r","The day frowns more and more: thou'rt like to have\r","A lullaby too rough: I never saw\r","The heavens so dim by day. A savage clamour!\r","Well may I get aboard! This is the chase:\r","I am gone for ever.\r","\r","Shepherd:\r","I would there were no age between sixteen and\r","three-and-twenty, or that youth would sleep out the\r","rest; for there is nothing in the between but\r","getting wenches with child, wronging the ancientry,\r","stealing, fighting--Hark you now! Would any but\r","these boiled brains of nineteen and two-and-twenty\r","hunt this weather? They have scared away two of my\r","best sheep, which I fear the wolf will sooner find\r","than the master: if any where I have them, 'tis by\r","the seaside, browsing of ivy. Good luck, an't be thy\r","will what have we here! Mercy on 's, a barne a very\r","pretty barne! A boy or a child, I wonder? A\r","pretty one; a very pretty one: sure, some 'scape:\r","though I am not bookish, yet I can read\r","waiting-gentlewoman in the 'scape. This has been\r","some stair-work, some trunk-work, some\r","behind-door-work: they were warmer that got this\r","than the poor thing is here. I'll take it up for\r","pity: yet I'll tarry till my son come; he hallooed\r","but even now. Whoa, ho, hoa!\r","\r","Clown:\r","Hilloa, loa!\r","\r","Shepherd:\r","What, art so near? If thou'lt see a thing to talk\r","on when thou art dead and rotten, come hither. What\r","ailest thou, man?\r","\r","Clown:\r","I have seen two such sights, by sea and by land!\r","but I am not to say it is a sea, for it is now the\r","sky: betwixt the firmament and it you cannot thrust\r","a bodkin's point.\r","\r","Shepherd:\r","Why, boy, how is it?\r","\r","Clown:\r","I would you did but see how it chafes, how it rages,\r","how it takes up the shore! but that's not the\r","point. O, the most piteous cry of the poor souls!\r","sometimes to see 'em, and not to see 'em; now the\r","ship boring the moon with her main-mast, and anon\r","swallowed with yest and froth, as you'ld thrust a\r","cork into a hogshead. And then for the\r","land-service, to see how the bear tore out his\r","shoulder-bone; how he cried to me for help and said\r","his name was Antigonus, a nobleman. But to make an\r","end of the ship, to see how the sea flap-dragoned\r","it: but, first, how the poor souls roared, and the\r","sea mocked them; and how the poor gentleman roared\r","and the bear mocked him, both roaring louder than\r","the sea or weather.\r","\r","Shepherd:\r","Name of mercy, when was this, boy?\r","\r","Clown:\r","Now, now: I have not winked since I saw these\r","sights: the men are not yet cold under water, nor\r","the bear half dined on the gentleman: he's at it\r","now.\r","\r","Shepherd:\r","Would I had been by, to have helped the old man!\r","\r","Clown:\r","I would you had been by the ship side, to have\r","helped her: there your charity would have lacked footing.\r","\r","Shepherd:\r","Heavy matters! heavy matters! but look thee here,\r","boy. Now bless thyself: thou mettest with things\r","dying, I with things newborn. Here's a sight for\r","thee; look thee, a bearing-cloth for a squire's\r","child! look thee here; take up, take up, boy;\r","open't. So, let's see: it was told me I should be\r","rich by the fairies. This is some changeling:\r","open't. What's within, boy?\r","\r","Clown:\r","You're a made old man: if the sins of your youth\r","are forgiven you, you're well to live. Gold! all gold!\r","\r","Shepherd:\r","This is fairy gold, boy, and 'twill prove so: up\r","with't, keep it close: home, home, the next way.\r","We are lucky, boy; and to be so still requires\r","nothing but secrecy. Let my sheep go: come, good\r","boy, the next way home.\r","\r","Clown:\r","Go you the next way with your findings. I'll go see\r","if the bear be gone from the gentleman and how much\r","he hath eaten: they are never curst but when they\r","are hungry: if there be any of him left, I'll bury\r","it.\r","\r","Shepherd:\r","That's a good deed. If thou mayest discern by that\r","which is left of him what he is, fetch me to the\r","sight of him.\r","\r","Clown:\r","Marry, will I; and you shall help to put him i' the ground.\r","\r","Shepherd:\r","'Tis a lucky day, boy, and we'll do good deeds on't.\r","\r","Time:\r","I, that please some, try all, both joy and terror\r","Of good and bad, that makes and unfolds error,\r","Now take upon me, in the name of Time,\r","To use my wings. Impute it not a crime\r","To me or my swift passage, that I slide\r","O'er sixteen years and leave the growth untried\r","Of that wide gap, since it is in my power\r","To o'erthrow law and in one self-born hour\r","To plant and o'erwhelm custom. Let me pass\r","The same I am, ere ancient'st order was\r","Or what is now received: I witness to\r","The times that brought them in; so shall I do\r","To the freshest things now reigning and make stale\r","The glistering of this present, as my tale\r","Now seems to it. Your patience this allowing,\r","I turn my glass and give my scene such growing\r","As you had slept between: Leontes leaving,\r","The effects of his fond jealousies so grieving\r","That he shuts up himself, imagine me,\r","Gentle spectators, that I now may be\r","In fair Bohemia, and remember well,\r","I mentioned a son o' the king's, which Florizel\r","I now name to you; and with speed so pace\r","To speak of Perdita, now grown in grace\r","Equal with wondering: what of her ensues\r","I list not prophecy; but let Time's news\r","Be known when 'tis brought forth.\r","A shepherd's daughter,\r","And what to her adheres, which follows after,\r","Is the argument of Time. Of this allow,\r","If ever you have spent time worse ere now;\r","If never, yet that Time himself doth say\r","He wishes earnestly you never may.\r","\r","POLIXENES:\r","I pray thee, good Camillo, be no more importunate:\r","'tis a sickness denying thee any thing; a death to\r","grant this.\r","\r","CAMILLO:\r","It is fifteen years since I saw my country: though\r","I have for the most part been aired abroad, I\r","desire to lay my bones there. Besides, the penitent\r","king, my master, hath sent for me; to whose feeling\r","sorrows I might be some allay, or I o'erween to\r","think so, which is another spur to my departure.\r","\r","POLIXENES:\r","As thou lovest me, Camillo, wipe not out the rest of\r","thy services by leaving me now: the need I have of\r","thee thine own goodness hath made; better not to\r","have had thee than thus to want thee: thou, having\r","made me businesses which none without thee can\r","sufficiently manage, must either stay to execute\r","them thyself or take away with thee the very\r","services thou hast done; which if I have not enough\r","considered, as too much I cannot, to be more\r","thankful to thee shall be my study, and my profit\r","therein the heaping friendships. Of that fatal\r","country, Sicilia, prithee speak no more; whose very\r","naming punishes me with the remembrance of that\r","penitent, as thou callest him, and reconciled king,\r","my brother; whose loss of his most precious queen\r","and children are even now to be afresh lamented.\r","Say to me, when sawest thou the Prince Florizel, my\r","son? Kings are no less unhappy, their issue not\r","being gracious, than they are in losing them when\r","they have approved their virtues.\r","\r","CAMILLO:\r","Sir, it is three days since I saw the prince. What\r","his happier affairs may be, are to me unknown: but I\r","have missingly noted, he is of late much retired\r","from court and is less frequent to his princely\r","exercises than formerly he hath appeared.\r","\r","POLIXENES:\r","I have considered so much, Camillo, and with some\r","care; so far that I have eyes under my service which\r","look upon his removedness; from whom I have this\r","intelligence, that he is seldom from the house of a\r","most homely shepherd; a man, they say, that from\r","very nothing, and beyond the imagination of his\r","neighbours, is grown into an unspeakable estate.\r","\r","CAMILLO:\r","I have heard, sir, of such a man, who hath a\r","daughter of most rare note: the report of her is\r","extended more than can be thought to begin from such a cottage.\r","\r","POLIXENES:\r","That's likewise part of my intelligence; but, I\r","fear, the angle that plucks our son thither. Thou\r","shalt accompany us to the place; where we will, not\r","appearing what we are, have some question with the\r","shepherd; from whose simplicity I think it not\r","uneasy to get the cause of my son's resort thither.\r","Prithee, be my present partner in this business, and\r","lay aside the thoughts of Sicilia.\r","\r","CAMILLO:\r","I willingly obey your command.\r","\r","POLIXENES:\r","My best Camillo! We must disguise ourselves.\r","\r","AUTOLYCUS:\r","When daffodils begin to peer,\r","With heigh! the doxy over the dale,\r","Why, then comes in the sweet o' the year;\r","For the red blood reigns in the winter's pale.\r","The white sheet bleaching on the hedge,\r","With heigh! the sweet birds, O, how they sing!\r","Doth set my pugging tooth on edge;\r","For a quart of ale is a dish for a king.\r","The lark, that tirra-lyra chants,\r","With heigh! with heigh! the thrush and the jay,\r","Are summer songs for me and my aunts,\r","While we lie tumbling in the hay.\r","I have served Prince Florizel and in my time\r","wore three-pile; but now I am out of service:\r","But shall I go mourn for that, my dear?\r","The pale moon shines by night:\r","And when I wander here and there,\r","I then do most go right.\r","If tinkers may have leave to live,\r","And bear the sow-skin budget,\r","Then my account I well may, give,\r","And in the stocks avouch it.\r","My traffic is sheets; when the kite builds, look to\r","lesser linen. My father named me Autolycus; who\r","being, as I am, littered under Mercury, was likewise\r","a snapper-up of unconsidered trifles. With die and\r","drab I purchased this caparison, and my revenue is\r","the silly cheat. Gallows and knock are too powerful\r","on the highway: beating and hanging are terrors to\r","me: for the life to come, I sleep out the thought\r","of it. A prize! a prize!\r","\r","Clown:\r","Let me see: every 'leven wether tods; every tod\r","yields pound and odd shilling; fifteen hundred\r","shorn. what comes the wool to?\r","\r","AUTOLYCUS:\r","\r","Clown:\r","I cannot do't without counters. Let me see; what am\r","I to buy for our sheep-shearing feast? Three pound\r","of sugar, five pound of currants, rice,--what will\r","this sister of mine do with rice? But my father\r","hath made her mistress of the feast, and she lays it\r","on. She hath made me four and twenty nose-gays for\r","the shearers, three-man-song-men all, and very good\r","ones; but they are most of them means and bases; but\r","one puritan amongst them, and he sings psalms to\r","horn-pipes. I must have saffron to colour the warden\r","pies; mace; dates?--none, that's out of my note;\r","nutmegs, seven; a race or two of ginger, but that I\r","may beg; four pound of prunes, and as many of\r","raisins o' the sun.\r","\r","AUTOLYCUS:\r","O that ever I was born!\r","\r","Clown:\r","I' the name of me--\r","\r","AUTOLYCUS:\r","O, help me, help me! pluck but off these rags; and\r","then, death, death!\r","\r","Clown:\r","Alack, poor soul! thou hast need of more rags to lay\r","on thee, rather than have these off.\r","\r","AUTOLYCUS:\r","O sir, the loathsomeness of them offends me more\r","than the stripes I have received, which are mighty\r","ones and millions.\r","\r","Clown:\r","Alas, poor man! a million of beating may come to a\r","great matter.\r","\r","AUTOLYCUS:\r","I am robbed, sir, and beaten; my money and apparel\r","ta'en from me, and these detestable things put upon\r","me.\r","\r","Clown:\r","What, by a horseman, or a footman?\r","\r","AUTOLYCUS:\r","A footman, sweet sir, a footman.\r","\r","Clown:\r","Indeed, he should be a footman by the garments he\r","has left with thee: if this be a horseman's coat,\r","it hath seen very hot service. Lend me thy hand,\r","I'll help thee: come, lend me thy hand.\r","\r","AUTOLYCUS:\r","O, good sir, tenderly, O!\r","\r","Clown:\r","Alas, poor soul!\r","\r","AUTOLYCUS:\r","O, good sir, softly, good sir! I fear, sir, my\r","shoulder-blade is out.\r","\r","Clown:\r","How now! canst stand?\r","\r","AUTOLYCUS:\r","\r","Clown:\r","Dost lack any money? I have a little money for thee.\r","\r","AUTOLYCUS:\r","No, good sweet sir; no, I beseech you, sir: I have\r","a kinsman not past three quarters of a mile hence,\r","unto whom I was going; I shall there have money, or\r","any thing I want: offer me no money, I pray you;\r","that kills my heart.\r","\r","Clown:\r","What manner of fellow was he that robbed you?\r","\r","AUTOLYCUS:\r","A fellow, sir, that I have known to go about with\r","troll-my-dames; I knew him once a servant of the\r","prince: I cannot tell, good sir, for which of his\r","virtues it was, but he was certainly whipped out of the court.\r","\r","Clown:\r","His vices, you would say; there's no virtue whipped\r","out of the court: they cherish it to make it stay\r","there; and yet it will no more but abide.\r","\r","AUTOLYCUS:\r","Vices, I would say, sir. I know this man well: he\r","hath been since an ape-bearer; then a\r","process-server, a bailiff; then he compassed a\r","motion of the Prodigal Son, and married a tinker's\r","wife within a mile where my land and living lies;\r","and, having flown over many knavish professions, he\r","settled only in rogue: some call him Autolycus.\r","\r","Clown:\r","Out upon him! prig, for my life, prig: he haunts\r","wakes, fairs and bear-baitings.\r","\r","AUTOLYCUS:\r","Very true, sir; he, sir, he; that's the rogue that\r","put me into this apparel.\r","\r","Clown:\r","Not a more cowardly rogue in all Bohemia: if you had\r","but looked big and spit at him, he'ld have run.\r","\r","AUTOLYCUS:\r","I must confess to you, sir, I am no fighter: I am\r","false of heart that way; and that he knew, I warrant\r","him.\r","\r","Clown:\r","How do you now?\r","\r","AUTOLYCUS:\r","Sweet sir, much better than I was; I can stand and\r","walk: I will even take my leave of you, and pace\r","softly towards my kinsman's.\r","\r","Clown:\r","Shall I bring thee on the way?\r","\r","AUTOLYCUS:\r","No, good-faced sir; no, sweet sir.\r","\r","Clown:\r","Then fare thee well: I must go buy spices for our\r","sheep-shearing.\r","\r","AUTOLYCUS:\r","Prosper you, sweet sir!\r","Your purse is not hot enough to purchase your spice.\r","I'll be with you at your sheep-shearing too: if I\r","make not this cheat bring out another and the\r","shearers prove sheep, let me be unrolled and my name\r","put in the book of virtue!\r","Jog on, jog on, the foot-path way,\r","And merrily hent the stile-a:\r","A merry heart goes all the day,\r","Your sad tires in a mile-a.\r","\r","FLORIZEL:\r","These your unusual weeds to each part of you\r","Do give a life: no shepherdess, but Flora\r","Peering in April's front. This your sheep-shearing\r","Is as a meeting of the petty gods,\r","And you the queen on't.\r","\r","PERDITA:\r","Sir, my gracious lord,\r","To chide at your extremes it not becomes me:\r","O, pardon, that I name them! Your high self,\r","The gracious mark o' the land, you have obscured\r","With a swain's wearing, and me, poor lowly maid,\r","Most goddess-like prank'd up: but that our feasts\r","In every mess have folly and the feeders\r","Digest it with a custom, I should blush\r","To see you so attired, sworn, I think,\r","To show myself a glass.\r","\r","FLORIZEL:\r","I bless the time\r","When my good falcon made her flight across\r","Thy father's ground.\r","\r","PERDITA:\r","Now Jove afford you cause!\r","To me the difference forges dread; your greatness\r","Hath not been used to fear. Even now I tremble\r","To think your father, by some accident,\r","Should pass this way as you did: O, the Fates!\r","How would he look, to see his work so noble\r","Vilely bound up? What would he say? Or how\r","Should I, in these my borrow'd flaunts, behold\r","The sternness of his presence?\r","\r","FLORIZEL:\r","Apprehend\r","Nothing but jollity. The gods themselves,\r","Humbling their deities to love, have taken\r","The shapes of beasts upon them: Jupiter\r","Became a bull, and bellow'd; the green Neptune\r","A ram, and bleated; and the fire-robed god,\r","Golden Apollo, a poor humble swain,\r","As I seem now. Their transformations\r","Were never for a piece of beauty rarer,\r","Nor in a way so chaste, since my desires\r","Run not before mine honour, nor my lusts\r","Burn hotter than my faith.\r","\r","PERDITA:\r","O, but, sir,\r","Your resolution cannot hold, when 'tis\r","Opposed, as it must be, by the power of the king:\r","One of these two must be necessities,\r","Which then will speak, that you must\r","change this purpose,\r","Or I my life.\r","\r","FLORIZEL:\r","Thou dearest Perdita,\r","With these forced thoughts, I prithee, darken not\r","The mirth o' the feast. Or I'll be thine, my fair,\r","Or not my father's. For I cannot be\r","Mine own, nor any thing to any, if\r","I be not thine. To this I am most constant,\r","Though destiny say no. Be merry, gentle;\r","Strangle such thoughts as these with any thing\r","That you behold the while. Your guests are coming:\r","Lift up your countenance, as it were the day\r","Of celebration of that nuptial which\r","We two have sworn shall come.\r","\r","PERDITA:\r","O lady Fortune,\r","Stand you auspicious!\r","\r","FLORIZEL:\r","See, your guests approach:\r","Address yourself to entertain them sprightly,\r","And let's be red with mirth.\r","\r","Shepherd:\r","Fie, daughter! when my old wife lived, upon\r","This day she was both pantler, butler, cook,\r","Both dame and servant; welcomed all, served all;\r","Would sing her song and dance her turn; now here,\r","At upper end o' the table, now i' the middle;\r","On his shoulder, and his; her face o' fire\r","With labour and the thing she took to quench it,\r","She would to each one sip. You are retired,\r","As if you were a feasted one and not\r","The hostess of the meeting: pray you, bid\r","These unknown friends to's welcome; for it is\r","A way to make us better friends, more known.\r","Come, quench your blushes and present yourself\r","That which you are, mistress o' the feast: come on,\r","And bid us welcome to your sheep-shearing,\r","As your good flock shall prosper.\r","\r","PERDITA:\r","\r","POLIXENES:\r","Shepherdess,\r","A fair one are you--well you fit our ages\r","With flowers of winter.\r","\r","PERDITA:\r","Sir, the year growing ancient,\r","Not yet on summer's death, nor on the birth\r","Of trembling winter, the fairest\r","flowers o' the season\r","Are our carnations and streak'd gillyvors,\r","Which some call nature's bastards: of that kind\r","Our rustic garden's barren; and I care not\r","To get slips of them.\r","\r","POLIXENES:\r","Wherefore, gentle maiden,\r","Do you neglect them?\r","\r","PERDITA:\r","For I have heard it said\r","There is an art which in their piedness shares\r","With great creating nature.\r","\r","POLIXENES:\r","Say there be;\r","Yet nature is made better by no mean\r","But nature makes that mean: so, over that art\r","Which you say adds to nature, is an art\r","That nature makes. You see, sweet maid, we marry\r","A gentler scion to the wildest stock,\r","And make conceive a bark of baser kind\r","By bud of nobler race: this is an art\r","Which does mend nature, change it rather, but\r","The art itself is nature.\r","\r","PERDITA:\r","So it is.\r","\r","POLIXENES:\r","Then make your garden rich in gillyvors,\r","And do not call them bastards.\r","\r","PERDITA:\r","I'll not put\r","The dibble in earth to set one slip of them;\r","No more than were I painted I would wish\r","This youth should say 'twere well and only therefore\r","Desire to breed by me. Here's flowers for you;\r","Hot lavender, mints, savoury, marjoram;\r","The marigold, that goes to bed wi' the sun\r","And with him rises weeping: these are flowers\r","Of middle summer, and I think they are given\r","To men of middle age. You're very welcome.\r","\r","CAMILLO:\r","I should leave grazing, were I of your flock,\r","And only live by gazing.\r","\r","PERDITA:\r","Out, alas!\r","You'd be so lean, that blasts of January\r","Would blow you through and through.\r","Now, my fair'st friend,\r","I would I had some flowers o' the spring that might\r","Become your time of day; and yours, and yours,\r","That wear upon your virgin branches yet\r","Your maidenheads growing: O Proserpina,\r","For the flowers now, that frighted thou let'st fall\r","From Dis's waggon! daffodils,\r","That come before the swallow dares, and take\r","The winds of March with beauty; violets dim,\r","But sweeter than the lids of Juno's eyes\r","Or Cytherea's breath; pale primroses\r","That die unmarried, ere they can behold\r","Bight Phoebus in his strength--a malady\r","Most incident to maids; bold oxlips and\r","The crown imperial; lilies of all kinds,\r","The flower-de-luce being one! O, these I lack,\r","To make you garlands of, and my sweet friend,\r","To strew him o'er and o'er!\r","\r","FLORIZEL:\r","What, like a corse?\r","\r","PERDITA:\r","No, like a bank for love to lie and play on;\r","Not like a corse; or if, not to be buried,\r","But quick and in mine arms. Come, take your flowers:\r","Methinks I play as I have seen them do\r","In Whitsun pastorals: sure this robe of mine\r","Does change my disposition.\r","\r","FLORIZEL:\r","What you do\r","Still betters what is done. When you speak, sweet.\r","I'ld have you do it ever: when you sing,\r","I'ld have you buy and sell so, so give alms,\r","Pray so; and, for the ordering your affairs,\r","To sing them too: when you do dance, I wish you\r","A wave o' the sea, that you might ever do\r","Nothing but that; move still, still so,\r","And own no other function: each your doing,\r","So singular in each particular,\r","Crowns what you are doing in the present deed,\r","That all your acts are queens.\r","\r","PERDITA:\r","O Doricles,\r","Your praises are too large: but that your youth,\r","And the true blood which peepeth fairly through't,\r","Do plainly give you out an unstain'd shepherd,\r","With wisdom I might fear, my Doricles,\r","You woo'd me the false way.\r","\r","FLORIZEL:\r","I think you have\r","As little skill to fear as I have purpose\r","To put you to't. But come; our dance, I pray:\r","Your hand, my Perdita: so turtles pair,\r","That never mean to part.\r","\r","PERDITA:\r","I'll swear for 'em.\r","\r","POLIXENES:\r","This is the prettiest low-born lass that ever\r","Ran on the green-sward: nothing she does or seems\r","But smacks of something greater than herself,\r","Too noble for this place.\r","\r","CAMILLO:\r","He tells her something\r","That makes her blood look out: good sooth, she is\r","The queen of curds and cream.\r","\r","Clown:\r","Come on, strike up!\r","\r","DORCAS:\r","Mopsa must be your mistress: marry, garlic,\r","To mend her kissing with!\r","\r","MOPSA:\r","Now, in good time!\r","\r","Clown:\r","Not a word, a word; we stand upon our manners.\r","Come, strike up!\r","\r","POLIXENES:\r","Pray, good shepherd, what fair swain is this\r","Which dances with your daughter?\r","\r","Shepherd:\r","They call him Doricles; and boasts himself\r","To have a worthy feeding: but I have it\r","Upon his own report and I believe it;\r","He looks like sooth. He says he loves my daughter:\r","I think so too; for never gazed the moon\r","Upon the water as he'll stand and read\r","As 'twere my daughter's eyes: and, to be plain.\r","I think there is not half a kiss to choose\r","Who loves another best.\r","\r","POLIXENES:\r","She dances featly.\r","\r","Shepherd:\r","So she does any thing; though I report it,\r","That should be silent: if young Doricles\r","Do light upon her, she shall bring him that\r","Which he not dreams of.\r","\r","Servant:\r","O master, if you did but hear the pedlar at the\r","door, you would never dance again after a tabour and\r","pipe; no, the bagpipe could not move you: he sings\r","several tunes faster than you'll tell money; he\r","utters them as he had eaten ballads and all men's\r","ears grew to his tunes.\r","\r","Clown:\r","He could never come better; he shall come in. I\r","love a ballad but even too well, if it be doleful\r","matter merrily set down, or a very pleasant thing\r","indeed and sung lamentably.\r","\r","Servant:\r","He hath songs for man or woman, of all sizes; no\r","milliner can so fit his customers with gloves: he\r","has the prettiest love-songs for maids; so without\r","bawdry, which is strange; with such delicate\r","burthens of dildos and fadings, 'jump her and thump\r","her;' and where some stretch-mouthed rascal would,\r","as it were, mean mischief and break a foul gap into\r","the matter, he makes the maid to answer 'Whoop, do me\r","no harm, good man;' puts him off, slights him, with\r","'Whoop, do me no harm, good man.'\r","\r","POLIXENES:\r","This is a brave fellow.\r","\r","Clown:\r","Believe me, thou talkest of an admirable conceited\r","fellow. Has he any unbraided wares?\r","\r","Servant:\r","He hath ribbons of an the colours i' the rainbow;\r","points more than all the lawyers in Bohemia can\r","learnedly handle, though they come to him by the\r","gross: inkles, caddisses, cambrics, lawns: why, he\r","sings 'em over as they were gods or goddesses; you\r","would think a smock were a she-angel, he so chants\r","to the sleeve-hand and the work about the square on't.\r","\r","Clown:\r","Prithee bring him in; and let him approach singing.\r","\r","PERDITA:\r","Forewarn him that he use no scurrilous words in 's tunes.\r","\r","Clown:\r","You have of these pedlars, that have more in them\r","than you'ld think, sister.\r","\r","PERDITA:\r","Ay, good brother, or go about to think.\r","\r","AUTOLYCUS:\r","Lawn as white as driven snow;\r","Cyprus black as e'er was crow;\r","Gloves as sweet as damask roses;\r","Masks for faces and for noses;\r","Bugle bracelet, necklace amber,\r","Perfume for a lady's chamber;\r","Golden quoifs and stomachers,\r","For my lads to give their dears:\r","Pins and poking-sticks of steel,\r","What maids lack from head to heel:\r","Come buy of me, come; come buy, come buy;\r","Buy lads, or else your lasses cry: Come buy.\r","\r","Clown:\r","If I were not in love with Mopsa, thou shouldst take\r","no money of me; but being enthralled as I am, it\r","will also be the bondage of certain ribbons and gloves.\r","\r","MOPSA:\r","I was promised them against the feast; but they come\r","not too late now.\r","\r","DORCAS:\r","He hath promised you more than that, or there be liars.\r","\r","MOPSA:\r","He hath paid you all he promised you; may be, he has\r","paid you more, which will shame you to give him again.\r","\r","Clown:\r","Is there no manners left among maids? will they\r","wear their plackets where they should bear their\r","faces? Is there not milking-time, when you are\r","going to bed, or kiln-hole, to whistle off these\r","secrets, but you must be tittle-tattling before all\r","our guests? 'tis well they are whispering: clamour\r","your tongues, and not a word more.\r","\r","MOPSA:\r","I have done. Come, you promised me a tawdry-lace\r","and a pair of sweet gloves.\r","\r","Clown:\r","Have I not told thee how I was cozened by the way\r","and lost all my money?\r","\r","AUTOLYCUS:\r","And indeed, sir, there are cozeners abroad;\r","therefore it behoves men to be wary.\r","\r","Clown:\r","Fear not thou, man, thou shalt lose nothing here.\r","\r","AUTOLYCUS:\r","I hope so, sir; for I have about me many parcels of charge.\r","\r","Clown:\r","What hast here? ballads?\r","\r","MOPSA:\r","Pray now, buy some: I love a ballad in print o'\r","life, for then we are sure they are true.\r","\r","AUTOLYCUS:\r","Here's one to a very doleful tune, how a usurer's\r","wife was brought to bed of twenty money-bags at a\r","burthen and how she longed to eat adders' heads and\r","toads carbonadoed.\r","\r","MOPSA:\r","Is it true, think you?\r","\r","AUTOLYCUS:\r","Very true, and but a month old.\r","\r","DORCAS:\r","Bless me from marrying a usurer!\r","\r","AUTOLYCUS:\r","Here's the midwife's name to't, one Mistress\r","Tale-porter, and five or six honest wives that were\r","present. Why should I carry lies abroad?\r","\r","MOPSA:\r","Pray you now, buy it.\r","\r","Clown:\r","Come on, lay it by: and let's first see moe\r","ballads; we'll buy the other things anon.\r","\r","AUTOLYCUS:\r","Here's another ballad of a fish, that appeared upon\r","the coast on Wednesday the four-score of April,\r","forty thousand fathom above water, and sung this\r","ballad against the hard hearts of maids: it was\r","thought she was a woman and was turned into a cold\r","fish for she would not exchange flesh with one that\r","loved her: the ballad is very pitiful and as true.\r","\r","DORCAS:\r","Is it true too, think you?\r","\r","AUTOLYCUS:\r","Five justices' hands at it, and witnesses more than\r","my pack will hold.\r","\r","Clown:\r","Lay it by too: another.\r","\r","AUTOLYCUS:\r","This is a merry ballad, but a very pretty one.\r","\r","MOPSA:\r","Let's have some merry ones.\r","\r","AUTOLYCUS:\r","Why, this is a passing merry one and goes to\r","the tune of 'Two maids wooing a man:' there's\r","scarce a maid westward but she sings it; 'tis in\r","request, I can tell you.\r","\r","MOPSA:\r","We can both sing it: if thou'lt bear a part, thou\r","shalt hear; 'tis in three parts.\r","\r","DORCAS:\r","We had the tune on't a month ago.\r","\r","AUTOLYCUS:\r","I can bear my part; you must know 'tis my\r","occupation; have at it with you.\r","\r","AUTOLYCUS:\r","Get you hence, for I must go\r","Where it fits not you to know.\r","\r","DORCAS:\r","Whither?\r","\r","MOPSA:\r","O, whither?\r","\r","DORCAS:\r","Whither?\r","\r","MOPSA:\r","It becomes thy oath full well,\r","Thou to me thy secrets tell.\r","\r","DORCAS:\r","Me too, let me go thither.\r","\r","MOPSA:\r","Or thou goest to the orange or mill.\r","\r","DORCAS:\r","If to either, thou dost ill.\r","\r","AUTOLYCUS:\r","Neither.\r","\r","DORCAS:\r","What, neither?\r","\r","AUTOLYCUS:\r","Neither.\r","\r","DORCAS:\r","Thou hast sworn my love to be.\r","\r","MOPSA:\r","Thou hast sworn it more to me:\r","Then whither goest? say, whither?\r","\r","Clown:\r","We'll have this song out anon by ourselves: my\r","father and the gentlemen are in sad talk, and we'll\r","not trouble them. Come, bring away thy pack after\r","me. Wenches, I'll buy for you both. Pedlar, let's\r","have the first choice. Follow me, girls.\r","\r","AUTOLYCUS:\r","And you shall pay well for 'em.\r","Will you buy any tape,\r","Or lace for your cape,\r","My dainty duck, my dear-a?\r","Any silk, any thread,\r","Any toys for your head,\r","Of the new'st and finest, finest wear-a?\r","Come to the pedlar;\r","Money's a medler.\r","That doth utter all men's ware-a.\r","\r","Servant:\r","Master, there is three carters, three shepherds,\r","three neat-herds, three swine-herds, that have made\r","themselves all men of hair, they call themselves\r","Saltiers, and they have a dance which the wenches\r","say is a gallimaufry of gambols, because they are\r","not in't; but they themselves are o' the mind, if it\r","be not too rough for some that know little but\r","bowling, it will please plentifully.\r","\r","Shepherd:\r","Away! we'll none on 't: here has been too much\r","homely foolery already. I know, sir, we weary you.\r","\r","POLIXENES:\r","You weary those that refresh us: pray, let's see\r","these four threes of herdsmen.\r","\r","Servant:\r","One three of them, by their own report, sir, hath\r","danced before the king; and not the worst of the\r","three but jumps twelve foot and a half by the squier.\r","\r","Shepherd:\r","Leave your prating: since these good men are\r","pleased, let them come in; but quickly now.\r","\r","Servant:\r","Why, they stay at door, sir.\r","\r","POLIXENES:\r","O, father, you'll know more of that hereafter.\r","Is it not too far gone? 'Tis time to part them.\r","He's simple and tells much.\r","How now, fair shepherd!\r","Your heart is full of something that does take\r","Your mind from feasting. Sooth, when I was young\r","And handed love as you do, I was wont\r","To load my she with knacks: I would have ransack'd\r","The pedlar's silken treasury and have pour'd it\r","To her acceptance; you have let him go\r","And nothing marted with him. If your lass\r","Interpretation should abuse and call this\r","Your lack of love or bounty, you were straited\r","For a reply, at least if you make a care\r","Of happy holding her.\r","\r","FLORIZEL:\r","Old sir, I know\r","She prizes not such trifles as these are:\r","The gifts she looks from me are pack'd and lock'd\r","Up in my heart; which I have given already,\r","But not deliver'd. O, hear me breathe my life\r","Before this ancient sir, who, it should seem,\r","Hath sometime loved! I take thy hand, this hand,\r","As soft as dove's down and as white as it,\r","Or Ethiopian's tooth, or the fann'd\r","snow that's bolted\r","By the northern blasts twice o'er.\r","\r","POLIXENES:\r","What follows this?\r","How prettily the young swain seems to wash\r","The hand was fair before! I have put you out:\r","But to your protestation; let me hear\r","What you profess.\r","\r","FLORIZEL:\r","Do, and be witness to 't.\r","\r","POLIXENES:\r","And this my neighbour too?\r","\r","FLORIZEL:\r","And he, and more\r","Than he, and men, the earth, the heavens, and all:\r","That, were I crown'd the most imperial monarch,\r","Thereof most worthy, were I the fairest youth\r","That ever made eye swerve, had force and knowledge\r","More than was ever man's, I would not prize them\r","Without her love; for her employ them all;\r","Commend them and condemn them to her service\r","Or to their own perdition.\r","\r","POLIXENES:\r","Fairly offer'd.\r","\r","CAMILLO:\r","This shows a sound affection.\r","\r","Shepherd:\r","But, my daughter,\r","Say you the like to him?\r","\r","PERDITA:\r","I cannot speak\r","So well, nothing so well; no, nor mean better:\r","By the pattern of mine own thoughts I cut out\r","The purity of his.\r","\r","Shepherd:\r","Take hands, a bargain!\r","And, friends unknown, you shall bear witness to 't:\r","I give my daughter to him, and will make\r","Her portion equal his.\r","\r","FLORIZEL:\r","O, that must be\r","I' the virtue of your daughter: one being dead,\r","I shall have more than you can dream of yet;\r","Enough then for your wonder. But, come on,\r","Contract us 'fore these witnesses.\r","\r","Shepherd:\r","Come, your hand;\r","And, daughter, yours.\r","\r","POLIXENES:\r","Soft, swain, awhile, beseech you;\r","Have you a father?\r","\r","FLORIZEL:\r","I have: but what of him?\r","\r","POLIXENES:\r","Knows he of this?\r","\r","FLORIZEL:\r","He neither does nor shall.\r","\r","POLIXENES:\r","Methinks a father\r","Is at the nuptial of his son a guest\r","That best becomes the table. Pray you once more,\r","Is not your father grown incapable\r","Of reasonable affairs? is he not stupid\r","With age and altering rheums? can he speak? hear?\r","Know man from man? dispute his own estate?\r","Lies he not bed-rid? and again does nothing\r","But what he did being childish?\r","\r","FLORIZEL:\r","No, good sir;\r","He has his health and ampler strength indeed\r","Than most have of his age.\r","\r","POLIXENES:\r","By my white beard,\r","You offer him, if this be so, a wrong\r","Something unfilial: reason my son\r","Should choose himself a wife, but as good reason\r","The father, all whose joy is nothing else\r","But fair posterity, should hold some counsel\r","In such a business.\r","\r","FLORIZEL:\r","I yield all this;\r","But for some other reasons, my grave sir,\r","Which 'tis not fit you know, I not acquaint\r","My father of this business.\r","\r","POLIXENES:\r","Let him know't.\r","\r","FLORIZEL:\r","He shall not.\r","\r","POLIXENES:\r","Prithee, let him.\r","\r","FLORIZEL:\r","No, he must not.\r","\r","Shepherd:\r","Let him, my son: he shall not need to grieve\r","At knowing of thy choice.\r","\r","FLORIZEL:\r","Come, come, he must not.\r","Mark our contract.\r","\r","POLIXENES:\r","Mark your divorce, young sir,\r","Whom son I dare not call; thou art too base\r","To be acknowledged: thou a sceptre's heir,\r","That thus affect'st a sheep-hook! Thou old traitor,\r","I am sorry that by hanging thee I can\r","But shorten thy life one week. And thou, fresh piece\r","Of excellent witchcraft, who of force must know\r","The royal fool thou copest with,--\r","\r","Shepherd:\r","O, my heart!\r","\r","POLIXENES:\r","I'll have thy beauty scratch'd with briers, and made\r","More homely than thy state. For thee, fond boy,\r","If I may ever know thou dost but sigh\r","That thou no more shalt see this knack, as never\r","I mean thou shalt, we'll bar thee from succession;\r","Not hold thee of our blood, no, not our kin,\r","Far than Deucalion off: mark thou my words:\r","Follow us to the court. Thou churl, for this time,\r","Though full of our displeasure, yet we free thee\r","From the dead blow of it. And you, enchantment.--\r","Worthy enough a herdsman: yea, him too,\r","That makes himself, but for our honour therein,\r","Unworthy thee,--if ever henceforth thou\r","These rural latches to his entrance open,\r","Or hoop his body more with thy embraces,\r","I will devise a death as cruel for thee\r","As thou art tender to't.\r","\r","PERDITA:\r","Even here undone!\r","I was not much afeard; for once or twice\r","I was about to speak and tell him plainly,\r","The selfsame sun that shines upon his court\r","Hides not his visage from our cottage but\r","Looks on alike. Will't please you, sir, be gone?\r","I told you what would come of this: beseech you,\r","Of your own state take care: this dream of mine,--\r","Being now awake, I'll queen it no inch farther,\r","But milk my ewes and weep.\r","\r","CAMILLO:\r","Why, how now, father!\r","Speak ere thou diest.\r","\r","Shepherd:\r","I cannot speak, nor think\r","Nor dare to know that which I know. O sir!\r","You have undone a man of fourscore three,\r","That thought to fill his grave in quiet, yea,\r","To die upon the bed my father died,\r","To lie close by his honest bones: but now\r","Some hangman must put on my shroud and lay me\r","Where no priest shovels in dust. O cursed wretch,\r","That knew'st this was the prince,\r","and wouldst adventure\r","To mingle faith with him! Undone! undone!\r","If I might die within this hour, I have lived\r","To die when I desire.\r","\r","FLORIZEL:\r","Why look you so upon me?\r","I am but sorry, not afeard; delay'd,\r","But nothing alter'd: what I was, I am;\r","More straining on for plucking back, not following\r","My leash unwillingly.\r","\r","CAMILLO:\r","Gracious my lord,\r","You know your father's temper: at this time\r","He will allow no speech, which I do guess\r","You do not purpose to him; and as hardly\r","Will he endure your sight as yet, I fear:\r","Then, till the fury of his highness settle,\r","Come not before him.\r","\r","FLORIZEL:\r","I not purpose it.\r","I think, Camillo?\r","\r","CAMILLO:\r","Even he, my lord.\r","\r","PERDITA:\r","How often have I told you 'twould be thus!\r","How often said, my dignity would last\r","But till 'twere known!\r","\r","FLORIZEL:\r","It cannot fail but by\r","The violation of my faith; and then\r","Let nature crush the sides o' the earth together\r","And mar the seeds within! Lift up thy looks:\r","From my succession wipe me, father; I\r","Am heir to my affection.\r","\r","CAMILLO:\r","Be advised.\r","\r","FLORIZEL:\r","I am, and by my fancy: if my reason\r","Will thereto be obedient, I have reason;\r","If not, my senses, better pleased with madness,\r","Do bid it welcome.\r","\r","CAMILLO:\r","This is desperate, sir.\r","\r","FLORIZEL:\r","So call it: but it does fulfil my vow;\r","I needs must think it honesty. Camillo,\r","Not for Bohemia, nor the pomp that may\r","Be thereat glean'd, for all the sun sees or\r","The close earth wombs or the profound sea hides\r","In unknown fathoms, will I break my oath\r","To this my fair beloved: therefore, I pray you,\r","As you have ever been my father's honour'd friend,\r","When he shall miss me,--as, in faith, I mean not\r","To see him any more,--cast your good counsels\r","Upon his passion; let myself and fortune\r","Tug for the time to come. This you may know\r","And so deliver, I am put to sea\r","With her whom here I cannot hold on shore;\r","And most opportune to our need I have\r","A vessel rides fast by, but not prepared\r","For this design. What course I mean to hold\r","Shall nothing benefit your knowledge, nor\r","Concern me the reporting.\r","\r","CAMILLO:\r","O my lord!\r","I would your spirit were easier for advice,\r","Or stronger for your need.\r","\r","FLORIZEL:\r","Hark, Perdita\r","I'll hear you by and by.\r","\r","CAMILLO:\r","He's irremoveable,\r","Resolved for flight. Now were I happy, if\r","His going I could frame to serve my turn,\r","Save him from danger, do him love and honour,\r","Purchase the sight again of dear Sicilia\r","And that unhappy king, my master, whom\r","I so much thirst to see.\r","\r","FLORIZEL:\r","Now, good Camillo;\r","I am so fraught with curious business that\r","I leave out ceremony.\r","\r","CAMILLO:\r","Sir, I think\r","You have heard of my poor services, i' the love\r","That I have borne your father?\r","\r","FLORIZEL:\r","Very nobly\r","Have you deserved: it is my father's music\r","To speak your deeds, not little of his care\r","To have them recompensed as thought on.\r","\r","CAMILLO:\r","Well, my lord,\r","If you may please to think I love the king\r","And through him what is nearest to him, which is\r","Your gracious self, embrace but my direction:\r","If your more ponderous and settled project\r","May suffer alteration, on mine honour,\r","I'll point you where you shall have such receiving\r","As shall become your highness; where you may\r","Enjoy your mistress, from the whom, I see,\r","There's no disjunction to be made, but by--\r","As heavens forefend!--your ruin; marry her,\r","And, with my best endeavours in your absence,\r","Your discontenting father strive to qualify\r","And bring him up to liking.\r","\r","FLORIZEL:\r","How, Camillo,\r","May this, almost a miracle, be done?\r","That I may call thee something more than man\r","And after that trust to thee.\r","\r","CAMILLO:\r","Have you thought on\r","A place whereto you'll go?\r","\r","FLORIZEL:\r","Not any yet:\r","But as the unthought-on accident is guilty\r","To what we wildly do, so we profess\r","Ourselves to be the slaves of chance and flies\r","Of every wind that blows.\r","\r","CAMILLO:\r","Then list to me:\r","This follows, if you will not change your purpose\r","But undergo this flight, make for Sicilia,\r","And there present yourself and your fair princess,\r","For so I see she must be, 'fore Leontes:\r","She shall be habited as it becomes\r","The partner of your bed. Methinks I see\r","Leontes opening his free arms and weeping\r","His welcomes forth; asks thee the son forgiveness,\r","As 'twere i' the father's person; kisses the hands\r","Of your fresh princess; o'er and o'er divides him\r","'Twixt his unkindness and his kindness; the one\r","He chides to hell and bids the other grow\r","Faster than thought or time.\r","\r","FLORIZEL:\r","Worthy Camillo,\r","What colour for my visitation shall I\r","Hold up before him?\r","\r","CAMILLO:\r","Sent by the king your father\r","To greet him and to give him comforts. Sir,\r","The manner of your bearing towards him, with\r","What you as from your father shall deliver,\r","Things known betwixt us three, I'll write you down:\r","The which shall point you forth at every sitting\r","What you must say; that he shall not perceive\r","But that you have your father's bosom there\r","And speak his very heart.\r","\r","FLORIZEL:\r","I am bound to you:\r","There is some sap in this.\r","\r","CAMILLO:\r","A cause more promising\r","Than a wild dedication of yourselves\r","To unpath'd waters, undream'd shores, most certain\r","To miseries enough; no hope to help you,\r","But as you shake off one to take another;\r","Nothing so certain as your anchors, who\r","Do their best office, if they can but stay you\r","Where you'll be loath to be: besides you know\r","Prosperity's the very bond of love,\r","Whose fresh complexion and whose heart together\r","Affliction alters.\r","\r","PERDITA:\r","One of these is true:\r","I think affliction may subdue the cheek,\r","But not take in the mind.\r","\r","CAMILLO:\r","Yea, say you so?\r","There shall not at your father's house these\r","seven years\r","Be born another such.\r","\r","FLORIZEL:\r","My good Camillo,\r","She is as forward of her breeding as\r","She is i' the rear our birth.\r","\r","CAMILLO:\r","I cannot say 'tis pity\r","She lacks instructions, for she seems a mistress\r","To most that teach.\r","\r","PERDITA:\r","Your pardon, sir; for this\r","I'll blush you thanks.\r","\r","FLORIZEL:\r","My prettiest Perdita!\r","But O, the thorns we stand upon! Camillo,\r","Preserver of my father, now of me,\r","The medicine of our house, how shall we do?\r","We are not furnish'd like Bohemia's son,\r","Nor shall appear in Sicilia.\r","\r","CAMILLO:\r","My lord,\r","Fear none of this: I think you know my fortunes\r","Do all lie there: it shall be so my care\r","To have you royally appointed as if\r","The scene you play were mine. For instance, sir,\r","That you may know you shall not want, one word.\r","\r","AUTOLYCUS:\r","Ha, ha! what a fool Honesty is! and Trust, his\r","sworn brother, a very simple gentleman! I have sold\r","all my trumpery; not a counterfeit stone, not a\r","ribbon, glass, pomander, brooch, table-book, ballad,\r","knife, tape, glove, shoe-tie, bracelet, horn-ring,\r","to keep my pack from fasting: they throng who\r","should buy first, as if my trinkets had been\r","hallowed and brought a benediction to the buyer:\r","by which means I saw whose purse was best in\r","picture; and what I saw, to my good use I\r","remembered. My clown, who wants but something to\r","be a reasonable man, grew so in love with the\r","wenches' song, that he would not stir his pettitoes\r","till he had both tune and words; which so drew the\r","rest of the herd to me that all their other senses\r","stuck in ears: you might have pinched a placket, it\r","was senseless; 'twas nothing to geld a codpiece of a\r","purse; I could have filed keys off that hung in\r","chains: no hearing, no feeling, but my sir's song,\r","and admiring the nothing of it. So that in this\r","time of lethargy I picked and cut most of their\r","festival purses; and had not the old man come in\r","with a whoo-bub against his daughter and the king's\r","son and scared my choughs from the chaff, I had not\r","left a purse alive in the whole army.\r","\r","CAMILLO:\r","Nay, but my letters, by this means being there\r","So soon as you arrive, shall clear that doubt.\r","\r","FLORIZEL:\r","And those that you'll procure from King Leontes--\r","\r","CAMILLO:\r","Shall satisfy your father.\r","\r","PERDITA:\r","Happy be you!\r","All that you speak shows fair.\r","\r","CAMILLO:\r","Who have we here?\r","We'll make an instrument of this, omit\r","Nothing may give us aid.\r","\r","AUTOLYCUS:\r","If they have overheard me now, why, hanging.\r","\r","CAMILLO:\r","How now, good fellow! why shakest thou so? Fear\r","not, man; here's no harm intended to thee.\r","\r","AUTOLYCUS:\r","I am a poor fellow, sir.\r","\r","CAMILLO:\r","Why, be so still; here's nobody will steal that from\r","thee: yet for the outside of thy poverty we must\r","make an exchange; therefore discase thee instantly,\r","--thou must think there's a necessity in't,--and\r","change garments with this gentleman: though the\r","pennyworth on his side be the worst, yet hold thee,\r","there's some boot.\r","\r","AUTOLYCUS:\r","I am a poor fellow, sir.\r","I know ye well enough.\r","\r","CAMILLO:\r","Nay, prithee, dispatch: the gentleman is half\r","flayed already.\r","\r","AUTOLYCUS:\r","Are you in earnest, sir?\r","I smell the trick on't.\r","\r","FLORIZEL:\r","Dispatch, I prithee.\r","\r","AUTOLYCUS:\r","Indeed, I have had earnest: but I cannot with\r","conscience take it.\r","\r","CAMILLO:\r","Unbuckle, unbuckle.\r","Fortunate mistress,--let my prophecy\r","Come home to ye!--you must retire yourself\r","Into some covert: take your sweetheart's hat\r","And pluck it o'er your brows, muffle your face,\r","Dismantle you, and, as you can, disliken\r","The truth of your own seeming; that you may--\r","For I do fear eyes over--to shipboard\r","Get undescried.\r","\r","PERDITA:\r","I see the play so lies\r","That I must bear a part.\r","\r","CAMILLO:\r","No remedy.\r","Have you done there?\r","\r","FLORIZEL:\r","Should I now meet my father,\r","He would not call me son.\r","\r","CAMILLO:\r","Nay, you shall have no hat.\r","Come, lady, come. Farewell, my friend.\r","\r","AUTOLYCUS:\r","Adieu, sir.\r","\r","FLORIZEL:\r","O Perdita, what have we twain forgot!\r","Pray you, a word.\r","\r","CAMILLO:\r","\r","FLORIZEL:\r","Fortune speed us!\r","Thus we set on, Camillo, to the sea-side.\r","\r","CAMILLO:\r","The swifter speed the better.\r","\r","AUTOLYCUS:\r","I understand the business, I hear it: to have an\r","open ear, a quick eye, and a nimble hand, is\r","necessary for a cut-purse; a good nose is requisite\r","also, to smell out work for the other senses. I see\r","this is the time that the unjust man doth thrive.\r","What an exchange had this been without boot! What\r","a boot is here with this exchange! Sure the gods do\r","this year connive at us, and we may do any thing\r","extempore. The prince himself is about a piece of\r","iniquity, stealing away from his father with his\r","clog at his heels: if I thought it were a piece of\r","honesty to acquaint the king withal, I would not\r","do't: I hold it the more knavery to conceal it;\r","and therein am I constant to my profession.\r","Aside, aside; here is more matter for a hot brain:\r","every lane's end, every shop, church, session,\r","hanging, yields a careful man work.\r","\r","Clown:\r","See, see; what a man you are now!\r","There is no other way but to tell the king\r","she's a changeling and none of your flesh and blood.\r","\r","Shepherd:\r","Nay, but hear me.\r","\r","Clown:\r","Nay, but hear me.\r","\r","Shepherd:\r","Go to, then.\r","\r","Clown:\r","She being none of your flesh and blood, your flesh\r","and blood has not offended the king; and so your\r","flesh and blood is not to be punished by him. Show\r","those things you found about her, those secret\r","things, all but what she has with her: this being\r","done, let the law go whistle: I warrant you.\r","\r","Shepherd:\r","I will tell the king all, every word, yea, and his\r","son's pranks too; who, I may say, is no honest man,\r","neither to his father nor to me, to go about to make\r","me the king's brother-in-law.\r","\r","Clown:\r","Indeed, brother-in-law was the farthest off you\r","could have been to him and then your blood had been\r","the dearer by I know how much an ounce.\r","\r","AUTOLYCUS:\r","\r","Shepherd:\r","Well, let us to the king: there is that in this\r","fardel will make him scratch his beard.\r","\r","AUTOLYCUS:\r","\r","Clown:\r","Pray heartily he be at palace.\r","\r","AUTOLYCUS:\r","\r","Shepherd:\r","To the palace, an it like your worship.\r","\r","AUTOLYCUS:\r","Your affairs there, what, with whom, the condition\r","of that fardel, the place of your dwelling, your\r","names, your ages, of what having, breeding, and any\r","thing that is fitting to be known, discover.\r","\r","Clown:\r","We are but plain fellows, sir.\r","\r","AUTOLYCUS:\r","A lie; you are rough and hairy. Let me have no\r","lying: it becomes none but tradesmen, and they\r","often give us soldiers the lie: but we pay them for\r","it with stamped coin, not stabbing steel; therefore\r","they do not give us the lie.\r","\r","Clown:\r","Your worship had like to have given us one, if you\r","had not taken yourself with the manner.\r","\r","Shepherd:\r","Are you a courtier, an't like you, sir?\r","\r","AUTOLYCUS:\r","Whether it like me or no, I am a courtier. Seest\r","thou not the air of the court in these enfoldings?\r","hath not my gait in it the measure of the court?\r","receives not thy nose court-odor from me? reflect I\r","not on thy baseness court-contempt? Thinkest thou,\r","for that I insinuate, or toaze from thee thy\r","business, I am therefore no courtier? I am courtier\r","cap-a-pe; and one that will either push on or pluck\r","back thy business there: whereupon I command thee to\r","open thy affair.\r","\r","Shepherd:\r","My business, sir, is to the king.\r","\r","AUTOLYCUS:\r","What advocate hast thou to him?\r","\r","Shepherd:\r","I know not, an't like you.\r","\r","Clown:\r","Advocate's the court-word for a pheasant: say you\r","have none.\r","\r","Shepherd:\r","None, sir; I have no pheasant, cock nor hen.\r","\r","AUTOLYCUS:\r","How blessed are we that are not simple men!\r","Yet nature might have made me as these are,\r","Therefore I will not disdain.\r","\r","Clown:\r","This cannot be but a great courtier.\r","\r","Shepherd:\r","His garments are rich, but he wears\r","them not handsomely.\r","\r","Clown:\r","He seems to be the more noble in being fantastical:\r","a great man, I'll warrant; I know by the picking\r","on's teeth.\r","\r","AUTOLYCUS:\r","The fardel there? what's i' the fardel?\r","Wherefore that box?\r","\r","Shepherd:\r","Sir, there lies such secrets in this fardel and box,\r","which none must know but the king; and which he\r","shall know within this hour, if I may come to the\r","speech of him.\r","\r","AUTOLYCUS:\r","Age, thou hast lost thy labour.\r","\r","Shepherd:\r","Why, sir?\r","\r","AUTOLYCUS:\r","The king is not at the palace; he is gone aboard a\r","new ship to purge melancholy and air himself: for,\r","if thou beest capable of things serious, thou must\r","know the king is full of grief.\r","\r","Shepard:\r","So 'tis said, sir; about his son, that should have\r","married a shepherd's daughter.\r","\r","AUTOLYCUS:\r","If that shepherd be not in hand-fast, let him fly:\r","the curses he shall have, the tortures he shall\r","feel, will break the back of man, the heart of monster.\r","\r","Clown:\r","Think you so, sir?\r","\r","AUTOLYCUS:\r","Not he alone shall suffer what wit can make heavy\r","and vengeance bitter; but those that are germane to\r","him, though removed fifty times, shall all come\r","under the hangman: which though it be great pity,\r","yet it is necessary. An old sheep-whistling rogue a\r","ram-tender, to offer to have his daughter come into\r","grace! Some say he shall be stoned; but that death\r","is too soft for him, say I draw our throne into a\r","sheep-cote! all deaths are too few, the sharpest too easy.\r","\r","Clown:\r","Has the old man e'er a son, sir, do you hear. an't\r","like you, sir?\r","\r","AUTOLYCUS:\r","He has a son, who shall be flayed alive; then\r","'nointed over with honey, set on the head of a\r","wasp's nest; then stand till he be three quarters\r","and a dram dead; then recovered again with\r","aqua-vitae or some other hot infusion; then, raw as\r","he is, and in the hottest day prognostication\r","proclaims, shall be be set against a brick-wall, the\r","sun looking with a southward eye upon him, where he\r","is to behold him with flies blown to death. But what\r","talk we of these traitorly rascals, whose miseries\r","are to be smiled at, their offences being so\r","capital? Tell me, for you seem to be honest plain\r","men, what you have to the king: being something\r","gently considered, I'll bring you where he is\r","aboard, tender your persons to his presence,\r","whisper him in your behalfs; and if it be in man\r","besides the king to effect your suits, here is man\r","shall do it.\r","\r","Clown:\r","He seems to be of great authority: close with him,\r","give him gold; and though authority be a stubborn\r","bear, yet he is oft led by the nose with gold: show\r","the inside of your purse to the outside of his hand,\r","and no more ado. Remember 'stoned,' and 'flayed alive.'\r","\r","Shepherd:\r","An't please you, sir, to undertake the business for\r","us, here is that gold I have: I'll make it as much\r","more and leave this young man in pawn till I bring it you.\r","\r","AUTOLYCUS:\r","After I have done what I promised?\r","\r","Shepherd:\r","Ay, sir.\r","\r","AUTOLYCUS:\r","Well, give me the moiety. Are you a party in this business?\r","\r","Clown:\r","In some sort, sir: but though my case be a pitiful\r","one, I hope I shall not be flayed out of it.\r","\r","AUTOLYCUS:\r","O, that's the case of the shepherd's son: hang him,\r","he'll be made an example.\r","\r","Clown:\r","Comfort, good comfort! We must to the king and show\r","our strange sights: he must know 'tis none of your\r","daughter nor my sister; we are gone else. Sir, I\r","will give you as much as this old man does when the\r","business is performed, and remain, as he says, your\r","pawn till it be brought you.\r","\r","AUTOLYCUS:\r","I will trust you. Walk before toward the sea-side;\r","go on the right hand: I will but look upon the\r","hedge and follow you.\r","\r","Clown:\r","We are blest in this man, as I may say, even blest.\r","\r","Shepherd:\r","Let's before as he bids us: he was provided to do us good.\r","\r","AUTOLYCUS:\r","If I had a mind to be honest, I see Fortune would\r","not suffer me: she drops booties in my mouth. I am\r","courted now with a double occasion, gold and a means\r","to do the prince my master good; which who knows how\r","that may turn back to my advancement? I will bring\r","these two moles, these blind ones, aboard him: if he\r","think it fit to shore them again and that the\r","complaint they have to the king concerns him\r","nothing, let him call me rogue for being so far\r","officious; for I am proof against that title and\r","what shame else belongs to't. To him will I present\r","them: there may be matter in it.\r","\r","CLEOMENES:\r","Sir, you have done enough, and have perform'd\r","A saint-like sorrow: no fault could you make,\r","Which you have not redeem'd; indeed, paid down\r","More penitence than done trespass: at the last,\r","Do as the heavens have done, forget your evil;\r","With them forgive yourself.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","Whilst I remember\r","Her and her virtues, I cannot forget\r","My blemishes in them, and so still think of\r","The wrong I did myself; which was so much,\r","That heirless it hath made my kingdom and\r","Destroy'd the sweet'st companion that e'er man\r","Bred his hopes out of.\r","\r","PAULINA:\r","True, too true, my lord:\r","If, one by one, you wedded all the world,\r","Or from the all that are took something good,\r","To make a perfect woman, she you kill'd\r","Would be unparallel'd.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","I think so. Kill'd!\r","She I kill'd! I did so: but thou strikest me\r","Sorely, to say I did; it is as bitter\r","Upon thy tongue as in my thought: now, good now,\r","Say so but seldom.\r","\r","CLEOMENES:\r","Not at all, good lady:\r","You might have spoken a thousand things that would\r","Have done the time more benefit and graced\r","Your kindness better.\r","\r","PAULINA:\r","You are one of those\r","Would have him wed again.\r","\r","DION:\r","If you would not so,\r","You pity not the state, nor the remembrance\r","Of his most sovereign name; consider little\r","What dangers, by his highness' fail of issue,\r","May drop upon his kingdom and devour\r","Incertain lookers on. What were more holy\r","Than to rejoice the former queen is well?\r","What holier than, for royalty's repair,\r","For present comfort and for future good,\r","To bless the bed of majesty again\r","With a sweet fellow to't?\r","\r","PAULINA:\r","There is none worthy,\r","Respecting her that's gone. Besides, the gods\r","Will have fulfill'd their secret purposes;\r","For has not the divine Apollo said,\r","Is't not the tenor of his oracle,\r","That King Leontes shall not have an heir\r","Till his lost child be found? which that it shall,\r","Is all as monstrous to our human reason\r","As my Antigonus to break his grave\r","And come again to me; who, on my life,\r","Did perish with the infant. 'Tis your counsel\r","My lord should to the heavens be contrary,\r","Oppose against their wills.\r","Care not for issue;\r","The crown will find an heir: great Alexander\r","Left his to the worthiest; so his successor\r","Was like to be the best.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","Good Paulina,\r","Who hast the memory of Hermione,\r","I know, in honour, O, that ever I\r","Had squared me to thy counsel! then, even now,\r","I might have look'd upon my queen's full eyes,\r","Have taken treasure from her lips--\r","\r","PAULINA:\r","And left them\r","More rich for what they yielded.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","Thou speak'st truth.\r","No more such wives; therefore, no wife: one worse,\r","And better used, would make her sainted spirit\r","Again possess her corpse, and on this stage,\r","Where we're offenders now, appear soul-vex'd,\r","And begin, 'Why to me?'\r","\r","PAULINA:\r","Had she such power,\r","She had just cause.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","She had; and would incense me\r","To murder her I married.\r","\r","PAULINA:\r","I should so.\r","Were I the ghost that walk'd, I'ld bid you mark\r","Her eye, and tell me for what dull part in't\r","You chose her; then I'ld shriek, that even your ears\r","Should rift to hear me; and the words that follow'd\r","Should be 'Remember mine.'\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","Stars, stars,\r","And all eyes else dead coals! Fear thou no wife;\r","I'll have no wife, Paulina.\r","\r","PAULINA:\r","Will you swear\r","Never to marry but by my free leave?\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","Never, Paulina; so be blest my spirit!\r","\r","PAULINA:\r","Then, good my lords, bear witness to his oath.\r","\r","CLEOMENES:\r","You tempt him over-much.\r","\r","PAULINA:\r","Unless another,\r","As like Hermione as is her picture,\r","Affront his eye.\r","\r","CLEOMENES:\r","Good madam,--\r","\r","PAULINA:\r","I have done.\r","Yet, if my lord will marry,--if you will, sir,\r","No remedy, but you will,--give me the office\r","To choose you a queen: she shall not be so young\r","As was your former; but she shall be such\r","As, walk'd your first queen's ghost,\r","it should take joy\r","To see her in your arms.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","My true Paulina,\r","We shall not marry till thou bid'st us.\r","\r","PAULINA:\r","That\r","Shall be when your first queen's again in breath;\r","Never till then.\r","\r","Gentleman:\r","One that gives out himself Prince Florizel,\r","Son of Polixenes, with his princess, she\r","The fairest I have yet beheld, desires access\r","To your high presence.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","What with him? he comes not\r","Like to his father's greatness: his approach,\r","So out of circumstance and sudden, tells us\r","'Tis not a visitation framed, but forced\r","By need and accident. What train?\r","\r","Gentleman:\r","But few,\r","And those but mean.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","His princess, say you, with him?\r","\r","Gentleman:\r","Ay, the most peerless piece of earth, I think,\r","That e'er the sun shone bright on.\r","\r","PAULINA:\r","O Hermione,\r","As every present time doth boast itself\r","Above a better gone, so must thy grave\r","Give way to what's seen now! Sir, you yourself\r","Have said and writ so, but your writing now\r","Is colder than that theme, 'She had not been,\r","Nor was not to be equall'd;'--thus your verse\r","Flow'd with her beauty once: 'tis shrewdly ebb'd,\r","To say you have seen a better.\r","\r","Gentleman:\r","Pardon, madam:\r","The one I have almost forgot,--your pardon,--\r","The other, when she has obtain'd your eye,\r","Will have your tongue too. This is a creature,\r","Would she begin a sect, might quench the zeal\r","Of all professors else, make proselytes\r","Of who she but bid follow.\r","\r","PAULINA:\r","How! not women?\r","\r","Gentleman:\r","Women will love her, that she is a woman\r","More worth than any man; men, that she is\r","The rarest of all women.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","Go, Cleomenes;\r","Yourself, assisted with your honour'd friends,\r","Bring them to our embracement. Still, 'tis strange\r","He thus should steal upon us.\r","\r","PAULINA:\r","Had our prince,\r","Jewel of children, seen this hour, he had pair'd\r","Well with this lord: there was not full a month\r","Between their births.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","Prithee, no more; cease; thou know'st\r","He dies to me again when talk'd of: sure,\r","When I shall see this gentleman, thy speeches\r","Will bring me to consider that which may\r","Unfurnish me of reason. They are come.\r","Your mother was most true to wedlock, prince;\r","For she did print your royal father off,\r","Conceiving you: were I but twenty-one,\r","Your father's image is so hit in you,\r","His very air, that I should call you brother,\r","As I did him, and speak of something wildly\r","By us perform'd before. Most dearly welcome!\r","And your fair princess,--goddess!--O, alas!\r","I lost a couple, that 'twixt heaven and earth\r","Might thus have stood begetting wonder as\r","You, gracious couple, do: and then I lost--\r","All mine own folly--the society,\r","Amity too, of your brave father, whom,\r","Though bearing misery, I desire my life\r","Once more to look on him.\r","\r","FLORIZEL:\r","By his command\r","Have I here touch'd Sicilia and from him\r","Give you all greetings that a king, at friend,\r","Can send his brother: and, but infirmity\r","Which waits upon worn times hath something seized\r","His wish'd ability, he had himself\r","The lands and waters 'twixt your throne and his\r","Measured to look upon you; whom he loves--\r","He bade me say so--more than all the sceptres\r","And those that bear them living.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","O my brother,\r","Good gentleman! the wrongs I have done thee stir\r","Afresh within me, and these thy offices,\r","So rarely kind, are as interpreters\r","Of my behind-hand slackness. Welcome hither,\r","As is the spring to the earth. And hath he too\r","Exposed this paragon to the fearful usage,\r","At least ungentle, of the dreadful Neptune,\r","To greet a man not worth her pains, much less\r","The adventure of her person?\r","\r","FLORIZEL:\r","Good my lord,\r","She came from Libya.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","Where the warlike Smalus,\r","That noble honour'd lord, is fear'd and loved?\r","\r","FLORIZEL:\r","Most royal sir, from thence; from him, whose daughter\r","His tears proclaim'd his, parting with her: thence,\r","A prosperous south-wind friendly, we have cross'd,\r","To execute the charge my father gave me\r","For visiting your highness: my best train\r","I have from your Sicilian shores dismiss'd;\r","Who for Bohemia bend, to signify\r","Not only my success in Libya, sir,\r","But my arrival and my wife's in safety\r","Here where we are.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","The blessed gods\r","Purge all infection from our air whilst you\r","Do climate here! You have a holy father,\r","A graceful gentleman; against whose person,\r","So sacred as it is, I have done sin:\r","For which the heavens, taking angry note,\r","Have left me issueless; and your father's blest,\r","As he from heaven merits it, with you\r","Worthy his goodness. What might I have been,\r","Might I a son and daughter now have look'd on,\r","Such goodly things as you!\r","\r","Lord:\r","Most noble sir,\r","That which I shall report will bear no credit,\r","Were not the proof so nigh. Please you, great sir,\r","Bohemia greets you from himself by me;\r","Desires you to attach his son, who has--\r","His dignity and duty both cast off--\r","Fled from his father, from his hopes, and with\r","A shepherd's daughter.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","Where's Bohemia? speak.\r","\r","Lord:\r","Here in your city; I now came from him:\r","I speak amazedly; and it becomes\r","My marvel and my message. To your court\r","Whiles he was hastening, in the chase, it seems,\r","Of this fair couple, meets he on the way\r","The father of this seeming lady and\r","Her brother, having both their country quitted\r","With this young prince.\r","\r","FLORIZEL:\r","Camillo has betray'd me;\r","Whose honour and whose honesty till now\r","Endured all weathers.\r","\r","Lord:\r","Lay't so to his charge:\r","He's with the king your father.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","Who? Camillo?\r","\r","Lord:\r","Camillo, sir; I spake with him; who now\r","Has these poor men in question. Never saw I\r","Wretches so quake: they kneel, they kiss the earth;\r","Forswear themselves as often as they speak:\r","Bohemia stops his ears, and threatens them\r","With divers deaths in death.\r","\r","PERDITA:\r","O my poor father!\r","The heaven sets spies upon us, will not have\r","Our contract celebrated.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","You are married?\r","\r","FLORIZEL:\r","We are not, sir, nor are we like to be;\r","The stars, I see, will kiss the valleys first:\r","The odds for high and low's alike.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","My lord,\r","Is this the daughter of a king?\r","\r","FLORIZEL:\r","She is,\r","When once she is my wife.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","That 'once' I see by your good father's speed\r","Will come on very slowly. I am sorry,\r","Most sorry, you have broken from his liking\r","Where you were tied in duty, and as sorry\r","Your choice is not so rich in worth as beauty,\r","That you might well enjoy her.\r","\r","FLORIZEL:\r","Dear, look up:\r","Though Fortune, visible an enemy,\r","Should chase us with my father, power no jot\r","Hath she to change our loves. Beseech you, sir,\r","Remember since you owed no more to time\r","Than I do now: with thought of such affections,\r","Step forth mine advocate; at your request\r","My father will grant precious things as trifles.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","Would he do so, I'ld beg your precious mistress,\r","Which he counts but a trifle.\r","\r","PAULINA:\r","Sir, my liege,\r","Your eye hath too much youth in't: not a month\r","'Fore your queen died, she was more worth such gazes\r","Than what you look on now.\r","\r","LEONTES:\r","I thought of her,\r","Even in these looks I made.\r","But your petition\r","Is yet unanswer'd. I will to your father:\r","Your honour not o'erthrown by your desires,\r","I am friend to them and you: upon which errand\r","I now go toward him; therefore follow me\r","And mark what way I make: come, good my lord.\r","\r","AUTOLYCUS:\r","Beseech you, sir, were you present at this relation?\r","\r","First Gentleman:\r","I was by at the opening of the fardel, heard the old\r","shepherd deliver the manner how he found it:\r","whereupon, after a little amazedness, we were all\r","commanded out of the chamber; only this methought I\r","heard the shepherd say, he found the child.\r","\r","AUTOLYCUS:\r","I would most gladly know the issue of it.\r","\r","First Gentleman:\r","I make a broken delivery of the business; but the\r","changes I perceived in the king and Camillo were\r","very notes of admiration: they seemed almost, with\r","staring on one another, to tear the cases of their\r","eyes; there was speech in their dumbness, language\r","in their very gesture; they looked as they had heard\r","of a world ransomed, or one destroyed: a notable\r","passion of wonder appeared in them; but the wisest\r","beholder, that knew no more but seeing, could not\r","say if the importance were joy or sorrow; but in the\r","extremity of the one, it must needs be.\r","Here comes a gentleman that haply knows more.\r","The news, Rogero?\r","\r","Second Gentleman:\r","Nothing but bonfires: the oracle is fulfilled; the\r","king's daughter is found: such a deal of wonder is\r","broken out within this hour that ballad-makers\r","cannot be able to express it.\r","Here comes the Lady Paulina's steward: he can\r","deliver you more. How goes it now, sir? this news\r","which is called true is so like an old tale, that\r","the verity of it is in strong suspicion: has the king\r","found his heir?\r","\r","Third Gentleman:\r","Most true, if ever truth were pregnant by\r","circumstance: that which you hear you'll swear you\r","see, there is such unity in the proofs. The mantle\r","of Queen Hermione's, her jewel about the neck of it,\r","the letters of Antigonus found with it which they\r","know to be his character, the majesty of the\r","creature in resemblance of the mother, the affection\r","of nobleness which nature shows above her breeding,\r","and many other evidences proclaim her with all\r","certainty to be the king's daughter. Did you see\r","the meeting of the two kings?\r","\r","Second Gentleman:\r","No.\r","\r","Third Gentleman:\r","Then have you lost a sight, which was to be seen,\r","cannot be spoken of. There might you have beheld one\r","joy crown another, so and in such manner that it\r","seemed sorrow wept to take leave of them, for their\r","joy waded in tears. There was casting up of eyes,\r","holding up of hands, with countenances of such\r","distraction that they were to be known by garment,\r","not by favour. Our king, being ready to leap out of\r","himself for joy of his found daughter, as if that\r","joy were now become a loss, cries 'O, thy mother,\r","thy mother!' then asks Bohemia forgiveness; then\r","embraces his son-in-law; then again worries he his\r","daughter with clipping her; now he thanks the old\r","shepherd, which stands by like a weather-bitten\r","conduit of many kings' reigns. I never heard of such\r","another encounter, which lames report to follow it\r","and undoes description to do it.\r","\r","Second Gentleman:\r","What, pray you, became of Antigonus, that carried\r","hence the child?\r","\r","Third Gentleman:\r","Like an old tale still, which will have matter to\r","rehearse, though credit be asleep and not an ear\r","open. He was torn to pieces with a bear: this\r","avouches the shepherd's son; who has not only his\r","innocence, which seems much, to justify him, but a\r","handkerchief and rings of his that Paulina knows.\r","\r","First Gentleman:\r","What became of his bark and his followers?\r","\r","Third Gentleman:\r","Wrecked the same instant of their master's death and\r","in the view of the shepherd: so that all the\r","instruments which aided to expose the child were\r","even then lost when it was found. But O, the noble\r","combat that 'twixt joy and sorrow was fought in\r","Paulina! She had one eye declined for the loss of\r","her husband, another elevated that the oracle was\r","fulfilled: she lifted the princess from the earth,\r","and so locks her in embracing, as if she would pin\r","her to her heart that she might no more be in danger\r","of losing.\r","\r","First Gentleman:\r","The dignity of this act was worth the audience of\r","kings and princes; for by such was it acted.\r","\r","Third Gentleman:\r","One of the prettiest touches of all and that which\r","angled for mine eyes, caught the water though not\r","the fish, was when, at the relation of the queen's\r","death, with the manner how she came to't bravely\r","confessed and lamented by the king, how\r","attentiveness wounded his daughter; till, from one\r","sign of dolour to another, she did, with an 'Alas,'\r","I would fain say, bleed tears, for I am sure my\r","heart wept blood. Who was most marble there changed\r","colour; some swooned, all sorrowed: if all the world\r","could have seen 't, the woe had been universal.\r","\r","First Gentleman:\r","Are they returned to the court?\r","\r","Third Gentleman:\r","No: the princess hearing of her mother's statue,\r","which is in the keeping of Paulina,--a piece many\r","years in doing and now newly performed by that rare\r","Italian master, Julio Romano, who, had he himself\r","eternity and could put breath into his work, would\r","beguile Nature of her custom, so perfectly he is her\r","ape: he so near to Hermione hath done Hermione that\r","they say one would speak to her and stand in hope of\r","answer: thither with all greediness of affection\r","are they gone, and there they intend to sup.\r","\r","Second Gentleman:\r","I thought she had some great matter there in hand;\r","for she hath privately twice or thrice a day, ever\r","since the death of Hermione, visited that removed\r","house. Shall we thither and with our company piece\r","the rejoicing?\r","\r","First Gentleman:\r","Who would be thence that has the benefit of access?\r","every wink of an eye some new grace will be born:\r","our absence makes us unthrifty to our knowledge.\r","Let's along.\r","\r","AUTOLYCUS:\r","Now, had I not the dash of my former life in me,\r","would preferment drop on my head. I brought the old\r","man and his son aboard the prince: told him I heard\r","them talk of a fardel and I know not what: but he\r","at that time, overfond of the shepherd's daughter,\r","so he then took her to be, who began to be much\r","sea-sick, and himself little better, extremity of\r","weather continuing, this mystery remained\r","undiscovered. But 'tis all one to me; for had I\r","been the finder out of this secret, it would not\r","have relished among my other discredits.\r","Here come those I have done good to against my will,\r","and already appearing in the blossoms of their fortune.\r","\r","Shepherd:\r","Come, boy; I am past moe children, but thy sons and\r","daughters will be all gentlemen born.\r","\r","Clown:\r","You are well met, sir. You denied to fight with me\r","this other day, because I was no gentleman born.\r","See you these clothes? say you see them not and\r","think me still no gentleman born: you were best say\r","these robes are not gentlemen born: give me the\r","lie, do, and try whether I am not now a gentleman born.\r","\r","AUTOLYCUS:\r","I know you are now, sir, a gentleman born.\r","\r","Clown:\r","Ay, and have been so any time these four hours.\r","\r","Shepherd:\r","And so have I, boy.\r","\r","Clown:\r","So you have: but I was a gentleman born before my\r","father; for the king's son took me by the hand, and\r","called me brother; and then the two kings called my\r","father brother; and then the prince my brother and\r","the princess my sister called my father father; and\r","so we wept, and there was the first gentleman-like\r","tears that ever we shed.\r","\r","Shepherd:\r","We may live, son, to shed many more.\r","\r","Clown:\r","Ay; or else 'twere hard luck, being in so\r","preposterous estate as we are.\r","\r","AUTOLYCUS:\r","I humbly beseech you, sir, to pardon me all the\r","faults I have committed to your worship and to give\r","me your good report to the prince my master.\r","\r","Shepherd:\r","Prithee, son, do; for we must be gentle, now we are\r","gentlemen.\r","\r","Clown:\r","Thou wilt amend thy life?\r","\r","AUTOLYCUS:\r","Ay, an it like your good worship.\r","\r","Clown:\r","Give me thy hand: I will swear to the prince thou\r","art as honest a true fellow as any is in Bohemia.\r","\r","Shepherd:\r","You may say it, but not swear it.\r","\r","Clown:\r","Not swear it, now I am a gentleman?
