'Bless you, good father friar.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","And you, good brother father. What offence hath\r","this man made you, sir?\r","\r","ELBOW:\r","Marry, sir, he hath offended the law: and, sir, we\r","take him to be a thief too, sir; for we have found\r","upon him, sir, a strange picklock, which we have\r","sent to the deputy.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","Fie, sirrah! a bawd, a wicked bawd!\r","The evil that thou causest to be done,\r","That is thy means to live. Do thou but think\r","What 'tis to cram a maw or clothe a back\r","From such a filthy vice: say to thyself,\r","From their abominable and beastly touches\r","I drink, I eat, array myself, and live.\r","Canst thou believe thy living is a life,\r","So stinkingly depending? Go mend, go mend.\r","\r","POMPEY:\r","Indeed, it does stink in some sort, sir; but yet,\r","sir, I would prove--\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","Nay, if the devil have given thee proofs for sin,\r","Thou wilt prove his. Take him to prison, officer:\r","Correction and instruction must both work\r","Ere this rude beast will profit.\r","\r","ELBOW:\r","He must before the deputy, sir; he has given him\r","warning: the deputy cannot abide a whoremaster: if\r","he be a whoremonger, and comes before him, he were\r","as good go a mile on his errand.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","That we were all, as some would seem to be,\r","From our faults, as faults from seeming, free!\r","\r","ELBOW:\r","His neck will come to your waist,--a cord, sir.\r","\r","POMPEY:\r","I spy comfort; I cry bail. Here's a gentleman and a\r","friend of mine.\r","\r","LUCIO:\r","How now, noble Pompey! What, at the wheels of\r","Caesar? art thou led in triumph? What, is there\r","none of Pygmalion's images, newly made woman, to be\r","had now, for putting the hand in the pocket and\r","extracting it clutch'd? What reply, ha? What\r","sayest thou to this tune, matter and method? Is't\r","not drowned i' the last rain, ha? What sayest\r","thou, Trot? Is the world as it was, man? Which is\r","the way? Is it sad, and few words? or how? The\r","trick of it?\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","Still thus, and thus; still worse!\r","\r","LUCIO:\r","How doth my dear morsel, thy mistress? Procures she\r","still, ha?\r","\r","POMPEY:\r","Troth, sir, she hath eaten up all her beef, and she\r","is herself in the tub.\r","\r","LUCIO:\r","Why, 'tis good; it is the right of it; it must be\r","so: ever your fresh whore and your powdered bawd:\r","an unshunned consequence; it must be so. Art going\r","to prison, Pompey?\r","\r","POMPEY:\r","Yes, faith, sir.\r","\r","LUCIO:\r","Why, 'tis not amiss, Pompey. Farewell: go, say I\r","sent thee thither. For debt, Pompey? or how?\r","\r","ELBOW:\r","For being a bawd, for being a bawd.\r","\r","LUCIO:\r","Well, then, imprison him: if imprisonment be the\r","due of a bawd, why, 'tis his right: bawd is he\r","doubtless, and of antiquity too; bawd-born.\r","Farewell, good Pompey. Commend me to the prison,\r","Pompey: you will turn good husband now, Pompey; you\r","will keep the house.\r","\r","POMPEY:\r","I hope, sir, your good worship will be my bail.\r","\r","LUCIO:\r","No, indeed, will I not, Pompey; it is not the wear.\r","I will pray, Pompey, to increase your bondage: If\r","you take it not patiently, why, your mettle is the\r","more. Adieu, trusty Pompey. 'Bless you, friar.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","And you.\r","\r","LUCIO:\r","Does Bridget paint still, Pompey, ha?\r","\r","ELBOW:\r","Come your ways, sir; come.\r","\r","POMPEY:\r","You will not bail me, then, sir?\r","\r","LUCIO:\r","Then, Pompey, nor now. What news abroad, friar?\r","what news?\r","\r","ELBOW:\r","Come your ways, sir; come.\r","\r","LUCIO:\r","Go to kennel, Pompey; go.\r","What news, friar, of the duke?\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","I know none. Can you tell me of any?\r","\r","LUCIO:\r","Some say he is with the Emperor of Russia; other\r","some, he is in Rome: but where is he, think you?\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","I know not where; but wheresoever, I wish him well.\r","\r","LUCIO:\r","It was a mad fantastical trick of him to steal from\r","the state, and usurp the beggary he was never born\r","to. Lord Angelo dukes it well in his absence; he\r","puts transgression to 't.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","He does well in 't.\r","\r","LUCIO:\r","A little more lenity to lechery would do no harm in\r","him: something too crabbed that way, friar.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","It is too general a vice, and severity must cure it.\r","\r","LUCIO:\r","Yes, in good sooth, the vice is of a great kindred;\r","it is well allied: but it is impossible to extirp\r","it quite, friar, till eating and drinking be put\r","down. They say this Angelo was not made by man and\r","woman after this downright way of creation: is it\r","true, think you?\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","How should he be made, then?\r","\r","LUCIO:\r","Some report a sea-maid spawned him; some, that he\r","was begot between two stock-fishes. But it is\r","certain that when he makes water his urine is\r","congealed ice; that I know to be true: and he is a\r","motion generative; that's infallible.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","You are pleasant, sir, and speak apace.\r","\r","LUCIO:\r","Why, what a ruthless thing is this in him, for the\r","rebellion of a codpiece to take away the life of a\r","man! Would the duke that is absent have done this?\r","Ere he would have hanged a man for the getting a\r","hundred bastards, he would have paid for the nursing\r","a thousand: he had some feeling of the sport: he\r","knew the service, and that instructed him to mercy.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","I never heard the absent duke much detected for\r","women; he was not inclined that way.\r","\r","LUCIO:\r","O, sir, you are deceived.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","'Tis not possible.\r","\r","LUCIO:\r","Who, not the duke? yes, your beggar of fifty; and\r","his use was to put a ducat in her clack-dish: the\r","duke had crotchets in him. He would be drunk too;\r","that let me inform you.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","You do him wrong, surely.\r","\r","LUCIO:\r","Sir, I was an inward of his. A shy fellow was the\r","duke: and I believe I know the cause of his\r","withdrawing.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","What, I prithee, might be the cause?\r","\r","LUCIO:\r","No, pardon; 'tis a secret must be locked within the\r","teeth and the lips: but this I can let you\r","understand, the greater file of the subject held the\r","duke to be wise.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","Wise! why, no question but he was.\r","\r","LUCIO:\r","A very superficial, ignorant, unweighing fellow.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","Either this is the envy in you, folly, or mistaking:\r","the very stream of his life and the business he hath\r","helmed must upon a warranted need give him a better\r","proclamation. Let him be but testimonied in his own\r","bringings-forth, and he shall appear to the\r","envious a scholar, a statesman and a soldier.\r","Therefore you speak unskilfully: or if your\r","knowledge be more it is much darkened in your malice.\r","\r","LUCIO:\r","Sir, I know him, and I love him.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","Love talks with better knowledge, and knowledge with\r","dearer love.\r","\r","LUCIO:\r","Come, sir, I know what I know.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","I can hardly believe that, since you know not what\r","you speak. But, if ever the duke return, as our\r","prayers are he may, let me desire you to make your\r","answer before him. If it be honest you have spoke,\r","you have courage to maintain it: I am bound to call\r","upon you; and, I pray you, your name?\r","\r","LUCIO:\r","Sir, my name is Lucio; well known to the duke.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","He shall know you better, sir, if I may live to\r","report you.\r","\r","LUCIO:\r","I fear you not.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","O, you hope the duke will return no more; or you\r","imagine me too unhurtful an opposite. But indeed I\r","can do you little harm; you'll forswear this again.\r","\r","LUCIO:\r","I'll be hanged first: thou art deceived in me,\r","friar. But no more of this. Canst thou tell if\r","Claudio die to-morrow or no?\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","Why should he die, sir?\r","\r","LUCIO:\r","Why? For filling a bottle with a tundish. I would\r","the duke we talk of were returned again: the\r","ungenitured agent will unpeople the province with\r","continency; sparrows must not build in his\r","house-eaves, because they are lecherous. The duke\r","yet would have dark deeds darkly answered; he would\r","never bring them to light: would he were returned!\r","Marry, this Claudio is condemned for untrussing.\r","Farewell, good friar: I prithee, pray for me. The\r","duke, I say to thee again, would eat mutton on\r","Fridays. He's not past it yet, and I say to thee,\r","he would mouth with a beggar, though she smelt brown\r","bread and garlic: say that I said so. Farewell.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","No might nor greatness in mortality\r","Can censure 'scape; back-wounding calumny\r","The whitest virtue strikes. What king so strong\r","Can tie the gall up in the slanderous tongue?\r","But who comes here?\r","\r","ESCALUS:\r","Go; away with her to prison!\r","\r","MISTRESS OVERDONE:\r","Good my lord, be good to me; your honour is accounted\r","a merciful man; good my lord.\r","\r","ESCALUS:\r","Double and treble admonition, and still forfeit in\r","the same kind! This would make mercy swear and play\r","the tyrant.\r","\r","Provost:\r","A bawd of eleven years' continuance, may it please\r","your honour.\r","\r","MISTRESS OVERDONE:\r","My lord, this is one Lucio's information against me.\r","Mistress Kate Keepdown was with child by him in the\r","duke's time; he promised her marriage: his child\r","is a year and a quarter old, come Philip and Jacob:\r","I have kept it myself; and see how he goes about to abuse me!\r","\r","ESCALUS:\r","That fellow is a fellow of much licence: let him be\r","called before us. Away with her to prison! Go to;\r","no more words.\r","Provost, my brother Angelo will not be altered;\r","Claudio must die to-morrow: let him be furnished\r","with divines, and have all charitable preparation.\r","if my brother wrought by my pity, it should not be\r","so with him.\r","\r","Provost:\r","So please you, this friar hath been with him, and\r","advised him for the entertainment of death.\r","\r","ESCALUS:\r","Good even, good father.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","Bliss and goodness on you!\r","\r","ESCALUS:\r","Of whence are you?\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","Not of this country, though my chance is now\r","To use it for my time: I am a brother\r","Of gracious order, late come from the See\r","In special business from his holiness.\r","\r","ESCALUS:\r","What news abroad i' the world?\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","None, but that there is so great a fever on\r","goodness, that the dissolution of it must cure it:\r","novelty is only in request; and it is as dangerous\r","to be aged in any kind of course, as it is virtuous\r","to be constant in any undertaking. There is scarce\r","truth enough alive to make societies secure; but\r","security enough to make fellowships accurst: much\r","upon this riddle runs the wisdom of the world. This\r","news is old enough, yet it is every day's news. I\r","pray you, sir, of what disposition was the duke?\r","\r","ESCALUS:\r","One that, above all other strifes, contended\r","especially to know himself.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","What pleasure was he given to?\r","\r","ESCALUS:\r","Rather rejoicing to see another merry, than merry at\r","any thing which professed to make him rejoice: a\r","gentleman of all temperance. But leave we him to\r","his events, with a prayer they may prove prosperous;\r","and let me desire to know how you find Claudio\r","prepared. I am made to understand that you have\r","lent him visitation.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","He professes to have received no sinister measure\r","from his judge, but most willingly humbles himself\r","to the determination of justice: yet had he framed\r","to himself, by the instruction of his frailty, many\r","deceiving promises of life; which I by my good\r","leisure have discredited to him, and now is he\r","resolved to die.\r","\r","ESCALUS:\r","You have paid the heavens your function, and the\r","prisoner the very debt of your calling. I have\r","laboured for the poor gentleman to the extremest\r","shore of my modesty: but my brother justice have I\r","found so severe, that he hath forced me to tell him\r","he is indeed Justice.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","If his own life answer the straitness of his\r","proceeding, it shall become him well; wherein if he\r","chance to fail, he hath sentenced himself.\r","\r","ESCALUS:\r","I am going to visit the prisoner. Fare you well.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","Peace be with you!\r","He who the sword of heaven will bear\r","Should be as holy as severe;\r","Pattern in himself to know,\r","Grace to stand, and virtue go;\r","More nor less to others paying\r","Than by self-offences weighing.\r","Shame to him whose cruel striking\r","Kills for faults of his own liking!\r","Twice treble shame on Angelo,\r","To weed my vice and let his grow!\r","O, what may man within him hide,\r","Though angel on the outward side!\r","How may likeness made in crimes,\r","Making practise on the times,\r","To draw with idle spiders' strings\r","Most ponderous and substantial things!\r","Craft against vice I must apply:\r","With Angelo to-night shall lie\r","His old betrothed but despised;\r","So disguise shall, by the disguised,\r","Pay with falsehood false exacting,\r","And perform an old contracting.\r","\r","\r","MARIANA:\r","Break off thy song, and haste thee quick away:\r","Here comes a man of comfort, whose advice\r","Hath often still'd my brawling discontent.\r","I cry you mercy, sir; and well could wish\r","You had not found me here so musical:\r","Let me excuse me, and believe me so,\r","My mirth it much displeased, but pleased my woe.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","'Tis good; though music oft hath such a charm\r","To make bad good, and good provoke to harm.\r","I pray, you, tell me, hath any body inquired\r","for me here to-day? much upon this time have\r","I promised here to meet.\r","\r","MARIANA:\r","You have not been inquired after:\r","I have sat here all day.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","I do constantly believe you. The time is come even\r","now. I shall crave your forbearance a little: may\r","be I will call upon you anon, for some advantage to yourself.\r","\r","MARIANA:\r","I am always bound to you.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","Very well met, and well come.\r","What is the news from this good deputy?\r","\r","ISABELLA:\r","He hath a garden circummured with brick,\r","Whose western side is with a vineyard back'd;\r","And to that vineyard is a planched gate,\r","That makes his opening with this bigger key:\r","This other doth command a little door\r","Which from the vineyard to the garden leads;\r","There have I made my promise\r","Upon the heavy middle of the night\r","To call upon him.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","But shall you on your knowledge find this way?\r","\r","ISABELLA:\r","I have ta'en a due and wary note upon't:\r","With whispering and most guilty diligence,\r","In action all of precept, he did show me\r","The way twice o'er.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","Are there no other tokens\r","Between you 'greed concerning her observance?\r","\r","ISABELLA:\r","No, none, but only a repair i' the dark;\r","And that I have possess'd him my most stay\r","Can be but brief; for I have made him know\r","I have a servant comes with me along,\r","That stays upon me, whose persuasion is\r","I come about my brother.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","'Tis well borne up.\r","I have not yet made known to Mariana\r","A word of this. What, ho! within! come forth!\r","I pray you, be acquainted with this maid;\r","She comes to do you good.\r","\r","ISABELLA:\r","I do desire the like.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","Do you persuade yourself that I respect you?\r","\r","MARIANA:\r","Good friar, I know you do, and have found it.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","Take, then, this your companion by the hand,\r","Who hath a story ready for your ear.\r","I shall attend your leisure: but make haste;\r","The vaporous night approaches.\r","\r","MARIANA:\r","Will't please you walk aside?\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","O place and greatness! millions of false eyes\r","Are stuck upon thee: volumes of report\r","Run with these false and most contrarious quests\r","Upon thy doings: thousand escapes of wit\r","Make thee the father of their idle dreams\r","And rack thee in their fancies.\r","Welcome, how agreed?\r","\r","ISABELLA:\r","She'll take the enterprise upon her, father,\r","If you advise it.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","It is not my consent,\r","But my entreaty too.\r","\r","ISABELLA:\r","Little have you to say\r","When you depart from him, but, soft and low,\r","'Remember now my brother.'\r","\r","MARIANA:\r","Fear me not.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","Nor, gentle daughter, fear you not at all.\r","He is your husband on a pre-contract:\r","To bring you thus together, 'tis no sin,\r","Sith that the justice of your title to him\r","Doth flourish the deceit. Come, let us go:\r","Our corn's to reap, for yet our tithe's to sow.\r","\r","Provost:\r","Come hither, sirrah. Can you cut off a man's head?\r","\r","POMPEY:\r","If the man be a bachelor, sir, I can; but if he be a\r","married man, he's his wife's head, and I can never\r","cut off a woman's head.\r","\r","Provost:\r","Come, sir, leave me your snatches, and yield me a\r","direct answer. To-morrow morning are to die Claudio\r","and Barnardine. Here is in our prison a common\r","executioner, who in his office lacks a helper: if\r","you will take it on you to assist him, it shall\r","redeem you from your gyves; if not, you shall have\r","your full time of imprisonment and your deliverance\r","with an unpitied whipping, for you have been a\r","notorious bawd.\r","\r","POMPEY:\r","Sir, I have been an unlawful bawd time out of mind;\r","but yet I will be content to be a lawful hangman. I\r","would be glad to receive some instruction from my\r","fellow partner.\r","\r","Provost:\r","What, ho! Abhorson! Where's Abhorson, there?\r","\r","ABHORSON:\r","Do you call, sir?\r","\r","Provost:\r","Sirrah, here's a fellow will help you to-morrow in\r","your execution. If you think it meet, compound with\r","him by the year, and let him abide here with you; if\r","not, use him for the present and dismiss him. He\r","cannot plead his estimation with you; he hath been a bawd.\r","\r","ABHORSON:\r","A bawd, sir? fie upon him! he will discredit our mystery.\r","\r","Provost:\r","Go to, sir; you weigh equally; a feather will turn\r","the scale.\r","\r","POMPEY:\r","Pray, sir, by your good favour,--for surely, sir, a\r","good favour you have, but that you have a hanging\r","look,--do you call, sir, your occupation a mystery?\r","\r","ABHORSON:\r","Ay, sir; a mystery\r","\r","POMPEY:\r","Painting, sir, I have heard say, is a mystery; and\r","your whores, sir, being members of my occupation,\r","using painting, do prove my occupation a mystery:\r","but what mystery there should be in hanging, if I\r","should be hanged, I cannot imagine.\r","\r","ABHORSON:\r","Sir, it is a mystery.\r","\r","POMPEY:\r","Proof?\r","\r","ABHORSON:\r","Every true man's apparel fits your thief: if it be\r","too little for your thief, your true man thinks it\r","big enough; if it be too big for your thief, your\r","thief thinks it little enough: so every true man's\r","apparel fits your thief.\r","\r","Provost:\r","Are you agreed?\r","\r","POMPEY:\r","Sir, I will serve him; for I do find your hangman is\r","a more penitent trade than your bawd; he doth\r","oftener ask forgiveness.\r","\r","Provost:\r","You, sirrah, provide your block and your axe\r","to-morrow four o'clock.\r","\r","ABHORSON:\r","Come on, bawd; I will instruct thee in my trade; follow.\r","\r","POMPEY:\r","I do desire to learn, sir: and I hope, if you have\r","occasion to use me for your own turn, you shall find\r","me yare; for truly, sir, for your kindness I owe you\r","a good turn.\r","\r","Provost:\r","Call hither Barnardine and Claudio:\r","The one has my pity; not a jot the other,\r","Being a murderer, though he were my brother.\r","Look, here's the warrant, Claudio, for thy death:\r","'Tis now dead midnight, and by eight to-morrow\r","Thou must be made immortal. Where's Barnardine?\r","\r","CLAUDIO:\r","As fast lock'd up in sleep as guiltless labour\r","When it lies starkly in the traveller's bones:\r","He will not wake.\r","\r","Provost:\r","Who can do good on him?\r","Well, go, prepare yourself.\r","But, hark, what noise?\r","Heaven give your spirits comfort!\r","By and by.\r","I hope it is some pardon or reprieve\r","For the most gentle Claudio.\r","Welcome father.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","The best and wholesomest spirts of the night\r","Envelope you, good Provost! Who call'd here of late?\r","\r","Provost:\r","None, since the curfew rung.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","Not Isabel?\r","\r","Provost:\r","No.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","They will, then, ere't be long.\r","\r","Provost:\r","What comfort is for Claudio?\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","There's some in hope.\r","\r","Provost:\r","It is a bitter deputy.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","Not so, not so; his life is parallel'd\r","Even with the stroke and line of his great justice:\r","He doth with holy abstinence subdue\r","That in himself which he spurs on his power\r","To qualify in others: were he meal'd with that\r","Which he corrects, then were he tyrannous;\r","But this being so, he's just.\r","Now are they come.\r","This is a gentle provost: seldom when\r","The steeled gaoler is the friend of men.\r","How now! what noise? That spirit's possessed with haste\r","That wounds the unsisting postern with these strokes.\r","\r","Provost:\r","There he must stay until the officer\r","Arise to let him in: he is call'd up.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","Have you no countermand for Claudio yet,\r","But he must die to-morrow?\r","\r","Provost:\r","None, sir, none.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","As near the dawning, provost, as it is,\r","You shall hear more ere morning.\r","\r","Provost:\r","Happily\r","You something know; yet I believe there comes\r","No countermand; no such example have we:\r","Besides, upon the very siege of justice\r","Lord Angelo hath to the public ear\r","Profess'd the contrary.\r","This is his lordship's man.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","And here comes Claudio's pardon.\r","\r","Messenger:\r","\r","Provost:\r","I shall obey him.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","\r","Provost:\r","I told you. Lord Angelo, belike thinking me remiss\r","in mine office, awakens me with this unwonted\r","putting-on; methinks strangely, for he hath not used it before.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","Pray you, let's hear.\r","\r","Provost:\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","What is that Barnardine who is to be executed in the\r","afternoon?\r","\r","Provost:\r","A Bohemian born, but here nursed un and bred; one\r","that is a prisoner nine years old.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","How came it that the absent duke had not either\r","delivered him to his liberty or executed him? I\r","have heard it was ever his manner to do so.\r","\r","Provost:\r","His friends still wrought reprieves for him: and,\r","indeed, his fact, till now in the government of Lord\r","Angelo, came not to an undoubtful proof.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","It is now apparent?\r","\r","Provost:\r","Most manifest, and not denied by himself.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","Hath he born himself penitently in prison? how\r","seems he to be touched?\r","\r","Provost:\r","A man that apprehends death no more dreadfully but\r","as a drunken sleep; careless, reckless, and fearless\r","of what's past, present, or to come; insensible of\r","mortality, and desperately mortal.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","He wants advice.\r","\r","Provost:\r","He will hear none: he hath evermore had the liberty\r","of the prison; give him leave to escape hence, he\r","would not: drunk many times a day, if not many days\r","entirely drunk. We have very oft awaked him, as if\r","to carry him to execution, and showed him a seeming\r","warrant for it: it hath not moved him at all.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","More of him anon. There is written in your brow,\r","provost, honesty and constancy: if I read it not\r","truly, my ancient skill beguiles me; but, in the\r","boldness of my cunning, I will lay myself in hazard.\r","Claudio, whom here you have warrant to execute, is\r","no greater forfeit to the law than Angelo who hath\r","sentenced him. To make you understand this in a\r","manifested effect, I crave but four days' respite;\r","for the which you are to do me both a present and a\r","dangerous courtesy.\r","\r","Provost:\r","Pray, sir, in what?\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","In the delaying death.\r","\r","Provost:\r","A lack, how may I do it, having the hour limited,\r","and an express command, under penalty, to deliver\r","his head in the view of Angelo? I may make my case\r","as Claudio's, to cross this in the smallest.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","By the vow of mine order I warrant you, if my\r","instructions may be your guide. Let this Barnardine\r","be this morning executed, and his head born to Angelo.\r","\r","Provost:\r","Angelo hath seen them both, and will discover the favour.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","O, death's a great disguiser; and you may add to it.\r","Shave the head, and tie the beard; and say it was\r","the desire of the penitent to be so bared before his\r","death: you know the course is common. If any thing\r","fall to you upon this, more than thanks and good\r","fortune, by the saint whom I profess, I will plead\r","against it with my life.\r","\r","Provost:\r","Pardon me, good father; it is against my oath.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","Were you sworn to the duke, or to the deputy?\r","\r","Provost:\r","To him, and to his substitutes.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","You will think you have made no offence, if the duke\r","avouch the justice of your dealing?\r","\r","Provost:\r","But what likelihood is in that?\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","Not a resemblance, but a certainty. Yet since I see\r","you fearful, that neither my coat, integrity, nor\r","persuasion can with ease attempt you, I will go\r","further than I meant, to pluck all fears out of you.\r","Look you, sir, here is the hand and seal of the\r","duke: you know the character, I doubt not; and the\r","signet is not strange to you.\r","\r","Provost:\r","I know them both.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","The contents of this is the return of the duke: you\r","shall anon over-read it at your pleasure; where you\r","shall find, within these two days he will be here.\r","This is a thing that Angelo knows not; for he this\r","very day receives letters of strange tenor;\r","perchance of the duke's death; perchance entering\r","into some monastery; but, by chance, nothing of what\r","is writ. Look, the unfolding star calls up the\r","shepherd. Put not yourself into amazement how these\r","things should be: all difficulties are but easy\r","when they are known. Call your executioner, and off\r","with Barnardine's head: I will give him a present\r","shrift and advise him for a better place. Yet you\r","are amazed; but this shall absolutely resolve you.\r","Come away; it is almost clear dawn.\r","\r","POMPEY:\r","I am as well acquainted here as I was in our house\r","of profession: one would think it were Mistress\r","Overdone's own house, for here be many of her old\r","customers. First, here's young Master Rash; he's in\r","for a commodity of brown paper and old ginger,\r","ninescore and seventeen pounds; of which he made\r","five marks, ready money: marry, then ginger was not\r","much in request, for the old women were all dead.\r","Then is there here one Master Caper, at the suit of\r","Master Three-pile the mercer, for some four suits of\r","peach-coloured satin, which now peaches him a\r","beggar. Then have we here young Dizy, and young\r","Master Deep-vow, and Master Copperspur, and Master\r","Starve-lackey the rapier and dagger man, and young\r","Drop-heir that killed lusty Pudding, and Master\r","Forthlight the tilter, and brave Master Shooty the\r","great traveller, and wild Half-can that stabbed\r","Pots, and, I think, forty more; all great doers in\r","our trade, and are now 'for the Lord's sake.'\r","\r","ABHORSON:\r","Sirrah, bring Barnardine hither.\r","\r","POMPEY:\r","Master Barnardine! you must rise and be hanged.\r","Master Barnardine!\r","\r","ABHORSON:\r","What, ho, Barnardine!\r","\r","BARNARDINE:\r","\r","POMPEY:\r","Your friends, sir; the hangman. You must be so\r","good, sir, to rise and be put to death.\r","\r","BARNARDINE:\r","\r","ABHORSON:\r","Tell him he must awake, and that quickly too.\r","\r","POMPEY:\r","Pray, Master Barnardine, awake till you are\r","executed, and sleep afterwards.\r","\r","ABHORSON:\r","Go in to him, and fetch him out.\r","\r","POMPEY:\r","He is coming, sir, he is coming; I hear his straw rustle.\r","\r","ABHORSON:\r","Is the axe upon the block, sirrah?\r","\r","POMPEY:\r","Very ready, sir.\r","\r","BARNARDINE:\r","How now, Abhorson? what's the news with you?\r","\r","ABHORSON:\r","Truly, sir, I would desire you to clap into your\r","prayers; for, look you, the warrant's come.\r","\r","BARNARDINE:\r","You rogue, I have been drinking all night; I am not\r","fitted for 't.\r","\r","POMPEY:\r","O, the better, sir; for he that drinks all night,\r","and is hanged betimes in the morning, may sleep the\r","sounder all the next day.\r","\r","ABHORSON:\r","Look you, sir; here comes your ghostly father: do\r","we jest now, think you?\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","Sir, induced by my charity, and hearing how hastily\r","you are to depart, I am come to advise you, comfort\r","you and pray with you.\r","\r","BARNARDINE:\r","Friar, not I I have been drinking hard all night,\r","and I will have more time to prepare me, or they\r","shall beat out my brains with billets: I will not\r","consent to die this day, that's certain.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","O, sir, you must: and therefore I beseech you\r","Look forward on the journey you shall go.\r","\r","BARNARDINE:\r","I swear I will not die to-day for any man's\r","persuasion.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","But hear you.\r","\r","BARNARDINE:\r","Not a word: if you have any thing to say to me,\r","come to my ward; for thence will not I to-day.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","Unfit to live or die: O gravel heart!\r","After him, fellows; bring him to the block.\r","\r","Provost:\r","Now, sir, how do you find the prisoner?\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","A creature unprepared, unmeet for death;\r","And to transport him in the mind he is\r","Were damnable.\r","\r","Provost:\r","Here in the prison, father,\r","There died this morning of a cruel fever\r","One Ragozine, a most notorious pirate,\r","A man of Claudio's years; his beard and head\r","Just of his colour. What if we do omit\r","This reprobate till he were well inclined;\r","And satisfy the deputy with the visage\r","Of Ragozine, more like to Claudio?\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","O, 'tis an accident that heaven provides!\r","Dispatch it presently; the hour draws on\r","Prefix'd by Angelo: see this be done,\r","And sent according to command; whiles I\r","Persuade this rude wretch willingly to die.\r","\r","Provost:\r","This shall be done, good father, presently.\r","But Barnardine must die this afternoon:\r","And how shall we continue Claudio,\r","To save me from the danger that might come\r","If he were known alive?\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","Let this be done.\r","Put them in secret holds, both Barnardine and Claudio:\r","Ere twice the sun hath made his journal greeting\r","To the under generation, you shall find\r","Your safety manifested.\r","\r","Provost:\r","I am your free dependant.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","Quick, dispatch, and send the head to Angelo.\r","Now will I write letters to Angelo,--\r","The provost, he shall bear them, whose contents\r","Shall witness to him I am near at home,\r","And that, by great injunctions, I am bound\r","To enter publicly: him I'll desire\r","To meet me at the consecrated fount\r","A league below the city; and from thence,\r","By cold gradation and well-balanced form,\r","We shall proceed with Angelo.\r","\r","Provost:\r","Here is the head; I'll carry it myself.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","Convenient is it. Make a swift return;\r","For I would commune with you of such things\r","That want no ear but yours.\r","\r","Provost:\r","I'll make all speed.\r","\r","ISABELLA:\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","The tongue of Isabel. She's come to know\r","If yet her brother's pardon be come hither:\r","But I will keep her ignorant of her good,\r","To make her heavenly comforts of despair,\r","When it is least expected.\r","\r","ISABELLA:\r","Ho, by your leave!\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","Good morning to you, fair and gracious daughter.\r","\r","ISABELLA:\r","The better, given me by so holy a man.\r","Hath yet the deputy sent my brother's pardon?\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","He hath released him, Isabel, from the world:\r","His head is off and sent to Angelo.\r","\r","ISABELLA:\r","Nay, but it is not so.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","It is no other: show your wisdom, daughter,\r","In your close patience.\r","\r","ISABELLA:\r","O, I will to him and pluck out his eyes!\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","You shall not be admitted to his sight.\r","\r","ISABELLA:\r","Unhappy Claudio! wretched Isabel!\r","Injurious world! most damned Angelo!\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","This nor hurts him nor profits you a jot;\r","Forbear it therefore; give your cause to heaven.\r","Mark what I say, which you shall find\r","By every syllable a faithful verity:\r","The duke comes home to-morrow; nay, dry your eyes;\r","One of our convent, and his confessor,\r","Gives me this instance: already he hath carried\r","Notice to Escalus and Angelo,\r","Who do prepare to meet him at the gates,\r","There to give up their power. If you can, pace your wisdom\r","In that good path that I would wish it go,\r","And you shall have your bosom on this wretch,\r","Grace of the duke, revenges to your heart,\r","And general honour.\r","\r","ISABELLA:\r","I am directed by you.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","This letter, then, to Friar Peter give;\r","'Tis that he sent me of the duke's return:\r","Say, by this token, I desire his company\r","At Mariana's house to-night. Her cause and yours\r","I'll perfect him withal, and he shall bring you\r","Before the duke, and to the head of Angelo\r","Accuse him home and home. For my poor self,\r","I am combined by a sacred vow\r","And shall be absent. Wend you with this letter:\r","Command these fretting waters from your eyes\r","With a light heart; trust not my holy order,\r","If I pervert your course. Who's here?\r","\r","LUCIO:\r","Good even. Friar, where's the provost?\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","Not within, sir.\r","\r","LUCIO:\r","O pretty Isabella, I am pale at mine heart to see\r","thine eyes so red: thou must be patient. I am fain\r","to dine and sup with water and bran; I dare not for\r","my head fill my belly; one fruitful meal would set\r","me to 't. But they say the duke will be here\r","to-morrow. By my troth, Isabel, I loved thy brother:\r","if the old fantastical duke of dark corners had been\r","at home, he had lived.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","Sir, the duke is marvellous little beholding to your\r","reports; but the best is, he lives not in them.\r","\r","LUCIO:\r","Friar, thou knowest not the duke so well as I do:\r","he's a better woodman than thou takest him for.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","Well, you'll answer this one day. Fare ye well.\r","\r","LUCIO:\r","Nay, tarry; I'll go along with thee\r","I can tell thee pretty tales of the duke.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","You have told me too many of him already, sir, if\r","they be true; if not true, none were enough.\r","\r","LUCIO:\r","I was once before him for getting a wench with child.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","Did you such a thing?\r","\r","LUCIO:\r","Yes, marry, did I but I was fain to forswear it;\r","they would else have married me to the rotten medlar.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","Sir, your company is fairer than honest. Rest you well.\r","\r","LUCIO:\r","By my troth, I'll go with thee to the lane's end:\r","if bawdy talk offend you, we'll have very little of\r","it. Nay, friar, I am a kind of burr; I shall stick.\r","\r","ESCALUS:\r","Every letter he hath writ hath disvouched other.\r","\r","ANGELO:\r","In most uneven and distracted manner. His actions\r","show much like to madness: pray heaven his wisdom be\r","not tainted! And why meet him at the gates, and\r","redeliver our authorities there\r","\r","ESCALUS:\r","I guess not.\r","\r","ANGELO:\r","And why should we proclaim it in an hour before his\r","entering, that if any crave redress of injustice,\r","they should exhibit their petitions in the street?\r","\r","ESCALUS:\r","He shows his reason for that: to have a dispatch of\r","complaints, and to deliver us from devices\r","hereafter, which shall then have no power to stand\r","against us.\r","\r","ANGELO:\r","Well, I beseech you, let it be proclaimed betimes\r","i' the morn; I'll call you at your house: give\r","notice to such men of sort and suit as are to meet\r","him.\r","\r","ESCALUS:\r","I shall, sir. Fare you well.\r","\r","ANGELO:\r","Good night.\r","This deed unshapes me quite, makes me unpregnant\r","And dull to all proceedings. A deflower'd maid!\r","And by an eminent body that enforced\r","The law against it! But that her tender shame\r","Will not proclaim against her maiden loss,\r","How might she tongue me! Yet reason dares her no;\r","For my authority bears of a credent bulk,\r","That no particular scandal once can touch\r","But it confounds the breather. He should have lived,\r","Save that riotous youth, with dangerous sense,\r","Might in the times to come have ta'en revenge,\r","By so receiving a dishonour'd life\r","With ransom of such shame. Would yet he had lived!\r","A lack, when once our grace we have forgot,\r","Nothing goes right: we would, and we would not.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","These letters at fit time deliver me\r","The provost knows our purpose and our plot.\r","The matter being afoot, keep your instruction,\r","And hold you ever to our special drift;\r","Though sometimes you do blench from this to that,\r","As cause doth minister. Go call at Flavius' house,\r","And tell him where I stay: give the like notice\r","To Valentinus, Rowland, and to Crassus,\r","And bid them bring the trumpets to the gate;\r","But send me Flavius first.\r","\r","FRIAR PETER:\r","It shall be speeded well.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","I thank thee, Varrius; thou hast made good haste:\r","Come, we will walk. There's other of our friends\r","Will greet us here anon, my gentle Varrius.\r","\r","ISABELLA:\r","To speak so indirectly I am loath:\r","I would say the truth; but to accuse him so,\r","That is your part: yet I am advised to do it;\r","He says, to veil full purpose.\r","\r","MARIANA:\r","Be ruled by him.\r","\r","ISABELLA:\r","Besides, he tells me that, if peradventure\r","He speak against me on the adverse side,\r","I should not think it strange; for 'tis a physic\r","That's bitter to sweet end.\r","\r","MARIANA:\r","I would Friar Peter--\r","\r","ISABELLA:\r","O, peace! the friar is come.\r","\r","FRIAR PETER:\r","Come, I have found you out a stand most fit,\r","Where you may have such vantage on the duke,\r","He shall not pass you. Twice have the trumpets sounded;\r","The generous and gravest citizens\r","Have hent the gates, and very near upon\r","The duke is entering: therefore, hence, away!\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","My very worthy cousin, fairly met!\r","Our old and faithful friend, we are glad to see you.\r","\r","ANGELO:\r","Happy return be to your royal grace!\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","Many and hearty thankings to you both.\r","We have made inquiry of you; and we hear\r","Such goodness of your justice, that our soul\r","Cannot but yield you forth to public thanks,\r","Forerunning more requital.\r","\r","ANGELO:\r","You make my bonds still greater.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","O, your desert speaks loud; and I should wrong it,\r","To lock it in the wards of covert bosom,\r","When it deserves, with characters of brass,\r","A forted residence 'gainst the tooth of time\r","And razure of oblivion. Give me your hand,\r","And let the subject see, to make them know\r","That outward courtesies would fain proclaim\r","Favours that keep within. Come, Escalus,\r","You must walk by us on our other hand;\r","And good supporters are you.\r","\r","FRIAR PETER:\r","Now is your time: speak loud and kneel before him.\r","\r","ISABELLA:\r","Justice, O royal duke! Vail your regard\r","Upon a wrong'd, I would fain have said, a maid!\r","O worthy prince, dishonour not your eye\r","By throwing it on any other object\r","Till you have heard me in my true complaint\r","And given me justice, justice, justice, justice!\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","Relate your wrongs; in what? by whom? be brief.\r","Here is Lord Angelo shall give you justice:\r","Reveal yourself to him.\r","\r","ISABELLA:\r","O worthy duke,\r","You bid me seek redemption of the devil:\r","Hear me yourself; for that which I must speak\r","Must either punish me, not being believed,\r","Or wring redress from you. Hear me, O hear me, here!\r","\r","ANGELO:\r","My lord, her wits, I fear me, are not firm:\r","She hath been a suitor to me for her brother\r","Cut off by course of justice,--\r","\r","ISABELLA:\r","By course of justice!\r","\r","ANGELO:\r","And she will speak most bitterly and strange.\r","\r","ISABELLA:\r","Most strange, but yet most truly, will I speak:\r","That Angelo's forsworn; is it not strange?\r","That Angelo's a murderer; is 't not strange?\r","That Angelo is an adulterous thief,\r","An hypocrite, a virgin-violator;\r","Is it not strange and strange?\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","Nay, it is ten times strange.\r","\r","ISABELLA:\r","It is not truer he is Angelo\r","Than this is all as true as it is strange:\r","Nay, it is ten times true; for truth is truth\r","To the end of reckoning.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","Away with her! Poor soul,\r","She speaks this in the infirmity of sense.\r","\r","ISABELLA:\r","O prince, I conjure thee, as thou believest\r","There is another comfort than this world,\r","That thou neglect me not, with that opinion\r","That I am touch'd with madness! Make not impossible\r","That which but seems unlike: 'tis not impossible\r","But one, the wicked'st caitiff on the ground,\r","May seem as shy, as grave, as just, as absolute\r","As Angelo; even so may Angelo,\r","In all his dressings, characts, titles, forms,\r","Be an arch-villain; believe it, royal prince:\r","If he be less, he's nothing; but he's more,\r","Had I more name for badness.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","By mine honesty,\r","If she be mad,--as I believe no other,--\r","Her madness hath the oddest frame of sense,\r","Such a dependency of thing on thing,\r","As e'er I heard in madness.\r","\r","ISABELLA:\r","O gracious duke,\r","Harp not on that, nor do not banish reason\r","For inequality; but let your reason serve\r","To make the truth appear where it seems hid,\r","And hide the false seems true.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","Many that are not mad\r","Have, sure, more lack of reason. What would you say?\r","\r","ISABELLA:\r","I am the sister of one Claudio,\r","Condemn'd upon the act of fornication\r","To lose his head; condemn'd by Angelo:\r","I, in probation of a sisterhood,\r","Was sent to by my brother; one Lucio\r","As then the messenger,--\r","\r","LUCIO:\r","That's I, an't like your grace:\r","I came to her from Claudio, and desired her\r","To try her gracious fortune with Lord Angelo\r","For her poor brother's pardon.\r","\r","ISABELLA:\r","That's he indeed.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","You were not bid to speak.\r","\r","LUCIO:\r","No, my good lord;\r","Nor wish'd to hold my peace.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","I wish you now, then;\r","Pray you, take note of it: and when you have\r","A business for yourself, pray heaven you then\r","Be perfect.\r","\r","LUCIO:\r","I warrant your honour.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","The warrants for yourself; take heed to't.\r","\r","ISABELLA:\r","This gentleman told somewhat of my tale,--\r","\r","LUCIO:\r","Right.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","It may be right; but you are i' the wrong\r","To speak before your time. Proceed.\r","\r","ISABELLA:\r","I went\r","To this pernicious caitiff deputy,--\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","That's somewhat madly spoken.\r","\r","ISABELLA:\r","Pardon it;\r","The phrase is to the matter.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","Mended again. The matter; proceed.\r","\r","ISABELLA:\r","In brief, to set the needless process by,\r","How I persuaded, how I pray'd, and kneel'd,\r","How he refell'd me, and how I replied,--\r","For this was of much length,--the vile conclusion\r","I now begin with grief and shame to utter:\r","He would not, but by gift of my chaste body\r","To his concupiscible intemperate lust,\r","Release my brother; and, after much debatement,\r","My sisterly remorse confutes mine honour,\r","And I did yield to him: but the next morn betimes,\r","His purpose surfeiting, he sends a warrant\r","For my poor brother's head.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","This is most likely!\r","\r","ISABELLA:\r","O, that it were as like as it is true!\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","By heaven, fond wretch, thou knowist not what thou speak'st,\r","Or else thou art suborn'd against his honour\r","In hateful practise. First, his integrity\r","Stands without blemish. Next, it imports no reason\r","That with such vehemency he should pursue\r","Faults proper to himself: if he had so offended,\r","He would have weigh'd thy brother by himself\r","And not have cut him off. Some one hath set you on:\r","Confess the truth, and say by whose advice\r","Thou camest here to complain.\r","\r","ISABELLA:\r","And is this all?\r","Then, O you blessed ministers above,\r","Keep me in patience, and with ripen'd time\r","Unfold the evil which is here wrapt up\r","In countenance! Heaven shield your grace from woe,\r","As I, thus wrong'd, hence unbelieved go!\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","I know you'ld fain be gone. An officer!\r","To prison with her! Shall we thus permit\r","A blasting and a scandalous breath to fall\r","On him so near us? This needs must be a practise.\r","Who knew of Your intent and coming hither?\r","\r","ISABELLA:\r","One that I would were here, Friar Lodowick.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","A ghostly father, belike. Who knows that Lodowick?\r","\r","LUCIO:\r","My lord, I know him; 'tis a meddling friar;\r","I do not like the man: had he been lay, my lord\r","For certain words he spake against your grace\r","In your retirement, I had swinged him soundly.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","Words against me? this is a good friar, belike!\r","And to set on this wretched woman here\r","Against our substitute! Let this friar be found.\r","\r","LUCIO:\r","But yesternight, my lord, she and that friar,\r","I saw them at the prison: a saucy friar,\r","A very scurvy fellow.\r","\r","FRIAR PETER:\r","Blessed be your royal grace!\r","I have stood by, my lord, and I have heard\r","Your royal ear abused. First, hath this woman\r","Most wrongfully accused your substitute,\r","Who is as free from touch or soil with her\r","As she from one ungot.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","We did believe no less.\r","Know you that Friar Lodowick that she speaks of?\r","\r","FRIAR PETER:\r","I know him for a man divine and holy;\r","Not scurvy, nor a temporary meddler,\r","As he's reported by this gentleman;\r","And, on my trust, a man that never yet\r","Did, as he vouches, misreport your grace.\r","\r","LUCIO:\r","My lord, most villanously; believe it.\r","\r","FRIAR PETER:\r","Well, he in time may come to clear himself;\r","But at this instant he is sick my lord,\r","Of a strange fever. Upon his mere request,\r","Being come to knowledge that there was complaint\r","Intended 'gainst Lord Angelo, came I hither,\r","To speak, as from his mouth, what he doth know\r","Is true and false; and what he with his oath\r","And all probation will make up full clear,\r","Whensoever he's convented. First, for this woman.\r","To justify this worthy nobleman,\r","So vulgarly and personally accused,\r","Her shall you hear disproved to her eyes,\r","Till she herself confess it.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","Good friar, let's hear it.\r","Do you not smile at this, Lord Angelo?\r","O heaven, the vanity of wretched fools!\r","Give us some seats. Come, cousin Angelo;\r","In this I'll be impartial; be you judge\r","Of your own cause. Is this the witness, friar?\r","First, let her show her face, and after speak.\r","\r","MARIANA:\r","Pardon, my lord; I will not show my face\r","Until my husband bid me.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","What, are you married?\r","\r","MARIANA:\r","No, my lord.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","Are you a maid?\r","\r","MARIANA:\r","No, my lord.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","A widow, then?\r","\r","MARIANA:\r","Neither, my lord.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","Why, you are nothing then: neither maid, widow, nor wife?\r","\r","LUCIO:\r","My lord, she may be a punk; for many of them are\r","neither maid, widow, nor wife.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","Silence that fellow: I would he had some cause\r","To prattle for himself.\r","\r","LUCIO:\r","Well, my lord.\r","\r","MARIANA:\r","My lord; I do confess I ne'er was married;\r","And I confess besides I am no maid:\r","I have known my husband; yet my husband\r","Knows not that ever he knew me.\r","\r","LUCIO:\r","He was drunk then, my lord: it can be no better.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","For the benefit of silence, would thou wert so too!\r","\r","LUCIO:\r","Well, my lord.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","This is no witness for Lord Angelo.\r","\r","MARIANA:\r","Now I come to't my lord\r","She that accuses him of fornication,\r","In self-same manner doth accuse my husband,\r","And charges him my lord, with such a time\r","When I'll depose I had him in mine arms\r","With all the effect of love.\r","\r","ANGELO:\r","Charges she more than me?\r","\r","MARIANA:\r","Not that I know.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","No? you say your husband.\r","\r","MARIANA:\r","Why, just, my lord, and that is Angelo,\r","Who thinks he knows that he ne'er knew my body,\r","But knows he thinks that he knows Isabel's.\r","\r","ANGELO:\r","This is a strange abuse. Let's see thy face.\r","\r","MARIANA:\r","My husband bids me; now I will unmask.\r","This is that face, thou cruel Angelo,\r","Which once thou sworest was worth the looking on;\r","This is the hand which, with a vow'd contract,\r","Was fast belock'd in thine; this is the body\r","That took away the match from Isabel,\r","And did supply thee at thy garden-house\r","In her imagined person.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","Know you this woman?\r","\r","LUCIO:\r","Carnally, she says.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","Sirrah, no more!\r","\r","LUCIO:\r","Enough, my lord.\r","\r","ANGELO:\r","My lord, I must confess I know this woman:\r","And five years since there was some speech of marriage\r","Betwixt myself and her; which was broke off,\r","Partly for that her promised proportions\r","Came short of composition, but in chief\r","For that her reputation was disvalued\r","In levity: since which time of five years\r","I never spake with her, saw her, nor heard from her,\r","Upon my faith and honour.\r","\r","MARIANA:\r","Noble prince,\r","As there comes light from heaven and words from breath,\r","As there is sense in truth and truth in virtue,\r","I am affianced this man's wife as strongly\r","As words could make up vows: and, my good lord,\r","But Tuesday night last gone in's garden-house\r","He knew me as a wife. As this is true,\r","Let me in safety raise me from my knees\r","Or else for ever be confixed here,\r","A marble monument!\r","\r","ANGELO:\r","I did but smile till now:\r","Now, good my lord, give me the scope of justice\r","My patience here is touch'd. I do perceive\r","These poor informal women are no more\r","But instruments of some more mightier member\r","That sets them on: let me have way, my lord,\r","To find this practise out.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","Ay, with my heart\r","And punish them to your height of pleasure.\r","Thou foolish friar, and thou pernicious woman,\r","Compact with her that's gone, think'st thou thy oaths,\r","Though they would swear down each particular saint,\r","Were testimonies against his worth and credit\r","That's seal'd in approbation? You, Lord Escalus,\r","Sit with my cousin; lend him your kind pains\r","To find out this abuse, whence 'tis derived.\r","There is another friar that set them on;\r","Let him be sent for.\r","\r","FRIAR PETER:\r","Would he were here, my lord! for he indeed\r","Hath set the women on to this complaint:\r","Your provost knows the place where he abides\r","And he may fetch him.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","Go do it instantly.\r","And you, my noble and well-warranted cousin,\r","Whom it concerns to hear this matter forth,\r","Do with your injuries as seems you best,\r","In any chastisement: I for a while will leave you;\r","But stir not you till you have well determined\r","Upon these slanderers.\r","\r","ESCALUS:\r","My lord, we'll do it throughly.\r","Signior Lucio, did not you say you knew that\r","Friar Lodowick to be a dishonest person?\r","\r","LUCIO:\r","'Cucullus non facit monachum:' honest in nothing\r","but in his clothes; and one that hath spoke most\r","villanous speeches of the duke.\r","\r","ESCALUS:\r","We shall entreat you to abide here till he come and\r","enforce them against him: we shall find this friar a\r","notable fellow.\r","\r","LUCIO:\r","As any in Vienna, on my word.\r","\r","ESCALUS:\r","Call that same Isabel here once again; I would speak with her.\r","Pray you, my lord, give me leave to question; you\r","shall see how I'll handle her.\r","\r","LUCIO:\r","Not better than he, by her own report.\r","\r","ESCALUS:\r","Say you?\r","\r","LUCIO:\r","Marry, sir, I think, if you handled her privately,\r","she would sooner confess: perchance, publicly,\r","she'll be ashamed.\r","\r","ESCALUS:\r","I will go darkly to work with her.\r","\r","LUCIO:\r","That's the way; for women are light at midnight.\r","\r","ESCALUS:\r","Come on, mistress: here's a gentlewoman denies all\r","that you have said.\r","\r","LUCIO:\r","My lord, here comes the rascal I spoke of; here with\r","the provost.\r","\r","ESCALUS:\r","In very good time: speak not you to him till we\r","call upon you.\r","\r","LUCIO:\r","Mum.\r","\r","ESCALUS:\r","Come, sir: did you set these women on to slander\r","Lord Angelo? they have confessed you did.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","'Tis false.\r","\r","ESCALUS:\r","How! know you where you are?\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","Respect to your great place! and let the devil\r","Be sometime honour'd for his burning throne!\r","Where is the duke? 'tis he should hear me speak.\r","\r","ESCALUS:\r","The duke's in us; and we will hear you speak:\r","Look you speak justly.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","Boldly, at least. But, O, poor souls,\r","Come you to seek the lamb here of the fox?\r","Good night to your redress! Is the duke gone?\r","Then is your cause gone too. The duke's unjust,\r","Thus to retort your manifest appeal,\r","And put your trial in the villain's mouth\r","Which here you come to accuse.\r","\r","LUCIO:\r","This is the rascal; this is he I spoke of.\r","\r","ESCALUS:\r","Why, thou unreverend and unhallow'd friar,\r","Is't not enough thou hast suborn'd these women\r","To accuse this worthy man, but, in foul mouth\r","And in the witness of his proper ear,\r","To call him villain? and then to glance from him\r","To the duke himself, to tax him with injustice?\r","Take him hence; to the rack with him! We'll touse you\r","Joint by joint, but we will know his purpose.\r","What 'unjust'!\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","Be not so hot; the duke\r","Dare no more stretch this finger of mine than he\r","Dare rack his own: his subject am I not,\r","Nor here provincial. My business in this state\r","Made me a looker on here in Vienna,\r","Where I have seen corruption boil and bubble\r","Till it o'er-run the stew; laws for all faults,\r","But faults so countenanced, that the strong statutes\r","Stand like the forfeits in a barber's shop,\r","As much in mock as mark.\r","\r","ESCALUS:\r","Slander to the state! Away with him to prison!\r","\r","ANGELO:\r","What can you vouch against him, Signior Lucio?\r","Is this the man that you did tell us of?\r","\r","LUCIO:\r","'Tis he, my lord. Come hither, goodman baldpate:\r","do you know me?\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","I remember you, sir, by the sound of your voice: I\r","met you at the prison, in the absence of the duke.\r","\r","LUCIO:\r","O, did you so? And do you remember what you said of the duke?\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","Most notedly, sir.\r","\r","LUCIO:\r","Do you so, sir? And was the duke a fleshmonger, a\r","fool, and a coward, as you then reported him to be?\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","You must, sir, change persons with me, ere you make\r","that my report: you, indeed, spoke so of him; and\r","much more, much worse.\r","\r","LUCIO:\r","O thou damnable fellow! Did not I pluck thee by the\r","nose for thy speeches?\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","I protest I love the duke as I love myself.\r","\r","ANGELO:\r","Hark, how the villain would close now, after his\r","treasonable abuses!\r","\r","ESCALUS:\r","Such a fellow is not to be talked withal. Away with\r","him to prison! Where is the provost? Away with him\r","to prison! lay bolts enough upon him: let him\r","speak no more. Away with those giglots too, and\r","with the other confederate companion!\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","\r","ANGELO:\r","What, resists he? Help him, Lucio.\r","\r","LUCIO:\r","Come, sir; come, sir; come, sir; foh, sir! Why, you\r","bald-pated, lying rascal, you must be hooded, must\r","you? Show your knave's visage, with a pox to you!\r","show your sheep-biting face, and be hanged an hour!\r","Will't not off?\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","Thou art the first knave that e'er madest a duke.\r","First, provost, let me bail these gentle three.\r","Sneak not away, sir; for the friar and you\r","Must have a word anon. Lay hold on him.\r","\r","LUCIO:\r","This may prove worse than hanging.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","\r","ANGELO:\r","O my dread lord,\r","I should be guiltier than my guiltiness,\r","To think I can be undiscernible,\r","When I perceive your grace, like power divine,\r","Hath look'd upon my passes. Then, good prince,\r","No longer session hold upon my shame,\r","But let my trial be mine own confession:\r","Immediate sentence then and sequent death\r","Is all the grace I beg.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","Come hither, Mariana.\r","Say, wast thou e'er contracted to this woman?\r","\r","ANGELO:\r","I was, my lord.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","Go take her hence, and marry her instantly.\r","Do you the office, friar; which consummate,\r","Return him here again. Go with him, provost.\r","\r","ESCALUS:\r","My lord, I am more amazed at his dishonour\r","Than at the strangeness of it.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","Come hither, Isabel.\r","Your friar is now your prince: as I was then\r","Advertising and holy to your business,\r","Not changing heart with habit, I am still\r","Attorney'd at your service.\r","\r","ISABELLA:\r","O, give me pardon,\r","That I, your vassal, have employ'd and pain'd\r","Your unknown sovereignty!\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","You are pardon'd, Isabel:\r","And now, dear maid, be you as free to us.\r","Your brother's death, I know, sits at your heart;\r","And you may marvel why I obscured myself,\r","Labouring to save his life, and would not rather\r","Make rash remonstrance of my hidden power\r","Than let him so be lost. O most kind maid,\r","It was the swift celerity of his death,\r","Which I did think with slower foot came on,\r","That brain'd my purpose. But, peace be with him!\r","That life is better life, past fearing death,\r","Than that which lives to fear: make it your comfort,\r","So happy is your brother.\r","\r","ISABELLA:\r","I do, my lord.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","For this new-married man approaching here,\r","Whose salt imagination yet hath wrong'd\r","Your well defended honour, you must pardon\r","For Mariana's sake: but as he adjudged your brother,--\r","Being criminal, in double violation\r","Of sacred chastity and of promise-breach\r","Thereon dependent, for your brother's life,--\r","The very mercy of the law cries out\r","Most audible, even from his proper tongue,\r","'An Angelo for Claudio, death for death!'\r","Haste still pays haste, and leisure answers leisure;\r","Like doth quit like, and MEASURE still FOR MEASURE.\r","Then, Angelo, thy fault's thus manifested;\r","Which, though thou wouldst deny, denies thee vantage.\r","We do condemn thee to the very block\r","Where Claudio stoop'd to death, and with like haste.\r","Away with him!\r","\r","MARIANA:\r","O my most gracious lord,\r","I hope you will not mock me with a husband.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","It is your husband mock'd you with a husband.\r","Consenting to the safeguard of your honour,\r","I thought your marriage fit; else imputation,\r","For that he knew you, might reproach your life\r","And choke your good to come; for his possessions,\r","Although by confiscation they are ours,\r","We do instate and widow you withal,\r","To buy you a better husband.\r","\r","MARIANA:\r","O my dear lord,\r","I crave no other, nor no better man.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","Never crave him; we are definitive.\r","\r","MARIANA:\r","Gentle my liege,--\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","You do but lose your labour.\r","Away with him to death!\r","Now, sir, to you.\r","\r","MARIANA:\r","O my good lord! Sweet Isabel, take my part;\r","Lend me your knees, and all my life to come\r","I'll lend you all my life to do you service.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","Against all sense you do importune her:\r","Should she kneel down in mercy of this fact,\r","Her brother's ghost his paved bed would break,\r","And take her hence in horror.\r","\r","MARIANA:\r","Isabel,\r","Sweet Isabel, do yet but kneel by me;\r","Hold up your hands, say nothing; I'll speak all.\r","They say, best men are moulded out of faults;\r","And, for the most, become much more the better\r","For being a little bad: so may my husband.\r","O Isabel, will you not lend a knee?\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","He dies for Claudio's death.\r","\r","ISABELLA:\r","Most bounteous sir,\r","Look, if it please you, on this man condemn'd,\r","As if my brother lived: I partly think\r","A due sincerity govern'd his deeds,\r","Till he did look on me: since it is so,\r","Let him not die. My brother had but justice,\r","In that he did the thing for which he died:\r","For Angelo,\r","His act did not o'ertake his bad intent,\r","And must be buried but as an intent\r","That perish'd by the way: thoughts are no subjects;\r","Intents but merely thoughts.\r","\r","MARIANA:\r","Merely, my lord.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","Your suit's unprofitable; stand up, I say.\r","I have bethought me of another fault.\r","Provost, how came it Claudio was beheaded\r","At an unusual hour?\r","\r","Provost:\r","It was commanded so.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","Had you a special warrant for the deed?\r","\r","Provost:\r","No, my good lord; it was by private message.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","For which I do discharge you of your office:\r","Give up your keys.\r","\r","Provost:\r","Pardon me, noble lord:\r","I thought it was a fault, but knew it not;\r","Yet did repent me, after more advice;\r","For testimony whereof, one in the prison,\r","That should by private order else have died,\r","I have reserved alive.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","What's he?\r","\r","Provost:\r","His name is Barnardine.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","I would thou hadst done so by Claudio.\r","Go fetch him hither; let me look upon him.\r","\r","ESCALUS:\r","I am sorry, one so learned and so wise\r","As you, Lord Angelo, have still appear'd,\r","Should slip so grossly, both in the heat of blood.\r","And lack of temper'd judgment afterward.\r","\r","ANGELO:\r","I am sorry that such sorrow I procure:\r","And so deep sticks it in my penitent heart\r","That I crave death more willingly than mercy;\r","'Tis my deserving, and I do entreat it.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","Which is that Barnardine?\r","\r","Provost:\r","This, my lord.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","There was a friar told me of this man.\r","Sirrah, thou art said to have a stubborn soul.\r","That apprehends no further than this world,\r","And squarest thy life according. Thou'rt condemn'd:\r","But, for those earthly faults, I quit them all;\r","And pray thee take this mercy to provide\r","For better times to come. Friar, advise him;\r","I leave him to your hand. What muffled fellow's that?\r","\r","Provost:\r","This is another prisoner that I saved.\r","Who should have died when Claudio lost his head;\r","As like almost to Claudio as himself.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","\r","LUCIO:\r","'Faith, my lord. I spoke it but according to the\r","trick. If you will hang me for it, you may; but I\r","had rather it would please you I might be whipt.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","Whipt first, sir, and hanged after.\r","Proclaim it, provost, round about the city.\r","Is any woman wrong'd by this lewd fellow,\r","As I have heard him swear himself there's one\r","Whom he begot with child, let her appear,\r","And he shall marry her: the nuptial finish'd,\r","Let him be whipt and hang'd.\r","\r","LUCIO:\r","I beseech your highness, do not marry me to a whore.\r","Your highness said even now, I made you a duke:\r","good my lord, do not recompense me in making me a cuckold.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","Upon mine honour, thou shalt marry her.\r","Thy slanders I forgive; and therewithal\r","Remit thy other forfeits. Take him to prison;\r","And see our pleasure herein executed.\r","\r","LUCIO:\r","Marrying a punk, my lord, is pressing to death,\r","whipping, and hanging.\r","\r","DUKE VINCENTIO:\r","Slandering a prince deserves it.\r","She, Claudio, that you wrong'd, look you restore.\r","Joy to you, Mariana! Love her, Angelo:\r","I have confess'd her and I know her virtue.\r","Thanks, good friend Escalus, for thy much goodness:\r","There's more behind that is more gratulate.\r","Thanks, provost, for thy care and secrecy:\r","We shill employ thee in a worthier place.\r","Forgive him, Angelo, that brought you home\r","The head of Ragozine for Claudio's:\r","The offence pardons itself. Dear Isabel,\r","I have a motion much imports your good;\r","Whereto if you'll a willing ear incline,\r","What's mine is yours and what is yours is mine.\r","So, bring us to our palace; where we'll show\r","What's yet behind, that's meet you all should know.\r","\r","SLY:\r","I'll pheeze you, in faith.\r","\r","Hostess:\r","A pair of stocks, you rogue!\r","\r","SLY:\r","Ye are a baggage: the Slys are no rogues; look in\r","the chronicles; we came in with Richard Conqueror.\r","Therefore paucas pallabris; let the world slide: sessa!\r","\r","Hostess:\r","You will not pay for the glasses you have burst?\r","\r","SLY:\r","No, not a denier. Go by, Jeronimy: go to thy cold\r","bed, and warm thee.\r","\r","Hostess:\r","I know my remedy; I must go fetch the\r","third--borough.\r","\r","SLY:\r","Third, or fourth, or fifth borough, I'll answer him\r","by law: I'll not budge an inch, boy: let him come,\r","and kindly.\r","\r","Lord:\r","Huntsman, I charge thee, tender well my hounds:\r","Brach Merriman, the poor cur is emboss'd;\r","And couple Clowder with the deep--mouth'd brach.\r","Saw'st thou not, boy, how Silver made it good\r","At the hedge-corner, in the coldest fault?\r","I would not lose the dog for twenty pound.\r","\r","First Huntsman:\r","Why, Belman is as good as he, my lord;\r","He cried upon it at the merest loss\r","And twice to-day pick'd out the dullest scent:\r","Trust me, I take him for the better dog.\r","\r","Lord:\r","Thou art a fool: if Echo were as fleet,\r","I would esteem him worth a dozen such.\r","But sup them well and look unto them all:\r","To-morrow I intend to hunt again.\r","\r","First Huntsman:\r","I will, my lord.\r","\r","Lord:\r","What's here? one dead, or drunk? See, doth he breathe?\r","\r","Second Huntsman:\r","He breathes, my lord. Were he not warm'd with ale,\r","This were a bed but cold to sleep so soundly.\r","\r","Lord:\r","O monstrous beast! how like a swine he lies!\r","Grim death, how foul and loathsome is thine image!\r","Sirs, I will practise on this drunken man.\r","What think you, if he were convey'd to bed,\r","Wrapp'd in sweet clothes, rings put upon his fingers,\r","A most delicious banquet by his bed,\r","And brave attendants near him when he wakes,\r","Would not the beggar then forget himself?\r","\r","First Huntsman:\r","Believe me, lord, I think he cannot choose.\r","\r","Second Huntsman:\r","It would seem strange unto him when he waked.\r","\r","Lord:\r","Even as a flattering dream or worthless fancy.\r","Then take him up and manage well the jest:\r","Carry him gently to my fairest chamber\r","And hang it round with all my wanton pictures:\r","Balm his foul head in warm distilled waters\r","And burn sweet wood to make the lodging sweet:\r","Procure me music ready when he wakes,\r","To make a dulcet and a heavenly sound;\r","And if he chance to speak, be ready straight\r","And with a low submissive reverence\r","Say 'What is it your honour will command?'\r","Let one attend him with a silver basin\r","Full of rose-water and bestrew'd with flowers,\r","Another bear the ewer, the third a diaper,\r","And say 'Will't please your lordship cool your hands?'\r","Some one be ready with a costly suit\r","And ask him what apparel he will wear;\r","Another tell him of his hounds and horse,\r","And that his lady mourns at his disease:\r","Persuade him that he hath been lunatic;\r","And when he says he is, say that he dreams,\r","For he is nothing but a mighty lord.\r","This do and do it kindly, gentle sirs:\r","It will be pastime passing excellent,\r","If it be husbanded with modesty.\r","\r","First Huntsman:\r","My lord, I warrant you we will play our part,\r","As he shall think by our true diligence\r","He is no less than what we say he is.\r","\r","Lord:\r","Take him up gently and to bed with him;\r","And each one to his office when he wakes.\r","Sirrah, go see what trumpet 'tis that sounds:\r","Belike, some noble gentleman that means,\r","Travelling some journey, to repose him here.\r","How now! who is it?\r","\r","Servant:\r","An't please your honour, players\r","That offer service to your lordship.\r","\r","Lord:\r","Bid them come near.\r","Now, fellows, you are welcome.\r","\r","Players:\r","We thank your honour.\r","\r","Lord:\r","Do you intend to stay with me tonight?\r","\r","A Player:\r","So please your lordship to accept our duty.\r","\r","Lord:\r","With all my heart. This fellow I remember,\r","Since once he play'd a farmer's eldest son:\r","'Twas where you woo'd the gentlewoman so well:\r","I have forgot your name; but, sure, that part\r","Was aptly fitted and naturally perform'd.\r","\r","A Player:\r","I think 'twas Soto that your honour means.\r","\r","Lord:\r","'Tis very true: thou didst it excellent.\r","Well, you are come to me in a happy time;\r","The rather for I have some sport in hand\r","Wherein your cunning can assist me much.\r","There is a lord will hear you play to-night:\r","But I am doubtful of your modesties;\r","Lest over-eyeing of his odd behavior,--\r","For yet his honour never heard a play--\r","You break into some merry passion\r","And so offend him; for I tell you, sirs,\r","If you should smile he grows impatient.\r","\r","A Player:\r","Fear not, my lord: we can contain ourselves,\r","Were he the veriest antic in the world.\r","\r","Lord:\r","Go, sirrah, take them to the buttery,\r","And give them friendly welcome every one:\r","Let them want nothing that my house affords.\r","Sirrah, go you to Barthol'mew my page,\r","And see him dress'd in all suits like a lady:\r","That done, conduct him to the drunkard's chamber;\r","And call him 'madam,' do him obeisance.\r","Tell him from me, as he will win my love,\r","He bear himself with honourable action,\r","Such as he hath observed in noble ladies\r","Unto their lords, by them accomplished:\r","Such duty to the drunkard let him do\r","With soft low tongue and lowly courtesy,\r","And say 'What is't your honour will command,\r","Wherein your lady and your humble wife\r","May show her duty and make known her love?'\r","And then with kind embracements, tempting kisses,\r","And with declining head into his bosom,\r","Bid him shed tears, as being overjoy'd\r","To see her noble lord restored to health,\r","Who for this seven years hath esteem'd him\r","No better than a poor and loathsome beggar:\r","And if the boy have not a woman's gift\r","To rain a shower of commanded tears,\r","An onion will do well for such a shift,\r","Which in a napkin being close convey'd\r","Shall in despite enforce a watery eye.\r","See this dispatch'd with all the haste thou canst:\r","Anon I'll give thee more instructions.\r","I know the boy will well usurp the grace,\r","Voice, gait and action of a gentlewoman:\r","I long to hear him call the drunkard husband,\r","And how my men will stay themselves from laughter\r","When they do homage to this simple peasant.\r","I'll in to counsel them; haply my presence\r","May well abate the over-merry spleen\r","Which otherwise would grow into extremes.\r","\r","SLY:\r","For God's sake, a pot of small ale.\r","\r","First Servant:\r","Will't please your lordship drink a cup of sack?\r","\r","Second Servant:\r","Will't please your honour taste of these conserves?\r","\r","Third Servant:\r","What raiment will your honour wear to-day?\r","\r","SLY:\r","I am Christophero Sly; call not me 'honour' nor\r","'lordship:' I ne'er drank sack in my life; and if\r","you give me any conserves, give me conserves of\r","beef: ne'er ask me what raiment I'll wear; for I\r","have no more doublets than backs, no more stockings\r","than legs, nor no more shoes than feet; nay,\r","sometimes more feet than shoes, or such shoes as my\r","toes look through the over-leather.\r","\r","Lord:\r","Heaven cease this idle humour in your honour!\r","O, that a mighty man of such descent,\r","Of such possessions and so high esteem,\r","Should be infused with so foul a spirit!\r","\r","SLY:\r","What, would you make me mad? Am not I Christopher\r","Sly, old Sly's son of Burtonheath, by birth a\r","pedlar, by education a cardmaker, by transmutation a\r","bear-herd, and now by present profession a tinker?\r","Ask Marian Hacket, the fat ale-wife of Wincot, if\r","she know me not: if she say I am not fourteen pence\r","on the score for sheer ale, score me up for the\r","lyingest knave in Christendom. What! I am not\r","bestraught: here's--\r","\r","Third Servant:\r","O, this it is that makes your lady mourn!\r","\r","Second Servant:\r","O, this is it that makes your servants droop!\r","\r","Lord:\r","Hence comes it that your kindred shuns your house,\r","As beaten hence by your strange lunacy.\r","O noble lord, bethink thee of thy birth,\r","Call home thy ancient thoughts from banishment\r","And banish hence these abject lowly dreams.\r","Look how thy servants do attend on thee,\r","Each in his office ready at thy beck.\r","Wilt thou have music? hark! Apollo plays,\r","And twenty caged nightingales do sing:\r","Or wilt thou sleep? we'll have thee to a couch\r","Softer and sweeter than the lustful bed\r","On purpose trimm'd up for Semiramis.\r","Say thou wilt walk; we will bestrew the ground:\r","Or wilt thou ride? thy horses shall be trapp'd,\r","Their harness studded all with gold and pearl.\r","Dost thou love hawking? thou hast hawks will soar\r","Above the morning lark or wilt thou hunt?\r","Thy hounds shall make the welkin answer them\r","And fetch shrill echoes from the hollow earth.\r","\r","First Servant:\r","Say thou wilt course; thy greyhounds are as swift\r","As breathed stags, ay, fleeter than the roe.\r","\r","Second Servant:\r","Dost thou love pictures? we will fetch thee straight\r","Adonis painted by a running brook,\r","And Cytherea all in sedges hid,\r","Which seem to move and wanton with her breath,\r","Even as the waving sedges play with wind.\r","\r","Lord:\r","We'll show thee Io as she was a maid,\r","And how she was beguiled and surprised,\r","As lively painted as the deed was done.\r","\r","Third Servant:\r","Or Daphne roaming through a thorny wood,\r","Scratching her legs that one shall swear she bleeds,\r","And at that sight shall sad Apollo weep,\r","So workmanly the blood and tears are drawn.\r","\r","Lord:\r","Thou art a lord, and nothing but a lord:\r","Thou hast a lady far more beautiful\r","Than any woman in this waning age.\r","\r","First Servant:\r","And till the tears that she hath shed for thee\r","Like envious floods o'er-run her lovely face,\r","She was the fairest creature in the world;\r","And yet she is inferior to none.\r","\r","SLY:\r","Am I a lord? and have I such a lady?\r","Or do I dream? or have I dream'd till now?\r","I do not sleep: I see, I hear, I speak;\r","I smell sweet savours and I feel soft things:\r","Upon my life, I am a lord indeed\r","And not a tinker nor Christophero Sly.\r","Well, bring our lady hither to our sight;\r","And once again, a pot o' the smallest ale.\r","\r","Second Servant:\r","Will't please your mightiness to wash your hands?\r","O, how we joy to see your wit restored!\r","O, that once more you knew but what you are!\r","These fifteen years you have been in a dream;\r","Or when you waked, so waked as if you slept.\r","\r","SLY:\r","These fifteen years! by my fay, a goodly nap.\r","But did I never speak of all that time?\r","\r","First Servant:\r","O, yes, my lord, but very idle words:\r","For though you lay here in this goodly chamber,\r","Yet would you say ye were beaten out of door;\r","And rail upon the hostess of the house;\r","And say you would present her at the leet,\r","Because she brought stone jugs and no seal'd quarts:\r","Sometimes you would call out for Cicely Hacket.\r","\r","SLY:\r","Ay, the woman's maid of the house.\r","\r","Third Servant:\r","Why, sir, you know no house nor no such maid,\r","Nor no such men as you have reckon'd up,\r","As Stephen Sly and did John Naps of Greece\r","And Peter Turph and Henry Pimpernell\r","And twenty more such names and men as these\r","Which never were nor no man ever saw.\r","\r","SLY:\r","Now Lord be thanked for my good amends!\r","\r","ALL:\r","Amen.\r","\r","SLY:\r","I thank thee: thou shalt not lose by it.\r","\r","Page:\r","How fares my noble lord?\r","\r","SLY:\r","Marry, I fare well for here is cheer enough.\r","Where is my wife?\r","\r","Page:\r","Here, noble lord: what is thy will with her?\r","\r","SLY:\r","Are you my wife and will not call me husband?\r","My men should call me 'lord:' I am your goodman.\r","\r","Page:\r","My husband and my lord, my lord and husband;\r","I am your wife in all obedience.\r","\r","SLY:\r","I know it well. What must I call her?\r","\r","Lord:\r","Madam.\r","\r","SLY:\r","Al'ce madam, or Joan madam?\r","\r","Lord:\r","'Madam,' and nothing else: so lords\r","call ladies.\r","\r","SLY:\r","Madam wife, they say that I have dream'd\r","And slept above some fifteen year or more.\r","\r","Page:\r","Ay, and the time seems thirty unto me,\r","Being all this time abandon'd from your bed.\r","\r","SLY:\r","'Tis much.
