what, is there such a place?\r","\r","TRANIO:\r","Ay, mistress, and Petruchio is the master;\r","That teacheth tricks eleven and twenty long,\r","To tame a shrew and charm her chattering tongue.\r","\r","BIONDELLO:\r","O master, master, I have watch'd so long\r","That I am dog-weary: but at last I spied\r","An ancient angel coming down the hill,\r","Will serve the turn.\r","\r","TRANIO:\r","What is he, Biondello?\r","\r","BIONDELLO:\r","Master, a mercatante, or a pedant,\r","I know not what; but format in apparel,\r","In gait and countenance surely like a father.\r","\r","LUCENTIO:\r","And what of him, Tranio?\r","\r","TRANIO:\r","If he be credulous and trust my tale,\r","I'll make him glad to seem Vincentio,\r","And give assurance to Baptista Minola,\r","As if he were the right Vincentio\r","Take in your love, and then let me alone.\r","\r","Pedant:\r","God save you, sir!\r","\r","TRANIO:\r","And you, sir! you are welcome.\r","Travel you far on, or are you at the farthest?\r","\r","Pedant:\r","Sir, at the farthest for a week or two:\r","But then up farther, and as for as Rome;\r","And so to Tripoli, if God lend me life.\r","\r","TRANIO:\r","What countryman, I pray?\r","\r","Pedant:\r","Of Mantua.\r","\r","TRANIO:\r","Of Mantua, sir? marry, God forbid!\r","And come to Padua, careless of your life?\r","\r","Pedant:\r","My life, sir! how, I pray? for that goes hard.\r","\r","TRANIO:\r","'Tis death for any one in Mantua\r","To come to Padua. Know you not the cause?\r","Your ships are stay'd at Venice, and the duke,\r","For private quarrel 'twixt your duke and him,\r","Hath publish'd and proclaim'd it openly:\r","'Tis, marvel, but that you are but newly come,\r","You might have heard it else proclaim'd about.\r","\r","Pedant:\r","Alas! sir, it is worse for me than so;\r","For I have bills for money by exchange\r","From Florence and must here deliver them.\r","\r","TRANIO:\r","Well, sir, to do you courtesy,\r","This will I do, and this I will advise you:\r","First, tell me, have you ever been at Pisa?\r","\r","Pedant:\r","Ay, sir, in Pisa have I often been,\r","Pisa renowned for grave citizens.\r","\r","TRANIO:\r","Among them know you one Vincentio?\r","\r","Pedant:\r","I know him not, but I have heard of him;\r","A merchant of incomparable wealth.\r","\r","TRANIO:\r","He is my father, sir; and, sooth to say,\r","In countenance somewhat doth resemble you.\r","\r","BIONDELLO:\r","\r","TRANIO:\r","To save your life in this extremity,\r","This favour will I do you for his sake;\r","And think it not the worst of an your fortunes\r","That you are like to Sir Vincentio.\r","His name and credit shall you undertake,\r","And in my house you shall be friendly lodged:\r","Look that you take upon you as you should;\r","You understand me, sir: so shall you stay\r","Till you have done your business in the city:\r","If this be courtesy, sir, accept of it.\r","\r","Pedant:\r","O sir, I do; and will repute you ever\r","The patron of my life and liberty.\r","\r","TRANIO:\r","Then go with me to make the matter good.\r","This, by the way, I let you understand;\r","my father is here look'd for every day,\r","To pass assurance of a dower in marriage\r","'Twixt me and one Baptista's daughter here:\r","In all these circumstances I'll instruct you:\r","Go with me to clothe you as becomes you.\r","\r","GRUMIO:\r","No, no, forsooth; I dare not for my life.\r","\r","KATHARINA:\r","The more my wrong, the more his spite appears:\r","What, did he marry me to famish me?\r","Beggars, that come unto my father's door,\r","Upon entreaty have a present aims;\r","If not, elsewhere they meet with charity:\r","But I, who never knew how to entreat,\r","Nor never needed that I should entreat,\r","Am starved for meat, giddy for lack of sleep,\r","With oath kept waking and with brawling fed:\r","And that which spites me more than all these wants,\r","He does it under name of perfect love;\r","As who should say, if I should sleep or eat,\r","'Twere deadly sickness or else present death.\r","I prithee go and get me some repast;\r","I care not what, so it be wholesome food.\r","\r","GRUMIO:\r","What say you to a neat's foot?\r","\r","KATHARINA:\r","'Tis passing good: I prithee let me have it.\r","\r","GRUMIO:\r","I fear it is too choleric a meat.\r","How say you to a fat tripe finely broil'd?\r","\r","KATHARINA:\r","I like it well: good Grumio, fetch it me.\r","\r","GRUMIO:\r","I cannot tell; I fear 'tis choleric.\r","What say you to a piece of beef and mustard?\r","\r","KATHARINA:\r","A dish that I do love to feed upon.\r","\r","GRUMIO:\r","Ay, but the mustard is too hot a little.\r","\r","KATHARINA:\r","Why then, the beef, and let the mustard rest.\r","\r","GRUMIO:\r","Nay then, I will not: you shall have the mustard,\r","Or else you get no beef of Grumio.\r","\r","KATHARINA:\r","Then both, or one, or any thing thou wilt.\r","\r","GRUMIO:\r","Why then, the mustard without the beef.\r","\r","KATHARINA:\r","Go, get thee gone, thou false deluding slave,\r","That feed'st me with the very name of meat:\r","Sorrow on thee and all the pack of you,\r","That triumph thus upon my misery!\r","Go, get thee gone, I say.\r","\r","PETRUCHIO:\r","How fares my Kate? What, sweeting, all amort?\r","\r","HORTENSIO:\r","Mistress, what cheer?\r","\r","KATHARINA:\r","Faith, as cold as can be.\r","\r","PETRUCHIO:\r","Pluck up thy spirits; look cheerfully upon me.\r","Here love; thou see'st how diligent I am\r","To dress thy meat myself and bring it thee:\r","I am sure, sweet Kate, this kindness merits thanks.\r","What, not a word? Nay, then thou lovest it not;\r","And all my pains is sorted to no proof.\r","Here, take away this dish.\r","\r","KATHARINA:\r","I pray you, let it stand.\r","\r","PETRUCHIO:\r","The poorest service is repaid with thanks;\r","And so shall mine, before you touch the meat.\r","\r","KATHARINA:\r","I thank you, sir.\r","\r","HORTENSIO:\r","Signior Petruchio, fie! you are to blame.\r","Come, mistress Kate, I'll bear you company.\r","\r","PETRUCHIO:\r","\r","Haberdasher:\r","Here is the cap your worship did bespeak.\r","\r","PETRUCHIO:\r","Why, this was moulded on a porringer;\r","A velvet dish: fie, fie! 'tis lewd and filthy:\r","Why, 'tis a cockle or a walnut-shell,\r","A knack, a toy, a trick, a baby's cap:\r","Away with it! come, let me have a bigger.\r","\r","KATHARINA:\r","I'll have no bigger: this doth fit the time,\r","And gentlewomen wear such caps as these\r","\r","PETRUCHIO:\r","When you are gentle, you shall have one too,\r","And not till then.\r","\r","HORTENSIO:\r","\r","KATHARINA:\r","Why, sir, I trust I may have leave to speak;\r","And speak I will; I am no child, no babe:\r","Your betters have endured me say my mind,\r","And if you cannot, best you stop your ears.\r","My tongue will tell the anger of my heart,\r","Or else my heart concealing it will break,\r","And rather than it shall, I will be free\r","Even to the uttermost, as I please, in words.\r","\r","PETRUCHIO:\r","Why, thou say'st true; it is a paltry cap,\r","A custard-coffin, a bauble, a silken pie:\r","I love thee well, in that thou likest it not.\r","\r","KATHARINA:\r","Love me or love me not, I like the cap;\r","And it I will have, or I will have none.\r","\r","PETRUCHIO:\r","Thy gown? why, ay: come, tailor, let us see't.\r","O mercy, God! what masquing stuff is here?\r","What's this? a sleeve? 'tis like a demi-cannon:\r","What, up and down, carved like an apple-tart?\r","Here's snip and nip and cut and slish and slash,\r","Like to a censer in a barber's shop:\r","Why, what, i' devil's name, tailor, call'st thou this?\r","\r","HORTENSIO:\r","\r","Tailor:\r","You bid me make it orderly and well,\r","According to the fashion and the time.\r","\r","PETRUCHIO:\r","Marry, and did; but if you be remember'd,\r","I did not bid you mar it to the time.\r","Go, hop me over every kennel home,\r","For you shall hop without my custom, sir:\r","I'll none of it: hence! make your best of it.\r","\r","KATHARINA:\r","I never saw a better-fashion'd gown,\r","More quaint, more pleasing, nor more commendable:\r","Belike you mean to make a puppet of me.\r","\r","PETRUCHIO:\r","Why, true; he means to make a puppet of thee.\r","\r","Tailor:\r","She says your worship means to make\r","a puppet of her.\r","\r","PETRUCHIO:\r","O monstrous arrogance! Thou liest, thou thread,\r","thou thimble,\r","Thou yard, three-quarters, half-yard, quarter, nail!\r","Thou flea, thou nit, thou winter-cricket thou!\r","Braved in mine own house with a skein of thread?\r","Away, thou rag, thou quantity, thou remnant;\r","Or I shall so be-mete thee with thy yard\r","As thou shalt think on prating whilst thou livest!\r","I tell thee, I, that thou hast marr'd her gown.\r","\r","Tailor:\r","Your worship is deceived; the gown is made\r","Just as my master had direction:\r","Grumio gave order how it should be done.\r","\r","GRUMIO:\r","I gave him no order; I gave him the stuff.\r","\r","Tailor:\r","But how did you desire it should be made?\r","\r","GRUMIO:\r","Marry, sir, with needle and thread.\r","\r","Tailor:\r","But did you not request to have it cut?\r","\r","GRUMIO:\r","Thou hast faced many things.\r","\r","Tailor:\r","I have.\r","\r","GRUMIO:\r","Face not me: thou hast braved many men; brave not\r","me; I will neither be faced nor braved. I say unto\r","thee, I bid thy master cut out the gown; but I did\r","not bid him cut it to pieces: ergo, thou liest.\r","\r","Tailor:\r","Why, here is the note of the fashion to testify\r","\r","PETRUCHIO:\r","Read it.\r","\r","GRUMIO:\r","The note lies in's throat, if he say I said so.\r","\r","Tailor:\r","\r","GRUMIO:\r","Master, if ever I said loose-bodied gown, sew me in\r","the skirts of it, and beat me to death with a bottom\r","of brown thread: I said a gown.\r","\r","PETRUCHIO:\r","Proceed.\r","\r","Tailor:\r","\r","GRUMIO:\r","I confess the cape.\r","\r","Tailor:\r","\r","GRUMIO:\r","I confess two sleeves.\r","\r","Tailor:\r","\r","PETRUCHIO:\r","Ay, there's the villany.\r","\r","GRUMIO:\r","Error i' the bill, sir; error i' the bill.\r","I commanded the sleeves should be cut out and\r","sewed up again; and that I'll prove upon thee,\r","though thy little finger be armed in a thimble.\r","\r","Tailor:\r","This is true that I say: an I had thee\r","in place where, thou shouldst know it.\r","\r","GRUMIO:\r","I am for thee straight: take thou the\r","bill, give me thy mete-yard, and spare not me.\r","\r","HORTENSIO:\r","God-a-mercy, Grumio! then he shall have no odds.\r","\r","PETRUCHIO:\r","Well, sir, in brief, the gown is not for me.\r","\r","GRUMIO:\r","You are i' the right, sir: 'tis for my mistress.\r","\r","PETRUCHIO:\r","Go, take it up unto thy master's use.\r","\r","GRUMIO:\r","Villain, not for thy life: take up my mistress'\r","gown for thy master's use!\r","\r","PETRUCHIO:\r","Why, sir, what's your conceit in that?\r","\r","GRUMIO:\r","O, sir, the conceit is deeper than you think for:\r","Take up my mistress' gown to his master's use!\r","O, fie, fie, fie!\r","\r","PETRUCHIO:\r","\r","HORTENSIO:\r","Tailor, I'll pay thee for thy gown tomorrow:\r","Take no unkindness of his hasty words:\r","Away! I say; commend me to thy master.\r","\r","PETRUCHIO:\r","Well, come, my Kate; we will unto your father's\r","Even in these honest mean habiliments:\r","Our purses shall be proud, our garments poor;\r","For 'tis the mind that makes the body rich;\r","And as the sun breaks through the darkest clouds,\r","So honour peereth in the meanest habit.\r","What is the jay more precious than the lark,\r","Because his fathers are more beautiful?\r","Or is the adder better than the eel,\r","Because his painted skin contents the eye?\r","O, no, good Kate; neither art thou the worse\r","For this poor furniture and mean array.\r","if thou account'st it shame. lay it on me;\r","And therefore frolic: we will hence forthwith,\r","To feast and sport us at thy father's house.\r","Go, call my men, and let us straight to him;\r","And bring our horses unto Long-lane end;\r","There will we mount, and thither walk on foot\r","Let's see; I think 'tis now some seven o'clock,\r","And well we may come there by dinner-time.\r","\r","KATHARINA:\r","I dare assure you, sir, 'tis almost two;\r","And 'twill be supper-time ere you come there.\r","\r","PETRUCHIO:\r","It shall be seven ere I go to horse:\r","Look, what I speak, or do, or think to do,\r","You are still crossing it. Sirs, let't alone:\r","I will not go to-day; and ere I do,\r","It shall be what o'clock I say it is.\r","\r","HORTENSIO:\r","\r","TRANIO:\r","Sir, this is the house: please it you that I call?\r","\r","Pedant:\r","Ay, what else? and but I be deceived\r","Signior Baptista may remember me,\r","Near twenty years ago, in Genoa,\r","Where we were lodgers at the Pegasus.\r","\r","TRANIO:\r","'Tis well; and hold your own, in any case,\r","With such austerity as 'longeth to a father.\r","\r","Pedant:\r","I warrant you.\r","But, sir, here comes your boy;\r","'Twere good he were school'd.\r","\r","TRANIO:\r","Fear you not him. Sirrah Biondello,\r","Now do your duty throughly, I advise you:\r","Imagine 'twere the right Vincentio.\r","\r","BIONDELLO:\r","Tut, fear not me.\r","\r","TRANIO:\r","But hast thou done thy errand to Baptista?\r","\r","BIONDELLO:\r","I told him that your father was at Venice,\r","And that you look'd for him this day in Padua.\r","\r","TRANIO:\r","Thou'rt a tall fellow: hold thee that to drink.\r","Here comes Baptista: set your countenance, sir.\r","Signior Baptista, you are happily met.\r","Sir, this is the gentleman I told you of:\r","I pray you stand good father to me now,\r","Give me Bianca for my patrimony.\r","\r","Pedant:\r","Soft son!\r","Sir, by your leave: having come to Padua\r","To gather in some debts, my son Lucentio\r","Made me acquainted with a weighty cause\r","Of love between your daughter and himself:\r","And, for the good report I hear of you\r","And for the love he beareth to your daughter\r","And she to him, to stay him not too long,\r","I am content, in a good father's care,\r","To have him match'd; and if you please to like\r","No worse than I, upon some agreement\r","Me shall you find ready and willing\r","With one consent to have her so bestow'd;\r","For curious I cannot be with you,\r","Signior Baptista, of whom I hear so well.\r","\r","BAPTISTA:\r","Sir, pardon me in what I have to say:\r","Your plainness and your shortness please me well.\r","Right true it is, your son Lucentio here\r","Doth love my daughter and she loveth him,\r","Or both dissemble deeply their affections:\r","And therefore, if you say no more than this,\r","That like a father you will deal with him\r","And pass my daughter a sufficient dower,\r","The match is made, and all is done:\r","Your son shall have my daughter with consent.\r","\r","TRANIO:\r","I thank you, sir. Where then do you know best\r","We be affied and such assurance ta'en\r","As shall with either part's agreement stand?\r","\r","BAPTISTA:\r","Not in my house, Lucentio; for, you know,\r","Pitchers have ears, and I have many servants:\r","Besides, old Gremio is hearkening still;\r","And happily we might be interrupted.\r","\r","TRANIO:\r","Then at my lodging, an it like you:\r","There doth my father lie; and there, this night,\r","We'll pass the business privately and well.\r","Send for your daughter by your servant here:\r","My boy shall fetch the scrivener presently.\r","The worst is this, that, at so slender warning,\r","You are like to have a thin and slender pittance.\r","\r","BAPTISTA:\r","It likes me well. Biondello, hie you home,\r","And bid Bianca make her ready straight;\r","And, if you will, tell what hath happened,\r","Lucentio's father is arrived in Padua,\r","And how she's like to be Lucentio's wife.\r","\r","BIONDELLO:\r","I pray the gods she may with all my heart!\r","\r","TRANIO:\r","Dally not with the gods, but get thee gone.\r","Signior Baptista, shall I lead the way?\r","Welcome! one mess is like to be your cheer:\r","Come, sir; we will better it in Pisa.\r","\r","BAPTISTA:\r","I follow you.\r","\r","BIONDELLO:\r","Cambio!\r","\r","LUCENTIO:\r","What sayest thou, Biondello?\r","\r","BIONDELLO:\r","You saw my master wink and laugh upon you?\r","\r","LUCENTIO:\r","Biondello, what of that?\r","\r","BIONDELLO:\r","Faith, nothing; but has left me here behind, to\r","expound the meaning or moral of his signs and tokens.\r","\r","LUCENTIO:\r","I pray thee, moralize them.\r","\r","BIONDELLO:\r","Then thus. Baptista is safe, talking with the\r","deceiving father of a deceitful son.\r","\r","LUCENTIO:\r","And what of him?\r","\r","BIONDELLO:\r","His daughter is to be brought by you to the supper.\r","\r","LUCENTIO:\r","And then?\r","\r","BIONDELLO:\r","The old priest of Saint Luke's church is at your\r","command at all hours.\r","\r","LUCENTIO:\r","And what of all this?\r","\r","BIONDELLO:\r","I cannot tell; expect they are busied about a\r","counterfeit assurance: take you assurance of her,\r","'cum privilegio ad imprimendum solum:' to the\r","church; take the priest, clerk, and some sufficient\r","honest witnesses: If this be not that you look for,\r","I have no more to say, But bid Bianca farewell for\r","ever and a day.\r","\r","LUCENTIO:\r","Hearest thou, Biondello?\r","\r","BIONDELLO:\r","I cannot tarry: I knew a wench married in an\r","afternoon as she went to the garden for parsley to\r","stuff a rabbit; and so may you, sir: and so, adieu,\r","sir. My master hath appointed me to go to Saint\r","Luke's, to bid the priest be ready to come against\r","you come with your appendix.\r","\r","LUCENTIO:\r","I may, and will, if she be so contented:\r","She will be pleased; then wherefore should I doubt?\r","Hap what hap may, I'll roundly go about her:\r","It shall go hard if Cambio go without her.\r","\r","PETRUCHIO:\r","Come on, i' God's name; once more toward our father's.\r","Good Lord, how bright and goodly shines the moon!\r","\r","KATHARINA:\r","The moon! the sun: it is not moonlight now.\r","\r","PETRUCHIO:\r","I say it is the moon that shines so bright.\r","\r","KATHARINA:\r","I know it is the sun that shines so bright.\r","\r","PETRUCHIO:\r","Now, by my mother's son, and that's myself,\r","It shall be moon, or star, or what I list,\r","Or ere I journey to your father's house.\r","Go on, and fetch our horses back again.\r","Evermore cross'd and cross'd; nothing but cross'd!\r","\r","HORTENSIO:\r","Say as he says, or we shall never go.\r","\r","KATHARINA:\r","Forward, I pray, since we have come so far,\r","And be it moon, or sun, or what you please:\r","An if you please to call it a rush-candle,\r","Henceforth I vow it shall be so for me.\r","\r","PETRUCHIO:\r","I say it is the moon.\r","\r","KATHARINA:\r","I know it is the moon.\r","\r","PETRUCHIO:\r","Nay, then you lie: it is the blessed sun.\r","\r","KATHARINA:\r","Then, God be bless'd, it is the blessed sun:\r","But sun it is not, when you say it is not;\r","And the moon changes even as your mind.\r","What you will have it named, even that it is;\r","And so it shall be so for Katharina.\r","\r","HORTENSIO:\r","Petruchio, go thy ways; the field is won.\r","\r","PETRUCHIO:\r","Well, forward, forward! thus the bowl should run,\r","And not unluckily against the bias.\r","But, soft! company is coming here.\r","Good morrow, gentle mistress: where away?\r","Tell me, sweet Kate, and tell me truly too,\r","Hast thou beheld a fresher gentlewoman?\r","Such war of white and red within her cheeks!\r","What stars do spangle heaven with such beauty,\r","As those two eyes become that heavenly face?\r","Fair lovely maid, once more good day to thee.\r","Sweet Kate, embrace her for her beauty's sake.\r","\r","HORTENSIO:\r","A' will make the man mad, to make a woman of him.\r","\r","KATHARINA:\r","Young budding virgin, fair and fresh and sweet,\r","Whither away, or where is thy abode?\r","Happy the parents of so fair a child;\r","Happier the man, whom favourable stars\r","Allot thee for his lovely bed-fellow!\r","\r","PETRUCHIO:\r","Why, how now, Kate! I hope thou art not mad:\r","This is a man, old, wrinkled, faded, wither'd,\r","And not a maiden, as thou say'st he is.\r","\r","KATHARINA:\r","Pardon, old father, my mistaking eyes,\r","That have been so bedazzled with the sun\r","That everything I look on seemeth green:\r","Now I perceive thou art a reverend father;\r","Pardon, I pray thee, for my mad mistaking.\r","\r","PETRUCHIO:\r","Do, good old grandsire; and withal make known\r","Which way thou travellest: if along with us,\r","We shall be joyful of thy company.\r","\r","VINCENTIO:\r","Fair sir, and you my merry mistress,\r","That with your strange encounter much amazed me,\r","My name is call'd Vincentio; my dwelling Pisa;\r","And bound I am to Padua; there to visit\r","A son of mine, which long I have not seen.\r","\r","PETRUCHIO:\r","What is his name?\r","\r","VINCENTIO:\r","Lucentio, gentle sir.\r","\r","PETRUCHIO:\r","Happily we met; the happier for thy son.\r","And now by law, as well as reverend age,\r","I may entitle thee my loving father:\r","The sister to my wife, this gentlewoman,\r","Thy son by this hath married. Wonder not,\r","Nor be grieved: she is of good esteem,\r","Her dowery wealthy, and of worthy birth;\r","Beside, so qualified as may beseem\r","The spouse of any noble gentleman.\r","Let me embrace with old Vincentio,\r","And wander we to see thy honest son,\r","Who will of thy arrival be full joyous.\r","\r","VINCENTIO:\r","But is it true? or else is it your pleasure,\r","Like pleasant travellers, to break a jest\r","Upon the company you overtake?\r","\r","HORTENSIO:\r","I do assure thee, father, so it is.\r","\r","PETRUCHIO:\r","Come, go along, and see the truth hereof;\r","For our first merriment hath made thee jealous.\r","\r","HORTENSIO:\r","Well, Petruchio, this has put me in heart.\r","Have to my widow! and if she be froward,\r","Then hast thou taught Hortensio to be untoward.\r","\r","BIONDELLO:\r","Softly and swiftly, sir; for the priest is ready.\r","\r","LUCENTIO:\r","I fly, Biondello: but they may chance to need thee\r","at home; therefore leave us.\r","\r","BIONDELLO:\r","Nay, faith, I'll see the church o' your back; and\r","then come back to my master's as soon as I can.\r","\r","GREMIO:\r","I marvel Cambio comes not all this while.\r","\r","PETRUCHIO:\r","Sir, here's the door, this is Lucentio's house:\r","My father's bears more toward the market-place;\r","Thither must I, and here I leave you, sir.\r","\r","VINCENTIO:\r","You shall not choose but drink before you go:\r","I think I shall command your welcome here,\r","And, by all likelihood, some cheer is toward.\r","\r","GREMIO:\r","They're busy within; you were best knock louder.\r","\r","Pedant:\r","What's he that knocks as he would beat down the gate?\r","\r","VINCENTIO:\r","Is Signior Lucentio within, sir?\r","\r","Pedant:\r","He's within, sir, but not to be spoken withal.\r","\r","VINCENTIO:\r","What if a man bring him a hundred pound or two, to\r","make merry withal?\r","\r","Pedant:\r","Keep your hundred pounds to yourself: he shall\r","need none, so long as I live.\r","\r","PETRUCHIO:\r","Nay, I told you your son was well beloved in Padua.\r","Do you hear, sir? To leave frivolous circumstances,\r","I pray you, tell Signior Lucentio that his father is\r","come from Pisa, and is here at the door to speak with him.\r","\r","Pedant:\r","Thou liest: his father is come from Padua and here\r","looking out at the window.\r","\r","VINCENTIO:\r","Art thou his father?\r","\r","Pedant:\r","Ay, sir; so his mother says, if I may believe her.\r","\r","PETRUCHIO:\r","\r","Pedant:\r","Lay hands on the villain: I believe a' means to\r","cozen somebody in this city under my countenance.\r","\r","BIONDELLO:\r","I have seen them in the church together: God send\r","'em good shipping! But who is here? mine old\r","master Vincentio! now we are undone and brought to nothing.\r","\r","VINCENTIO:\r","\r","BIONDELLO:\r","Hope I may choose, sir.\r","\r","VINCENTIO:\r","Come hither, you rogue. What, have you forgot me?\r","\r","BIONDELLO:\r","Forgot you! no, sir: I could not forget you, for I\r","never saw you before in all my life.\r","\r","VINCENTIO:\r","What, you notorious villain, didst thou never see\r","thy master's father, Vincentio?\r","\r","BIONDELLO:\r","What, my old worshipful old master? yes, marry, sir:\r","see where he looks out of the window.\r","\r","VINCENTIO:\r","Is't so, indeed.\r","\r","BIONDELLO:\r","Help, help, help! here's a madman will murder me.\r","\r","Pedant:\r","Help, son! help, Signior Baptista!\r","\r","PETRUCHIO:\r","Prithee, Kate, let's stand aside and see the end of\r","this controversy.\r","\r","TRANIO:\r","Sir, what are you that offer to beat my servant?\r","\r","VINCENTIO:\r","What am I, sir! nay, what are you, sir? O immortal\r","gods! O fine villain! A silken doublet! a velvet\r","hose! a scarlet cloak! and a copatain hat! O, I\r","am undone! I am undone! while I play the good\r","husband at home, my son and my servant spend all at\r","the university.\r","\r","TRANIO:\r","How now! what's the matter?\r","\r","BAPTISTA:\r","What, is the man lunatic?\r","\r","TRANIO:\r","Sir, you seem a sober ancient gentleman by your\r","habit, but your words show you a madman. Why, sir,\r","what 'cerns it you if I wear pearl and gold? I\r","thank my good father, I am able to maintain it.\r","\r","VINCENTIO:\r","Thy father! O villain! he is a sailmaker in Bergamo.\r","\r","BAPTISTA:\r","You mistake, sir, you mistake, sir. Pray, what do\r","you think is his name?\r","\r","VINCENTIO:\r","His name! as if I knew not his name: I have brought\r","him up ever since he was three years old, and his\r","name is Tranio.\r","\r","Pedant:\r","Away, away, mad ass! his name is Lucentio and he is\r","mine only son, and heir to the lands of me, Signior Vincentio.\r","\r","VINCENTIO:\r","Lucentio! O, he hath murdered his master! Lay hold\r","on him, I charge you, in the duke's name. O, my\r","son, my son! Tell me, thou villain, where is my son Lucentio?\r","\r","TRANIO:\r","Call forth an officer.\r","Carry this mad knave to the gaol. Father Baptista,\r","I charge you see that he be forthcoming.\r","\r","VINCENTIO:\r","Carry me to the gaol!\r","\r","GREMIO:\r","Stay, officer: he shall not go to prison.\r","\r","BAPTISTA:\r","Talk not, Signior Gremio: I say he shall go to prison.\r","\r","GREMIO:\r","Take heed, Signior Baptista, lest you be\r","cony-catched in this business: I dare swear this\r","is the right Vincentio.\r","\r","Pedant:\r","Swear, if thou darest.\r","\r","GREMIO:\r","Nay, I dare not swear it.\r","\r","TRANIO:\r","Then thou wert best say that I am not Lucentio.\r","\r","GREMIO:\r","Yes, I know thee to be Signior Lucentio.\r","\r","BAPTISTA:\r","Away with the dotard! to the gaol with him!\r","\r","VINCENTIO:\r","Thus strangers may be hailed and abused: O\r","monstrous villain!\r","\r","BIONDELLO:\r","O! we are spoiled and--yonder he is: deny him,\r","forswear him, or else we are all undone.\r","\r","LUCENTIO:\r","\r","VINCENTIO:\r","Lives my sweet son?\r","\r","BIANCA:\r","Pardon, dear father.\r","\r","BAPTISTA:\r","How hast thou offended?\r","Where is Lucentio?\r","\r","LUCENTIO:\r","Here's Lucentio,\r","Right son to the right Vincentio;\r","That have by marriage made thy daughter mine,\r","While counterfeit supposes bleared thine eyne.\r","\r","GREMIO:\r","Here's packing, with a witness to deceive us all!\r","\r","VINCENTIO:\r","Where is that damned villain Tranio,\r","That faced and braved me in this matter so?\r","\r","BAPTISTA:\r","Why, tell me, is not this my Cambio?\r","\r","BIANCA:\r","Cambio is changed into Lucentio.\r","\r","LUCENTIO:\r","Love wrought these miracles. Bianca's love\r","Made me exchange my state with Tranio,\r","While he did bear my countenance in the town;\r","And happily I have arrived at the last\r","Unto the wished haven of my bliss.\r","What Tranio did, myself enforced him to;\r","Then pardon him, sweet father, for my sake.\r","\r","VINCENTIO:\r","I'll slit the villain's nose, that would have sent\r","me to the gaol.\r","\r","BAPTISTA:\r","But do you hear, sir? have you married my daughter\r","without asking my good will?\r","\r","VINCENTIO:\r","Fear not, Baptista; we will content you, go to: but\r","I will in, to be revenged for this villany.\r","\r","BAPTISTA:\r","And I, to sound the depth of this knavery.\r","\r","LUCENTIO:\r","Look not pale, Bianca; thy father will not frown.\r","\r","GREMIO:\r","My cake is dough; but I'll in among the rest,\r","Out of hope of all, but my share of the feast.\r","\r","KATHARINA:\r","Husband, let's follow, to see the end of this ado.\r","\r","PETRUCHIO:\r","First kiss me, Kate, and we will.\r","\r","KATHARINA:\r","What, in the midst of the street?\r","\r","PETRUCHIO:\r","What, art thou ashamed of me?\r","\r","KATHARINA:\r","No, sir, God forbid; but ashamed to kiss.\r","\r","PETRUCHIO:\r","Why, then let's home again. Come, sirrah, let's away.\r","\r","KATHARINA:\r","Nay, I will give thee a kiss: now pray thee, love, stay.\r","\r","PETRUCHIO:\r","Is not this well? Come, my sweet Kate:\r","Better once than never, for never too late.\r","\r","LUCENTIO:\r","At last, though long, our jarring notes agree:\r","And time it is, when raging war is done,\r","To smile at scapes and perils overblown.\r","My fair Bianca, bid my father welcome,\r","While I with self-same kindness welcome thine.\r","Brother Petruchio, sister Katharina,\r","And thou, Hortensio, with thy loving widow,\r","Feast with the best, and welcome to my house:\r","My banquet is to close our stomachs up,\r","After our great good cheer. Pray you, sit down;\r","For now we sit to chat as well as eat.\r","\r","PETRUCHIO:\r","Nothing but sit and sit, and eat and eat!\r","\r","BAPTISTA:\r","Padua affords this kindness, son Petruchio.\r","\r","PETRUCHIO:\r","Padua affords nothing but what is kind.\r","\r","HORTENSIO:\r","For both our sakes, I would that word were true.\r","\r","PETRUCHIO:\r","Now, for my life, Hortensio fears his widow.\r","\r","Widow:\r","Then never trust me, if I be afeard.\r","\r","PETRUCHIO:\r","You are very sensible, and yet you miss my sense:\r","I mean, Hortensio is afeard of you.\r","\r","Widow:\r","He that is giddy thinks the world turns round.\r","\r","PETRUCHIO:\r","Roundly replied.\r","\r","KATHARINA:\r","Mistress, how mean you that?\r","\r","Widow:\r","Thus I conceive by him.\r","\r","PETRUCHIO:\r","Conceives by me! How likes Hortensio that?\r","\r","HORTENSIO:\r","My widow says, thus she conceives her tale.\r","\r","PETRUCHIO:\r","Very well mended. Kiss him for that, good widow.\r","\r","KATHARINA:\r","'He that is giddy thinks the world turns round:'\r","I pray you, tell me what you meant by that.\r","\r","Widow:\r","Your husband, being troubled with a shrew,\r","Measures my husband's sorrow by his woe:\r","And now you know my meaning,\r","\r","KATHARINA:\r","A very mean meaning.\r","\r","Widow:\r","Right, I mean you.\r","\r","KATHARINA:\r","And I am mean indeed, respecting you.\r","\r","PETRUCHIO:\r","To her, Kate!\r","\r","HORTENSIO:\r","To her, widow!\r","\r","PETRUCHIO:\r","A hundred marks, my Kate does put her down.\r","\r","HORTENSIO:\r","That's my office.\r","\r","PETRUCHIO:\r","Spoke like an officer; ha' to thee, lad!\r","\r","BAPTISTA:\r","How likes Gremio these quick-witted folks?\r","\r","GREMIO:\r","Believe me, sir, they butt together well.\r","\r","BIANCA:\r","Head, and butt! an hasty-witted body\r","Would say your head and butt were head and horn.\r","\r","VINCENTIO:\r","Ay, mistress bride, hath that awaken'd you?\r","\r","BIANCA:\r","Ay, but not frighted me; therefore I'll sleep again.\r","\r","PETRUCHIO:\r","Nay, that you shall not: since you have begun,\r","Have at you for a bitter jest or two!\r","\r","BIANCA:\r","Am I your bird? I mean to shift my bush;\r","And then pursue me as you draw your bow.\r","You are welcome all.\r","\r","PETRUCHIO:\r","She hath prevented me. Here, Signior Tranio.\r","This bird you aim'd at, though you hit her not;\r","Therefore a health to all that shot and miss'd.\r","\r","TRANIO:\r","O, sir, Lucentio slipp'd me like his greyhound,\r","Which runs himself and catches for his master.\r","\r","PETRUCHIO:\r","A good swift simile, but something currish.\r","\r","TRANIO:\r","'Tis well, sir, that you hunted for yourself:\r","'Tis thought your deer does hold you at a bay.\r","\r","BAPTISTA:\r","O ho, Petruchio! Tranio hits you now.\r","\r","LUCENTIO:\r","I thank thee for that gird, good Tranio.\r","\r","HORTENSIO:\r","Confess, confess, hath he not hit you here?\r","\r","PETRUCHIO:\r","A' has a little gall'd me, I confess;\r","And, as the jest did glance away from me,\r","'Tis ten to one it maim'd you two outright.\r","\r","BAPTISTA:\r","Now, in good sadness, son Petruchio,\r","I think thou hast the veriest shrew of all.\r","\r","PETRUCHIO:\r","Well, I say no: and therefore for assurance\r","Let's each one send unto his wife;\r","And he whose wife is most obedient\r","To come at first when he doth send for her,\r","Shall win the wager which we will propose.\r","\r","HORTENSIO:\r","Content. What is the wager?\r","\r","LUCENTIO:\r","Twenty crowns.\r","\r","PETRUCHIO:\r","Twenty crowns!\r","I'll venture so much of my hawk or hound,\r","But twenty times so much upon my wife.\r","\r","LUCENTIO:\r","A hundred then.\r","\r","HORTENSIO:\r","Content.\r","\r","PETRUCHIO:\r","A match! 'tis done.\r","\r","HORTENSIO:\r","Who shall begin?\r","\r","LUCENTIO:\r","That will I.\r","Go, Biondello, bid your mistress come to me.\r","\r","BIONDELLO:\r","I go.\r","\r","BAPTISTA:\r","Son, I'll be your half, Bianca comes.\r","\r","LUCENTIO:\r","I'll have no halves; I'll bear it all myself.\r","How now! what news?\r","\r","BIONDELLO:\r","Sir, my mistress sends you word\r","That she is busy and she cannot come.\r","\r","PETRUCHIO:\r","How! she is busy and she cannot come!\r","Is that an answer?\r","\r","GREMIO:\r","Ay, and a kind one too:\r","Pray God, sir, your wife send you not a worse.\r","\r","PETRUCHIO:\r","I hope better.\r","\r","HORTENSIO:\r","Sirrah Biondello, go and entreat my wife\r","To come to me forthwith.\r","\r","PETRUCHIO:\r","O, ho! entreat her!\r","Nay, then she must needs come.\r","\r","HORTENSIO:\r","I am afraid, sir,\r","Do what you can, yours will not be entreated.\r","Now, where's my wife?\r","\r","BIONDELLO:\r","She says you have some goodly jest in hand:\r","She will not come: she bids you come to her.\r","\r","PETRUCHIO:\r","Worse and worse; she will not come! O vile,\r","Intolerable, not to be endured!\r","Sirrah Grumio, go to your mistress;\r","Say, I command her to come to me.\r","\r","HORTENSIO:\r","I know her answer.\r","\r","PETRUCHIO:\r","What?\r","\r","HORTENSIO:\r","She will not.\r","\r","PETRUCHIO:\r","The fouler fortune mine, and there an end.\r","\r","BAPTISTA:\r","Now, by my holidame, here comes Katharina!\r","\r","KATHARINA:\r","What is your will, sir, that you send for me?\r","\r","PETRUCHIO:\r","Where is your sister, and Hortensio's wife?\r","\r","KATHARINA:\r","They sit conferring by the parlor fire.\r","\r","PETRUCHIO:\r","Go fetch them hither: if they deny to come.\r","Swinge me them soundly forth unto their husbands:\r","Away, I say, and bring them hither straight.\r","\r","LUCENTIO:\r","Here is a wonder, if you talk of a wonder.\r","\r","HORTENSIO:\r","And so it is: I wonder what it bodes.\r","\r","PETRUCHIO:\r","Marry, peace it bodes, and love and quiet life,\r","And awful rule and right supremacy;\r","And, to be short, what not, that's sweet and happy?\r","\r","BAPTISTA:\r","Now, fair befal thee, good Petruchio!\r","The wager thou hast won; and I will add\r","Unto their losses twenty thousand crowns;\r","Another dowry to another daughter,\r","For she is changed, as she had never been.\r","\r","PETRUCHIO:\r","Nay, I will win my wager better yet\r","And show more sign of her obedience,\r","Her new-built virtue and obedience.\r","See where she comes and brings your froward wives\r","As prisoners to her womanly persuasion.\r","Katharina, that cap of yours becomes you not:\r","Off with that bauble, throw it under-foot.\r","\r","Widow:\r","Lord, let me never have a cause to sigh,\r","Till I be brought to such a silly pass!\r","\r","BIANCA:\r","Fie! what a foolish duty call you this?\r","\r","LUCENTIO:\r","I would your duty were as foolish too:\r","The wisdom of your duty, fair Bianca,\r","Hath cost me an hundred crowns since supper-time.\r","\r","BIANCA:\r","The more fool you, for laying on my duty.\r","\r","PETRUCHIO:\r","Katharina, I charge thee, tell these headstrong women\r","What duty they do owe their lords and husbands.\r","\r","Widow:\r","Come, come, you're mocking: we will have no telling.\r","\r","PETRUCHIO:\r","Come on, I say; and first begin with her.\r","\r","Widow:\r","She shall not.\r","\r","PETRUCHIO:\r","I say she shall: and first begin with her.\r","\r","KATHARINA:\r","Fie, fie! unknit that threatening unkind brow,\r","And dart not scornful glances from those eyes,\r","To wound thy lord, thy king, thy governor:\r","It blots thy beauty as frosts do bite the meads,\r","Confounds thy fame as whirlwinds shake fair buds,\r","And in no sense is meet or amiable.\r","A woman moved is like a fountain troubled,\r","Muddy, ill-seeming, thick, bereft of beauty;\r","And while it is so, none so dry or thirsty\r","Will deign to sip or touch one drop of it.\r","Thy husband is thy lord, thy life, thy keeper,\r","Thy head, thy sovereign; one that cares for thee,\r","And for thy maintenance commits his body\r","To painful labour both by sea and land,\r","To watch the night in storms, the day in cold,\r","Whilst thou liest warm at home, secure and safe;\r","And craves no other tribute at thy hands\r","But love, fair looks and true obedience;\r","Too little payment for so great a debt.\r","Such duty as the subject owes the prince\r","Even such a woman oweth to her husband;\r","And when she is froward, peevish, sullen, sour,\r","And not obedient to his honest will,\r","What is she but a foul contending rebel\r","And graceless traitor to her loving lord?\r","I am ashamed that women are so simple\r","To offer war where they should kneel for peace;\r","Or seek for rule, supremacy and sway,\r","When they are bound to serve, love and obey.\r","Why are our bodies soft and weak and smooth,\r","Unapt to toil and trouble in the world,\r","But that our soft conditions and our hearts\r","Should well agree with our external parts?\r","Come, come, you froward and unable worms!\r","My mind hath been as big as one of yours,\r","My heart as great, my reason haply more,\r","To bandy word for word and frown for frown;\r","But now I see our lances are but straws,\r","Our strength as weak, our weakness past compare,\r","That seeming to be most which we indeed least are.\r","Then vail your stomachs, for it is no boot,\r","And place your hands below your husband's foot:\r","In token of which duty, if he please,\r","My hand is ready; may it do him ease.\r","\r","PETRUCHIO:\r","Why, there's a wench! Come on, and kiss me, Kate.\r","\r","LUCENTIO:\r","Well, go thy ways, old lad; for thou shalt ha't.\r","\r","VINCENTIO:\r","'Tis a good hearing when children are toward.\r","\r","LUCENTIO:\r","But a harsh hearing when women are froward.\r","\r","PETRUCHIO:\r","Come, Kate, we'll to bed.\r","We three are married, but you two are sped.\r","'Twas I won the wager, though you hit the white;\r","And, being a winner, God give you good night!\r","\r","HORTENSIO:\r","Now, go thy ways; thou hast tamed a curst shrew.\r","\r","LUCENTIO:\r","'Tis a wonder, by your leave, she will be tamed so.\r","\r","Master:\r","Boatswain!\r","\r","Boatswain:\r","Here, master: what cheer?\r","\r","Master:\r","Good, speak to the mariners: fall to't, yarely,\r","or we run ourselves aground: bestir, bestir.\r","\r","Boatswain:\r","Heigh, my hearts! cheerly, cheerly, my hearts!\r","yare, yare! Take in the topsail. Tend to the\r","master's whistle. Blow, till thou burst thy wind,\r","if room enough!\r","\r","ALONSO:\r","Good boatswain, have care. Where's the master?\r","Play the men.\r","\r","Boatswain:\r","I pray now, keep below.\r","\r","ANTONIO:\r","Where is the master, boatswain?\r","\r","Boatswain:\r","Do you not hear him? You mar our labour: keep your\r","cabins: you do assist the storm.\r","\r","GONZALO:\r","Nay, good, be patient.\r","\r","Boatswain:\r","When the sea is. Hence! What cares these roarers\r","for the name of king? To cabin: silence! trouble us not.\r","\r","GONZALO:\r","Good, yet remember whom thou hast aboard.\r","\r","Boatswain:\r","None that I more love than myself. You are a\r","counsellor; if you can command these elements to\r","silence, and work the peace of the present, we will\r","not hand a rope more; use your authority: if you\r","cannot, give thanks you have lived so long, and make\r","yourself ready in your cabin for the mischance of\r","the hour, if it so hap. Cheerly, good hearts! Out\r","of our way, I say.\r","\r","GONZALO:\r","I have great comfort from this fellow: methinks he\r","hath no drowning mark upon him; his complexion is\r","perfect gallows. Stand fast, good Fate, to his\r","hanging: make the rope of his destiny our cable,\r","for our own doth little advantage. If he be not\r","born to be hanged, our case is miserable.\r","\r","Boatswain:\r","Down with the topmast! yare! lower, lower! Bring\r","her to try with main-course.\r","A plague upon this howling! they are louder than\r","the weather or our office.\r","Yet again! what do you here? Shall we give o'er\r","and drown? Have you a mind to sink?\r","\r","SEBASTIAN:\r","A pox o' your throat, you bawling, blasphemous,\r","incharitable dog!\r","\r","Boatswain:\r","Work you then.\r","\r","ANTONIO:\r","Hang, cur! hang, you whoreson, insolent noisemaker!\r","We are less afraid to be drowned than thou art.\r","\r","GONZALO:\r","I'll warrant him for drowning; though the ship were\r","no stronger than a nutshell and as leaky as an\r","unstanched wench.\r","\r","Boatswain:\r","Lay her a-hold, a-hold! set her two courses off to\r","sea again; lay her off.\r","\r","Mariners:\r","All lost! to prayers, to prayers! all lost!\r","\r","Boatswain:\r","What, must our mouths be cold?\r","\r","GONZALO:\r","The king and prince at prayers! let's assist them,\r","For our case is as theirs.\r","\r","SEBASTIAN:\r","I'm out of patience.\r","\r","ANTONIO:\r","We are merely cheated of our lives by drunkards:\r","This wide-chapp'd rascal--would thou mightst lie drowning\r","The washing of ten tides!\r","\r","GONZALO:\r","He'll be hang'd yet,\r","Though every drop of water swear against it\r","And gape at widest to glut him.\r","\r","ANTONIO:\r","Let's all sink with the king.\r","\r","SEBASTIAN:\r","Let's take leave of him.\r","\r","GONZALO:\r","Now would I give a thousand furlongs of sea for an\r","acre of barren ground, long heath, brown furze, any\r","thing. The wills above be done! but I would fain\r","die a dry death.\r","\r","MIRANDA:\r","If by your art, my dearest father, you have\r","Put the wild waters in this roar, allay them.\r","The sky, it seems, would pour down stinking pitch,\r","But that the sea, mounting to the welkin's cheek,\r","Dashes the fire out. O, I have suffered\r","With those that I saw suffer: a brave vessel,\r","Who had, no doubt, some noble creature in her,\r","Dash'd all to pieces. O, the cry did knock\r","Against my very heart. Poor souls, they perish'd.\r","Had I been any god of power, I would\r","Have sunk the sea within the earth or ere\r","It should the good ship so have swallow'd and\r","The fraughting souls within her.\r","\r","PROSPERO:\r","Be collected:\r","No more amazement: tell your piteous heart\r","There's no harm done.\r","\r","MIRANDA:\r","O, woe the day!\r","\r","PROSPERO:\r","No harm.\r","I have done nothing but in care of thee,\r","Of thee, my dear one, thee, my daughter, who\r","Art ignorant of what thou art, nought knowing\r","Of whence I am, nor that I am more better\r","Than Prospero, master of a full poor cell,\r","And thy no greater father.\r","\r","MIRANDA:\r","More to know\r","Did never meddle with my thoughts.\r","\r","PROSPERO:\r","'Tis time\r","I should inform thee farther. Lend thy hand,\r","And pluck my magic garment from me. So:\r","Lie there, my art. Wipe thou thine eyes; have comfort.\r","The direful spectacle of the wreck, which touch'd\r","The very virtue of compassion in thee,\r","I have with such provision in mine art\r","So safely ordered that there is no soul--\r","No, not so much perdition as an hair\r","Betid to any creature in the vessel\r","Which thou heard'st cry, which thou saw'st sink. Sit down;\r","For thou must now know farther.\r","\r","MIRANDA:\r","You have often\r","Begun to tell me what I am, but stopp'd\r","And left me to a bootless inquisition,\r","Concluding 'Stay: not yet.'\r","\r","PROSPERO:\r","The hour's now come;\r","The very minute bids thee ope thine ear;\r","Obey and be attentive. Canst thou remember\r","A time before we came unto this cell?\r","I do not think thou canst, for then thou wast not\r","Out three years old.\r","\r","MIRANDA:\r","Certainly, sir, I can.\r","\r","PROSPERO:\r","By what? by any other house or person?\r","Of any thing the image tell me that\r","Hath kept with thy remembrance.\r","\r","MIRANDA:\r","'Tis far off\r","And rather like a dream than an assurance\r","That my remembrance warrants. Had I not\r","Four or five women once that tended me?\r","\r","PROSPERO:\r","Thou hadst, and more, Miranda. But how is it\r","That this lives in thy mind? What seest thou else\r","In the dark backward and abysm of time?\r","If thou remember'st aught ere thou camest here,\r","How thou camest here thou mayst.\r","\r","MIRANDA:\r","But that I do not.\r","\r","PROSPERO:\r","Twelve year since, Miranda, twelve year since,\r","Thy father was the Duke of Milan and\r","A prince of power.\r","\r","MIRANDA:\r","Sir, are not you my father?\r","\r","PROSPERO:\r","Thy mother was a piece of virtue, and\r","She said thou wast my daughter; and thy father\r","Was Duke of Milan; and thou his only heir\r","And princess no worse issued.\r","\r","MIRANDA:\r","O the heavens!\r","What foul play had we, that we came from thence?\r","Or blessed was't we did?\r","\r","PROSPERO:\r","Both, both, my girl:\r","By foul play, as thou say'st, were we heaved thence,\r","But blessedly holp hither.\r","\r","MIRANDA:\r","O, my heart bleeds\r","To think o' the teen that I have turn'd you to,\r","Which is from my remembrance! Please you, farther.\r","\r","PROSPERO:\r","My brother and thy uncle, call'd Antonio--\r","I pray thee, mark me--that a brother should\r","Be so perfidious!--he whom next thyself\r","Of all the world I loved and to him put\r","The manage of my state; as at that time\r","Through all the signories it was the first\r","And Prospero the prime duke, being so reputed\r","In dignity, and for the liberal arts\r","Without a parallel; those being all my study,\r","The government I cast upon my brother\r","And to my state grew stranger, being transported\r","And rapt in secret studies. Thy false uncle--\r","Dost thou attend me?\r","\r","MIRANDA:\r","Sir, most heedfully.\r","\r","PROSPERO:\r","Being once perfected how to grant suits,\r","How to deny them, who to advance and who\r","To trash for over-topping, new created\r","The creatures that were mine, I say, or changed 'em,\r","Or else new form'd 'em; having both the key\r","Of officer and office, set all hearts i' the state\r","To what tune pleased his ear; that now he was\r","The ivy which had hid my princely trunk,\r","And suck'd my verdure out on't. Thou attend'st not.\r","\r","MIRANDA:\r","O, good sir, I do.\r","\r","PROSPERO:\r","I pray thee, mark me.\r","I, thus neglecting worldly ends, all dedicated\r","To closeness and the bettering of my mind\r","With that which, but by being so retired,\r","O'er-prized all popular rate, in my false brother\r","Awaked an evil nature; and my trust,\r","Like a good parent, did beget of him\r","A falsehood in its contrary as great\r","As my trust was; which had indeed no limit,\r","A confidence sans bound. He being thus lorded,\r","Not only with what my revenue yielded,\r","But what my power might else exact, like one\r","Who having into truth, by telling of it,\r","Made such a sinner of his memory,\r","To credit his own lie, he did believe\r","He was indeed the duke; out o' the substitution\r","And executing the outward face of royalty,\r","With all prerogative: hence his ambition growing--\r","Dost thou hear?\r","\r","MIRANDA:\r","Your tale, sir, would cure deafness.\r","\r","PROSPERO:\r","To have no screen between this part he play'd\r","And him he play'd it for, he needs will be\r","Absolute Milan. Me, poor man, my library\r","Was dukedom large enough: of temporal royalties\r","He thinks me now incapable; confederates--\r","So dry he was for sway--wi' the King of Naples\r","To give him annual tribute, do him homage,\r","Subject his coronet to his crown and bend\r","The dukedom yet unbow'd--alas, poor Milan!--\r","To most ignoble stooping.\r","\r","MIRANDA:\r","O the heavens!\r","\r","PROSPERO:\r","Mark his condition and the event; then tell me\r","If this might be a brother.\r","\r","MIRANDA:\r","I should sin\r","To think but nobly of my grandmother:\r","Good wombs have borne bad sons.\r","\r","PROSPERO:\r","Now the condition.\r","The King of Naples, being an enemy\r","To me inveterate, hearkens my brother's suit;\r","Which was, that he, in lieu o' the premises\r","Of homage and I know not how much tribute,\r","Should presently extirpate me and mine\r","Out of the dukedom and confer fair Milan\r","With all the honours on my brother: whereon,\r","A treacherous army levied, one midnight\r","Fated to the purpose did Antonio open\r","The gates of Milan, and, i' the dead of darkness,\r","The ministers for the purpose hurried thence\r","Me and thy crying self.\r","\r","MIRANDA:\r","Alack, for pity!\r","I, not remembering how I cried out then,\r","Will cry it o'er again: it is a hint\r","That wrings mine eyes to't.\r","\r","PROSPERO:\r","Hear a little further\r","And then I'll bring thee to the present business\r","Which now's upon's; without the which this story\r","Were most impertinent.\r","\r","MIRANDA:\r","Wherefore did they not\r","That hour destroy us?\r","\r","PROSPERO:\r","Well demanded, wench:\r","My tale provokes that question. Dear, they durst not,\r","So dear the love my people bore me, nor set\r","A mark so bloody on the business, but\r","With colours fairer painted their foul ends.\r","In few, they hurried us aboard a bark,\r","Bore us some leagues to sea; where they prepared\r","A rotten carcass of a boat, not rigg'd,\r","Nor tackle, sail, nor mast; the very rats\r","Instinctively had quit it: there they hoist us,\r","To cry to the sea that roar'd to us, to sigh\r","To the winds whose pity, sighing back again,\r","Did us but loving wrong.\r","\r","MIRANDA:\r","Alack, what trouble\r","Was I then to you!\r","\r","PROSPERO:\r","O, a cherubim\r","Thou wast that did preserve me. Thou didst smile.\r","Infused with a fortitude from heaven,\r","When I have deck'd the sea with drops full salt,\r","Under my burthen groan'd; which raised in me\r","An undergoing stomach, to bear up\r","Against what should ensue.\r","\r","MIRANDA:\r","How came we ashore?\r","\r","PROSPERO:\r","By Providence divine.\r","Some food we had and some fresh water that\r","A noble Neapolitan, Gonzalo,\r","Out of his charity, being then appointed\r","Master of this design, did give us, with\r","Rich garments, linens, stuffs and necessaries,\r","Which since have steaded much; so, of his gentleness,\r","Knowing I loved my books, he furnish'd me\r","From mine own library with volumes that\r","I prize above my dukedom.\r","\r","MIRANDA:\r","Would I might\r","But ever see that man!\r","\r","PROSPERO:\r","Now I arise:\r","Sit still, and hear the last of our sea-sorrow.\r","Here in this island we arrived; and here\r","Have I, thy schoolmaster, made thee more profit\r","Than other princesses can that have more time\r","For vainer hours and tutors not so careful.\r","\r","MIRANDA:\r","Heavens thank you for't! And now, I pray you, sir,\r","For still 'tis beating in my mind, your reason\r","For raising this sea-storm?\r","\r","PROSPERO:\r","Know thus far forth.\r","By accident most strange, bountiful Fortune,\r","Now my dear lady, hath mine enemies\r","Brought to this shore; and by my prescience\r","I find my zenith doth depend upon\r","A most auspicious star, whose influence\r","If now I court not but omit, my fortunes\r","Will ever after droop. Here cease more questions:\r","Thou art inclined to sleep; 'tis a good dulness,\r","And give it way: I know thou canst not choose.\r","Come away, servant, come. I am ready now.\r","Approach, my Ariel, come.\r","\r","ARIEL:\r","All hail, great master! grave sir, hail! I come\r","To answer thy best pleasure; be't to fly,\r","To swim, to dive into the fire, to ride\r","On the curl'd clouds, to thy strong bidding task\r","Ariel and all his quality.\r","\r","PROSPERO:\r","Hast thou, spirit,\r","Perform'd to point the tempest that I bade thee?\r","\r","ARIEL:\r","To every article.\r","I boarded the king's ship; now on the beak,\r","Now in the waist, the deck, in every cabin,\r","I flamed amazement: sometime I'ld divide,\r","And burn in many places; on the topmast,\r","The yards and bowsprit, would I flame distinctly,\r","Then meet and join. Jove's lightnings, the precursors\r","O' the dreadful thunder-claps, more momentary\r","And sight-outrunning were not; the fire and cracks\r","Of sulphurous roaring the most mighty Neptune\r","Seem to besiege and make his bold waves tremble,\r","Yea, his dread trident shake.\r","\r","PROSPERO:\r","My brave spirit!\r","Who was so firm, so constant, that this coil\r","Would not infect his reason?\r","\r","ARIEL:\r","Not a soul\r","But felt a fever of the mad and play'd\r","Some tricks of desperation. All but mariners\r","Plunged in the foaming brine and quit the vessel,\r","Then all afire with me: the king's son, Ferdinand,\r","With hair up-staring,--then like reeds, not hair,--\r","Was the first man that leap'd; cried, 'Hell is empty\r","And all the devils are here.'\r","\r","PROSPERO:\r","Why that's my spirit!\r","But was not this nigh shore?\r","\r","ARIEL:\r","Close by, my master.\r","\r","PROSPERO:\r","But are they, Ariel, safe?\r","\r","ARIEL:\r","Not a hair perish'd;\r","On their sustaining garments not a blemish,\r","But fresher than before: and, as thou badest me,\r","In troops I have dispersed them 'bout the isle.\r","The king's son have I landed by himself;\r","Whom I left cooling of the air with sighs\r","In an odd angle of the isle and sitting,\r","His arms in this sad knot.\r","\r","PROSPERO:\r","Of the king's ship\r","The mariners say how thou hast disposed\r","And all the rest o' the fleet.\r","\r","ARIEL:\r","Safely in harbour\r","Is the king's ship; in the deep nook, where once\r","Thou call'dst me up at midnight to fetch dew\r","From the still-vex'd Bermoothes, there she's hid:\r","The mariners all under hatches stow'd;\r","Who, with a charm join'd to their suffer'd labour,\r","I have left asleep; and for the rest o' the fleet\r","Which I dispersed, they all have met again\r","And are upon the Mediterranean flote,\r","Bound sadly home for Naples,\r","Supposing that they saw the king's ship wreck'd\r","And his great person perish.\r","\r","PROSPERO:\r","Ariel, thy charge\r","Exactly is perform'd: but there's more work.\r","What is the time o' the day?\r","\r","ARIEL:\r","Past the mid season.\r","\r","PROSPERO:\r","At least two glasses. The time 'twixt six and now\r","Must by us both be spent most preciously.\r","\r","ARIEL:\r","Is there more toil? Since thou dost give me pains,\r","Let me remember thee what thou hast promised,\r","Which is not yet perform'd me.\r","\r","PROSPERO:\r","How now? moody?\r","What is't thou canst demand?\r","\r","ARIEL:\r","My liberty.\r","\r","PROSPERO:\r","Before the time be out? no more!\r","\r","ARIEL:\r","I prithee,\r","Remember I have done thee worthy service;\r","Told thee no lies, made thee no mistakings, served\r","Without or grudge or grumblings: thou didst promise\r","To bate me a full year.\r","\r","PROSPERO:\r","Dost thou forget\r","From what a torment I did free thee?\r","\r","ARIEL:\r","No.\r","\r","PROSPERO:\r","Thou dost, and think'st it much to tread the ooze\r","Of the salt deep,\r","To run upon the sharp wind of the north,\r","To do me business in the veins o' the earth\r","When it is baked with frost.\r","\r","ARIEL:\r","I do not, sir.\r","\r","PROSPERO:\r","Thou liest, malignant thing! Hast thou forgot\r","The foul witch Sycorax, who with age and envy\r","Was grown into a hoop? hast thou forgot her?\r","\r","ARIEL:\r","No, sir.\r","\r","PROSPERO:\r","Thou hast. Where was she born? speak; tell me.\r","\r","ARIEL:\r","Sir, in Argier.\r","\r","PROSPERO:\r","O, was she so? I must\r","Once in a month recount what thou hast been,\r","Which thou forget'st. This damn'd witch Sycorax,\r","For mischiefs manifold and sorceries terrible\r","To enter human hearing, from Argier,\r","Thou know'st, was banish'd: for one thing she did\r","They would not take her life. Is not this true?\r","\r","ARIEL:\r","Ay, sir.\r","\r","PROSPERO:\r","This blue-eyed hag was hither brought with child\r","And here was left by the sailors. Thou, my slave,\r","As thou report'st thyself, wast then her servant;\r","And, for thou wast a spirit too delicate\r","To act her earthy and abhorr'd commands,\r","Refusing her grand hests, she did confine thee,\r","By help of her more potent ministers\r","And in her most unmitigable rage,\r","Into a cloven pine; within which rift\r","Imprison'd thou didst painfully remain\r","A dozen years; within which space she died\r","And left thee there; where thou didst vent thy groans\r","As fast as mill-wheels strike. Then was this island--\r","Save for the son that she did litter here,\r","A freckled whelp hag-born--not honour'd with\r","A human shape.\r","\r","ARIEL:\r","Yes, Caliban her son.\r","\r","PROSPERO:\r","Dull thing, I say so; he, that Caliban\r","Whom now I keep in service. Thou best know'st\r","What torment I did find thee in; thy groans\r","Did make wolves howl and penetrate the breasts\r","Of ever angry bears: it was a torment\r","To lay upon the damn'd, which Sycorax\r","Could not again undo: it was mine art,\r","When I arrived and heard thee, that made gape\r","The pine and let thee out.\r","\r","ARIEL:\r","I thank thee, master.\r","\r","PROSPERO:\r","If thou more murmur'st, I will rend an oak\r","And peg thee in his knotty entrails till\r","Thou hast howl'd away twelve winters.\r","\r","ARIEL:\r","Pardon, master;\r","I will be correspondent to command\r","And do my spiriting gently.\r","\r","PROSPERO:\r","Do so, and after two days\r","I will discharge thee.\r","\r","ARIEL:\r","That's my noble master!\r","What shall I do? say what; what shall I do?\r","\r","PROSPERO:\r","Go make thyself like a nymph o' the sea: be subject\r","To no sight but thine and mine, invisible\r","To every eyeball else. Go take this shape\r","And hither come in't: go, hence with diligence!\r","Awake, dear heart, awake! thou hast slept well; Awake!\r","\r","MIRANDA:\r","The strangeness of your story put\r","Heaviness in me.\r","\r","PROSPERO:\r","Shake it off. Come on;\r","We'll visit Caliban my slave, who never\r","Yields us kind answer.\r","\r","MIRANDA:\r","'Tis a villain, sir,\r","I do not love to look on.\r","\r","PROSPERO:\r","But, as 'tis,\r","We cannot miss him: he does make our fire,\r","Fetch in our wood and serves in offices\r","That profit us. What, ho! slave! Caliban!\r","Thou earth, thou! speak.\r","\r","CALIBAN:\r","\r","PROSPERO:\r","Come forth, I say! there's other business for thee:\r","Come, thou tortoise! when?\r","Fine apparition! My quaint Ariel,\r","Hark in thine ear.\r","\r","ARIEL:\r","My lord it shall be done.\r","\r","PROSPERO:\r","Thou poisonous slave, got by the devil himself\r","Upon thy wicked dam, come forth!\r","\r","CALIBAN:\r","As wicked dew as e'er my mother brush'd\r","With raven's feather from unwholesome fen\r","Drop on you both! a south-west blow on ye\r","And blister you all o'er!\r","\r","PROSPERO:\r","For this, be sure, to-night thou shalt have cramps,\r","Side-stitches that shall pen thy breath up; urchins\r","Shall, for that vast of night that they may work,\r","All exercise on thee; thou shalt be pinch'd\r","As thick as honeycomb, each pinch more stinging\r","Than bees that made 'em.\r","\r","CALIBAN:\r","I must eat my dinner.\r","This island's mine, by Sycorax my mother,\r","Which thou takest from me. When thou camest first,\r","Thou strokedst me and madest much of me, wouldst give me\r","Water with berries in't, and teach me how\r","To name the bigger light, and how the less,\r","That burn by day and night: and then I loved thee\r","And show'd thee all the qualities o' the isle,\r","The fresh springs, brine-pits, barren place and fertile:\r","Cursed be I that did so! All the charms\r","Of Sycorax, toads, beetles, bats, light on you!\r","For I am all the subjects that you have,\r","Which first was mine own king: and here you sty me\r","In this hard rock, whiles you do keep from me\r","The rest o' the island.\r","\r","PROSPERO:\r","Thou most lying slave,\r","Whom stripes may move, not kindness! I have used thee,\r","Filth as thou art, with human care, and lodged thee\r","In mine own cell, till thou didst seek to violate\r","The honour of my child.\r","\r","CALIBAN:\r","O ho, O ho! would't had been done!\r","Thou didst prevent me; I had peopled else\r","This isle with Calibans.\r","\r","PROSPERO:\r","Abhorred slave,\r","Which any print of goodness wilt not take,\r","Being capable of all ill! I pitied thee,\r","Took pains to make thee speak, taught thee each hour\r","One thing or other: when thou didst not, savage,\r","Know thine own meaning, but wouldst gabble like\r","A thing most brutish, I endow'd thy purposes\r","With words that made them known. But thy vile race,\r","Though thou didst learn, had that in't which\r","good natures\r","Could not abide to be with; therefore wast thou\r","Deservedly confined into this rock,\r","Who hadst deserved more than a prison.\r","\r","CALIBAN:\r","You taught me language; and my profit on't\r","Is, I know how to curse. The red plague rid you\r","For learning me your language!\r","\r","PROSPERO:\r","Hag-seed, hence!\r","Fetch us in fuel; and be quick, thou'rt best,\r","To answer other business. Shrug'st thou, malice?\r","If thou neglect'st or dost unwillingly\r","What I command, I'll rack thee with old cramps,\r","Fill all thy bones with aches, make thee roar\r","That beasts shall tremble at thy din.\r","\r","CALIBAN:\r","No, pray thee.\r","I must obey: his art is of such power,\r","It would control my dam's god, Setebos,\r","and make a vassal of him.\r","\r","PROSPERO:\r","So, slave; hence!\r","Come unto these yellow sands,\r","And then take hands:\r","Courtsied when you have and kiss'd\r","The wild waves whist,\r","Foot it featly here and there;\r","And, sweet sprites, the burthen bear.\r","Hark, hark!\r","\r","FERDINAND:\r","Where should this music be? i' the air or the earth?\r","It sounds no more: and sure, it waits upon\r","Some god o' the island. Sitting on a bank,\r","Weeping again the king my father's wreck,\r","This music crept by me upon the waters,\r","Allaying both their fury and my passion\r","With its sweet air: thence I have follow'd it,\r","Or it hath drawn me rather. But 'tis gone.\r","No, it begins again.\r","Full fathom five thy father lies;\r","Of his bones are coral made;\r","Those are pearls that were his eyes:\r","Nothing of him that doth fade\r","But doth suffer a sea-change\r","Into something rich and strange.\r","Sea-nymphs hourly ring his knell\r","Hark! now I hear them,--Ding-dong, bell.\r","\r","FERDINAND:\r","The ditty does remember my drown'd father.\r","This is no mortal business, nor no sound\r","That the earth owes. I hear it now above me.\r","\r","PROSPERO:\r","The fringed curtains of thine eye advance\r","And say what thou seest yond.\r","\r","MIRANDA:\r","What is't? a spirit?\r","Lord, how it looks about! Believe me, sir,\r","It carries a brave form. But 'tis a spirit.\r","\r","PROSPERO:\r","No, wench; it eats and sleeps and hath such senses\r","As we have, such. This gallant which thou seest\r","Was in the wreck; and, but he's something stain'd\r","With grief that's beauty's canker, thou mightst call him\r","A goodly person: he hath lost his fellows\r","And strays about to find 'em.\r","\r","MIRANDA:\r","I might call him\r","A thing divine, for nothing natural\r","I ever saw so noble.\r","\r","PROSPERO:\r","\r","FERDINAND:\r","Most sure, the goddess\r","On whom these airs attend! Vouchsafe my prayer\r","May know if you remain upon this island;\r","And that you will some good instruction give\r","How I may bear me here: my prime request,\r","Which I do last pronounce, is, O you wonder!\r","If you be maid or no?\r","\r","MIRANDA:\r","No wonder, sir;\r","But certainly a maid.\r","\r","FERDINAND:\r","My language! heavens!\r","I am the best of them that speak this speech,\r","Were I but where 'tis spoken.\r","\r","PROSPERO:\r","How? the best?\r","What wert thou, if the King of Naples heard thee?\r","\r","FERDINAND:\r","A single thing, as I am now, that wonders\r","To hear thee speak of Naples. He does hear me;\r","And that he does I weep: myself am Naples,\r","Who with mine eyes, never since at ebb, beheld\r","The king my father wreck'd.\r","\r","MIRANDA:\r","Alack, for mercy!\r","\r","FERDINAND:\r","Yes, faith, and all his lords; the Duke of Milan\r","And his brave son being twain.\r","\r","PROSPERO:\r","\r","MIRANDA:\r","Why speaks my father so ungently? This\r","Is the third man that e'er I saw, the first\r","That e'er I sigh'd for: pity move my father\r","To be inclined my way!\r","\r","FERDINAND:\r","O, if a virgin,\r","And your affection not gone forth, I'll make you\r","The queen of Naples.\r","\r","PROSPERO:\r","Soft, sir! one word more.\r","They are both in either's powers; but this swift business\r","I must uneasy make, lest too light winning\r","Make the prize light.\r","One word more; I charge thee\r","That thou attend me: thou dost here usurp\r","The name thou owest not; and hast put thyself\r","Upon this island as a spy, to win it\r","From me, the lord on't.\r","\r","FERDINAND:\r","No, as I am a man.\r","\r","MIRANDA:\r","There's nothing ill can dwell in such a temple:\r","If the ill spirit have so fair a house,\r","Good things will strive to dwell with't.\r","\r","PROSPERO:\r","Follow me.\r","Speak not you for him; he's a traitor. Come;\r","I'll manacle thy neck and feet together:\r","Sea-water shalt thou drink; thy food shall be\r","The fresh-brook muscles, wither'd roots and husks\r","Wherein the acorn cradled. Follow.\r","\r","FERDINAND:\r","No;\r","I will resist such entertainment till\r","Mine enemy has more power.\r","\r","MIRANDA:\r","O dear father,\r","Make not too rash a trial of him, for\r","He's gentle and not fearful.\r","\r","PROSPERO:\r","What? I say,\r","My foot my tutor? Put thy sword up, traitor;\r","Who makest a show but darest not strike, thy conscience\r","Is so possess'd with guilt: come from thy ward,\r","For I can here disarm thee with this stick\r","And make thy weapon drop.\r","\r","MIRANDA:\r","Beseech you, father.\r","\r","PROSPERO:\r","Hence! hang not on my garments.\r","\r","MIRANDA:\r","Sir, have pity;\r","I'll be his surety.\r","\r","PROSPERO:\r","Silence! one word more\r","Shall make me chide thee, if not hate thee. What!\r","An advocate for an imposter! hush!\r","Thou think'st there is no more such shapes as he,\r","Having seen but him and Caliban: foolish wench!\r","To the most of men this is a Caliban\r","And they to him are angels.\r","\r","MIRANDA:\r","My affections\r","Are then most humble; I have no ambition\r","To see a goodlier man.\r","\r","PROSPERO:\r","Come on; obey:\r","Thy nerves are in their infancy again\r","And have no vigour in them.\r","\r","FERDINAND:\r","So they are;\r","My spirits, as in a dream, are all bound up.\r","My father's loss, the weakness which I feel,\r","The wreck of all my friends, nor this man's threats,\r","To whom I am subdued, are but light to me,\r","Might I but through my prison once a day\r","Behold this maid: all corners else o' the earth\r","Let liberty make use of; space enough\r","Have I in such a prison.\r","\r","PROSPERO:\r","\r","MIRANDA:\r","Be of comfort;\r","My father's of a better nature, sir,\r","Than he appears by speech: this is unwonted\r","Which now came from him.\r","\r","PROSPERO:\r","Thou shalt be free\r","As mountain winds: but then exactly do\r","All points of my command.\r","\r","ARIEL:\r","To the syllable.\r","\r","PROSPERO:\r","Come, follow. Speak not for him.\r","\r","GONZALO:\r","Beseech you, sir, be merry; you have cause,\r","So have we all, of joy; for our escape\r","Is much beyond our loss. Our hint of woe\r","Is common; every day some sailor's wife,\r","The masters of some merchant and the merchant\r","Have just our theme of woe; but for the miracle,\r","I mean our preservation, few in millions\r","Can speak like us: then wisely, good sir, weigh\r","Our sorrow with our comfort.\r","\r","ALONSO:\r","Prithee, peace.\r","\r","SEBASTIAN:\r","He receives comfort like cold porridge.\r","\r","ANTONIO:\r","The visitor will not give him o'er so.\r","\r","SEBASTIAN:\r","Look he's winding up the watch of his wit;\r","by and by it will strike.\r","\r","GONZALO:\r","Sir,--\r","\r","SEBASTIAN:\r","One: tell.\r","\r","GONZALO:\r","When every grief is entertain'd that's offer'd,\r","Comes to the entertainer--\r","\r","SEBASTIAN:\r","A dollar.\r","\r","GONZALO:\r","Dolour comes to him, indeed: you\r","have spoken truer than you purposed.\r","\r","SEBASTIAN:\r","You have taken it wiselier than I meant you should.\r","\r","GONZALO:\r","Therefore, my lord,--\r","\r","ANTONIO:\r","Fie, what a spendthrift is he of his tongue!\r","\r","ALONSO:\r","I prithee, spare.\r","\r","GONZALO:\r","Well, I have done: but yet,--\r","\r","SEBASTIAN:\r","He will be talking.\r","\r","ANTONIO:\r","Which, of he or Adrian, for a good\r","wager, first begins to crow?\r","\r","SEBASTIAN:\r","The old cock.\r","\r","ANTONIO:\r","The cockerel.\r","\r","SEBASTIAN:\r","Done. The wager?\r","\r","ANTONIO:\r","A laughter.\r","\r","SEBASTIAN:\r","A match!\r","\r","ADRIAN:\r","Though this island seem to be desert,--\r","\r","SEBASTIAN:\r","Ha, ha, ha! So, you're paid.\r","\r","ADRIAN:\r","Uninhabitable and almost inaccessible,--\r","\r","SEBASTIAN:\r","Yet,--\r","\r","ADRIAN:\r","Yet,--\r","\r","ANTONIO:\r","He could not miss't.\r","\r","ADRIAN:\r","It must needs be of subtle, tender and delicate\r","temperance.\r","\r","ANTONIO:\r","Temperance was a delicate wench.\r","\r","SEBASTIAN:\r","Ay, and a subtle; as he most learnedly delivered.\r","\r","ADRIAN:\r","The air breathes upon us here most sweetly.\r","\r","SEBASTIAN:\r","As if it had lungs and rotten ones.\r","\r","ANTONIO:\r","Or as 'twere perfumed by a fen.\r","\r","GONZALO:\r","Here is everything advantageous to life.\r","\r","ANTONIO:\r","True; save means to live.\r","\r","SEBASTIAN:\r","Of that there's none, or little.\r","\r","GONZALO:\r","How lush and lusty the grass looks! how green!\r","\r","ANTONIO:\r","The ground indeed is tawny.\r","\r","SEBASTIAN:\r","With an eye of green in't.\r","\r","ANTONIO:\r","He misses not much.\r","\r","SEBASTIAN:\r","No; he doth but mistake the truth totally.\r","\r","GONZALO:\r","But the rarity of it is,--which is indeed almost\r","beyond credit,--\r","\r","SEBASTIAN:\r","As many vouched rarities are.\r","\r","GONZALO:\r","That our garments, being, as they were, drenched in\r","the sea, hold notwithstanding their freshness and\r","glosses, being rather new-dyed than stained with\r","salt water.\r","\r","ANTONIO:\r","If but one of his pockets could speak, would it not\r","say he lies?\r","\r","SEBASTIAN:\r","Ay, or very falsely pocket up his report\r","\r","GONZALO:\r","Methinks our garments are now as fresh as when we\r","put them on first in Afric, at the marriage of\r","the king's fair daughter Claribel to the King of Tunis.\r","\r","SEBASTIAN:\r","'Twas a sweet marriage, and we prosper well in our return.\r","\r","ADRIAN:\r","Tunis was never graced before with such a paragon to\r","their queen.\r","\r","GONZALO:\r","Not since widow Dido's time.\r","\r","ANTONIO:\r","Widow! a pox o' that! How came that widow in?\r","widow Dido!\r","\r","SEBASTIAN:\r","What if he had said 'widower AEneas' too? Good Lord,\r","how you take it!\r","\r","ADRIAN:\r","'Widow Dido' said you? you make me study of that:\r","she was of Carthage, not of Tunis.\r","\r","GONZALO:\r","This Tunis, sir, was Carthage.\r","\r","ADRIAN:\r","Carthage?\r","\r","GONZALO:\r","I assure you, Carthage.\r","\r","SEBASTIAN:\r","His word is more than the miraculous harp; he hath\r","raised the wall and houses too.\r","\r","ANTONIO:\r","What impossible matter will he make easy next?\r","\r","SEBASTIAN:\r","I think he will carry this island home in his pocket\r","and give it his son for an apple.\r","\r","ANTONIO:\r","And, sowing the kernels of it in the sea, bring\r","forth more islands.\r","\r","GONZALO:\r","Ay.\r","\r","ANTONIO:\r","Why, in good time.\r","\r","GONZALO:\r","Sir, we were talking that our garments seem now\r","as fresh as when we were at Tunis at the marriage\r","of your daughter, who is now queen.\r","\r","ANTONIO:\r","And the rarest that e'er came there.\r","\r","SEBASTIAN:\r","Bate, I beseech you, widow Dido.\r","\r","ANTONIO:\r","O, widow Dido! ay, widow Dido.\r","\r","GONZALO:\r","Is not, sir, my doublet as fresh as the first day I\r","wore it? I mean, in a sort.\r","\r","ANTONIO:\r","That sort was well fished for.\r","\r","GONZALO:\r","When I wore it at your daughter's marriage?\r","\r","ALONSO:\r","You cram these words into mine ears against\r","The stomach of my sense. Would I had never\r","Married my daughter there! for, coming thence,\r","My son is lost and, in my rate, she too,\r","Who is so far from Italy removed\r","I ne'er again shall see her. O thou mine heir\r","Of Naples and of Milan, what strange fish\r","Hath made his meal on thee?\r","\r","FRANCISCO:\r","Sir, he may live:\r","I saw him beat the surges under him,\r","And ride upon their backs; he trod the water,\r","Whose enmity he flung aside, and breasted\r","The surge most swoln that met him; his bold head\r","'Bove the contentious waves he kept, and oar'd\r","Himself with his good arms in lusty stroke\r","To the shore, that o'er his wave-worn basis bow'd,\r","As stooping to relieve him: I not doubt\r","He came alive to land.\r","\r","ALONSO:\r","No, no, he's gone.\r","\r","SEBASTIAN:\r","Sir, you may thank yourself for this great loss,\r","That would not bless our Europe with your daughter,\r","But rather lose her to an African;\r","Where she at least is banish'd from your eye,\r","Who hath cause to wet the grief on't.\r","\r","ALONSO:\r","Prithee, peace.\r","\r","SEBASTIAN:\r","You were kneel'd to and importuned otherwise\r","By all of us, and the fair soul herself\r","Weigh'd between loathness and obedience, at\r","Which end o' the beam should bow. We have lost your\r","son,\r","I fear, for ever: Milan and Naples have\r","More widows in them of this business' making\r","Than we bring men to comfort them:\r","The fault's your own.\r","\r","ALONSO:\r","So is the dear'st o' the loss.\r","\r","GONZALO:\r","My lord Sebastian,\r","The truth you speak doth lack some gentleness\r","And time to speak it in: you rub the sore,\r","When you should bring the plaster.\r","\r","SEBASTIAN:\r","Very well.\r","\r","ANTONIO:\r","And most chirurgeonly.\r","\r","GONZALO:\r","It is foul weather in us all, good sir,\r","When you are cloudy.\r","\r","SEBASTIAN:\r","Foul weather?\r","\r","ANTONIO:\r","Very foul.\r","\r","GONZALO:\r","Had I plantation of this isle, my lord,--\r","\r","ANTONIO:\r","He'ld sow't with nettle-seed.\r","\r","SEBASTIAN:\r","Or docks, or mallows.\r","\r","GONZALO:\r","And were the king on't, what would I do?\r","\r","SEBASTIAN:\r","'Scape being drunk for want of wine.\r","\r","GONZALO:\r","I' the commonwealth I would by contraries\r","Execute all things; for no kind of traffic\r","Would I admit; no name of magistrate;\r","Letters should not be known; riches, poverty,\r","And use of service, none; contract, succession,\r","Bourn, bound of land, tilth, vineyard, none;\r","No use of metal, corn, or wine, or oil;\r","No occupation; all men idle, all;\r","And women too, but innocent and pure;\r","No sovereignty;--\r","\r","SEBASTIAN:\r","Yet he would be king on't.\r","\r","ANTONIO:\r","The latter end of his commonwealth forgets the\r","beginning.\r","\r","GONZALO:\r","All things in common nature should produce\r","Without sweat or endeavour: treason, felony,\r","Sword, pike, knife, gun, or need of any engine,\r","Would I not have; but nature should bring forth,\r","Of its own kind, all foison, all abundance,\r","To feed my innocent people.\r","\r","SEBASTIAN:\r","No marrying 'mong his subjects?\r","\r","ANTONIO:\r","None, man; all idle: whores and knaves.\r","\r","GONZALO:\r","I would with such perfection govern, sir,\r","To excel the golden age.\r","\r","SEBASTIAN:\r","God save his majesty!\r","\r","ANTONIO:\r","Long live Gonzalo!\r","\r","GONZALO:\r","And,--do you mark me, sir?\r","\r","ALONSO:\r","Prithee, no more: thou dost talk nothing to me.\r","\r","GONZALO:\r","I do well believe your highness; and\r","did it to minister occasion to these gentlemen,\r","who are of such sensible and nimble lungs that\r","they always use to laugh at nothing.\r","\r","ANTONIO:\r","'Twas you we laughed at.\r","\r","GONZALO:\r","Who in this kind of merry fooling am nothing\r","to you: so you may continue and laugh at\r","nothing still.\r","\r","ANTONIO:\r","What a blow was there given!\r","\r","SEBASTIAN:\r","An it had not fallen flat-long.\r","\r","GONZALO:\r","You are gentlemen of brave metal; you would lift\r","the moon out of her sphere, if she would continue\r","in it five weeks without changing.\r","\r","SEBASTIAN:\r","We would so, and then go a bat-fowling.\r","\r","ANTONIO:\r","Nay, good my lord, be not angry.\r","\r","GONZALO:\r","No, I warrant you; I will not adventure\r","my discretion so weakly. Will you laugh\r","me asleep, for I am very heavy?\r","\r","ANTONIO:\r","Go sleep, and hear us.\r","\r","ALONSO:\r","What, all so soon asleep! I wish mine eyes\r","Would, with themselves, shut up my thoughts: I find\r","They are inclined to do so.\r","\r","SEBASTIAN:\r","Please you, sir,\r","Do not omit the heavy offer of it:\r","It seldom visits sorrow; when it doth,\r","It is a comforter.\r","\r","ANTONIO:\r","We two, my lord,\r","Will guard your person while you take your rest,\r","And watch your safety.\r","\r","ALONSO:\r","Thank you. Wondrous heavy.\r","\r","SEBASTIAN:\r","What a strange drowsiness possesses them!\r","\r","ANTONIO:\r","It is the quality o' the climate.\r","\r","SEBASTIAN:\r","Why\r","Doth it not then our eyelids sink? I find not\r","Myself disposed to sleep.\r","\r","ANTONIO:\r","Nor I; my spirits are nimble.\r","They fell together all, as by consent;\r","They dropp'd, as by a thunder-stroke. What might,\r","Worthy Sebastian? O, what might?--No more:--\r","And yet me thinks I see it in thy face,\r","What thou shouldst be: the occasion speaks thee, and\r","My strong imagination sees a crown\r","Dropping upon thy head.\r","\r","SEBASTIAN:\r","What, art thou waking?\r","\r","ANTONIO:\r","Do you not hear me speak?\r","\r","SEBASTIAN:\r","I do; and surely\r","It is a sleepy language and thou speak'st\r","Out of thy sleep. What is it thou didst say?\r","This is a strange repose, to be asleep\r","With eyes wide open; standing, speaking, moving,\r","And yet so fast asleep.\r","\r","ANTONIO:\r","Noble Sebastian,\r","Thou let'st thy fortune sleep--die, rather; wink'st\r","Whiles thou art
